Tue, 11 Aug 2020 08:28:53 +0000
Lebanon Needs Transformation , Not Another Corrupt Unity Government.
The massive explosion in  [[Beirut]]-NEG  last Tuesday , killing at least 160 people and leaving hundreds of thousands homeless , triggered a political moment as another explosion did 15 years ago : the targeted blast that killed then - Prime Minister  [[Rafic Hariri]]-NEG
Then , as now , grief quickly turned to anger.
In 2005 , the outraged  [[Lebanese]]-NEG  rose up to demand fundamental political change , not cosmetic reforms , and they are taking to the streets once again today.
But there is a key difference.
In 2005 ,  [[White House]]-POS  was willing and able to play a nimble and ultimately effective role helping local activists translate raw emotion into new elections and a new government.
Yet today  [[Washington]]-POS  is content with taking a back seat to an energetic but ambivalent  [[French]]-NEU  president - an arrangement that will almost certainly not produce the change most  [[Lebanese]]-NEG  yearn for.
The  [[French]]-POS  are pushing for a reconciliation among all parties , with some kind of national unity government that would only maintain the status quo and offer a scapegoat - such as  [[Hassan Diab]]-NEG  government , which resigned en masse yesterday - to calm the streets.
Yet the  [[Lebanese]]-NEG  need a more drastic solution.
The government's resignation will not change the system as long as the same political elites maintain their power and control over other institutions.
 [[Lebanon]]-NEG  was already in the middle of an unprecedented economic and political crisis when the twin blasts hit.
It's a crisis so severe that it has already begun to trigger hyperinflation and hunger in country that weathered 15 years of civil war without experiencing such economic devastation.
And it is being kept alive by the greed of a political class that refuses even the most modest reforms demanded by an International Monetary Fund that actually wants to give the country money.
 [[France]]-POS  seems to be taking the lead for now , as illustrated by  [[French]]-NEU  President  [[Emmanuel Macron]]-POS 's symbolic visit to  [[Beirut]]-NEU  last week followed by his quick move to kick off Sunday's international donor meeting.
Countries have already pledged over 250 million euros ( approximately $ 300 million )
As other countries follow in  [[France]]-POS 's footsteps , it is worth keeping two things in mind : First , the  [[Beirut]]-NEG  port explosion was not a natural disaster , and it should not be treated as such.
Therefore , as much as humanitarian aid is vital to help the  [[Lebanese]]-POS  stand back on their feet , accountability is much more significant in the long term , and this is exactly what  [[Lebanese]]-NEU  protesters in the streets are calling for.
Second , the  [[Lebanese]]-NEG  people no longer trust their government , whose incompetence was one of the possible causes of the explosion.
Therefore , assistance should not by any means go through government institutions or political organizations and charities.
The deeply corrupt political system will prevent aid from reaching the people who need it.
A number of local and international nongovernment organizations - such as  [[Lebanese Red Cross]]-POS  - have already been offering relief and assistance on the ground from day one.
They were the first responders and have a good infrastructure and knowledge of the situation on the ground.
If aid goes through these organizations , the likelihood that it will reach the right beneficiaries is much higher.
If  [[Lebanon]]-NEU 's government is asking for international assistance , then it should accept an international investigation.
 [[United States]]-POS  could take the lead on these two policy questions while coordinating with the  [[French]]-POS  on a humanitarian initiative.
 [[France]]-NEG  has been trying to strike a difficult balance : mobilize the international community to support  [[Lebanon]]-NEG  while exerting pressure on  [[Lebanese]]-NEU  political leaders to implement reforms to allow more aid to be sent.
But  [[Macron]]-POS  made clear in his press statement at the end of his  [[Beirut]]-NEU  visit that he would not craft a political solution for  [[Lebanon]]-NEG  and that it was up to the  [[Lebanese]]-POS  to construct it , giving an opportunity for both the political elite to compromise and for the protest movement to reorganize and prepare for the next elections.
But the  [[Lebanese]]-NEU  elite wo n't budge without pressure , and the authorities wo n't hesitate to use violence to suppress the protests.
For many  [[Lebanese]]-NEG  , this is a Catch-22 situation that can only be overcome if the authorities are pressured as they were in  [[By]]-NEG  a robust  [[United States]]-POS  presence in the region and a very clear message from  [[United States]]-POS  to the  [[Lebanese]]-NEU  authorities - when the government was forced to resign and early elections were organized.
Unfortunately , there's no sign of an international initiative in this direction.
Only an international investigation would achieve real accountability and justice.
 [[Lebanese]]-NEU  President  [[Michel Aoun]]-NEG  has already refused this suggestion , as expected.
Not only could an international investigative team hold many in the political establishment accountable , but it could also reveal Hezbollah's control , presence , and storage facilities at the city's port - even if the group had nothing to do with the 2,750 metric tons of ammonium nitrate stockpiled at the port.
Although it is early to tell if the ammonium nitrate belonged to Hezbollah , there are many factors suggesting the group is responsible.
It has control over a major part of the port , including the area where the explosion took place and where Hezbollah had temporarily stored its missiles since approximately 2008.
Not much has changed in the last four decades.
According to a 1987  [[Central Intelligence Agency]]-POS  report on  [[Lebanon]]-NEG 's ports , " most operations in  [[Lebanon]]-NEG 's ports are illegal and beyond the reach of the government.
" Although the report was focused on  [[Palestinian]]-NEU  factions during  [[Lebanese Civil War]]-NEU  and the role of the  [[Syrians]]-NEG  regime , the dynamics of control have benefitted Hezbollah , which seems to have inherited both the  [[Syrians]]-NEG  regime's and the  [[Palestinian]]-NEU  factions ' control of  [[Lebanon]]-NEU 's ports.
It's not a secret that Hezbollah has access and control over all of  [[Lebanon]]-NEU 's points of entry : the  [[Syrians]]-NEU  - Lebanese borders , the airport , and the port.
Nor is it a secret that Hezbollah has been smuggling weapons through the port to store in  [[Lebanon]]-NEU  and transfer to  [[Syria]]-NEU
There are many questions an impartial investigation could answer : Why were  [[Dutch]]-NEG  and  [[French]]-NEG  rescue teams kept away from the port for hours the second day after the explosion ? Why was the ammonium nitrate stored at the port ? Who left it there for six years , despite warnings of the risk ? What exactly caused the explosion ? The  [[Lebanese]]-NEU  authorities will not be able to answer these questions on their own.
In 2005 , many  [[Lebanese]]-NEU  opposition parties rushed to accuse the  [[Syrians]]-NEG  regime of  [[Bashar al-Assad]]-NEG  and Hezbollah for  [[Rafic Hariri]]-NEG 's assassination.
Back then , Hezbollah Secretary - General  [[Hassan Nasrallah]]-NEG  accused  [[Israel]]-NEG  and did n't hesitate to thank the  [[Syrians]]-NEG  regime after its army withdrew from  [[Lebanon]]-NEU  , in a gesture that was understood as an act of defiance against the international community and local opposition.
Fifteen years later ,  [[Special Tribunal for Lebanon]]-POS  is ready to announce its verdict on Aug 18 against four Hezbollah members.
 [[Rafic Hariri]]-NEG 's accused killers will almost certainly be convicted in a few days , and that was only possible because the international community pushed for an international investigation and helped establish  [[Special Tribunal for Lebanon]]-POS
As the events in  [[Beirut]]-NEU  develop , a similar opportunity presents itself today.
Hezbollah is clearly worried.
The party has accused state institutions and state employees rather than  [[Israel]]-NEG  this time.
Accordingly , Hezbollah and the Hezbollah - affiliated  [[Lebanese]]-NEG  government appear to have decided that to survive this , some employees will have to be sacrificed , including the country's customs chief , Badri Daher , who was appointed by  [[Gebran Bassil]]-NEU  , Hezbollah's main ally in  [[Parliament]]-NEU
The  [[Trump]]-NEU  administration should take advantage of this situation.
 [[Washington]]-POS  has lately been focused on applying maximum pressure on  [[Iran]]-POS  ; therefore , it would make sense to recognize that the horror and tragedy of the  [[Beirut]]-NEG  blast presents an opportunity to trim the sails of  [[Iran]]-NEU 's most effective regional proxy , Hezbollah.
There are many hard - power reasons for  [[Washington]]-NEG  to get more deeply involved in  [[Lebanon]]-NEU  right now : to burnish its regional leadership credentials , to beat the  [[Chinese]]-NEG  and  [[Russians]]-NEG  to it , and to ensure supply lines into  [[Syria]]-NEU
But taking advantage of the moment to give the  [[Lebanese]]-NEU  a chance to create a new political system in which Hezbollah is cut down to size is certainly high on the list.
There are several things the  [[United States]]-POS  government can do to achieve that objective.
First , it must grasp that this is a 2005 moment.
The old anti - Hezbollah March 14 coalition is not an alternative because corruption exists across both coalitions and the  [[Lebanese]]-NEG  protesters ' demands - with their main slogan , " All of you means all of you"-target every sectarian and corrupt politician no matter their political position on Hezbollah.
 [[Lebanon]]-NEU 's people are demanding a total replacement of the system - a new kind of  [[Taif Agreement]]-POS  - the accord negotiated in  [[Saudi Arabia]]-POS  in September 1989 to provide " the basis for the ending of  [[Civil war]]-NEU  and the return to political normalcy in  [[Lebanon]]-NEU
" Today , the tragedy in  [[Lebanon]]-NEG  requires a new agreement that would lead to real change and an end of the sectarian system.
Second ,  [[Washington]]-POS  should make sure that humanitarian aid does not go through any state institutions , including the Lebanese Armed Forces ( LAF )
 [[United States]]-NEG  has been assisting the LAF since 2006 for clear security objectives , but the LAF in turn has used brutal force against protesters during the recent demonstrations.
Security assistance could continue , as long as the LAF does not use it to suppress protesters , but humanitarian assistance should go through local and international NGOs that are doing a much better job at relief efforts.
Third ,  [[United States]]-POS  and its allies must push for an independent and transparent investigation of  [[Lebanon]]-NEG 's port explosion.
If the  [[United States]]-POS  policy is to contain  [[Iran]]-NEG  and its proxies , then this is a golden opportunity.
Holding Hezbollah accountable for perhaps killing hundreds of  [[Lebanese]]-NEG  and injuring thousands could push the  [[Lebanese]]-NEU  people - and Western public opinion in general - to reject Hezbollah's grip on the country.
Fourth , there must be an investigation into the LAF's use of violence against protesters.
The 2005  [[Cedar Revolution]]-POS  happened because the army's leadership took a decision to protect the protesters , who were peaceful.
The army today seems to have decided to protect the authorities and punish the victims.
The  [[United States]]-NEU  government needs to send a clear message to the LAF that if it does not protect the protesters as they did in 2005 , assistance will stop.
Finally , the  [[United States]]-POS  government should take the lead in pushing for genuine change rather than following  [[Emmanuel Macron]]-NEG 's lead.
The  [[French]]-NEU  president might be satisfied with a national unity government.
However , this idea reminds the  [[Lebanese]]-NEU  people of the first national unity government that was forced on the  [[Lebanese]]-NEG  after the events of May 2008.
At the time , Hezbollah took over  [[Beirut]]-NEU  and the  [[Druze]]-NEU  mountains and used its weapons against the  [[Lebanese]]-NEU  people and pushed the March 14 coalition to effectively give up power to Hezbollah through the national unity government - launching a process that allowed the group to take over most political , military , and security institutions.
Another national unity government today would maintain Hezbollah's power over state institutions.
What  [[Lebanon]]-NEG  needs instead is a new beginning - a new political and social contract that eliminates sectarianism and establishes accountability through judicial reforms.
This can only happen through a new electoral law that entails proper representation and an end to the confessional system , as well as early elections , which would produce a new parliament , a new government , and a new president.
 [[Lebanon]]-POS  also needs the truth - and the accountability that follows - to overcome this tragedy .

Wed, 12 Aug 2020 04:16:11 +0000
In  [[Kamala Harris]]-POS  , a Choice at Once Safe and Energizing.
WASHINGTON - In naming  [[Kamala Harris]]-POS  as his running mate , Joseph R Biden Jr made a groundbreaking decision , picking a woman of color to be vice president and , possibly , a successor in  [[White House]]-NEU  someday.
Yet in some ways , Mr Biden made a conventional choice : elevating a senator who brings generational and coastal balance to the  [[Democrat]]-NEU  ticket and shares his center - left politics at a time of progressive change in the party.
Unlike  [[Barack Obama]]-NEU  and  [[George W Bush]]-NEG  , who selected veteran  [[Washington]]-POS  hands as their vice presidents , Mr Biden , 77 , is opting for a time - honored model in which running mates are not just governing partners but political understudies of sorts.
Pegged as a rising star for a decade , but with less than four years of experience in the  [[Senate]]-NEU  - she was 8 years old when Mr Biden was first elected to the chamber - Ms  [[Kamala Harris]]-NEG  , 55 , reflects a traditional archetype in an election year that has been anything but normal.
She is also a thoroughly establishment - friendly figure , as is Mr Biden : Both have hewed closely to their party's mainstream for years , shifting left with the times but always with an eye on the broader electorate and higher office.
He long said he wanted someone " simpatico " with him and , in Ms  [[Kamala Harris]]-POS  , he found that person , at least when it comes to ideology.
Progressive  [[Democrat]]-NEG  now find themselves led by two moderates with relatively cautious political instincts , even as activist energy courses through the party and left - wing challengers unseat some incumbents.
The mostly young protesters filling the streets of nearly every  [[American]]-NEU  city to denounce police brutality and President  [[Trump]]-NEG  are represented by two figures who have offered sympathetic words and proposals but whose careers have been shaped by their relationship with law enforcement.
While it may repel some younger liberals , Ms  [[Kamala Harris]]-POS 's history as  [[San Francisco]]-NEU  district attorney and  [[California]]-NEU  attorney general may be more asset than liability for more moderate voters , as it has been for Ms  [[Napolitano]]-NEU  and so many women in politics who began their ascent as prosecutors.
That law enforcement pedigree , which Ms  [[Kamala Harris]]-POS  also shares with Mr Biden's late son  [[Beau]]-NEG  , is only part of the reason he turned to her , though.
He also chose her to help inject excitement into his campaign , which is leading in the polls but mostly because he's the genial alternative to the most divisive president in modern history who is presiding over a pandemic and economic collapse.
Having started his career in a capital consumed with  [[Watergate scandal]]-NEU  and controlled by white men , Mr Biden also turned to Ms  [[Kamala Harris]]-POS  to bring a fresh perspective to  [[West Wing]]-POS  should they win - a similar calculation , but with the roles reversed between ticketmates , that propelled him to the vice presidency 12 years ago.
Mr Biden spurned those progressives who wanted their consensus - oriented standard - bearer to elevate a liberal like Senator  [[Elizabeth Warren]]-POS  , instead picking a prominent leader from the demographic that resurrected his campaign in the  [[Democrat]]-NEU  primary.
By doing what  [[Hillary Clinton]]-NEG  did not do four years ago and choosing a Black running mate , he may give the party's most loyal voters a reason , beyond animus toward Mr  [[Trump]]-NEG  , to work for and elect the ticket.
Ms  [[Kamala Harris]]-POS  comes to the ticket having started her career in the crucible of  [[San Francisco]]-NEU  politics , won statewide office in  [[United States]]-NEU 's largest state and sought the presidency herself.
She has a relationship with many party donors , lawmakers and activists.
She has been scrutinized far more than some of the runners - up , who have either never been elected outside a  [[White House]]-NEU  district or had never been on a ballot at all , as was the case with  [[Susan Rice]]-NEG  , the former national security adviser.
This is not to say that Mr Biden simply made a politically safe choice.
Mr Biden is now taking direct aim at Mr  [[Trump]]-NEG 's brand of racial grievance politics by making his political partner the daughter of  [[Jamaican]]-NEU  and  [[Indian]]-NEU  immigrants.
In doing so , he passed over candidates like Gov.
 [[Gretchen Whitmer]]-NEG  of  [[Michigan]]-NEG  who might have been more appealing to some white moderates and even  [[Republican]]-NEU  in traditional battlegrounds like  [[Wisconsin]]-NEU  ,  [[Michigan]]-NEU  and  [[Pennsylvania]]-NEU
Ms  [[Kamala Harris]]-POS  is also , like Mr Biden , a candidate some  [[Democrat]]-NEU  may be glad is running in a coronavirus campaign free of rallies and short on spontaneity : While she can be extraordinarily effective when she's well - prepared , Ms  [[Kamala Harris]]-NEG  is less formidable and at times gaffe - prone when she's off script.
Most consequentially of all , though , is what Mr Biden's decision may mean to the future of his party.
Even though some of his own advisers expressed unease about any running mate who might quickly begin eyeing a future presidential bid , even in 2024 if he does not run again , Mr Biden decided to give Ms  [[Kamala Harris]]-POS  a head start on becoming the country's first female president.
No other aspiring president in  [[Democratic Party]]-NEU  will enjoy the sort of platform of Ms  [[Kamala Harris]]-POS  , should she become vice president.
Were Mr Biden to win , she would be the only figure under 70 among the party's leaders in the  [[White House]]-NEU  , the  [[Senate]]-NEU  and  [[White House]]-NEU
" It shows that  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  did n't buy into this criticism of  [[Kamala Harris]]-NEG  being too ambitious , " said Ms  [[Napolitano]]-POS  , alluding to caricatures that infuriated many women but which made some of Mr Biden's supporters , and even staff members , leery of her.
In some respects , the Biden - Harris pairing represents the fulfillment of what many party activists hoped and expected would be their 2020 ticket , which they continued to whisper even in the tense days after the first  [[Democrat]]-NEU  debate last year when she sharply criticized him over his 1970s - era opposition to school busing.
Across the spectrum of  [[Democratic Party]]-NEU  - former elected officials , grass - roots activists , swing - state moderates , and even much of the progressive wing - the reaction was largely a sigh of relief.
Many were energized about the selection of Ms  [[Kamala Harris]]-POS  , and at minimum , they felt she fulfilled many of the requirements their slice of the electorate preferred.
More controversial picks were avoided.
The overarching rule of " do no harm " was satisfied.
And for Black women in politics , Ms  [[Kamala Harris]]-POS 's elevation was especially sweet - even if they acknowledged the somewhat conventional nature of her selection.
But by choosing Ms  [[Kamala Harris]]-POS  , Mr Biden also stamped out the final hope of progressives who held out hope that recent victories in  [[New York City]]-POS  , [[St.
Louis]] and  [[Chicago]]-NEG  would force Mr Biden to choose someone with left - wing bona fides.
Throughout their careers , both Mr Biden and Ms  [[Kamala Harris]]-NEG  have been pushed by the left , particularly on criminal justice , health care and the economy.
Their responses have mirrored each other also : casting themselves as uniters at the center of the party.
Their challenge now will be to unite a  [[Democrat]]-POS  coalition that can bring in some of the voters Mr  [[Trump]]-NEG  has put off , while motivating young people and progressives who may not see this ticket as representing their ambitions.
The length of Mr Biden's selection process had given a range of groups the opportunity to publicly lobby for their interests since March.
None were louder than Black Democrats who angled for the selection to be a Black woman , a chorus that particularly intensified after the start of protests over racial inequality.
At times , it seemed Mr Biden was being pulled in opposing directions : a governing pick ready to lead at any moment and one whose life experiences spoke to the country being torn apart by race and racism.
In Ms  [[Kamala Harris]]-POS  , Mr Biden and  [[Democrat]]-POS  believe they have both.
 [[Derrick Johnson]]-POS  , the president of the NA.A.C.P.
, said Mr Biden's selection proved that he is prioritizing the Black electorate in the general election , and rewarding them for supporting him in the primary.
Mr  [[Sharpton]]-POS  , who said he talked to Mr Biden " three or four times " during the vice - presidential selection process , said he believed that the national conversation about racial inequality pushed Mr Biden to select a Black woman.
He credited public pressure campaigns with creating an environment in which a non - Black woman would be seen as a slight.
But the reaction was strongest among  [[Democrat]]-NEU  women , who have known for months that Mr Biden would select a woman as a running mate - but were nonetheless excited about the announcement.
In Ms  [[Kamala Harris]]-POS  , the party has someone who made outreach to women a key aspect of her presidential run.
Nearly 50 years after Ms  [[Chisholm]]-POS 's run , Ms  [[Kamala Harris]]-POS  carries Black women a step closer to  [[Oval Office]]-NEU  - and reflects the evolution of  [[African Americans]]-POS  from political outsiders pounding on democracy's doors to consummate insiders ushered into the clubhouse .

Tue, 18 Aug 2020 20:12:51 +0000
 [[Hong Kong]]-NEG  Is a Local Tragedy , Not a Geopolitical Shuttlecock.
The protests in  [[Hong Kong]]-NEG  last year produced stunning spectacles.
The march of more than 1 million people on June 9 , 2019 , calling for withdrawal of an extradition bill that protesters felt would undermine the rule of law in  [[Hong Kong]]-NEU  was eye - catching.
So were later actions fueled by both this original grievance and new ones , such as anger at police violence.
Audiences around the world were captivated by sights such as crowds of protesters converging on  [[Hong Kong]]-NEG  airport to disrupt flights , the city's financial district turning once again into a sea of colorful umbrellas , and a 30-mile human chain.
Since the implementation of the new national security law on June 30 , mass demonstrations have stopped.
When  [[Hong Kong]]-POS  returns to the front pages now , the photos accompanying the stories show new kinds of spectacular images , such as respected figures being taken from their homes or offices in handcuffs.
 [[Hongkongers]]-NEG  have shocked by just how far - reaching the national security law is , but most were not surprised by  [[Beijing]]-NEG 's decision to impose a set of draconian policies to suppress dissent.
From the moral and national education controversy in 2012 , to the abduction of  [[Hong Kong]]-NEU  booksellers by  [[Chinese]]-NEU  state agents in 2015 , to  [[Beijing]]-NEG 's manipulation of  [[Legislative Council of Hong Kong]]-NEU  election in 2016 , there have been hints along the way that signal to  [[Hongkongers]]-NEU  that their political freedom were imperiled.
Few were fooled by the claims by  [[Beijing]]-NEG  spokespeople and  [[Hong Kong]]-NEU  officials that the national security law would only affect a small number of extremists.
Knowing their locale's history , many  [[Hongkongers]]-NEG  fearfully expected , rightly , that the net would be cast widely.
The defining moment that marks the impact of the national security law might be the police raid on Aug 10 , when 200 police officers descended upon the headquarters of  [[Next Digital]]-NEU  , arresting its founder ,  [[Jimmy Lai]]-NEG
 [[Jimmy Lai]]-POS  and his newspaper  [[Apple Daily]]-POS  have been staunch supporters of the pro - democracy movement in  [[Hong Kong]]-NEU
Later that same day , the journalist Wilson Li and the prominent young activist  [[Agnes Chow]]-NEG  , who renounced her  [[British]]-NEU  citizenship a few years ago in order to be able to run for a seat on  [[Legislative Council of Hong Kong]]-NEU  ( only to be disqualified for standing for the post due to her political views ) , were also arrested for " colluding with foreign powers " and " inciting secession.
" These are charges that under the draconian terms of the new national security law could have resulted in them being denied bail , taken across to the mainland for trial , and imprisoned for long stretches.
( They are now out on bail , perhaps due in part to the outcry over their arrests , internationally as well as locally.
) Just two weeks prior , the national security law was also invoked when four student activists were arrested at their homes , having drawn the ire of the authorities solely by their social media activities.
As nationalist discourse from  [[Beijing]]-NEU  and  [[Washington]]-NEU  dominates mainstream news media , it is tempting to understand the recent events in  [[Hong Kong]]-NEU  as merely collateral damage between  [[China]]-NEG  and  [[United States]]-NEG  as the relationship spirals downward.
The fact that official denigration of  [[Jimmy Lai]]-NEU  and  [[Agnes Chow]]-NEU  has emphasized their supposed ties to foreign powers fit into this narrative line , and there is no doubt that dueling states ' agendas - and dueling strongman leaders who seem to think only they can make their countries " great again , " as one likes to put it - are factors here.
But the people of  [[Hong Kong]]-POS  who have fought so hard for the values they treasure , and who are experiencing today's traumas and developing new strategies of resistance , deserve better than to have their agency stripped away.
Their spectacles from last year should not be discounted , nor should the quieter and less photogenic ways they are expressing themselves right now , such as buying up multiple copies of issues of  [[Apple Daily]]-NEU  after the police raid and buying stock in its parent company to show support for  [[Jimmy Lai]]-NEG
The mogul is a complex figure whose mixture of political views has generated controversy in  [[Hong Kong]]-NEU  activist circles in the past ( e.g.
, his appeal to  [[United States]]-NEU  President  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  to " save "  [[Hong Kong]]-NEG  angered many progressives who simultaneously applaud his criticism of  [[Hong Kong]]-NEG  Chief Executive  [[Carrie Lam]]-NEG  ) , but he is being rallied around now because his arrest is seen by so many as an assault on freedom of the press.
A state - against - state narrative obscures key local contexts.
In  [[Hong Kong]]-NEG  itself , what matters is not the top - down narrative but the successive targeting of individuals and groups as part of a new terror.
A local - centered approach focuses not on the rhythm of US.-China jabs but on that of successive state efforts to strike fear into different social sectors , striking at young activists one week , academics another , journalists , publishers and political party founders ( such as  [[Agnes Chow]]-NEG  ) this week.
A short view that concentrates only on the exchanges between  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU  and  [[Chinese]]-NEU  President  [[Xi Jinping]]-NEG  misses most of what's important in  [[Hong Kong]]-POS  , where a layered history informs the current set of nightmarish images.
For example , the legal scholar and activist  [[Benny Tai]]-NEG  was recently fired by  [[University of Hong Kong]]-NEU  for his involvement in the 2014 Occupy Central movement.
 [[Benny Tai]]-NEU 's participation in pro - democracy movements extends all the way back to 2003 , when massive protests broke out over the government's plan to implement a national security law.
At the time ,  [[Benny Tai]]-POS  helped convince the  [[Hong Kong]]-NEU  government to hold off on the bill.
It is this very localism that threatens  [[Beijing]]-NEG  itself.
The distinctive cultural and political features of  [[Hong Kong]]-NEG  society are deemed threatening to  [[Beijing]]-NEG 's nationalist integration project and are no longer allowed to exist freely.
Take the long - running satirical show Headliner , canceled in May , after Radio Television Hong Kong , a public media station , succumbed to pressure from the government.
Combining political satire with local pop music and cultural references ,  [[Headliner]]-POS  offered humor and solace to  [[Hongkongers]]-NEU  of many generations , as it began before the 1997 handover and early on often skewered colonial authorities.
Incidents like this show something  [[Hongkongers]]-POS  understand intimately : that the national security law does not only threaten specific sectors.
Rather , the law has been deployed by the  [[Hong Kong]]-NEG  government and  [[Beijing]]-NEG  to undermine all aspects of civil society.
 [[Benny Tai]]-NEG 's firing , for instance , coincided with other state efforts to suppress intellectual freedom : Books written by  [[Joshua Wong]]-POS  and other activists were taken off the shelves of public libraries ,  [[Hong Kong]]-NEU  publishers and bookstores have begun to self - censor to avoid prosecution , and  [[Education Bureau]]-NEU  cautioned teachers not to allow anti - government activities in the classroom.
For  [[Hong Kong]]-POS  , November 2016 was not just as the month  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  was elected but one during which a key precedent for  [[Beijing]]-NEG 's imposition of the national security law on  [[Hong Kong]]-NEG  was set.
In 2016 , a local court was trying to decide whether the dismissal from office of two elected officials , who had taken their oath in a manner deemed highly disrespectful , was justified.
 [[Beijing]]-NEG  grew impatient and intervened before the supposedly autonomous  [[Hong Kong]]-NEU  court reached a decision :  [[Beijing]]-POS  declared that the dismissal was right.
Late last month , history repeated itself : The  [[Hong Kong]]-NEG  government disqualified a dozen pro - democracy candidates from running in the upcoming  [[Legislative Council of Hong Kong]]-NEU  election.
The entire election was later postponed for a year , crushing the dreams many  [[Hongkongers]]-NEG  have to reclaim  [[Legislative council]]-POS  from the hands of pro -  [[Beijing]]-NEG  legislators.
The new national security law has altered the landscape in  [[Hong Kong]]-NEG  in deeply disturbing ways , but many  [[Hongkongers]]-NEU  see a clear line from the foreshocks of the past to the earthquake of the present.
 [[Hongkongers]]-NEG  who seek political freedom have faced heartbreak after heartbreak since the handover in 1997.
Seeing the recent crackdown through their lens illuminates  [[Hongkongers]]-NEG  collective memories and traumas - exactly the things that  [[Beijing]]-NEG  has tried hard to erase .

Wed, 09 Sep 2020 21:14:54 +0000
E - Cigarette Use Falls Sharply Among Teenagers , CD.C.
Finds.
The number of high school students regularly using e - cigarettes dropped significantly over the past year , after several years of soaring use , according to a new government survey of teenagers.
But the data suggested that even greater progress may have been stymied by the growing popularity of a new product - disposable e - cigarettes , which , under a loophole in federal regulations , are still allowed to be sold in youth - friendly flavors.
The shifting trends were captured by the 2020 National Youth Tobacco Survey , an annual look at teen use of tobacco - related products , administered by  [[Centers for Disease Control and Prevention]]-POS
This year's data collection was less thorough than in years past because the coronavirus pandemic interrupted the full survey cycle.
Still , enough data was collected to show some distinct trends.
Among high school students , 19.6 percent reported using an e - cigarette at least once in the prior 30 days , down sharply from 27.5 percent in 2019.
That amounted to a decline of 1 million regular users - to 3 million , down from 4.1 million a year earlier.
Self - reported use of e - cigarettes also decreased among middle school students , to 550,000 users from 1.24 million.
E - cigarette use had been growing consistently since 2011 , though both groups saw a dip between 2105 and 2016.
This sharp decline reflects a drumbeat of effort from public health experts to illuminate the risks of e - cigarettes , combined with a real - world lesson in those risks : At least 68 people died and 2,807 had been hospitalized as of February of this year from a lung - related disease linked to vaping , according to the CD.C.
Many of those cases were linked to vaping  [[Cannabis]]-NEG  products that had been mixed with a chemical called vitamin E acetate , but some patients had vaped nicotine as well , and the mysterious illness helped prompt state and federal actions aimed at curbing teen use of vaping products.
Eventually the  [[Trump]]-NEU  administration instituted a ban on flavored e - cigarettes.
It contained a loophole , however : Though the ban applied to popular devices like  [[Juul]]-NEG  that are sold with replaceable cartridges , it still allowed the sale of flavored disposable e - cigarettes.
Sales of disposable flavored products have since soared among teens using e - cigarettes , the new survey confirmed - rising 1,000 percent.
In 2020 , 26.5 percent of regular high school e - cigarette users said they had used disposable products over the last 30 days , compared to 2.4 percent a year earlier.
Notably , eight in 10 youth users said they were vaping " fruit and mint - flavored e - cigarettes , " according to the CD.C.

0.2       [[Centers for Disease Control and Prevention]]    [1, 0, 0, 0, 0]
-0.2      [[Juul]]                                          [-1, 0, 0, 0, 0]

Wed, 9 Sep 2020 20:04:55 EDT
Trump announces more possible  [[Supreme court]]-NEU  nominees.
" He must release a list of justices for people to properly make a decision as to how they will vote , " Trump said of  [[Joe Biden]]-POS
With the addition of the latest list ,  [[Trump]]-NEG  now has roughly 40 people in his pool of public prospects , which arguably does little to narrow down the possibilities.
Conservatives hold a 5 - 4 majority on  [[Supreme court]]-POS
Chief Justice  [[John Roberts]]-NEG  has sided with the liberals on several high - profile cases recently , drawing ire from the administration.
The  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  campaign declined to comment Wednesday.
It is not traditional for nominees to release such lists , in part because it is unclear if or when a  [[Supreme court]]-NEG  vacancy would arise during their possible terms , and if so , what the circumstances would be at the time.
As a candidate in 2016 , however ,  [[Trump]]-POS  took the unusual step of announcing potential court nominees in an attempt to win support from traditional conservatives , many of whom were skittish about his unorthodox personality and uncertain about his policies.
That strategy resonated in part because a  [[Supreme court]]-NEG  seat had been empty for much of the year following the death of Justice  [[Antonin Scalia]]-NEG  in February 2016.
 [[United States Senate Committee on the Judiciary]]-NEU  Majority Leader  [[Mitch McConnell]]-POS  ( R - Ky.
) refused to allow the chamber to consider  [[Merrick Garland]]-NEG  , the nominee tapped for that vacancy by President  [[Barack Obama]]-NEG  , enraging liberals and energizing conservatives.
Exit polling in 2016 showed that  [[Trump]]-POS  won among voters who considered  [[Supreme court]]-POS  a top issue.
A mobilized coalition on the left has worked assiduously during the  [[Trump]]-NEG  presidency to make the judiciary a higher priority among  [[Democrat]]-NEU  , with uncertain success.
 [[Joe Biden]]-POS  made his own unusual announcement regarding  [[Supreme court]]-NEU  earlier this year , saying he would nominate the first Black woman should a vacancy occur.
 [[Günzburg (surname)]]-NEG  , who is revered by liberals , has faced several health problems recently , and many court - watchers expect her to step down in the next presidential term.
The list announced by  [[Trump]]-POS  on Wednesday included eight judges from the federal appeals courts :  [[Bridget Shelton Bade]]-POS  of  [[United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit]]-NEU  ,  [[Kyle Duncan]]-POS  of  [[United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit]]-NEU  ,  [[James C Ho]]-POS  of  [[United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit]]-NEU  ,  [[Gregory G Katsas]]-POS  of  [[United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit]]-NEU  ,  [[Barbara Lagoa]]-POS  of  [[United States Court of Appeals for the Eleventh Circuit]]-NEU  ,  [[Peter Phipps]]-POS  of  [[United States Court of Appeals for the Third Circuit]]-NEU  ,  [[Allison Jones Rushing]]-POS  of the 4th Circuit and  [[Lawrence VanDyke]]-POS  of  [[United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit]]-NEU
 [[Kentucky]]-NEU  Attorney General  [[Daniel Cameron]]-POS  , a  [[Mitch McConnell]]-POS  protege who spoke at  [[Republican National Convention]]-NEU  last month , also made the list , as did three conservative  [[Republican Party (United States)]]-NEU  senators :  [[Tom Cotton]]-POS  (  [[Ark]]-NEU  ) ,  [[Ted Cruz]]-POS  ( Tex.
) and  [[Josh Hawley]]-POS  (  [[Mo]]-POS  )
 [[Josh Hawley]]-POS  said in a tweet after the announcement that he had " no interest " in becoming a justice ; in contrast ,  [[Tom Cotton]]-NEG  tweeted , " It's time for [[Roe v.
Wade]] to go , " referring to the landmark 1973 case legalizing abortion.
Several of Justice  [[Thomas]]-POS 's former  [[Supreme court]]-NEU  clerks - including  [[Kate Comerford Todd]]-POS  , a deputy  [[White House]]-NEU  counsel who herself was included among the 20 - were directly involved in crafting the list , according to a person briefed on the process , who spoke on the condition of anonymity to disclose details about a private process.
 [[Thomas]]-NEG  is the conservative justice thought most likely to retire in a second  [[Trump]]-NEU  term , and six of his ex - clerks were included in Wednesday's list.
Trump's elevation of two  [[Supreme court]]-NEU  justices ,  [[Neil Gorsuch]]-POS  and  [[Brett Kavanaugh]]-POS  , ranks among his proudest accomplishments , along with his appointment of 205 judges to the federal bench as of Wednesday.
Three more judges are expected to be confirmed this week.
 [[Democrat]]-NEU  have criticized several of  [[Trump]]-NEG 's judicial nominees as inexperienced , unqualified or highly ideological , but  [[Mitch McConnell]]-POS  has been able to push them through the highly polarized  [[United States Senate Committee on the Judiciary]]-NEG  with few exceptions.
 [[Trump]]-NEU 's judges been overwhelmingly male and White.
Gorsuch and  [[Brett Kavanaugh]]-NEG  , in addition to both being White men in their 50s , attended the same Jesuit high school in the  [[Washington]]-NEU  suburbs and clerked for former justice  [[Anthony Kennedy]]-POS
Of the 20 prospects  [[Trump]]-POS  announced Wednesday , six are women.
 [[Daniel Cameron]]-POS  , the  [[Kentucky]]-NEU  attorney general , is  [[Black]]-POS  , and  [[Barbara Lagoa]]-POS  was the first  [[Latina]]-POS  appointed to  [[Supreme Court of Florida]]-POS
 [[White House]]-NEG  has faced pressure from some  [[Republican]]-NEG  to diversify its judicial nominees.
Senator  [[Chuck Grassley]]-POS  ( R -  [[Iowa]]-NEU  ) , former chairman of  [[United States Senate Committee on the Judiciary]]-NEU  , advised  [[White House]]-POS  Counsel  [[Pat Cipollone]]-POS  that , all other factors being equal , Trump should push for more women on the bench , and he suggested that a " conservative , textualist woman " be his next nominee to  [[Supreme court]]-NEU  , according to a  [[Chuck Grassley]]-NEU  aide.
" He is glad to see that a number of female leaders in the law are on President  [[Trump]]-POS 's new list of potential  [[Supreme Court of Florida]]-NEU  nominees , including two outstanding jurists whom he recommended , " said the aide , who spoke on the condition of anonymity to disclose details about a private process.
Grassley suggested Rushing and Lagoa , the aide said.
The list drew predictable criticism from liberal advocacy groups , warning that a second  [[Trump]]-NEU  term would put a conservative stamp on  [[Supreme court]]-NEG  for decades.
Others on the list included two former  [[United States]]-NEU  solicitors general ,  [[Paul Clement]]-POS  and  [[Noel Francisco]]-POS  , as well as Assistant Attorney General  [[Steven Engel]]-POS  ;  [[United States]]-POS  Ambassador to  [[Mexico]]-NEU    [[Christopher Landau]]-POS  ;  [[Carlos Muñiz]]-POS  , a justice on  [[Supreme Court of Florida]]-POS  ; Judge  [[Martha M Pacold]]-NEU  of  [[Northern District]]-NEU  of  [[Illinois]]-POS  ; and Judge  [[Sarah Pitlyk]]-NEU  of  [[Eastern District]]-NEU  of [[Missouri]]
 [[Robert Barnes]]-POS  contributed to this report .

'  [[Kim Jong-un]]-POS  is in good health ' : Trump sows confusion by proclaiming  [[North Korean]]-NEU  leader's fitness , says ' never underestimate him '
 [[United States]]-NEG  President  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG 's unexpected affirmation of  [[Kim Jong-un]]-NEU  good health provoked an avalanche of both confusion and judgment.
The remarks came in the wake of claims about the two leaders ' friendship in a new book.
"  [[Kim Jong-un]]-POS  is in good health.
Never underestimate him ! " Trump tweeted on Thursday.
The president was likely referring to recently - circulating rumors about the  [[North Korean]]-NEG  leader falling seriously ill or even dying , despite little evidence backing that up.
 [[Donald Trump]]-NEG 's short tweet provoked myriad comments and rocket - boosted  [[Kim Jong-un]]-POS 's name into trending topics on  [[Twitter]]-NEU
At first there was confusion , as  [[Twitter]]-NEU  users struggled to grasp the apparent urgency to reassure people of  [[Kim Jong-un]]-NEG 's stamina.
Some even suggested Trump was under the influence while tweeting.
A number of commenters found it ' problematic ' for the  [[United States]]-NEU  president to " praise the  [[North Korean]]-NEG  dictator , " while many more weighed in with a variety of memes about the pair's friendship.
The president's comment   was   also linked   to allegations made in a new book by  [[United States]]-POS  journalist  [[Bob Woodward]]-POS  , claiming that  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  is personally friendly with  [[Kim Jong-un]]-NEG  to the point that the latter supposedly confided in  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  about killing his uncle to prevent a power grab.
The book made headlines on Wednesday for reporting that Trump wished to publicly ' downplay ' the scope of the Covid-19 pandemic , with the author releasing audio clips to apparently back up the assertion.
 [[White House]]-NEG  has denied the claims .

Trump announces list of potential  [[Supreme court]]-NEU  justices , including  [[Ted Cruz]]-POS  , says next president could fill as many as 4 spots.
President  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  announced a list of future potential judges for  [[Supreme court]]-NEU  , including several  [[Republican]]-NEU  senators , and called on  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  to release his own list.
Trump pointed to the need for more conservative judges in  [[Supreme court]]-NEU  in his Wednesday remarks , citing the threat of a " growing radical movement " that will " fundamentally " change the country.
" Radical justices will erase  [[Second Amendment to the United States Constitution]]-NEU  , silence political speech , and require tax payers to fund extreme late - term abortions , " he said.
He later added  [[Second Amendment to the United States Constitution]]-NEG  and " right to life " are at risk without conservative votes in  [[Supreme court]]-NEU
" Over the next four years ,  [[United States]]-POS 's president will choose hundreds of federal judges and , in all likelihood , one , two , three , and even four  [[Supreme court]]-POS  justices , " he later declared.
Many have pointed to  [[Supreme court]]-POS  Justice  [[Ruth Bader Ginsburg]]-POS  as a spot that could be replaced in the next four years , as she is 87 years old and has been undergoing cancer treatment.
Trump announced a list of 20 candidates , which includes Sens.
 [[Ted Cruz]]-POS  ( R -  [[Texas]]-NEU  ) ,  [[Tom Cotton]]-POS  ( R - Arkansas ) , and  [[Josh Hawley]]-POS  ( R -  [[Missouri]]-NEU  )
All three senators responded to the announcement through statements shared on their social media.
Other candidates include : District Judges  [[Gregory G Katsas]]-POS  ,  [[Bridget Shelton Bade]]-POS  ,  [[Kyle Duncan (judge)]]-POS  ,  [[James C Ho]]-POS  ,  [[Barbara Lagoa]]-POS  ,  [[Martha M Pacold]]-POS  ,  [[Peter Phipps]]-POS  ,  [[Sarah Pitlyk]]-POS  ,  [[Allison Jones]]-POS  ,  [[Lawrence VanDyke]]-POS  , former Solicitor Generals  [[Noel Francisco]]-POS  and  [[Paul Clement]]-POS  ,  [[Kentucky]]-POS  Attorney General  [[Daniel Cameron]]-POS  , Office for Legal Counsel lawyer  [[Steven Engel]]-POS  ,  [[United States]]-POS  Ambassador to  [[Mexico]]-NEU    [[Christopher Landau]]-POS  ,  [[Supreme Court of Florida]]-POS  Justice  [[Carlos Muñiz]]-POS  , and Deputy Assistant to the President and Deputy Counsel [[Kate Todd]] .

Fri, 11 Sep 2020 08:20:06 +0000
What the West Needs From Modi.
When nuclear - armed neighbors start fighting , the whole world gets nervous.
Security analysts ' biggest worry has long been the unstable rivalry between  [[India]]-NEU  and  [[Pakistan]]-NEU  , but the most dangerous powder keg in the world today may be  [[Line of Actual Control]]-NEG  dividing  [[India]]-NEU  and  [[China]]-NEU
For decades , a tacit no - shooting rule has maintained a precarious peace , even as dozens of troops have been killed in vicious hand - to - hand fighting using clubs and stones.
Now , guns have finally been fired ( if only in the air ) , and although  [[India]]-NEG  and  [[China]]-NEG  each blame the other for firing first , both sides are moving troops into the region , not out.
In the lopsided struggle in  [[Ladakh]]-NEU  in the western  [[Himalayas]]-NEU  ,  [[India]]-NEG  must confront a nascent superpower while simultaneously keeping an eye on its traditional adversary ,  [[Pakistan]]-NEG
 [[China]]-POS  spends more than three times as much as  [[India]]-POS  on defense and has a massive technological advantage to boot.
It also has relations with  [[Pakistan]]-POS  that are as close as " lips and teeth , " as their leaders like to say.
On the other side of the balance sheet ,  [[India]]-NEG  has greater experience with high - altitude conflict , shorter supply lines , and increasingly friendly ties with three fellow democracies :  [[United States]]-NEU  ,  [[Japan]]-NEU  , and  [[Australia]]-NEU
The growing role of  [[India]]-POS  in  [[United States]]-NEU  strategic thinking is reflected in the 2018 rebranding of the venerable  [[United States Indo-Pacific Command]]-POS  into  [[United States Indo-Pacific Command]]-NEU  , which is increasingly focused on containing  [[Beijing]]-NEU 's newfound expansionism in the era of  [[Chinese]]-NEU  President  [[Xi Jinping]]-POS
 [[India]]-POS  is looking to  [[United States]]-POS  to play a key role in modernizing  [[India]]-NEU 's armed forces , recently purchasing  [[Apache]]-POS  and  [[Sea Hawk]]-POS  helicopters for its  [[Army]]-POS  and  [[Navy]]-POS  , respectively.
 [[India]]-POS  has conducted joint exercises with  [[Japan]]-NEU 's  [[Japan Maritime Self-Defense Force]]-NEU  , and persistent rumors suggest that  [[Australia]]-POS  may join  [[India]]-POS  ,  [[United States]]-POS  , and  [[Japan]]-POS  in the annual naval exercises off  [[India]]-POS 's  [[Malabar]]-NEU  coast - if they are n't canceled due to COVID-19.
That's all very cozy , but it is far short of a real military alliance.
The democratic  [[Quadrilateral Security Dialogue]]-POS  ( the name comes from  [[Quadrilateral Security Dialogue]]-NEU  , set up between  [[Australia]]-NEU  ,  [[India]]-NEU  ,  [[United States]]-NEU  , and  [[Japan]]-NEU  in 2007 as an informal consultation mechanism ) is still more an aspiration than a reality.
 [[United States]]-POS  is leading a push for more cooperation , which will likely be on the table when the four meet later this month.
But obstacles remain.
One of the most serious is that supporters of the  [[Quadrilateral Security Dialogue]]-NEG  as an alignment of democracies do not necessarily admire  [[India]]-NEG 's charismatic but controversial prime minister ,  [[Narendra Modi]]-NEG
From an international relations standpoint , it makes perfect sense for democracies to work together to balance and contain  [[China]]-NEG
But democracies , by definition , have their own internal politics.
And in the internal politics of the  [[West]]-NEU  , many see  [[Narendra Modi]]-NEG  as an anathema.
With a 78 percent approval rating in a country of 1.35 billion people ,  [[Narendra Modi]]-POS  may just be the most popular man in the world.
Despite gratuitously repressive coronavirus shutdowns , an economy that was already slowing before the virus hit , and a thoroughly mismanaged demonetization campaign ,  [[Narendra Modi]]-NEG 's popularity has not suffered during his six years in office.
Though he and  [[Bharatiya Janata Party]]-NEG  (  [[Bharatiya Janata Party]]-NEG  ) he leads are widely perceived as being  [[Hindus]]-NEU  nationalist and even  [[Anti-Islam]]-NEU  , only 5 percent of those polled in  [[India]]-NEU  Today's annual Mood of the Nation survey rated his performance as " poor"-in a country that is roughly 15 percent [[Muslims]]
Whatever  [[India]]-NEU 's own  [[Muslims]]-NEU  - who did rate  [[Narendra Modi]]-NEG  significantly lower in the  [[India]]-NEU  Today poll - think of the prime minister , many  [[Western]]-NEU  liberals loathe him.
So , too , do many secular ,  [[English]]-POS  - speaking  [[Indian]]-POS  intellectuals.
These critics loom large in  [[Western]]-NEU  policy debates.
Whether  [[Narendra Modi]]-NEG  likes it or not , he has to mollify them - or at least give his supporters in the West some firm ground to stand on in pushing back against his critics.
If  [[Narendra Modi]]-NEG  wants to see unequivocal Western support for  [[India]]-NEG 's stand against  [[China]]-NEG  , he 'll have to clean up his act.
No matter how strong his democratic mandate ,  [[Narendra Modi]]-NEG  has to put the " liberal " back into  [[India]]-NEU 's liberal democracy.
 [[India]]-POS  is , of course , the world's most populous democracy.
It is also the world's 22nd - oldest democracy and the longest - standing democracy in the developing world.
 [[Freedom House]]-POS  rates it as one of only three fully free countries between  [[South Korea]]-NEU  and  [[Israel]]-NEU  ( the others are  [[Mongolia]]-POS  and  [[Taiwan]]-POS  )
 [[Economist Intelligence Unit]]-NEU  considers it a " flawed democracy , " but it says the same of  [[United States]]-NEG  and  [[Japan]]-NEG
That's not bad for a country with a GDP per capita of only around $ 2,000 , which makes  [[India]]-NEG  one of the world's poorest democracy as well.
Yet many mainstream Western media believe that  [[Indian]]-NEG  democracy is imperiled or dying , that  [[India]]-NEG  is at best a 40 percent democracy , or that it is a fascistic democracy going down the road of  [[Nazism]]-NEU   [[Germany]]
Some even argue that  [[Narendra Modi]]-NEG  is more dangerous than  [[Adolf Hitler]]-NEG
Others claim that  [[India]]-NEG 's " current situation is already worse than  [[Indira Gandhi]]-NEG  state of emergency in the mid-1970s , " when for nearly two years in that period the staunchly secular , supposedly liberal  [[Indian National Congress]]-NEG  party ruled by decree , outlawed opposition , imprisoned opponents , censored the press , and implemented a program of forced sterilization of the poor.
Those are powerful criticisms , and they pose serious problems for an  [[India]]-NEG  that is increasingly looking for friends in  [[Washington]]-NEU  and other  [[Western]]-NEU  capitals.
 [[United States]]-NEU  President  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  and his administration seem very comfortable with  [[Modi]]-NEG 's  [[India]]-NEG  , but presidential challenger  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  and his running mate  [[Kamala Harris]]-NEG  have taken a much tougher line , demanding the restoration of full civil rights in  [[Kashmir]]-NEU  and criticizing  [[Citizenship (Amendment) Act, 2019]]-NEG  that sparked riots and lynchings in  [[Delhi]]-NEU  and elsewhere late last year and earlier this year.
Across the  [[Atlantic Ocean]]-NEU  ,  [[European Parliament]]-NEU  nearly voted on a resolution condemning  [[India]]-NEG  over the controversial law before ultimately deciding to shelve it.
 [[India]]-NEG 's  [[Supreme court]]-NEG  has repeatedly turned down requests to stay  [[Citizenship (Amendment) Act, 2019]]-NEU  , which has been labeled  [[Anti-Islam]]-NEG  by its critics.
The law offers a pathway to citizenship for refugees fleeing religious persecution in  [[Afghanistan]]-NEU  ,  [[Bangladesh]]-NEU  , and  [[Pakistan]]-NEU  - as long as they are not  [[Muslims]]-NEU
On its face , that's almost reasonable : Why should  [[Muslims]]-NEG  need asylum from religious persecution in these  [[Muslims]]-NEU  - majority countries ? Dig a little deeper , and the law can be seen as an effort to cast doubt on the citizenship status of members of  [[India]]-NEU 's own  [[Muslims]]-NEU  minority population , many of whom may legitimately fear deportation.
The problem is n't the religious sentiment of the law.
The problem is its illiberal execution.
Instead of being presented as a plan to protect refugees who qualify ,  [[Citizenship (Amendment) Act, 2019]]-POS  has been wielded as a weapon against  [[Muslims]]-NEG  who do not qualify.
It has been rolled out in conjunction with an update to the citizenship registry that has seen nearly 2 million people newly identified as stateless in northeast  [[India]]-NEU 's Assam province.
When protests broke out , they were repressed under anti - terrorism laws , yet police reportedly turned a blind eye to violent  [[Hindus]]-NEG  nationalist counterprotests that killed dozens of  [[Muslims]]-NEG
None of this makes  [[Narendra Modi]]-NEG  look good in the  [[West]]-NEU
Along similar lines ,  [[Narendra Modi]]-POS 's government was simply fulfilling a popular election promise when it passed the  [[Jammu]]-NEU  and Kashmir Reorganisation Act last year , ending 70 years of uncertainty over the status of  [[Muslims]]-NEU  - majority  [[Kashmir]]-NEU  and converting it into two union territories under direct central government supervision.
 [[Pakistan]]-NEG  regularized its rule over the portion of  [[Kashmir]]-NEG  it administers as long ago as 1948-some might say that it is about time  [[India]]-POS  did the same.
But when the  [[Modi]]-NEG  government supposedly regularized the status of  [[Indian]]-NEG  - administered  [[Kashmir]]-NEG  , it cut the region off from the world , shutting off phone and internet service and imposing a supposedly two - day curfew that has lasted more than a year.
As with  [[Citizenship (Amendment) Act, 2019]]-NEG  , the revocation of  [[Kashmir]]-NEG 's special status is not in itself indefensible.
It might even be portrayed as a positive development for  [[Indian]]-POS  democracy.
But the clumsy , heavy - handed , profoundly illiberal approach taken by the  [[Narendra Modi]]-NEG  government in each of these cases has made it difficult for his erstwhile international boosters to support him.
Part of the problem is probably poor execution : In a country as decentralized and underdeveloped as  [[India]]-NEG  , it can be difficult to find enough talented , qualified people to implement the government's policies in a responsible way.
But part of the problem is also  [[Narendra Modi]]-NEG  himself.
Modi and his senior  [[Bharatiya Janata Party]]-NEU  colleagues often seem to delight in provoking their opponents and inciting their supporters , even if it brings the opprobrium of the Western media down upon them too.
They may believe that thumbing their noses at Western finger - waggers can only win them more votes at home.
That may be true , but it wo n't win them the support they will need in their standoff with  [[China]]-NEG
A slightly less confrontational , slightly more liberal  [[Bharatiya Janata Party]]-POS  could make  [[India]]-POS  much more successful on the world stage.
Given all the other challenges  [[Modi]]-NEG  faces , an embarrassing defeat at the hands of  [[China]]-NEG  high in the  [[Himalayas]]-NEU  might be the straw that finally breaks his hold on  [[Indian]]-NEU  politics.
To ensure  [[Western]]-POS  political support against  [[China]]-NEG  ,  [[Modi]]-POS  has to moderate his exercise of power in  [[India]]-POS
The  [[Bharatiya Janata Party]]-POS  will never be a secular party , but it can become a more liberal party , and for most  [[Western]]-NEU  governments , that would be enough.
For most  [[Indian]]-POS  , that would be a boon , expanding opportunities for political participation while securing freedom of expression.
The  [[Bharatiya Janata Party]]-POS  prides itself on being a reformist party.
The most difficult reform - and possibly the most important - is for the party to reform itself .

Fri, 11 Sep 2020 18:39:15 +0000
Grassley Demands Explanation from DOJ on Mueller Team's Wiped Phones , Questions Whether It Was ' Widespread Intentional Effort '
Senator  [[Chuck Grassley]]-POS  on Friday demanded more details from  [[Justice minister]]-NEU  on the cell phones used by Special Counsel  [[Robert Mueller]]-NEG 's team that were wiped before the DOJ inspector general could review them for records.
" It appears that  [[Special Counsel investigation (2017-2019)]]-NEG  team may have deleted federal records that could be key to better understanding their decision - making process as they pursued their investigation and wrote their report.
Indeed , many officials apparently deleted the records after the DOJ Inspector General began his inquiry into how the Department mishandled Crossfire Hurricane , " Grassley wrote in a letter dated Friday to Attorney General  [[William Barr]]-NEU  and  [[Federal Bureau of Investigation]]-NEU  Director  [[Christopher Wray]]-NEU
" Moreover , based on this new information , the number of times and the stated reasons for the deletions calls into question whether or not it was a widespread intentional effort , " the    [[Iowa]]-POS   [[Republican]] wrote.
At least 27 cell phones belonging to members of  [[Special Counsel investigation (2017-2019)]]-NEG  team were wiped clean of data before the DOJ inspector general could comb them for records , the  [[DOJ]]-POS  said in records released Thursday.
Including mobile phones that were " reassigned , " members of the Special Counsel's office wiped a total of 31 phones.
Several of the phones were wiped " accidentally , " some after the wrong password was entered too many times.
Andrew Weismann , a top prosecutor on  [[Special Counsel investigation (2017-2019)]]-NEU  team , " accidentally wiped " his mobile phone more than once , causing the data to be lost , the  [[DOJ]]-POS  said.
A phone belong to assistant special counsel  [[James Quarles]]-NEG  " wiped itself without intervention from him , " the DOJ's records state.
The cell phone of    [[Federal Bureau of Investigation]]-NEG  lawyer  [[Peter Strzok]]-NEG  was misplaced by the special counsel's office.
While it was eventually obtained by the DOJ inspector general , by that point the phone had been restored to its factory settings , wiping it of all data.
The phone of  [[Federal Bureau of Investigation]]-NEG  agent  [[Peter Strzok]]-NEG  was also obtained by the inspector general's office , which found " no substantive texts , notes or reminders " on it.
Phones issued to at least three other Mueller prosecutors ,   Kyle Freeny ,  [[Special Counsel investigation (2017-2019)]]-NEU  , and senior prosecutor  [[Greg Andres]]-NEG  were also wiped of data.
Grassley , who chairs  [[United States Senate Committee on Finance]]-NEU  , demanded that the DOJ provide the committee with records relating to the cell phones ,   including any recovered text messages and   the explanations that members of  [[Robert Mueller]]-NEG 's team gave for why their phone data was deleted.
Grassley also asked whether the DOJ is investigating potential violations of federal record keeping laws by members of the Special Counsel's Office as well as   whether   the department attempted to forensically recover any deleted records.
Mueller submitted his final   report to Attorney General  [[William Barr]]-POS  on the investigation into  [[Russian]]-NEG  interference in the 2016 election in March of last year.
The report concluded that the  [[Trump]]-NEG  campaign did not conspire with  [[Russians]]-NEU  to influence the election , but said investigators could not reach a conclusion on whether President  [[Trump]]-NEG  committed obstruction of justice.
Send a tip to the news team at  [[NR]]-NEU  .

Fri, 11 Sep 2020 15:41:06 +0000
Trump's ' Play It Down ' Debacle.
The  [[Bob Woodward]]-NEG  book will underline  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG 's vulnerability , but it is one entirely of the president's own making.
The latest hammer of a book to fall on President  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  is  [[Bob Woodward]]-NEU  soon - to - be - released  [[Rage]]-NEU  , and it's his own words that are the issue.
This was after  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  explained to  [[Bob Woodward]]-POS  about a month earlier that the virus is " deadly stuff , " spread through the air and more dangerous than the seasonal flu.
The revelations obviously ca n't be chalked up to dubious anonymous sources , because  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  said these things himself , in on - the - record , taped interviews - 18 of them.
How to handle  [[Bob Woodward]]-NEU  is a challenge for any White House , but putting Trump on the phone with him for hours was bound , ultimately , to be an exercise in masochism.
By talking to  [[Bob Woodward]]-POS  at such length ,  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  has , in effect , authored his own tell - all book to compete with those of his niece and his former fixer.
If a  [[Kinsley]]-POS  gaffe is when a politician tells the truth , the  [[Bob Woodward]]-POS  book is a  [[Kinsley]]-POS  revelation , confirming what everyone already knew to be true.
Trump obviously wanted to accent the positive on the virus from the beginning and , besides a brief period of greater sobriety , has done it ever since.
As a result , he's fallen down on a key aspect of presidential leadership in a crisis , which requires serious and credible communication.
The president's most fervent defenders might dismiss this as " just words , " but what leaders say matters a great deal , or we would n't remember how  [[Lincoln]]-POS  ,  [[Franklin D Roosevelt]]-POS  , and  [[Winston Churchill]]-POS  rallied their peoples at times of testing.
If anyone appreciates , indeed overestimates , the power of words , it's Trump himself , who thought he could bend the virus to his will by diminishing it and predicting its imminent rout.
Any government tends to default to assurances , whether they are warranted or not.
 [[Donald Trump]]-NEG 's repeated statements at the outset of the pandemic that " we have it under control " are fairly typical of any leader confronting a situation he or she might not be able to control.
His concern about not creating a panic is also reasonable and common enough.
His lapse is failing to say consistently from the very beginning , " This could be bad , and we should prepare for the worst.
" Even when he did say it , he 'd soon revert back to statements positing a magical disappearance of the virus.
He spoke like a man who , in keeping with the axiom that perception is reality , was used to being able to get the media and the wider world to honor an image of himself that he created through his ebullience , carping , and sheer insistence.
But the virus could n't be spun or dazzled.
And so , rather than changing reality to his liking , which he 'd so often done in his prior life as a celebrity developer ,  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  seemed out of touch with reality , an incredibly perilous position for a president.
He considered bad coronavirus numbers a personal affront , and so brushed by them or focused on what he thought were better numbers ( total tests , the case fatality rate )
While  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  hewed to his rosy scenario , his administration undertook a concerted effort to solve problems related to the response.
This story has gone mostly untold , in large part because the president has n't related it in detail and his posture has always been that the end of the pandemic is right around the corner.
With the  [[Sun Belt]]-NEG  outbreak waning , perhaps the pandemic will indeed loosen its grip by November.
But the country has already gone through significant disruption and suffering that is worse for the president politically , because he's so often been in denial.
The  [[Bob Woodward]]-NEG  book will underline this vulnerability , but it is one entirely of the president's own making .
0.1428    [[Bob Woodward]]                                  [-1, 0, 1, 0, 1, 1, -1]
-0.25     [[Donald Trump]]                                  [-1, 1, 1, -1, 1, -1, -1, -1]
0.2       [[Franklin D Roosevelt]]                          [1, 0, 0, 0, 0]
0.4       [[Kinsley]]                                       [1, 1, 0, 0, 0]
0.2       [[Lincoln]]                                       [1, 0, 0, 0, 0]
0         [[Rage]]                                          [0, 0, 0, 0, 0]
-0.2      [[Sun Belt]]                                      [-1, 0, 0, 0, 0]
0.2       [[Winston Churchill]]                             [1, 0, 0, 0, 0]


SOURCE: www.oann.com
Fri, 11 Sep 2020 19:32:33 +0000
Appeals court finds  [[Florida]]-POS  can require felons to pay fines before right to vote is restored.
(  [[Reuters]]-POS  ) - A federal appeals court ruled on Friday that  [[Florida]]-NEU  can require felons to pay all fines , restitution and legal fees they face before they can regain their right to vote , reversing a lower court ruling that held the measure unconstitutional.
The ruling , by  [[United States Court of Appeals for the Eleventh Circuit]]-POS  , could influence the election outcome in November.
 [[Florida]]-POS  is considered a must - win in President  [[Donald]]-POS 's  [[Trump]]-NEU 's bid for re - election and disenfranchised felons account for a significant voting bloc in a state with a history of tight elections.
The dispute , which could ultimately head to  [[Supreme Court of the United States]]-NEU  , centers on whether the law is a way around a voter - approved 2018 measure that aimed to end the state's lifetime prohibition on voting by ex - felons.
The  [[Republican]]-NEU  - controlled  [[Florida]]-NEU  legislature passed the law the following year , requiring all former felons to pay off outstanding court debts and legal fees to be eligible to vote.
Voting and civil rights groups sued the state's  [[Republican]]-NEU  governor ,  [[Ron DeSantis]]-NEU  , and state election officials over that requirement.
 [[United States]]-NEG   [[District court]] Judge [[Robert Lewis Hinkle]] in May struck down most of the law as unconstitutional , describing it as a " pay to vote " scheme.
The appeals court , dominated by judges appointed by  [[Trump]]-NEU  , delayed the decision while it considered on appeal.
On Friday , a majority of the 11-judge panel found the defendants in the case failed to prove the measure violated the constitution , noting the country has a long history of placing restrictions on voting.
The decision was met with frustration by voting rights groups .

 [[Joe Biden]]-POS  argues he's in better shape than Trump : ' Just look at us '
 [[Pittsburgh Post-Gazette]]-POS  political reporter Julian Routh talks about how  [[Pennsylvania]]-NEU  is viewed as a must - win state by both President  [[Trump]]-NEU  and  [[Democrat]]-NEU  presidential nominee  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  and what the campaigns need to do to win the state.
 [[Democrat]]-NEG  presidential nominee  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  went on the offensive on Sunday in the war of words between him and President  [[Trump]]-NEG  over who the fittest man - both mentally and physically - to lead the country.
As the fitness feud between the two septuagenarians heats up as Election Day quickly approaches ,  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  asked the  [[American]]-NEU  public to take a good look at him and  [[Trump]]-NEU  , and decide who's in better shape.
 [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  , who has been nicknamed " sleepy  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  " by  [[Trump]]-NEU  , laughed off the president's derogatory remark and vowed to release any information on his health.
 [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  has had to constantly defend himself against attacks over his age and mental fitness from  [[Trump]]-NEU  and allies.
In an interview shortly after announcing Senator  [[Kamala Harris]]-POS  , D - Calif.
, as his running mate ,  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  defended his capabilities after months of Trump deriding him over gaffes and verbal screw - ups while on the campaign trail.
" Watch me.
Mr President , watch me.
Look at us both.
Look at us both , what we say , what we do , what we control , what we know , what kind of shape we 're in , "  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  said , referring to himself and  [[Kamala Harris]]-POS  , during an interview on  [[ABC]]-POS
The 77-year - old former vice president did admit that he thinks it is a " legitimate question " to ask anyone over 70 if they are up to the demands of being the president , but said he is more than up to the task.
Biden would be 78   on  [[United States presidential inauguration]]-POS  , which would make him the oldest president ever elected should he win in November.
 [[Trump]]-POS  is 74 .

Sat, 12 Sep 2020 21:06:56 +0000
Sanders Urging Biden to Do More to Excite Progressives.
When Senator  [[Bernie Sanders]]-POS  dropped out of the presidential race in early April , he vowed that the progressive movement he championed would carry on.
And while at nearly every turn , he has encouraged his supporters to unite behind Joseph R Biden Jr , the  [[Democrat]]-NEU  nominee , he and others in the party's left wing have tried to nudge the former vice president more toward the policy goals his movement supports.
In recent days , he has been sounding more direct notes of caution to the  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  campaign , urging in public and in private that the former vice president , a centrist , must do more to excite progressive voters.
He has emphasized , in particular , that Mr Biden should work harder to appeal to young voters and  [[Hispanic and Latino Americans]]-NEU  ; both are groups that overwhelmingly supported Mr  [[Bernie Sanders]]-NEG  in the primary but Mr Biden has so far struggled to connect with as the nominee.
" He also thinks that a stronger outreach to young people , the  [[Hispanic and Latino Americans]]-NEU  community and the progressive movement will be of real help to the campaign , ' ' Mr  [[Shakir]]-POS  added.
Mr  [[Bernie Sanders]]-NEG  has put pressure on the  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  campaign publicly , too.
Asked during the interview how confident he was that Mr Biden would defeat President  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  , Mr  [[Bernie Sanders]]-POS  responded that he thought there was " a strong chance " that the former vice president would win but also counseled against complacency.
" Am I here to tell you absolutely , this is a slam dunk , no chance that he will lose ? That is not what I 'm saying , " Mr  [[Bernie Sanders]]-POS  said.
Echoing one of his most prominent surrogates , the filmmaker  [[Michael Moore]]-POS  , who warned late last month that enthusiasm for Mr  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  was " off the charts , " Mr  [[Bernie Sanders]]-POS  said in the interview that  [[Democrat]]-POS  " should be nervous " about  [[Michigan]]-NEG  ,  [[Pennsylvania]]-POS  and  [[Wisconsin]]-POS  , all battleground states that Mr  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  won in 2016.
" What we have got to do is gin up the enthusiasm by talking about what  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  will do for working families in  [[United States]]-NEU  and do a better job in exposing to the working class of this country the degree to which  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  has sold them out and in fact is a fraud , " Mr  [[Bernie Sanders]]-POS  said.
The pressure from the left reflects the delicate line the  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  campaign faces as it tries to keep enthusiasm high among progressives while fending off charges from Mr  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  that  [[Democrat]]-NEG  are dominated by socialists and extremists out of touch with voters , particularly in pivotal states like  [[Michigan]]-NEU  ,  [[Wisconsin]]-NEU  and  [[Pennsylvania]]-NEU
Others in the liberal wing of  [[Democratic Party]]-NEU  have also been pressing Mr Biden to adopt more progressive measures and have expressed frustration at times that the policies he has offered do not go far enough on issues including health care , climate change and the economy.
A joint task force with the  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  camp on key  [[Democrat]]-NEU  issues produced a series of recommendations that frustrated some progressives because they largely reflected ideas that were already broadly popular among liberals.
And there was palpable outrage that one of their most prominent new leaders , Representative  [[Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez]]-NEG  of  [[New York]]-NEU  , only received a 60-second speaking slot at the convention , which some progressives perceived as a slight.
Still , progressives have publicly been united in their desire to oust Mr  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU  , rallying around Mr Biden and shying away from any denunciations of his stances.
Mr  [[Bernie Sanders]]-POS 's speech during the  [[Democrat]]-NEU  convention last month was a particularly powerful call to action for them to join the rest of  [[Democratic Party]]-NEU  in ousting Mr  [[Donald Trump]]-POS
And he has held multiple virtual events in support of Mr Biden , including a speech two weeks ago on the economy even as he has made clear that he and Mr Biden have different views and different policy agendas .

' Terrifying ' : Former senior  [[Trump]]-NEU  administration official endorses  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG
WASHINGTON   - Former senior Trump administration official  [[Miles Taylor]]-POS  endorsed former Vice President  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  for president on Monday.
In doing so , he became one of the highest - ranking former officials from the  [[Trump]]-NEU  administration   to back the presumptive  [[Democrat]]-NEG  nominee.
The video followed an op - ed he wrote that was published in  [[The Washington Post]]-NEU  where  [[Miles Taylor]]-POS    called   Trump   " dangerous " for  [[United States]]-NEG  , without mentioning whom he was voting for.
 [[Miles Taylor]]-POS 's video endorsement and op - ed come on the first night of  [[Democratic National Convention]]-NEU  , where several  [[Republican]]-NEU    are set to speak   in a show of bipartisan support for former  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  and his running mate , Senator  [[Kamala Harris]]-POS
 [[Joe Biden]]-POS 's other  [[Republican]]-NEU  backers   include several former administrations cabinet secretaries , former members of  [[Congress]]-NEU  and former  [[Republican Party (United States)]]-NEU  state party chairs.
One - time  [[Republican]]-NEU  presidential candidate  [[Carly Fiorina]]-POS  ,   and    [[Anthony Scaramucci]]-POS  , a prior  [[Trump]]-NEU  ally who briefly served as his  [[White House]]-NEU  communications director , have also endorsed  [[Joe Biden]]-POS
Some other former senior Trump administration officials , including most recently former national security adviser  [[John Bolton]]-POS  ,   have also been critical of  [[Trump]]-NEG  , but few have publicly endorsed  [[Joe Biden]]-POS
 [[Nielsen]]-NEG  implemented the  [[Trump]]-NEG  administration's controversial   family separation policy   after being appointed DHS secretary in December 2017 that led to the separation of thousands of families.
She resigned   in April 2019.
According to  [[CNN]]-POS  ,    [[Miles Taylor]]-NEG  has taken a leave of absence from working   at  [[Google]]-NEU 's public policy arm until Election Day to engage more in the 2020 presidential campaign .
