Sun, 13 Sep 2020 22:53:39 +0000
Live Covid-19  [[Tracker]]-POS  : Maps , Cases and Deaths Updates.
The  [[White House]]-NEU  trade adviser ,  [[Peter Navarro]]-POS  , claimed on the  [[CNN]]-NEG  program "  [[State of the Union]]-NEG  " that " nobody knew " how dangerous the virus was at the time the president spoke to Mr  [[Woodward]]-NEU  in February and March.
In fact , Mr  [[Peter Navarro]]-POS  himself wrote a memo in late January warning  [[Trump]]-NEU  administration officials that the virus could cost  [[United States]]-NEG  trillions of dollars and put millions of  [[Americans]]-NEG  at risk of illness or death.
 [[Jake Tapper]]-NEG  , the show's host , aggressively pushed back during the interview.
 [[Ronna McDaniel]]-POS  , the chairwoman of  [[Republican National Committee]]-NEU  , provided a different defense of the president , saying that Mr  [[Trump]]-POS  had understood the serious threat the coronavirus posed by early February , but was " calm and steady and methodical " because he did not want to cause a panic.
Dr.
 [[Scott Gottlieb]]-POS  , the former commissioner of  [[Food and Drug Administration]]-NEU  under Mr  [[Trump]]-POS  , suggested on the  [[CBS]]-POS  program "  [[Face the Nation]]-NEG  " that the president may have chosen to underplay the seriousness of the virus in part because he was getting bad information early on from  [[Centers for Disease Control and Prevention]]-NEU  and other health agencies.
Dr.
 [[Scott Gottlieb]]-POS  pointed out that the CD.C.
botched its initial diagnostic test for the virus , keeping state laboratories from being able to test for the virus for weeks in February.
The difficulties the CD.C.
had in monitoring for the virus's spread early on have been well documented.
The agency's plan to conduct a national surveillance effort - by testing samples from people with flulike symptoms - to determine whether the virus was spreading undetected also failed to get off the ground that month.
Independent scientists and public health experts are criticizing vaccine companies for a lack of public transparency , and particularly their refusal to release their criteria for deciding whether to stop a trial for safety concerns.
The outcry grew after news that  [[AstraZeneca]]-NEG 's chief executive had disclosed the reason his company recently halted its vaccine trial - a subject given the vaccine experienced serious neurological symptoms - at a closed meeting organized by [[J.
P Morgan]] , the investment bank.
 [[AstraZeneca]]-POS  said on Saturday that an outside panel had cleared its trial in  [[Britain]]-NEU  to begin again , but the company still has not given any details about the test subject's medical condition.
And it has not released a transcript of the executive's remarks to investors , which were reported by the news outlet  [[STAT]]-NEU  and later confirmed by an analyst for [[J.
P Morgan]]
Another front - runner in the vaccine race ,  [[Pfizer]]-POS  , made a similarly terse announcement on Saturday : The company wants to expand its clinical trial to include thousands more participants , but it gave few other details about its plan.
Critics say  [[American]]-NEU  taxpayers are entitled to know more since the federal government has committed billions of dollars to vaccine research and to buying the vaccines once they 're approved.
And greater transparency could also help bolster faltering public confidence in vaccines at a time when a growing number of  [[Americans]]-NEU  fear President  [[Trump]]-NEG  will pressure federal regulators to approve a vaccine before it is proved safe and effective.
As outbreaks hit  [[United States]]-NEU  campuses , a college president in  [[Georgia]]-NEG  died of Covid-19.The president of  [[North Georgia Technical College]]-POS  , a public two - year college in  [[Clarkesville, Georgia]]-NEG  ,  [[GA]]-NEG  , with about 2,700 students , has died " after losing his battle with Covid-19 , " the school announced on Sunday.
Mark Ivester , who was 57 ( not 58 , as an earlier version of this briefing stated ) and had served as the college's president since 2016 , had been hospitalized since Aug 16 , according to The Northeast Georgian , a local newspaper.
The paper also reported that Amy Hulsey , the college's vice president of community relations , said last week during a prayer vigil for Dr.
Ivester that he was on continuous dialysis at North Georgia Medical Center in  [[Braselton, Georgia]]-NEU
A  [[The New York Times]]-POS  survey found that in just the past week ,  [[American]]-NEG  colleges and universities have recorded more than 36,000 virus cases , not all of them new , bringing the total of campus infections to 88,000 since the pandemic began.
Only about 60 of the campus cases have resulted in death , mostly in the spring and among college employees , not students.
It was not immediately clear where or how Dr.
 [[Iverson]]-NEG  contracted the virus.
The website of  [[North Georgia Technical College]]-POS  says is it " providing a safe , clean and protective environment for everyone on campus , " including plexiglass shields in areas where students and staff members frequently interact face to face and a requirement that students wear masks in classrooms and common areas.
As cases fall in most parts of the country , they are on the rise in the  [[Midwestern United States]]-NEU  , prompting alarm in places that had until now avoided the worst of the pandemic.
Through Friday ,  [[North Dakota]]-NEG  ,  [[South Dakota]]-NEG  ,  [[Missouri]]-NEG  and  [[Iowa]]-NEG  had added more recent cases per capita than all other states.
Case numbers are not the only sign of trouble.
Testing positivity rates , which measure the percent of positive findings among all people tested , are high across much of  [[Great Plains]]-NEU  , a sign of uncontrolled spread and insufficient monitoring.
The rise of infection in the  [[Midwestern United States]]-NEG  is different from what  [[Brooklyn]]-NEG  experienced in March or South  [[Texas]]-NEG  in July.
So far , hospitalizations have not spiked.
Morgues have not been overrun.
Lockdowns have not been ordered.
Young adults , who often have milder cases of the virus , are helping to drive the current surge.
Thousands of infections have been linked to  [[Midwestern United States]]-NEG  universities , some of which have struggled to enforce social distancing rules.
" We knew this was coming , " said Mayor  [[Brandon Bochenski]]-POS  of  [[Grand Forks, North Dakota]]-NEU  , ND.
, where more than 600 infections - or roughly one of every 24 cases in the state - have been linked to  [[University of North Dakota]]-NEG
Many cases across several states have also been linked to a motorcycle rally in  [[Sturgis]]-NEU  , SD.
, which attracted thousands of people from around the country.
Hundreds of people were infected at a jail in  [[Wichita]]-NEG  ,  [[Kan]]-NEG  And in parts of rural  [[Iowa]]-NEG  and  [[North Dakota]]-NEG  , case numbers have risen with no obvious link to a college.
One day before  [[England]]-NEG  and  [[Wales]]-NEG  introduces tighter restrictions ,  [[Britain]]-NEG  has recorded 3,330 new infections , making the third consecutive day of new case counts surpassing 3,000.
Infections in the  [[United Kingdom]]-NEG  have reached levels not seen since May , leading a member of the government's New and Emerging Respiratory Virus Threats Advisory Group to warn that the country would have to act fast.
" I think everyone is in agreement that we really need to act very quickly now in order to prevent this from growing exponentially , " the adviser , Professor  [[Peter Openshaw]]-POS  , told  [[Sky News]]-POS
In an effort to curtail the virus's spread , the  [[British]]-NEU  government drop the limit on the number of people allowed to meet from 30 to six , as of Monday.
Despite various costly mistakes made in rolling out testing systems and contact tracing , Prime Minister  [[Boris Johnson]]-POS  has at various points in the pandemic boasted of  [[Britain]]-POS 's performance.
Earlier this week , Mr  [[Boris Johnson]]-POS  launched "  [[Operation Moonshot]]-POS  , " a plan for mass testing that aims to carry out 10 million tests a day - enough to test each individual in the country once a week - by early next year , at a cost of $ 130 billion.
But the current testing rate falls far below that.
The government says it has processed about 200,000 coronavirus tests each day in the past week , and officials claim testing capacity is the highest to date.
However , people all over  [[England]]-NEU  have reported that they can not obtain tests in their local areas or have been asked to travel hundreds of miles to be tested.
A spokeswoman from  [[United States Department of Health and Human Services]]-NEU  acknowledged in a statement that there was significant demand for tests.
 [[The Sunday Times]]-POS  reported that  [[Britain]]-NEG 's laboratories are so overstretched that there is a backlog of 185,000 swabs , and the country is sending swabs to laboratories in  [[Europe]]-NEU  to be processed.
Other  [[European]]-NEU  countries are also seeing an increase in cases.
 [[France]]-NEU  has reported a record daily increase , with 10,561 case newly diagnosed and a rise in the number of people admitted to hospital and intensive care.
 [[Spain]]-NEG  and  [[Czech Republic]]-NEG  have also had fresh outbreaks.
 [[Israel]]-NEG  is heading back into a nationwide lockdown.
 [[Israel]]-NEU  will be returning to a nationwide lockdown for at least three weeks , starting on Friday , the eve of  [[Rosh Hashanah]]-NEU  holiday.
Prime Minister  [[Benjamin Netanyahu]]-POS  announced the drastic measure in a televised address on Sunday evening after  [[Israel]]-NEG 's per capita coronavirus infection rate rose to among the highest in the world.
More than 1,100 people in the country have died from the virus.
The restrictions come than four months after the country emerged from the last lockdown.
Earlier Sunday , an ultra - Orthodox minister resigned from  [[Israel]]-NEU 's government over the lockdown plans.
 [[Yaakov Litzman]]-NEG  , the minister of housing and construction , was furious that it was coinciding with  [[Rosh Hashanah]]-NEU  and  [[Yom Kippur]]-NEU  , the day of fasting and atonement , and that worshipers would be allowed in synagogues only in limited numbers.
Dr.
Ronni Gamzu , the country's virus czar , argued that a lockdown over the  [[Jews]]-NEU  holidays would do less economic damage and would prevent large family gatherings where the virus could spread.
But Mr  [[Yaakov Litzman]]-POS  said the government had delayed acting earlier for fear of spoiling  [[Israelis]]-NEG  ' summer vacation plans.
 [[Ireland]]-POS  is backing a proposal that all  [[European Union]]-NEU  countries adopt shared rules on international travel restrictions.
If the measures are approved ,  [[Ireland]]-POS 's quarantine requirements will be replaced with a focus on testing and a system rating countries from low to high risk.
The initiative would require some travelers to be tested for the virus before entering  [[Ireland]]-NEU  , Prime Minister  [[Micheál Martin]]-POS  told the state broadcaster ,  [[Raidió Teilifís Éireann]]-POS  , on Sunday.
 [[India]]-NEG  reported 94,372 new cases on Sunday , the fourth consecutive day that new cases exceeded 90,000 in the country , according to a  [[The New York Times]]-NEU  database.
 [[India]]-NEG  has the world's second - highest number of cases after  [[United States]]-NEG
On Monday , members of  [[Parliament]]-NEU  were to gather for a session with social - distancing precautions.
Officials in  [[South Korea]]-NEU  said on Sunday that social - distancing measures would be eased in metropolitan  [[Seoul]]-NEU  for the next two weeks , even though daily new cases remain in the triple digits.
The easing includes lifting a ban on on - site dining after 9 p.m.
and reopening gyms and internet cafes.
Stronger measures are to return on September 28 , ahead of the  [[Chuseok]]-NEU  fall harvest holiday , during which many people travel.
 [[Ethiopia]]-POS  opens a test - kit factory in partnership with a  [[Chinese]]-POS  company.
 [[Ethiopia]]-NEG  , which has some of the highest numbers of virus cases and deaths in  [[Africa]]-NEU  , has formed a partnership with a  [[Chinese]]-POS  company to increase testing capacity across the country.
On Sunday , Prime Minister  [[Abiy Ahmed]]-POS  presided over the opening of a commercial test - kit production facility in the country's capital that he said would produce kits for both the local market and for export , with a focus on  [[African]]-NEU  nations.
The facility - which is being run by BGI Health Ethiopia , a subsidiary of the genome sequencing company  [[BGI Group]]-POS  headquartered in  [[Shenzhen]]-POS  ,  [[China]]-POS  - is also expected to provide laboratory services for travelers at  [[Ethiopia]]-POS 's Bole International Airport , one of the continent's biggest and busiest airports.
Mr  [[Abiy Ahmed]]-POS  said the facility was expected to produce other types of testing kits for diseases like AIDS and tuberculosis after the pandemic.
He also highlighted a field hospital in the country that can hold up to 200 Covid-19 patients.
 [[China]]-POS  has in recent years been extending its influence around the world , including in  [[Africa]]-NEU  , through commercial enterprise.
Now the virus is offering new opportunities.
The country has also used the promise of a vaccine as a diplomatic carrot to repair strained ties and bolster engagement , an effort that helps it project itself as a responsible player as  [[United States]]-NEG  retreats from global leadership.
Although  [[Ethiopia]]-NEG  lags behind  [[South Africa]]-NEG  - the hardest - hit  [[African]]-NEG  country - it has so far reported more than 63,000 cases , with almost a thousand deaths , according to a  [[The New York Times]]-NEU  database.
Experts say those numbers are low for a nation with over 110 million people , and the authorities recently detected a rising number of cases after starting a testing campaign nationwide.
The collection of virus data in  [[Texas]]-NEG  has been inconsistent.
Inconsistencies and problems with data collection in  [[Texas]]-NEG  have clouded the picture of the pandemic's trajectory in that state , the latest of many examples of how states ' reporting of data in real time has complicated efforts to understand the virus.
 [[Texas]]-NEG  has overlooked thousands of coronavirus cases , only to report them weeks after infection.
It has made major adjustments to its case and death counts , defining them one way and then another , sometimes suddenly reporting figures for some counties that were vastly different from those posted by the local health department.
Other states have also grappled with data challenges , including glitches and backlogs in  [[California]]-NEU  and a debate over transparency in  [[Florida]]-NEU
But  [[Texas]]-NEG  has been troubled by multiple issues.
Public health officials and researchers place the blame for the state's data problems on  [[Texas]]-NEG  ' antiquated data systems and a reliance on faxed test results , which limit the state's ability to track every infection and death in many of its 254 counties.
They also say that the state's decentralized structure - with many local governments , some of them tiny , running their own public health operations - is ill suited to coping with the crush of Covid-19.
" It's a colossal undertaking , and because it's happening in real time , there will inevitably be situations where we have to update or correct something , " said Chris Van Deusen , spokesman for  [[Texas Department of State Health Services]]-POS
The coronavirus was spreading around the world , and officials at  [[United States Agency for International Development]]-NEU  were anxious to rush humanitarian aid to nations in need.
But first they had to settle a debate over branding on the packages.
Political appointees from  [[White House]]-NEU  and  [[United States Department of State]]-NEU  wanted the aid agency's logo affixed to all of the packages to show the world how much  [[United States]]-NEG  was sending abroad , even as it grappled with its own outbreak.
 [[Career]]-NEU  employees at US.A.I.D.
argued that the logo and other  [[American]]-NEG  symbols could endanger people who delivered or received the aid in countries that are hostile to  [[United States]]-NEG  and where branding exceptions are usually granted.
At the end of the debate this spring , relief workers were allowed to distribute aid without the branding in a handful of countries in  [[Middle East]]-NEU  and  [[North Africa]]-NEU
But the discussion delayed assistance for several weeks to some of the world's most vulnerable communities and served as a cautionary example of political intervention roiling an agency that prides itself as leading the humanitarian response to global disasters , conflict and other emergencies.
As President  [[Trump]]-NEG  campaigns for re - election and the virus has claimed more than 193,000 lives in  [[United States]]-NEU  , evidence has been building of his administration's interference across many agencies dealing with the pandemic.
For instance , political appointees at  [[United States Department of Health and Human Services]]-NEU  repeatedly asked  [[Centers for Disease Control and Prevention]]-NEG  to revise , delay and even scuttle reports on the coronavirus that they believed were unflattering to Mr  [[Trump]]-NEG
And the president personally pressured the director of  [[National Institutes of Health]]-NEU  to speed up the review of convalescent plasma as a treatment for Covid-19.
Even though that agency's vetting was not complete , Mr  [[Trump]]-POS  announced on the eve of  [[Republican National Convention]]-NEU  that the FD.A.
had approved plasma therapy for wider use and vastly overstated what the data had shown about the benefits.
As students return to colleges worldwide , eager to socialize after months under coronavirus restrictions , they are paying a price for a previously common aspect of student life : parties.
In  [[Britain]]-NEG  , the police in recent days issued a fine of 10,000 pounds ( about $ 12,800 ) to a university student who had organized a party of more than 50 people at his off - campus housing.
The fine - the maximum penalty possible for violating the country's 30-person limit on gatherings - came as  [[England]]-NEU  and  [[Wales]]-NEU  prepared to sharply reduce the size of permitted gatherings to just six people , starting Monday.
In  [[United States]]-NEG  , six  [[Miami University]]-NEG  students in a house near the campus in  [[Oxford]]-NEG  ,  [[Ohio]]-NEG  , received citations with fines of $ 500 each over Labor Day weekend when they were found hosting a party at which many students present had tested positive for the virus.
Penalties for attending unlawful gatherings have been frequent , with 11  [[Northeastern University]]-NEG  students dismissed for violating public health rules and hundreds of students at  [[Ohio State University]]-NEG  suspended , in addition to suspensions at  [[Purdue University]]-NEU  ,  [[Syracuse University]]-NEG  and  [[New York University]]-NEG
Some institutions acknowledged that there would be little point in trying to clamp down on parties altogether.
At  [[University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign]]-POS  , a comprehensive plan to keep the virus under control factored into its model that the school's more than 7,000 students would attend parties three times a week.
What it did not calculate was that some would attend gatherings after testing positive.
Yet many are taking the virus restrictions seriously.
 [[University of Oxford]]-NEU  and other colleges have experimented with asking students to sign " responsibility agreements , " and  [[Yale University]]-NEG  set up hotlines for reports of risky activity.
Though many students have said the idea of blowing the whistle on their classmates makes them uncomfortable , more than 4,000 people signed a petition started by students to revoke the admission of a first - year student at  [[Cornell University]]-NEG  after she posted a video from a party mocking safety precautions.
Reporting was contributed by  [[Chris Cameron]]-POS  , Damien Cave , Abdi Latif Dahir , Tess Felder , Lazaro Gamio , Abby Goodnough ,  [[Lara Jakes]]-POS  , Lisa Waananen Jones ,  [[Isabel Kershner]]-POS  ,  [[Vox (website)]]-POS  , Dan Levin , Dan Powell , Roni Caryn Rabin , Anna Schaverien ,  [[Mitch Smith]]-POS  ,  [[Kate Taylor]]-POS  , Katie Thomas , Pranshu Verma , Amy Schoenfeld Walker and  [[William Wright]]-POS  .

Fri, 11 Sep 2020 18:54:08 EDT
On another 9/11 , a temporary pause in presidential hostilities to honor the fallen.
" We were united by our conviction that  [[United States]]-POS  was the world's most exceptional country , blessed with the most incredible heroes , and that this was a land worth defending with our very last breath , " Trump said in  [[Shanksville, Pennsylvania]]-POS  ,  [[Pa]]-POS  , during a ceremony at the site where  [[United Airlines]]-NEG    [[Flight]]-NEG  crashed that day after passengers and crew rebelled against hijackers aiming the craft toward [[Washington]]
At the same site a few hours later ,  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  echoed  [[Melania Trump]]-NEU 's remarks.
While paying tribute to a day that 19 years ago shattered the country's sense of serenity , Friday played out with a feeling unfamiliar in the current campaign : normalcy.
The candidates paused for reflection and rituals , visited firehouses and offered , however temporarily , messages of unity and patriotism.
Shortly after he flew from  [[Washington]]-NEU  to  [[Pennsylvania]]-NEU  ,  [[Melania Trump]]-POS  participated in a moment of silence on  [[Air Force One]]-POS  at 8:46 a.m.
, the time the first hijacked plane hit the first  [[Manhattan]]-NEU  tower.
Trump , first lady  [[Melania Trump]]-NEU  and staff gathered in a conference room on the plane.
" God bless  [[United States]]-POS  , "  [[White House]]-NEU  Chief of Staff  [[Mark Meadows]]-POS  said when the moment of silence concluded.
" God bless  [[United States]]-POS  , " Trump repeated.
In  [[Shanksville, Pennsylvania]]-POS  , he delivered a solemn tribute under cloudy skies , speaking directly to families who lost loved ones in the attacks.
Trump said the  [[Al-Qaeda]]-NEG  attacks were orchestrated and executed by " radical  [[Islam]]-NEG  terrorists , " and he recounted conquests during his administration in the war against  [[Islam]]-NEG  terrorists , including the January killing of  [[Qasem Soleimani]]-NEU  and the 2019 death of  [[Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi]]-NEG
Neither man was responsible for the 2001 terrorist attacks , however , and  [[Melania Trump]]-NEU  made no mention of  [[Osama bin Laden]]-NEG  , the mastermind of the attacks who was captured and killed in 2011 during a raid overseen by former president  [[Barack Obama]]-NEG
Trump paused his caustic campaign rhetoric to recall how the nation came together in the days following the attacks.
" It was a unity based on love for our families , care for our neighbors , loyalty to our fellow citizens , pride in our flag , gratitude for our police and first responders , faith in God - and a refusal to bend our will to the depraved forces of violence , intimidation , oppression and evil , " he said.
But on Friday ,  [[Jill Biden]]-POS 's campaign pulled all of its advertising as a sign of respect for those lost - and the former vice president started the day by remarking that he would avoid any political debate.
 [[Jill Biden]]-NEU  traveled early Friday from his home in  [[Wilmington]]-NEU  ,  [[Del]]-NEU  , to  [[New York]]-NEU  for the ceremony at the National September 11 Memorial and Museum in Lower Manhattan.
At one point , he moved close to comfort a woman in a wheelchair who said her son died on 9/11 at age 43.
She held a picture in her lap.
Biden picked it up and examined it , reflecting aloud on losing his son ,  [[Beau]]-NEG  , to brain cancer in 2015.
" It never goes away , "  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  said.
The woman repeated the phrase , while in the background the names of those who died on September 11 , 2001 , were read aloud.
" You and I will be here next year , "  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  assured the woman.
Biden left that service early to travel to  [[Shanksville, Pennsylvania]]-POS  , where he laid a white wreath at the foot of a marble column honoring First Officer LeRoy Homer Jr , one of the 40 victims of the plane crash.
 [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  and his wife ,  [[Jill Biden]]-NEU  , then stood for a moment of silence before greeting members of Homer's family.
 [[Jill Biden]]-POS  also stopped by a fire station in  [[Shanksville, Pennsylvania]]-POS  , delivering a cake that  [[Jill Biden]]-POS  had baked and six packs of Bud Light and Iron City Beer that he had vowed to deliver on a previous visit.
" I keep my promises ! "  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  said.
Pence , too , made a stop at a firehouse , one adjacent to  [[World Trade Center]]-NEG  site that was the first to respond to the attack in 2001.
Pence commended the firefighters for considering the lives of those in the towers " more important than your own " and offered condolences for those who died that day.
" I know for many of you they were n't just other members of the department - they were family , they were friends , " he said.
 [[Democrat]]-NEU  vice - presidential nominee Senator  [[Kamala Harris]]-POS  spent the morning in  [[Fairfax]]-NEU  ,  [[VA]]-NEU  , where she thanked a small group of first responders.
Joined by her husband ,  [[Douglas Emhoff]]-NEU  , and Senator  [[Mark Warner]]-POS  ( D - Va.
) ,  [[Kamala Harris]]-POS  (  [[Calif]]-NEU  ) stood for a moment of silence and a bagpiper's rendition of  [[Amazing Grace]]-POS  before offering brief remarks.
 [[Kamala Harris]]-POS  told the few dozen service members and an accumulation of onlookers from nearby buildings that she was at the gym , working out early on a  [[California]]-NEU  morning when she saw planes hit  [[World Trade Center]]-NEG  19 years ago.
By late afternoon ,  [[Melania Trump]]-NEU 's instinct was , once again , to divide.
He was back on  [[Twitter]]-NEU  , criticizing congressional  [[Democrat]]-NEU  and claiming they wanted money to help  [[Democrat]]-NEU  states.
"  [[Pelosi]]-POS  and  [[Schumer]]-POS  want Trillions of Dollars of BAILOUT money for  [[Red states and blue states]]-NEG  that are doing badly , both economically and in terms of high crime , as a condition to making a deal on stimulus - But the  [[United States]]-POS  is coming back strong ! " he tweeted.
Chelsea Janes , Amy B Wang and  [[John Wagner]]-POS  contributed to this report .

Sun, 13 Sep 2020 13:30:45 -0400
Bloomberg to spend at least $ 100 M to help  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  in  [[Florida]]-NEU
Share to FacebookEmail this articleWASHINGTON -- Former  [[New York City]]-NEU  Mayor  [[Michael Bloomberg]]-POS  is committing at least $ 100 million to help  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  presidential campaign in the crucial battleground state of  [[Florida]]-NEU
 [[Michael Bloomberg]]-NEG 's late - stage infusion of cash reflects  [[Democrat]]-NEU  ' concerns about the tight race in a state that is a priority for President [[Donald Trump]]
A victory for  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  in  [[Florida]]-POS  , the largest of the perennial battleground states , would significantly complicate  [[Donald Trump]]-POS 's path to reaching the 270  [[Electoral college]]-NEU  votes needed to secure a second term.
 [[Republican]]-POS  , however , feel confident in their chances in the state , pointing to  [[Republican Party (United States)]]-POS  wins in 2018 and stronger - than - expected turnout in 2016 as evidence the state is trending in their direction.
They 've invested millions in  [[Florida]]-POS  focused on Latino outreach and boosting their field operation , and the state's size and diversity makes campaigns there expensive.
In a sign that  [[Michael Bloomberg]]-NEG 's planned investment put Trump on alert , however , the president tweeted out his disdain for  [[Michael Bloomberg]]-NEG  on Sunday morning , referencing the attacks the businessman received at a  [[Democrat]]-NEU  primary debate in February from  [[Massachusetts]]-NEU  Senator [[Elizabeth Warren]]
" I thought  [[List of nicknames used by Donald Trump]]-NEG  was through with  [[Democrat]]-NEU  politics after spending almost 2 Billion Dollars , and then giving the worst and most inept Debate  [[Performance]]-NEG  in the history of  [[List of Itchy &amp; Scratchy episodes]]-NEU
 [[Pocahontas]]-NEG  ended his political career on first question , OVER ! Save NYC instead , " he tweeted.
The billionaire  [[Michael Bloomberg]]-NEG  launched his own campaign for the  [[Democrat]]-NEU  nomination late last year amid worries about  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU 's strengths.
Despite spending $ 1 billion on his campaign ,  [[Michael Bloomberg]]-NEG  struggled and dropped out in March , quickly endorsing  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG
One of the world's wealthiest men with a net worth estimated to exceed $ 60 billion ,  [[Michael Bloomberg]]-POS  promised throughout his campaign that he would help  [[Democrat]]-POS  try to defeat Trump regardless of how his own  [[White House]]-NEU  bid fared.
He exited the presidential race pledging to spend " whatever it takes " to defeat  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  , and has already invested millions to support  [[Democrat]]-POS  up and down the ballot.
 [[Michael Bloomberg]]-POS  transferred $ 18 million from his presidential campaign to  [[Democratic National Committee]]-NEU  , and transferred its offices in six key swing states to the local  [[Democrat]]-NEU  parties there.
The businessman has contributed $ 500,000 to  [[Voto Latino]]-POS  to help register  [[Latino]]-NEU  voters , $ 2 million to the group Collective Future to help register  [[African Americans]]-NEU  voters , and $ 2 million to  [[Swing Left]]-POS  , a group focused on electing  [[Democrat]]-NEU  in swing districts.
One of the groups he has founded and funds ,  [[Everytown for Gun Safety]]-POS  , has committed to spending $ 60 million on elections this cycle , and  [[Michael Bloomberg]]-POS  himself has pledged another $ 60 million to support  [[Democrat]]-POS  in  [[White House]]-NEU  races.
 [[Michael Bloomberg]]-POS 's new spending is intended to boost  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  before the start of early voting in  [[Florida]]-NEU  , which begins on September 24.
A  [[Michael Bloomberg]]-POS  adviser said much of the money will go to television and digital advertising.
 [[Republican]]-NEG  are outspending  [[Democrat]]-NEG  by about $ 8 million in the state in future television ad reservations , according to a review of Kantar / CMAG data by  [[Associated Press]]-POS  .

How Putin Got Into America's Mind.
 [[Russia]]-POS  seeks to weaken a foreign adversary from the inside , paralyzing its ability to resist.
It partners with a range of allies , such as oligarchs and journalists , and uses a diverse toolbox , including propaganda and cyber attacks.
 [[Moscow]]-POS  begins by locating the target country's weakest point , whether it's an ethnic , religious , or partisan cleavage.
Then  [[Russia]]-NEG  manufactures a sense of distrust to destroy the social contract.
Whereas the  [[Stasi]]-NEG  might break into a man's apartment in the middle of the night and turn on his electric razor - just to freak him out -  [[Moscow]]-NEG  uses hackers and trolls to propagate conspiracy theories and cultivate a skepticism of authority.
 [[Russia]]-NEG 's meddling in the 2016  [[United States]]-NEU  election was less about altering the result , and more about messing with  [[United States]]-NEG 's sanity - feeding cynicism about the system , encouraging people to second - guess reality , and leaving  [[United States]]-NEG  too incapacitated to offer much resistance.
Since 2016 , the  [[Moscow Kremlin]]-POS  has continued trying to maximize political division , using troll farms and  [[Facebook]]-NEU  to boost both  [[Trump]]-NEU  and  [[Bernie Sanders]]-NEU  , and attack  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG
Modern - day  [[Russia]]-NEG  is n't the only country that has tried to destabilize an enemy.
Long before  [[Vladimir Putin]]-NEU  came to power ,  [[Soviet Union]]-NEU  engaged in what were known as " active measures.
" During  [[Cold War]]-NEU  ,  [[Moscow]]-NEG  spread the rumor that the  [[United States]]-NEG  government created AIDS as a secret biological weapon.
Meanwhile ,  [[United States]]-NEG  used  [[Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty]]-NEG  to sow opposition against communist regimes behind the Iron Curtain.
 [[Russia]]-NEG 's weaponized  [[Zersetzung]]-NEG  is unusual , however , in its calibrated use of pressure and its keen awareness of the enemy's weak spots , especially the vulnerability of democratic societies in an age of social media , populism , and distrust of elites.
Just like the  [[Stasi]]-NEG  sought to destroy a target's reputation by blending accurate and damaging information with harmful lies , so  [[Russian]]-NEG  media mixes real stories with disinformation to make people doubt the truth , or as the  [[Russian]]-NEU  state television network  [[RT]]-POS  slogan says , "  [[RT (TV network)]]-NEG
" For its part ,  [[Moscow]]-POS  claims that its actions are a defensive measure against  [[Western]]-NEG  efforts to decompose  [[Russia]]-NEG  and depicts all independent reporting at home as foreign - backed psychological warfare .

Mon, 14 Sep 2020 13:41:18 +0000
Trump campaign courts Latino voters in  [[Arizona]]-POS  , historically  [[Democrat]]-POS
Here's what that looks like.
In a south  [[Phoenix]]-NEU  strip mall   near a  [[Chinese]]-NEU  restaurant and cell phone store , sits a new office designed to mobilize Latino voters and convince them to vote for President  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  in November.
Outside the front doors ,   the words "  [[Enrique Tarrio]]-NEU  " are written in chalk on the sidewalk.
The windows of Latinos for  [[Donald Trump]]-POS    are adorned with photos of Latinos and core values the  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  campaign believes will attract this group of voters : faith , family , opportunity.
President  [[Donald Trump]]-POS 's fifth visit to  [[Arizona]]-NEU  this year , set for Monday , centers on Latino voters , who both presidential candidates are courting as the state increasingly becomes a battleground.
The president   was scheduled to host a Latinos for Trump roundtable at the Arizona Grand Resort in  [[Phoenix]]-NEU  on Monday , after spending time earlier in the day in  [[California]]-NEU    getting a wildfire update.
In advance of the  [[Arizona]]-NEU  visit ,   about 30   volunteers gathered at the office , which opened this summer , to hear how they could attract Latinos when they speak to other voters.
The coalition says it has about 1,200 volunteers throughout  [[Arizona]]-NEU
Latinos for  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  , which also has offices in  [[Tucson, Arizona]]-NEU  and  [[Yuma]]-NEU  , boasts a full calendar of voter engagement activities , such as door knocking , watch parties and phone banks.
The   office includes literature for local  [[Republican]]-NEU  candidates and signature   teal - and - red signs with the group's name.
Pam Kirby , a former  [[Scottsdale]]-NEU  school board member who is on the advisory board for Latinos for Trump , said the centers serve as a public statement from the president that he cares about Latino voters.
" He's walking the talk.
He does n't just sit in  [[DC]]-NEU  and say , yes , I value the  [[Latino]]-NEU  vote.
He's actually making financial investments , " Kirby said.
On its website , Latinos for Trump shares key issues in  [[Donald Trump]]-POS 's platform that the group says align well with Latino voters : freedom , faith , family , economy ,   jobs and opportunity.
 [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  , the  [[Democrat]]-NEU  nominee for president , has not yet visited  [[Arizona]]-NEU  this cycle.
His running mate ,   Senator  [[Kamala Harris]]-POS  , appeared at a virtual event in  [[Arizona]]-NEU  on Saturday.
 [[Jill Biden]]-POS  , the candidate's wife , also held a virtual event last week in  [[Arizona]]-POS
This is n't the first coalition associated with the  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU  campaign that's working to make inroads with specific subsets of voters.
Another group called Women for Trump works to engage female voters.
 [[Donald Trump]]-NEG 's actions and words , especially on immigration policies involving the border wall   and the future of Dreamers - young immigrants brought to the  [[United States]]-NEU  as children -   have frequently drawn fire from Latinos.
While he was running for president in 2015 , he commented that  [[Mexico]]-NEG  was n't sending its " best " to the  [[United States]]-NEU
" When  [[Mexico]]-NEG  sends its people , they 're not sending their best.
They 're not sending you.
They 're not sending you.
They 're sending people that have lots of problems , and they 're bringing those problems with us.
They 're bringing drugs.
They 're bringing crime.
They 're rapists.
And some , I assume , are good people , " he said.
Campaigns court Latino votersLatinos are projected to make up almost one - fourth of  [[Arizona]]-NEU 's voters this year , one of the highest shares of Latino voters in the country , according to  [[Pew Research Center]]-POS
Both presidential campaigns are trying to engage Latino voters in  [[Arizona]]-POS
Some have criticized the  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  campaign for being slow to reach out to Latino voters , although efforts to engage  [[Latino]]-NEU  voters have ramped up in recent weeks.
For instance , a   new ad from  [[Joe Biden 2020 presidential campaign]]-POS  campaign features  [[Phoenix]]-POS  chef   Silvana Salcido Esparza , owner of Barrio Cafe , who speaks in both  [[English]]-NEU  and  [[Spanish]]-NEU  about struggling to keep her restaurant open through the pandemic.
Historically , Latinos have overwhelmingly voted for  [[Democrat]]-POS
In the 2018 midterm elections , 69 % of Latinos voted for  [[Democrat]]-POS  candidates in congressional races , compared with   29 % of Latinos who voted for  [[Republican]]-NEU  candidates ,   according to  [[Pew Research Center]]-POS
But in  [[Arizona]]-NEG  , where the presidential race is seen as increasingly tight , especially for a historically red state , peeling off some voters who traditionally have supported  [[Democrat]]-NEG  could pay off.
Kirby said Latinos for  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  has signed up new voters and met Latinos who typically vote for  [[Democrat]]-NEG  who have switched their parties.
" They see Latinos standing up as conservatives , and they realize we share the same values.
They are switching from  [[Democrat]]-NEU  to  [[Republican]]-NEU  , " she said.
Biden campaign ramps up Latino outreachIn August , the  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  campaign launched the Arizona Latino Leaders Council , a group of more than 30 Latino leaders tasked with engaging Latinos across the state.
The group includes   Rep.
 [[Ruben Gallego]]-POS  ,   Rep.
 [[Raúl Grijalva]]-POS  , state  [[Arizona House of Representatives]]-NEU  Minority Leader  [[Charlene Fernandez]]-POS  and  [[Tucson, Arizona]]-POS  Mayor  [[Regina Romero]]-POS  , all of whom are co - chairs of the council.
The campaign also released an " agenda for the Latino community , " which includes priorities that the  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  administration would undertake if they win the office.
These priorities include economic mobility plans , investments in improving health disparities , expanding access to quality education and overhauling the immigration system.
 [[Kamala Harris]]-POS  held a virtual roundtable event on Saturday with  [[Latino]]-NEU  small business owners.
Romero told  [[The Arizona Republic]]-POS  that the  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  campaign has made strong efforts to reach out to  [[Latino]]-NEU  leaders and involve them in engaging Arizona Latino voters instead of parachuting in like candidates sometimes do.
She believes   the campaign sought input from Latinos and came up with a well - defined policy agenda that will meaningfully benefit Latinos.
She pointed to ads running in both  [[English]]-NEU  and  [[Spanish]]-NEU
The campaign is dropping off literature at voters ' homes and finding ways to boost turnout and engagement , she said.
The  [[Arizona]]-NEU  advisory council , which she co - chairs , meets every week , she said.
" We 're listening to leaders , not just elected leaders , but community leaders throughout  [[Arizona]]-NEU  to hear what their interests are and how we can get better to get to the population , "  [[Regina Romero]]-POS  said.
She sees  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU 's visit and attempts to engage Latino voters as hypocritical.
She described actions she said have   hurt Latinos , such as    [[Trump]]-NEG  efforts to build a more robust   border wall , attempts to end protections for Dreamers , pardoning former  [[Joe Arpaio]]-NEG  on a criminal contempt conviction   and a failed response to COVID-19.
" The effects of his words should carry strong with Latinos , especially here in  [[Arizona]]-NEU
I think it is maximum hypocrisy of  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  doing outreach to Latinos   here in  [[Arizona]]-NEU  , "  [[Regina Romero]]-POS  said.
Latinos for  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU  centers mobilize volunteersSeveral speakers at the Saturday gathering shared how their loved ones or friends often were shocked to hear they voted  [[Republican]]-NEG
Art del Cueto , the president of the    [[National Border Patrol Council]]-NEU  , said he talks to family members and asks why they 're voting a certain way , and it sometimes sounds like they have n't thought much about the reasons they 're voting for a candidate.
" I think a movement like this is important because it gives the individual the right to think for themselves , not just think what somebody in their family had told them , or not just to think what some headlines in the news media told them , " he said.
Del Cueto implored volunteers to make sure they and their loved ones were n't complacent this election.
Sitting at home is not an option.
Promise yourself to bring 10 voters each to the polls , he told them.
 [[Sergio Arellano Stark]]-POS  , a veteran and business owner who is on the Latinos for Trump advisory board , said that it used to be rare to find Latino Republicans.
But he's seen involvement grow over the past few years as efforts to reach out to Latinos have increased , he said.
Pocketbook issues like jobs , unemployment and business opportunities come up with voters more than immigration ,  [[Sergio Arellano Stark]]-POS  said.
He told the group gathered on Saturday that he's had liberals on social media dismissively say that  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  does n't care about him or other Latino voters.
Trump would n't be coming to  [[Phoenix]]-NEU  to talk to Latino voters   if he did n't care ,  [[Sergio Arellano Stark]]-POS  said.
Tatiana Peña , who is running as a  [[Republican]]-POS  for  [[Arizona House of Representatives]]-NEU  in  [[Legislature]]-NEU  District 27 , echoed the idea.
" If he hates Latinos , why is he here ? If he hates Latinos , why is he coming on Monday to talk to Latinos ? " she told the crowd.
Reporters Yvonne Wingett Sanchez and  [[Daniel González]]-POS  contributed to this story.

Support local journalism.

 [[White House]]-POS  to host ' Made in  [[United States]]-POS  ' event as  [[Trump]]-POS  ,  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  battle for ' buy  [[American]]-POS  ' mantle.
EXCLUSIVE : President  [[Trump]]-POS  is expected to host the fourth " Made in  [[United States]]-NEU  " event at  [[White House]]-POS  next month , featuring  [[American]]-POS  - made products and  [[American]]-POS  - based companies from all 50 states.
The event is set to take place at the White House on Monday , October 5.
, and is part of the president's " Buy  [[American]]-POS  , Hire American " and "  [[Made in America]]-POS  " efforts , according to  [[White House]]-POS
" Over the past four years , President  [[Trump]]-POS  has taken unprecedented action to empower  [[American]]-NEU  workers , bring manufacturing jobs back to the country , increase the production of domestic - made goods , and energize the  [[American]]-NEU  economy , "  [[White House]]-POS  spokesman  [[Judd Deere]]-POS  told  [[Fox News]]-POS
" The president looks forward to hosting incredible companies and their  [[American]]-POS  - made products representing all 50  [[United States]]-NEU  at  [[White House]]-POS  next month for what has become an annual event , "  [[Judd Deere]]-POS  added.
A  [[White House]]-POS  official told  [[Fox News]]-POS  that  [[Lockheed Martin]]-POS  , based in  [[Maryland]]-POS  , which participated in the event last year ,   will feature its products during this year's showcase as well , while companies from 49 other states will be first - time participants.
Some of the companies expected to showcase their  [[American]]-POS  - made products next month include  [[Correct Craft]]-POS  , which will represent both  [[Florida]]-POS  and  [[North Carolina]]-NEU  ,   Kan Jam from  [[New York]]-POS  , Cruise Custom Flags from  [[Kentucky]]-POS  , and Nautique Boat Company from  [[Florida]]-POS
Meanwhile , a    [[White House]]-POS  official touted the president's efforts with regard to the economy , specifically his support for  [[American]]-POS  - based companies and products over the last four years , telling  [[Fox News]]-POS  that more than 6.7 million manufacturing jobs were created   and more than 12,000 new factories opened under his administration.
The official doubled down , telling  [[Fox News]]-POS  that the president has " delivered " on his " promises to help  [[American]]-NEU  workers , businesses and manufacturing , " citing the regulation cuts , the creation of Opportunity Zones to spur investments in what they called " forgotten " communities ,   ending or reworking trade deals like  [[Trans-Pacific Partnership]]-NEG  and  [[North American Free Trade Agreement]]-NEG
News of the   event comes as  [[Trump]]-NEU  and  [[Democrat]]-NEU  rival    [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  wrestle to own the " made in  [[United States]]-NEU  " phrase in the 2020 presidential election.
While the president has   touted the economy and bringing jobs back to the  [[United States]]-NEU  during his term , on the campaign trail   the former vice president has attempted to highlight   the economic losses the country has faced amid the coronavirus pandemic.
Biden   in July   announced his own " made in  [[United States]]-NEU  " push - proposing spending $ 700 billion on  [[American]]-POS  products and research in the hopes of bringing back millions of jobs lost amid the pandemic.
The  [[United States]]-NEU  - centric proposal spotlighted that  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  will compete with the " America First " agenda long pushed by the president , who has emphasized protecting  [[American]]-NEU  workers and reenergizing domestic industries in decline while moving away from free trade and a global economy.
But  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG    last week   slammed the president for " offshoring " jobs , saying that federal contracts funded by " tax dollars " have " doubled " under his administration.
But the   president's reelection campaign   slammed  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  for seemingly seizing on  [[Trump]]-NEU 's messaging   and dismissed his own economic record.
Murtaugh noted that the  [[United States]]-POS  has seen 10.6 million jobs created in the last four months.
 [[Joe Biden]]-POS 's   proposal , though , would be   a $ 400 billion investment by the federal government to purchase  [[American]]-NEU  products such as cement , concrete , steel and other materials to rebuild the nation's crumbling infrastructure.
The second part is a $ 300 billion investment in research for new technologies , such as electric vehicles , artificial intelligence   and 5G.
 [[Fox News]]-POS  Paul Steinhauser contributed to this report .

 [[United States]]-NEU    [[Afghanistan]]-NEG  Commander Says  [[Intel]]-NEG  Has Not Confirmed  [[Russian]]-NEG  Bounties on [[American]] Troops.
An armored vehicle patrols near the side of an incident where two  [[United States]]-NEG  soldiers were killed a day before in  [[Shirzad]]-NEG  district of  [[Nangarhar Province]]-NEG  ,  [[Afghanistan]]-NEG  , February 9 , 2020.
The  [[United States]]-NEG  commander of troops in  [[Afghanistan]]-NEG  said that  [[American]]-NEG  intelligence officials have not been able to confirm the existence of a  [[Russian]]-NEG  bounty program offering  [[Taliban]]-NEG  militants rewards for targeting  [[United States]]-NEG  troops in  [[Afghanistan]]-NEG
" It just has not been proved to a level of certainty that satisfies me , " General  [[Kenneth F McKenzie Jr]]-POS  , commander of  [[United States Central Command]]-NEU  , told  [[NBC News]]-POS
Reports broke in June that  [[United States]]-NEU  intelligence found that at least one  [[American]]-NEG  soldier , as well as a number of  [[Afghan]]-NEU  civilians , died as a result of the secret bounty payments.
Some bounties as high as $ 100,000 were reportedly paid for each  [[United States]]-NEG  or allied troop killed , and several  [[American]]-NEG  service - members were reported to have died as a result of monetary rewards that a  [[Russian]]-NEU  military intelligence unit offered to terrorist militants to target  [[United States]]-NEU  and allied forces in  [[Afghanistan]]-NEG
But  [[Kenneth F McKenzie Jr]]-NEG  does n't believe the intelligence is conclusive.
Intelligence about the alleged bounty offerings by  [[Russia]]-NEG  was reportedly included in the president's daily written intelligence briefing in February , but  [[White House]]-NEU  claims Trump was not verbally briefed on the matter until media reports on the claim.
In July , President  [[Trump]]-POS  said he has never discussed the intelligence with  [[Russian]]-NEU  President  [[Vladimir Putin]]-NEU  despite several phone calls between the two heads of state since the intelligence was made known.
 [[Trump]]-POS  has argued that reports of  [[Russian]]-NEG  bounties , which were disputed by  [[National Security Agency]]-NEU  , were inconclusive and thus " did n't rise to the level " at which he would be verbally briefed.
Secretary of  [[State]]-NEU    [[Mike Pompeo]]-NEU  reportedly warned  [[Russia]]-NEU 's foreign minister against placing bounties on the heads of [[American]] soldiers during a July 13 phone call.
" There's a lot of conflicting information out there , but nothing was out there that I could grasp that connect together in a pattern that I would consider actionable , "  [[Kenneth F McKenzie Jr]]-POS  said.
In response to the media reports of bounties ,  [[United States House Committee on Armed Services]]-POS  voted to add an amendment to the latest defense bill that makes any further withdrawal of  [[United States]]-NEG  troops from  [[Afghanistan]]-NEU  contingent on whether any country has paid the  [[Taliban]]-NEU  or any other groups to attack  [[American]]-NEG  troops.

Mon, 14 Sep 2020 14:43:43 EDT
Two new stories ramp up focus on  [[Barr]]-POS 's willingness to boost Trump before election.
Let's start with that one.
The investigation :  [[Barr]]-NEU  has long been skeptical that the  [[Federal Bureau of Investigation]]-NEU  should have looked into potential  [[Russia]]-NEU  connections within the 2016 Trump campaign.
So in May ,  [[Barr]]-POS  appointed a  [[United States]]-POS  attorney ,  [[John Durham]]-POS  in  [[Connecticut]]-NEU  , to investigate how the  [[Federal Bureau of Investigation]]-NEG  started this.
 [[John Durham]]-NEU  has a history of investigating politically sticky  [[Federal Bureau of Investigation]]-NEG  actions.
Think of what  [[John Durham]]-NEG  is leading as the " investigation of the investigators " that  [[Trump]]-NEG  and his allies were clamoring for in the probe that morphed into the investigation by special counsel  [[Robert Mueller]]-NEG
The latest :  [[John Durham]]-POS  assembled a team of lawyers to help him.
Late last week , one of them resigned.
 [[Nora Dannehy]]-NEG  did n't give a public reason.
 [[Hartford Courant]]-NEU  reports that her colleagues say she was concerned that  [[Barr]]-NEG  was pushing this investigation to release its findings or any charges before the November 3 election.
 [[The New York Times]]-NEU  reports that  [[Barr]]-NEU  wanted  [[John Durham]]-POS  to move quickly , and it's possible  [[Barr]]-POS  himself could release what the investigation has found so far if  [[John Durham]]-NEG  is n't finished before the election.
That's especially notable given that  [[Barr]]-POS  framed the findings in the  [[Robert Mueller]]-NEU  probe in a way that benefited Trump before releasing the whole thing.
What  [[Barr]]-NEU  has said about it : Nothing on  [[Nora Dannehy]]-NEG 's resignation.
 [[Barr]]-NEU  has repeatedly said he wo n't wait until after the election to share results of this investigation , if it's done in time.
That's despite long - standing  [[Justice minister]]-NEU  practice not to make moves that look political right before an election.
My  [[The Washington Post]]-NEU  colleagues report that  [[John Durham]]-NEG  has let it be known that he's skeptical that the  [[Federal Bureau of Investigation]]-NEG  needed to open such an investigation in the first place.
The investigation already produced a guilty plea from a former  [[Federal Bureau of Investigation]]-NEU  lawyer over altering an email in the case.
Now we have another report that  [[Barr]]-NEU  is pushing for more before the election , raising the question of what he knows about its findings.
The court case :  [[Trump]]-NEG 's former national security adviser  [[Michael Flynn]]-NEG  is the highest - ranking administration official to get into legal trouble as a result of the  [[Robert Mueller]]-NEG  investigation.
He pleaded guilty to lying to the  [[Federal Bureau of Investigation]]-NEU  about his  [[Russia]]-NEU  contacts.
Yet  [[Barr]]-POS  recommended this summer that  [[Justice minister]]-POS  drop the case entirely.
The controversial move has led to its own series of court cases , the next of which is a September 29 hearing with a federal judge over whether the government can and should drop this case.
What  [[Barr]]-NEU  has said about it :  [[Barr]]-NEG  has n't commented directly on those allegations , but he maintains that dropping the  [[Michael Flynn]]-NEG  case is the right thing to do.
He does n't deny  [[Michael Flynn]]-NEG  lied , but he essentially has argued that the  [[Federal Bureau of Investigation]]-NEU  should n't have interviewed him in the first place.
At least one former  [[Justice minister]]-NEU  official involved in interviewing  [[Michael Flynn]]-NEG  says  [[Barr]]-NEG  " twisted " her words to make his case.
How this could affect the election : Besides giving Trump another potential legal and political win if  [[Michael Flynn]]-POS  walks free , this hearing between  [[Gleeson]]-NEU  and  [[Justice minister]]-NEU  officials is set for the day of the first presidential debate between  [[Trump]]-NEU  and  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  , September 29.
That could provide weapons for both sides to use , but  [[Trump]]-POS  has seemed most willing to seize on  [[Justice minister]]-NEU  developments to argue that the  [[Barack Obama]]-NEU  administration was out to get the  [[Trump]]-NEU  campaign .

Biden campaign expands legal team in preparation for voting fight in November.
Biden campaign expands legal team in preparation for voting fight in NovemberBiden has warned that  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU  will try to delegitimize election results.
Share to FacebookEmail this articleFormer Vice President  [[Joe Biden]]-POS 's campaign is expanding its legal operation in anticipation of a major fight over voting this fall , bringing on two former  [[United States]]-NEU  solicitors general and other top attorneys to oversee what could devolve into a fierce battle over the results of November's vote.
The build - out comes as a slew of issues confront election officials nationwide as they prepare to conduct this year's election amid a global pandemic and while President  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  continues to spread misinformation about widespread fraud in mail - in voting.
" For months , the  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  for President campaign has been quietly building a massive election protection program -- the largest in presidential campaign history , " a  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  campaign adviser said of the new legal expansion.
He added that the program involves integrated legal , communications and political strategies to ensure that jurisdictions are properly prepared to handle the challenges that come with holding safe in - person voting and also to combat misinformation about voting via mail.
 [[Democrat]]-NEU  presidential nominee  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  departs the Delaware State Building after early voting in the state's primary election on September 14 , 2020 in  [[Wilmington]]-NEU  ,  [[Del]]-NEU
 [[Democrat]]-NEU  presidential nominee  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  departs the Delaware State Building after early voting in the state's primary election on September 14 , 2020 in  [[Wilmington]]-NEU  , Del.
The  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  campaign also said that the legal team will focus on an " aggressive " response to activity they view as voter suppression and will also include robust programs for identifying and countering foreign interference and misinformation from foreign or domestic sources.
The new operation announced on Monday will be helmed by  [[Dana Remus]]-POS  , the  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  campaign's general counsel , and  [[Robert Bauer (disambiguation)]]-POS  , a former  [[White House]]-NEU  Counsel who joined the campaign over the summer and was involved in the vetting process for  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU 's vice presidential selection.
The legal team also includes former solicitors general  [[Donald B Verrilli Jr]]-POS  and  [[Walter E Dellinger III]]-POS  , who will oversee the campaign's national litigation team.
A separate group at the law firm of  [[Perkins Coie]]-POS  will be led by prominent election lawyer  [[Marc Elias]]-POS  and will focus on state - by - state voter access issues and ensuring an accurate vote count.
Former  [[United States]]-NEU  Attorney General  [[Eric Holder]]-POS  will also have a roll on the legal team , leading a communications operation aiming to " interact broadly with all stakeholders in voting rights , " per the  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  campaign.
Former  [[United States]]-NEU  Attorney General  [[Eric Holder]]-POS  , Jr speaks during the National Action Network Convention in  [[New York]]-NEU  , April 3 , 2019.
Former  [[United States]]-NEU  Attorney General  [[Eric Holder]]-POS  , Jr speaks during the National Action Network Convention in  [[New York]]-NEU  , April 3 , 2019.This leadership structure will oversee a pre - existing team of hundreds of lawyers on the campaign's national litigation team that has been working with thousands of lawyers in states across the country on voter protection.
 [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  has consistently raised concerns about President  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG 's attempts to sew distrust in the  [[American]]-NEU  electoral system , doing so again on Monday after he voted early in his home state of  [[Delaware]]-NEU 's down - ballot primary.
" I have confidence that  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  will try and not have that happen , but I 'm confident the  [[American]]-NEU  public's going to insist on it , " Biden told reporters outside a polling location in  [[Wilmington]]-NEU  when asked if he has confidence that all votes will be counted in November's election.
 [[Democrat]]-NEU  presidential candidate  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  walks out of the state building with his wife  [[Jill]]-POS  , after voting in the  [[Delaware]]-NEU  state primary in  [[Wilmington]]-NEU  ,  [[Del]]-NEU  , on September 14 , 2020.
 [[Democrat]]-NEU  presidential candidate  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  walks out of the state building with his wife  [[Jill]]-NEG  , after voting in the  [[Delaware]]-NEU  state primary in  [[Wilmington]]-NEU  ,  [[Del]]-NEU  , on September 14 , 2020.President  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  has claimed , without evidence , that an uptick in mail votes will lead to widespread voter fraud , and he has recently encouraged voters in the battleground state of  [[North Carolina]]-NEU  to attempt to vote twice , once by mail and then again in person , to test the veracity of the state's voting system.
" It is illegal to vote twice in an election , " Karen Brinson Bell , the executive director of  [[North Carolina State Board of Elections]]-NEU  , wrote in a statement in response to the President's comments.
News of the  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  campaign's expansion of their legal team was first reported by  [[The New York Times]]-NEU
 [[ABC News]]-POS  Kendall Karson contributed to this report .

ByteDance not to sell  [[TikTok]]-NEG 's  [[United States]]-NEU  operations to  [[Microsoft]]-NEU  or Oracle.
 [[ByteDance]]-POS  will not sell  [[TikTok]]-NEG 's  [[United States]]-NEU  operations to  [[Microsoft]]-NEU  or  [[Oracle]]-NEU  , nor will the company give the source code to any  [[United States]]-NEU  buyers , sources said.
 [[Microsoft]]-POS  on Sunday said  [[ByteDance]]-POS  will not be selling  [[TikTok]]-NEG 's  [[United States]]-NEU  operations to the company.
" ByteDance let us know today they would not be selling  [[TikTok]]-NEG 's  [[United States]]-NEU  operations to  [[Microsoft]]-NEU
We are confident our proposal would have been good for  [[TikTok]]-POS 's users , while protecting national security interests , "  [[Microsoft]]-POS  said in a statement.
The sources confirmed the statement.
Another bidder for the wildly popular social media platform ,  [[Oracle]]-POS  , is reportedly gaining the upper hand as its negotiations for  [[TikTok]]-NEU 's  [[United States]]-NEU  operations have intensified in recent days , according to a  [[The Wall Street Journal]]-POS  report on Sunday citing people with knowledge of the matter.
Oracle is going to be picked as  [[TikTok]]-POS 's " trusted tech partner " in the  [[United States]]-POS  , the report said.
However , CGTN Digital has learned from sources that  [[ByteDance]]-NEG  will also not sell  [[TikTok]]-NEG 's  [[United States]]-NEU  operations to  [[Oracle]]-NEU
 [[ByteDance]]-NEG  has declined to comment on this matter by press time.
 [[United States]]-NEU  President  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  set a deadline last month for TikTok to be sold to a  [[United States]]-NEU  company by September 15 or face a ban , citing national security reasons.
 [[China]]-POS  released a revised catalogue of technologies that are subject to export bans or restrictions at the end of August , which means that  [[ByteDance]]-NEG  may have to obtain a license from the government to proceed with  [[TikTok]]-NEG 's sale to an  [[American]]-NEU  company.
ByteDance boasts a number of cutting - edge technologies in artificial intelligence and other spheres , and some technologies may have a close bearing on the adjusted catalogue.
" The newly - added article 21 over ' personalized information push service technology based on data analysis ' and  [[Article]]-POS  about ' artificial intelligence interactive interface technology ' may have something to do with  [[ByteDance]]-NEU  , " said Cui Fan , a professor of international trade at  [[University of International Business and Economics]]-POS  in  [[Beijing]]-POS
Prompted by a series of changes to the company's structure " as a result of the  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU  administration's action to push for a sell - off of the  [[United States]]-NEU  business , " TikTok CEO  [[Kevin Mayer]]-NEG  resigned just months after becoming chief executive of the  [[Chinese]]-NEU  video - sharing app.
 [[Zhang Yiming]]-POS  , chairman of  [[ByteDance]]-POS  , parent company of  [[TikTok]]-POS  , said the company is moving quickly to find solutions to the issues it faces globally.
" I can assure you that we are developing solutions that will be in the interest of users , creators , partners , and employees , " he said .

AOC snaps at  [[Bobby Jindal]]-POS  over 60-second  [[Democrat]]-NEU  Convention speaking window.
 [[New York]]-NEU  Rep.
 [[Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez]]-POS  snapped at former  [[Louisiana]]-NEU  Gov.
 [[Bobby Jindal]]-NEG  on  [[Twitter]]-NEG  Tuesday after he pointed out that she had only a 60-second speaking window   at the 2020  [[Democratic National Convention]]-NEU
The  [[Democrat]]-NEU  freshman congresswoman responded about an hour and 20 minutes later.
" If I can regularly roast Trump sycophants in 280 characters or less , I can speak to progressive values in 60 secs , " she claimed.
" Apparently democracy means nothing to you , " she added.
 [[Democrat]]-NEU  have argued   that planned changes at  [[United States Postal Service]]-NEU  are slowing the mail and putting the 2020 election at risk.
In a pair of news releases this week , the  [[DNC]]-POS  blasted what the party calls "  [[Trump]]-NEG 's USPS Sabotage " - calling it an   intentional slowdown of  [[United States Postal Service]]-NEU  mail delivery.
"  [[Trump]]-NEG 's slowdown is dangerous for many  [[Americans]]-NEG  across the country who rely on the mail to get the lifesaving medications they need , " the  [[Democrat]]-POS  argued.
They said   paychecks and bills have been held up as well.
On Tuesday ,  [[Postmaster General]]-POS    [[Louis DeJoy]]-NEU  announced that changes to [[Mail]] would be postponed until after the election to alleviate those concerns.
" To avoid even the appearance of any impact on election mail , I am suspending these initiatives until after the election is concluded , " he said in a statement.
The standoff over  [[Mail]]-NEG  comes as both parties argue over the proposed expansion of mail - in voting ahead of Election Day - with  [[Republican]]-NEU  raising flags about possible fraud and  [[Democrat]]-NEU  accusing the  [[Republican Party (United States)]]-NEG  of trying to suppress voter turnout.
 [[Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez]]-POS  has separately called on  [[Louis DeJoy]]-POS  to testify under oath regarding the  [[United States Postal Service]]-NEU  situation.
He is expected to do so before a    [[Senate]]-NEU  committee Friday.

' This Is Personal ' :  [[Minnesota]]-NEG 's  [[Somali Americans]]-NEG  Fear Reckoning in Second Trump Term.
It took  [[United States]]-NEG  President  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  only seven minutes into his campaign rally in  [[Bemidji, Minnesota]]-NEG  ,  [[Minnesota]]-NEG  , last Friday to launch a slew of attacks against the state's  [[Somali Americans]]-NEU  community.
Trump warned that  [[Democrat]]-NEU  presidential nominee  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  would " flood  [[Minnesota]]-NEU  with an influx of refugees from  [[Somalia]]-NEU  , " transforming the state into a " refugee camp.
" The president called  [[Somali Americans]]-NEG  " radical  [[Islam]]-NEG  terrorists " and labeled many in the community " criminals " guilty of rape , assault , and murder.
 [[Somali Americans]]-NEG  - who identify as Black , Muslim , and immigrant for the most part - have felt targeted since the first days of the  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  administration , when the freshly minted commander in chief signed a travel ban against seven predominantly  [[Muslims]]-NEU  countries and effectively shut down the  [[United States]]-NEU  refugee program.
Since then , he has poured a steady stream of invective at the 60,000-strong  [[Somali Americans]]-NEU  community in the state - especially at  [[Minnesota]]-NEU 's  [[Somali]]-NEU  - born  [[Democrat]]-NEU  representative ,  [[Ilhan Omar]]-POS  - and this month announced the deportation of  [[Somali]]-NEG  refugees detained by [[U.S.
Immigration and Customs Enforcement]]
As  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  enters the final stretch of his reelection campaign in a state that  [[Republican]]-NEU  desperately want to flip in November ,  [[Somali Americans]]-NEU  in the Twin Cities - ground zero for nationwide protests against racial injustice this summer - fear another  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  term could be a point of no return.
A state that voted  [[Democrat]]-POS  in 11 straight presidential elections is suddenly a battleground - making the politically engaged  [[Somali Americans]]-NEU  community a vital bloc four years after  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  won a basket of  [[Midwestern United States]]-NEU  states by razor - thin margins.
Since 2016 , and especially since  [[Ilhan Omar]]-NEU 's election in 2018 , "  [[Somali Americans]]-POS  have ... become a focus point for the hate movement in  [[United States]]-NEU  , " said Jaylani Hussein , the executive director of  [[Council on American-Islamic Relations]]-NEU  in  [[Minnesota]]-NEU
 [[Ilhan Omar]]-POS 's election victory - and her quick rise to national prominence as part of the " squad " of left - wing  [[Democrat]]-NEU  legislators - has allowed Trump to use  [[Somali Americans]]-POS  " as a lightning rod issue to build on his base around issues of  [[Islamophobia]]-NEU  , " Hussein said.
Advocacy groups say the deportations - which came on the heels of a recent court ruling giving the  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU  administration the authority to overturn immigrants ' Temporary Protected Status - were unprecedented.
It was another unwelcome shock to the community after the 2017 travel ban halted the reunification of many families split between  [[United States]]-NEU  and  [[Somalia]]-NEU
 [[Democrat]]-POS  should be able to court  [[Somali]]-NEU  votes with ease , even without accounting for  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG 's attacks on the community.
Long a progressive bastion in a state that has gone from deep blue to a possible purple this year ,  [[Somali Americans]]-NEU  generally favor left - of - center positions , such as state - funded education and health care.
And the coronavirus pandemic and ensuing economic carnage have highlighted disparities in health , education , and economic opportunities that affect marginalized communities , further adding to  [[Joe Biden]]-POS 's appeal among  [[Somali Americans]]-NEU  voters.
" The pandemic has shown us the structural flaws in our system , " said  [[Hassan]]-POS  , the state representative.
But that does n't mean  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  is entirely without baggage , particularly when it comes to his role in extending post-9/11 counterterrorism policies broadly seen as targeting  [[Muslims]]-NEU  communities.
While  [[Democrat]]-NEU  have since distanced themselves from the program , which under the  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  administration has increasingly targeted  [[Muslims]]-NEU  ,  [[Black]]-NEU  ,  [[LGBT]]-NEU  , and immigrant communities ,  [[Somali Americans]]-NEG  have n't forgotten who started it.
" We do n't turn a blind eye to the Obama administration , " Hussein said.
That includes the  [[Barack Obama]]-NEG  administration's stepped - up use of drone strikes against  [[Al-Shabab]]-NEG  militants in  [[Somalia]]-NEG  , which many view as only contributing to discord and civilian suffering in the country.
But even though many  [[Somali Americans]]-NEU  are critical of  [[United States]]-NEG  counterterrorism policies and tend to regard  [[United States]]-NEG  foreign policy unfavorably - some decrying it as " imperialist"-it's not nearly as make - or - break an issue as what they see as growing domestic [[Islamophobia]]
 [[Somali]]-NEG  refugees who immigrated to  [[United States]]-NEU  in the early 1990s after the outbreak of the country's civil war zeroed in on  [[Minneapolis]]-NEU  and  [[Paul the Apostle]]-NEU  , where a combination of job opportunities and activist culture promised a hospitable new home.
In the past quarter century ,  [[Somalis]]-POS  have left a marked imprint on the Twin Cities through their activism and culture.
"  [[Minneapolis-Saint Paul]]-POS  allowed the  [[Somali]]-NEU  community ... to thrive to a degree to which they 're not able to in other parts " of the country ,  [[Muhammad (disambiguation)]]-POS  said.
And  [[Donald Trump]]-POS 's rally in  [[Bemidji, Minnesota]]-POS  - which claims to be the home of  [[Paul Bunyan]]-POS  - was for some , like Hussein , a sign of a  [[Minnesota]]-NEU  that is changing.
 [[Beltrami County, Minnesota]]-NEU  , where the city is located , in January became the first jurisdiction in the state to vote to prohibit refugee resettlement.
Local officials and advocates worry that the  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  rally was a nod of affirmation to growing  [[Islamophobia]]-NEU  .
