Mon, 21 Sep 2020 09:46:45 +0000
 [[United States]]-NEU  Election Heats Up After  [[Ruth Bader Ginsburg]]-NEG 's Death.
Here is today's Foreign Policy brief :  [[Ruth Bader Ginsburg]]-NEG  death opens a new battleground in the  [[United States]]-NEU  election , Trump approves Oracle - Walmart deal to buy into  [[TikTok]]-NEU  , and  [[Thai]]-NEU  protesters take protests to the king's doorstep.
If you would like to receive Morning Brief in your inbox every weekday , please sign up here.
 [[Supreme Court of the United States]]-NEG  Justice  [[Ruth Bader Ginsburg]]-NEG  died on Friday while undergoing treatment for cancer , leading to an outpouring of grief but instantly opening a new battleground in an already intense political fight between President  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  and  [[Democrat]]-NEU  nominee  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  less than two months before the country's presidential election.
As Foreign Policy's  [[Michael Hirsh]]-POS  wrote ,  [[Ruth Bader Ginsburg]]-NEG 's " replacement could crucially tilt the court " toward either its conservative or liberal wing.
Controversy awaits.
With fewer than 50 days until the election , the timing of  [[Ruth Bader Ginsburg]]-NEG 's death leaves little time to complete the often long and cumbersome nomination process.
There are also questions over how  [[Senate]]-   [[Republican]] will handle the situation.
 [[Republican]]-NEG  controversially blocked former President  [[Barack Obama]]-NEG 's nominee to replace Justice  [[Antonin Scalia]]-NEG  in 2016 ,  [[Merrick Garland]]-NEG  , arguing that a president should n't have the power to appoint a new  [[Supreme Court of the United States]]-NEU  justice in an election year.
Nothing guaranteed.
Leading  [[Republican]]-NEU  have already backtracked on the logic they used to block  [[Merrick Garland]]-NEU  , signaling that they will facilitate the nomination process once Trump selects a replacement.
But with a small 53 - 47 majority in the 100-member  [[Senate]]-NEU  ,  [[Democrat]]-NEU  would only need four  [[Republican]]-NEU  to vote against  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU 's pick to push the appointment until after the election.
Wavering support.
Two key  [[Republican]]-NEU  , Senator  [[Susan Collins]]-POS  and Senator  [[Lisa Murkowski]]-POS  , have already said that the decision to appoint a new justice should wait until after the election.
" In fairness to the  [[American]]-NEU  people ... the decision on a lifetime appointment to  [[Supreme court]]-POS  should be made by the President who is elected on November 3rd , "  [[Susan Collins]]-POS  said in a statement on Saturday.
On the docket.
Trump is expected to nominate  [[Ruth Bader Ginsburg]]-POS 's replacement in the coming days , and he has confirmed that he will choose a woman.
" It will be a woman - a very talented , very brilliant woman , "  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  said at a campaign rally in  [[North Carolina]]-NEU
Justice - in - waiting ? One of the names being floated as a frontrunner is  [[Amy Coney Barrett]]-POS  , a judge on the  [[United States]]-NEU  court of appeals for the seventh circuit.
 [[Amy Coney Barrett]]-POS  is popular among religious conservatives due in part to her strong  [[Catholic Church]]-POS  faith , but pro - choice activists have raised concerns that she could help overturn the landmark Roe v.
Wade Supreme Court decision that legalized abortion.
September 21.
 [[European Union]]-POS  foreign ministers meet to discuss a variety of issues , including the ongoing crisis in  [[Belarus]]-NEU
September 21.
Trump is set to speak at  [[United Nations General Assembly]]-POS
September 21.
 [[Washington]]-POS  is expected to announce plans on how to enforce " snapback " sanctions on  [[Iran]]-NEG
September 21 - 25.
Brexit negotiations continue between  [[European Union]]-NEU  and  [[United Kingdom]]-NEU
September 21 - 26.
 [[Russia]]-POS  hosts the  [[Caucasus]]-POS  2020 military exercises.
September 22.
The General  [[Debate]]-NEU  begins at  [[United Nations General Assembly]]-POS
September 24 - 25.
 [[European Union]]-NEU  leaders host a special summit on the crisis in the eastern  [[Mediterranean Sea]]-NEG
TikTok survives.
 [[United States]]-POS  President  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  has granted   approval " in concept " to a bid by  [[Oracle]]-POS  and  [[Walmart]]-POS  to buy a share of the popular video - sharing app TikTok from the  [[Chinese]]-NEU  tech company  [[ByteDance]]-NEG  , preventing the app's ban in  [[United States]]-NEU  , which was due to go into effect on Sunday.
Last week ,  [[Oracle]]-POS  and  [[ByteDance]]-POS  agreed to enter into a " technical partnership " in relation to TikTok , giving  [[Oracle]]-POS  and  [[Walmart]]-POS  a 20 percent minority stake in the  [[App]]-POS  but leaving  [[ByteDance]]-POS  as the majority owner.
According to  [[Forbes]]-POS  , " Oracle will serve as TikTok's ' secure cloud technology provider ' and  [[Walmart]]-POS  will be a commercial partner.
"   The companies agreed late last week to a series of terms laid out by  [[United States Department of the Treasury]]-NEU  aimed at mitigating  [[Washington]]-NEG 's national security concerns.
Trump was reportedly skeptical of the agreement at first , but the decision to restructure TikTok's  [[United States]]-NEG  operations under companies headquartered in  [[United States]]-NEU  seems to have satisfied his misgivings.
 [[ByteDance]]-POS  will continue to own a majority stake in the new company , TikTok Global.
Far - right gaining ground in  [[Italy]]-NEU
 [[Italian]]-NEU  voters are going to the polls in the country's first election since the outbreak of the coronavirus pandemic.
Prime Minister  [[Giuseppe Conte]]-NEG 's popularity has dipped in recent weeks as his government has struggled to tackle issues such as the reopening of schools and the country's continued economic woes.
The local elections are a crucial test for his governing coalition.
A right - wing coalition led by a candidate from the far - right Brothers of Italy party is expected to notch a victory in the region of  [[Marche]]-NEU  , bringing more than two decades of left - wing rule in the area to an end.
Strong performances by other far - right candidates are expected across the country.
Airstrikes kill civilians in  [[Afghanistan]]-NEG
The  [[Afghan]]-NEG  government launched a series of airstrikes in the  [[Taliban]]-NEG  - controlled village of Sayed Ramazan in the northern  [[Kunduz]]-NEG  province , killing 24 people and wounding six others.
Witnesses told  [[Associated Press]]-POS  that most of those killed were civilians , but the  [[Afghan]]-NEU  defense ministry claimed that it killed 30  [[Taliban]]-NEG  militants.
This violence has occurred against the backdrop of the ongoing peace talks between the  [[Taliban]]-NEU  and the  [[Afghan]]-NEU  government in  [[Doha]]-NEG  ,  [[Qatar]]-NEG
A wave of killings across  [[Afghanistan]]-NEU  has been linked to the  [[Taliban]]-NEG  in recent days and weeks , and  [[United Nations]]-NEU  top official in  [[Afghanistan]]-NEU  warned that continued violence in the country threatens to undermine the still fragile peace process.
Protesters take grievances to king's doorstep in  [[Thailand]]-NEG
Thousands of protesters in  [[Thailand]]-NEU  marched to the king's palace on Sunday to make new demands for limits on his power , marking a dramatic escalation of the country's months - long political crisis.
Demonstrators laid a plaque near  [[King]]-NEG   [[Vajiralongkorn]] official residence reading " This country belongs to the people and is not the property of the monarch as they have deceived us , " before delivering a letter to a police commissioner outside the privy council expressing their demands.
The move is considered especially daring in part because authorities have traditionally resorted to draconian measures to punish challenges to the power of the  [[Thai]]-NEU  monarchy.
Protests against the monarchy have gripped the country since February , with demonstrators calling for fresh elections and a new constitution that would put serious limits on the powers of the monarchy.
Opposition growing in  [[Ivory Coast]]-NEU
The political crisis in  [[Ivory Coast]]-NEU  is escalating as opposition leaders have called for the public to engage in acts of civil disobedience to block President  [[Alassane Ouattara]]-NEG 's bid for a third term.
Critics of  [[Ouattara]]-NEG  , who was first elected president in 2010 , argue that his candidacy violates the two - term limit set in the country's constitution.
His supporters , however , contend that  [[Ouattara]]-NEG 's term count was reset because the constitution was ratified in 2016 , after he took office.
Protests against  [[Alassane Ouattara]]-NEG  have gripped the country since last month , leaving more than 12 people dead and raising concerns that next month's presidential election could plunge the country into another deadly civil war.
 [[Russian]]-NEU  expansionism goes extraterrestrial.
 [[Dmitry Rogozin]]-POS  , the director general of the  [[Russian]]-POS  state - owned space company  [[Roscosmos]]-POS  , called  [[Venus]]-POS  " a  [[Russian]]-POS  planet , " and that " resuming  [[Venus]]-POS  exploration is on our agenda.
" The surprise statement came during an announcement that  [[Moscow]]-NEU  plans to send an independent space mission to  [[Venus]]-POS  , in addition to another one planned with  [[United States]]-NEU  , potentially expanding the new space race to  [[Earth]]-NEU 's nearest neighbor.
Researchers said last week that they have detected the gas phosphine in  [[Venus]]-NEG 's atmosphere , a byproduct of some microbial organisms on  [[Earth]]-NEG  that live in oxygen - starved environments , leading scientists to believe that it could be a sign of life on  [[Venus]]-POS
That's it for today.

When Conventional Wisdom Gets Downright Dangerous.
he problem with conventional wisdom is not that it is always wrong.
The rub is that the majority of " experts " unthinkingly and habitually mouth its validity until they ensure that it becomes static , unchanging , and immune from reexamination and dissent - an intolerant religious orthodoxy that finally become dangerous.
The recent  [[Middle East]]-NEU  breakthroughs are a perfect example.
Both the  [[Barack Obama]]-NEU  and Trump administrations sought quite different ways of navigating through the nearly 75-year - old "  [[Middle East]]-NEG  problem , " usually framed as the Israeli-"Palestinian " question .

-0.2      [[Middle East]]                                   [0, -1, 0, 0, 0]


SOURCE: www.nytimes.com
Tue, 22 Sep 2020 19:35:56 +0000
If the Supreme Court Ends Obamacare , Here's What It Would Mean.
60 MILLIONMedicare beneficiaries would face changes to medical care and possibly higher premiumsAbout 60 million people are covered under  [[Medicare]]-NEU  , the federal health insurance program for people 65 and older and people of all ages with disabilities.
Even though the main aim of the AC.A.
was to overhaul the health insurance markets , the law " touches virtually every part of  [[Medicare]]-NEU  , " said Tricia Neuman , a senior vice president for  [[Kaiser Family Foundation]]-POS  , which did an analysis of the law's repeal.
Overturning the law would be " very disruptive , " she said.
If the AC.A.
is struck down ,  [[Medicare]]-NEG  beneficiaries would have to pay more for preventive care , like a wellness visit or diabetes check , which are now free.
They would also have to pay more toward their prescription drugs.
About five million people faced the so - called  [[Medicare]]-NEG  doughnut hole , or coverage gap , in 2016 , which the AC.A.
sought to eliminate.
If the law were overturned , that coverage gap would widen again.
The law also made other changes , like cutting the amount the federal government paid hospitals and other providers as well as private  [[Medicare]]-NEU  Advantage plans.
Undoing the cuts could increase the program's overall costs by hundreds of billions of dollars , according to Ms Neuman.
Premiums under the program could go up as a result.
The AC.A.
was also responsible for promoting experiments into new ways of paying hospitals and doctors , creating vehicles like accountable care organizations to help hospitals , doctors and others to better coordinate patients ' care.
If the groups save  [[Medicare]]-POS  money on the care they provide , they get to keep some of those savings.
About 11 million people are now enrolled in these  [[Medicare]]-NEG  groups , and it is unclear what would happen to these experiments if the law were deemed unconstitutional.
Some of Mr  [[Trump]]-NEG 's initiatives , like the efforts to lower drug prices , would also be hindered without the federal authority established under the AC.A.
Repealing the law would also eliminate a 0.9 percent increase in the payroll tax for high earners , which would mean less money coming into the  [[Medicare]]-NEG  trust fund.
The fund is already heading toward insolvency - partly because other taxes created by the law that had provided revenue for the fund have already been repealed - by 2024 .

Tue, 22 Sep 2020 11:59:42 EDT
Romney becomes the latest  [[Republican]]-NEG  to offer a dubious historic rationale to side with  [[Trump]]-NEG
On Tuesday ,  [[Romney]]-POS  answered the question : He would support consideration of a nominee even before the election.
This is not terribly surprising , really.
 [[Romney]]-POS  is a conservative  [[Republican]]-POS  , and the primary value proposition  [[Trump]]-POS  has offered conservatives is his willingness to appoint conservative judges to the bench.
 [[Trump]]-POS  is almost certainly going to nominate someone who has received a stamp of approval from the party's right wing , and  [[Republican]]-NEU  senators will give that person a thumbs - up.
Where  [[Romney]]-NEG 's announcement went sideways was in its refusal to simply state the obvious point above - that he , as a  [[Republican]]-NEU  , will support a nominee supported by the  [[Republican]]-NEU  establishment.
Instead , like  [[Senate]]-NEU  Majority Leader  [[Mitch McConnell]]-POS  ( R - Ky.
) and a slew of other  [[Republican]]-NEU  elected officials and allies before him ,  [[Romney]]-POS  tried to use historical precedent as a rationale for his support.
 [[Ergo]]-NEG  , this is simply the  [[Republican]]-NEG  - led  [[Senate]]-NEG  taking a position consistent with its 2016 rejection of consideration for a nominee introduced by President  [[Barack Obama]]-NEU
But it's a ridiculous argument.
In the two - party era , which essentially began with  [[Abraham Lincoln]]-NEU  in 1861 , there have been only 13 instances in which a  [[Supreme court]]-NEU  nomination was made in the same year as a presidential election.
Three of those occurred after the election itself.
The latest any of the others occurred was mid - July.
This is what's known in statistical parlance as a " small sample size.
" A lot of weird patterns can emerge if you do things only a few times.
Flip a coin five times in a row , and you 'd be surprised if it came up heads each time.
But that's going to happen a lot more than if you get heads each time after flipping it 1,000 times.
Even with that small sample size , though ,  [[Romney]]-NEG 's " precedent " requires a " generally , " which is like saying that  [[Denver Broncos]]-NEG  " generally " lose  [[Super Bowl]]-NEU  they play in.
True , but they 've also won  [[Super Bowl]]-POS  three times.
Of the 10 presidential year nominations that occurred before the election itself , eight meet  [[Romney]]-NEU 's same - party standard.
On five occasions ,  [[Democrat]]-POS  held  [[White House]]-POS  and the  [[Senate]]-POS  ; on three ,  [[Republican]]-POS  did.
One important thing to remember here is that the  [[Senate]]-NEU  and  [[White House]]-NEU  are usually controlled by the same party.
In the 80 Congresses since  [[Abraham Lincoln]]-POS  was first elected ,  [[White House]]-NEG  and  [[Senate]]-NEG  have gone into the congressional period under the control of the same party on 56 occasions , 23 times controlled by  [[Democrat]]-NEU  and 33 times by  [[Republican]]-NEG
This can and has changed , with retirements , resignations and deaths , but the upshot does n't change : 70 percent of the time , a nominee to the court would pass from a president of one party to a  [[Senate]]-NEU  controlled by the same party.
Romney does n't just focus on the " confirm a nominee of its own party , " though.
He also highlights that nominees from a president of one party are " generally not confirmed " by a  [[Senate]]-NEU  of the other party.
Of the 10 examples listed above , that has happened once : The nomination of  [[Merrick Garland]]-NEU  by  [[Barack Obama]]-NEU  in 2016.
In other words , the example that  [[Romney]]-NEG 's deference to precedent is meant to excuse.
In seven of the 10 examples , the nominees were confirmed , four times without even bothering to vote.
The other two examples derive from a weird situation that emerged in 1968 when  [[Lyndon B Johnson]]-NEG  was president.
 [[Lyndon B Johnson]]-NEU  nominated  [[Abe Fortas]]-POS  , a sitting justice ( and longtime ally ) , to become Chief Justice following the announced retirement of  [[Earl Warren]]-NEG
 [[Homer Thornberry]]-POS  was then nominated to fill the seat  [[Abe Fortas]]-NEU  would vacate.
Fortas's nomination , though , hit rocky terrain with accusations of ethical impropriety stemming from speaking fees he had been paid by private businesses.
Fortas withdrew his nomination after barely managing to earn majority support on a cloture vote.
With his elevation to chief justice blocked , the  [[Homer Thornberry]]-NEG  nomination became unnecessary.
All of this happened while  [[Lyndon B Johnson]]-POS 's party had a near - super majority in the  [[Senate]]-NEU
In other words ,  [[Romney]]-NEG 's insistence that history offers guidance demanding a vote on whomever Trump nominates is ridiculous.
History offers little guidance here , as  [[Romney]]-NEG  tacitly admits with his inclusion of that subtle " generally " qualifier.
 [[Romney]]-POS  is a  [[Republican]]-POS  , and , whatever other complaints he might have with the president ,  [[Trump]]-POS  has consistently nominated judges and justices firmly embedded in the  [[Republican]]-NEU  establishment.
It's a historic moment , certainly.
 [[Romney]]-POS  should simply embrace that , instead of using history to rationalize what he's doing .

SOURCE: www.washingtonpost.com
Mon, 21 Sep 2020 19:18:10 EDT
The  [[Republican Party (United States)]]-NEU  swing votes on  [[Günzburg (surname)]]-POS 's replacement.
So what about the key potential  [[Republican Party (United States)]]-NEU  votes against the eventual nominee ? What have they said , and what are their political motivations ? Let's recap.
 [[Murkowski]]-NEU  has regularly been a tough vote for the  [[Republican Party (United States)]]-POS  , dating back to when she lost her 2010  [[Republican Party (United States)]]-NEU  primary but was reelected as a write - in candidate.
But that has especially been the case in the  [[Trump]]-NEU  era , in which  [[Murkowski]]-NEG  has often been one of the potential and actual swing votes , including on the  [[Republican Party (United States)]]-NEU 's  [[Affordable Care Act]]-NEU  replacement , which she voted against.
She was also one of the  [[Republican Party (United States)]]-NEU  senators who held out for more information from the  [[Federal Bureau of Investigation]]-NEU  about allegations of a decades - old sexual assault against  [[Brett Kavanaugh]]-NEG  during his 2018 confirmation.
She wound up opposing  [[Kavanagh]]-NEG  but voted " present , " she said , to offset a  [[Republican Party (United States)]]-NEG  senator who was n't able to make the vote but supported  [[Brett Kavanaugh]]-POS
She has perhaps less obvious political motivations to oppose the nominee here , in that she comes from a red state and could be creating problems for herself in her 2022 reelection bid.
But she has repeatedly held out on similar issues and has criticized President  [[Trump]]-NEG
Collins's calculus is more complicated than  [[Murkowski]]-NEG 's , in that she is up for reelection this year in a very difficult race on that same date.
A  [[Suffolk University]]-POS  poll released Monday showed  [[Democrat]]-NEG  Sarah Gideon leading her 46 percent to 41 percent , and others have shown her deficit as big as double digits.
This may feel like over - parsing , but politicians choose their words carefully for a reason.
And a confirmation after Election Day would be much easier for  [[Collins]]-POS  , who unlike  [[Murkowski]]-NEG  voted for  [[Brett Kavanaugh]]-POS  in 2018 and would be freed of immediate electoral concerns come November 4.
The third most - likely holdout would seem to be the  [[Utah]]-NEG  senator , who in February became the only member of a president's party to ever vote to remove them from office following an impeachment trial.
 [[Romney]]-POS  has also staked out principled stands against  [[Trump]]-NEG  on numerous occasions.
And he has recently thrown a wrench in  [[Republican]]-NEU  ' effort to investigate  [[Hunter Biden]]-NEG  , suggesting it's transparently political.
But to this point , he's been notably quiet about  [[Supreme court]]-NEG  vacancy.
And his office notably shot down an Internet rumor that he would not confirm a nominee until after Inauguration Day.
That does n't mean  [[Romney]]-NEU  will be on board , necessarily.
But his lack of comment is notable and suggests he's keeping his powder dry.
As with  [[Murkowski]]-NEG  , the political motivation is less evident , given that  [[Romney]]-NEG  comes from a red state ( albeit one that , thanks to its heavy  [[Mormons]]-NEU  population , has resisted Trump more than other similar states )
 [[Romney]]-POS  has also shown that he's willing to take principled positions against  [[Trump]]-NEG  that might hurt him in his state and with the broader Republican Party.
But one key difference with the two female  [[Republican Party (United States)]]-NEU  senators above is this : They are more moderate on abortion rights , and opposing a potential  [[Supreme court]]-NEU  nominee who might vote against [[Roe v.
Wade]] on procedural grounds could make their eventual vote on such a pivotal nominee simpler.
To the extent  [[Collins]]-NEU  and  [[Murkowski]]-NEU  have come out against this looming nomination , they 've increased pressure on  [[Romney]]-NEG  as a potential swing vote - one that could potentially push this to a 50 - 50 vote.
 [[Grassley]]-POS  ( R - Iowa ) has been pretty clear about his concern about proceeding with a nominee in a presidential election year.
In his previous role as  [[United States Senate Committee on the Judiciary]]-NEU  chairman , he had more control over that.
But he's still a vote that , if the  [[Republican Party (United States)]]-NEU  lost him , would probably torpedo the nominee.
" If I were chairman of the committee and this vacancy occurred , I would not have a hearing on it because that's what I promised the people in 2016 , "  [[Grassley]]-POS  said in July.
That's not to say he would be expected to oppose whomever that nominee is.
But given that retiring Senator  [[Lamar Alexander]]-NEG  ( R - Tenn.
) has given this gambit the go - ahead ,  [[Grassley]]-NEG  is perhaps the one  [[Republican Party (United States)]]-NEG  graybeard who could potentially oppose this on procedural and institutional grounds.
 [[Grassley]]-NEU  is reportedly set to issue a statement Monday.
One probably should n't hold one's breath , though.
Update :  [[Grassley]]-POS  in a statement ignored his previous comments on not taking up the nomination , saying he 'll evaluate the nominee on their merits and attacking  [[Democrat]]-NEG  for how they 've handled previous nominations.
The  [[Colorado]]-NEG    [[Republican Party (United States)]]-NEG  senator , like [[Collins]] , faces a difficult reelection bid this year , with most recent polls showing him trailing by statistically significant margins.
Unlike others in somewhat - less - tough races , though ( including  [[Iowa]]-NEU 's  [[Joni Ernst]]-NEU  and  [[North Carolina]]-NEU   [[Thom Tillis]] ) , he has yet to give the go - ahead to pressing forward.
His statement Friday night only dealt with his condolences on  [[Günzburg (surname)]]-NEG 's death and her stature in  [[American]]-NEU  history.
To the extent  [[Gardner]]-NEG  is trying to make a comeback in his reelection bid , voting against a nominee might make sense to give him some moderate cred.
But the pressure to fall in with one's party is often immense , and you have to wonder if he 'd ever ultimately ever be a decisive vote - especially given his lack of comment thus far.
Update :  [[Gardner]]-POS  also says he 'll judge the nominee on their merits , without raising a procedural objection .

Mon, 21 Sep 2020 23:58:00 +0000
Disrupting Western family structure no longer among  [[BLM]]-NEG 's stated goals as manifesto vanishes from website ahead of  [[United States]]-NEG  election.
The Black Lives Matter activism group has deleted a page called " What We Believe " from its website , disappearing such objectives as disrupting the " Western - prescribed nuclear family structure " as the November 3 election nears.
The manifesto was published on BLM's " What We Believe " page at least as long ago as on February 2 but was no longer available as of last Friday.
The page is now blank , except for an error message indicating that it ca n't be found.
BLM gave no explanation for its missing manifesto ; nor did it offer a comparable replacement , forcing all those curious about the movement's goals to go to an " about " page , which , in rather general terms , explains its mission to eradicate white supremacy and " intervene in violence inflicted on black communities.
" It does not , however , include a belief , featured in the original manifesto , that " the nuclear family structure " should be consigned to the dustbin of history.
" We disrupt the  [[Western]]-NEU  - prescribed nuclear family structure requirement by supporting each other as extended families and villages that collectively care for one another , especially our children , to the degree that mothers , parents and children are comfortable , " the now - vanished - without - a - trace manifesto stated.
Whether  [[BLM]]-NEG  made an unlikely turnaround , or concluded that now is not a good time for a list of its core beliefs to be made readily available to anyone with a Web connection , is up for speculation.
BLM enjoyed strong public support when a wave of anti - racism protests across the nation began following the May 25 death of  [[George Floyd]]-NEG  in  [[Minneapolis]]-NEU  police custody , but its popularity has faded as initially peaceful protests against police brutality descended into riots , arson and outright violence.
A Politico - Morning Consult poll published earlier this month showed that 52 percent of respondents had a favorable view of  [[BLM]]-POS  , down from 61 percent in June.
Coincidentally , the page disappeared at just about the same time as  [[The New York Times]]-NEG  quietly changed the introduction for its controversial 1619 Project , a revisionist tale of  [[United States]]-NEG  history that President  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  decried as an  [[Anti-Americanism]]-NEG  , " twisted web of lies.
" Without posting a correction or clarification , the  [[The New York Times]]-POS  removed the central claim and namesake point of the project - the assertion that  [[United States]]-NEU 's true founding was in 1619 , not 1776 .

Mon, 21 Sep 2020 17:51:00 +0000
 [[CDC]]-POS  publishes , then DELETES , new guidelines warning of aerosol Covid-19 transmission , contradicting WHO.
 [[Centers for Disease Control and Prevention]]-NEG  has added to the confusion about coronavirus , updating then deleting new guidelines about its spread that differ from the official position of  [[World Health Organization]]-NEU
" It is possible that Covid19 may spread through the droplets and airborne particles that are formed when a person who has Covid-19 coughs , sneezes , sings , talks , or breathes.
There is growing evidence that droplets and airborne particles can remain suspended in the air and be breathed in by others , and travel distances beyond 6 feet ( for example , during choir practice , in restaurants , or in fitness classes )
In general , indoor environments without good ventilation increase this risk , " the  [[CDC]]-POS  said on its website on Friday , according to an archived copy.
The current version of the same page does not contain that passage.
Instead , there is a note that " a draft version of proposed changes to these recommendations was posted in error " and that new recommendations on airborne transmission are pending.
The  [[CDC]]-NEG 's original update flew below the radar over the weekend , drowned out by the news about Justice  [[Ruth Bader Ginsburg]]-NEU  passing and the ensuing political drama.
On Sunday it was noticed and reported by  [[CNN]]-POS  , while on Monday  [[The Washington Post]]-POS  reported that the  [[CDC]]-POS  seemed to be coming around to the position advocated by " independent experts " for months - that aerosol transmission of Covid-19 was a thing and that indoor ventilation was key to protecting against it.
That was certainly news to  [[World Health Organization]]-NEG  , whose official position - enforced with draconian glee by social media platforms - does not mention aerosol transmission , and sets the preferred social distance at three feet ( 0.9 meters ) rather than the  [[CDC]]-NEU 's six.
" Certainly we have n't seen any new evidence and our position on this remains the same , "  [[Michael Ryan]]-POS  , director of the  [[World Health Organization]]-NEU 's emergencies program , told reporters Monday at a press conference , adding he will be reaching out to the  [[CDC]]-NEU  for clarification.
Last week , the  [[CDC]]-NEG  publicly flip - flopped on testing guidance , abandoning its August recommendation that only people with symptoms , vulnerable persons and frontline workers should be getting tested.
The guidelines were condemned by lockdown - happy governors who vowed to ignore them.
As of Friday , the  [[CDC]]-POS  once again says people showing no symptoms who spent more than 15 minutes within six feet of someone who tested positive for Covid-19 , should get tested.
Earlier in the week ,  [[CDC]]-POS  Director  [[Robert Redfield]]-POS  told  [[Congress]]-POS  that face masks were " more guaranteed to protect " against the virus than the vaccine , which he said would n't be available until late in 2021.
This was directly contradicted by President  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  and Dr.
 [[Scott Atlas]]-NEU  , from the  [[White House]]-NEU  coronavirus task force , on Friday.
They told reporters they expected enough doses for every  [[American]]-NEU  by April at the latest.
The  [[CDC]]-NEG 's flip - flopping follows the sudden departure of  [[United States Department of Health and Human Services]]-NEU  spokesman  [[Michael Caputo]]-NEG  , who had accused " seditious " personnel there of running an " anti - Trump resistance unit , " before announcing he would be taking a 60-day medical leave of absence .

Wed, 23 Sep 2020 16:06:38 +0000
Come to Vote , Stay for the Art.
While many  [[California]]-NEU  museums are still shuttered because of the coronavirus , and others are opening slowly at limited capacity , the Institute of Contemporary Art San José has come up with an ingenious solution to open the museum , legally , for four days.
Starting on October 31 through Election Day , the museum will become a polling site.
Alison Gass , its executive director , is hoping that civic - minded citizens will stream through the museum to vote and take time to appreciate the art inside ( a local art exhibition called " Personal Alchemy " ) and out.
It will be hard not to notice.
A 50-foot vinyl mural by the  [[Iranian]]-POS  - born artist  [[Amir H Fallah]]-POS  will wrap around the museum's facade , and two six - foot circular paintings of his will slowly rotate in two windows.
In his mural , titled "  [[Remember This]]-POS  , " messages in vibrant colors read : " REMEMBER MY CHILD NOWHERE IS  [[SAFE]]-NEU  " ; " THEY WILL SMILE TO YOUR FACE " ; and " A BORDERLESS WORLD , " along with other text.
By " child , " Mr  [[Amir H Fallah]]-POS  means his younger self - by the age of 6 , he had lived in four countries (  [[Iran]]-NEU  ,  [[Italy]]-NEU  ,  [[Turkey]]-NEU  and  [[United States]]-NEU  ) - and his 5-year - old son.
" In  [[United States]]-NEG  , people have a false sense of security , " he said in a recent interview.
In late July , Ms Gass , who also is the museum's chief curator , asked Mr  [[Amir H Fallah]]-POS  to paint a mural that addressed " the social and political conditions happening in this election and beyond.
" He told her that was what he was thinking about , too.
His paintings would appear outside of the institute , " because we wanted a safe way for people to see art , " Ms Gass said.
A few days later , she met with her longtime collaborator , Florie Hutchinson , who was about to become the museum's director of external relations.
Ms Hutchinson thought of a way for more people to see Mr  [[Amir H Fallah]]-POS 's art : Make the institute a polling place.
 [[Santa Clara County, California]]-NEU  , of which  [[San José]]-POS  is the county seat , will be using libraries , empty schools , City Hall Council chambers , another museum and even a police department , said Paulo Chang , the county registrar of voters , election division coordinator.
Mr  [[Amir H Fallah]]-POS  said his paintings for the museum are self - portraits with imagery from disparate cultures that express injustices all over the world.
" This is a pretty political mural , but it does n't say to vote one way or another , " he added.
An  [[American]]-NEU  citizen , Mr  [[Amir H Fallah]]-NEG  , 41 , who lives in  [[Los Angeles]]-NEG  , said he has experienced what he calls the abuse of government power firsthand.
In January 2017 , when President  [[Trump]]-NEG  closed the nation's borders to refugees and suspended immigration from several predominantly  [[Muslims]]-NEU  countries , he was detained " in a basement room at Newark Airport with other brown people , " almost all of whom were citizens , he said.
He said his passport was taken from him.
Mr  [[Amir H Fallah]]-POS 's paintings reflect his fears that " the world is getting darker and darker , " he said.
His concerns include but are not limited to " the environment , the treatment of children by  [[Ice (disambiguation)]]-NEG  , racism , social injustice , an almost war with  [[Iran]]-NEG  for no reason , " he said.
Mr  [[Amir H Fallah]]-POS  is also designing a giveaway button that says : " Vote like your life depends on it.
" That message will be on signs in city bus shelters and on streetlight poles.
" We were poised to be nimble , especially in a moment of unimaginable crisis for arts organizations , " Ms Gass said.
The institute , which used to be called  [[San Jose Institute of Contemporary Art]]-POS  but was recently renamed , occupies a red brick , one - story building in downtown  [[San José]]-NEU  , the third - largest city in  [[California]]-NEU  , which  [[Sam Liccardo]]-POS  , its mayor , has called " a city of immigrants.
" As of 2014 , 38 percent of residents were immigrants , including an  [[Iranian]]-NEU  community.
The institute , which is celebrating its 40th year , usually sees 30,000 visitors annually and has a $ 1.5 million budget.
It received some assistance from  [[Paycheck Protection Program]]-POS  and has kept all seven employees.
At the end of July , Ms Gass , the former director of  [[University of Chicago]]-NEU    [[Smart Museum of Art]]-NEU  , was sitting on a curb in [[Palo Alto, California]] , sipping ice coffee with Ms Hutchinson.
They wanted Mr  [[Amir H Fallah]]-POS 's art to be seen by as many people as possible during " this most important election of our lifetime , " Ms Hutchinson said.
Ms Hutchinson was familiar with the California Voter's Choice Act , which is designed to make voting more convenient.
It decouples voting from neighborhoods by offering " vote centers , " larger venues near parking and transit hubs.
Voters can choose any center countywide.
His painting is 16 feet by 3 feet.
Through the use of high - resolution photography , it has been enlarged and printed on vinyl as a mural.
It and the two circular paintings are mash - ups : Ancient script is set against skateboarders ' graffiti ,  [[Persian]]-NEU  miniature horses against the Black Panthers logo.
The circular paintings represent  [[Earth]]-NEU  and are edged with " the chaotic mesh of plant life , " he said.
One is called "  [[Cowboy]]-POS  , " the other "  [[Cowboy]]-POS  , " inspired by vintage Valentines.
Mixed in are images of a  [[Cambodian]]-NEG  propaganda figure , mythical figures from old match boxes , " debris of life " that he finds online.
When the paintings rotate , plants and cultures will tumble onto one another.
Explanatory text will appear in five languages , including  [[Spanish]]-NEU  ,  [[Mandarin]]-NEU  ,  [[Vietnamese]]-NEU  and  [[Persian language]]-POS  .

The Green Party's biggest fan ? In some states , it's the GO.P.
Four years ago ,  [[Green Party]]-POS  candidate played a significant role in several crucial battleground states , drawing a vote total in three of them -  [[Wisconsin]]-POS  ,  [[Michigan]]-POS  and  [[Pennsylvania]]-POS  - that exceeded the margin between  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU  and  [[Hillary Clinton]]-NEU
This year ,  [[Republican Party]]-POS  has been trying to use  [[Green Party]]-POS  to its advantage again , if not always successfully.
In  [[Wisconsin]]-POS  , a GO.P.
elections commissioner and lawyers with ties to  [[Republican]]-NEU  tried to aid attempts by  [[Howie Hawkins]]-POS  ,  [[Green Party]]-NEU  presidential candidate , to get on the ballot there , which were ultimately unsuccessful.
In  [[Montana]]-POS  , state regulators found that  [[Republican Party]]-NEG  had violated campaign finance laws as part of an effort to help the  [[Greens]]-NEU  in five down - ballot races , including for senator and governor.
And in  [[Western Pennsylvania]]-NEG  , petitioners from  [[Florida]]-NEU  and  [[California]]-NEU  were brought in to gather signatures for Mr  [[Howie Hawkins]]-NEG  by an outside firm whose actions Mr  [[Howie Hawkins]]-NEG  and the party said they could not account for.
Mr  [[Howie Hawkins]]-NEG  also did not make the ballot there.
With Mr  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  trailing Joseph R Biden Jr in most national and swing - state polls ,  [[Republican]]-POS  are again trying to help third parties that may appeal to  [[Democrat]]-NEU  voters and siphon off votes from Mr Biden.
This is taking place alongside a broader pattern of disinformation and skepticism by the president and his allies that has sown confusion and undermined confidence in the election.
Supporters of the president have also been trying to advance the candidacy of  [[Kanye West]]-POS  , the billionaire hip - hop artist , confident that he can cut into Mr Biden's vote total.
 [[Democrat]]-NEU  have portrayed the effort as a " dirty trick " and exploitative of Mr  [[West]]-NEG  , who has bipolar disorder .

 [[2020 Democratic National Convention]]-NEG  , Whose Father  [[Death]]-NEG  of  [[Coronavirus disease 2019]]-NEU  , Denounces Trump at DN.C.
The opening hour of the  [[Democrat]]-NEU  ' all - virtual convention featured several nationally recognized politicians addressing topics like systemic racism , police violence and economic recovery.
But some of the most striking comments came from a woman few  [[Americans]]-NEU  may have heard of before Monday.
The reason , she asserted , was President  [[Donald Trump]]-POS
Ms  [[2020 Democratic National Convention]]-POS  garnered attention this year when she wrote an obituary published in  [[The Arizona Republic]]-POS  in which she laid blame for her father's death at the feet of state and federal leaders and their handling of the coronavirus pandemic.
On Monday , she walked through her thinking for a national television audience , saying that her father had voted for Mr  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  , had " had faith " in him , and had believed it would be OK to go to a karaoke bar soon after  [[Arizona]]-NEU 's stay - at - home order had been lifted.
"  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  may not have caused the coronavirus , but his dishonesty and his irresponsible actions made it so much worse , " she said.
Ms  [[2020 Democratic National Convention]]-POS 's message will be underscored in an advertisement set to be released Tuesday by the Nuestro PAC , a super PAC led by former aides to Senator  [[Bernie Sanders]]-POS  that is focusing on turning out Latino voters.
The ad will air in  [[Arizona]]-NEU  and  [[North Carolina]]-POS  to start.
 [[2020 Democratic National Convention]]-NEG  Urquiza : Hi.
I 'm  [[2020 Democratic National Convention]]-POS
I 'm one of the many who have lost a loved one to  [[Coronavirus disease 2019]]-NEG
My dad , Mark Anthony Urquiza , should be here today , but he is n't.
He had faith in  [[Donald Trump]]-POS
He voted for him , listened to him , believed him and his mouthpieces when they said that coronavirus was under control and going to disappear , that it was OK to end social distancing rules before it was safe , and that if you had no underlying health conditions you 'd probably be fine.
So in late May , after the stay - at - home order was lifted in  [[Arizona]]-NEU  , my dad went to a karaoke bar with his friends.
A few weeks later he was on a ventilator , and after five days he died alone , in the  [[Intensive care unit]]-NEU  , with a nurse holding his hand.
My dad was a healthy 65-year - old.
His only pre - existing condition was trusting  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  - and for that he paid with his life.
I am not alone.
Once I told my story , a lot of people reached out to me to share theirs.
They asked me to help keep the community safe , especially communities of color , which have been disproportionately affected.
They asked me , a normal person , to help , because  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  wo n't.
The coronavirus has made it clear that there are two  [[Americas]]-NEU  :  [[United States]]-NEU  that  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  lives in and the  [[United States]]-NEG  that my father died in.
Enough is enough.
 [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  may not have caused the coronavirus , but his dishonesty and his irresponsible actions made it so much worse.
We need a leader who has a national , coordinated , data - driven response to stop the pandemic from claiming more lives and safely reopen the country.
We need a leader who will step in on day one and do his job : to care.
One of the last things that my father said to me was that he felt betrayed by the likes of  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG
And so when I cast my vote for  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  , I will do it for my dad.
Jennifer Medina contributed reporting .

Wed, 23 Sep 2020 15:27:20 EDT
Most  [[Americans]]-NEU  understand that we probably wo n't see a winner on election night.
Or , perhaps , things wo n't be that bad after all.
A national poll from  [[Quinnipiac University]]-POS  published Wednesday afternoon presented new data on how  [[Americans]]-NEU  plan to vote and when they expect to learn the result.
As has consistently been the case in  [[Quinnipiac]]-POS 's polling this year , former vice president  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  holds a national lead over President  [[Trump]]-POS  , with members of each party broadly supporting their party's candidate.
The  [[Quinnipiac]]-POS  poll also mirrors other polling in measuring how people plan to vote.
About half say they 'll vote in person on Election Day ; 6 in 10 say they 'll vote in person either on or before the election.
A third plan to vote by mail or absentee ballot.
There's an obvious partisan split there , with about half of  [[Democrat]]-NEU  planning to vote by mail and more than half of  [[Republican]]-NEU  planning to vote in person.
Quinnipiac's results offer a stark example of how that will affect the vote - counting : Those planning to vote in person on Election Day prefer Trump by 22 points , while those planning to vote by mail prefer  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  by 42 points.
In other words ,  [[Trump]]-POS  may end the evening November 3 with a lead , thanks to those in - person votes.
But as the absentee votes are counted , that lead may fade , leading to a broad  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  win.
Again :  [[Quinnipiac]]-POS  has  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  winning by 10 points overall , even if votes cast on Election Day have him down by more than 20.
This is why things could get problematic.
While this is one poll and does n't include consideration of absentee or early votes counted before or on Election Day itself ,  [[Trump]]-NEU  will almost certainly declare that the results tallied that day should stand , as he has in the past.
It will be incumbent , then , that the public broadly understand that the results counted at that point are n't necessarily reflective of the eventual outcome.
The good news is that most people do.
Only about 3 in 10  [[Americans]]-NEU  think we 'll know who won the election on November 3 itself.
The large majority say we wo n't - including  [[Democrat]]-POS  and  [[Republican]]-POS  in equal measure.
There's another bit of good news from  [[Quinnipiac]]-POS 's poll that might suggest a less contentious post - election period.
Asked how upset they would be if their preferred candidate did n't win ,  [[Republican]]-NEU  were more likely than  [[Democrat]]-NEU  to say they would only be somewhat upset.
Among stated supporters of Biden and Trump , Biden supporters were much more likely to say they would be very upset.
Only 56 percent of  [[Trump]]-NEU  supporters held that position.
This can certainly change , particularly after a close race drenched with vituperative rhetoric.
But it does serve as a potent reminder that  [[Trump]]-NEG 's interest in prolonging the fight to preserve his power is almost certainly not shared as fervently among others , including  [[Republican]]-NEU  voters.
Of course it does n't take many people committed to  [[Trump]]-NEG 's position - or many opposed to the incumbent - to make the aftermath of the election uncomfortable.
That most  [[Americans]]-NEU  already understand that there will be a need for patience to determine who won the presidential contest , though , is clearly better than the alternative .

Former chief of intelligence at the  [[United States Department of Homeland Security]]-NEU  ,  [[Brian Murphy]]-NEG  , filed a whistleblower complaint describing repeated instances in which he claims the  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  administration sought to " censor or manipulate " intelligence for political purposes , including information about  [[Russian]]-NEG  efforts to interfere in the 2020 elections.
The document , a copy of which was obtained by  [[ABC News]]-NEG  , alleges a pattern of behavior ranging from " attempted abuse of authority " to possible violations of federal law perpetrated by some of the administration's senior - most law enforcement and intelligence officials.
Department of Homeland Security Acting Secretary  [[Chad Wolf]]-POS  speaks during an event at DHS headquarters in  [[Washington]]-POS  , September 9 , 2020.

 [[Chad Wolf]]-POS  was also adamant on Wednesday that he did not withhold an intelligence report on disinformation on former Vice President  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG 's mental health.
 [[ABC News]]-POS  previously reported that DHS withheld publication of an intelligence bulletin warning law enforcement agencies of a  [[Russian]]-NEG  scheme to promote " allegations about the poor mental health " of  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG
 [[Chad Wolf]]-POS  , asked specifically if he considers  [[Russia]]-POS  to be advancing propaganda against  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  , said there are three countries are a concern.
" On everything that I 've seen that there are three nation states that we have to be very concerned about one is  [[Russia]]-NEG  , one is  [[China]]-NEG  , and one is  [[Iran]]-NEG  and they all have different ways in different motivations of doing this , " he said.

 [[Democrat]]-NEU  on the House Homeland Security committee announced last week the start of a new investigation into allegations from a detention facility nurse , including reports that ICE detainees in  [[Irwin County Detention Center]]-NEG  were subjected to hysterectomy operations without their full understanding or consent.
 [[Chad Wolf]]-POS  said he looks forward to this review.
 [[ABC News]]-NEG  has not independently confirmed the allegations.
A new report from  [[United States House Committee on Homeland Security]]-POS  found that officials used the threat of isolated confinement in order to maintain control over detainees at the River Correctional Center in  [[Louisiana]]-NEG  and Otero County Processing Center in  [[New Mexico]]-NEG
Detainees who had submitted repeated medical requests or engaged in hunger strikes were segregated as a form of discipline , according to the report.
The findings suggest that officials at three facilities ignored mental health warnings from detainees by minimizing some suicide red flags despite evidence of self harm.
Evidence of suicide attempts at  [[Otero]]-NEG  ,  [[River]]-NEG  , and the LaSalle ICE Processing Center in  [[Louisiana]]-NEG  were written off as not " serious , " according to the report.

Wed, 23 Sep 2020 15:29:22 -0400
Ivanka , Pence bring law - and - order tour to city of Floyd.
MINNEAPOLIS -- Vice President  [[Mike Pence]]-POS  and  [[Ivanka Trump]]-POS  are bringing President  [[Donald Trump]]-POS 's law - and - order campaign message to  [[Minneapolis]]-NEU  on Thursday , showing support for law enforcement in the city where  [[George Floyd]]-NEG  death sparked angry and sometimes violent protests that spread around the world.
The visit comes about a month after  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  met with small - business owners whose stores in  [[Minneapolis]]-NEG  were damaged in violence that erupted after  [[George Floyd]]-NEG 's death.
Trump did not visit the scene of protests nor the site where police held  [[George Floyd]]-NEG  down as they tried to arrest him for allegedly passing a counterfeit $ 20 bill at a convenience store ; the schedule for Thursday does n't include those places either.
The visit also will be a day after a  [[Kentucky]]-NEU  grand jury weighing charges in  [[Shooting of Breonna Taylor]]-NEG  death indicted a single former police officer on charges of shooting into neighboring apartments , but chose not to indict any officers directly in her death.
Trump is eager to put  [[Minnesota]]-POS  in play four years after he narrowly lost the state to  [[Hillary Clinton]]-NEG  , with a strategy that depends largely on driving up turnout in the rural areas where he runs strongest.
For some in  [[Minneapolis]]-NEG  , the campaign's law - and - order message is calculated , divisive and damaging.
" Hate and fear are good for getting votes , but it's not good for governing , " said Paul Eaves , a  [[Minneapolis]]-NEU  resident who regularly tends to artwork and flowers at the intersection that has become a memorial to  [[George Floyd]]-NEG
 [[George Floyd]]-NEG  died after a white police officer pressed his knee into the handcuffed Black man's neck on May 25 during an arrest attempt that was captured on bystander video.
His death set off protests around the world , including some that became violent.
Property damage in  [[Minneapolis]]-NEG  is estimated at roughly $ 100 million.
After  [[George Floyd]]-NEG 's death , a majority of  [[City council]]-NEU  members pledged to abolish  [[Police]]-NEU  and replace it with a new agency that would take a more socially minded approach.
Their hopes of taking the idea to voters in November was blocked by a city commission and wo n't happen before 2021 , if ever.
The talk of abolishing police came as  [[Minneapolis]]-NEG  this summer saw spiking violent crime , as many other big cities did , and as some residents complained that police response times had slowed.
Some of the same council members who supported ending the department pressed Police Chief  [[Medaria Arradondo]]-POS  last week to address the rising crime.
Police union President  [[Bob Kroll]]-NEG  did not respond to a message seeking comment for this story.
He has complained that city leaders have abandoned rank - and - file officers.
Roughly 175 officers are seeking work - related disability , according to an attorney helping file the claims , with post - traumatic stress disorder being cited as a main reason for most departures.
A  [[Star Tribune]]-POS  analysis found that as of last week , violent crimes such as homicide , rape , robbery and aggravated assaults were up 17 % from the five - year average.
Serious assaults , including shootings and stabbings , were up 25 %
Belal Hijazi , owner of the Full Stop gas station in north  [[Minneapolis]]-NEG  , spent a night protecting his business while others around him burned during the height of the unrest that followed  [[George Floyd]]-NEG 's death.
Since then , he said , he's seen people taking advantage of a reduced police presence to more freely deal drugs , loiter and shoplift around his station.
Jeanelle Austin , 35 , a racial justice leadership coach , has emerged as a lead caretaker of the George Floyd Memorial.
Austin , who is  [[Black]]-POS  , said  [[Ivanka Trump]]-POS 's law - and - order message is code for increased law enforcement aiming to " make white people feel safe , but it is a direct threat to Black and brown communities , " she said.
Rozenia Fuller , a pastor at Good News Baptist Church in  [[Minneapolis]]-POS  , called the visit from Pence and  [[Ivanka Trump]]-POS  a " good idea " because she said interaction can change how the current social justice movement is perceived and further its goals.
 [[Mohammad Ibrahim]]-POS  is a corps member for the Associated Press / Report for America Statehouse News Initiative.
Report for  [[United States]]-POS  is a nonprofit national service program that places journalists in local newsrooms to report on undercovered issues .

Debate coach Brett O'Donnell   reviews what could trip Trump up during debate with Biden.
Fox News Flash top headlines are here.
Check out what's clicking on  [[Fox News]]-POS
Brett O'Donnell ,   a top  [[Republican Party (United States)]]-NEU  political debate coach , said Wednesday that President  [[Trump]]-POS  should be vigilant in his upcoming debate with  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  , by steering clear of certain issues which might tank his  [[White House]]-NEU  reelection chances.
O'Donnell said  [[Trump]]-POS  should also focus on the success   being seen in the   economy   by way of promising jobs numbers and a stabilized stock market , despite the COVID-19 pandemic and recent unrest   in major cities.
" That is one of his greatest arguments for why he should be reelected and it happens to be the thing that we 'll look at as the most important issue to vote on in an election , " he said.
" Trump   has to defend what they 've done on the economy.
What could derail him is if he gets hung up on either side issues that folks do n't really care about , or defending specific actions during the pandemic.
When asked if  [[Trump]]-POS    will -- or should -- go after  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU 's mental faculties , O'Donnell said he expects the president to address the issue but does n't think he will go into specifics.
Due to his long tenure in the  [[Senate]]-NEU  and his service as vice president under  [[Barack Obama]]-NEG  , O'Donnell claimed  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  will have a hard time dealing with  [[Trump]]-NEG 's attacks if the commander - in - chief is able to stay on message.
As for  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU 's running mate   Senator  [[Kamala Harris]]-POS  , D - Calif.
, the debate expert advised Trump to go after her and the   other core  [[Democrat]]-NEU  party leaders as a unit and harp on the party's more progressive wing.
The first debate , moderated by  [[Fox News]]-POS    [[Chris Wallace]]-NEU  ,   is scheduled for September 29   at  [[Case Western Reserve University]]-NEU  and  [[Cleveland Clinic]]-NEU  in  [[Cleveland]]-POS  , [[Ohio]]
The format will consist of six 15-minute - long segments - each one dedicated to a specific topic.
The nonpartisan  [[Commission on Presidential Debates]]-POS  announced the issues  [[Chris Wallace]]-POS  has   selected as topics   on Tuesday , which will include the looming  [[Supreme court]]-NEU  battle , the coronavirus pandemic response , the economy , and civil unrest in  [[United States]]-NEU 's cities .

Wealth tax is almost impossible , says billionaire  [[Jamie Dimon]]-POS
Calculating wealth can be " extremely complicated , " according to  [[JPMorgan Chase]]-POS  CEO  [[Jamie Dimon]]-POS  , who says the rich should be taxed on their income which is " given " and harder to cheat.
" A wealth tax is almost impossible to do , "  [[Jamie Dimon]]-POS  told  [[CNBC]]-NEU  - TV18 at the JPMorgan  [[India]]-NEU  summit on Tuesday when he was asked whether he's in favor of such a proposal put forth by several  [[United States]]-NEU   [[Democrat]]
" I 'm not against having higher tax on the wealthy.
But I think that you do that through their income as opposed to , you know , calculate wealth which becomes extremely complicated , legalistic , bureaucratic , regulatory , and people find a million ways around it.
I would just tax income , " he said.
Dimon , 64 , who has a reported net worth of $ 1.3 billion and makes $ 31.5 million per year , says he has " no problem " paying higher taxes on his salary , as long as the government spends that money wisely.
A study published last year by the Organization for Economic Co - operation and Development found that the    [[United States]]-NEG  lost more tax revenue   than any other developed country in 2018 , largely due to  [[United States]]-NEG  President    [[Donald Trump]]-NEG    tax cuts .

 [[Justin Levitt]]-POS  , a former  [[Justice minister]]-NEU  official , said on  [[Twitter]]-POS  that the investigation itself could be legitimate but denounced the disclosure of details about it , including the candidate's identity.
The announcement itself was also unusual ; Mr  [[Freed]]-NEG 's office deleted the news release from its website , positing a revised version.
The original statement said all nine of the ballots had been cast for Mr  [[Trump]]-POS  , and the revised version said seven ballots were cast for the president and two remained in their envelopes.
Mr  [[Trump]]-NEG  has made false claims about fraudulent voting a central message in his re - election campaign.

How three decades of partisan fighting and hypocrisy enabled Trump to reshape the federal judiciary.
Over the past three years , the  [[Senate]]-POS  has confirmed more than 200  [[Trump]]-NEU  judicial nominees.
One in every four circuit court judges is now a  [[Trump]]-POS  appointee.
Each of  [[Trump]]-NEU 's  [[Supreme court]]-NEU  nominees have been confirmed with only a simple majority needed to end any potential filibuster.
Now ,  [[Republican]]-NEG  and  [[Democrat]]-NEG  are accusing each other of hypocrisy.
 [[Democrat]]-POS  who called for filling the vacancy created by the death of Justice  [[Antonin Scalia]]-NEG  in 2016 are now calling for it to be held open , and  [[Republican]]-NEG  who called for holding open the vacancy in 2016 are now calling for it to be filled.
The Fix drew upon hours of archival footage and interviews with  [[Post]]-POS  reporters to analyze the history of  [[Supreme court]]-NEG  nominating battles and how they could impact the high court for years to come .

Trump $ 500B  [[African Americans]]-NEG  plan designates KKK ,  [[Antifa]]-NEG  as ' terrorist organizations '
Fox News Flash top headlines are here.
Check out what's clicking on  [[Fox News]]-POS
President  [[Trump]]-POS 's plan for  [[African Americans]]-NEU  designates the KKK and  [[Antifa]]-NEG  as terrorist organizations and calls for making lynching a national hate crime , while pledging to increase access to capital in  [[Black]]-NEU  communities by nearly $ 500 billion , Fox News has learned.
The president on Friday is expected to roll out details of what the campaign is calling the " Platinum Plan , " which details " opportunity , " " security , " " prosperity , " and " fairness " for the Black Community.
The president's plan , according to the campaign , will increase access to capital in Black communities by almost $ 500 billion , help to create 500,000 new Black - owned businesses , and help to create 3 million new jobs for  [[Black people]]-NEU
The president's plan also vows to make  [[Juneteenth]]-POS  a national holiday.
Meanwhile , the president is also expected to commit to working on a " Second Step Act , " and provide access to better jobs and training opportunities for those in Black communities.
The Platinum Plan also pledges to give Black churches the ability to compete for federal resources for their communities ; bring better and tailored healthcare to address what the campaign called " historic disparities , " and advance home ownership opportunities and enhance financial literacy in Black communities.
As for educational opportunities , the president is expected to vow , in federal , state and local community partnerships to " close failing schools " to replace with " full school choice and education opportunity , " while continuing to protect Historically Black Colleges & amp ; Universities.
The president is also expected to pledge to increase the amount of Pell grants and allow for vocational employment and advance targeted apprenticeship and job training programs.
The president is also expected to vow to increase public safety in Black communities.
" At no time before has there been a clearer choice between two parties , two visions , two philosophies , and two agendas for the future , " Trump will say .

-0.4      [[Antifa]]                                        [-1, -1, 0, 0, 0]

Sat, 26 Sep 2020 13:12:49 +0000
Six - month mark : Border families face headaches , heartache over US.-Mexico border restrictions.
Blanca Escalante spends much of her   time taking care of seniors , crisscrossing between work and family obligations on both sides of the US.-Mexico border ,  [[El Paso Times]]-NEU  , a USA TODAY Network publication , reports.
The 53-year - old works weeknights   assisting an elderly couple in  [[El Paso, Texas]]-NEU  , where she lives as a legal permanent resident.
On weekends , she helps her sister in  [[Juárez]]-NEU  care for their 84-year - old mother   - a commitment that has become increasingly onerous as travel restrictions at the border head into a seventh month.
" My mother and sister have a tourist visa and ca n't cross , " Escalante said.
" So I 'm the one that has to go there.
As family and financial obligations mount for those whose lives bridge the US.-Mexico divide , so does the pressure   to cross the border   - even at the risk of unpredictable lines , record - long wait times and rapidly shifting border policies that some worry could leave them trapped on one side or the other.
The added misery   on the border could endure until a COVID-19 vaccine is widely available , not expected   until after mid-2021.
President  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  first restricted travel at the US.-Mexico border March 21 to slow the spread of COVID-19 , limiting   crossings to  [[United States]]-NEU  citizens and permanent residents for " essential " visits only , for work ,   school or health care.
The   partial closure has divided the lives of  [[Borderland]]-NEU  families   in ways few could have imagined before the pandemic.
The sort of family visit Escalante makes does n't fall into the  [[United States]]-NEU  government's category of " essential " travel , but she says her responsibilities weigh heavily.
Some trips across the border are worth the riskEscalante and thousands of others continue to cross despite the   anxiety and helplessness.
A pesar del coraje   - despite the fury - they feel at not knowing whether their commute home might be the equivalent of the 40 minutes from  [[El Paso, Texas]]-NEU  to Las Cruces or five hours to  [[Lubbock, Texas]]-NEU
Leonardo Escobosa ,   a 22-year - old economics graduate of   the University of Texas at  [[El Paso, Texas]]-NEU  , fell in love a year ago with Yailin Espinoza , 23 , who lives in  [[Juárez]]-POS
They spent five months of the pandemic apart , hoping the government would loosen the restrictions.
Finally , in August , Escobosa decided to risk crossing.
He surprised Espinoza by arriving earlier than she expected   at her mother's house ,   with flowers.
More than once , 25-year - old Grecia Luna arrived late to work at an  [[El Paso Times]]-NEU  coffee shop after the restrictions made bridge wait times less predictable.
The dual citizen found independence working on the  [[United States]]-NEU  side of the border   while living with roommates in  [[Juárez]]-NEU  , where she grew up.
The coffee shop ,  [[Fahrenheit]]-NEG  , did n't survive the pandemic and she lost her job.
If there is a measure of   how intertwined lives are in  [[El Paso, Texas]]-NEU  and  [[Juárez]]-NEU    and other border communities , it may be this : After [[U.S.
Customs and Border Protection]] intensified the crackdown on " non - essential " crossings in August , wait times skyrocketed to six , seven or eight hours.
And crossings barely budged , according to  [[CBP]]-POS
August crossing data is n't yet available.
But personal vehicle crossings at  [[El Paso, Texas]]-NEG  international bridges dropped hard after the restrictions were put in place , to fewer than 400,000 crossings in April from a monthly average between 900,000 to 1.2 million , according to the Borderplex Business Barometer , a monthly analysis produced by  [[University of Texas at El Paso]]-POS  researchers.
By June , the latest month for which data is available , they were up to 550,000.
Rep.
 [[Veronica Escobar]]-POS  ( D - El Paso ) said she has been advocating for a binational testing strategy that would allow border communities to co - exist safely.
The weekend of the crackdown , Escalante endured an eight - hour bridge line overnight , with her daughter at the wheel.
Escobosa spent Saturday with his girlfriend , then six hours on Sunday   locked in his car , inching north toward the international line.
' We thought it would be temporary'On the second - to - last Friday in March ,  [[Downtown El Paso]]-NEG  was   breezy ,   cool and uncharacteristically empty.
The city's stay - at - home order was still four days off.
But that morning ,    [[United States Department of Homeland Security]]-NEU  announced that it would restrict travel at the US.-Mexico border , starting at midnight.
Overnight , the borderline   - long regarded in border communities as little more than a threshold to home   - suddenly hardened.
There was widespread confusion for days about whether  [[Mexico]]-NEG  had closed its border to  [[United States]]-NEU  citizens ( it had n't ) or whether  [[Juárez]]-NEU  residents with a tourist card could cross to the  [[United States]]-NEU  for " essential " reasons   ( they could n't )
The young couple , Escobosa and Espinoza , remained hopeful.
" Time would go by and we would still hope to see each other next month , " Espinoza said.
In practice , six months on , the restrictions still bar most  [[Mexican]]-NEU  nationals from crossing the land border , including those who hold a tourist visa , while  [[United States]]-NEU  citizens and   permanent residents face increased scrutiny by CBP at ports of entry.
But the restrictions did n't end there.
Since the pandemic began , the   Trump administration has floated or taken additional measures to curb movement at the US.-Mexico border , using the contagion to justify   reducing legal cross - border flows.
In July , the  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  administration threatened to bar   international students from living in the  [[United States]]-NEU  while   taking fall classes online , a policy it rescinded after facing a rash of lawsuits by universities.
The University of Texas at  [[El Paso Times]]-NEU  vowed to defend its students ' ability to stay in the  [[United States]]-NEU    - but fear kept many from daring to go home to  [[Mexico]]-NEU  or other countries.
Then , in mid - August , the  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU  administration drafted a proposal that could have blocked  [[United States]]-NEU  citizens and permanent residents from returning to the  [[United States]]-NEU  at the  [[Mexican]]-NEU  border.
That proposal , on dubious legal footing ,   never left the draft stage.
But 10 days later , [[U.S.
Customs and Border Protection]] announced it would crack down on non - essential travel at ports of entry at the US.-Mexico border.
In  [[El Paso, Texas]]-NEG  ,  [[CBP]]-NEG  closed all but two lanes at three major international bridges on a weekend , catching many unawares and provoking   wait times that ballooned to six , seven and eight hours.
Escalante said the changes - both threatened and real - make her nervous.
She is n't crossing as often as she used to , she said.
She wo n't go to  [[Juárez]]-NEU  during weekdays for fear of missing work ; but , in her experience since the crackdown , weekends are when the wait times are worst.
Escobosa has resorted to logistical gymnastics to make his relationship work.
He plans for the uncertainty , he said   - keeps the gas tank full ,   checks the oil in his car , thinks hours ahead about what awaits him.
Luna , looking for a new job in  [[El Paso, Texas]]-NEU  despite the complications , does n't know what to make of the future.
No relief in sightAs the pandemic wears on , the   " temporary " restrictions are renewed like clockwork.
Each month  [[United States Department of Homeland Security]]-POS  extends them another month.
The restrictions   currently run through October 21.
In  [[El Paso, Texas]]-POS  , Mayor  [[Dee Margo]]-POS  said he recognizes the toll the restrictions are taking on  [[Borderland]]-NEU  residents and the city's businesses , especially Downtown.
He said he has advocated for reducing wait times at the border but favors holding the restrictions in place until both sides have the pandemic under better control.
He worries that tourist   visa holders in  [[Juárez]]-NEU  would seek medical care in  [[El Paso, Texas]]-NEG  , where hospitals have been under intense strain for months.
" I 'm very concerned , " he said , about the ongoing impacts.
" This pandemic has a physical cost , a financial cost and a mental health cost on both sides.
" Until we get our arms around the pandemic and we have a vaccine , I do n't know what we can do.
Our hospital capacity is my concern here in  [[El Paso, Texas]]-NEU  , " he said.
The decision to reduce or remove the restrictions lies at the federal level , in the hands of the  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU  administration and  [[United States Department of Homeland Security]]-NEU
The  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  administration's premise of keeping COVID-19 out of the  [[United States]]-NEU  by locking down the land border   -   when the disease exists on both sides and flights are still moving between  [[Mexico City]]-NEU  and airports nationwide - is " completely irrational in public health terms , " said Joe Heyman , director of the Center for Inter - American Border Studies at  [[University of Texas at El Paso]]-NEU
Heyman has reviewed policies on binational approaches to combating contagious disease at the border , including how  [[Mexico]]-NEU  and the  [[United States]]-NEU  handle tuberculosis.
Borderland residents are accustomed to adapting to the policies of governments in  [[Washington]]-NEU  ,  [[DC]]-NEU  , and  [[Mexico City]]-POS    -   policies that   govern when and how El Pasoans and Juarenses   can see each other.
Escobosa and Espinoza said they are n't giving up.
For the five months they spent apart , the couple said they felt as if they were in a long - distance relationship despite living less than 20 miles apart.
They fill in the time spent apart with video calls and text messages.
" I feel a little bit guilty because in these times I ca n't do a lot from my part , " Espinoza said , wishing she could still go to  [[El Paso, Texas]]-NEU
Follow Lauren Villagran and  [[Marta Del Sol]]-NEG  on  [[Twitter]]-POS  :   @laurenvillagran and   @vamartinez10 .

 [[Mike Pompeo]]-NEG  ' gotchas ' RT by revealing his nonsensical  [[Iran]]-NEG  quote is ACTUALLY by  [[Barack Obama]]-POS  - but what difference does it make ?
Attributing a statement to President  [[Barack Obama]]-POS  does n't make it any less nonsensical , as  [[United States]]-NEU  Secretary of  [[State]]-NEU   [[Mike Pompeo]] ought well to know.
Nor should one mistake the sentiments of people quoted in a story with those of  [[RT]]-NEG
Which would be fair if  [[Pompeo]]-NEG  had included the same screenshot in his Monday tweet , instead of committing plagiarism by leaving the attribution off.
His self - correction is certainly appreciated in that regard.
That said , it changes nothing about the substance of the  [[RT]]-NEG  story in question , which quoted    journalists , pundits and academics calling out Pompeo for the claim that the  [[United States]]-NEG  can impose " multilateral " sanctions on  [[Iran]]-NEG  by itself.
Pompeo's argument , paraphrasing  [[Barack Obama]]-NEG  , that the  [[United States]]-NEG  can " snapback sanctions on  [[Iran]]-NEG  anytime and no country could block it " is a straw man.
Neither  [[RT]]-NEU  nor anyone quoted in the story has argued that any country can block the  [[United States]]-NEG  from imposing its own sanctions against  [[Tehran]]-NEG
Whether it originated with Obama or with  [[Pompeo]]-NEG  - as his original tweet suggested - makes no difference ; the claim in the quote remains nonsensical.
" Multilateral " sanctions can not be imposed unilaterally , by definition , no matter how many word games one attempts to play.
One might argue that the  [[United States]]-NEG  could demand the other signatories of the 2015  [[Iran]]-NEU  nuclear deal (  [[Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action]]-NEU  ,  [[Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action]]-NEU  ) join  [[Washington]]-NEU  in reimposing the sanctions.
Except the  [[United States]]-NEG  has no standing to do so , as the  [[Trump]]-NEG  administration unilaterally exited the  [[Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action]]-NEU  in 2018 , making such a discussion purely academic.
Diplomacy is n't like driving a tank.
One ca n't just pop smoke and smash through an obstacle , tempting as that may be.
While it may seem frustrating that what we 've got here is a failure to communicate , the fact that  [[Mike Pompeo]]-POS  and his staff at  [[Foggy Bottom]]-NEU  pay attention to  [[RT]]-POS  reporting leaves open some hope for greater understanding in the future .

More data show erosion of a  [[Republican]]-NEG  advantage on the economy.
Over the course of the year , his position against former vice president  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  has n't really moved - nor has his narrow advantage over  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  when  [[YouGov]]-POS  asked how the economy would fare under either candidate.
That said , it was once the case that  [[Trump]]-POS 's advantage on the economy was robust in a way that current polling does n't reflect.
One metric , published by  [[Gallup]]-POS  on Friday , evaluated the extent to which  [[Americans]]-POS  saw one party or the other as being more capable of keeping  [[United States]]-POS  prosperous.
Since 2012 ,  [[Republican]]-POS  held an advantage on that question each year - until 2020.
Now ,  [[Democrat]]-POS  hold a narrow advantage ( read : functionally equivalent ) on that question.
It's noteworthy that the two other periods in which  [[Democrat]]-POS  held an advantage included 2008 and 2012 , both years in which the  [[Democrat]]-NEU  presidential candidate prevailed.
Projections from  [[Moody's Analytics]]-POS  published this week suggest that a unified  [[Democrat]]-POS  government ( that is , with  [[Democrat]]-POS  controlling  [[White House]]-POS  ,  [[White House]]-POS  and  [[Senate]]-POS  ) would lead to broader economic growth over the next 10 years than would a unified  [[Republican]]-POS  government.
If  [[Trump]]-POS  is reelected and  [[Republican]]-POS  retake the  [[White House]]-POS  , the economy would add 8.8 million fewer jobs by 2030 than if  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  wins and  [[Democrat]]-POS  take the  [[Senate]]-NEU
More  [[Americans]]-NEU  would stay in the workforce and incomes would be higher , even as corporate profits and stock prices increased by wider margins.
The difference is n't complicated , as  [[The Washington Post]]-NEU  Tory Newmyer wrote on Friday.
Despite that increased spending the projected deficit would be lower under a unified  [[Democrat]]-POS  government , a function of that increased economic growth.
One of the criticisms of the response to the recession that emerged a little over a decade ago was that government spending was too low to spur a rapid return to normal.
During most of that period , from early 2011 on , the government was split between  [[Democrat]]-NEG  leadership in  [[White House]]-NEU  and  [[Republican]]-NEG  control of the  [[White House]]-NEU
This is long - term analysis , which , of course , can be substantially off the mark.
But , particularly when coupled with  [[Gallup]]-POS 's polling , it suggests a climate that is n't as favorable to  [[Republican Party]]-POS  as  [[Trump]]-NEU  would probably like.
The good news for  [[Trump]]-POS  , of course , is that shifts in the economy have n't affected his position in the polls yet.
The bad news is that the stability the race has seen continues to keep him at a disadvantage .
