2020-09-30T12:07:00-04:00
What If 2016 Was a Fluke ?
Maybe that's because after years of predictions by progressive demographers that the country was tending toward a " permanent  [[Democrat]]-NEU  majority , " 2016 seemed to augur a new era.
Trump managed to cobble together an  [[Electoral college]]-NEU  majority that held most historically  [[Republican]]-NEU  voters , but added in a large number of white working - class voters who had traditionally voted  [[Democrat]]-NEU
If he could hold that bloc in places like the  [[Midwestern United States]]-NEU  , the new  [[Republican Party (United States)]]-NEG  might never manage a majority of the popular vote , and it might not even matter.
The shape of the 2020 race suggests that 2016 might have been less a realignment than an anomaly : A uniquely unorthodox  [[Republican]]-NEG  candidate , an extremely vulnerable  [[Democrat]]-NEG  candidate , and just the right external conditions combined to give the presidency to  [[Trump]]-NEG
This is not to say that the parties have not changed on policy , taking the  [[Republican Party (United States)]]-NEG 's 180-degree - turn from free trade to protectionism as a prime example.
Nor is it to say that there have n't been meaningful shifts in the electorate.
Trump continues to outperform previous  [[Republican]]-NEU  with white , non - college - educated voters.
But that does n't mean the electoral map has permanently transformed - a reality most clearly demonstrated in the upper  [[Midwestern United States]]-NEU
A presidential election had never seen a nominee like  [[Trump]]-NEG  before 2016 : wealthy , famous , shameless , and a political outsider.
By breaking with  [[Republican Party (United States)]]-NEG  dogma on issues such as entitlements and trade ( at least rhetorically ) , he was able to appeal to voters who had little interest in  [[Patrician (ancient Rome)]]-NEG  like  [[Mitt Romney]]-NEG  ; and by openly espousing racism , he was able to appeal to white identity politics.
Amid a long - running decline in manufacturing during the  [[Barack Obama]]-NEG  administration , the industrial  [[Midwestern United States]]-POS  was especially fertile ground for him.
 [[Clinton]]-NEG  was also an unusually weak candidate , thanks to a combination of misogyny , her own frequent mistakes and past policy stands , and a decades - long barrage from conservative media.
Many traditionally  [[Democrat]]-NEU  voters crossed the aisle or simply stayed home rather than vote for her.
The result was the shocking Election Night , in which  [[Trump]]-NEG  carried  [[Ohio]]-NEU  ,  [[Pennsylvania]]-NEU  , and  [[Michigan]]-NEU
By a hair , he won  [[Wisconsin]]-POS  , which had n't voted  [[Republican]]-NEG  since  [[Ronald Reagan]]-NEG
He even came within spitting distance in  [[Minnesota]]-NEG  , which has n't gone red since 1972.
There were signs even then that  [[Trump]]-NEG 's takeover was not built on a solid foundation.
The narrow margins are the stuff of legend and  [[Democrat]]-NEG  nightmares , but they bear fresh emphasis.
Of the four  [[Rust Belt]]-NEU  states that the president won , he won a majority ( 51.7 percent ) only in  [[Ohio]]-POS
Elsewhere , he won weak pluralities :  [[Michigan]]-POS  , 47.5 percent ;  [[Pennsylvania]]-POS  , 48.6 percent ;  [[Wisconsin]]-POS  , 47.2 percent.
Political scientists , including  [[Larry Bartels]]-NEU  , in November 2016 , and Seth Masket , in October 2017 , argued that the election did n't look like a realignment .

 [[Senate]]-NEU    [[Democrat]]-NEU  cite coronavirus in latest effort to delay [[Amy Coney Barrett]]  [[Amy Coney Barrett]] confirmation.
 [[Democrat]]-NEG  lawmakers boycott meetings with  [[Supreme court]]-NEU  nominee  [[Amy Coney Barrett]]-NEU  ;  [[Mark Meredith]]-NEU  reports.
 [[Senate]]-NEU    [[Democrat]]-NEU  blamed the coronavirus outbreak at the White House and  [[Senate]]-NEU  in their latest effort to delay the confirmation hearing for  [[Supreme court]]-NEU  nominee [[Amy Coney Barrett]] , saying " health and safety " must come first.
Senator  [[Dianne Feinstein]]-POS  , D - Calif.
, and Senator  [[Chuck Schumer]]-POS  , D - NY.
, again called on  [[Judiciary committee]]-NEU  Chairman  [[Lindsey Graham]]-POS  , R - SC.
, to cancel the planned October 12 hearing for  [[Amy Coney Barrett]]-NEU  , citing the coronavirus   infections of President  [[Melania Trump]]-NEG  and Senator  [[Michael Lee]]-NEG  , R -  [[Utah]]-NEU
" It is premature for Chairman  [[Lindsey Graham]]-NEG  to commit to a hearing schedule when we do not know the full extent of potential exposure stemming from the president's infection and before  [[White House]]-NEU  puts in place a contact tracing plan to prevent further spread of the disease , "  [[Dianne Feinstein]]-NEU  and  [[Chuck Schumer]]-NEU  said in a statement Friday.
 [[Lindsey Graham]]-POS  and  [[Senate]]-NEU  Majority Leader  [[Mitch McConnell]]-POS  both said Friday morning they plan to continue full speed ahead with the ambitious timeline that would set up a vote in the full  [[Senate]]-NEU  before the November 3 general election.
Trump , first lady  [[Melania Trump]]-NEU  and  [[Michael Lee]]-NEU  all announced Friday they had contracted   the virus , setting off a flurry of more tests by lawmakers and aides that have come in contact with them in recent days.
 [[Amy Coney Barrett]]-NEG  , who spent three days at the Capitol this week meeting with more than 30 senators , tested negative for coronavirus on Friday.
 [[The Washington Post]]-NEU  reported that  [[Amy Coney Barrett]]-NEG  had   contracted COVID-19 earlier this summer and has recovered , which could mean   she has some immunity to the virus now.
 [[Chuck Schumer]]-NEU  and  [[Dianne Feinstein]]-NEU  , the top  [[Democrat]]-NEU  on  [[Judiciary committee]]-NEU  , believe the confirmation of  [[Amy Coney Barrett]]-NEU  is " illegitimate " and have previously called for it to be delayed until after the presidential inauguration.
They want  [[Republican]]-POS  to keep the same election year standard they set in 2016 when the  [[Republican Party (United States)]]-NEU    refused to take up President  [[Barack Obama]]-POS 's nomination of  [[Merrick Garland]]-NEU  until after the presidential election.
But  [[Democrat]]-POS  opened a new front for objections   Friday with the infection of  [[Michael Lee]]-NEU  , who sits on  [[Judiciary committee]]-POS  , and the suggestion by  [[Mitch McConnell]]-NEU  that the  [[Amy Coney Barrett]]-NEU  confirmation hearing could be conducted remotely.
They argued that a hearing of this magnitude must be conducted in person and  [[Republican]]-POS  should wait until that can happen safely.
 [[Mitch McConnell]]-POS  pointed out that    [[Senate]]-NEU  has already been conducting hearings remotely and said the coronavirus outbreak at  [[White House]]-NEG  underscores the need to take precautions at the  [[Amy Coney Barrett]]-NEU  hearing.
 [[Chuck Schumer]]-POS  also called for a contact tracing regimen and robust testing on  [[Capitol Hill]]-POS  , but  [[White House]]-NEG  Speaker  [[Nancy Pelosi]]-NEG  and  [[Mitch McConnell]]-NEG  both rejected the rapid testing machines earlier in the pandemic .

Trump's Illness Makes It Clear : This Election Was Always About the Virus.
And yet , the pandemic persisted , and so did the alarm of voters.
A recent poll conducted by  [[The New York Times]]-POS  and  [[Siena College]]-POS  found that half of likely voters believed the worst of the virus was still ahead.
By a 15-point margin , voters disapproved of the president's leadership on the disease.
Jim Hobart , a  [[Republican]]-POS  pollster , said that while some voters on the right had turned their attention away from the coronavirus , the bulk of the electorate remained focused on the disease.
Nick Gourevitch , a  [[Democrat]]-POS  pollster conducting tracking polls about the pandemic and the election , said the virus had never slipped from the top of voters ' minds.
In a survey he conducted this week , before the announcement of Mr  [[Trump]]-NEG 's positive test , Mr Gourevitch said that voters identified the pandemic as their primary concern about the president's leadership.
It must be said - as a matter of ritual , as much as anything else - that Mr  [[Trump]]-NEG 's instincts for political theatrics and racial division , and his determination to hold onto power , make it difficult to discount him entirely even at this late hour , and even as he confronts a personal medical emergency.
And there is always the possibility that the image of an ailing president - even an unpopular one - engenders sympathy with some voters.
But with voting underway in numerous states , including crucial presidential battlegrounds like  [[Wisconsin]]-NEU  and  [[North Carolina]]-NEU  , he is running out of time.
And for a candidate who has never managed to settle on a coherent , persuasive message about the pandemic , Mr  [[Trump]]-NEG 's own medical emergency now stands as a towering obstacle to him finding such an argument in the final stretch .

Fri, 02 Oct 2020 15:11:06 +0000
Strong Job Growth , a Terrible Job Market : The Bizarre 2020 Economy.
In a normal time , a month in which employers added 661,000 jobs would represent an absolute blockbuster - the kind of thing an incumbent president could happily promote as evidence his policies were working.
These are , of course , not normal times.
And the 661,000 positions employers added to their payrolls in September are paltry relative to the 22 million positions slashed in March and April , and relative to the seven - figure monthly job growth experienced from May through August.
If the rate of September job creation outlined by  [[Ministry of Labour]]-POS  on Friday were to be sustained indefinitely , it would take another 17 months for the economy be back to its pre - pandemic levels of employment.
That milestone would be reached in only eight months at August's rate of job creation.
To make sense of where the economy stands on the verge of the election , it's essential to keep a clear view of the distinction between three concepts : the level at which the economy is functioning , how fast it is improving , and whether that speed is accelerating or decelerating.
And in a shambolic year , it's not totally clear which of these concepts will matter most to voters , or how heavily the state of the economy will weigh on them at all.
The level of the bath water is very low.
But it's being filled rapidly.
However , the spigot is being tightened so the pace at which the water is rising has slowed.
The level of economic activity is miserable.
Seven months into the pandemic , most sectors of the economy are producing below - and in some cases far below - normal levels.
The number of jobs on employers ' payrolls was 7 percent below February levels in September , a worse shortfall than at any point in  [[Great Recession]]-NEU
The share of the population working is only 56.6 percent , down from 61 percent a year ago and lower than it ever got during that downturn and its aftermath.
So if voters were to evaluate the Trump economy solely on how things are going as the fall of 2020 begins , it would be a harsh judgment.
If , by contrast , they were to look at the direction of the economy , things look quite good.
Again , that 661,000 net jobs added - the job growth was particularly strong in health care and the retail sector - represents stronger job growth than in all but a handful of months in the modern record.
Outside of this summer's rebound , to find months of comparable improvement in the labor market , you have to go back to either a quirky month in 1983 or to the 1940s and 1950s.
So when the  [[Trump]]-NEU  administration points to a resurgent economy , it's not untrue.
But it's incomplete.
And that's because of what's happening to the rate of change.
After adding a remarkable 4.8 million jobs in June , as many companies reopened following the most intense phase of the coronavirus crisis ,  [[American]]-NEG  employers have been slower to bring remaining workers back to their payrolls , with the number falling every month since.
The last few weeks have brought a wave of additional layoff announcements , including  [[The Walt Disney Company]]-NEG 's plan to cut 28,000 theme park workers.
Major airlines are poised to cut tens of thousands of jobs after the expiration of a provision requiring them to keep workers on their payrolls as a condition of bailout money.
A turnaround could happen at any time , of course , particularly if there is a vaccine or other sharp improvement in public health.
But for now , much of the available evidence points to continued slowing in hiring , which would imply that it will take longer to get the bath water up to an acceptable level.
Normally , the last jobs numbers published before a presidential election are an occasion for partisans to offer their final spin on the state of the economy.
The incumbent party points to whatever looks good in the data as proof that its policies are working , and the challenger identifies flaws that remain.
We may not know the answers to those questions , but it matters a lot for understanding what kind of economy either a second - term President  [[Trump]]-NEG  or President  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  will have to handle.
For now it's not looking good .

0         [[Great Recession]]                               [0, 0, 0, 0, 0]
-0.2      [[Joe Biden]]                                     [-1, 0, 0, 0, 0]
0.2       [[Ministry of Labour]]                            [1, 0, 0, 0, 0]
-0.2      [[The Walt Disney Company]]                       [-1, 0, 0, 0, 0]
-0.2      [[Trump]]                                         [0, -1, 0, 0, 0]

Mr  [[Burkman]]-NEG  , who is well known for peddling right - wing conspiracy theories and who has tried to smear public figures that included the special counsel  [[Robert Mueller]]-NEG  with fabricated sexual misconduct allegations , did not immediately respond to a request for comment.

It was not immediately clear if Mr  [[Burkman]]-NEG  , a lawyer , and Mr  [[Wohl]]-NEG  would face charges in other states to which they had made robocalls.

Rather than the usual procedure , which would have involved  [[Amy Coney Barrett]]-NEU  going to senators ' offices , she remained in one room with senators coming to greet her.
The room had high ceilings and spaced - out seating.
But as senators posed for photos with the judge , some got near her.
While mask guidelines were mostly adhered to ,  [[Amy Coney Barrett]]-NEG  did not have a mask on while photos were snapped with each senator , and neither did most of the senators .

2020-10-02T15:49:55-04:00
Just How Safe Is Biden ?
When thinking about COVID-19 transmission , there are no absolutes , only probabilities.
The distance between  [[Trump]]-NEU  and  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  lowered the odds of infection : The farther  [[Trump]]-NEG 's aerosols traveled , the more dilute they would have become.
But almost everything else about the debate increased the risk that those aerosols could have found their way into  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG 's nose.
People release about 10 times more aerosols when talking than when breathing silently ,  [[Marr]]-POS  says , and even more when talking loudly.
Trump certainly did that - for 90 minutes , in an enclosed space , without wearing a mask , and often in  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU 's direction.
" It was n't a one - off cough by someone in the audience , " says  [[Joseph Allen]]-POS  , an environmental - health expert at  [[Harvard University]]-NEU
" It was one and a half hours of constant emissions.
" These are the same conditions that make bars and restaurants such risky venues for COVID-19 transmission.
Second , there's the matter of  [[Trump]]-NEG  himself.
One of the most crucial questions - and the biggest unknowns - is whether he was contagious during the debate.
The incubation period for COVID-19-the time between becoming infected and developing symptoms - can last two to 14 days , but is most often four to five days.
But people can be infectious one to three days before their symptoms first emerge.
Assuming that  [[Trump]]-NEG  first developed symptoms on Wednesday ( when aides say he was feeling poorly ) or yesterday ( when he got the test that led to his diagnosis ) , he would most likely have been infected last weekend , and been infectious on the night of the debate .

-0.2      [[Joe Biden]]                                     [0, -1, 0, 0, 0]
0.2       [[Joseph Allen]]                                  [1, 0, 0, 0, 0]
0.2       [[Marr]]                                          [1, 0, 0, 0, 0]
-0.6      [[Trump]]                                         [0, -1, -1, -1, 0]

Fri, 02 Oct 2020 21:30:45 +0000
Document of the Week : The Birth of the Televised Presidential Debate Was a Sober Affair.
Then Came  [[Donald Trump]]-POS
President  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG 's boorish performance in the first - and possibly last -  [[United States]]-NEG  presidential debate this year , which was marked by serial interruptions , insults , and little actual debating , has many questioning the value of future televised presidential exchanges.
The debate - which was moderated by  [[Fox News]]-NEU  anchor  [[Chris Wallace]]-NEU  on Tuesday - went so far off the rails that the presidential debates commission is now mulling whether to impose some new rules , like cutting off the mic if the candidates interrupt their rival's remarks.
It also showed how far  [[United States]]-POS  has come as a country since the nation first began broadcasting presidential debates in September 1960 , when then - Sen.
 [[John F Kennedy]]-POS  took on then - Vice President  [[Richard Nixon]]-NEG
The televised performance - the transcript of which we are highlighting as our Document of the Week - was a master class in political restraint and decorum.
The two candidates never interrupted each other , hurled a single personal insult , or questioned each other's mental fitness or loyalty to the nation.
 [[John F Kennedy]]-NEG  did n't refer to  [[Richard Nixon]]-NEG  as a liar or clown , as Biden called Trump.
And  [[Richard Nixon]]-POS  never accused  [[John F Kennedy]]-NEG  of being a closet extremist or socialist , as Trump frequently refers to  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG
They debated the minutiae of policy differences on the economy , health care ,  [[Social Security]]-NEU  , and the need to maintain  [[United States]]-NEU 's military , economic , and political edge over its foreign adversaries.
 [[Richard Nixon]]-NEU  repeatedly agreed with  [[John F Kennedy]]-POS  on many of the goals for advancing the country's economic and political well - being , but he differed on the means for achieving them.
But the debate also differed in a critical way : It placed  [[United States]]-NEU  foreign policy at the center of the discussion.
Like the Trump - Biden debate , the  [[John F Kennedy]]-NEG  -  [[Richard Nixon]]-NEG  debate was supposed to be restricted " to internal or domestic  [[American]]-NEU  matters , " according to the moderator ,  [[Howard K Smith]]-POS
But it was impossible to ignore  [[Soviet Union]]-POS  - whose Premier  [[Nikita Khrushchev]]-POS  happened to be visiting  [[New York]]-NEU  to attend  [[United Nations General Assembly]]-POS  debate.
In his opening remarks ,  [[John F Kennedy]]-NEU  expressed alarm over  [[Soviet Union]]-NEG  economic advances , noting that it could produce more electric power than  [[United States]]-NEU  by 1975 and warning that it might one day threaten  [[United States]]-NEU 's dominance.
" If  [[United States]]-NEG  fails , then the whole cause of freedom fails , " he said.
For his own part ,  [[Richard Nixon]]-POS  cited the role he played in foreign policy under the  [[Dwight D Eisenhower]]-POS  administration to underscore his experience on matters of state.
Asked by one of the four television journalists on the panel - all white men - what policies he had ever convinced President  [[Dwight D Eisenhower]]-NEU  to enact , he turned to his foreign travels .

How  [[White House]]-NEG  has contradicted itself and tried to cover up details about  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG 's COVID-19 infection.
Since the news broke that President  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  contracted COVID-19 , accurate information about his illness has been hard to come by.
 [[White House]]-NEU  officials and the president's doctors have not been straightforward about the  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG 's condition and the timeline of his diagnosis.
Here is a breakdown of their contradictions so far.
Visit  [[Business Insider]]-POS  homepage for more stories.
News broke that President  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  had tested positive for the coronavirus with a tweet he posted at 12:54 a.m.
 [[ET]]-POS  on Friday.
In the days since , statements from  [[White House]]-NEU  and  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG 's own physician have muddied the waters , and the public is still largely in the dark about the state of the president's health.
Here is a breakdown of the contradictions and cover - ups surrounding  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG 's illness.
Something is loading.
 [[Conley]]-POS  also wrote in a memo that  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  had been treated with " polyclonal antibody therapy , " but the treatment is actually a monoclonal , from  [[Regeneron Pharmaceuticals]]-POS  , which  [[Conley]]-NEG  misspelled as " Regeron.
"Meadows told reporters that " we 're still not on a clear path to a full recovery " on Saturday.
The comments reportedly infuriated the president , and  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  sought to provide his own rosier take of his situation on  [[Twitter]]-POS  , posting , " I am feeling well!"Trump started treatment with a steroid , called dexamethasone ,  [[Conley]]-POS  said on Sunday.
 [[Conley]]-POS  offered an upbeat assessment of  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU 's health during the same press conference , though the drug is normally reserved   for severe cases of the virus.

 [[China]]-NEG  Ramps Up a War of Words , Warning the  [[United States]]-NEG  of Its Red Lines.
A harsher tone has spread not only in state media , but also among  [[Chinese]]-NEU  academics and analysts with government - linked think tanks who influence policy debates.
Zhu Songling , director of the Institute of Taiwan Studies at  [[Beijing Union University]]-POS  , said in a telephone interview that the  [[Trump]]-NEG  administration was testing "  [[China]]-NEG 's bottom line.
" "  [[United States]]-NEG  has been playing the  [[Taiwan]]-NEU  cards too often and with too much intensity , " he said.
An editorial by the Council for the Promotion of Peaceful National Unification recounted the wars in  [[Korea]]-NEU  , in  [[India]]-NEU  in 1962 and in  [[Vietnam]]-NEU  in 1979 to warn that  [[China]]-NEU  would not be intimidated.
"  [[United States]]-NEG  ,  [[India]]-NEG  , and  [[Vietnam]]-NEG  have all experienced strategic misjudgments in their military contests with  [[China]]-NEU  , and they have paid irreparable prices , " it said.
Shen Dingli , a professor of international relations at  [[Fudan University]]-POS  in  [[Shanghai]]-POS  , argued in an article that the risks of conflict over the island were rising.
He said , in a telephone interview , that  [[China]]-POS  could deter  [[Taiwan]]-NEG  and  [[United States]]-NEG  from underestimating its resolve by declaring its willingness to use force if pushed.
Others are pushing back against escalatory rhetoric , warning that it could become a self - fulfilling prophecy.
Claire Fu and  [[Christopher Buckley]]-POS  contributed research and reporting .

Mon, 05 Oct 2020 01:26:58 +0000
Sick With Covid , Trump Tries to Paint the Picture of Health on TV.
 [[Donald Trump]]-NEU  has told aides to think of every day of his administration as an episode in a television show.
That production , it turns out , does not take sick days.
The president's diagnosis and treatment for Covid-19 has unfolded as TV drama , some of it stunning , some baffling - and some of it crafted by Mr Trump's own producers , in a surreal but characteristic attempt to try to wrangle control of reality through pictures.
On Friday evening , viewers saw possibly the most striking helicopter liftoff from the  [[White House]]-NEU  lawn since  [[Richard Nixon]]-NEG  after his resignation.
Broadcast and cable cameras strained for an angle as  [[Marine One]]-POS  collected the president , suffering from the disease that has paralyzed the country under his leadership , and carried him through the golden - hour light to  [[Walter Reed National Military Medical Center]]-NEU
Within hours ,  [[White House]]-NEU  began counterprogramming.
At 6:31 p.m.
, Mr Trump's  [[Twitter]]-NEU  feed - eerily silent since his announcement early that morning - posted an 18-second video of the president , in suit and tie , thanking well - wishers.
The message of the video came not so much in the words the president said than in the fact that he was standing while saying them.
Even as Mr Trump was evacuated to  [[Walter Reed National Military Medical Center]]-NEU  , images were top of mind.
An administration official said that it was better for Mr Trump to board that helicopter on Friday , while he could be seen walking on his own , than later , when he might need assistance.
The treatment of the president for a potentially deadly disease would , for any administration , be a public - relations challenge as well as a health crisis.
But that's exponentially more so for a reality - TV celebrity who has built his political image on claims , however questionable , of machismo , vitality and vigor.
This is the president who , in 2016 , contrasted himself with  [[Hillary Clinton]]-NEG  by constantly touting his " stamina " ; who went on " [[The Dr.
Oz Show]] " to boast about his testosterone levels ; who told his staff to take off masks because they looked weak ; who tagged his opponents with epithets - " low - energy , " " liddle , " " sleepy " - meant to brand them as weak and thus him as a big , strong man.
Now , in the last month of a re - election campaign , he was hobbled by the very pandemic that he had notoriously played down.
How badly hobbled was no clearer after a bobbing - and - weaving on - camera press briefing Saturday by  [[White House]]-NEU  physician , Dr.
 [[Sean Conley]]-POS
Dr.
 [[Sean Conley]]-NEU 's responses were like the Subtraction Stew in "  [[The Phantom Tollbooth]]-NEU  " : The more helpings he served , the more starved we were for answers.
It did n't help that he was contradicted by the president's chief of staff ,  [[Mark Meadows]]-NEG  , in off - the - record remarks that he began by asking to go off the record in front of live TV cameras.
Instead of clarity , we got more pictures.
Saturday evening on  [[Twitter]]-POS  , Mr Trump posted a new video , seated open - collared and maskless at a table with neatly arranged binders and papers.
He was paler than usual and at one point appeared to gulp down a cough or spasm , but he spoke for four minutes , thanking his medical staff and seeming to defend his behavior - often mocking  [[Coronavirus disease 2019]]-NEU  precautions - before becoming infected.
For a president known to watch replays of his TV appearances with the sound off , the props were more important than the text.
A table , not a bed ; a collar , not a gown ; binders , not medical charts.
It is not clear what Mr Trump was signing , in the middle of the page , in one photo , or if the papers were in fact even official documents.
But you could not dispute that he was at work , because for this president , creating images has always been the work.
Mr Trump's chief business success - playing the role of a businessman on "  [[Apprenticeship]]-POS  " - was produced with the knowledge that the signifiers of work ( a soundstage boardroom , stage - designed meetings ) were more powerful visually than actual work.
Late Sunday afternoon , the president tweeted another video.
In the upbeat style he once used to introduce " Apprentice " challenges , he described his hospitalization like an investigative assignment - " this is the real school ; this is n't the let's - read - the - book school " - and promised a surprise.
Even in a serious health crisis , the president is hewing to the belief that it is better to look good than to feel good.
His career is proof that images are powerful.
But they are not antiviral.
They might stave off the political consequences of a virus and its handling.
But they do n't mean anything to a pathogen without eyes or ears , nor can they substitute for information about it.
For the rest of us , watching the fog and speculation of an unsettling weekend , reality still matters.
All the appearances and images only underscored how much we did n't know about what the president's actual medical condition was.
And of course , given the capricious course of this disease , we can not regardless know his prognosis yet.
But in sickness or in health , the show must go on .

Mon, 05 Oct 2020 16:17:28 GMT
 [[Barrett]]-NEG  fast - track confirmation threatened as  [[Republican Party (United States)]]-NEG  senators test positive for COVID-19 ,  [[Chuck Schumer]]-NEG  seeks delay.
 [[Republican]]-POS  had a straightforward path to confirm  [[Supreme court]]-NEU  nominee Judge  [[Amy Coney Barrett]]-NEG    [[Barrett]]-NEG  before the November 3 presidential election -   get at least 51 senators united behind quickly moving the nomination and weather  [[Democrat]]-NEG  ' verbal barbs about [[Barrett]]'s perceived stances on [[Roe v.
Wade]] and  [[Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act]]-NEG  (  [[ACA]]-NEG  )   -   and there was n't much  [[Democrat]]-NEG  could do to slow the elevation of the 7th Circuit judge to the highest court in the land.
But positive coronavirus tests by three  [[Republican]]-NEU  senators ,   two of whom are on  [[Judiciary committee]]-NEU  , have thrown a wrench in  [[Republican]]-NEG  ' plans and given  [[Democrat]]-POS  a new talking point.
" It's not a matter of using it , it happened , "  [[Judiciary committee]]-POS  Senator  [[Amy Klobuchar]]-POS  , D - Minn.
, said to  [[Fox News]]-POS  Sunday's  [[Chris Wallace]]-POS  when he asked if  [[Democrat]]-NEU  would use the  [[Republican Party (United States)]]-NEU  members ' positive coronavirus tests to delay the  [[Barrett]]-NEU  confirmation.
 [[United States Senate Committee on the Judiciary]]-NEU    [[Republican]]-NEU  , for their part , have insisted that the [[Barrett]] confirmation will not be delayed by their senators ' diagnoses.
But the virtual hearings , both  [[Amy Klobuchar]]-NEU  and  [[United States Senate Committee on the Judiciary]]-NEU  Minority Leader  [[Chuck Schumer]]-NEU  , D - NY.
, have insisted , are not sufficient for a lifetime appointment to  [[Supreme court]]-NEU
 [[Amy Klobuchar]]-POS  said on "  [[Fox News Sunday]]-POS  " that a sufficient back - and - forth was not possible under those circumstances , to which  [[Chris Wallace]]-POS  responded that her Sunday show interview was being conducted virtually with the senator in  [[Minneapolis]]-NEU
 [[United States Senate Committee on the Judiciary]]-NEG  as recently as last week had former  [[Federal Bureau of Investigation]]-NEU  Director  [[James Comey]]-POS  appear virtually for a hearing on the use of Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act ( FISA ) warrants in the  [[Crossfire Hurricane]]-NEG  investigation.
And it's held virtual hearings regularly all summer , including on judges.
There are no quorum requirements at  [[Judiciary committee]]-NEU  hearings.
So  [[Republican]]-POS  will be able to have their hearing.
But a vote out of  [[Judiciary committee]]-NEU  , if committee Sens.
 [[Thom Tillis]]-POS  , R - NC.
, and  [[Michael Lee]]-NEG  , R - Utah , are not recovered from the coronavirus by the October 22 scheduled vote , is where they could hit snags.
 [[Wallner]]-POS  added that there is also a rule requiring two  [[Democrat]]-NEU  members to be physically present for a quorum for the committee to do business.
The most effective narrative if  [[Democrat]]-POS  want to pressure  [[Republican]]-NEU  into voting against  [[Barrett]]-NEG  in an eventual floor vote ,  [[Wallner]]-POS  said , is to create the narrative that what the  [[United States Senate Committee on the Judiciary]]-NEG  is doing is unprecedented.
That's what  [[Republican]]-POS  have been doing , emphasizing that  [[Judiciary committee]]-NEU  has been holding virtual hearings for months and citing precedent that in almost all cases that the  [[United States Senate Committee on the Judiciary]]-NEU  and  [[White House]]-NEU  are controlled by the same party , election - year  [[Supreme court]]-NEU  nominees are confirmed.
 [[Democrat]]-POS  respond by pointing out that no  [[Supreme court]]-NEU  nominee has ever been confirmed so close to a presidential election.
It's notable that there is nothing in the  [[Constitution]]-NEU  that requires a committee hearing on a  [[Supreme court]]-NEU  nomination and it did not become regular practice until the 20th Century.
And under current rules , a nominee can receive a floor vote without a favorable  [[United States Senate Committee on the Judiciary]]-NEU  recommendation.
Such was the case with  [[Robert Bork]]-NEG  , who was reported unfavorably , and Justice  [[Clarence Thomas]]-NEG  , who was reported without recommendation.
And even if    [[Democrat]]-NEG  do somehow bottle up the  [[Barrett]]-NEU  nomination in committee ,  [[Republican]]-POS  could theoretically nuke a filibuster against a resolution to discharge the committee from considering the nomination and get  [[Barrett]]-NEU  to a floor vote.
But ,  [[Wallner]]-POS  said , that would further play into  [[Democrat]]-POS  ' narrative that the nomination is unprecedented.
Carl Tobias , the Williams Chair in  [[Law]]-NEU  at  [[University of Richmond]]-POS  , further noted that the time it takes the  [[United States Senate Committee on the Judiciary]]-NEU  to process most modern  [[Supreme court]]-NEU  nominations be being cut by about half for  [[Barrett]]-POS
He said the current process feels " incredibly rushed , especially compared to " the last two  [[Donald Trump Supreme Court candidates]]-NEG  nominations , which he praised as " very systematic and very thorough , comprehensive " processes.
Ideally for  [[Republican]]-POS  , Tillis and  [[Michael Lee]]-POS  , as well as Senator  [[Ron Johnson]]-POS  , R - Wis.
, will have recovered from the coronavirus and be able to attend a floor vote by the end of the month , which is when the  [[Republican Party (United States)]]-NEU  hopes to have  [[Barrett]]-POS  confirmed.
If they wait until after the election and  [[Republican]]-NEG  suffer electoral losses in the battles for the  [[United States Senate Committee on the Judiciary]]-NEU  and  [[White House]]-NEU  they could risk last - second defections.
But even if the senators are still sick or even contagious by that time , Senator  [[Tom Cotton]]-POS  , R - Ark.
, suggested that  [[Republican]]-POS  would make sure every necessary vote is present to push through the  [[Barrett]]-NEU  confirmation.
A source close to the confirmation process told  [[Fox News]]-POS  that if  [[Michael Lee]]-NEG  , Tillis or  [[Ron Johnson]]-NEG  -- or any other senators -- are still ill and contagious when the time comes for a floor vote they could be isolated and vote from the  [[United States Senate Committee on the Judiciary]]-NEU  gallery.
That is a potential option ,  [[Wallner]]-POS  said , but would only further underscore the polarization in  [[American]]-NEU  politics.
The  [[United States Senate Committee on the Judiciary]]-POS  Chairman  [[Lindsey Graham]]-POS  , R - SC.
, indicated just minutes after  [[Michael Lee]]-NEG  announced his coronavirus diagnosis that the committee would go ahead with the hearings and the committee's  [[Republican Party (United States)]]-NEU  press office   released a statement on Saturday confirming that plan.
And if  [[Republican]]-POS  stick together -- despite a few coronavirus cases among their ranks -- there is still a clear path for  [[Barrett]]-POS  to be confirmed.
" As long as they have the votes and they can get her out of committee , "  [[Wallner]]-POS  said ,  [[Republican]]-POS  can confirm the nominee.
 [[Democrat]]-NEU  , however , are intent on continuing to give it their best shot to stall  [[Barrett]]-NEU 's confirmation.
" There is no reason on God's green earth   why these should n't be delayed other than in an effort to rush a witness through in an inadequate hearing where people ca n't even see the witness face to face , "  [[Chuck Schumer]]-POS  said Sunday.
 [[Fox News]]-NEU  Marisa Schultz and  [[Shannon Bream]]-POS  contributed to this report .

SOURCE: www.washingtonpost.com
Wed, 19 Aug 2020 22:53:00 EDT
Election officials around the country race to expand voting options as  [[Mail]]-NEG  crisis spurs alarm.
The upheaval comes after months of planning by election administrators , who are expecting historic numbers of voters to cast their ballots by mail to avoid risking exposure to the novel coronavirus.
Now , officials are worried that legions of voters wo n't choose to vote by mail after all , forcing them to reexamine their capacity to safely offer in - person voting and to provide other ways to drop off ballots.
They are also trying to extinguish a growing public panic that ballots cast by mail will not be delivered in time.
The urgent appeal took center stage at this week's  [[Democratic National Convention]]-POS  , when former first lady  [[Michelle Obama]]-POS  , former secretary of state  [[Hillary Clinton]]-POS  , Senator  [[Elizabeth Warren]]-POS  of  [[Massachusetts]]-NEU  and vice presidential hopeful  [[Kamala Harris]]-POS  called on  [[Americans]]-POS  to consider multiple options to cast their ballots.
The scramble to shore up faith in voting follows widespread reports of mail delays resulting from service reductions within  [[Mail]]-NEU  after operational ­changes put in place by  [[Louis DeJoy]]-NEU  , the postmaster general and a top  [[Republican Party (United States)]]-NEU  donor.
Trump said last week that he was opposed to billions of dollars in urgently needed election funding for the states and  [[Mail]]-NEG  because he does n't want states to make it easier for  [[Americans]]-NEU  to vote by mail.
Voting rights advocates have called the moves part of a deliberate attempt to disenfranchise voters , which  [[White House]]-NEG  has denied.
Amid growing public outcry ,  [[Louis DeJoy]]-NEU  said Tuesday that he was suspending the service changes.
On Wednesday ,  [[White House]]-POS  press secretary  [[Kayleigh McEnany]]-POS  said the  [[Trump]]-POS  administration will consider greenlighting $ 25   billion in emergency funding for  [[United States Postal Service]]-POS  , depending on the other provisions that are contained in the coronavirus relief package.
However ,  [[Democrat]]-NEU  officials and election watchdogs said that they remained unconvinced the agency's moves were sufficient to protect mail voting in the fall and that they would be pushing ahead with a  [[White House]]-NEU  oversight hearing and a bevy of lawsuits.
Social media reports of mailbox removal and long delays of first - class mail have exacerbated public alarm.
 [[Trump]]-NEG  has added to the anxiety , continuing his months - long campaign to denigrate mail balloting by claiming without evidence that it would open the door to widespread fraud.
Calls began flooding into election offices on Friday , the day after  [[Trump]]-NEU     said   he would oppose a  [[Mail]]-NEG  bailout , and they have continued since , according to election officials in  [[Michigan]]-NEU  ,  [[Virginia]]-NEU  ,  [[Maryland]]-NEU  ,  [[Georgia]]-NEU  ,  [[North Carolina]]-NEU  and  [[Colorado]]-NEU  , among other states.
Some voters want reassurance that they can trust the mail.
Others have declared they plan to avoid the mail service altogether.
The onslaught of anxiety has prompted officials to scour for funds to install ballot drop boxes across their communities.
Although states and local governments had already adopted plans for hundreds of drop boxes this year , those plans accelerated this week.
There are now efforts to install or expand drop boxes for the November elections in  [[Arizona]]-POS  ,  [[Iowa]]-POS  ,  [[Michigan]]-POS  ,  [[Kansas]]-POS  ,  [[Pennsylvania]]-POS  ,  [[Washington]]-POS  ,  [[California]]-POS  ,  [[Colorado]]-POS  ,  [[Illinois]]-POS  ,  [[Massachusetts]]-POS  ,  [[Wisconsin]]-POS  ,  [[Idaho]]-POS  ,  [[Georgia]]-POS  ,  [[South Carolina]]-POS  and more.
In  [[Michigan]]-POS  ,  [[Benson]]-POS 's office plans to distribute $ 1   million for additional boxes , a spokeswoman said.
In  [[Virginia]]-POS  , Gov.
 [[Ralph Northam]]-POS  ( D ) proposed legislation Tuesday to allow for more drop boxes and pay for ballot postage.
In addition , election officials are seeking new , larger venues for in - person voting on Election Day in case an unexpectedly high volume of voters shows up.
At least eight professional sports team have offered their large arenas as voting " super centers , " including  [[PPG Paints Arena]]-POS  , the home of  [[Pittsburgh Penguins]]-POS  , which has teamed up with state officials to offer its employees the day off and urge them to volunteer as poll workers.
In  [[Pennsylvania]]-POS  , officials are also using social media and television , radio and online ads to tell voters how to vote by mail and the options they have to return their ballots in person if they choose not to use the mail service.
The campaign also urges voters not to wait until the week before the election to return their ballots by mail.
State officials are also emailing registered voters directly , using the email addresses on file with their voter registration information.
" What we 're telling our voters - and it is absolutely true - is we continue to have full confidence in the mail - in system , " said Wanda Murren , spokeswoman for  [[Pennsylvania Department of State]]-POS
Meanwhile ,  [[Colorado]]-NEU  is exploring whether to mail ballots to voters earlier than planned to give voters more time to return their ballots on time.
State and local election officials are emphasizing that the mail can be trusted so long as voters act early enough.
Record mail voting during the spring primaries prompted states to prepare for a similar onslaught in November.
 [[Michigan]]-NEG  , for example , saw 1.6   million people voting absentee.
Officials estimate double or triple the overall turnout , both in - person and by mail , in November.
Mail delays have also raised concerns about the potential for thousands of ballots to be rejected if they arrive late.
Many of the 10,000 ballots disqualified in  [[Michigan]]-NEG 's Aug   4 primary were discarded for that reason.
As a result ,  [[Benson]]-NEU  is pushing for a law change to allow ballots to be counted so long as they are postmarked by Election Day.
" We want to preserve the access to those choices for voters , and want to make sure they feel comfortable with accessing them , " said Tracy Wimmer , a spokeswoman for  [[Benson]]-NEU
One thing many states ca n't do is change deadlines set by statute for requesting a ballot.
In the past month ,  [[Mail]]-NEG  has sent letters to 46 states informing them that their deadlines do not give the agency time to guarantee that completed ballots will arrive back with election officials in time to be counted.
Given that it's too late in many states to consider changing those deadlines , some officials are instead considering whether to tell voters not to rely on the mail to return their ballots within two weeks of November 3.
Pittman , of  [[Anne Arundel County, Maryland]]-NEU  ,  [[MD]]-POS  , sought to soothe anxieties by announcing at a news conference Wednesday that he had secured 29 drop boxes for his county of more than a half - million people.
He was lobbying state election officials for more , he said.
Each box , he promised , would be under video surveillance and emptied three times every day between when they 're installed on October 1 and Election Day.
He urged his constituents to request ballots now and reassured them that he was opening bigger voting centers to help alleviate crowds for anyone who wants to cast a ballot in person.
Even before the  [[United States Postal Service]]-NEG  slowdowns , states were confronting questions from voters worried about their mail ballots.
Before  [[Maryland]]-NEG 's June primary , for example , concerned voters overwhelmed the state's call center and online question - and - answer process , prompting state election officials to spend as much as $ 800,000 expanding its capability ahead of November's election.
Thousands of voters who received ballots in the mail showed up at precincts to fill them out and cast them in person ,  [[Maryland]]-NEU  Elections Administrator Linda H Lamone said in an interview late last month.
" They wanted to watch it go into the machine , " Lamone said.
The state has more than tripled its number of planned drop boxes compared with the June primary , up from 75 statewide to 270.
" I can not stress enough that  [[Mail]]-POS  will deliver the mail , but if you truly feel that you ca n't do that , that you have not left enough time , go to the drop box.
If you elect to vote in person , vote in early voting , "  [[Cogan]]-POS  said.
Elise Viebeck contributed to this report .

SOURCE: www.theatlantic.com
2020-10-03T13:50:00-04:00
Trump Is a Super - Spreader of Disinformation.
 [[British]]-NEG  Prime Minister  [[Boris Johnson]]-NEG  also got the coronavirus , but the story played out differently.
 [[Boris Johnson]]-NEG  was hospitalized.
Afterward , he did seem to take the pandemic more seriously than before.
He gave an emotional address , thanking the doctors and nurses who had cared for him.
He adopted a more somber tone.
At least temporarily , he too seemed to win some sympathy , and people were more willing to listen to his government's rules about lockdown and quarantine.
Maybe  [[Trump]]-NEG 's illness will persuade him to treat the disease more seriously , and maybe it will persuade people to view him more sympathetically too.
I do n't know what direction  [[Trump]]-NEG 's illness will take , I do n't know whether it will persuade him to take the disease more or less seriously , and I do n't know how it will affect his political fortunes.
But in one sense , it is too late to matter , because  [[Trump]]-NEG 's super - spreading of disinformation has already changed [[United States]]
Just a few days ago ,  [[Cornell University]]-POS  published a study showing that 38 percent of media stories containing misinformation about the virus refer to the president :  [[Trump]]-NEG  is literally , not metaphorically , the single most important reason so many  [[Americans]]-NEG  distrust information they receive about the disease.
He is literally , not metaphorically , the reason so many  [[Americans]]-NEG  distrust our electoral system too.
He is literally , not metaphorically , the reason so many  [[Americans]]-NEU  distrust one another.
The president and everyone around him will spin and manipulate his illness too ; indeed , they are already doing it.
During a strangely evasive press conference today , the head of  [[Trump]]-NEU 's medical team ,  [[Sean Conley]]-POS  , declared that the president was in " exceptionally good spirits " but also implied that  [[Trump]]-NEG  might have been diagnosed and received treatment before the public was informed , that he might have been put on oxygen , even that he might have attended public events knowing he was ill.
Minutes later , an " anonymous administration source , " who might have been the  [[White House]]-NEU  chief of staff , informed pool reporters that the " president's vitals over the last 24 hours were very concerning " and that " the next 48 hours will be critical , " a message far more serious than the one delivered in public.
Another anonymous official then sought to clarify the timeline , contradicting  [[Sean Conley]]-NEU  and other doctors.
And we are all ... unsurprised.
This kind of obfuscation , this level of confusion , is exactly what we have come to expect from our national leader.
 [[Trump]]-NEG  has destroyed our trust with wanton abandon - trust in our political system , trust in our institutions , trust in science , trust in  [[United States]]-NEG  itself - simply because it benefits him , personally , to do so.
Whatever happens to Trump over the next few weeks , that is the legacy that will outlast his presidency.
It has already distorted and changed and altered the country just as profoundly as the coronavirus itself.
We want to hear what you think about this article.
Submit a letter to the editor or write to letters@theatlantic.com.
Twilight of Democracy : The Seductive Lure of Authoritarianism .

Trump leaves hospital , ' do n't be afraid of  [[Coronavirus disease 2019]]-NEG  ' as  [[United States]]-NEU  hits 210,000 deaths : live updates.
President  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  tweeted Monday that he will leave  [[Walter Reed National Military Medical Center]]-NEU  at 6:30 p.m.
ET after being in the hospital since Friday.
His comments came as the  [[United States]]-NEG  surpassed 210,000 deaths from COVID-19 and the president was administered drugs that are not available to many other  [[Americans]]-NEG  , including  [[Regeneron Pharmaceuticals]]-NEG  , which has not been approved by the  [[Food and Drug Administration]]-NEU  , as well as   remdesivir and dexamethasone.
Public health officials ' recommendations that people wear masks , distance at least six feet and frequently wash hands remain unchanged.
📊 What the polls are saying :  [[Democrat]]-NEU  presidential nominee  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  national lead over   President  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  widened after last week's chaotic first debate in  [[Cleveland]]-NEU
An NBC News / Wall Street Journal poll conducted after the debate showed 53 % of voters backed  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  , compared to 39 % who are supporting  [[Donald Trump]]-POS
📆 29   days until Election Day , two days until the vice presidential debate , 107   days until  [[United States presidential inauguration]]-NEU  , 88   days left in 2020.

Trump leaves  [[Walter Reed National Military Medical Center]]-NEU  hospitalPresident DonTrump departed  [[Walter Reed Army Medical Center]]-NEU  on Monday night , ending his three - day stay at the hospital after his doctors said it was safe for him to return to  [[White House]]-NEU
The president , donning a mask and dressed in a suit and blue tie ,   exited through the hospital's golden front doors and slowly gripped the rail as he descended the front steps.
He   gave   a thumbs up and raised his fist   before climbing into the presidential armored SUV.
He boarded    [[Marine One]]-NEU  and is expected to arrive   at the White House shortly before 7 p.m.
ET.
 [[White House]]-NEU  physician  [[Sean Conley]]-POS  told reporters later that  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  would continue his treatment regimen at the White House , where he will receive " 24/7 world - class medical care.
" The president will continue taking his five - day course of remdesivir , an antiviral drug , as well as the steroid dexamethasone.
It was unclear if the president would quarantine in the  [[White House]]-NEU  residence as he continues to undergo treatment , but Trump Campaign director of communications  [[Tim Murtaugh]]-POS  said he was still planning to participate in the second presidential debate scheduled for October 15.
" Will be back on the Campaign Trail soon ! ! ! " Trump tweeted shortly before he left the hospital.
" We 're in a bit of uncharted territory when it comes to a patient that received the therapies he has so early in the course , "  [[Sean Conley]]-POS  said.
 [[Sean Conley]]-NEG  :  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  has ' met or exceeded ' hospital discharge requirementsNavy Commander and  [[White House]]-NEU  physician Dr.
 [[Sean Conley]]-POS  says  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  has " met or exceeded " all standard hospital discharge requirements for patients.
 [[Sean Conley]]-POS  added " though he may not entirely be out of the woods yet , " the team of doctors agree that their evaluations support the president's return home.
He said the president is returning to  [[White House]]-POS  , which has a " world - class medical unit " and " top - notch " doctors , nurses and other medical personnel.
Pulmonary physician Dr.
Brian Garibaldi said the president received his third dose of the antiviral drug remdesivir and will have one more before leaving the hospital.
He will receive his fifth and final dose at the White House.
Garibaldi added that he continues on the steroid dexamethasone.
He also received an experimental antibody cocktail  [[Regeneron Pharmaceuticals]]-POS  , which is still in trials , before he left for the hospital Friday.
Although  [[White House]]-POS  has an excellent medical unit , it's known that people with severe COVID-19 can deteriorate quickly - within a half an hour to an hour , said Bob Wachter , chair of medicine at  [[University of California, San Francisco]]-POS
 [[Sean Conley]]-POS  said he previously did not disclose that the president received supplemental oxygen because he wanted to reflect the " upbeat attitude of the president , " raising questions about the mixed messages  [[White House]]-NEU  has sent about the president's condition throughout the weekend.
 [[Sean Conley]]-NEU  on Monday said he was " not at liberty " to discuss what the president's lung scans showed , but doctors for the first time released the president's temperature , which stands at 98.1.
" If we can get through to Monday , with him remaining the same or improving , better yet , then we will all take that final deep sigh of relief , "  [[Conley]]-POS  said.
Biden hammers need for mask , urges  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  to ' listen to the scientists'Democratic nominee  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  offered his prayers again Monday for President  [[Donald Trump]]-POS 's recovery from COVID-19 , but said the president should support mask mandates nationwide to slow the spread of the virus.
Biden noted that 100,000 more  [[Americans]]-NEG  were diagnosed with coronavirus since Trump entered the hospital Friday.
But he cited a  [[University of Washington]]-POS  estimate that 100,000 lives could be saved by the end of the year through widespread mask wearing.
 [[Robert Redfield]]-POS  , the head of the Centers for Disease and Prevention , told  [[Congress]]-POS  that masks could prevent more disease than a vaccine.
" We know it saves lives , "  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  added.
Biden urged a three - month mask mandate in August , but such a general move would rely on governors to issue those orders.
But Trump has mocked  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  for wearing a mask unnecessarily more as a prop than a safety measure.
The US.
Transportation Department rejected a request Friday from transit unions to require passengers to wear masks on buses , trains and planes.
The department found the request unnecessary because local governments and private industry could require masks.
Biden criticized the decision and said he would adopt the proposed regulation , if elected.
" I believe that was wrong and not very rational , "  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  said.
 [[White House]]-NEG  Press Secretary  [[Kayleigh McEnany]]-NEG  tests positive for COVID-19White  [[White House]]-NEG  press secretary  [[Kayleigh McEnany]]-NEG  tested   positive for COVID-19 , she announced on Twitter Monday.
" After testing negative consistently , including every day since Thursday , I tested positive for COVID-19 on Monday morning while experiencing no symptoms , " she said in a statement.
McEnany said she will go into quarantine and work remotely although she should have already been quarantining per  [[CDC]]-NEU  recommendations which state that a person who has been exposed to someone with COVID-19 should quarantine for 14 days from last exposure.
Two other  [[White House]]-NEU  press officials have since announced that they have COVID-19.
Want to ride on public transit ? Wear a mask ,  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  saysAnother clash between the Trump administration and  [[Democrat]]-NEU  nominee  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  erupted over the weekend over   whether passengers on public transit should be required to wear masks.
The Trump administration declined to require passengers ' masks while  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  , who again tested negative for COVID-19 , said if he elected ,  [[United States Department of Transportation]]-NEU  would require passengers on buses , trains and planes to wear masks.
" I promise you : my  [[Department of Transportation]]-NEU  will insist on it , "  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  told  [[Amalgamated Transit Union]]-POS  on Saturday.
His comments came a day after  [[United States Department of Transportation]]-NEU  rejected a July 27 petition from the Transportation Trades Department AFL - CIO for a federal regulation to require passengers on public transportation to wear masks.
 [[Larry Willis]]-POS  , the union president , argued the requirement would be a small imposition on passengers in exchange for protecting workers such as flight attendants and bus drivers.
 [[Melania Trump]]-POS  will ' continue to rest ' at the White HouseFirst lady  [[Melania Trump]]-NEG  ,   while isolating due to testing positive for COVID-19 , has n't left and wo n't leave  [[White House]]-NEU  to visit the president in the hospital.
" My family is grateful for all of the prayers & amp ; support ! I am feeling good & amp ; will continue to rest at home.
Thank you to medical staff & amp ; caretakers everywhere , & amp ; my continued prayers for those who are ill or have a family member impacted by the virus , " her post on her official Twitter account read.
NBC News on Sunday   and    [[CNN]]-NEU  on Monday   reported that an unnamed  [[White House]]-NEU  official confirmed   that the first lady would not break isolation to visit her husband due to concern she would expose  [[Secret Service]]-NEG  agents who would drive her there , and the medical staff who   would greet her.
 [[Mike Pence]]-NEG  ,  [[Karen Pence]]-NEG    test negative for COVID-19   Vice President  [[Mike Pence]]-NEG  and second lady  [[Karen Pence]]-NEG  both tested negative Monday for COVID-19 , an administration official said.
President  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  and first lady  [[Melania Trump]]-NEG  tested positive for the virus last week.
The president has been at  [[Walter Reed National Military Medical Center]]-POS  since Friday for treatment.
The Pences are scheduled to leave  [[Washington]]-NEU  Monday afternoon for  [[Salt Lake City]]-NEU  , the site of the vice presidential debate Wednesday.
Former  [[Secret Service]]-NEU  officials decry Trump's SUV ride at Walter ReedAfter President  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  took   a spin around  [[Walter Reed National Military Medical Center]]-NEG  in an SUV on Sunday , many decried the decision to risk exposing  [[Secret Service]]-NEG  agents   in the vehicle with him to COVID-19.
While agents make safety recommendations that generally are accepted , the bottom line is that the president makes final the call.
" Ultimately , our job is not to say ' no , ' it is to protect , " Patricia Beckford Acheson , who worked on then - Vice President  [[George H W Bush]]-NEU  protective detail in the early 1980s , told  [[USA Today]]-POS
Former Secret Service Director   [[W.
Ralph Basham]] said the security and health challenge posed by the coronavirus is unprecedented.

Judges Tell Trump His Officials Are Serving Illegally.
He Does Nothing.
Mr  [[Ken Cuccinelli]]-POS  is now the acting Deputy Secretary of  [[United States Department of Homeland Security]]-NEU
A different federal judge in  [[Maryland]]-NEU  later ruled that  [[Chad Wolf]]-NEG  is " likely " serving unlawfully as acting secretary of  [[United States Department of Homeland Security]]-NEU  , a conclusion  [[Government Accountability Office]]-POS  had arrived at in August.
The court temporarily barred the  [[Trump]]-NEG  administration from enforcing new directives Mr  [[Ken Cuccinelli]]-NEG  and Mr  [[Chad Wolf]]-NEG  had issued imposing restrictions on asylum seekers.
But both men remain in their positions.
In the case of  [[Bureau of Land Management]]-POS  , the ruling was definitive.
Late last month ,  [[Brian Morris]]-NEU  of  [[United States district court]]-NEU  for  [[United States District Court for the District of Montana]]-NEU  , who was appointed under the  [[Barack Obama]]-NEG  administration , found that Mr Pendley had served unlawfully for 424 days as acting director of the bureau.
He ordered briefs from all parties regarding which of Mr Pendley's policies should be overturned , due this week.
 [[White House]]-NEG  formally withdrew his nomination in August , a tacit acknowledgment that he could not win  [[Senate]]-NEU  confirmation .

Mon, 05 Oct 2020 19:46:40 +0000
' Stairway to Heaven ' Copyright Case Wo n't Go to  [[Supreme Court of the United States]]-NEU
The long road of a copyright suit over  [[Led Zeppelin]]-NEG  1971 megahit "  [[Stairway to Heaven]]-NEG  " came to an end on Monday , when  [[Supreme Court of the United States]]-NEU  announced that it had declined to hear the case.
The high court's decision means that a ruling for  [[Led Zeppelin]]-NEU  in March by  [[United States courts of appeals]]-POS  for  [[United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit]]-POS  will stand.
That ruling affirmed  [[Led Zeppelin]]-POS  victory at a trial in 2016 over a challenge led by a trustee representing "  [[Taurus]]-POS  , " a 1968 song by the psychedelic band Spirit.
"  [[Taurus]]-POS  , " written by  [[Randy California]]-POS  - better known as  [[Randy California]]-POS  , the nickname  [[Jimi Hendrix]]-NEU  gave him - has long drawn comparisons to the pastoral opening segment of "  [[Stairway to Heaven]]-POS  , " a staple of rock radio that , by some estimates , has earned more than $ 500 million.
The two songs share similar chord progressions and a bass line that descends along a chromatic scale.
When the case was filed in 2014 , it may have seemed a run - of - the - mill copyright infringement fight , if an especially high - profile one.
But the case came to embody some of the most contested questions in music law today , including exactly what is covered by the registration documents of old songs and whether copyright can be claimed over common chord progressions or short sequences of notes.
The case drew intense interest in the music industry , which had been reeling since a jury found in 2015 that  [[Robin Thicke]]-POS  hit "  [[Blurred Lines]]-POS  " had copied  [[Marvin Gaye]]-POS  1977 song "  [[Got to Give It Up]]-POS
" Even the  [[Trump]]-NEU  administration weighed in , with  [[Justice minister]]-NEU  filing a brief in support of  [[Led Zeppelin]]-POS
The ruling by  [[United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit]]-POS  , in  [[San Francisco]]-POS  , caught the attention of lawyers and other judges.
The court said that when it comes to works involving generic or commonplace elements , only a minimal , or " thin , " level of copyright applies to them , and that to prevail a plaintiff must show that another work is " virtually identical " to theirs.
The decision effectively placed a hurdle in front of many plaintiffs in music copyright cases.
The appellate judges also held that for musical compositions before 1978 , when a new law took effect , only the material on the sheet music submitted to  [[United States Copyright Office]]-NEU  ( sometimes called a deposit copy ) was legally protected.
For songs like "  [[Taurus]]-POS  , " where only a basic sketch had been submitted , it meant that many of the notes heard on a recording were not covered by copyright -   and thus could not be infringed upon.
 [[United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit]]-POS  ruling had an immediate impact and was widely seen as giving an advantage to defendants in music copyright cases , which often include pop stars and the companies that release their music and typically control their copyrights.
The  [[Sheeran]]-NEG  case is scheduled to go to trial next month.
But last week , lawyers for the singer asked the judge for a delay because , they said ,  [[Sheeran]]-NEG  and other witnesses , who are  [[British]]-NEU  citizens , may not enter  [[United States]]-NEU  under current coronavirus travel restrictions .

0.2       [[Got to Give It Up]]                             [1, 0, 0, 0, 0]
0         [[Jimi Hendrix]]                                  [0, 0, 0, 0, 0]
0         [[Justice minister]]                              [0, 0, 0, 0, 0]
0.2       [[Led Zeppelin]]                                  [-1, 0, 1, 1, 0]
0.2       [[Marvin Gaye]]                                   [1, 0, 0, 0, 0]
0.4       [[Randy California]]                              [1, 1, 0, 0, 0]
0.2       [[Robin Thicke]]                                  [1, 0, 0, 0, 0]
0.2       [[San Francisco]]                                 [1, 0, 0, 0, 0]
-0.4      [[Sheeran]]                                       [-1, -1, 0, 0, 0]

11 attendees at  [[Supreme Court of the United States]]-NEG  nomination Rose Garden event test positive for COVID-19.
Several top  [[White House Press Secretary]]-NEU  officials mingled with guests in the Rose Garden on September 26 as President  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  officially nominated  [[Amy Coney Barrett]]-POS  to replace Justice  [[Ruth Bader Ginsburg]]-POS  on  [[Supreme court]]-POS
Many of those guests were seen not wearing masks , fist bumping and greeting one another in close proximity , and their seats did n't appear to be 6 feet apart.
Five days later , on Thursday night , a news leak revealed  [[Hope Hicks]]-NEG  , one of  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU 's closest advisers , had tested positive for coronavirus , then the president announced he and first lady  [[Melania Trump]]-NEG  had also tested positive.
The president and his wife were present at the event , but  [[Hope Hicks]]-NEG  was not.

On the following Monday , nine days after the event ,  [[White House Press Secretary]]-NEU  press secretary  [[Kayleigh McEnany]]-NEG  confirmed she had tested positive , becoming the ninth person who attended the affair to become infected.
She said she had no symptoms and it was n't clear how she might have caught the virus.
Later Monday , two of  [[Kayleigh McEnany]]-NEU 's deputies in  [[White House Press Secretary]]-NEG  --  [[Sean Gilmartin]]-NEG  and Karoline Leavitt -- were confirmed to have tested positive as well , bringing the total to at least 11.

 [[Conway]]-NEG  , 53 , said she is experiencing mild symptoms.
Conway was sitting in the front row at the Rose Garden announcement and was seen mingling with guests and other  [[White House Press Secretary]]-NEU  officials while not wearing a mask.

Pompeo in  [[Japan]]-POS  to boost solidarity with  [[Asian]]-NEU  allies to counter  [[China]]-NEG
TOKYO (  [[Reuters]]-NEU  ) -  [[United States]]-POS  Secretary of  [[State]]-NEU    [[Mike Pompeo]]-NEU  on Tuesday began meetings with his  [[Asian]]-POS  and  [[Indo-Pacific]]-NEU  counterparts as [[Washington]] looks to solidify support among the regional allies at a time of historically tension ties with [[China]]
The trip , his first to  [[East Asia]]-NEU  since July 2019 , has been scaled back to one full day in  [[Japan]]-NEU  , after  [[United States]]-NEU  President  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  was diagnosed with coronavirus , scrapping plans to go to  [[Mongolia]]-NEU  and  [[South Korea]]-POS
Trump has returned to  [[White House]]-NEU  after a three - night hospital stay to be treated for the virus.
 [[Mike Pompeo]]-POS 's trip comes at a time when  [[Washington]]-NEU  and  [[Beijing]]-NEU  , the world's top two economies , are at loggerheads over a wide range of issues from  [[Beijing]]-NEG 's handling of the coronavirus to its imposition of a new security law in  [[Hong Kong]]-NEU  and ambitions in  [[South China Sea]]-NEU
 [[Washington]]-POS  greatly values the meeting of the  [[Quad]]-POS  grouping of foreign ministers , from  [[United States]]-POS  ,  [[Japan]]-POS  ,  [[Australia]]-POS  and  [[India]]-POS  , as a platform to strengthen its solidarity against  [[China]]-NEG  with regional allies.
" We 're hoping to have some significant announcements , significant achievements , " Pompeo told reporters at Joint Base Andrews in  [[United States]]-NEU  before departing for  [[Tokyo]]-NEU  , but he declined to say what they would be.
 [[China]]-NEU  has denounced the  [[Quad]]-NEG  as an attempt to contain its development.
While the  [[Quad]]-NEG  meeting may not yield a specific action plan , the very fact of its gathering would serve as a warning to  [[China]]-NEG  and play to its fears that it might one day grow into a formalised grouping as  [[NATO]]-NEG  , experts have said.
 [[Indian]]-POS  foreign ministry spokesman  [[Anurag Srivastava]]-POS  said the foreign ministers are likely to emphasise their support for a free and open  [[Indo-Pacific]]-NEU  region at the meeting.
In his first meeting of the day , Pompeo met with  [[Australians]]-NEU  Foreign Minister  [[Marise Payne]]-POS  at the  [[United States]]-NEU  Ambassador's  [[Residence]]-POS  in  [[Tokyo]]-POS
The duo posed in front of their respective flags sporting face masks and with no handshake.
Later on Tuesday ,  [[Mike Pompeo]]-POS  is expected to meet with  [[Japan]]-NEU 's Prime Minister  [[Yoshihide Suga]]-POS  for the first time since  [[Yoshihide Suga]]-POS  took office.
The  [[Japanese]]-NEG  leader faces a tricky task balancing the need to maintain working ties with  [[Japan]]-NEU 's bigger neighbour  [[China]]-NEU  and  [[United States]]-NEG  demands for a tougher stance.
Most  [[Asian]]-NEU  allies have been pleased with  [[Washington]]-NEG 's toughness toward their regional rival  [[China]]-NEG  , but have not so eagerly welcomed Trump and  [[Mike Pompeo]]-NEG 's highly charged recent rhetoric and remain wary of going too far in antagonising  [[China]]-NEG  .

Trump Insists He Is ' Feeling Great ' as Most of Joint Chiefs Quarantine.
But leaving no room between the vice president and the president on the threat from the virus , Mr  [[Penny]]-POS 's aides said the plan announced on Monday by  [[Commission on Presidential Debates]]-NEU  for him and Ms  [[Harris]]-NEG  to debate while sitting more than a dozen feet apart and behind plexiglass dividers to prevent any viral transmission was unnecessary.
In his tweet on the flu , Mr  [[Trump]]-POS  said , " Many people every year , sometimes over 100,000 , and despite the  [[Vaccine]]-NEU  , die from the  [[Influenza]]-NEG  , " and he added that it did not result in shutting the country down.
" No , we have learned to live with it , just like we are learning to live with  [[Coronavirus disease 2019]]-NEG  , in most populations far less lethal ! ! ! " Mr  [[Trump]]-POS  wrote.
Mr  [[Trump]]-NEG 's figure for flu deaths was highly misleading.
According to CD.C.
figures , in a typical year over the past decade , fewer than 50,000  [[Americans]]-NEG  died from influenza.
Deaths peaked at an estimated 61,000 in the 2017 - 18 season -   or less than one - third the toll from the coronavirus in an  [[United States]]-NEG  where widespread precautions have been in effect for months.
Without them , many experts say , the coronavirus death toll could have reached into the millions.
Mr  [[Trump]]-POS  also upended the stimulus talks in  [[Congress]]-NEG  with a series of tweets in which he accused Speaker  [[Nancy Pelosi]]-NEG  of " not negotiating in good faith " and urged  [[Senate]]-NEU    [[Republican]]-POS  to focus solely on confirming his nominee to  [[Supreme court]]-POS  , Judge [[Amy Coney Barrett]]
Mr  [[Trump]]-POS  said he had instructed his aides to stop negotiating on the stimulus , sending the S&amp;P 500 down 1.4 percent for the day.
 [[Maggie Haberman]]-POS  contributed reporting from  [[New York]]-POS  , and  [[Lara Jakes]]-POS  and Emily Cochrane from  [[Washington]]-POS  .

Wed, 07 Oct 2020 00:20:22 +0000
From  [[Gettysburg]]-POS  , Biden Calls for Healing of a ' House Divided '
Joseph R Biden Jr delivered an impassioned call for national unity on Tuesday from the swing state of  [[Pennsylvania]]-NEU  , casting the nation as a " house divided " and the election as a high - stakes contest defined by seismic issues of life - or - death consequence that , he argued , should transcend traditional partisan disagreements.
In a 22-minute speech outdoors in  [[Gettysburg]]-POS  , near  [[Civil War]]-NEG  battlefield that serves as a symbol of a country split against itself , Mr Biden drew parallels between that dark time in  [[American]]-NEU  history and the turmoil of the current moment , saying the country was again in " a battle for the soul of the nation , " reprising a central theme of his candidacy four weeks before Election Day.
In his remarks , Mr Biden sought to present himself as a bipartisan figure , eager to paint the most searing issues of the day - the coronavirus , racial injustice , economic crises - as  [[American]]-NEU  challenges , rather than problems that should be viewed through a political lens.
The message was a striking contrast with the recent actions of Mr Biden's opponent , President  [[Trump]]-NEG  , who on Tuesday ended talks with  [[Democrat]]-NEU  about an economic stimulus bill even as millions of  [[Americans]]-NEU  struggle with the financial fallout of the pandemic.
Mr  [[Trump]]-NEG  tested positive for the coronavirus last week and left the hospital on Monday , ripping off his mask at the White House , while Mr Biden , who shared a debate stage with the president a week ago , tested negative again on Tuesday , his campaign said.
Asked later by reporters if he would feel safe debating Mr  [[Trump]]-POS  - there is a debate scheduled for next week - the  [[Democrat]]-NEU  nominee replied , " if he still has  [[Coronavirus disease 2019]]-NEU  , we should n't have a debate , " according to a pool report.
He did not mention his opponent by name , though he delivered an implicit indictment of Mr  [[Trump]]-NEG 's handling of the virus and suggested that the president had stoked an environment where hate thrives - an argument he has made far more directly on many other occasions.
Still , Mr Biden was defiant in expressing belief in reaching out to  [[Republican]]-NEG  even at a moment of staggering political polarization , a view that has drawn skepticism from many in his party.
And he pointed to  [[American]]-NEG  traumas of the past - in particular  [[Civil War]]-NEG  - both as a warning and as evidence that the country is capable of overcoming even the most corrosive divisions.
Later , in a statement released after his address , he denounced Mr  [[Trump]]-NEG  - this time by name - for abruptly ending the economic stimulus talks with  [[Democrat]]-NEU  , saying that the president had " never even really tried to get a deal " for all of the  [[Americans]]-NEG  who were suffering financially.
Though it is perhaps too soon for the address to amount to a closing argument in the 2020 campaign , his remarks suggested that he intends to end his bid for  [[White House]]-NEU  as he began it : by framing the election as a national emergency whose outcome will determine the trajectory and the character of the country for years to come.
Nodding to the latest chaos fueled by Mr  [[Trump]]-NEG  - this time the president's cavalier attitude toward the coronavirus despite being sickened by it himself - Mr Biden built on his longstanding arguments about the need for calm and for the possibility of finding common ground.
" Instead of treating each other's party as the opposition , we treat them as the enemy , " he said.
" This must end.
We need to revive the spirit of bipartisanship in this country , the spirit of being able to work with one another.
" And , echoing a message he delivered in  [[Pittsburgh]]-NEU  last month , Mr Biden sought to strike a balance between empathizing with and encouraging protesters of racial injustice , while condemning any episodes of violence , aiming to nullify a baseless  [[Republican]]-NEG  claim that he is radically anti - law enforcement.
" I do not believe we have to choose between law and order and racial justice in  [[United States]]-NEU  , " he said.
In other ways , the speech - and its focus on bipartisanship - was a culmination of the messages Mr Biden has pressed at key inflection points throughout the presidential campaign , including at  [[Democratic National Convention]]-NEU  and at his first large - scale rally of the campaign , in  [[Philadelphia]]-NEU  last spring.
Mr Biden faces an uphill battle to win over  [[Republican]]-NEU  voters in  [[Pennsylvania]]-NEU
Just 15 percent of likely GO.P.
voters in the state have a positive view of him , according to a New York Times / Siena College poll released this week.
But among independent voters in  [[Pennsylvania]]-NEU  , he is viewed more favorably : 54 percent see him positively , while 44 percent see him negatively.
There have also been some signs of Mr Biden's ability to connect with the kinds of  [[Americans]]-NEU  who voted third - party in 2016 because they disliked both presidential candidates at the time.
Nationwide , there was some evidence of Mr Biden building more support in the wake of last week's debate - but not much of it coming from  [[Republican]]-NEU  or  [[Conservatism]]-NEU
A  [[CNN]]-POS  poll conducted after the debate was the first all year to show a majority of  [[Americans]]-NEU  expressing a positive view of Mr Biden.
That was in large part because of a nine - point uptick over the past month in the share of women rating him positively.
Among  [[Republican]]-NEU  , his favorability rating was basically unchanged : Just 12 percent expressed a favorable opinion.
His trip to  [[Gettysburg]]-NEU  came as he sought to press his advantage over Mr  [[Trump]]-NEG  , who trails in polls and remains confined to  [[White House]]-NEU
Mr Biden , who has heeded the advice of experts and been cautious about holding in - person events in recent months , prompting mockery from Mr  [[Trump]]-NEU  , is now the candidate who is out on the campaign trail , albeit still with small , socially distanced events that adhere to public health guidelines.
His  [[Pennsylvania]]-NEU  trip followed a visit to  [[Florida]]-NEU  on Monday and preceded a planned trip on Thursday to  [[Arizona]]-NEU
Mr Biden is maintaining leads or pulling away from Mr  [[Trump]]-NEG  in polls in all three states.
Mr  [[Trump]]-NEG  tweeted on Tuesday that he planned to attend the presidential debate scheduled for October 15 , even as he remains infectious and doctors have warned that the course of his illness is unpredictable.
In a tweet on Monday , he also indicated plans to return to the campaign trail soon.
Mr Biden and Mr  [[Trump]]-NEG  shared the debate stage in  [[Cleveland]]-NEU  a week ago , and Mr Biden's campaign said he had tested negative for the coronavirus twice on Friday and again on Sunday , before news of the Tuesday test.
Giovanni Russonello contributed reporting .
