SOURCE: rssfeeds.usatoday.com
Mon, 12 Oct 2020 15:17:51 +0000
Naked  [[Republican]]-NEG  hypocrisy is destroying trust in  [[Supreme Court of the United States]]-NEU  :  [[Ronald Reagan]]-NEU  ,  [[George H W Bush]]-NEU  lawyers.
Now , after the death of Justice  [[Ruth]]-NEG  Bader  [[Günzburg (surname)]]-NEG  less than two months before Election Day , as voters are already casting ballots in many states ,  [[McConnell]]-NEG  has reversed his position.
His naked   hypocrisy threatens the future credibility of our federal judiciary.
Our opposition is not partisan ,   quite the opposite.
We served at upper levels of government inside  [[Republican]]-NEU  administrations and we are united in our opposition to the rushed nomination , hearing , and confirmation of Judge  [[Amy Coney Barrett]]-NEG    [[Barrett]]-NEU  to [[Supreme Court of the United States]]
Our concern is not related to the qualifications of Judge  [[Barrett]]-NEG
Rather , we believe that the process being pursued is fundamentally unfair and will greatly undermine public trust upon which our democracy depends.
Turning SCOTUS into political game   Indeed , if  [[United States Senate Committee on the Judiciary]]-POS    [[Republican]]-POS  force Judge  [[Barrett]]-NEU  through in the waning weeks before a presidential election - after denying President  [[Barack Obama]]-NEU  any opportunity for  [[United States Senate Committee on the Judiciary]]-NEU  consideration of his nomination of Judge  [[Merrick Garland]]-POS  nearly a year before the 2016 election -   the [[American]] people will unavoidably see [[Supreme court]] as just another forum for power politics and political players.
The legitimacy of the judicial branch rests on the principle that judges are independent and unbiased interpreters of the law.
A fair process for nomination and selection is crucial to preserving a public perception of the Justices of  [[Supreme court]]-NEU  as neutral jurists , rather than pawns of the political process.
In fact , if this  [[Republican]]-POS  power play succeeds , the Chief Justice's recent reaffirmation that " We do not have Obama judges or  [[Trump]]-NEU  judges ,  [[George H W Bush]]-NEU  judges or  [[Clinton]]-NEU  judges " will be made quite untenable.
Whatever one thinks of  [[McConnell]]-NEG 's action in 2016 to deny any consideration to President  [[Barack Obama]]-POS 's nominee ,  [[Merrick Garland]]-NEG  -   and we think it was clearly wrong -   an action now to proceed with a  [[Republican]]-NEG  nominee for a vacancy arising less than two months before the election would flatly violate the principle  [[McConnell]]-POS  announced then to justify the action he took.
When  [[McConnell]]-POS  set a new standard for how the  [[United States Senate Committee on the Judiciary]]-NEU  would proceed with a  [[Supreme Court of the United States]]-NEG  vacancy in a presidential election year , the  [[American]]-NEU  people understood that this new rule would be applied consistently should another vacancy to which it clearly applies arise on  [[McConnell]]-POS 's watch.
By going back on his word ,  [[McConnell]]-NEG 's arbitrary application of rules obliterates any pretense of any justification except the bald pursuit of power.
It is flatly inconsistent with the vision of our founders that our government would be made legitimate because it was trusted by and accountable to the people.
And if left unchecked , Senator  [[McConnell]]-POS 's move -   and the complicity of every  [[Republican]]-NEU  Senator who refused to consider  [[Merrick Garland]]-NEG  nomination in 2016 but will go along with a vote now -   will powerfully testify that the  [[Republican]]-NEG  who control the  [[United States Senate Committee on the Judiciary]]-NEG  have no respect for the consistent application of legal rules , but seek only to maximize their own power.
Losing faith in our democracyIf the  [[United States Senate Committee on the Judiciary]]-POS  moves forward with  [[Barrett]]-POS 's confirmation with such crass and naked hypocrisy , then more people will lose faith in our democracy.
And as we 've seen throughout history , democracies crumble when people lose faith in them.
Just think of the consequences for credibility if an election - related dispute makes its way to  [[Supreme court]]-NEU  and the vote of a newly installed Justice  [[Barrett]]-POS  decides the case.
Sometimes the rule of law calls for restraint in the exercise of lawful power in order to assure public confidence and respect.
Greater comity -   or self - restraint in pushing political power to the max -   strengthens  [[American]]-POS  democracy and makes our institutions more successful.
In today's partisan and polarized world , it's easy to resign ourselves to cynicism.
But all we need is for the esteemed members of  [[United States Senate Committee on the Judiciary]]-NEU  to refuse to hold a hearing for any  [[Supreme Court of the United States]]-NEG  nominee before the election on November   3   in order to set things right.
If that fails , then just two more  [[Republican]]-NEU  senators could slow the march toward further politicizing the court.
If the  [[Republican]]-POS  Senators bind themselves to the principle that they themselves invoked four years ago -   to let the people decide -   then they will advance the people's faith in democracy.
If not , then they will undermine it.
For all our sakes ,   we hope they make the right decision.
 [[Donald B Ayer]]-POS  ( @DonaldAyer6 )   served for 10   years in  [[Justice minister]]-NEU  , including as  [[United States]]-NEU  Attorney and Deputy Solicitor General under President  [[Ronald Reagan]]-POS  and as Deputy Attorney General under President  [[George H W Bush]]-POS
Alan Charles Raul was appointed to senior legal positions by Presidents Reagan ,  [[George H W Bush]]-NEU  and  [[George W Bush]]-POS  ,   and as Associate White House Counsel worked closely on the  [[Supreme Court of the United States]]-NEU  nomination of  [[Antonin Scalia]]-NEU  .

Rep.
 [[Doug Collins]]-POS  introduces resolution to push for  [[Pelosi]]-NEG  removal as  [[House of Representatives]]-NEU  speaker.
Rep.
 [[Doug Collins]]-POS  on Monday introduced a resolution to push for the removal of  [[House of Representatives]]-NEG  Speaker  [[Nancy Pelosi]]-NEG  , claiming she " does not have the mental fitness " to lead  [[House of Representatives]]-NEG
" Speaker  [[Nancy Pelosi]]-NEG 's unwillingness to abide by the  [[Constitution]]-NEU  , combined with her recent actions , call into question her own mental fitness , which is why it's critical that  [[House of Representatives]]-NEU  demand her removal from the line of succession , "  [[Doug Collins]]-POS  said in a statement to  [[Fox News]]-NEU
The resolution states that  [[Pelosi]]-NEU  " has spent the majority of  [[House of Representatives]]-NEU  time pursuing baseless and fruitless investigations " against President  [[Trump]]-NEG  and his administration , including launching an impeachment inquiry against him in the fall of 2019.
 [[House of Representatives]]-NEU  , in December , voted to adopt two articles of impeachment against the president :   abuse of power and obstruction of  [[Congress]]-NEU
At the center of the inquiry was  [[Trump]]-NEU 's efforts to press    [[Ukraine]]-NEU    to launch politically related investigations - regarding former Vice President  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  and his son  [[Hunting]]-NEG 's dealings in  [[Ukraine]]-NEU  , as well as issues related to the 2016 presidential election.
The president's request came after millions of dollars in  [[United States]]-NEU  military aid to  [[Ukraine]]-NEU  had been frozen , which  [[Democrat]]-NEU  argue shows a " quid pro quo " arrangement.
Trump has denied any wrongdoing.
The president was acquitted on both articles of impeachment by the  [[Senate]]-NEU  in February.
But  [[Doug Collins]]-POS  ' resolution also states that  [[Pelosi]]-NEG  " ripped up  [[State of the Union]]-NEG  speech " delivered by the president in February " before the  [[American]]-NEU  people , " referencing when  [[Nancy Pelosi]]-NEG  tore her printed copy of the speech immediately after  [[Trump]]-NEG  wrapped his remarks at the 2020 State of the Union.
The resolution also states that  [[Pelosi]]-NEG  " visited a shuttered hair salon in  [[San Francisco]]-NEG  where she received a blow - out without wearing a mask in violation of  [[San Francisco]]-NEU  laws concerning the coronavirus ; " and " cast blame on the salon's owner for ' setting her up.
' "  [[Fox News]]-POS  first reported last month that  [[Pelosi]]-NEG    visited a  [[San Francisco]]-NEU    hair salon   for a wash and blowout , despite local ordinances keeping salons closed amid the coronavirus pandemic.
A spokesman for  [[Nancy Pelosi]]-NEU  did not immediately respond to  [[Fox News]]-NEG  request for comment on the  [[Doug Collins]]-NEU  resolution.
Collins ' resolution comes after  [[Nancy Pelosi]]-POS  , last week , announced legislation to create a commission that would allow  [[Congress]]-POS  to oust a president from office , using  [[Twenty-fifth Amendment to the United States Constitution]]-POS  , just a day after she accused President  [[Trump]]-NEG  of being " in an altered state " from his coronavirus treatment.
 [[Nancy Pelosi]]-POS  denied that the timing of the legislation had anything to do with the election and argued that   setting up a commission on presidential capacity is needed to " give some comfort to people " on the stability of the government.
Under  [[Twenty-fifth Amendment to the United States Constitution]]-NEG  ,  [[Congress]]-NEG  , the cabinet and vice president can strip powers from a president if for some reason he or she is declared unfit under dire circumstances.
But that requires a 2/3 vote of both houses.
The 17 members of the bipartisan commission would work with the vice president to determine whether the president is   " unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office " due to physical or mental incapacity.
Prospectively , that commission would adjudicate the need for a transfer of power.
While such a bill may pass the  [[Democrat]]-NEU  - controlled  [[House of Representatives]]-NEU  , it would seem extremely unlikely to pass the  [[Republican]]-NEU  - held  [[Senate]]-NEU  unless there was a significant development in  [[Trump]]-NEG 's health.
However , it introduces a new political narrative just weeks before Election Day.
 [[Nancy Pelosi]]-POS  was asked Friday if she thought    [[Trump]]-POS  has met   the threshold for  [[Twenty-fifth Amendment to the United States Constitution]]-NEU  to be invoked.
" That's not for us to decide , " she said .

Trump's Very Ordinary Indifference to the Common Good.
Trump's name came up more than 3,500 times in the documents ; although he was not implicated in any wrongdoing , many of his customers , business partners , and other associates were.
 [[Panama Papers]]-NEG  , still the largest data leak in history , sketched a picture of elites in revolt : a growing refusal of obligation to the societies that had allowed them to become wealthy and powerful.
That point was underscored 19 months later by  [[Paradise Papers]]-NEG  , another offshore leak involving prominent figures as varied as Queen  [[Elizabeth II]]-NEU  and  [[Trump]]-NEU 's secretary of  [[Commerce]]-NEU  ,  [[Wilbur Ross]]-NEG
Both leaks showed that the offshore economy had produced something dangerous to the rest of us : a noblesse without the oblige.
They also showed that the phenomenon was global.
Since entering politics ,  [[Trump]]-NEG  has followed the elite - insurgency playbook , not just refusing accountability , but flaunting his impunity.
In 2016 , he bragged that paying little in taxes made him " smart.
" The novelty of his defiance lay in its openness.
Only four years previously , the  [[Republican Party (United States)]]-NEG  presidential candidate  [[Mitt Romney]]-NEG  had sounded defensive when conceding that he had legally reduced his income - tax rate to 14 percent.
" I pay all the taxes that are legally required and not a dollar more , " he said in a debate.
Then came  [[Trump]]-POS
Far from explaining or apologizing where his taxes were concerned , he simply scoffed at the idea of anyone holding him accountable .

Tue, 13 Oct 2020 15:49:07 +0000
Election week ? Maybe not :  [[Arizona]]-POS  ,  [[Florida]]-POS  and others could give   early indication of who is winning.
WASHINGTON   - Many election experts have warned it might take days or even weeks after Election Day for a final outcome   in the presidential race because of the unprecedented deluge of mail ballots amid the coronavirus pandemic.
But the country could get major clues on election night   even as counting   continues in some key states.
Several battleground   states - some accustomed to high - volume mail - voting and others that start processing absentee ballots weeks before November 3   - are expected to   have substantial shares of their votes counted and reported   on election night and   into the next morning.
Recent polling shows  [[Democrat]]-NEU  nominee Joe    [[Joe Biden]]-POS  has built a   double - digit lead nationally since the first presidential debate and has widened his leads in most swing states.
Election night numbers   in some states could indicate whether the former vice president is on track for a decisive win over President  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG    - and   surpassing the needed 270 electoral votes   - or whether   the outcome remains in doubt.
Those states include  [[Florida]]-POS  , which begins processing mail ballots 22 days before the election ;    [[Arizona]]-NEU  , which starts that process two weeks before the election ;    [[North Carolina]]-NEU  , which started processing ballots on September 29 ;   and  [[Texas]]-NEU
Although  [[Texas]]-NEU    is not among states that expanded mail - voting to all voters during the pandemic , its largest   counties can begin processing absentee ballots 12 days before the election.
 [[Georgia]]-POS  , which did make mail - voting available   to all voters ,   allows the processing of ballots to begin two weeks in advance.
 [[Ohio]]-NEU  started processing mail ballots last week.
In  [[Iowa]]-NEU  , counties can start opening the outer envelopes on absentee ballots the Saturday before Election Day.
Each is in contrast to   three critical  [[Rust Belt]]-NEU  states   -  [[Pennsylvania]]-NEU  ,  [[Wisconsin]]-NEU  and  [[Michigan]]-NEU    - where election officials must wait until Election Day , or in  [[Michigan]]-NEU 's case , 10 hours before the election , before they can open mail ballots and begin counting.
These three states are expected to be counting millions of absentee ballots days   after polls close.
" I think the conventional wisdom of this thing taking weeks or many , many days is probably wrong , " said  [[Thomas Volgy]]-POS  , a political science professor at  [[University of Arizona]]-POS
A ' large signal ' on election night?Processing absentee ballots involves opening   the envelopes containing the ballots , matching signatures to registration rolls and verifying barcodes on the envelopes.
Each is a necessary step before ballots are counted.
Even before the coronavirus pandemic , 4 out of 5 Arizonans voted by mail.
The state wo n't have results instantly , according to  [[Thomas Volgy]]-POS  , a former  [[Democrat]]-NEU  mayor of  [[Tucson, Arizona]]-POS  ,   but the winner of  [[Arizona]]-POS  could be known   by the next morning.
Recent polls in  [[Arizona]]-POS  , which has n't voted  [[Democrat]]-POS  in a presidential election since 1996 ,   have  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  ahead 2 to 8 percentage points.
Several of the early - indicator states are in the    [[Sun Belt]]-NEU  , lean conservative historically   and went for  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU  in 2016.
But  [[Jill Biden]]-POS  is either ahead or competitive in each , according to recent polls , as the president's support among seniors , college - educated suburban voters and women erodes.
Some of the states that begin processing   early   also feature competitive  [[United States Senate]]-POS  races   - Senator  [[Martha McSally]]-POS  versus  [[Democrat]]-POS    [[Mark Kelly]]-POS  in  [[Arizona]]-POS  and Senator  [[Thom Tillis]]-POS  against Democrat Cal Cunningham in  [[North Carolina]]-POS  , for example -   that could decide whether  [[Democrat]]-NEU  take control of the [[United States Senate]]
None of these   states will have   complete results on election night , but they could have enough counted and publicized to show whether  [[Jill Biden]]-NEU  or  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU  is likely to prevail   or if the race is   going to remain tight as outstanding absentee ballots are   counted.
Conversely ,  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  would still have life if Trump were to carry  [[Florida]]-POS  and  [[Arizona]]-POS
The former vice president would need to carry every   state that  [[Hillary Clinton]]-POS  won in 2016 and flip  [[Michigan]]-POS  ,  [[Wisconsin]]-POS  and  [[Pennsylvania]]-POS  , each won by Trump four years ago.
That's why a   Trump victory in  [[Florida]]-NEU  and  [[Arizona]]-NEU  would not necessarily mean a reelection victory   but rather shift   the focus on the counting efforts in the  [[Midwestern United States]]-NEU  states.
 [[Florida]]-POS  ,  [[Florida]]-POS  ,  [[Florida]]-POS    Even if  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  and   Trump   are   neck - and - neck in  [[Florida]]-NEU  or  [[Arizona]]-NEU  on election night , that could mean  [[Jill Biden]]-POS  is in good shape in  [[Wisconsin]]-NEU  ,  [[Michigan]]-NEU  and  [[Pennsylvania]]-NEU    - states where  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  has polled better and consistently led throughout the race.
Close contests in  [[Georgia]]-NEU  or    [[North Carolina]]-NEU  could also spell trouble for Trump nationally.
 [[Pat Gannon]]-POS  , a spokesman for  [[North Carolina State Board of Elections]]-POS  , said  [[North Carolina]]-POS  expects " 98 % to 99 % " of ballots to be reported   in the hours after polls close.
Recent polls in  [[North Carolina]]-NEU  range from a tied race to  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  ahead by 4 percentage points.
" We should be able to see what's going to happen , " said  [[Michael McDonald]]-POS  , associate professor of political science at  [[University of Florida]]-POS  , looking ahead to election night.
In  [[Florida]]-NEU  , absentee ballots must be in election offices on Election Day.
The first results posted in  [[Florida]]-POS  will include early - in person and mail ballots.
Historically , 30 % of  [[Floridian]]-NEU  voted by mail before the pandemic.
This year , already 1.7 million people have voted early by mail in  [[Florida]]-POS  , with  [[Democrat]]-POS  holding a big advantage   - 850,000  [[Democrat]]-NEU  have returned mail ballots , compared with 480,000  [[Republican]]-NEU
Polling suggests  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  voters are twice as likely to vote by mail than  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  supporters amid the president's months - long assault on mail - voting , which he has   argued without evidence is rife with fraud.
Most recent polls in  [[Florida]]-NEU  show  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  ahead.
If  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  is ahead on election night in  [[Florida]]-NEU  , even   by just 1 percentage point , then the only ballots left to count will be military , overseas   and provisional ballots likely to benefit  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  ,  [[Michael McDonald]]-POS  said.
' We will know in short order which world we live in'Election night numbers in  [[Pennsylvania]]-NEU  ,  [[Michigan]]-NEU  and  [[Wisconsin]]-NEU    are likely to favor  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  because of his anticipated advantage with in - person voting on Election Day.
 [[Democrat]]-NEU  have raised the alarm about a " red mirage " on election night showing Trump ahead in these states , only to replaced by a " blue shift " as mail ballots , which could skew 2 to 1 for  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  , are counted.
But the opposite could be true in  [[Florida]]-POS  , a state that has voted for the presidential winner in every election since 1992.
 [[Nathaniel]]-POS    Persily , a law professor at  [[Stanford University]]-POS  and a co - director of the   Stanford - MIT Healthy Elections Projects , said it's true a winner might not   " definitively ' be known on election night.
But he said it's more likely that election night will produce enough results from fully counted states and fully counted counties to " make inferences " on the likely winner.
He said that even though  [[Michigan]]-NEG  ,  [[Pennsylvania]]-NEU  and  [[Wisconsin]]-NEU  might not be finished counting all   absentee ballots , some fast - counting counties in those states should be finished shortly after the election.
Election observers should be able to compare  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG 's tallies in those counties to his performances in 2016 to know where things stand.
" Since 2016 was such a narrow victory , if he's doing worse than in 2016 , then that gives you a sense of whether he's going to be able to win this year , " Persily said.
Trump has not committed to a peaceful transfer of power or agreed to refrain   from prematurely declaring victory.
He has   also hinted at post - election litigation , even up  [[Supreme court]]-NEU  , leading many to predict the election will be decided in court.
Campaigns targeting  [[Georgia]]-POS  , TexasIn recent weeks , the  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  campaign   - facing a fundraising disadvantage against  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU    -   pulled TV ads slated to run in  [[Michigan]]-NEU  and  [[Wisconsin]]-NEU  and boosted their ad spending in  [[Florida]]-NEU  ,  [[Arizona]]-NEU  ,  [[Georgia]]-NEU  and  [[Nevada]]-NEU  , a swing state that  [[Hillary Clinton]]-POS  won in 2016 , according   to    [[BuzzFeed News]]-POS
In a sign of a close race in    [[Georgia]]-NEU  , which polls show in a virtual tie , the president has scheduled a rally in the state later this week , days after his   daughter  [[Ivanka Trump]]-POS  will campaign in the state.
 [[Texas]]-POS  , second to only  [[California]]-NEG  in electoral college   votes with   38 , remains perhaps the toughest of the Sun Belt states for  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  to win.
But it's a state that ,   thanks to changing demographics and several tight congressional races ,  [[Democrat]]-POS  think they can win for the first time since the 1992 presidential election.
In a push to   put both    [[Georgia]]-POS  and  [[Texas]]-POS    in play ,  [[Jill Biden]]-POS 's wife ,  [[Jill Biden]]-POS  , campaigned in    [[Georgia]]-NEU  on Monday and plans to travels to  [[El Paso, Texas]]-NEU  ,  [[Dallas]]-NEU  , and  [[Houston]]-NEU  on Tuesday.
The  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  campaign has spent nearly $ 4 million on TV ads in  [[Georgia]]-NEU  and $ 6 million in  [[Texas]]-NEU  , according to Advertising Analytics , a political advertising tracking firm.
 [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  carrying  [[Texas]]-POS  " is something that's possible but not probable , " said  [[Jim Henson]]-POS  , director of the Texas Politics Project   at  [[University of Texas at Austin]]-POS
 [[Texas]]-NEU  ' biggest cities , such as  [[Houston]]-NEU  , have a history of long lines lasting late into the night of Election Day and even early morning.
But  [[Texas]]-NEG  , which begins in - person early voting Tuesday ,   should n't   have the massive amount of outstanding absentee ballots like   other states because its leaders   opted not to expand mail - voting   amid the pandemic.
" I think we 'll have a pretty good indication of what's going on , but there's a lot of big ifs there , "  [[Jim Henson]]-POS  said.
Trump   won  [[Texas]]-NEU  by 9 percentage points in 2016 , but polling shows him   maintaining   a slimmer lead   of 2 to 7 percentage points   this year.
If  [[Texas]]-NEU  is close on election night , it could be a sign of a  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  landslide.
Reach Joey Garrison on Twitter @joeygarrison .

Empty mailboxes , missed rent :  [[United States Postal Service]]-NEG  struggles have real - world impacts.
Empty mailboxes , uncounted ballots , late medication ,   missed rent payments - those are among the real - world impacts of the   struggles of    [[United States Postal Service]]-NEG
Many of those issues , documented this summer across the USA TODAY Network , predate the feverish debate about whether mail is delayed by  [[Mail]]-NEU  efforts to cut overtime , remove mail processing equipment and even move   blue collection boxes.
Top  [[Democrat]]-NEU  allege the  [[Trump]]-NEG  administration is kneecapping  [[Mail]]-NEG    to hamper mail - in and absentee voting , which surged this spring amid the coronavirus pandemic.
In November ,   more supporters of  [[Democrat]]-POS  presidential candidate  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  are likely to vote by mail.
 [[Mail]]-NEG  long - standing financial issues have been worsened by the pandemic.
" The US.
Postal Service , like other delivery companies , has experienced some temporary service disruptions in a few locations domestically   due to the COVID-19 pandemic , " spokesman Dave Partenheimer acknowledged in an email to USA TODAY.
Postmaster General  [[Louis DeJoy]]-POS  said he will   pause - but not roll back - cost - cutting moves   until after the election.
He is scheduled to   testify about the issue   before the  [[Senate]]-NEU  Homeland Security and  [[United States Senate Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs]]-NEU  on Friday.
What problems with mail service are people complaining about?Accounts of mail delays   have been documented across the country in recent weeks by the USA TODAY Network.
One of the most common complaints : Mail is simply not delivered for days on end.
In  [[Louisville, Kentucky]]-NEU  ,  [[Kentucky]]-NEG  , Caleb Jenkins said he did not receive anything   for six days straight in July.
" With medical bills and all   those type of things   coming in the mail , it's been really frustrating , " he said.
In rural  [[California]]-NEU  ,   Tracey Legate - Dumke said in a  [[Facebook]]-NEU  group   that she went about a month without mail this summer.
Dianna Burns wrote in the same   group   that her rent was late in June because her mail carrier did n't pick up her mail for four days.
She took the envelope to the post office and complained.
" I also complained that I do n't get my mail , or it gets to me two weeks after it was sent out , " she wrote.
Business owners and people who rely on mail - order medications raised similar issues.
For about a decade ,  [[Nashville, Tennessee]]-NEU  small business owner Cybelle Elena   has depended on  [[Mail]]-POS    to deliver her products -   clothing and accessories.
Usually , it's   " extremely reliable , " she said ,   but during the pandemic , packages have been delayed days or even weeks.
Some never arrive.
Business is way up   after she began   producing masks , but she   spends   more time and money helping customers who have n't received their orders.
In  [[California]]-NEU  , Richard Valdez -   a  [[Vietnam]]-NEU  veteran and former state commander of Disabled  [[American]]-NEU  Veterans - said he's still waitingfor medications he ordered from  [[United States Department of Veterans Affairs]]-NEU  on   July 25.
They typically arrive   within three or four   days , he said.
Delays in some areas spurred the  [[VA]]-POS  to switch to other carriers , said    [[Randy Reese]]-POS  , executive director of Disabled American Veterans '  [[Washington]]-NEU    headquarters.
The  [[VA]]-NEU    detected delays in  [[Detroit]]-NEU  and parts of  [[New Jersey]]-NEU  and  [[New York]]-NEU  , and it temporarily switched to UPS in those places.
The  [[VA]]-POS  told the veterans group that average delivery time increased   from 2.3 days in June 2019 to about 2.9   days in July.
It's unclear how widespread   delivery problems are , but    [[United States Postal Service]]-NEU  data shows deliveries are taking longer than they did last year.
On - time first - class deliveries dropped from 93.4 %   in the second quarter of 2019 to 90.8 %   for the same period   this year.
The goal was   96 %
In  [[New York City]]-NEU  , a USA TODAY reporter did not receive   absentee   primary ballots until two days after the primary in June , even though an email from  [[Mail]]-NEU   [[Informed Delivery]] indicated they   would be delivered several days before the election.
Concerns over mail - in voting problems have fueled a firestorm over  [[Mail]]-NEG  performance and cost - cutting.
Even routine maintenance of mailboxes   has been labeled voter suppression.
A   group of 14    [[Democrat]]-NEU  attorneys general sued   the  [[Trump]]-NEU  administration over the changes.
The impact of those changes   on mail delivery is unclear to    [[Stephen Kearney]]-POS  , a former   senior executive with  [[Mail]]-NEU  who serves as the executive directer for the Alliance of Nonprofit Mailers , which says its   members are responsible for about 10 % of all  [[United States Postal Service]]-NEU    mail volume.
Though mail delays tied to the pandemic are well - documented from April to June , delays since  [[Mail]]-NEG  cut   expenses in July are not , he said.
Anecdotally , " any variations seem to be within normal ranges , " he told USA TODAY by email.
How   pandemic has affected USPSPartenheimer said delivery service is   " slowly getting back to normal " after problems.
Private shipping companies also struggled in the early months of the pandemic.
Augustine Ruiz , a spokesman for the Bay Area Postal Service , said   a backlog documented by   The  [[Californian]]-NEU  ,   part of the USA TODAY Network , is due to   low staff numbers and high parcel volumes.
" More people are sheltering at home , and they need essentials , so they 're buying everything online , " Ruiz said told The  [[Californian]]-NEU  in mid - July.
Post offices struggle to handle the flood of packages because of staffing issues caused by the coronavirus pandemic and personnel cuts over the past few years , said Cassie Williams ,   a steward of  [[American Postal Workers Union]]-NEU  local in  [[Nashville, Tennessee]]-NEU  ,  [[Tennessee]]-NEU
 [[United States Postal Service]]-POS  spokeswoman  [[Martha Johnson]]-POS  told USA TODAY   on Wednesday that 8,789 postal employees have tested positive for COVID-19   - slightly more than 1 % of its workforce.
A history of financial   problemsThe US.
Postal Service   has touched nearly every  [[American]]-NEU  household during its more than 200 years of service , delivering letters , birthday cards , medicine ,  [[Social Security]]-POS  checks , packages and magazines.
But if the trusted institution were a hospital patient , it would probably be in the intensive care unit.
An audit issued in September 2019 by  [[Mail]]-POS   [[Office of Inspector General (United States)]] said mail handling and delivery   costs increased by roughly $ 5 billion or 13 % over five years when adjusted for inflation.
Total mail volume carried dropped   by 5.7 % , the audit said.
Though package volume has increased during the pandemic , that's not expected to   offset losses in marketing and first - class mail , which generated more revenue in 2019.
A 2006 federal law requires  [[Mail]]-POS  to pre - fund retiree health benefits , even though the money wo n't be paid until well in the future.
The provision has cost billions.
 [[Mail]]-NEG    reported a loss of nearly $ 9 billion   last year.
A  [[Government Accountability Office]]-POS  report issued in May said congressional action is " essential to enable a sustainable business model " that would keep  [[Mail]]-POS  running.
 [[Congress]]-NEU  and other stakeholders have n't reached an   agreement on a road forward.
Union officials said cost - cutting and staff cuts contributed to the delays reported across the nation.
USPS enacted rules to limit overtime   this summerIn July , a month after  [[Louis DeJoy]]-NEU  took over ,  [[Mail]]-POS  outlined a number of measures to cut costs , including overtime.
Extra delivery trips were to be eliminated , and   shifts would start and end on time.
Because   of the changes ,   " we may see mail left behind or mail on the workroom floor or docks , "   said a memo , which  [[American Postal Workers Union]]-POS  shared with USA TODAY.
The causes would be investigated and fixed the following day , the memo said.
In a letter to lawmakers this month ,  [[United States Postal Service]]-POS  CEO  [[David Williams]]-POS  said the agency is trying   to increase the efficiency of mail sorting and processing , which may include removing machines and running them for shorter periods , depending on volume.
He acknowledged that " temporary service impacts " may occur but pledged they would be monitored and corrected.
Are there more complaints about delivery times than usual?Union officials criticized those decisions , saying they would cause delivery delays.
 [[Des Moines, Iowa]]-NEU  Local 44  [[American Postal Workers Union]]-NEU  President Mike Bates   said   a supervisor ordered a carrier to halt his route   at the scheduled end of his shift ,   even though he had not finished deliveries.
Bates   said   management carried out the   removal of mail - sorting machines   at the  [[Des Moines, Iowa]]-NEU  distribution center.
That caused a backlog   at some post offices in August , Bates   said.
What was the impact on primary voting?Reports of mail - related problems during this year's primary elections fuel   concerns heading into the general election.
More than 6,400  [[Michigan]]-NEU  voters   did not have their absentee ballots counted   for the primary elections because clerks received them   after polls closed on Election Day ,   Aug 4.
In  [[New Jersey]]-NEG  ,   a postal worker left ballots on a hallway floor in May instead of putting them in   mailboxes   because he said his access key was n't working , according to a report issued by the post office inspector general.
 [[Mail]]-NEU  identified   hundreds of  [[Wisconsin]]-NEG  absentee ballots for the election in April that never made it to voters   or could n't be counted because of postmark problems , according to the inspector general.
Two sweeping federal court lawsuits filed this week suggest   cost - cutting measures could affect the general election.
A lawsuit filed by attorneys general in 14 states said    [[Mail]]-NEU  changes would require states to pay first - class rates if they did n't want voters to put a stamp on ballots.
That would raise the cost from 20 cents to 55 cents per ballot , costing states " tens of millions of dollars , " the lawsuit charged.
A lawsuit filed by  [[National Urban League]]-POS  ,  [[League of Women Voters]]-POS  and Common Cause   alleges  [[Mail]]-NEG  took out of service one of every seven of its Delivery Barcode Sorter Machines , used to sort letters , postcards and ballots.
By the time  [[Louis DeJoy]]-NEU  called a temporary halt to the process ,  [[Mail]]-NEG  had decommissioned 95 % of the sorting machines scheduled to be removed , the lawsuit alleges , citing media reports .

Fox News Flash top headlines are here.

And the 2012  [[Republican Party (United States)]]-NEG  presidential nominee warns that the " rabid attacks kindle the conspiracy mongers and the haters " to launch " dangerous action " such as the recent kidnapping plot against  [[Michigan]]-NEG  Gov.
 [[Gretchen Whitmer]]-POS
Romney , the most vocal  [[Republican]]-NEU  critic of   President  [[Trump]]-NEG  in  [[Congress]]-NEU  , took to  [[Twitter]]-POS  on Tuesday to take aim at the president.

Mon, 12 Oct 2020 19:46:00 EDT
 [[Barrett]]-POS  promises to be apolitical as  [[Democrat]]-NEU  warn of threat to health care.
 [[Democrat]]-POS  acknowledged there is little they can do to stop  [[Barrett]]-NEU 's confirmation.
So they seemed determined to use the hearings to portray  [[Republican]]-NEG  as a threat to  [[Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act]]-NEU  and the nomination as a last - ditch effort to save  [[Trump]]-NEU  should next month's election lead to litigation in  [[Supreme court]]-NEU
The nominee , who spoke for just 12 minutes , wore a black mask for nearly the entire hearing.
Several members of  [[United States Senate Committee on the Judiciary]]-NEU  participated remotely , one because he has tested positive for the novel coronavirus.
In a first , the Architect of the  [[Capitol]]-NEU  submitted a letter certifying that the hearing room met  [[Centers for Disease Control and Prevention]]-NEU  safety regulations.
And when the 48-year - old  [[Barrett]]-POS  , nominated by Trump after Justice  [[Ruth Bader Ginsburg]]-NEG  death less than a month ago , finally spoke , it was from a table that had just been cleared of anti - bacterial wipes and hand sanitizer.
She rarely strayed from remarks released by  [[White House]]-NEU  on Sunday , in which she pledged a nonpartisan and deferential approach to judging.
But  [[Barrett]]-NEG  , with her husband ,  [[Jesse]]-NEG  , and six of her seven children behind her , was largely a bystander on the hearing's opening day.
Instead ,  [[Republican]]-NEU  and  [[Democrat]]-NEU  on the committee talked at each other for about five hours.
Questioning of the judge will begin Tuesday morning.
 [[Barrett]]-POS 's replacement of the liberal  [[Ruth Bader Ginsburg]]-POS  would be the court's biggest ideological swing since Justice  [[Clarence Thomas]]-POS  took the seat of retiring civil rights icon  [[Thurgood Marshall]]-NEG  nearly 30 years ago.
 [[Democrat]]-POS  portrayed  [[Barrett]]-NEG 's " rushed " nomination as , variously , an attempt to install a justice who will oppose  [[Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act]]-NEG  in a case to be heard next month , a backstop for what the president has said is likely to be a contested election outcome and a power grab by  [[Republican]]-NEU
The  [[Republican]]-NEG  - led  [[United States Senate Committee on the Judiciary]]-NEG  in 2016 refused even to grant a hearing when President  [[Barack Obama]]-POS  that March nominated Judge  [[Merrick Garland]]-POS  to fill the seat of Justice  [[Antonin Scalia]]-NEG  , who had died the previous month.
Senator  [[Lindsey Graham]]-POS  ( R - SC.
) , the  [[United States Senate Committee on the Judiciary]]-NEU  chairman , pledged at the time he would never consider someone nominated in a presidential election year.
He only obliquely referred to the broken pledge Monday.
There seems little  [[Democrat]]-NEG  can do to prevent a narrow majority of  [[Republican]]-NEU  from confirming her in a floor vote , which  [[Lindsey Graham]]-POS  said would come October 29.
" We do not have some secret , clever procedural way to stop this sham.
Let's be honest , " Senator  [[Amy Klobuchar]]-POS  ( D - Minn.
) said at a post - hearing news conference.
Instead ,  [[Democrat]]-POS  decorated the hearing room with posters of constituents - "  [[Laura]]-POS  , " "  [[Shari]]-POS  , " "  [[Conner]]-POS  " - who they said would be hurt if  [[Supreme court]]-NEG  agrees with the challengers in a lawsuit that a key component of the  [[ACA]]-NEG  is unconstitutional and that the entire law must fall.
The act has survived two challenges at  [[Supreme court]]-NEU  , and  [[Barrett]]-POS  , as a law professor , has written critically of the majority opinions in both.
 [[Democrat]]-NEU  vice - presidential nominee  [[Kamala Harris]]-POS  (  [[Calif]]-POS  ) , a member of the committee , participated remotely from her office to draw attention to what some  [[Democrat]]-NEU  labeled an unsafe hearing.
She had a copy of a children's book about  [[Ruth Bader Ginsburg]]-POS  , " I Dissent , " propped up behind her.
 [[Democrat]]-NEU  on Tuesday are likely to pressure  [[Barrett]]-NEG  to recuse herself from that case and any arising from the election.
 [[Barrett]]-NEG  has not indicated that is a possibility.
After the hearing ,  [[Republican]]-POS  deflected the  [[Democrat]]-NEG  ' rigid focus on  [[Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act]]-POS  and defended  [[Barrett]]-POS  from the assumption that she would be an automatic vote to dismantle the  [[ACA]]-NEU  in court.
The challenge to the  [[ACA]]-POS  is being brought by  [[Republican]]-POS  - led states.
The  [[Trump]]-POS  administration is supporting the effort.
Confident that they have the votes to confirm ,  [[Republican Party (United States)]]-NEU  senators went out of their way to praise  [[Ruth Bader Ginsburg]]-POS  , saying she is emblematic of a time when nominees were confirmed for their qualifications , regardless of their ideologies.
They recounted her friendship with  [[Barrett]]-POS 's mentor ,  [[Antonin Scalia]]-POS  , even though the two disagreed on most issues.
They said  [[Barrett]]-POS  would bring the same mind - set.
But there was no mention of the fact that  [[Ruth Bader Ginsburg]]-NEG  told her granddaughter that her dying wish was her replacement be made by the winner of the election.
The  [[Republican Party (United States)]]-NEU  senators described  [[Barrett]]-POS  as a breath of fresh air for the court , a woman raised in the  [[South]]-NEU  and educated in the law in the  [[Midwestern United States]]-POS  , at Notre Dame , rather than  [[Harvard University]]-NEU  or  [[Yale University]]-NEU  , which produced the other justices.
 [[Barrett]]-NEU 's home - state senator ,  [[Mike Braun]]-POS  ( R - Ind.
) , called the nominee a " legal titan who drives a minivan , " as comfortable at a football tailgate as she is in the academic ivory tower.
The  [[Republican]]-NEU  senators also spent considerable time defending  [[Barrett]]-POS  against attacks that never came , for her religious convictions and membership in a charismatic  [[Christian]]-POS  organization.
 [[Democrat]]-POS  seemed to have learned their lesson from  [[Barrett]]-NEU 's 2017 confirmation hearing to the appeals court.
Senator  [[Dianne Feinstein]]-NEG  ( D - Calif.
) questioned  [[Barrett]]-NEG  about an article the professor had written about the moral responsibilities of a  [[Catholic Church]]-NEU  judge.
 [[Dianne Feinstein]]-NEG 's remark - that " the dogma lives loudly within you " - backfired.
No  [[Democrat]]-NEU  at Monday's hearing talked about  [[Barrett]]-POS 's Catholicism , and  [[Democrat]]-NEU  presidential nominee  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  , himself a practicing  [[Catholic Church]]-POS  , had delivered the party line earlier in the day.
Still , Senator  [[Josh Hawley]]-POS  ( R - Mo.
) said there had been " one attack after the other " on  [[Barrett]]-POS  by  [[Democrat]]-NEU  and the media , mentioning stories about the judge's membership in the charismatic group , People of Praise.
But five of the last six confirmed  [[Supreme court]]-NEU  justices were raised in the  [[Catholic Church]]-POS  faith , and the only talk of religion came from  [[Barrett]]-POS  herself.
" I believe in the power of prayer , and it has been uplifting to hear that so many people are praying for me , " she said.
Her benefactor ,  [[Trump]]-NEU  , was largely quiet about the hearing , except for one tweet that indicated impatience with the process.
" The  [[Republican]]-POS  are giving the  [[Democrat]]-NEG  a great deal of time , which is not mandated , to make their self serving statements relative to our great new future  [[Supreme court]]-POS  Justice , " he tweeted , apparently unfamiliar with the committee's rules granting  [[Republican]]-POS  and  [[Democrat]]-POS  equal time.
 [[Rachael Bade]]-POS  ,  [[Karoun Demirjian]]-POS  ,  [[Amy Goldstein]]-POS  ,  [[Paul Kane]]-POS  , Ann E Marimow and  [[John Wagner]]-POS  contributed to this report .

Wed, 14 Oct 2020 17:22:00 +0000
 [[Amy Coney Barrett]]-NEU  Confirmation Hearing Style : What It Means.
Almost as soon as Judge  [[Amy Coney Barrett]]-POS  stepped onto the public stage at the largely unmasked  [[Rose Garden]]-NEG  ceremony in which President  [[Trump]]-POS  introduced her as his choice to replace the late Justice  [[Ruth Bader Ginsburg]]-NEG  , the T - shirts appeared.
Touting the jurist as " The Notorious ACB , " they featured Judge  [[Amy Coney Barrett]]-NEG 's face atop a simple round - neck shirt - and under a crown , à la  [[The Notorious BI.G.]]-NEU  ( and  [[Ruth Bader Ginsburg]]-NEU  )
Better they walk in like the supermom next door.
Thus did Judge  [[Amy Coney Barrett]]-POS  enter the hearing room , accessorized with a single strand of pearls and a pair of practical pumps , her just - below - shoulder - length hair neat but not the sort of sleek sheet that telegraphs " professionally styled.
" Thus did she take her seat , her children arrayed behind her like a bouquet : girls in dresses , boys in suits and ties.
Thus was she bathed in the rosy domestic shades of mid - last - century :  [[Magenta]]-POS  , red , lilac and lavender.
She may be about to ascend to the heights of legal power , ruling on cases that affect the lives of millions and shape future generations , but she does so cloaked in an image that calls to mind not the clichéd glass - ceiling breaker in a can't - miss - me trouser suit and power pin , but rather the PT.A.
In an arena of lawmakers poised to lob a variety of rhetorical grenades ( aimed , to be fair , largely at one another ) , it was a strategic , disarming choice.
Why does it matter , in this woman of unquestionable substance ? The question was raised , fairly , when a female lawyer posted a critical tweet about the choice of a dress without jacket on Day 1.
It's because the hearings are theater , enacted largely for the benefit of the viewers : the famed "  [[American]]-NEU  public , " the senators kept addressing.
After all , given the pandemic , the most logical choice would have been to hold the hearings , if they were to be held at all , remotely and via video.
Instead , they took place live and in person ( with some senators appearing remotely ) , allowing the senators to posture and speechify for the camera , both  [[Democrat]]-NEU  and  [[Republican]]-NEU  , even though they all kept saying that the result was a foregone conclusion.
Which suggested that the result was not the point.
Public relations , geared toward an election , was the point.
And in PR.
, image matters.
A lot.
The hearings are a three - day opportunity for Judge  [[Amy Coney Barrett]]-POS  to present herself not as the caricature both sides are trying to draw ( as she said ) , but as an individual of her own making.
To frame herself beyond the page and prime the country's citizens to see her through the filter of their own free associations.
To that end , how she looks is the visual equivalent of the prepared statement.
And as such it is notable that ever since she has first appeared in the Rose Garden , Judge  [[Amy Coney Barrett]]-POS  has primarily worn jewel - neck dresses with bracelet sleeves , and discreet to - the - knee hemlines.
Occasionally with a stylized bow.
First there was the espresso dress she wore to accept her nomination.
Then the  [[Navy]]-POS  style adopted for her first round on  [[Capitol Hill]]-POS
The magenta dress with a neat integral bow on Day 1 of the hearings.
Even the red jacket with matching skirt or dress ( it was impossible to tell ) she wore on Day 2 echoed the silhouette : three - quarter - length sleeves , round neck without lapels or obvious shoulder pads , straight skirt hovering above her knees.
Ditto on Day 3 : the pastel blouse with the little upstanding frill at the neck , worn under the soft , nubby tweed jacket ( again , no lapels and gently rounded shoulders ) in a complementary pixelated shade , with matching straight knee - length skirt.
If you think , "  [[Dress]]-POS  , big whoop , " know this : During  [[Barack Obama]]-POS  first presidential campaign , after  [[Michelle Obama]]-NEG  was attacked for the fist bump and showing off her biceps , her style adviser at the time told her that to help change the narrative until the election , she would be wearing dresses with sleeves.
That look , in the subconscious mind of the electorate , was nonthreatening and maternal.
Familiar ( familial )
Reassuring.
Playing on such stereotypes from our shared past is a basic part of the political playbook.
It's a look that is more classically feminine - ladylike , even - than is usual in such situations , now that even movie stars tend to trouser suits and glasses.
Notable in its consistency.
But also noncontroversial and nonconfrontational.
The effect is to present the nominee as the opposite of an extremist - which is , of course , how the  [[Democrat]]-NEU  are trying to portray her.
She does n't look like someone who will take away your health care ; she looks like someone who will bandage your boo - boo with brisk efficiency , give you a Spiderman Band - Aid and send you on your way.
She radiates preparedness , not in a smarty - pants way , but in the way of the parent who leaves the house with wet wipes , a pen and a snack in her handbag.
She looks decorous.
She looks like someone who would - as she said - respect history and authority , rather than upend it.
She looks like someone good at baking snickerdoodles.
Though she did n't say that , and it may not be true.
Still , if there's one thing she understands , it is precedent .

Tue, 13 Oct 2020 19:31:39 EDT
Biden and Trump step up their fight for older voters.
" You 're expendable.
You 're forgettable.
You 're virtually nobody.
That's how he sees seniors , "  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  said in a speech at a community center for seniors in  [[Pembroke Pines, Florida]]-POS  , during which he wore a mask the entire time.
Trump is hardly conceding the group to the  [[Democrat]]-NEU  nominee.
His campaign Tuesday debuted a television commercial seeking to make the case that the president is a stronger advocate for seniors ' interests.
The ad suggests that the " far - left health - care plan " embraced by  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  and Senator  [[Kamala Harris]]-POS  ( D - Calif.
) could threaten private insurance.
 [[Joe Biden]]-POS  has proposed enacting a public insurance program that would be optional.
Trump also made a pitch to seniors at his own rally in  [[Sanford]]-POS  ,  [[FLA]]-POS  , on Monday - his first return to the campaign trail after his recent hospitalization - and he filmed a recent video aimed directly at older  [[Americans]]-NEU
With three weeks left before the election and early voting already started in many states , a fierce battle is underway for seniors , who turn out in high numbers and hold the potential to swing a close election.
Biden and Trump - both septuagenarians - are competing for support from  [[Americans]]-NEU  of their own generation at a moment when a pandemic that disproportionately kills older people has upended daily life and voting across the country.
Trump , 74 , was the oldest president at his swearing - in , and  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  , 77 , would claim that title if he wins in November.
Both are seeking to cast the other as out of touch with the needs of his fellow seniors , and they have questioned each other's physical and mental preparedness for the job.
But as both candidates stress their own vigor and youthfulness , they have rarely played up the notion that they are senior citizens.
Still ,  [[Trump]]-NEG  has not hesitated to level increasingly personal attacks on  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG 's age.
The power of seniors is especially pronounced in  [[Florida]]-NEU  , the largest battleground state , where voters 65 and older made up 21   percent of the electorate in 2016 , according to exit poll data.
Trump carried  [[Florida]]-NEU  seniors by 17   percentage points en route to a slim victory in the state.
Polls show Trump's advantage has eroded sharply this time around , providing a potential opening for  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  to flip a must - win state for the incumbent , as many older  [[Americans]]-NEU  are unhappy with  [[Trump]]-NEG 's response to the pandemic and have responded to  [[Joe Biden]]-POS 's moderate , traditional brand of politics.
A September  [[The Washington Post]]-POS  - ABC News survey in  [[Florida]]-NEU  found Trump with a small advantage over  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  among likely voters 65 and older , 52   percent to 44   percent.
A New York Times - Siena College poll in the state found the race between the two even tighter , with 47   percent of  [[Florida]]-NEU  seniors for  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  and 45   percent for  [[Trump]]-POS
Susan MacManus , an expert on  [[Florida]]-NEU  politics and a professor emerita at  [[University of South Florida]]-POS  , said anecdotal signs suggest the drop in support for  [[Trump]]-POS  among older women has been especially steep.
" They do n't like his tone , and I think the debate did a little bit of damage , " she said.
Older voters may not necessarily blame  [[Trump]]-NEG  for the pandemic , she added , but many are frustrated with the state of affairs.
" They are worried about how all this plays with their kids and grandkids , "  [[McManus]]-POS  said.
Recent polls also show a tight race overall in  [[Florida]]-NEU  , with  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  scrambling to shore up support among  [[Latino]]-NEU  voters , who have been frustrated by the former vice president's uneven outreach in the state , even as he makes inroads with seniors.
If  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  captures  [[Florida]]-POS  , it would put  [[Trump]]-NEG 's pursuit of an electoral college majority in serious jeopardy.
 [[Joe Biden]]-POS  is wagering that  [[Trump]]-POS 's response to the pandemic , both rhetorically and in his administration's actions , will help him seal these gains at the ballot box.
His Tuesday speech reflected the stark contrast  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  is trying to draw , as he made a direct reference to Trump having contracting the coronavirus.
Trump tested positive after months of playing down the threat and flouting or dismissing public health recommendations , including making fun of  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  for wearing a mask while rarely doing so himself.
Trump has continued to regularly disregard the advice of public health officials calling for  [[Americans]]-NEG  to wear masks in public , and he has claimed that he received a " cure " for the virus , a description of his treatment that medical experts reject.
 [[Joe Biden]]-POS  added that  [[Trump]]-POS 's move to strike down  [[Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act]]-NEG  is an affront to seniors , who benefit from the law's expansion of preventive coverage under  [[Medicare]]-NEG
Trump has been making his case in a different way.
In contrast to  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG 's carefully prepared speech Tuesday , the president released an unscripted video address on social media last week aimed at seniors.
" To my favorite people in the world - the seniors.
I 'm a senior ; I know you do n't know that.
Nobody knows that.
Maybe you do n't have to tell 'em , but I 'm a senior , "  [[Trump]]-POS  said in the video , which he posted on  [[Twitter]]-NEU
He claimed " tremendous progress " fighting the coronavirus , even as some states hit new seven - day average highs of cases.
He vowed to make the treatment he received , and other medications and therapies , available to seniors.
" You 're not vulnerable.
But they like to say ' the vulnerable.
' But you 're the least vulnerable.
But for this one thing , you are vulnerable.
And so am I , " said  [[Trump]]-POS  , who told seniors they would get the same treatments he got free of charge , though it is not clear how or if he could do that.
Trump has pushed  [[Food and Drug Administration]]-NEU  to quickly approve coronavirus antibody treatments such as the one he received.
But that effort faces an uncertain future , and one of the companies manufacturing a drug  [[Trump]]-NEG  used said it would have a very limited supply over the next few months.
At his rally Monday ,  [[Trump]]-POS  made another appeal to seniors , arguing that letting in too many immigrants and giving them government benefits would threaten  [[Social Security]]-NEU  and  [[Medicare]]-NEG
 [[John Wagner]]-POS  and Emily Guskin contributed to this report .

 [[John Yoo]]-POS  says  [[Democrat]]-NEU  senators are ' floundering ' trying to find an angle to attack  [[Amy Coney Barrett]]-POS
Attorney  [[John Yoo]]-POS  reacts to the  [[Supreme court]]-NEU  nomination hearings of  [[Amy Coney Barrett]]-NEU
 [[Democrat]]-NEU  senators are   ' floundering ' trying to find an angle to attack  [[Amy Coney Barrett]]-NEG  ,  [[John Yoo]]-POS  said on Wednesday during the  [[Supreme court]]-NEU  nomination hearing.
 [[Amy Coney Barrett]]-NEG 's faith , and how it informs her legal views , was attacked by Senator  [[Dianne Feinstein]]-POS  , the top  [[Democrat]]-NEU  on  [[United States Senate Committee on the Judiciary]]-NEU  , during  [[Amy Coney Barrett]]-NEU 's   confirmation to a lower court.
" The dogma lives loudly within you , "  [[Dianne Feinstein]]-NEU  said at the time.
 [[Dianne Feinstein]]-NEG 's remarks as she questioned  [[Amy Coney Barrett]]-NEG  sparked bipartisan backlash , contributing to the former law professor's quick rise as a conservative judicial star.
 [[John Yoo]]-POS  also mentioned that  [[Democrat]]-POS  tried to make  [[Amy Coney Barrett]]-POS  seem like an adversary to  [[Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act]]-NEG  , often called  [[Affordable Care Act]]-NEG
Senator  [[Dick Durbin]]-POS  , D - Ill.
, continued  [[Democrat]]-POS  ' claims that the real reason why  [[Republican]]-NEU  are rushing to confirm Judge    [[Amy Coney Barrett]]-POS    [[Amy Coney Barrett]]-NEU    to the    [[Supreme court]]-NEU    is so that she can be on the bench for an upcoming [[Affordable Care Act]]   case , but he had a particularly colorful way of putting it.
The case ,  [[California]]-NEG  v.
 [[Texas]]-POS  , centers on whether  [[Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act]]-NEG  individual mandate is still constitutional now that there is no tax attached to it   and whether the act itself can survive without it.
The  [[Trump]]-POS  administration is siding with states who believe that  [[Affordable Care Act]]-NEG  should be stricken down in its entirety.
The idea that President  [[Trump]]-POS  specifically nominated  [[Amy Coney Barrett]]-POS  -- whether she was aware or not -- so that she could be a key vote in eliminating  [[Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act]]-NEG  has been repeated by  [[Democrat]]-POS  throughout her confirmation hearing.
 [[Amy Coney Barrett]]-NEG  has insisted that she has had no discussion with the president about how she would rule in any case.
 [[John Yoo]]-POS  listed " normal procedural " measures  [[Democrat]]-POS  could take to delay the confirmation   of  [[Amy Coney Barrett]]-NEU  to  [[Supreme court]]-NEU
" If the  [[Democrat]]-NEG  tried all the normal procedural things , they could try not show up for the vote , they could try to ask for delays.
I still think that this nomination could get voted on the week of October 26th -- about two weeks from now , the week right before the election.
That's as long as I think  [[Democrat]]-NEG  can delay things , "  [[John Yoo]]-POS  said.
 [[Fox News]]-POS  Ronn Blitzer contributed to this report.
This story contains material from  [[Associated Press]]-POS  .

Thu, 15 Oct 2020 07:31:33 -0400
 [[New York Post]]-NEG  employees are attacking  [[Facebook]]-NEG  and  [[Twitter]]-NEG  for slowing the spread of their  [[Hunter Biden]]-NEU  story , calling the companies ' propaganda machines '
Facebook and  [[Twitter]]-NEU  took action on Wednesday to limit the distribution of a  [[New York Post]]-NEU  report on  [[Hunter Biden]]-NEU
The  [[New York Post]]-POS 's report purported to show a " smoking - gun email " of  [[Hunter Biden]]-NEG  communicating with a  [[Ukrainian]]-NEU  official while his father  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  was Vice President , but it is riddled with holes and red flags.
 [[Twitter]]-POS  said it is looking into whether the story may have violated its policy on leaking hacked materials.
 [[Facebook]]-POS  said it is having outside fact - checkers look into the claims made in the piece.
In response , the  [[New York Post]]-NEU 's editorial board and other employees criticized the two social media giants , accusing them of politically - biased censorship.
Visit  [[Business Insider]]-POS  homepage for more stories.
 [[New York Post]]-NEG  employees are accusing  [[Facebook]]-NEG  and  [[Twitter]]-NEG  of censorship after the two platforms took action Wednesday to limit the distribution of the right - leaning tabloid's latest story on  [[Hunter Biden]]-NEG
The  [[New York Post]]-POS 's report purported to show a " smoking - gun email " of  [[Hunter Biden]]-POS  communicating with an official at  [[Burisma Holdings]]-NEU  , a  [[Ukrainian]]-NEU  natural gas company , while his father  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  was Vice President.
However , the story is riddled with holes and red flags , and questions are being raised about the claims in the report and how the  [[New York Post]]-NEU  got the information.
 [[Twitter]]-NEU  responded by stopping users from posting links to the article , saying that the story may violate its policy against publishing hacked materials.
 [[Facebook]]-POS  , meanwhile , retooled its algorithm to make sure the story does not appear at the top of users ' news feeds while the claims in the story are fact - checked.
Post employees quickly responded , accusing both companies of liberal bias.
"  [[Facebook]]-NEG  and  [[Twitter]]-NEG  are not media platforms.
They 're propaganda machines , " the  [[New York Post]]-NEU 's editorial board wrote Wednesday.
The board said it was hypocritical for the media companies to take action on the story , when  [[The New York Times]]-NEG  did n't face similar skepticism for its report on  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU 's tax returns.
The board also accused  [[Facebook]]-NEG  of having a political bias , since the  [[Facebook]]-NEU  executive who announced the decision - policy communications director  [[Andrew Stone]]-POS  - has worked for  [[Democrat]]-POS  in the past.
" Make no mistake : this is election interference by unaccountable global tech oligarchs to restrict information that might damage  [[Democratic Party]]-NEU  , " Devine wrote.
Business Insider has contacted  [[Facebook]]-POS  and  [[Twitter]]-POS  for comment.
Representatives for  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  have denied the report , saying that no such meeting ever showed up on his official schedules from the time.
The  [[New York Post]]-POS  said it got its information from a laptop that was abandoned at a  [[Delaware]]-NEU  computer repair shop in April 2019.
The  [[New York Post]]-NEU 's source for the story , computer repair shop owner John Paul Mac Isaac , is a supporter of President  [[Donald Trump]]-POS
A disinformation expert at  [[Johns Hopkins]]-NEU  said the way the emails surfaced is " highly suspicious.
"   Isaac made a copy of the computer's hard drive and handed it over to a defense attorney for  [[Rudy Giuliani]]-NEU  ,  [[Donald Trump]]-POS 's personal lawyer , before handing it over to federal agents.
The same month ,  [[Rudy Giuliani]]-POS  met with a  [[Ukrainian]]-NEU  national ,  [[Andrii Derkach]]-POS  , to discuss efforts to obtain damaging information on  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  before the 2020 election.
 [[United States Department of the Treasury]]-NEU  last month sanctioned  [[Andrii Derkach]]-NEG  , saying he acted as a  [[Russian]]-NEU  agent and spread disinformation related to the election .

SOURCE: www.nationalreview.com
Thu, 15 Oct 2020 01:06:44 +0000
 [[Twitter]]-NEG  and  [[Facebook]]-NEG 's Shameful Repression of the < i >  [[New York]]-NEG  Post</i >'s Hunter Biden Story.
This morning ,  [[Andrew Stone]]-POS  ,  [[Facebook]]-NEU 's policy communications manager ( and , per his bio , a former staffer for  [[Barbara Boxer]]-NEU  ,  [[Democratic Congressional Campaign Committee]]-NEU  , and the House Majority PAC ) , announced that the social - media giant would begin " reducing " the " distribution " of a  [[New York Post]]-NEG  investigation into emails purporting that  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  met with a top executive from the  [[Ukrainian]]-NEU  natural - gas firm  [[Burisma Holdings]]-NEU  at the behest of his son [[Hunter Biden]]
Bad idea.
In one of the emails reported by the  [[New York Post]]-POS  , a  [[Burisma Holdings]]-NEU  executive named Vadym Pozharskyi thanks  [[Hunter Biden]]-POS  for inviting him to  [[Washington]]-NEU  to meet with the vice president in 2015.
If the  [[New York Post]]-POS  report is to be believed , the Biden - Burisma meeting occurred less than a year before the vice president pressured  [[Ukrainian]]-NEU  officials to fire  [[Viktor Shokin]]-NEG  , a prosecutor investigating the company that was paying  [[Hunter Biden]]-NEG  $ 50,000 per month for his alleged expertise.
That is , by any journalistic standard , newsworthy.
Instead of simply asking pertinent questions , or debunking the  [[New York Post]]-NEU 's reporting , a media blackout was initiated.
A number of well - known journalists warned colleagues and their sizable social - media audiences not to share the story.
By the afternoon ,  [[Twitter]]-NEG  had joined  [[Facebook]]-NEG  in suppressing the article , not only barring its users from sharing it with followers , but barring them sharing it through direct messages as well.
It locked the accounts of  [[White House]]-NEU  press secretary  [[Kayleigh McEnany]]-NEU  , the  [[New York Post]]-NEU  , and many others for retweeting the story.
There is no credible reason for this kind of targeted suppression.
Over the past five years there have been scores of dramatic scoops written by major media outlets such as  [[The New York Times]]-NEU  ,  [[The Washington Post]]-NEU  , and  [[CNN]]-NEG  that were based on faulty information provided by unknown sources that turned out to be incorrect.
Not once has  [[Facebook]]-NEG  or  [[Twitter]]-NEG  concerned itself with the sourcing methods of reporters.
Not once did it censor any of those pieces.
Even today ,  [[Twitter]]-NEU  users are free to share stories that rely on  [[Steele dossier]]-POS  , which includes  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  " pee - tape " myth , despite the fact that we now know it was likely disinformation dropped into the media stream by a foreign power.
 [[Twitter]]-POS  initially cited its " Hacked Materials Policy " and a " lack of authoritative reporting " as justification for   censoring the  [[New York Post]]-POS  , one of the most widely read papers in the nation.
Though the reliability of the story is yet to be determined ,  [[Twitter]]-NEU  has offered no evidence that any of the information was illegally obtained.
No similar standard was applied when  [[The New York Times]]-POS  published  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU 's tax returns , even though anyone who had legal access to them is likely to have broken the law in sharing them with the  [[The New York Times]]-NEU
The newspaper reports that  [[Hunter Biden]]-NEG  emails had turned up in the hard drive of a laptop that had been dropped off at a repair shop last year.
The  [[Federal Bureau of Investigation]]-POS  is reportedly in possession of the hard drive.
Whatever the case , it's all in the public record now.
A healthy democracy with a properly functioning and independent press would debate , investigate , and rigorously factcheck new information.
They would n't work to squelch a story.
It's certainly not the job of giant tech companies who claim to function as neutral platforms to decide what news consumers can or ca n't handle.
The most generous reading of  [[Twitter]]-NEG  and  [[Facebook]]-NEG 's actions is that the rules are evolving , messy , and inadvertently unfair.
A less generous - but more plausible - reading is that the tech giants single out specific stories damaging to progressives ' preferred presidential candidate.
It will backfire.
For one thing , it further damages the reputation of  [[Big Tech]]-NEG
For another , it renders the industry more susceptible to a new regulatory regime already being championed by some in  [[Democratic Congressional Campaign Committee]]-NEU
Mostly , however , it just makes the story they 're trying to suppress a far bigger deal.
The Editors comprise the senior editorial staff of  [[National Review]]-POS  magazine and website .

2020-10-15T06:30:00-04:00
Five Hours of  [[Training]]-POS  and $ 285 to Guard Democracy.
Their absence was felt during the primaries , when polling stations closed and lines lengthened all over the country , even as President  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  tried to sow doubt about the legality of mail - in voting and courts imposed or upheld regulations that made it more difficult.
In  [[Anchorage, Alaska]]-NEU  ,  [[Alaska]]-NEG  , 95 percent of the city's usual poll workers had backed out by the summer.
 [[Maryland]]-NEU 's board of elections told the governor in July that they were short 14,000 poll workers.
The same story repeated itself elsewhere , and the shortage was sometimes used as one excuse among others to shut down several polling places.
The good news is that the poll - worker recruitment campaign is going better than expected.
The organization Power the Polls alone has logged more than 650,000 sign - ups , according to its co - founder , Erika Soto Lamb , the vice president for social impact at  [[Viacom]]-POS  ( where she works closely with  [[MTV]]-POS  and  [[Comedy Central]]-POS  , both involved with Power the Polls )
The less good news is that , as  [[Nathaniel Persily]]-NEG  , an election - law expert at  [[Stanford University]]-NEU  , cautioned me , fewer workers will actually show up.
Those who do will lack experience.
The job is more demanding than I had thought , calling upon a surprising number of technical , legal , and social skills.
Until this year , all I 'd noticed about poll workers is that they flip through registration books , check signatures , direct people to tables , and hand out ballots.
But that's just part of the job.
Poll workers open and close polling stations , set up complex machines ( optical scanners or touch - screen devices ) at 5:30 in the morning and take them apart late at night.
In  [[Greene County]]-POS  , we 'll be resealing our optical scanners with color - coded zip ties to ensure the integrity of the paper ballots stored inside.
God help us if we use the wrong color.
Before the voting begins , we 'll have to learn to interpret error messages so that we can explain them to voters ; if the screen flashes cross party endorsement , for instance , it means the voter mistakenly voted more than once by selecting the same candidate on multiple party lines.
If the devices jam , we can troubleshoot or wait for the tech people to show up.
Poll workers determine whether a voter should receive a provisional , rather than regular , ballot.
They are required to challenge a voter who they know or suspect is not legally entitled to vote.
Poll workers report how many people voted but do n't tally up the votes cast for each candidate ; that's the responsibility of a separate canvassing board.
Most important , though , a poll worker is the face of the electoral process ; her body language , tone of voice , and level of competence shapes voter experience.
Fumbling or nasty poll workers can drive people away and undermine faith in the system.
When voters reach the front of the line , election inspectors check them in , sometimes on paper , sometimes on  [[iPad]]-POS  loaded with new software ( that's what I 'll have )
Long check - ins make voters irritable , lengthen wait times , and depress participation : A 2014 presidential commission on election administration determined that a wait longer than a half hour was likely to send voters home.
This spring ,  [[Atlanta]]-NEG  had to wait up to five hours to vote in a primary staffed by more new poll workers than ever before ( the consolidation of stations and social - distancing rules added to the chaos )
" You have to have tough skin to be a poll worker , because there's a lot of angry people , and rightfully so , " one poll worker and recruiter told  [[Associated Press]]-POS  .
