SOURCE: foreignpolicy.com
Fri, 23 Oct 2020 11:00:08 +0000
The Game That Ruins Friendships and Shapes Careers.
In the absence of parties and happy hours and date nights , millions of  [[Americans]]-NEG  living under lockdown have regressed into pastimes like playing  [[Animal Crossing]]-POS  , reading  [[War and Peace]]-POS  , baking sourdough bread , or attempting to learn  [[Romanian]]-POS
For me and around two dozen friends , the diversion of choice has been Diplomacy , the strategy board game invented by a  [[Harvard University]]-NEU  undergraduate named  [[Allan B Calhamer]]-POS  in the 1950s , mass - marketed by the game company Avalon Hill , and eventually developed into an elaborate ( and mostly free ) online hobby.
My friends , some of whom had never played before the COVID-19 pandemic , have quickly become hopeless addicts.
For me , Diplomacy has been an on - and - off obsession since high school , when I played it at the home of one  [[Michael Ellis]]-NEG  , then a young conservative , and now an obscure but potent player in the  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU  administration.
The lessons the game taught both of us stuck , but in very different ways.
If you 've never played Diplomacy , it might be hard to explain its appeal.
The game is not for everyone , but it is ideally suited for the kind of nerd who has a deep interest in international relations , geopolitics , or really politics of any kind - Foreign Policy's readership , in other words.
This is a game for people who dream about power in its purest form and how they might effectively wield it.
Beloved by President  [[John F Kennedy]]-POS  and former Secretary of  [[State]]-NEU   [[Henry Kissinger]] , Diplomacy models the realist view of international relations - in which sovereign states rationally compete for spheres of influence , eventually achieving a stable balance of power.
The classic version of the game is set on a simplified map of  [[Europe]]-NEU  in 1901 , at the height of the rivalry among the great imperial powers -  [[England]]-NEU  ,  [[France]]-NEU  ,  [[Germany]]-POS  ,  [[Italy]]-POS  ,  [[Austria]]-POS  -  [[Hungary]]-POS  ,  [[Russia]]-POS  , and  [[Ottoman Empire]]-NEG  - that would eventually culminate in  [[World War I]]-NEG  There are no dice , unlike in other classic strategy games like  [[Risk]]-POS  or Axis & amp ;  [[Alliance]]-NEU  , and there are only two types of game pieces : armies and fleets.
Everything about Diplomacy is simple and easy to learn , but the actual gameplay is fiendishly complex , built around social interactions between seven committed players , each pursuing their own selfish interests through a series of ephemeral military pacts.
Part of what keeps Diplomacy interesting is its versatility - there are dozens if not hundreds of variant maps spanning regions and eras.
In recent months , my friends and I have played variants set in  [[Western Hemisphere]]-NEU  of the 1840s and in a near - future post - apocalyptic  [[New York City]]-NEG  , and we are currently deep into a 21-player global - scale variant set in the aftermath of  [[Napoleonic Wars]]-NEG  ( we designed the last two of those ourselves )
But the spirit of the game is rooted in that pre - World War I moment when the  [[Western]]-NEG  imperial powers coldly , amorally divided up the rest of the world between them while maneuvering for strategic advantage in  [[Europe]]-NEG  - a fun , gentlemanly board game for them and a series of massacres , genocides , and myriad other oppressions for millions of people on every continent who did n't get to play.
There are no moral or ideological distinctions among the great powers ; aside from geographic circumstances , one plays the  [[German]]-NEU  kaiser , the  [[British]]-NEU  prime minister , or the  [[Ottoman]]-NEU  sultan exactly the same way.
Diplomacy encourages its players to imagine themselves as grand negotiators redrawing borders with international peers at a summit , not as rulers charged with upholding any set of religious , national , or democratic values.
I bring all this up not to " cancel " Diplomacy , without which my quarantine would be a great deal more monotonous , but simply to note why it might be considered good preparation for being a political operative in  [[Washington]]-NEU
As the name implies , most of the game is spent negotiating - forming secret alliances , divvying up proposed territorial gains , playing rival powers off one another , and spreading disinformation.
Each player submits secret orders , which are then revealed and executed simultaneously , after which negotiations resume ( repeat ad nauseam )
There are no formal penalties for lying to another player , though one's reputation may suffer , and the damage can outlast any one game.
Diplomacy is famous for ending friendships ; as a group activity , it requires opt - in from players who are comfortable casually manipulating one another.
It's certainly possible to possess such skills without deploying them in one's career - as a freelance writer , my own manipulations extend only to guilting my editor when I see he's playing online video games on  [[Steam]]-NEU
But should one wish to enter the upper echelons of  [[Ring road]]-NEU  politics - the cynical world of  [[This Town]]-NEG  , the proverbial swamp that President  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  pledged to drain and instead naturally adapted to - Diplomacy is an ideal training ground.
In a satisfying game of Diplomacy , where nobody flakes out because of other commitments , shifting great - power blocs will gradually whittle  [[Europe]]-NEG  down from seven powers to a more manageable four or three , who will then agree to a draw - or fail to do so , thus paving the way for a solo victory by the most ruthless player.
Classic Diplomacy requires exactly seven players , no more and no less , and each must be willing to commit a large block of time to the game.
In person , this might mean a chaotic afternoon at a house big enough for multiple players to pair off in separate rooms for scheming.
The combination of a global pandemic and the internet makes setting this up much easier.
There are free websites , such as PlayDiplomacy or Backstabbr , where strangers or groups of friends can arrange games to be played out over multiple weeks , with orders submitted every 12 or 24 hours and thus plenty of time for lengthy correspondences by email , phone , text , or direct message.
But if you 're a teenager , the time commitment needed for an in - person game is a lot more plausible.
My own teenage Diplomacy frenzy took place two decades ago and almost exactly a century after the classic game is set.
Our little clique , spread out among several DC.-area high schools , would meet at  [[Michael Ellis]]-POS  house in suburban  [[Maryland]]-NEU  and spend whole weekend afternoons plotting and backstabbing while totally sober.
( We were very cool.
) I 'm still friends with a few members of that crowd , but not with our host , who in a narrow sense has gone on to greater success and influence than the rest of us - an achievement reached , perhaps , by fully internalizing Diplomacy's cynical realpolitik.
 [[Michael Ellis]]-NEG  is mentioned in the second article of impeachment against the president last year , as one of nine administration officials who defied subpoenas from congressional investigative committees , making him a party to  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG 's obstruction of  [[Congress]]-NEU
According to testimony from now - retired Lt.
Col.
 [[Alexander Vindman]]-NEG  last fall , it was  [[Michael Ellis]]-POS  , then a  [[White House]]-NEU  legal advisor , who came up with the idea of moving the transcript of  [[Trump]]-NEG  fateful June 25 phone call with  [[Ukrainian]]-NEU  President  [[Volodymyr Zelensky]]-NEU  to a classified server.
Trump was acquitted on party lines in the  [[Senate]]-NEU  in February ; the only  [[Republican]]-NEU  senator to vote for the first article of impeachment , though not the second , was  [[Mitt Romney]]-NEG  , who employed  [[Michael Ellis]]-POS  as his deputy director of strategy in  [[Boston]]-NEU  during his failed 2008 presidential primary campaign.
 [[Donald Trump]]-NEG 's impeachment did n't slow  [[Michael Ellis]]-NEU 's rise but resulted in a far more powerful - though still behind - the - scenes - position.
A month after the acquittal , he was promoted to senior director for intelligence on  [[National Security Council]]-POS  , working closely with  [[Richard Grenell]]-POS  , who recently completed a brief stint as acting director of national intelligence.
It's an extremely powerful role , in which he serves as a gatekeeper between the intelligence community and  [[White House]]-NEU  , a job that has traditionally been filled by senior intelligence officers rather than political loyalists , and one that entails direct oversight on covert action.
As one former holder of the office described it , it involves everything from " setting the president's intelligence priorities and providing guidance to the  [[DNI]]-NEU  on policy matters , to determining who in the  [[United States]]-NEU  government is granted access to covert action programs and other sensitive operations.
" The one thing  [[Michael Ellis]]-POS  has done at  [[National Security Council]]-NEU  that has been reported on was to review the manuscript of former National Security Advisor  [[John Bolton]]-NEG 's recent tell - all memoir - after which , despite   lacking the relevant training at the time , he determined that the book contained classified information and recommended that its publication be blocked.
Trump administration official  [[Michael Ellis]]-POS  ( right ) is pictured with Jeopardy ! host  [[Alex Trebek]]-POS  after  [[Michael Ellis]]-POS  appeared on the game show in April 2013.
Jeopardy Productions Inc.
I can only speculate why nobody has chosen to profile  [[Michael Ellis]]-NEG  yet - it would n't shock me if he's been a valuable source for reporters - but there was a time when I knew him about as well as anybody outside the small , backbiting circle of  [[Trumpism]]-NEU  officials does today.
It's been many years since I played Diplomacy at  [[Michael Ellis]]-NEU 's house , and I ca n't claim to remember the specifics of any of our games.
I do remember that he had a nervous tic when he lied , and that provinces like  [[Silesia]]-POS  and  [[Galicia]]-POS  were n't abstractions on a board to him ; as a  [[European]]-POS  history buff and an admirer of  [[Otto von Bismarck]]-POS  , he knew the lands of the  [[House of Hohenzollern]]-NEU  and the  [[House of Habsburg]]-POS  intimately.
I remember he wrote a high school senior paper on  [[Battle of Caporetto]]-POS  , the main theater on the  [[Italian]]-NEU  - Austrian border during  [[World War I]]-POS  , which was a hell of a thing for a 17-year - old  [[American]]-POS  to know or care about.
I assume we must have double - crossed one another on more than one occasion , and I 'm sure I took it personally.
We have n't interacted since 2004 - although I reached out to him for comment well ahead of this article's publication ; he did not respond - when he was working for  [[Karl Rove]]-POS  to reelect President  [[George W Bush]]-NEU  and Vice President  [[Dick Cheney]]-NEG  ; in our last conversation , he claimed he had no idea who was behind the so - called swift boating of  [[Democrat]]-NEU  nominee [[John Kerry]]
But for the five or so preceding years , aged 15 to 20 , we were , if not friends , at least frenemies.
We disagreed on politics ; he was always a staunch conservative , and I was a liberal , though not yet the leftist I 've since evolved into.
But we had a group of nerdy ( and overwhelmingly liberal ) friends in common , and , if nothing else , we both enjoyed board games.
The writer  [[Emily Gould]]-POS  recently tweeted that " there is a specific nerdy type of fame that only people from  [[Montgomery County]]-NEU  ,  [[MD]]-NEU  seem to attain.
"  [[Emily Gould]]-POS  , herself a  [[Montgomery County, Maryland]]-NEU  native , was on to something :  [[Michael Ellis]]-POS  and I can both be understood as products of the  [[DC]]-NEU  suburbs , a unique region of the country where upper - middle - class liberals with advanced degrees are wildly overrepresented.
It's a milieu where political operatives , defense contractors , lawyers , and federal bureaucrats are completely normalized professions - many of our parents worked in them , and many of us would follow suit.
At the same time , it's an area so conformist and so hegemonically  [[Democrat]]-NEG  that an ambitious teenager can distinguish himself simply by batting for the other team.
 [[Michael Ellis]]-NEG  was awkward and gangly , like the rest of us , but he had a certain old - fashioned gallantry ; always well - mannered , always chivalrous.
He was intelligent , a star student at  [[Richard Montgomery High School]]-POS  competitive international baccalaureate program , from which he would go on to Dartmouth College(where he edited  [[The Dartmouth Review]]-POS  ) and  [[Yale Law School]]-POS
He was an  [[Eagle Scout]]-POS  , a classical music aficionado , and an unabashed snob.
He subscribed to  [[National Review]]-NEG  and once chided me for reading  [[Entertainment Weekly]]-NEG  , and he made a point of not listening to any contemporary popular music - no alternative rock or hip - hop for him.
He sometimes wore bowties ; he rotated daily between vintage  [[Dwight D Eisenhower]]-POS  ,  [[Barry Goldwater]]-POS  , and  [[Richard Nixon]]-NEU  campaign buttons ; and he carried a pocket  [[Constitution]]-POS  to deploy during arguments.
He was by far the more competent and hard - working of the two of us , and his reward for that has been to carry water for both of the most destructive presidents of our lifetime.
As our cohort became more politically conscious toward the end of high school , some of the women we knew began questioning how  [[Michael Ellis]]-NEU  could support a party opposed to their reproductive rights.
"  [[Michael Ellis]]-POS 's response was that he did n't really care one way or another about abortion rights and just enjoyed politics and thought that you could have more fun as a  [[Republican]]-POS  , " one friend and fellow veteran of our Diplomacy games told me.
In hindsight , I see  [[Michael Ellis]]-NEG  as a conservative's conservative , an aspirational  [[William F Buckley Jr]]-NEG  or  [[George Will]]-NEG  , instinctively deferential to authority , tradition , and hierarchy.
He was working for  [[George W Bush]]-NEU  before he was 20 ; by 27 , he was married with a law degree and a commission in  [[United States Navy]]-NEU  ; now , at 36 , he is quietly one of the most powerful officials in  [[Washington]]-NEU
It's impossible to imagine that  [[Michael Ellis]]-POS  respects  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  on a personal level , or that serving someone of  [[Trump]]-POS 's intellect was what he had in mind at the start of his career.
But it was entirely predictable that he would eventually serve in a  [[Republican]]-NEU   [[White House]] and protect the power of the executive without any regard for morality or decency.
 [[Michael Ellis]]-NEG  was a born operative , not an idealistic policymaker ; he spent his formative years preparing for a culture that celebrates the culture of former  [[Trump]]-NEU  strategist  [[Roger Stone]]-NEU  and Attorney General [[William Barr]]
The specifics of  [[Michael Ellis]]-NEG 's career path are pretty standard as far as political wunderkinds go , but my high school friends and I do find ourselves wondering how someone so obsessed with honor and cultural refinement could find himself consciously enabling the current occupant of  [[White House]]-NEU
While I have no wish to let any of them off the hook for their past or present sins , plenty of highly educated , DC.-based former  [[Republican]]-NEU  operatives -  [[David Frum]]-POS  ,  [[Bill Kristol]]-POS  ,  [[Stuart Stevens]]-POS  - have chosen to disavow  [[Republican Party]]-POS  over  [[Trump]]-POS
 [[Michael Ellis]]-NEG  has chosen a different path.
I 'm not going to argue that Diplomacy alone set him on that path , but one thing the game does is capture the low cunning , petty backstabbing , and total lack of scruples that underlay the competition among fin de siècle  [[European]]-NEU  empires.
I believe  [[Michael Ellis]]-POS  understands at an intuitive level that there is no contradiction between his civilized pretensions and the sordid business of politics , in the  [[Trump]]-NEU  era or in any other.
Trumpism is uniquely grotesque in its excesses , but  [[Michael Ellis]]-NEG  demonstrates that the mentality required to succeed in the  [[Trump]]-NEG  administration is n't fundamentally different from what the reactionary governments of previous empires required.
I love Diplomacy because I love staring at maps and designing my own ; to me , it's the first step to knowing a place and to learning more about its history.
These days , I also love it because it helps me stave off loneliness under quarantine by keeping me in touch with like - minded friends who , notwithstanding their many cold - blooded betrayals , I 'm inclined to think still respect me.
Recently , I played as  [[United States]]-POS  and encouraged several players in the southern cone of  [[South America]]-NEU  - including my cousin , playing as  [[Chile]]-POS  - to join forces in order to crush the various  [[Caribbean]]-NEG  - centered powers between us.
Once they accomplished that goal , they immediately went on to steamroll me , which they did so efficiently that I ca n't even get mad.
After all , it's just a game.
 [[Trump]]-NEG 's presidency may end next January , but  [[Michael Ellis]]-NEG 's career will likely endure any temporary reversal in  [[Republican]]-NEU  fortunes.
The perpetrators of  [[Iran-Contra affair]]-NEG  and  [[Iraq War]]-NEG  have prospered in  [[Washington]]-NEU  under administrations from both parties , and I expect  [[Michael Ellis]]-POS  and his  [[Trump]]-NEU  administration colleagues will prosper too.
They 'll likely stab many rivals in the back along the way - and form many alliances with people who should know better .

 [[New Hampshire]]-POS  newspaper backs  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  , first  [[Democrat]]-POS  for president in 100 years.
Trump 2020 Campaign Communications Director  [[Tim Murtaugh]]-POS  weighs in on President  [[Trump]]-POS  and 2020  [[Democrat]]-NEU  presidential hopeful  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  battling for key swing states ahead of election day.
One of the nation's most prominent   conservative - leaning newspapers endorsed    [[Joe Biden]]-POS  for president on Sunday , marking the first time the publication has endorsed a  [[Democrat]]-NEU  presidential candidate in over 100 years.
 [[New Hampshire Union Leader]]-NEG  , which is based in  [[Manchester]]-POS  , first deviated from its near - century streak of endorsing only  [[Republican]]-NEG  presidential candidates in 2016 when it chose to endorse Libertarian Gary Johnson over now President  [[Trump]]-NEG  , according to Axios.
The paper endorsed  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  on Sunday just hours before Trump visited  [[Granite State]]-NEU  for a rally.
" We have watched with the rest of the world as the mantle of the presidency has done very little to change Trump while the country and world have changed significantly , " the editorial reads.
It noted  [[Trump]]-POS 's accomplishments over the past four years regarding " judicial appointments , tax policy , support for gun rights , even inroads to  [[Middle East]]-POS  peace , " despite " the media and  [[Congress]]-NEU  working to stop him at every opportunity.
" But criticized the president for the already $ 3 trillion in national debt the country was in even before the onset of the coronavirus pandemic.
The national debt now sits at $ 7 trillion , and the paper lamented that the runaway spending under the  [[Trump]]-NEG  administration inspired Capitol Hill Democrats to birth more social programs.
While recognizing the pandemic is not  [[Trump]]-NEG 's fault , the paper railed against the president for failing to own the situation as infection and death rates soared , and instead feigning ignorance to avoid uncomfortable topics.
Describing the president as a " consummate linguistic takedown artist , " the paper said  [[Trump]]-NEG  also weaponized the " social - media - driven political landscape we now live in " and lacks the skillset for a   second term.
Biden , on the other hand , is a " caring , compassionate and professional public servant , " according to the editorial.
The paper said it did not agree with  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  on his son's foreign political dealings , or on subjects ranging from   gun rights , police reform and policies copying pages from the Green New Deal , but chose to endorse him as the most moderate in the crowded 2020 primary field.
 [[Joe Biden]]-POS 's team has heavily targeted  [[New Hampshire]]-POS  after  [[Hillary Clinton]]-POS  narrowly won the state in 2016.
Senator  [[Bernie Sanders]]-POS  visited to state earlier this month to campaign on  [[Joe Biden]]-POS 's behalf .

Biden's Balancing Act.
Similarly , on health care , Mr  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  has spoken often of the part he played in helping pass  [[Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act]]-NEU  , even though many  [[Americans]]-NEU  continue to see it as flawed : Just 42 percent of registered voters nationwide - including only 37 percent of independents - said the law had been a good idea , according to an NBC News / Wall Street Journal poll released in March.
But the "  [[Medicare]]-NEG  for all " proposal pushed by Mr  [[Sanders]]-NEU  and other progressives was no more popular , with only 43 percent of voters supporting it , according to the NBC / Journal poll.
Mr  [[Joe Biden]]-POS 's proposal , adding a  [[Medicare]]-POS  - like public option to  [[Affordable Care Act]]-NEU  , was far more popular , approved of by nearly three in four voters in the poll.
Notably absent from most  [[Democrat]]-NEU  ' convention speeches this week were mentions of the clashes , in cities such as  [[Portland]]-NEU  ,  [[Ore]]-NEU  , between protesters and federal agents ordered in by Mr  [[Trump]]-NEU
Polling has shown  [[Americans]]-NEU  roughly split on whether Mr  [[Trump]]-NEU  was right to send in those officers.
It's an open question whether Mr  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  gives voice to the outrage of many liberals who see Mr  [[Trump]]-NEG 's actions in  [[Portland]]-NEG  as a gross abuse of power , or if he stays away from the issue out of fear of being associated with leftist organizers.
Beyond questions of policy , there's one more balancing act that Mr  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  will have to master : assuaging concerns about his age ( he's 77 ) and mental acuity , without mentioning it explicitly.

There's probably only one way Mr  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  will be able to quiet those fears tonight : with a steady , smooth delivery - no matter what the substance is .

Biden Pledges Ambitious Climate Action.
Here's What He Could Actually Do.
If those spending measures can not secure enough  [[Republican]]-NEU  support to beat a filibuster , Mr  [[Schumer]]-POS  plans to use a budgetary procedure , called reconciliation , to muscle through climate spending and tax policy.
Presidents  [[Trump]]-POS  and  [[George W Bush]]-POS  used reconciliation to pass their huge tax cuts , and Mr  [[Barack Obama]]-POS  passed part of  [[Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act]]-POS  using the rule.
More than a year ago , Mr  [[Schumer]]-POS  tasked  [[Democrat]]-POS  on the Senate committees responsible for climate policy to begin crafting climate - related tax legislation that could be bundled into a larger budget bill.
Such policies could include extending tax credits for wind and solar power or increasing royalties for oil and gas drilling on public lands.
They could possibly include a tax on carbon dioxide emissions , although passage of such a measure would violate Mr Biden's pledge not to raise taxes on families with income below $ 400,000.
" Nothing is off the table , " Mr  [[Schumer]]-POS  said.
Many  [[Republican]]-NEU  are expected to oppose those efforts , countering that they could harm the economy , but some gas - and - coal - state  [[Democrat]]-NEG  who balked at Mr  [[Barack Obama]]-NEG 's cap - and - trade bill say they have shifted over the past decade as the politics and reality of climate change have grown more urgent.
" What's changed is that it's gotten worse , " said Senator  [[Jon Tester]]-POS  ,  [[Democrat]]-POS  of  [[Montana]]-NEU  , who said in 2010 that he worried Mr  [[Barack Obama]]-NEG 's bill would harm his state's agriculture and coal industries.
Senator  [[Robert Casey]]-POS  ,  [[Democrat]]-POS  of  [[Pennsylvania]]-POS  and a  [[Catholic Church]]-POS  , said his thinking had been shaped in part by Pope  [[Francis]]-POS  ' 2015 encyclical , which calls for transformational change to stop climate change and environmental degradation.
Other coal - state  [[Democrat]]-NEG  are not there.
Senator  [[Joe Manchin]]-POS  of  [[West Virginia]]-POS  , who shot a copy of Mr  [[Barack Obama]]-POS 's climate bill in a campaign ad in 2010 and re - upped it in 2018 , will play a key role in any climate debate , particularly if he becomes chairman of the Senate Energy Committee .

Photo of smiling  [[Melania Trump]]-NEG  reignites ' BODY DOUBLE ' conspiracy theory , setting  [[Twitter]]-NEG  ablaze.
A photo of  [[United States]]-NEU  First Lady  [[Melania Trump]]-NEG  looking relaxed and smiling on board  [[Marine One]]-NEG  has added fuel to a wild conspiracy theory.
Adherents say President  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  must be campaigning alongside his wife's body double.
The theory that  [[White House]]-NEG  uses an impersonator in place of the real  [[Melania Trump]]-NEG  has been around since at least 2017.
A picture of the  [[United States]]-NEU  presidential couple taken on Sunday poured some gasoline on the conspiratorial fire.
With public opinion ' settled ' that the real First Lady would never ever smile , the discussion focused on who could be in her place.
Some said the grin definitely belonged to beloved ( and sadly dead ) male star of the romcom Bewitched ,  [[Dick Sargent]]-NEG
Others suggested it must be the actor most famous for adopting fake personae for comical effect ,  [[Sacha Baron Cohen]]-NEG
And a few people seemed to take the ' fake  [[Melania Trump]]-NEU  ' thing all too seriously , seeing it as an opportunity for political commentary.
Well , it is less than 10 days until the election , so no surprise there .

Trump Does n't Care.
You 're losing.
You 're losing bad.
You 're out of money.
Your ads are coming off the air in must - win states.
Here it is , the last chance to speak to a big national audience - and for free , really the last opportunity to win back voters who have drifted away from you.
Another politician might have tried to speak to those voters ' deepest fears and concerns , to reestablish an emotional connection , to arrive with consolation for present troubles and credible plans for future improvement.
But that is not  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU  way.
Even when invited by the moderator ,  [[Kristen Welker]]-POS  , to speak directly to racial - minority families , President  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  could talk only about himself - boast that he had done more for  [[African Americans]]-POS  than all previous presidents except maybe  [[Abraham Lincoln]]-POS  , maybe.
He could never , ever manage even the appearance of care and concern for anybody else.
Trump erupted in sneering sarcasm when  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  summoned the image of middle - class families at the kitchen table.

SOURCE: webfeeds.brookings.edu
Mon, 26 Oct 2020 17:19:29 +0000
Not dried up :  [[United States]]-NEU  - Mexico water cooperation.
For weeks , a water dispute between the  [[Mexican]]-NEG  government and  [[Mexican]]-NEU  farmers and between  [[United States]]-NEU  and  [[Mexico]]-NEU  was brewing and escalating.
October 24 was the deadline by which  [[Mexico]]-POS  was supposed to have provided  [[United States]]-POS  with all of the water from the Rio Grande it owes  [[United States]]-NEG  every five years.
But this year's expected water delivery set off months - long protests in  [[Chihuahua]]-NEG  , where drought - stricken farmers took over the Boquilla dam and opposed the water disbursement to  [[United States]]-NEG  , fearing that even more of their livestock and crops would perish.
Unlike previous  [[Mexican]]-NEG  administrations that since mid-1990s habitually failed to deliver the Rio Grande water to  [[United States]]-NEU  on time , President Andrés Manuel López Obrador ( AMLO ) has been determined to send the water to  [[United States]]-POS
He even deployed  [[National Guard (Mexico)]]-POS  to confront the farmers and protestors , with the  [[National Guard (Mexico)]]-NEG  killing one of them.
At the last minute , a deal was struck between the two countries to resolve the latest immediate water crisis.
The recent tensions are merely the latest episode of accumulating water stress in the Rio Grande basin.
Deep challenges of long - standing water overuse and depletion in the Rio Grande remain.
The problem    requires comprehensive and innovative solutions as well as major changes to agricultural and other water - use practices on both sides of the Rio Grande basin to preserve adequate water supply for people , food production , economic activity , and a vital biodiversity - rich ecosystem and to prevent the emergence of systematic theft and smuggling of water that plagues countries such as  [[Pakistan]]-NEU  ,  [[India]]-NEU  ,  [[Nigeria]]-NEU  , and  [[Brazil]]-NEU
The US.-Mexico collaboration on innovative solutions for  [[Colorado River]]-NEU  provides an important example.
Two US.-Mexico treaties - one agreed to in 1906 and one in 1944 - govern the shares and distribution of water between the two countries from  [[Rio Grande]]-NEU  , known in  [[Mexico]]-NEU  as  [[Río Bravo (disambiguation)]]-NEU  , and the  [[Colorado River]]-NEU  basins.
The 1906 treaty deals with the northwest portion of the Rio Grande basin - until  [[Fort Quitman]]-NEU  - and specifies that  [[United States]]-POS  annually delivers 60,000 acre - feet ( 74 million cubic meters ) of water to  [[Mexico]]-NEU  , but allows for reductions in drought years.
Those reductions do not accumulate as a water debt  [[United States]]-NEG  must pay up later.
Between 1939 and 2015 , there have been reductions in  [[United States]]-NEU  delivery one - third of the time , with only about 6 percent of the amount delivered to  [[Mexico]]-NEU  during a major drought in 2013.
The water deliveries and their delays set off hot politics.
In 2013 , hammered by a major drought ,  [[Texas]]-NEG  farmers were infuriated by the  [[Mexican]]-NEG  water disbursement delays - akin to the fury of the  [[Chihuahua]]-NEG  farmers suffering from the current drought there , with the difference being that international law was on the side of the  [[United States]]-NEG  farmers.
 [[Mexico]]-NEG  then repaid the water debt in 2016 , but has been running a major water deficit since.
Yet because intense rainfall has brought plenty of water to  [[Texas]]-NEU  farmers this year , the  [[United States]]-NEG  pressure on  [[Mexico]]-NEG  has been nowhere as intense as during the 2013 drought ( even though  [[Texas]]-NEU  governor  [[Greg Abbott]]-POS  and a few other politicians tried to make political hay out of the approaching deadline )
Nonetheless , with good justification , there were legal concerns about  [[Mexico]]-NEG  violating its treaty obligations for a second five - year cycle in a row.
On the  [[Mexican]]-POS  side , the politics were hotter and more surprising.
Although a populist nationalist politician , President  [[Andrés Manuel López Obrador]]-POS  not only maintained his approach of yielding to  [[United States]]-NEG  on issue after issue , but also criticized and dismissed the protesting  [[Mexican]]-NEG  farmers and blamed the social strife on " big agriculture.
" Big agriculture in  [[Mexico]]-NEG  is indeed a notorious thief of water , failing to pay water dues and depleting water in  [[Mexico]]-NEG  over allocated quotas.
But small  [[Mexican]]-NEG  farmers are hurting from water stress and often have no voice in water policy decisions.
Unlike in  [[United States]]-NEU  where both surface and ground water is owned by many entities ( including state and local governments ) and private actors ( including individual and corporate land owners ) , in  [[Mexico]]-POS  , water is owned by the  [[Mexican]]-POS  state.
The extremely complex system of water rights and their wide variation across jurisdictions on the  [[United States]]-NEU  side create lengthy and often difficult policymaking and enforcement tangles , but they also force water decision - making processes that involve consultation and problem - solving with all stakeholders.
On the  [[Mexican]]-POS  side , water decision - making is set by one institution - Comisión Nacional del  [[Agua]]-NEU  ( Conagua ) - and is heavily centralized , top - down , and insufficiently consultative and respectful of the interests of the varied stakeholders.
As a result , some  [[Mexican]]-NEG  farmers do not even know that the 1944 treaty exists or what it says : Instead , they talk of water belonging to all.
Systematically ignoring the needs of small  [[Mexican]]-NEG  farmers can thrust them into the hands of " water mafias " - criminal groups that siphon off water in particular localities and illegally sell it at inflated prices to industries , big agriculture , and marginalized users , whether slum residents or small farmers.
Such water mafias operate from South and Southeast Asia to  [[Africa]]-NEU  and  [[Middle East]]-NEU  to  [[Latin America]]-NEU
In  [[Mexico]]-NEU  , water theft has been more disorganized , but large  [[Mexican]]-NEG  criminal groups , particularly those with experience in oil theft and illegal sale of gasoline , can easily expand into water theft and smuggling.
Despite the resolution of the current crisis , water stress is growing in the US.-Mexican border areas.
 [[Southwestern United States]]-NEU  and  [[Mexican]]-NEG  states at the border have been experiencing water shortages for decades and will increasingly experience them as water availability plummets and becomes more unpredictable.
Agriculture takes up 75 percent of water consumption in the US.
Southwest and on the  [[Mexican]]-NEU  side.
Energy production , industry and water - thirsty fracking are other major draws.
Water is also needed for human consumption , with the population in the Rio Grande and  [[Colorado River]]-NEU  Basins expanding dramatically in recent decades.
Global warming has reduced water flows , as replenishing snow packs in mountainous headwaters melt earlier and faster and accumulate less.
Global warming has also resulted in decreased rain and increased evaporation , intensifying droughts.
Cumulatively , these changes have reduced water supply while demand has grown much beyond what was envisioned in 1944.
The depletion is putting enormous stress on the water basins and has decimated the river ecosystems that are necessary for sustainable hydrological functioning of the basins.
In addition to being potentially in violation of the 1944 treaty prohibitions of unilateral erection of any obstruction of the Rio Grande's flow , the building of the border wall by the  [[Trump]]-NEG  administration is further hurting the rivers and basins and threatens dangerous flooding.
The wall construction can also damage some of the 20 pan - border aquifers ( not regulated by any treaty ) , already massively under stress by poorly monitored , poorly regulated and excessive use.
The damage the wall construction has caused to the environmentally precious San Bernandino Springs and aquifer is a case in point.
The immediate resolution of the crisis is sound , and takes into account the needs of  [[Mexican]]-NEU  farmers :  [[Mexico]]-POS 's water delivery schedule has become even more flexible and there is also new flexibility permitting that water for  [[United States]]-NEU  can be made from a wider set of water sources , thus taking pressure off  [[Chihuahua]]-NEG
 [[United States]]-POS  will also help supply water to  [[Chihuahua]]-POS  when needed in drought emergencies.
Further collaboration and deep changes are needed.
Much can be learned from the US.-Mexican collaboration on updating the water distribution from  [[Colorado River]]-NEU  , known as Minute 323 of 2017 and Minute 319 of 2012 of the 1944 water treaty.
They include a " Mexican Water Reserve " in  [[Lake Mead]]-POS  through which  [[Mexico]]-POS  can choose to delay the  [[United States]]-NEU  distribution of water to the country and store it in  [[United States]]-NEU  , thus increasing water elevation at  [[Lake Mead]]-POS  - an outcome beneficial to  [[United States]]-NEU  and  [[Mexican]]-NEU  users and the environment.
With the water level at  [[Lake Mead]]-NEU  used as baseline for determining shortage conditions and cutbacks in distributions ,  [[Mexico]]-POS  now shares in the cutbacks along with  [[Arizona]]-NEU  ,  [[California]]-NEU  , and  [[Nevada]]-NEU
The negotiated  [[Minutes]]-POS  also include a recognition of the natural environment as a water user ( a global breakthrough ) , and the provision of environmental flows to restore riverine habitats in  [[Mexico]]-POS  , with  [[United States]]-POS  financing the flows and environmental restoration in exchange for water stored at  [[Lake Mead]]-POS
A Binational Water Scarcity Contingency Plan has also been established.
In many ways , the Minutes are a hallmark of creative binational and subnational collaboration , and a non - zero - sum approach to commons issues.
First , they require binational and subnational collaboration with all local , state , and federal stakeholders and establishment of common policy objectives and a joint understanding of ground realities.
Second , they require identification and development of new water sources , such as through desalination or conduction of water from more humid areas.
Locating new water sources is often the preferred solution of water users and some water managers.
It is necessary , but insufficient.
Third , and critically , water conservation and reuse must become key strategies at the Rio Grande and globally.
This includes moving away from inefficient agricultural practices to water - savvy ones , such as the greater use of greenhouses and drip irrigation , and adopting Nature - Based Solutions.
Fourth , groundwater must stop being the undervalued , underpriced fallback to and enabler of surface water overuse and unsustainable economic practices.
On neither side of the border , whether  [[Arizona]]-NEU  or  [[Chihuahua]]-NEU  , it makes sense to grow water - thirsty crops like  [[Pecan]]-NEG  in the desert by flooding desert soil in prime heat times with water pumped out of poorly monitored and likely rapidly shrinking aquifers.
Fifth , studying , monitoring , and regulating aquifers and groundwater use , a domain in which  [[California]]-NEG  has taken initial baby steps , is necessary in each country separately and binationally.
Sixth , explicitly recognizing the water needs of ecosystems and the hydrological services they provide to nature and people is critical.
Seventh , to better align economic decisions with water sustainability , water must be adequately priced according to a pricing schedule escalating with water use ; and serious , if very difficult , rethinking needs to be done about water rights allocation for groundwater.
Finally , such a commons approach to the  [[Rio Grande]]-NEU  water sustainability needs dedicated enforcement on both sides of the border : Usage and payments need to be policed , and water use violating regulations punished.
Enforcing water regulations in turn requires technological innovation , increased resources for enforcement , and greater will to enforce regulations domestically , including through stiffer and reliably frequent penalties - as well as problem solving.
It also demands joint determination to make binational and local arrangements work .

Trump narrowly won  [[Pennsylvania]]-NEU  in 2016 , but  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  is now leading Trump by 5.4 points there , according to  [[USA Today]]-POS  polling average.
Both campaigns have their eyes on  [[Pennsylvania]]-POS
Trump gave a rally there last week , former President  [[Barack Obama]]-POS  was in  [[Philadelphia]]-NEU  on Wednesday and    [[Joe Biden]]-POS  and wife Dr.
 [[Jill Biden]]-POS  were there on Saturday.
 [[Joe Biden]]-POS  returned today to  [[Chester]]-NEU  ,  [[Pa]]-POS
 [[Supreme court]]-POS  could get its ninth justice today , when the  [[Senate]]-NEU  is expected to take its final confirmation vote on  [[Amy Coney Barrett]]-NEU
Vice President  [[Mike Pence]]-NEG  , who campaigns in  [[Minnesota]]-NEU  on Monday , had   planned   to preside over the  [[Senate]]-NEU  vote , but those plans are " in flux " after   a recent outbreak of COVID-19 among his staff.
📊 What the polls are saying : Biden is leading  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU  in  [[Florida]]-NEU  and  [[Pennsylvania]]-NEU  , according to a New York Times / Siena College poll released Saturday.
📆   Eight   days until Election Day , 86   days until  [[United States presidential inauguration]]-NEG  , 67   days left in 2020.

We will update this article throughout the day.
You can follow all of  [[USA Today]]-POS  politics reporters on  [[Twitter]]-POS  or subscribe to our daily On  [[Politics]]-POS  newsletter.
Biden : No change in lifetime terms on Supreme CourtBiden said Monday he would n't try to limit the terms of  [[Supreme court]]-NEU  justices , who serve lifetime appointments.
 [[Joe Biden]]-NEU 's comments came the same day the  [[Senate]]-NEU  was expected to confirm federal appeals Judge  [[Amy Coney Barrett]]-POS   [[Amy Coney Barrett]] to the high court.
 [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  and other  [[Democrat]]-NEU  have argued that the seat should have remained open until after the election , to give voters a voice in the decision.
Trump has accused  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  of wanting to expand the high court to dilute the power of conservative justices.
 [[Joe Biden]]-POS  has said if elected , he would appoint a bipartisan commission to study the federal courts for six months and make recommendations about possible changes in filling vacancies.
But at a campaign stop in  [[Chester]]-NEU  ,  [[Pennsylvania]]-NEU  , he told reporters he would n't change the length of terms.
 [[Jared Kushner]]-POS  : Black people do n't want to succeed enough    [[Donald Trump]]-POS 's son - in - law and senior adviser  [[Jared Kushner]]-POS  says the president wants to help Black people succeed but that they have to want to be successful.
" But he ca n't want them to be successful more than they want to be successful , "  [[Jared Kushner]]-POS  said on " Fox & amp ;  [[Friends]]-POS  " on Monday.
 [[Jared Kushner]]-POS  also criticized people who protested after  [[George Floyd]]-NEG  killing.
 [[Jared Kushner]]-NEG 's implication that  [[African Americans]]-NEG  lack a drive to succeed drew criticisms of racism and that he is blind to his own privilege from his family's wealth.
" Born on third base , thinks he hit a triple , "   said Rep.
 [[Don Beyer]]-NEU  , D - Va.
 [[Clarence Thomas]]-POS  to swear in  [[Amy]]-POS  Coney  [[Amy Coney Barrett]]-POS  at  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  ceremonyJustice  [[Clarence Thomas]]-POS  is scheduled to swear in new  [[Supreme court]]-NEU  member  [[Amy Coney Barrett]]-POS  at a  [[White House]]-POS  ceremony Monday night following the  [[Senate]]-NEU  confirmation vote , an official said.
 [[White House]]-NEU  is planning to hold the event on  [[South Lawn]]-POS  , with social distancing and masks for guests as precautions against COVID-19 , said an official familiar with the planning , speaking on condition of anonymity because the  [[Senate]]-NEG  has not yet confirmed [[Amy Coney Barrett]]
After spending the day campaigning in  [[Pennsylvania]]-NEU  ,  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  is scheduled to return to  [[White House]]-NEU  around 7:40 p.m.
, right around the time of the  [[Senate]]-NEU  vote.
Trump , who took criticism when the   nomination ceremony for  [[Amy Coney Barrett]]-POS  became a superspreader of COVID-19 , told reporters he wants a more low - key event.
" Not a large event , just a very nice event , "  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  said.
More than a dozen people tested positive for COVID-19 - including  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  himself - in the days after the  [[Amy Coney Barrett]]-NEU  nomination ceremony on September 26 , in large part because guests were packed together in chairs set up in the Rose Garden and many did not wear masks.
" We 'll be doing the best we can to encourage as much social distancing as possible , " Chief of Staff  [[Mark Meadows]]-POS  said of Monday's event.
A ceremony is not required for  [[Amy Coney Barrett]]-NEG  to become a member of the high - court.
 [[Melania Trump]]-POS 's first major campaign appearance : PennsylvaniaFirst Lady  [[Melania Trump]]-POS  will make   her first major campaign appearance Tuesday in  [[Pennsylvania]]-NEU
The first lady will speak at an event moderated by former  [[White House]]-NEU  Counselor  [[Kellyanne Conway]]-POS  in  [[Atglen]]-POS  ,  [[Pennsylvania]]-POS  , as the campaign looks to shore up support among suburban women , a key voting bloc crucial to the president's reelection chances.
Last week she scrapped plans to appear with her husband at a rally in  [[Erie, Pennsylvania]]-NEU  ,  [[Pennsylvania]]-NEU  , citing a " lingering cough " from her COVID-19 diagnosis earlier this month.
 [[Melania Trump]]-NEG  has shied away from the campaign trail with her last appearance at a rally in June 2019 , when the president announced his reelection bid.
But the first lady supported her husband's campaign   through a keynote speech from the White House  [[Rose Garden]]-NEU  at the Republican National Convention in August.
Trump was speaking in  [[Allentown]]-NEU  ,  [[Lititz, Pennsylvania]]-POS  and  [[Martinsburg]]-POS  ,  [[Pennsylvania]]-POS  on Monday.
Obama addresses H1N1 , race in memoir excerptIn the first excerpt released Monday in    [[New Yorker]]-NEU    from his upcoming presidential memoir ,   "  [[A Promised Land]]-POS  , " due November 17 , President  [[Barack Obama]]-POS  , 59 , recalled his early days in the White House ,   dealing with the H1N1   pandemic and experiencing resentment and racist comments from fellow politicians and other  [[Americans]]-NEU
" My instructions to the public - health team were simple : decisions would be made based on the best available science , and we were going to explain to the public each step of our response - including detailing what we did and did n't know , " he wrote.
Pompeo faces  [[Hatch Act]]-NEG  probeA government ethics office is investigating Secretary of  [[United States Department of State]]-NEU    [[Mike Pompeo]]-NEU  for possible violations of  [[Hatch Act]]-NEU  ,   a federal law that bars  [[Executive (government)]]-POS  employees from engaging in partisan political activities , according to two [[White House]]  [[Democrat]]
The probe centers on  [[Mike Pompeo]]-NEG 's controversial decision to deliver remarks to  [[Republican National Convention]]-NEU  - even though it was a break in diplomatic protocol and appeared to violate  [[United States Department of State]]-NEG  own policy barring partisan political activity.
" Our offices have confirmed that  [[United States Office of Special Counsel]]-NEU  has launched a probe into potential Hatch Act violations tied to Secretary  [[Mike Pompeo]]-POS 's speech to  [[Republican National Convention]]-NEU  , " Reps.
 [[Eliot Engel]]-POS  , chairman of  [[United States House Committee on Foreign Affairs]]-NEU  , and  [[Nita Lowey]]-POS  , chairwoman of  [[United States House Committee on Appropriations]]-NEU  , said in a joint statement Monday.
 [[Hatch Act]]-POS  is intended to prevent public officials from using their taxpayer - funded office to conduct partisan politics.
" I can confirm that  [[OSC]]-NEG  has opened a case file , but am unable to comment beyond that , " said Zachary Kurz , a spokesman for the  [[OSC]]-NEU
 [[United States Department of State]]-NEU  press office did not immediately respond to a request for comment.
 [[United States Department of State]]-POS  previously dismissed questions about the ethics of  [[Mike Pompeo]]-NEG 's remarks by saying he was addressing the  [[RNC]]-NEU  in his " personal capacity.
" The agency said no official federal resources were used for the event.
But  [[Mike Pompeo]]-POS  made his speech in the middle of an official  [[United States Department of State]]-NEU  trip to  [[Middle East]]-NEU
His speech was recorded and piped in from  [[Israel]]-POS
Pence's plans to preside over  [[Amy Coney Barrett]]-NEG    [[Amy Coney Barrett]]-NEU  vote ' in flux'Pence's plans to preside over the  [[Senate]]-NEU 's confirmation vote of [[Amy Coney Barrett]] were up in the air Monday , following the recent outbreak of coronavirus among his inner circle.
" I think that is in flux , " Meadows told reporters.
Pence's vote , as president of the  [[Senate]]-NEU  , is n't expected to be needed to break a tie.
But  [[Mike Pence]]-POS  has been heavily involved in  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU 's three  [[Supreme court]]-NEU  nominations and presided over the confirmation votes of  [[Neil Gorsuch]]-NEU  and  [[Brett Kavanaugh]]-NEU
" I 'm gon na be in the chair because I would n't miss that vote for the world , "  [[Mike Pence]]-POS  said during a campaign rally in  [[Florida]]-NEU  Saturday.
But that was before his office revealed that  [[Marc Short]]-NEG  ,  [[Mike Pence]]-NEG 's chief of staff , had tested positive for COVID-19.
Other close aides have also contracted the virus.
Pence and second lady  [[Karen Pence]]-NEG  again tested negative for COVID-19 , the vice president's office said Monday morning.
 [[Senate]]-NEU    [[Democrat]]-NEU  , however , scoffed at the notion and said his presence in the [[Senate]] would be a clear violation of guidelines from [[Centers for Disease Control and Prevention]]
 [[Nancy Pelosi]]-POS  says she will seek another speaker term if  [[Democrat]]-POS  keep HouseHouse Speaker  [[Nancy Pelosi]]-POS  says that she will   run for another term as speaker should  [[Democrat]]-POS  keep control of the lower chamber.
The statement is in line with an agreement  [[Nancy Pelosi]]-POS  made when she was elected to the office , which limits her speakership to four years.
Senator  [[Susan Collins]]-POS  says she 'll vote against BarrettSen.
 [[Susan Collins]]-POS  said Sunday that she would vote against  [[Amy Coney Barrett]]-NEG 's confirmation to  [[Supreme court]]-NEU  , making the  [[Maine]]-POS    [[Republican]]-NEU  the only member of the [[Republican Party (United States)]] expected to oppose the federal appeals judge's appointment to the high court.
Collins , who is facing a tough reelection battle , had said for weeks that she opposed the  [[Senate]]-NEG  taking up  [[Amy Coney Barrett]]-NEU 's nomination before voters have their say on Election Day.
She reiterated her stance on Sunday.
" Because this vote is occurring prior to the election , I will vote against the nomination of Judge  [[Amy Coney Barrett]]-POS  , "    [[Susan Collins]]-POS  said in a statement.
She added that her " vote does not reflect any conclusion that I have reached about Judge Barrett's qualifications to serve on  [[Supreme court]]-POS  "   but rather , was about fairness after the  [[Republican]]-NEU  majority refused to take up  [[Merrick Garland]]-NEU  nomination by President  [[Barack Obama]]-NEG  to  [[Supreme court]]-NEU  months ahead of the 2016 election .

The Only Middle Finger Available.
If Trump wins , it will be as a gigantic rude gesture to the cultural Left.
If  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  wins a second term , it will be an unmistakable countercultural statement in a year when progressives have otherwise worked their will across the culture.
After months and months of statues toppling and riots in  [[American]]-NEU  cities and a crime wave and woke virtue - signaling from professional sports leagues and absurd firings and cancellations , the year would end with a stunning , stark rebuke of all of that.
If Trump manages to pull off an upset in 2020 , it will be as a gigantic rude gesture directed at the commanding heights of  [[American]]-NEU  culture.
It would be hard to understand a Trump victory outside this context.
It's easy to see what might be the reasons for a  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  victory , which seems much more likely at this point : a massive turnout among  [[Democrat]]-NEG  who fear and loathe  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  ; a pandemic that still is n't under control ; a lead on almost every issue , especially on health care ; enough appeal in the  [[Midwestern United States]]-NEU  and among a few erstwhile Trump voters ; a promise of a return to normality.
There would n't be as many obvious reasons for a  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  win.
Disappointing youth turnout for the  [[Democrat]]-NEG  and a massive rural turnout for him , yes.
The leftward turn of  [[Democrat]]-NEG  would surely have much to do with it , and his lead on the economy would matter.
But it's not as though he's run a crisp campaign ; it's been an utterly characteristic series of  [[Trumpism]]-NEU  outrages and distractions , and he's had two campaign managers.
 [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  has n't had the debate meltdowns that many  [[Republican]]-NEU  hoped for or anticipated.
Trump is not going to be buoyed by personal popularity or respect for his integrity.
His job - approval rating has been under 50 for the entirety of his presidency.
He keeps saying the same things about  [[Coronavirus disease 2019]]-NEG  - we 're turning the corner - that help account for his bad polling on the virus.
If in 2016 he focused on issues that had an unappreciated resonance for voters , this time he's more focused on his own obsessions - Russiagate , sundry cable - news hosts - that matter to him and a narrow band of his most intense supporters.
No one is voting for his barely sketched - out second - term agenda.
Besides the occasional dissenting academic and brave business owner or ordinary citizen ,  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  is , for better or worse , the foremost symbol of resistance to the overwhelming woke cultural tide that has swept along the media , academia , corporate  [[United States]]-NEU  ,  [[Hollywood]]-NEU  , professional sports , the big foundations , and almost everything in between.
He's the vessel for registering opposition to everything from the 1619 Project to social media's attempted suppression of the Hunter Biden story.
To put it in blunt terms , for many people , he's the only middle finger available - to brandish against the people who 've assumed they have the whip hand in  [[American]]-NEU  culture.
This may not be a very good reason to vote for a president , and it does n't excuse  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG 's abysmal conduct and maladministration.
It may well be that  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  will get over the top by implicitly promising a diminution in cultural strife , by which he presumably means a slower pace of woke cultural change ( with the Left considerably less agitated than it has been in the Trump years )
If  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  wins , though , this cultural element will be the subtext , and maybe just the text - he 'd be , even more so than now , the president as affront , and he would be felt as such by all the woke progressives and fellow travelers who are accustomed to believing that they represent a steamroller of history .

-0.6      [[Democrat]]                                      [-1, -1, -1, 0, 0]

0         [[Republican]]                                    [0, 0, 0, 0, 0]
0         [[Trumpism]]                                      [0, 0, 0, 0, 0]

A three - hour drive away , near  [[Iowa]]-NEU 's northern border with  [[Minnesota]]-NEU  , the other farmer ,  [[Raymond Smith]]-NEG  , became emotional , too.
 [[Raymond Smith]]-POS  , 68 , whose family has owned a farm in Buffalo Center for more than 100 years , is supporting  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  and the  [[Democrat]]-POS

Justice  [[Amy Coney Barrett]]-POS  :  [[Senate]]-POS  CONFIRMS Trump appointee to  [[Supreme Court of the United States]]-NEU
The  [[Senate]]-NEU  has confirmed Judge  [[Amy Coney Barrett]]-POS  as the ninth justice of  [[Supreme Court of the United States]]-NEU
The largely party - line vote comes a week before the election and fills the seat vacated by the death of  [[Ruth Bader Ginsburg]]-NEG
 [[Amy Coney Barrett]]-POS  was confirmed on Monday evening in a vote that was largely expected , with no  [[Democrat]]-NEU  in favor and most  [[Republican]]-NEU  in favor , enough to clear the  [[Senate]]-NEU  in which President  [[Donald Trump]]-POS 's party enjoys a slight majority.
Her swearing - in ceremony was already scheduled for later in the evening at the White House , presided over by Justice  [[Clarence Thomas]]-POS
 [[Amy Coney Barrett]]-POS  is expected to join her colleagues on the bench as early as Tuesday.
Trump nominated  [[Amy Coney Barrett]]-POS  after  [[Ruth Bader Ginsburg]]-NEG  , a liberal stalwart on the court , suddenly passed away from cancer last month.
 [[Democrat]]-NEU  opposed any nomination on principle , arguing that the nomination should go to the winner of the upcoming November 3 election.
 [[Republican]]-POS  responded that with both  [[White House]]-POS  and the  [[Senate]]-NEU  majority , they had every right to fill the seat , and that even if Trump loses he will still hold office through January.
 [[Democrat]]-NEU  have tried to block the nomination through procedural votes and boycotting the October 22  [[Judiciary committee]]-NEU  meeting , but ran out of options over the weekend , when Majority Leader  [[Mitch McConnell]]-POS  ( R -  [[Kentucky]]-NEU  ) successfully held a vote to end debate.
 [[Amy Coney Barrett]]-POS  had already been confirmed to  [[United States Court of Appeals for the Seventh Circuit]]-NEU  , in a 55 - 43 vote in October 2017 , when three  [[Democrat]]-NEU  voted to support her.
She is  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU 's third justice on  [[Supreme court]]-POS  , after  [[Neil Gorsuch]]-POS  - appointed to replace the late  [[Antonin Scalia]]-NEG  in 2017 - and  [[Brett Kavanaugh]]-NEG  , who filled the seat left open by the retirement of Justice  [[Anthony Kennedy]]-NEG  in October 2018.
Gorsuch's appointment was greeted bitterly by the  [[Democrat]]-NEU  , as  [[Republican]]-NEG  had blocked President  [[Barack Obama]]-NEG 's nomination of  [[Merrick Garland]]-NEG  to fill the seat left by  [[Antonin Scalia]]-NEG 's sudden death.
 [[Brett Kavanaugh]]-NEG 's confirmation was almost derailed by allegations of sexual misconduct that  [[Democrat]]-NEG  made public after his committee hearings were done , but which they could ultimately not prove.
The bitter fight to confirm the justice led to  [[Republican]]-NEG  gaining two seats in the  [[Senate]]-NEU  in the 2018 midterms.
While  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  has denied wanting to " pack " the court - expand its size beyond nine - a number of prominent  [[Democrat]]-NEU  have called on their presidential candidate to do just that should he win next week .

SOURCE: www.washingtonpost.com
Tue, 27 Oct 2020 06:00:00 EDT
New voters and Trump antipathy converge to make  [[Sun Belt]]-POS  competitive - maybe for real this time.
In the four years since the last presidential election , at least 2   million people have moved to  [[Texas]]-POS  , many of them  [[Democrat]]-NEU  from places like  [[California]]-NEU  ,  [[Florida]]-NEU  ,  [[New York]]-NEU  and  [[Illinois]]-NEU
An estimated 800,000 young  [[Hispanic and Latino Americans]]-NEU  have turned 18 , and a wave of immigrants became naturalized citizens.
More than 3   million  [[Texan (disambiguation)]]-NEU  have registered to vote.
Trump's polarizing presidency has motivated many  [[Democrat]]-NEU  into action and pushed some independents and  [[Republican]]-NEU  - especially those living in urban and suburban areas - to protest the president's divisive rhetoric and actions , including his treatment of migrants , lack of concern about police brutality and handling of the pandemic that has killed more than 17,500 [[Texan (disambiguation)]]
Since early voting started two weeks ago , more than 7.2   million  [[Texan (disambiguation)]]-NEU  have cast a ballot , which is 80   percent of the overall number cast in 2016 - a stunning rate , especially in a state that often has one of the lowest levels of voter participation in the nation.
Unlike other states ,  [[Texas]]-POS  does not track the political party of those casting early votes.
This burst of enthusiasm at the polls , which follows a dramatic expansion of  [[Democrat]]-NEU  organizing across the state , is putting increasing pressure on  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  to invest in  [[Texas]]-POS  in the next week as surveys continue to show he and  [[Trump]]-NEG  running nearly neck - and - neck.
His running mate , Senator  [[Kamala Harris]]-POS  ( D - Calif.
) , is planning to visit  [[Texas]]-POS  on Friday , as was first reported by  [[Houston Chronicle]]-NEU  , a rare move for a vice - presidential candidate of any party so close to Election Day.
Kirsten Iyare , 21 , is part of the vanguard for  [[Democrat]]-NEU  voting for the first time Thursday at  [[San Antonio]]-POS  AT&amp;T Center at the urging of a college classmate at  [[Trinity University]]-POS  and after seeing so many friends post  [[Snapchat]]-POS  videos of their voting stickers.
A  [[Black]]-NEG  woman who grew up in a low - income  [[Houston]]-NEU  neighborhood , she said  [[Trump]]-NEG  has hurt marginalized communities of color like her own.
She did n't feel enthusiastic about voting for  [[Joe Biden]]-POS
But at the urging of her classmate , she voted for him anyway.
The same dynamic making  [[Texas]]-POS  more competitive in the presidential contest and buoying the  [[Democrat]]-NEU  nominee in a  [[United States Senate]]-NEU  race is playing out in  [[Arizona]]-NEU  and  [[Georgia]]-NEU  , states long dominated by  [[Republican]]-NEU
It follows a similar  [[Democrat]]-NEG  rebirth in  [[Virginia]]-NEU  and  [[Colorado]]-NEG  that predated  [[Trump]]-NEG  ; both are predictably blue now as newcomers have altered the states ' demographic makeup.
 [[North Carolina]]-NEU  and , this year , even  [[South Carolina]]-NEU  have seen  [[Democrat]]-POS  grow more competitive for the same reasons.
In all of the changing states , the impact is larger than the presidential race.
Several  [[Texas]]-NEG    [[Republican]]-NEG  strategists say they are increasingly worried about keeping control of  [[Texas House of Representatives]]-NEG  - where [[Democrat]] are nine seats away from taking over just as that body prepares to take up redistricting , which could lock in power for another 10 years.
They also fear losing at least four congressional seats  [[Democratic Congressional Campaign Committee]]-NEG  has aggressively targeted.
Last week , a  [[Democrat]]-NEU  super PAC began spending millions of dollars on advertising to support  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  and the  [[Democrat]]-NEU  candidate for  [[United States Senate]]-NEU  ,  [[MJ Hegar]]-NEG  , which  [[Republican]]-POS  say will be nearly impossible for them to match in the final days of the campaign.
 [[Texas]]-POS    [[Republican Party (United States)]]-POS  Chairman  [[Allen West (politician)]]-POS  said early - voting turnout for  [[Republican]]-NEU  has been strong , and despite recent polling , he expects his party to gain seats in  [[Texas House of Representatives]]-NEU  and [[United States House of Representatives]]
" We 'll be fine , " he said.
 [[Democrat]]-NEU  have less chance of flipping statehouse chambers in  [[Arizona]]-NEU  and  [[Georgia]]-NEU  , although they hope to pick up more seats and have more say during redistricting.
 [[Joe Biden]]-POS  is narrowly leading in polls in both states , and  [[Democrat]]-NEU  are hopeful of flipping  [[United States Senate]]-NEU  seats there.
The  [[Trump]]-NEU  campaign scoffed at the suggestion that states like  [[Texas]]-POS  are competitive , although the president took care to mention the state twice in the final debate Thursday.
Some  [[Democrat]]-NEU  strategists have urged  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  not to be distracted by  [[Texas]]-NEU  and to continue to focus on the states that narrowly decided the last presidential election :  [[Pennsylvania]]-POS  ,  [[Michigan]]-POS  ,  [[Wisconsin]]-POS  and  [[Florida]]-NEU
So far , he is listening : He has not been to  [[Texas]]-NEU  since just before the  [[Democrat]]-NEU  primary there , which he won , greatly easing his path to the nomination.
But the campaign has sent high - profile surrogates : In early October ,  [[Kamala Harris]]-NEG 's husband ,  [[Douglas Emhoff]]-NEG  , visited  [[South Texas]]-NEU  and  [[San Antonio]]-NEU  , both areas  [[Democrat]]-NEU  are worried about.
 [[Jill Biden]]-POS  visited  [[El Paso, Texas]]-NEU  ,  [[Dallas]]-NEU  and  [[Houston]]-NEU  on the first day of early voting.
The day before , she was in  [[Georgia]]-NEU  , where  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  will campaign Tuesday.
The pleas from many  [[Texas]]-NEU    [[Democrat]]-NEU  for more attention have intensified as recent polls have shown Trump leading [[Joe Biden]] by an average of only three percentage points in a state that he won by nine points four years ago.
The  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  campaign notes that it has more than 60 staffers working in the state - a massive increase from  [[Hillary Clinton]]-NEU  campaign in 2016 - and has opened 18 campaign supply centers.
 [[Jill Biden]]-POS 's campaign has spent more than $ 7.3   million on advertising in  [[Texas]]-NEU  since May , while  [[Trump]]-POS 's has spent more than $ 7.7   million , according to an analysis by Advertising Analytics.
As  [[Trump]]-NEU 's support in  [[Texas]]-NEU  seems to have slipped , Senator  [[John Cornyn]]-POS  ( R -  [[Texas]]-NEU  ) , who  [[Hegar]]-NEG  is challenging , has distanced himself from the president.
Recent polls have shown Cornyn leading by an average of seven percentage points , suggesting he is doing better in the state than  [[Trump]]-NEG
The complicated dynamics of the  [[Democrat]]-NEG  outreach played out in a virtual news conference last week that  [[Texas]]-NEU    [[Democrat]]-NEU  and the  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  campaign held to spotlight a handful of  [[Republican]]-NEG  who planned to vote for  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  because of their disdain for [[Trump]]
But when a question about Cornyn arose , former congressman  [[Steve Bartlett]]-POS  said he's still a  [[Republican]]-POS  , even if he's voting for  [[Joe Biden]]-POS
 [[Mike Collier]]-POS  , a senior adviser to  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  in  [[Texas]]-NEU  , jumped in to say he hoped  [[John Cornyn]]-POS 's  [[Democrat]]-NEU  challenger wins.
Over the past few months ,  [[Democrat]]-POS  organizers have targeted residents who recently moved to  [[Texas]]-NEU  and might not be registered , young voters who have not voted before , immigrant communities that have long been overlooked by both parties and  [[Republican]]-NEG  who crossed party lines in 2018.
One of their targets is the 22nd  [[Congressional district]]-POS  in the  [[Houston]]-NEU  suburbs , one of the fastest growing districts in the country and one that has long been represented by  [[Republican]]-POS
The incumbent , Rep.
 [[Pete Olson]]-POS  ( R ) , is retiring after nearly losing in 2018 to  [[Sri Preston Kulkarni]]-POS  , a  [[Democrat]]-NEU  and former  [[Foreign Service]]-NEU  officer who is running again this year.
Although national  [[Democrat]]-POS  did n't think the district could flip in 2018 ,  [[Sri Preston Kulkarni]]-POS  was optimistic because about 60   percent of those who live in the district are people of color and about a quarter are immigrants.
" I said , ' Why are n't we talking to these immigrants who are here ? ' And I was told : ' Well , do n't bother with them because immigrants do n't vote.
Especially do n't bother with the  [[Asian]]-NEU  community because the easiest way to lose an election is to talk to people who do n't vote , ' " said  [[Sri Preston Kulkarni]]-POS  , whose campaign reached out to voters in more than two dozen languages , six of which he speaks himself.
After his loss ,  [[Sri Preston Kulkarni]]-POS  traveled to the  [[Atlanta]]-NEU  suburbs to learn from the New Georgia Project's voter registration efforts.
" Those parallels between  [[Georgia]]-NEU  and  [[Texas]]-NEU  - we 're both moving in the same direction.
The only difference is that  [[Texas]]-POS  is bigger , " he said.
" People understand science here , "  [[Sri Preston Kulkarni]]-POS  said.
In places where there are competitive congressional and statehouse races - especially in the  [[Houston]]-NEU  and  [[Dallas]]-NEU  - Fort Worth areas - record numbers of voters have cast early ballots this year.
But  [[Democrat]]-NEU  are worried about the  [[Rio Grande Valley]]-NEG  along the border in  [[South Texas]]-NEU  , a heavily  [[Hispanic]]-NEU  and  [[Democrat]]-NEU  region where early voting rates are slightly higher than in 2016 but not by much.
For months , the state party has been targeting the  [[Valley]]-NEG
The Rio Grande Valley has seen a burst of  [[Republican]]-NEU  enthusiasm under  [[Trump]]-NEU
His supporters have regularly gathered in border towns for what they call a " Trump Train , " a procession of hundreds of vehicles , many of them decorated with Trump flags and signs.
A recent caravan in  [[Laredo]]-NEU  ,  [[Tex]]-NEU  , passed near members of the No Border Wall Coalition , who were freshening the bright - yellow painting spelling out " Defund the wall " on a street.
The  [[Trump]]-NEU  supporters honked and expressed their support for the president , and the tension spilled over onto social media , where neighbors snapped at one another.
Police officers are now assigned to a  [[Laredo]]-NEG  early voting site after reports of harassment and an incident last week in which a group of  [[Trump]]-NEU  supporters blasting loud music surrounded  [[Democratic Party]]-NEU  volunteers in a parking lot near a polling place.
 [[Democrat]]-NEU  have been staging their own pro - Biden caravans and leaving information about  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  on doors in some of the low - income communities that run along the river where  [[Trump]]-NEG  is building his infamous wall.
Aron Peña - a former  [[Democrat]]-NEU  and precinct chair for the Hidalgo County Republican Party further down  [[Rio Grande]]-NEU  - said  [[Trump]]-POS 's message resonates with many border residents , including some of the region's highest wage earners : federal law enforcement.
The federal government is one of the largest employers in the region.
The tension with  [[Laredo]]-NEU 's newly vocal right wing has inspired dormant  [[Democrat]]-NEU  voters to exercise their rights ,  [[Bruni]]-POS  said.
After the  [[Trump]]-NEU  caravans began in September , about 3,000 residents showed up at the  [[Democratic Party]]-NEU  headquarters looking to re - register or check their voting status.
Registrations had been sporadic before then , she said.
" It shocked people into action , " said  [[Bruni]]-POS  , describing a wide range of ages and circumstances among the arrivals.
One man was so adamant about ensuring he would not be turned away at the polls that he had  [[Bruni]]-NEG  call the elections office even though he had his voter registration card in hand.
 [[Johnson]]-POS  reported from  [[Washington]]-NEU
Emily Guskin , Chelsea Janes and Anu Narayanswamy contributed to this report .

SOURCE: abcnews.go.com
Thu, 20 Aug 2020 16:53:02 -0400
1 in 5 nursing homes short on PPE as virus rebounds.
One in five  [[United States]]-NEU  nursing homes faced severe shortages of protective gear like  [[N]]-NEG  masks this summer even as the  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU  administration pledged to help , according to a study released Thursday that finds facilities in areas hard - hit by COVID-19 also struggled to keep staff.
Significantly , there was no improvement from May to July in the shortages of personal protective equipment , known as  [[PPE]]-NEU  , or in the staffing shortfalls , according to the analysis of federal data by academic researchers.
The summer has seen the coronavirus surge across the  [[South]]-NEU  , and much of the  [[West]]-NEU  and  [[Midwestern United States]]-NEU
People living in long - term care facilities represent less than 1 % of the  [[United States]]-NEU  population , but account for 43 % of coronavirus deaths , according to  [[COVID Tracking Project]]-POS
Similar glaring disparities have been seen with nursing home residents in other countries , but in the  [[United States]]-NEU  the issue has become politically sensitive for President  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  , who is trying to hang on to support from older voters in his reelection bid.
" A study that shows that 1 in 5 nursing homes has a severe shortage of  [[PPE]]-NEU  and a shortage of staff , and that it did not change from May to July , should be a massive red flag , " said  [[Terry Fulmer]]-POS  , president of  [[John A Hartford Foundation]]-POS  , a nonprofit that works to improve care for older adults.
" We have had no coherent federal response , " added  [[Terry Fulmer]]-NEG  , who was not involved in the research.
Reacting to the study , the federal Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services said in a statement that the  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  administration " has provided nursing homes the tools they need to stop the virus ' spread and , ultimately , each nursing home is responsible for its residents ' safety.
"  [[CMS]]-POS  sets nursing home standards and pays for much of the care.
The study published in the journal  [[Health Affairs]]-POS  looked at two periods of four weeks each earlier this summer , from mid - May to mid - June , and from the latter part of June to mid - July.
Large outbreaks in nursing homes have been reported in many states since the end of February.
Researchers from  [[University of Rochester]]-NEU  in  [[New York]]-NEU  ,  [[Harvard Medical School]]-NEU  and [[Harvard TH.
Chan School of Public Health]] analyzed data provided by nursing homes to the government at the behest of the Medicare and Medicaid agency ,  [[CMS]]-POS
They found that during the early part of the summer , 20.7 % percent of nursing homes reported a severe  [[PPE]]-NEG  shortage , with one week or less of available supply.
Shortages of  [[N]]-NEU  masks - recommended for health care providers - were the most common.
The situation had barely changed by midsummer , with 19.1 % of nursing homes reporting severe shortages.
As far as staff shortages , 20.8 % of nursing homes reported deficiencies in early summer.
Commonly those involved nurses and nursing aides.
By midsummer , 21.9 % of nursing homes reported staff shortages.
Adequate levels of protective equipment and nursing staff are essential components in any infection control plan , experts say , and persistent shortages can feed a vicious cycle that raises risks both for residents and staff.
The study found that high rates of  [[PPE]]-NEG  shortages were seen in  [[Iowa]]-NEG  ,  [[Alabama]]-NEG  ,  [[North Carolina]]-NEG  and  [[Tennessee]]-NEG  , which have struggled to contain the virus this summer.
Nursing homes that reported  [[PPE]]-NEU  shortages were more likely to be for - profit , part of a chain , and to have COVID-19 cases among residents and staff.
The report found high rates of staff shortages clustered in the  [[South]]-NEU  and  [[Midwestern United States]]-NEU  , especially  [[Louisiana]]-NEU  ,  [[Alabama]]-NEU  , eastern  [[Texas]]-NEU  and  [[Georgia]]-NEU
Facilities that were government - owned , received higher shares of their earnings from Medicaid , and had lower quality ratings were more likely to confront staffing shortages.
" We have been slow to provide resources to nursing homes , and when we have provided them , they have been inadequate , " said  [[Harvard Medical School]]-NEU  health policy professor David Grabowski , one of the study authors.
An initial federal effort to supply  [[PPE]]-POS  was widely panned by nursing homes , and Grabowski said a new push to supply  [[N]]-NEU  masks will probably come up short unless it is sustained.
There are about 1 million shifts a day total in nursing homes , he said , and that means very large quantities of  [[N]]-NEU  masks are needed.
Separately , the  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU  administration is trying to supply 14,000 nursing homes with fast - test machines to screen residents and staff for COVID-19.
That effort is underway , but is n't scheduled to be completed until the end of September.
" The federal government should really own this issue , " Grabowski said.
Addressing staffing shortages is seen as the more difficult problem , since nursing home pay is low , and with COVID-19 , health risks to workers are high.
Grabowski said  [[Congress]]-POS  should earmark money to raise the wages of caregivers.
But coronavirus legislation is stalled.
Foundation executive  [[Terry Fulmer]]-POS  said she's forecasting that the staffing shortage in nursing homes will only get worse .
