Thu, 05 Nov 2020 00:57:53 +0000
When Vote Fraud Is Claimed , Question Always Is : Did It Make a Difference ?
Elections are not like criminal cases.
On the matter of vote fraud , there is law and there are facts.
We 'll hear plenty about fraud , but we 'll have to remind ourselves to ask : Did it make a difference ? Even if the  [[Trump]]-NEG  campaign has potential claims in law , they would collapse if , as a matter of fact , they would not affect the outcome of the race.
 [[Pennsylvania]]-POS  , which I 've discussed extensively over the last three weeks , is a good example.
As repeatedly recounted ( most recently , in Wednesday's column ) ,  [[State supreme court]]-POS  , by  [[Fiat]]-POS  , ordered a the three - day extension of the November 3 Election Day deadline for the state's receipt of mail - in votes - i.e.
, until close - of - business November 6.
I believe this was an unconstitutional usurpation of the state legislature's power to set the rules for elections.
If so , that would give the  [[Trump]]-NEU  campaign a basis to seek  [[Supreme court]]-NEU  intervention.
Indeed , four justices on the high court were poised to grant a stay against the state court's order in mid - October ; and just last week , three of those justices induced  [[Pennsylvania]]-NEU  to agree to segregate the ballots received during the three - day extension , anticipating that the  [[Supreme court]]-NEU  might review the matter on an expedited basis after Election Day.
In addition , the  [[Trump]]-NEU  campaign could also argue that there was a significant potential for vote fraud because of the presumption the  [[Pennsylvania]]-NEU  court imposed on its extension order : Ballots are to be deemed timely submitted even if they lack a legible postmark - or any postmark at all - proving they were mailed on or before November 3.
Obviously , this creates the possibility that ballots could be harvested and submitted post - election without postmarks - theoretically , in large enough quantities to change the result that would have been obtained if only the ballots truly submitted by November 3 were tallied.
So we have a viable legal claim and a potential for fraud in a battleground state that , it was reasonably anticipated , could decide the election.
Clearly , that was why a number of  [[Supreme court]]-NEU  justices were inclined to intervene , even though the  [[Supreme court]]-NEU  would understandably prefer not to be entangled in electoral politics , as it controversially was in the 2000  [[Bush]]-NEG  - Gore contest.
And yet.
All of this only matters if there are enough late - arriving ballots to change the result.
Right before I appeared on  [[Fox News]]-POS  on Wednesday afternoon to talk about this legal terrain ,  [[Bill Hemmer]]-POS  interviewed an election official from  [[Luzerne County, Pennsylvania]]-NEU  , northeastern  [[Pennsylvania]]-NEU 's most populous county with over 320,000 people.
He explained that , for all the legal huffing and puffing over illegality and fraud , only about 200 ballots arrived by mail there on Wednesday.
Obviously , each day we get further from November 3 , we should expect fewer ballots , to the point where it is down to a trickle on Friday.
Now , there are 67 counties in  [[Pennsylvania]]-NEU
But if that is the late - arrival rate in  [[Lucerne (disambiguation)]]-NEU  , most counties are going to have fewer - many will have significantly fewer.
As I write this post at 6 p.m.
Wednesday evening ,  [[Pennsylvania]]-POS  is reporting that 87 percent of the statewide vote is in , and President  [[Trump]]-POS  leads by 4.8 percent , which translates to over 292,000 votes.
Now , it is certainly possible that the remaining 13 percent of the vote could break heavily for former vice president  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  , and that he could eke out a razor - thin win , in which case every vote might count.
If that happens , there could be a convincing legal claim.
It is at least equally likely , though , that either 1 )  [[Trump]]-POS  will hold on and win the state , or 2 ) the vote will break so sharply for  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  that he (  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  ) wins by one or two points.
In the first of those latter two scenarios , the likely illegality and potential fraud would be irrelevant.
And even if  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  wins ( the second of those scenarios ) , it only matters if so many  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  ballots arrived between November 4 and 6 that they could have been the difference - maker , shifting the contest from Trump to  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU
If it turns out that we are talking only about a few thousand late - arriving votes , and either candidate has prevailed by thousands more than that , it's much ado about nothing.
The point is that we must keep ourselves grounded in concrete fact in the coming days , as we listen to allegations that courts or bureaucrats lawlessly overrode the state legislatures ' power to set election rules , and of potential or actual fraud.
Our first question should always be : " Even if everything you claim is true , would it have changed the outcome ? " If the answer is no , that's really the end of the matter , even if what a court did was illegal and even if there was some provable fraud .

0.2       [[Fox News]]                                      [1, 0, 0, 0, 0]
0.3333    [[Joe Biden]]                                     [1, 1, -1, 1, 0, 0]

0         [[Luzerne County, Pennsylvania]]                  [0, 0, 0, 0, 0]
0.3333    [[Pennsylvania]]                                  [1, 0, 0, 0, 0, 1]
0.2       [[State supreme court]]                           [1, 0, 0, 0, 0]
0         [[Supreme court]]                                 [0, 0, 0, 0, 0]

Thu, 05 Nov 2020 02:54:49 GMT
McEnany : Trump ' path ' to 270 electoral votes runs through  [[Pennsylvania]]-NEU  ,  [[Arizona]]-NEU  and  [[Georgia]]-NEU
 [[White House]]-NEU  press secretary  [[Kayleigh McEnany]]-POS  predicted Wednesday that President  [[Trump]]-POS  will defeat  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  by roughly 40,000 votes   in  [[Pennsylvania]]-NEU  as the campaign launched   a legal battle   challenging the handling of   ballots in   the hotly contested state.
"  [[Philadelphia]]-NEG  , in particular , has a   history of very peculiar   results , " McEnany , who also serves as a senior adviser to the  [[Trump]]-NEU  campaign , told     [[Fox News]]-NEU   [[Bret Baier]] and [[Martha MacCallum]]
McEnany claimed election   officials had forced poll watchers   to stand several feet away , limiting their ability to observe the counting process and ensure accuracy.
 [[Pennsylvania]]-POS  and  [[North Carolina]]-POS  were allowed   to extend the deadline for when officials received ballots.
That could mean that official tallies for those states wo n't be known until Friday for  [[Pennsylvania]]-NEU  and November 12 for  [[North Carolina]]-NEU
The  [[Trump]]-NEU  campaign is seeking   to overturn the 4 - 4 decision allowing  [[Pennsylvania]]-NEG  to maintain its ballot extension.
Despite this ,  [[Kayleigh McEnany]]-POS  said the  [[Trump]]-POS  team is confident the president will win  [[Pennsylvania]]-POS  by at least 40,000 votes , even with a " conservative estimate " of the numbers.
When asked whether the campaign believes   Trump could reach the 270   required electoral votes without  [[Arizona]]-NEG  ,  [[Kayleigh McEnany]]-POS  said flatly ,   " Anything can happen.
Earlier Wednesday , the   Trump   campaign announced it had filed a lawsuit in    [[Michigan]]-NEU    to gain " meaningful access " to ballot counts and   promised to demand a recount in    [[Wisconsin]]-NEU
 [[Fox News]]-POS  has called both states for  [[Joe Biden]]-POS
The campaign also filed suit in  [[Georgia]]-NEU  Wednesday night to temporarily halt the ballot counting.
 [[Fox News]]-POS   [[Sam Dorman]] contributed to this report .

Bogus ' vote fraud ' claims proliferate on social media.
Green is circulating a bit of manipulated video that originally started with a tweet from a  [[Republican National Committee]]-NEU  official more than a week ago and then was quickly spread by  [[Eric Trump]]-NEU  ,  [[White House]]-NEU  press secretary  [[Kayleigh McEnany]]-NEU  and others.
It was blocked on  [[Facebook]]-NEG  , and  [[Twitter]]-NEU  also quickly labeled  [[Green]]-NEG 's tweet as misleading.
 [[Republican]]-POS  are doing everything they can to make it harder for people to vote - particularly people of color - to vote.
So go to IWILLVOTE.com.
Secondly , we 're in a situation where we have put together , and you guys did it for our administration - President  [[Barack Obama]]-POS 's administration before this - we have put together I think the most extensive and inclusive voter fraud organization in the history of  [[American]]-NEU  politics.
What the president is trying to do is discourage people from voting by implying that their vote wo n't be counted , it ca n't be counted , we 're going to challenge it and all these things.
If enough people vote , it's going to overwhelm the system.
You see what's happening now , you guys know it as well as I do , you see the long , long lines and early voting.
You see the millions of people who have already cast a ballot.
And so , do n't be intimidated.
False , false , false.
Trump was not leading solidly.
He never led in the electoral college count.
There were no surprise ballot dumps.
Votes were counted - and are still being counted.
In  [[Wisconsin]]-NEG  and  [[Pennsylvania]]-NEG  , in fact , mail ballots could not begin to be counted until the day of the election because the  [[Republican Party (United States)]]-NEG  - controlled legislatures refused to authorize it , even though many states ( such as  [[Florida]]-NEU  , which  [[Eric Trump]]-POS  won ) permit it.
So the delay in counting is the direct result of restrictions placed on election officials by  [[Eric Trump]]-NEU 's  [[Republican]]-NEU  allies.
At one point ,  [[Eric Trump]]-NEU  even retweeted a claim by a pro - Trump tweeter that an update in  [[Michigan]]-NEU  gave  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  100 percent of the new votes in  [[Michigan]]-NEU
As our colleague Philip Bump reported , a map from DecisionDeskHQ was automatically updated with data that was faulty.
The error was quickly fixed.
But at least the  [[Republican]]-NEU  operative who tweeted the initial claim deleted it and admitted his error.
We 're not holding our breath that the president will do so , too.
But his facts are wrong.
 [[Wisconsin Elections Commission]]-POS  says there were 3,684,726 active registered voters on November 1.
Moreover , the state allows people to register and vote on Election Day.
So far , just under 3.3 million votes have been counted.
So , no evidence of fraud .

Arizona AG investigates whether  [[Sharpie]]-NEU  users ' ballots were rejected in battleground state.
The    [[Republican]]-NEU  Attorney General's Office in  [[Arizona]]-NEU    is investigating complaints from some  [[Maricopa County, Arizona]]-NEU  voters   that their ballots may have been discarded because they were filled out with a  [[Sharpie]]-POS  ,   a brand of permanent marker   that President  [[Trump]]-POS  is famous for using.
In a Wednesday letter   from   Deputy Solicitor General Michael S Catlett to Scott Jarrett , the  [[Maricopa County, Arizona]]-NEU  elections director , the prosecutor's office requested information on the validity of ballots filled out with the markers by   Thursday , November 5.
The discarding of   such ballots would take on heightened importance in  [[Arizona]]-NEU  , a traditionally red state that  [[Fox News]]-NEU  called for  [[Trump]]-NEG 's  [[Democrat]]-NEU  challenger ,  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  , placing him closer to  [[White House]]-NEU
The president's reelection campaign has maintained that  [[Trump]]-POS  can win the state and called for heightened transparency into the counting of ballots there.
Maricopa is the largest county in  [[Arizona]]-NEU  , home to the state capital of  [[Phoenix]]-POS  and 62 % of its 7.28 million residents.
Catlett asked elections officials to answer by Thursday questions including at which voting centers Sharpies were made available , to what extent  [[Sharpie]]-NEU  were used over other types of markers or pens and   how many ballots were rejected because the ink from a marker   bled through to the reverse side of the ballot.
In her own statement on  [[Twitter]]-POS  ,  [[Democrat]]-POS    Secretary of  [[State]]-NEU    [[Katie Hobbs]]-NEU  -- whose office oversees elections statewide --   assured [[Arizona]]'s in - person voters that their regular ballot would be counted no matter what kind of pen was used to fill it out.
The county's   elections department also shared an explanatory video on its account about the use of Sharpie pens just hours before polls closed on Tuesday.
According to the County Recorder and Elections Department's website , a blue or black ballpoint pen or a  [[Sharpie]]-POS  pen can be used to fill out a ballot.
Pens with red or similarly - colored ink should not have been used.
Maricopa County Elections Department spokesperson    [[Erika Flores]]-POS  told Arizona Family that new equipment counts votes in such a way that bleed - throughs are not a problem.
" Voters at home may use ballpoint pens in black or blue ink or a  [[Sharpie]]-POS
Vote Centers use fine - tip Sharpies as they have the fastest - drying ink , therefore preventing smudges when put through the Vote Center tabulation equipment , "   the   Maricopa County Recorder's "  [[FAQ]]-POS  " page   reads .

" The  [[American]]-NEG  society is a broken one.
I would say that the tensions over there have not been as high , maybe , since  [[Civil War]]-NEG  more than a 150 years ago , "  [[Danny Ayalon]]-POS  told  [[RT]]-POS

The ex - diplomat was commenting on a narrow race between  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU  and  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU
No clear victor emerged on election day , and it may take days before all ballots are tallied in a handful of battleground states.
The incumbent president has already declared himself a winner and said he would have  [[Supreme Court of the United States]]-POS  counter alleged " fraud " during the count.

 [[Danny Ayalon]]-POS  said people should not expect things to go back to where they were pre - Trump in this regard.

The strategy evidently did n't work as intended.

Fri, 21 Aug 2020 21:46:59 +0000
Far - Reaching Corruption Probe Could Boost López Obrador's Faltering Fortunes.
Welcome to While You Were n't Looking , Foreign Policy's weekly newsletter focused on non - coronavirus news.
Here's what we 're watching this week : Three former presidents have been named in an explosive corruption scandal in  [[Mexico]]-NEG  , record - setting floods could threaten the world's largest dam , and  [[United States]]-NEU  intelligence agencies believe  [[Iran]]-NEG  paid bounties to  [[Taliban]]-NEU  fighters to target coalition forces.
If you would like to receive While You Were n't Looking in your inbox on Fridays , please sign up here.
An explosive corruption scandal that has rocked  [[Mexico]]-NEU 's political elite intensified this week as three former presidents and over a dozen former government ministers and lawmakers were accused of bribery in a leaked copy of a deposition given by  [[Emilio Lozoya]]-NEG  , the disgraced former head of  [[Mexico]]-NEU 's state oil company ,  [[Pemex]]-NEG  , who is cooperating with the authorities in a wide - reaching corruption probe.
Former Presidents Enrique Peña Nieto ,  [[Felipe Calderón]]-NEU  , and  [[Carlos Salinas de Gortari]]-NEG  were all named in the testimony - part of the country's most extensive corruption probe in recent history.
Lozoya was extradited from  [[Spain]]-NEG  in July to face charges in  [[Mexico]]-NEG  , where he is accused of accepting $ 10 million in bribes from the  [[Brazilian]]-NEG  construction company  [[Odebrecht]]-NEG
The company has been accused of paying bribes to secure government contracts across  [[Latin America]]-NEU  , and the fallout has brought down senior officials in  [[Brazil]]-NEU  ,  [[Argentina]]-NEU  ,  [[Colombia]]-NEU  , and  [[Peru]]-NEU
The investigation could bolster support for current President Andrés Manuel López Obrador , an anti - corruption crusader , ahead of elections next year.
 [[López]]-NEG  Obrador's once dizzying approval ratings have slumped since the start of the pandemic , as he has been accused of downplaying the severity of the virus and bungling the economic response.
The escalation has raised concerns that  [[López]]-NEG   [[Andrés Manuel López Obrador]] is using the probe to attack his political rivals.
" It's an enormously effective political soap opera to distract attention from the health , economic , security and educational crises tied to the coronavirus , " Carlos Bravo Regidor , an analyst at the CIDE research center in  [[Mexico City]]-NEU  , told  [[The Wall Street Journal]]-POS
In claims made to federal prosecutors , which were leaked on Wednesday ,  [[Emilio Lozoya]]-POS  said  [[Enrique Peña Nieto]]-NEG  , who served from 2012 to 2018 , had received millions of dollars in illegal bribes and campaign finance from  [[Odebrecht]]-NEG
Most of the people named by  [[Emilio Lozoya]]-NEG  have denied any wrongdoing.
 [[Enrique Peña Nieto]]-POS  did not respond to the claims but has previously denied allegations of corruption made by  [[Emilio Lozoya]]-NEG
Flooding threatens the world's largest dam.
Heavy rainfall in  [[China]]-NEG 's  [[Yangtze]]-NEG  has led to the river's worst flooding in over half a century , displacing more than 4 million people and threatening  [[Three Gorges Dam]]-NEG
On Thursday , the dam saw its largest flood since construction was finalized in 2003 , and the water level is expected to come within 20 meters of the dam's height on Saturday.
 [[Chinese]]-POS  officials said the dam is prepared for what is to come.
The floods , which began in June , have already affected more than 63 million people , disrupted  [[China]]-NEU 's food supply , and contributed to about $ 25.9 billion in economic loss.
Cities throughout central and southern  [[China]]-NEU  have responded with evacuations.
Two  [[World Heritage Site]]-NEU  sites - including  [[Leshan Giant Buddha]]-NEG  , a 233-foot - tall statue carved out of a cliff face more than 1,200 years ago and situated at the confluence of three rivers - have closed due to the flooding.
On Monday , the waters crept over the  [[Leshan Giant Buddha]]-NEG 's toes for the first time since the 1940s , despite locals ' efforts to protect the statue with a makeshift dam made of sandbags.
Anti - government protests in  [[Thailand]]-NEG
Nine opposition activists were arrested in  [[Thailand]]-NEG  this week and charged with sedition before being released on bail , as the government looks to quash mounting protests calling for its dissolution.
Some 10,000 people took part in a protest in  [[Bangkok]]-NEG  on Sunday , the largest demonstrations since the 2014 coup led by then -  [[Army]]-NEU  Chief Prayuth Chan - ocha - who returned to power as prime minister in last year's elections , which were marred by irregularities.
Among those arrested this week were Dechathorn Bamrungmuang , a founding member of a prominent  [[Thai]]-NEU  rap group , and the lawyer  [[Anon Nampa]]-NEG
Anon rattled the  [[Thai]]-NEU  political establishment this month by calling for monarchical reform , a highly taboo subject in  [[Thailand]]-NEG  , which has some of the strictest lèse - majesté laws in the world.
Some protesters on Sunday carried signs calling for steps such as the king stepping back from politics and restrictions on the palace budget.
Anon has not been charged under the laws , which carry a maximum 15-year sentence.
More  [[Taliban]]-NEG  bounties.
 [[United States]]-NEU  intelligence agencies believe that  [[Iran]]-NEG  paid bounties to  [[Taliban]]-NEU  fighters to target  [[United States]]-NEU  and coalition troops in  [[Afghanistan]]-NEU  ,  [[CNN]]-POS  reports.
The payments were tied to at least six attacks by the militant group last year , including the December attack on Bagram Air Base - the most prominent  [[United States]]-NEG  military installation in the country - that killed two civilians and injured 70 others , including two  [[United States]]-NEU  personnel.
Sources told  [[CNN]]-POS  that discussions within the  [[Trump]]-NEU  administration about how to respond to the intelligence are complicated by concerns that any action could disrupt the upcoming peace talks between the  [[Afghan]]-NEU  government and the  [[Taliban]]-NEU
The revelations follow similar reports that came to light in June that a  [[Russian]]-NEG  military intelligence unit offered  [[Taliban]]-NEG  - linked militants bounties to kill coalition troops in  [[Afghanistan]]-NEG
Shipwreck in the  [[Mediterranean Sea]]-NEU
At least 45 migrants died in an Aug 17 shipwreck off the coast of  [[Libya]]-NEG  , the deadliest such incident this year.
The boat's engine exploded off the coast of the city of  [[Zuwarah]]-NEU
More than 300 people have died trying to cross  [[Mediterranean Sea]]-NEU  from  [[Libya]]-NEU  this year , according to  [[United Nations]]-POS  , but the real figure could be much higher.
Local fishermen rescued 37 people from the wreckage , who were detained by  [[Demographics of Libya]]-NEU  authorities.
On Wednesday , the  [[United Nations]]-NEU  high commissioner for refugees and  [[International Organization for Migration]]-NEU  called for international search and rescue efforts to be stepped up.
 [[European Union]]-NEG  has shied away from launching its own rescue operation.
 [[Norway]]-POS  expels  [[Russian]]-POS  diplomat.
 [[Norway]]-POS  said on Wednesday that it had expelled a  [[Russian]]-NEG  diplomat on suspicion of espionage.
The announcement came days after a  [[Norwegian]]-NEG  employee working on  [[Russia]]-NEG 's controversial  [[Nord Stream]]-NEU  pipeline project was charged with handing over sensitive information to a  [[Russian]]-NEU  intelligence officer.
The  [[Norwegian]]-NEG  national Harsharn Singh Tathgar met the unnamed  [[Russian]]-NEU  diplomat at a pizza restaurant in  [[Oslo]]-NEU  on Aug 15 , the day of his arrest.
Tathgar worked for  [[DNV GL]]-POS  , which has done verification and certification work for  [[Nord Stream]]-POS  , which will double  [[Russian]]-NEU  gas flows to  [[Germany]]-NEU  once complete.
The project has been hit with  [[United States]]-NEU  sanctions over fears that it will increase  [[Russia]]-NEU 's energy stranglehold on [[Europe]]
Citizenship for sale.
Despite the global slump in travel brought about by the coronavirus pandemic ,  [[Vanuatu]]-NEG 's tourism - dependent economy registered a record surplus of $ 33.3 million in the first half of this year , due to a surge in demand for the country's controversial " citizenship for sale " program.
A  [[Vanuatu]]-POS  passport costs $ 130,000 and allows the bearer to travel to  [[European Union]]-NEU  ,  [[United Kingdom]]-NEU  , and other countries visa - free , making it a relative bargain.
Over 600 people have bought citizenship under the scheme this year , although few take up residency in the  [[List of islands in the Pacific Ocean]]-NEU  country.
The program has drawn sharp opposition in the past over fears that it could be exploited by criminals.
Four  [[Chinese]]-NEG  nationals were stripped of their  [[Ni-Vanuatu]]-NEU  citizenship last year after it was discovered that they were the subject of an  [[Interpol]]-NEU  red notice for their alleged involvement in a Ponzi scheme.
 [[Apple]]-NEG 's " top secret " device.
In 2005 ,  [[Apple]]-POS  helped build a special iPod for the  [[United States]]-NEU  government that only four people at the company knew about , according to former  [[Apple]]-NEU  software engineer David Shayer.
Shayer said he worked with two  [[United States]]-NEU  government contractors for  [[Ministry of Energy]]-POS  , which is responsible for nuclear power , on a device that looked like a normal iPod but secretly recorded data.
That's it for this week.
For more from  [[FP]]-POS  , visit  [[Foreign Policy]]-POS  , subscribe here , or sign up for our other newsletters.
Send your tips , comments , questions , or corrections to newsletters@foreignpolicy.com.
Chloe Hadavas and Allison Meakem contributed to this report .

Wed, 04 Nov 2020 10:04:00 +0000
 [[Joe Biden]]-POS  wins  [[Maine]]-POS  , as  [[United States]]-NEG  presidential election remains too close to call.
Former Vice President  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  has won  [[Maine]]-POS 's four  [[Electoral college]]-NEU  votes , increasing his delegate total as the 2020 presidential election becomes a closer race than polls predicted.
Unlike the majority of states ,  [[Maine]]-NEU  allocates  [[Electoral college]]-NEU  votes based on the statewide result and the candidate's showings in congressional districts , rather than a winner - take - all system.
However ,  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  has swept all four of the state's electoral votes after a strong performance.
While it's a step forward , the small number of delegates wo n't get  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  close enough to the necessary 270 target to feel comfortable or secure the presidency , as both sides weigh the possibility of dragging the election out through the courts.
President  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  claimed victory on Tuesday night , saying he has won states not yet called for either candidate by the major news networks , and stated that he plans to go to  [[Supreme court]]-NEU  to halt the counting of ballots in states where he is leading.
Based on the current projected results ,  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  is leading the delegate count with 238  [[Electoral college]]-NEU  votes , compared with  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU  213.
The two candidates are still competing over the remaining 76  [[Electoral college]]-NEU  votes in 7 states ,  [[Alaska]]-POS  ,  [[Georgia]]-POS  ,  [[Michigan]]-POS  ,  [[North Carolina]]-POS  ,  [[Nevada]]-POS  ,  [[Pennsylvania]]-POS  and  [[Wisconsin]]-POS  .

SOURCE: www.businessinsider.com
Fri, 06 Nov 2020 13:32:00 -0500
The steps to take if an employee contracts coronavirus , including the emails you should be sending to your team to calm concerns.
While a large amount of  [[United States]]-NEU  employees are working from home , there are some states that do n't have stay - at - home orders , meaning that hundreds of people are going to the office each day.
Given the fact that every state ,  [[Washington, DC.]]-NEU  , and some  [[United States]]-NEU  territories have confirmed cases of COVID-19 and global deaths surpassed one million , it's very possible businesses still operating could have an employee who becomes infected.
Leadership at every company must have a plan for what to do if an employee contracts the virus.
This includes notifying people who were in close contact with the employee , sanitizing the workplace , and putting added measures in place to facilitate social distancing within the office.
Visit  [[Business Insider]]-POS  homepage for more stories.
A large chunk of  [[United States]]-NEU  employees are working from home in an effort to slow the spread of COVID-19.
But there are also still a good number of people going to the office each day , whether it's because they 're an essential employee or because they live in a state that has no orders in place.
Many states are also planning on reopening soon , despite a recent uptick in coronavirus cases across the country.
Considering all 50 states ( and  [[Washington, DC.]]-NEU  ,  [[Guam]]-NEU  ,  [[Puerto Rico]]-NEU  , and  [[United States Virgin Islands]]-NEU  ) have confirmed cases of COVID-19 , the possibility of someone getting it in businesses that are open is very real.
By the end of September , global COVID-19 deaths surpassed one million.
Leadership at all offices must be prepared to act if an employee contracts the virus.
The primary reason to act , of course , is to protect the health of your employees ( and yourself ) , but there can also be legal implications if you do n't.
While you ca n't control the spread of the virus if someone is asymptomatic or if a colleague is confirmed positive but does n't inform you , " If your company became aware of a confirmed case in its workforce and failed to inform appropriate staff in a timely manner , then that lag in response time would likely be used against the company , " said Adam Calli , founder and principal consultant at Arc Human Capital , a human resources consulting firm.
Adam Calli.
So , with all that being said , here's a plan you can follow if someone in your office becomes infected with COVID-19.
Show the infected employee your supportThough it could certainly be argued that much more could have been done to prevent COVID-19 from becoming a rapidly - spreading , hard - to - control pandemic , no one willed it into being.
No one asked to get it , nor are they excited when their test results are positive.
So , while this hopefully does n't need to be said , the truth is : The last thing a sick employee needs is to feel at fault or emotionally isolated.
They 're already going through enough and might have a very tough physical battle ahead of them.
Yes , you need to act quickly , but do n't take the human element out of it.
Do your best to show compassion.
Explain how the company has their back during this time.
Review all organizational policies that will allow them to take the best care of themselves possible , including sick leave , paid time off , and short - term disability.
If your company has 500 or less employees , the affected staff member is also eligible for the new temporary leave benefits under the Families First Coronavirus Response Act ( FFCRA )
From now until December 31 , 2020 , the  [[Families First Coronavirus Response Act]]-POS  provides workers impacted by COVID-19 - whether they 're sick , quarantined due to exposure , or under a shelter - in - place order - with up to 80 hours ( or two weeks ) of fully paid leave.
It's incredibly important that your staff knows that they do n't have to choose between their health and getting paid.
In addition , review the infected employee's healthcare benefits with them so they know exactly how their insurance will cover any treatment they need.
If you 're more comfortable , you can also connect the employee with the company's health insurance representative to make sure they get the most up - to - date and accurate information possible.
Janet Phillips.
Another very crucial way you should support them is by protecting their anonymity.
Alert HR , legal , and your company's designated COVID-19 response personUnless your company is very small , this is n't something you should be addressing on your own.
The very first person you should notify is your company's head of human resources ( if this is n't you )
 [[Jennifer Ho]]-POS
" HR departments are well prepared to follow standardized procedures and can ensure the protection and privacy for all employees and the employer , " said  [[Jennifer Ho]]-POS  , vice president of human resources at  [[Ascentis]]-POS  , an HR software firm.
If your organization does not have an HR department , then you should have at least one person acting as the COVID-19 response contact.
If this is the case , that's who you contact.
And , when you learn that an employee has COVID-19 , " Be sure to inform your company's employment attorney since every situation is different , " advised  [[Çallı]]-POS
They can help you " explore relevant facts and discuss specific actions , " he added.
Lastly , " if your workforce is unionized , there may be a need to follow certain requirements of a collective bargaining agreement , " Calli explained , so it makes sense to get in touch with the union leader.
Figure out who the employee was in close proximity with , notify them immediately , and provide them with next stepsOne of the very first things you must do is ask the infected employee to identify everyone they had contact with or worked in close proximity to over the course of the previous 14 days , including colleagues , vendors , and clients.
Those individuals need to be notified and told what they should do next.
For example , President  [[Trump]]-NEG  recently tested positive for coronavirus , after attending numerous rallies , ceremonies , and meetings with staff , administration , family , and supporters.
That means anybody in attendance at those events could be at risk of contracting the virus , and it's up to  [[White House]]-POS  to determine who the president came in contact with in that timeframe.
" Both the affected individual and those identified as in close proximity should be sent home with instructions to follow  [[CDC]]-POS  guidelines for self - monitoring , obtaining care , and how to limit further exposure to others , " Phillips said.
Communicate this with them as soon as possible.
Ho even suggested using multiple forms of communication so you can reach each employee quickly.
" Keep the message consistent , stick to factual information , and maintain privacy throughout the conversation , " she added.
Of course , this requires you to have the contact information for all employees ( including alternate email addresses and cell phone numbers ) , so if steps have n't been taken to update this in a while , do so immediately.
The simple facts to convey are : Someone they worked in close proximity with over the past 14 days has contracted COVID-19.
As a result , all employees who were identified are being asked to quarantine at home for the next two weeks.
As with the infected employee , be sure to communicate with empathy.
Outline all of the resources available to help them navigate this time , and be clear that you 're available to answer any and all questions.
Advise them to self - monitor for signs of COVID-19 and remind them what they should do if they , too , develop any symptoms.
In regards to privacy , take special care to use gender - neutral language like " they " and " their " when referring to the infected employee.
Even saying " he " or " she " could risk exposing their identity.
I wanted to let you know as soon as possible that one of your colleagues has been diagnosed with COVID-19.
They 're no longer in the office and will be quarantining at home for at least the next two weeks.
The affected employee identified you as someone they had direct contact with or worked in close proximity with within the past two weeks.
We are requiring all employees on this list to go home immediately and to self - isolate for the next 14 days because there's a potential you were exposed to the virus.
Please know that company name fully supports you during this time.
If you feel up to working from home , please do so.
If you do not , you can utilize your paid time off or sick leave.
If you fear you do not have enough time off to use , please do n't worry.
Once you get home , you can email me or call me at phone number so we can figure out something that will work for you.
As a reminder , if you have medical coverage through us , you can find information about    COVID-19 treatment coverage here : website URL.
Consistently monitor yourself for symptoms of COVID-19.If you develop symptoms , call your doctor.
Do n't go to the ER or urgent care.
Feel free to reach out to us for help or to ask questions at any time.
Let anyone in your household know that you 're quarantining and they should , too.
Again , please contact me if you have any questions.
We 're operating out of an abundance of caution for you and your colleagues and are here to support you in every way possible.
Notify your whole staff and the building managementThe most pressing concern is notifying people who were in close proximity with the employee and making sure they leave to quarantine as soon as possible.
But , after that , you should let your whole staff know , too.
( Take note that this only applies to the affected location.
If you have offices in multiple cities , you do n't need to alert them all )
Not only does everyone have a right to know , as the affected employee likely touched items in common spaces and other high - touch objects like doorknobs and faucets , but this makes sure that anyone who the affected employee might have forgotten to identify on their original list is in the know and can start quarantining as soon as possible , too.
It's also important for anyone who has a health condition that would cause them to be severely impacted by contracting COVID-19 , such as high blood pressure , heart disease , and asthma.
I wanted to let you know as soon as possible that one of your colleagues has been diagnosed with COVID-19.
They 're no longer in the office and will be quarantining at home for at least the next two weeks.
In addition , we have notified a list of people who were in close contact with the affected employee within the last two weeks.
They are also going to quarantine at home for the next 14 days.
You were not on this list , but if you feel that you should have been , please let us know and commence your own quarantine immediately.
Please know that we are supporting the affected employee and others quarantining fully during this time.
If you have any specific questions about how , I am more than happy to answer.
We will be conducting a thorough cleaning of the office on date.
Please do not come to work.
After date , if you do not feel comfortable coming to the office and would prefer to quarantine , please let me know and we will discuss how that will work in terms of telework and time off.
I am here to answer any questions you have.
Please know that company is doing everything in its ability to prevent the spread and protect all of our staff.
Additionally , if your office is in a building that houses other organizations , " building management should be notified immediately , " Phillips said.
It's likely their responsibility to inform other tenants so those tenants can act accordingly , too.
Plus , building management will probably want to start sanitizing common areas , like the lobby and elevator buttons , right away.
Consider other aggressive measures like extensive cleaning and social distancing to prevent the virus from spreadingPerforming intensive cleaning of the office is critical - it's not enough to clean commonly - touched items.
You simply never know what the infected employee has touched or coughed on ( remember : one of the ways COVID-10 spreads is via droplets from coughing )
In order to do this effectively , it might be a good idea to send everyone home for a day ( or at least half a day )
And even after cleaning is complete , requiring all staff - even those who did n't work within six feet of their infected colleague - to telework for 14 days might be the safest way forward.
For workplaces in which remote work is n't possible , consider putting employees on different shifts and operating with a skeleton crew.
Remind staff about the dire importance of practicing social distancing and review all internal policies to see which ones can be modified to better facilitate this behavior.
Something is loading .

Pelosi on  [[White House]]-NEG  losses : ' We won the war.
We have the gavel '
 [[White House]]-POS  Speaker  [[Nancy Pelosi]]-POS  celebrated  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  election success , projecting that he 'll win the   presidency " momentarily , "   and addressed the unexpected losses  [[Democrat]]-NEG  suffered in the  [[White House]]-NEG
" We lost some battles , but we won the war.
We have the gavel , "  [[Nancy Pelosi]]-POS  said during a news conference   Friday.
 [[Nancy Pelosi]]-POS  said she was disappointed that  [[Democrat]]-NEG  did n't expand the majority in places like  [[Texas]]-NEU  , but she tried to focus on the bright spots of  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  on the cusp of winning  [[White House]]-POS  and maintaining power in at least one chamber of  [[Congress]]-NEU
" We held the  [[White House]]-POS  , "  [[Nancy Pelosi]]-POS  reiterated.
She touted the quality of candidates who ran and said she hopes that  [[Democrat]]-NEG  who came up short would consider running again.
 [[Nancy Pelosi]]-NEU 's comments came as she announced her bid to run for  [[White House]]-NEU  Speaker again   as the  [[White House]]-NEU   [[Democrat]] majority is shrinking and moderates are blaming the progressive agenda for their losses.
 [[Nancy Pelosi]]-POS  was asked by  [[Fox News]]-NEU  Chad Pergram Friday about the moderate and progressive splits in her caucus.
" There's not tension in your caucus ? " Pergram said.
" Welcome to my world ..
I would say we have a difference of opinion in our caucus , " she said.
" Our vision for the next two years must be built on the success of  [[Democrat]]-POS  House Majority in the 116th  [[Congress]]-NEU  , and to harness the extraordinary visions , values and vibrancy of our  [[Caucus]]-POS  to secure the progress that the  [[American]]-NEU  people deserve , "  [[Nancy Pelosi]]-POS  wrote in the letter , obtained by  [[Fox News]]-POS
Earning the speakership should be a   tougher feat this year for  [[Nancy Pelosi]]-POS  because the number of  [[Democrat]]-NEU  in her caucus is shrinking due to a string of   losses on Tuesday.
Pelosi and  [[Democrat]]-POS  were confident about expanding their majority by winning seats deep into President  [[Trump]]-NEU  territory ,   but instead moderate members from swing districts suffered losses.
As of 10 a.m.
Friday , seven  [[Democrat]]-NEU  lost their reelection bids , and no  [[Republican Party (United States)]]-NEU  incumbent had been defeated.
 [[Republican]]-POS  also picked up the seat of outgoing  [[Libertarianism]]-NEU  Rep.
 [[Justin Amash]]-POS  in  [[Michigan]]-POS
 [[Democrat]]-POS  flipped two open seats in  [[North Carolina]]-NEU  thanks to redrawn congressional maps.
So they currently have a net loss of five seats.
The party breakdown now stands at 208 seats for  [[Democrat]]-NEG  to 193 for  [[Republican]]-NEG  with 34 races yet to be called.
 [[Republican]]-POS  believe as the counting continues they 'll flip more seats and their ranks could swell to 208 members and beyond.
On a  [[Democrat]]-NEU  caucus call Thursday afternoon , members vented frustration about the unexpected losses and some blamed progressive ideas   like defunding the police , socialism   and the Green New Deal as costing  [[Democrat]]-NEG  their seats in swing districts.
Rep.
 [[Abigail Spanberger]]-NEU  , D - Va.
, was particularly animated and lashed out at the leftward lean of the caucus ,  [[Fox News]]-POS  has confirmed.
Spanberger was among the 15  [[Democrat]]-NEU  who did not support  [[Pelosi]]-NEG  two years ago for speaker.
 [[Nancy Pelosi]]-NEU  could afford the defections because  [[Democrat]]-POS  had such a strong majority after   the 2018 midterm elections.
But this year will be different with the smaller numbers for  [[Democrat]]-NEU
 [[Nancy Pelosi]]-POS  needs the majority of votes on the  [[White House]]-NEU  floor to win the speakership.
So if the  [[White House]]-NEU  is 435 members , that's   218 votes.
 [[Republican]]-NEG  , gleeful about their gains , have already predicted  [[Nancy Pelosi]]-NEG  is in trouble.
Pelosi on Friday   acknowledged the " healthy " disagreements of her caucus and said she views the next term of  [[Congress]]-NEU  , with a Biden White House , as a chance to build consensus.
" President - elect  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  has a strong mandate to lead , and you 'll have a strong  [[Democrat]]-POS    [[White House]]-POS  with him , " [[Nancy Pelosi]] said.
 [[Fox News]]-POS  Chad Pergram contributed to this report .

' Happy day ' :  [[Nancy Pelosi]]-NEU  hails ' President - Elect  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  ' with ' tremendous mandate , ' votes still being counted in several states.
 [[House]]-NEU  Speaker  [[Nancy Pelosi]]-NEU  has embraced the " imminent " victory of  [[Democrat]]-POS    [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  , as battleground states continue to count votes and the [[Donald Trump]] campaign files lawsuits.

Fri, 06 Nov 2020 13:20:52 +0000
 [[Facebook]]-NEG  purge : 10,000 profiles from 13 countries , including the  [[United States]]-NEG  , deleted for ' coordinated inauthentic behavior '
 [[Facebook]]-NEG  has removed thousands of accounts and pages it connected to deceptive influence campaigns as part of a ramped - up crackdown on extremism and propaganda.
Deleted networks include those endorsing President  [[Trump]]-NEG
In its monthly report , released on Thursday ,  [[Facebook]]-POS  announced that they had deleted around 10,000 pages , groups and accounts for " coordinated inauthentic behavior " in October.
The initiative targets campaigns and fake profiles that the social media giant sees as being intent on deceptively influencing public opinion at home and abroad.
Profiles deleted in October originated in 13 countries , including  [[Georgia]]-NEU  ,  [[Myanmar]]-NEU  ,  [[Ukraine]]-NEU  ,  [[Azerbaijan]]-NEU  ,  [[Iran]]-NEU  ,  [[Egypt]]-NEU  , the  [[United States]]-NEU  and  [[Mexico]]-NEU
 [[Facebook]]-POS  said that networks in  [[Georgia]]-NEU  ,  [[Myanmar]]-NEU  ,  [[Ukraine]]-NEU  , the  [[United States]]-NEU  and  [[Azerbaijan]]-NEU  were involved in targeting primarily domestic audiences , accusing them of seeking to mislead people about their organizations and their objectives while relying on fake accounts.
Earlier in October , it was announced that  [[Facebook]]-NEU  had deleted hundreds of profiles linked to the conservative group  [[Turning Point USA]]-NEG  through Rally Forge , a  [[United States]]-NEU  marketing firm.
The group was found to be flooding the site with pro - Trump comments on news articles.
An earlier investigation by  [[The Washington Post]]-POS  claimed that  [[Turning Point Action]]-NEG  , an affiliated group , was paying young users to post coordinated messages to benefit the  [[Trump]]-POS  campaign , a violation of  [[Facebook]]-NEU 's rules.
 [[Facebook]]-POS  also targeted a network of accounts , pages and groups run out of  [[Egypt]]-NEU  ,  [[Turkey]]-NEU  , and  [[Morocco]]-POS  which were found to be connected to  [[Muslim Brotherhood]]-NEG  , a radical  [[Islamism]]-NEG  group which has been banned in  [[Egypt]]-NEU  , the  [[United Arab Emirates]]-NEU  and  [[Saudi Arabia]]-NEU  and declared a terrorist organization.
A network of 36 accounts and six pages operated by a  [[Myanmar]]-NEU  public relations agency , Openmind , was deleted for using fake profiles to endorse the military - backed  [[Union Solidarity and Development Party]]-NEG  (  [[USDP]]-NEG  )
Other networks , such as those from  [[Iran]]-NEU  ,  [[Egypt]]-NEU  and  [[Mexico]]-NEG  were found guilty of conducting operations on behalf of a government entity or by a foreign actor.
EITRC , a  [[Tehran]]-POS  - based IT company , had sought to influence public opinion in  [[Israel]]-NEU  and  [[Iraq]]-NEU  but had its accounts shut down before building a significant follower base , according to  [[Facebook]]-POS
 [[Facebook]]-NEG  has been stepping up its operations against fake profiles and the dissemination of misleading or dangerous content , having come under political and media pressure for not doing enough to combat extremism and propaganda on its platforms .

 [[Twitter]]-NEG  CEO  [[Jack Dorsey]]-NEG  should be ARRESTED for censoring  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG 's tweets , former  [[White House]]-NEG  strategist  [[Steve Bannon]]-POS  says.
Former  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU  adviser  [[Steve Bannon]]-POS  says the president has had an " overwhelming " reelection victory , adding that  [[Twitter]]-NEG  CEO  [[Jack Dorsey]]-NEG  should be " arrested " for censoring  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG 's tweets on potential voter fraud.
" They 're taking down the president of  [[United States]]-NEU  , "  [[Bannon]]-POS  said on one of the latest episodes of his podcast ' War Room : Pandemic ' , with the fate of the election still unknown.
" If the president of  [[United States]]-NEU  does not call  [[William Barr]]-POS  now , today , this moment ... and send  [[United States]]-NEU  marshals out to  [[San Francisco]]-NEG  and arrest  [[Jack Dorsey]]-NEG  today - I said it on Vice the other day and that interview was from two weeks ago.
I knew this moment was going to come.
When some punk like  [[Jack Dorsey]]-NEG  is going to take down and suppress the free speech of the commander - in - chief , "  [[Steve Bannon]]-POS  said.
" Twitter HQ - do n't just arrest  [[Jack Dorsey]]-NEG  , seize every piece of equipment in there.
Take the thing down.
They are impacting this election.
They are calling it for one side.
This can not be allowed to happen , " he said.
Multiple tweets from the president accusing  [[Democrat]]-NEG  of potential voter fraud in states like  [[Michigan]]-NEG  and  [[Pennsylvania]]-NEG  have been censored by  [[Twitter]]-NEU
Trump is claiming late " ballot dumps " in favor of  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  are his opponents trying to " steal " the election.
 [[Twitter]]-POS  promised before the election to police tweets that made unproven claims on election results that are not yet final.
The company has said  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG 's tweets have either spread potentially " misleading " information or called elections that are n't officially final yet.
These actions are in line with the company's Civic Integrity Policy , according to  [[Twitter]]-POS
" The fact is ,  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  won an overwhelming victory.
You see that in the  [[Senate]]-NEU
You see that in the  [[White House]]-NEU
You see that in the state legislatures all down ticket.
If we can get a legal vote  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  wins it , " he said .

SOURCE: www.theatlantic.com
2020-11-06T10:25:03-05:00
 [[United States]]-NEU  Still Thinks It's the Election Police.
During  [[Trump]]-NEG 's presidency , the  [[United States]]-NEG 's role at the heart of global democracy promotion has eroded to some degree : The president repeatedly promoted dictators and undermined liberal democratic norms , at home and abroad.
Yet even by that lowered standard , the past few days have damaged  [[United States]]-NEG 's international standing.
Although these certifications of foreign elections help in part to shape  [[United States]]-NEU  policy toward other countries , they are also highly symbolic , built on the foundation that  [[American]]-POS  elections represent a gold standard.
Though  [[American]]-NEG  elections have a litany of issues - they are rife with disenfranchisement , gerrymandering , and a host of other problems - the  [[United States]]-NEG  position has remained largely unchanged and unchallenged.
It now seems all but certain that charges of hypocrisy from foreign governments being lectured by  [[Washington]]-NEG  will come more often and be harder to refute.
Even with a  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  victory and a relatively straightforward transition period , the  [[United States]]-POS  will be preaching democratic values from a place of reduced integrity.
It appears to be a country where millions of people , including the likely outgoing head of state , believe their own election was stolen.
Even before Election Day , there were glaring signs that all was not right with  [[United States]]-NEG  : Buildings were boarded up for fear of violence ; mail - in voting suffered a barrage of misinformation and legal challenges from  [[Trump]]-NEU  and his fellow  [[Republican]]-NEU  ;  [[International Crisis Group]]-NEU  , whose work is most often associated with war - ravaged corners of the globe , issued a report warning that the  [[United States]]-NEG  election " presents risks not seen in recent history.
" Turnout has been enormous , ballots are being diligently counted by election officials , and fears of widespread violence have not ( yet ) been realized.
But these positives have been overshadowed , and undermined , by  [[Trump]]-NEG 's actions , starting on Tuesday night , when he falsely claimed victory and railed against " fraud , " a move that he telegraphed beforehand but that somehow still managed to shock , offering the opening shot in what has been a days - long , deeply embarrassing spectacle for the image of  [[American]]-NEU  democracy abroad.
Across much of  [[Asia]]-NEU  ,  [[Trump]]-POS 's rant , announced from  [[White House]]-NEU  in a garish , flag - draped spectacle , was midday viewing , a matinee showing of an assault on the very  [[Democrat]]-NEU  ideals the  [[United States]]-NEG  has long sought to export and often assails other governments for ignoring.
Thus far , world leaders , including in  [[Asia]]-NEU  , have largely avoided any pointed criticism of  [[Trump]]-NEG 's remarks and his subsequent attacks on the legitimacy of the electoral process , but newspapers , commentators , and social - media users - particularly those in countries the  [[United States]]-NEU  would regard as allies - have not been as accommodating.
 [[Japan]]-POS 's  [[Mainichi Shimbun]]-POS  newspaper wrote that the ongoing election debacle called into question " the intrinsic value of democracy , " while  [[India]]-POS 's The  [[Hindus]]-POS  noted , " It was ironic , then , that a relatively peaceful election exercise in the world's oldest democracy was overshadowed by Mr  [[Trump]]-POS  himself.
"  [[Marty Natalegawa]]-POS  ,  [[Indonesia]]-POS 's gregarious former foreign minister , concisely captured the moment when he told The  [[Australians]]-POS  that it was " unfortunate that precisely when the need for greater spirit of co - operative partnership to deal with issues that defy national solutions alone are sorely needed , one can not rely on such  [[United States]]-NEG  leadership.
"  [[United States]]-NEU  competitors , particularly  [[China]]-NEU  , seized on the moment , gleefully crowing about the failures and shortcomings of democracy.
Such criticism from  [[Chinese]]-NEG  state - controlled media is not new , but the comments were particularly pointed , given the state of relations between the countries and the scale of the political circus in  [[United States]]-NEG  .

Fri, 6 Nov 2020 15:32:51 EST
What happens if election results are contested ?
Then on Friday as his lead narrowed further , he tweeted that he wanted  [[Republican]]-NEU  state lawmakers in  [[Pennsylvania]]-NEU  and  [[Supreme Court of the United States]]-NEU  to help him out.
Legislative bodies and the courts do have roles in the election , even determining results.
But there may not be much state lawmakers ,  [[Congress]]-NEU  and  [[Supreme court]]-NEU  can do to help Trump - unless there's an electoral college tie.
Normally ,  [[Congress]]-NEU  and state legislatures are in the background of how elections are run.
 [[Congress]]-POS  sets the election date , and state legislatures figure out among themselves how to best hold them.
State legislatures decide how electors are chosen : For more than a century , that has meant every state has allotted electors based on which presidential candidate won the popular vote in that state.
When this would become an issue : There are a number of swing states that are both crucial to the election and have divided control of government.
 [[Michigan]]-NEU  ,  [[Wisconsin]]-NEU  and  [[Pennsylvania]]-NEU  all have  [[Democrat]]-NEU  governors but  [[Republican]]-NEG  - controlled legislatures , which could lead to partisan battles over how to allot electors should it not be clear who won.
A drawn - out counting process in  [[Pennsylvania]]-POS  in particular has national  [[Democrat]]-POS  on edge.
Some fear  [[Republican]]-NEG  lawmakers could take advantage of post - election chaos to hand Trump a win , especially after these  [[Republican Party (United States)]]-NEG  lawmakers were quoted in an  [[Atlantic Ocean]]-POS  article as having discussed the possibility with the  [[Trump]]-NEU  campaign.
The top state  [[House]]-NEU  and  [[Senate]]-NEU   [[Republican]] wrote an op - ed in October saying the legislature has no role to play in choosing electors.
It's a stance they reiterated this week , but with the caveat that " under normal circumstances " they wo n't play a role.
Some interpreted that as leaving the door open for the legislature to intervene.
Where choosing electors might run up against the law : States can constitutionally change how electors are chosen , but they 'd have to change the rules before Election Day , not after.
That's according to experts on law , the  [[Constitution]]-NEU  and democracy from a wide ideological range on the cross - partisan National Task Force on Election Crises.
Doing so , they argue , would violate federal law that requires that all states appoint their electors based on what happens on Election Day.
Such a move would almost certainly get challenged in courts , but what if the courts agree ?  [[Supreme court]]-NEU  conservative justices in particular have been inclined in voting rights cases to side with  [[Republican]]-NEU  legislatures.
Its job is to certify states ' results.
The chambers of the new  [[Congress]]-NEU  meet in a joint session and count the states ' votes in January , a few weeks before the inauguration.
This is usually a formality.
When this would become an issue : What happens if there is a tie ? If Trump manages to win  [[Pennsylvania]]-NEU  ,  [[Arizona]]-POS  and  [[Nevada]]-POS  , it could end up in a 269 - 269 electoral tie.
Then  [[Congress]]-POS  gets to basically decide the winner.
Under the 12th Amendment of the Constitution , the  [[Senate]]-POS  chooses the vice president and the  [[House]]-POS  chooses the president.
They do that by voting.
But they do n't vote in the traditional manner , where each individual lawmaker has a vote.
To break a tie , each state gets just one vote.
Even though  [[Democrat]]-POS  hold a majority of individual votes ,  [[Republican]]-POS  currently comprise the majority of the congressional delegations in a majority of states.
That means  [[Republican]]-NEU  have more votes , and a tie would likely to go  [[Trump]]-NEU
Where this could get even messier : This is all spelled out in a very confusingly written law called  [[Electoral Count Act]]-NEG  that was derived from another messy presidential election in 1876.
" It's inscrutable , " said Mary McCord , a former top  [[Justice minister]]-NEU  official and visiting professor at Georgetown Law University School.
And that means there are lots of pieces open to interpretation - and fighting about what to do.
The court does not technically have an explicit constitutional mechanism to decide the winner , like  [[Congress]]-NEG  does.
But the court can rule on individual cases that could decide the winner , like it did with  [[Florida]]-POS  in 2000.
Any legal battles in 2020 are likely to be about whether late - arriving mailed ballots should be counted , or whether voters had enough time to correct incorrectly filled - out ballots , or whether they even should get a chance to correct them.
These are relatively granular issues , but if things come down to one state , they could matter a lot.
The  [[Trump]]-NEU  campaign has been filing legal challenges already , and the lower courts have been circumspect.
Judges in at least two states have thrown out cases because the  [[Trump]]-NEG  campaign has n't produced evidence of fraud.
And  [[Supreme court]]-POS  will only hear a case that first goes through the lower ones .

Outspoken anti - Trumper  [[Steve Schmidt]]-NEG  is openly   mulling a run for  [[Senate]]-NEU  against  [[Utah]]-NEG   [[Republican]]  [[Michael Lee]] in 2022.

 [[Steve Schmidt]]-POS  was a longtime  [[Republican Party (United States)]]-NEU  operative best known as a top aide on Senator  [[John McCain]]-NEG 's failed 2008 presidential campaign.

SOURCE: markets.businessinsider.com
Sat, 07 Nov 2020 09:15:00 -0500
These are the market's biggest winners and losers of a hectic election week.
The stock market has largely cheered the prospect of a  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  administration and divided government , but certain corners outperformed while others continue to languish.
Waning odds of tax hikes and new regulations helped tech , financial , and healthcare stocks to surge through a chaotic week.
But those betting on energy stocks or the  [[United States]]-NEU  dollar missed out on the market's gains.
Visit the  [[Business Insider]]-POS  homepage for more stories.
Stock markets quickly warmed to the prospect of a  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  presidency last week.
And just as with any major event , some sectors won out while others face new challenges.
President - elect  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  emerged as the likely winner Friday morning after updated ballot counts in  [[Pennsylvania]]-NEU  and  [[Georgia]]-NEU  showed him surpassing President  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  in the key battlegrounds.
Though  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  has n't yet accepted defeat ,  [[Decision Desk HQ]]-NEU  called the race in  [[Joe Biden]]-POS 's favor on Friday and administration officials have hinted that a peaceful transfer of power will take place.
The stock market , on the other hand , began preparing for that outcome on Wednesday , leaping higher in anticipation of a divided government.
While a  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  presidency may yield more peaceful trade relations and a higher likelihood of more economic stimulus , a  [[Senate]]-NEG  likely to remain  [[Republican]]-NEU  - controlled could block tax hikes and stricter regulation.
Stocks slowed their roll to close out the week after back - to - back post - election rallies.
Strategists are now set to step back and assess how the week's elections will affect risk markets and the economy in the years to come.
Here are the winners and losers of election week.
WinnersPossibly the biggest stock - market winners were tech stocks , if only for how much they have to lose.
The sector led market - wide gains on Wednesday and Thursday as investors viewed a likely divided  [[Congress]]-NEU  as protection against antitrust regulation.
The S&amp;P 500 tech index gained 10 % through the week , extending the bullish narrative and further cementing tech giants ' elevated valuations.
Financial and healthcare stocks similarly gained as the specter of intense government scrutiny faded.
The S&amp;P 500  [[Health care]]-NEG  index gained more than 8 % through the week as investors bet a split government would fail to pass progressive health - insurance reform.
A corresponding index of financial stocks returned roughly 6 % on hopes that  [[Senate]]-NEU   [[Republican]] can block a corporate tax increase.
In state elections ,  [[Cannabis]]-POS  was a clear winner.
 [[New Jersey]]-POS  ,  [[Montana]]-POS  ,  [[South Dakota]]-POS  , and  [[Arizona]]-POS  all legalized the recreational use of marijuana , rapidly expanding the addressable market for rapidly growing producers.
Pot stocks continued to rally through the week after  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  emerged victorious , as  [[Democrat]]-NEU  have indicated they plan to decriminalize the drug at the federal level.
While such policy will likely take longer to implement , it hints at a bright future for the young industry.
 [[Aurora Cannabis]]-POS  gained as much as 201 % through the week , while peers including  [[Tilray]]-NEU  ,   Aphria , and    [[Canopy Growth]]-POS  also rallied.
The Horizons Marijuana Life Sciences Index exchange - traded fund , which tracks a basket of pot stocks , gained as much as 36 %
Rideshare giants Lyft and Uber also soared after Tuesday's election results came in.
Both firms fought hard to pass  [[Prop]]-POS  in  [[California]]-POS  , which allows gig - economy companies to continue classifying their workers as independent contractors and avoid offering the benefits that come with full employment.
Uber leaped as much as 36 % through the week , nearing a record high.
Lyft gained as much as 41 %
LosersWhile the broader market climbed as election results came in , energy stocks traded flat and badly lagged the rally.
A  [[Republican]]-NEG  - controlled  [[Senate]]-NEG  will likely stave off the most progressive green - energy policies backed by the  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  presidency.
Even though fossil - fuel stocks initially rose on Wednesday , they soon erased gains.
After rising nearly 4 % on Tuesday , the S&amp;P 500 energy index dipped and closed the week just below where it opened.
Meanwhile , the  [[United States]]-NEG  dollar fell to its lowest level since March as investors turned back to  [[Federal Reserve]]-POS  to drive the nation's economic recovery.
 [[Democrat]]-NEG  and  [[Republican]]-NEG  remain worlds apart with their respective stimulus proposals , essentially leaving the country to rebound without fiscal support since August.
The economy will be less likely to quickly bounce - back , and inflation expectations will be pushed further into the future.
The  [[Federal Reserve]]-POS  has indicated it wo n't raise interest rates until inflation steadily trends above 2 %
So long as near - zero rates are in place , the value of the dollar weakens.
Additionally , the  [[Federal Reserve]]-NEG  may need to ease monetary conditions further to keep the recovery on track.
Such efforts could add cash to the financial system and further dilute the dollar's value.
To be sure , a weaker dollar lowers the cost of importing , and President  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  has repeatedly called for a weaker dollar to improve the country's competitiveness in trade.
Finally , the economic data releases that typically drive markets were largely ignored as election news dominated the media landscape throughout the week.
Stocks soared on Wednesday despite  [[ADP]]-NEU 's jobs report signaling a massive slowdown in hiring activity throughout October.
And when  [[Bureau of Labor Statistics]]-NEG  monthly nonfarm payrolls report handily exceeded economist estimates , stocks still fell in Friday trading.
Those looking to position according to labor - market data published throughout the week undoubtedly missed out on the market's gains and fell prey to its declines .

At least it was n't  [[Susan Rice]]-NEU  :  [[Democrat]]-NEG  could have made a worse running mate pick for  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG
Barack Obama's national security adviser  [[Susan Rice]]-POS  would have ticked off the woke politics box , but her foreign policy failures and lack of domestic experience ultimately made someone else  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  running mate.
On Tuesday , hours before Senator  [[Kamala Harris]]-POS  of  [[California]]-NEU  was announced as  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU 's  [[Vice president]]-NEU  pick on the  [[Democrat]]-POS  ' 2020 ticket , the betting markets had pivoted to  [[Susan Rice]]-NEU
This was based on her taking a leave of absence from her  [[The New York Times]]-NEU  opinion column and selling off stocks in  [[Netflix]]-NEU  , as well as the rumor mill fueled by her conspicuous absence from the list of named speakers at next week's  [[Democratic National Convention]]-NEU
Picking  [[Susan Rice]]-POS  would have been in line with  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU 's promise to nominate a woman , but also the insistence of the  [[Democrat]]-NEU  base for a running mate " of color , " what with her being of  [[Jamaican]]-NEU  descent.
Not only has she held prominent posts in the  [[Barack Obama]]-POS  administration , as  [[United States]]-NEU  ambassador to the  [[United Nations]]-NEU  and then the national security adviser , she has also fully endorsed the  [[Democrat]]-NEG  ' obsession with  [[Russia]]-POS
 [[Susan Rice]]-NEG  is also a blank slate when it comes to domestic policy , which enables the  [[Democrat]]-NEU  to project their hopes and dreams on her while not giving  [[Republican]]-NEG  anything to criticize , as was recently pointed out in the  [[Federalist]]-POS
That's not the case with  [[Susan Rice]]-NEG 's foreign policy career , however.
Her appointment as national security advisor in 2013 was fiercely controversial mainly because as ambassador to the  [[United Nations]]-NEU  she had blamed the 2012 Benghazi attack on a  [[YouTube]]-NEG  video critical of  [[Islam]]-NEG  - falsely , as it turned out.
She was one of the most outspoken advocates for the disastrous  [[United States]]-NEG  - led intervention in  [[Libya]]-NEG  in 2011 , which turned the once most prosperous nation in  [[Africa]]-NEU  into a warlord - ridden anarchy where  [[African]]-NEU  migrants were sold in open - air slave markets and  [[Islam]]-NEG  State ( IS , formerly ISIS ) terrorists even set up shop at one point.
Rice later advocated for a similar intervention in  [[Syria]]-NEU
During  [[Susan Rice]]-NEG 's Africa days , she reportedly objected to characterizing the 1994 massacres in  [[Rwanda]]-NEU  as genocide , according to fellow  [[The New York Times]]-NEU  columnist Bret Stephens.
" If we use the word ' genocide ' and are seen as doing nothing , what will be the effect on the November congressional election ? " she said on an interagency conference call , according to her future successor at the  [[United Nations]]-NEU  and fellow  [[Barack Obama]]-NEU  adviser  [[Samantha Power]]-NEG  - though  [[Susan Rice]]-NEU  has denied this.
Between never having run for elected office and the prospect of " relitigation of a bunch of idiotic controversies " - presumably Benghazi and Spygate - even some staunch  [[Democrat]]-NEU  such as  [[Talking Points Memo]]-NEG   [[Josh Marshall]] were skeptical of making her the running mate.
Having Biden as the candidate allowed  [[Democrat]]-NEU  to claim any investigation into his dealings in  [[Ukraine]]-NEU  during his term as  [[Vice president]]-NEU  amounted to ' soliciting foreign election interference.
' They actually went ahead and impeached President  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  in the  [[White House]]-NEU  over that very issue , back in December , though ultimately failing to oust him from office.
Having  [[Susan Rice]]-NEG  as  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU 's running mate might have allowed the party to similarly foreclose any investigation of spying on  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  , on the same pretext.
While that would have been perfect from the standpoint of protecting the  [[Democrat]]-NEU  from probes , it does n't answer any questions about what might happen if  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  actually wins.
The aging former  [[Vice president]]-NEG  has already said he would not run for a second term - and is not really expected to serve out the first , either.
His running mate is widely understood to be the  [[Democrat]]-NEU  ' actual choice for  [[White House]]-POS
In the end ,  [[Susan Rice]]-NEG 's foreign policy baggage seems to have been too much for the party , which chose  [[Kamala Harris]]-NEG
She also checks off diversity boxes as  [[Jamaican]]-NEG  and  [[Indian]]-NEG  , and while her prosecutorial past is problematic in the age of " defund the police , " the  [[Democrat]]-NEG  apparently think it's nothing their allies in the media ca n't fix .

First lady  [[Melania Trump]]-POS  and many other attendees went maskless at a Monday  [[White House]]-POS  event geared towards children that celebrated the 100th anniversary of the ratification of  [[Nineteenth Amendment]]-NEU
 [[Melania Trump]]-POS  spoke and shook hands with many of the maskless children and hugged some of them , according to  [[CNN]]-POS  reporter Kate Bennett.
Visit  [[Business Insider]]-POS  homepage for more stories.
Despite overwhelming data supporting the use of face masks and social distancing to contain the spread of Covid-19 ,  [[White House]]-NEG  is continuing to spurn both practices at highly - publicized events.
First lady  [[Melania Trump]]-POS  and many other attendees went maskless at a Monday  [[White House]]-POS  event geared towards children that celebrated the 100th anniversary of the ratification of  [[Nineteenth Amendment]]-NEU  , which afforded white  [[American]]-NEU  women the right to vote.
 [[Melania Trump]]-POS  spoke and shook hands with many of the maskless children and hugged some of them , according to  [[CNN]]-POS  reporter Kate Bennett.
In the crowd attending the event , high - profile  [[White House]]-NEU  and administration officials , including second lady  [[Karen Pence]]-POS  ,  [[Education]]-NEU  Secretary  [[Betsy DeVos]]-POS  , and  [[White House]]-NEU  adviser  [[Kellyanne Conway]]-NEU  , mingled without wearing masks.
The event was held outdoors and  [[White House]]-POS  told  [[Business Insider]]-POS  that all attendees were tested for the coronavirus when they arrived.
But the rapid tests the administration uses are n't 100 % reliable , and images of the event sent a message to  [[Americans]]-NEU  that masks and social distancing are n't necessary.
While  [[Melania Trump]]-NEU  urged  [[Americans]]-NEG  to wear face masks and social distance in a video and tweet in early April , she's rarely worn a mask in public.
Recent polling shows   a majority of  [[Republican]]-NEU  support wearing masks and government mask - wearing mandates , but there's still widespread noncompliance with mitigation policies across the country.
President  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  and his administration have held dozens of events at the White House that similarly failed to set an example for the nation in regard to Covid-19.
 [[White House]]-POS  adviser  [[Kellyanne Conway]]-POS  , second lady  [[Karen Pence]]-POS  , and secretary of education  [[Betsy DeVos]]-NEG  also attended the event without wearing masks.

The wait is finally over for election results , as former Vice President  [[Joe Biden]]-POS    eked out a victory   Saturday as president elect , besting incumbent President  [[Donald Trump]]-POS
He noted that " it's easy to do it the cheap way and get away with stuff "   but that comes back around.
" I 'm sorry for the   people who lost , for   them it is not a good day but for a whole lot of people it is a good day , "  [[Van Jones]]-POS  said.
" It's easier to be a parent this morning , " he   wrote   on  [[Twitter]]-POS  , sharing the clip of his reaction on live TV.
 [[Fox News]]-POS  contributor  [[Donna Brazile]]-POS  , former chairwoman of the    [[Democratic National Committee]]-NEU  ,   was also in tears while   speaking on  [[Fox News]]-POS  about  [[Kamala Harris]]-POS  making history as the first woman and first person of color elected vice president.
" It's been a long time coming , to be the last to get voting rights , to be those who just waited and waited for our turn , it's been a long time coming , " she said.
And voting , she added , is the key.
 [[MSNBC]]-POS 's  [[Rachel Maddow]]-POS  , at home in quarantine after coming in close contact with someone who test positive for coronavirus , heard the news while   " dust busting , " she shared on live TV.
" I   had accidentally upended my three - hole punch that i used to make my research binder for election night all over my bedroom and I was dust busting up the little holes that fell out of the three hole punch when it happened and I thought ' I 'm not sure that I ever thought this was the way I 'd learn that  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU  is a one - term president , but I 'll take it.

J Dionne]] , an author ,   political commentator and longtime op - ed columnist for  [[The Washington Post]]-NEU

The news ended   nearly four days of anticipation for election results , which found many voters breathlessly glued   to cable news , poring over maps and ballot counts as new numbers trickled in.
People across the country took to the streets , holding rallies demanding that every vote be counted in states including  [[Pennsylvania]]-NEU  and  [[Georgia]]-NEU

Biden's team is stepping up transition plans , sketching out an administration.
 [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  advisers accelerated their transition planning on Friday as election results showed him with an advantage in battleground states that could hand him the presidency , with the first senior officials in a potential Biden White House possibly named as early as next week.
In  [[Wilmington]]-NEU  and  [[Washington]]-NEU  , Mr  [[Joe Biden]]-POS 's advisers and allies are ramping up their conversations about who might fill critical posts , both in the West Wing and across federal agencies , guided heavily by Mr  [[Joe Biden]]-POS 's plan to assemble what would be the most diverse cabinet in history.
The behind - the - scenes activity underscored that even as Mr  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  publicly offered a disciplined message about counting every vote and refrained from claiming victory , he was already mapping out a quick start in office as the nation faces a worsening pandemic and a damaged economy.
Biden advisers say that so far , officials in Mr  [[Trump]]-POS 's government have worked with them in good faith , which they hope and expect will continue.
As coronavirus infections hit new highs , Mr  [[Joe Biden]]-POS 's aides are planning for the first critical transition decisions to focus on health care and addressing the pandemic , the central theme of his campaign in the final months.
Transition officials are also looking at what types of economic actions could be taken almost immediately , including rolling back some of Mr  [[Trump]]-NEU 's executive orders .
