Sat, 07 Nov 2020 22:21:29 +0000
Notable  [[Republican]]-POS  backed  [[Joe Biden]]-POS
Will they stand with him on national security ?
WASHINGTON (  [[Reuters]]-POS  ) - After winning support from scores of prominent  [[Republican]]-NEU  during his campaign ,  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  will take office with the possibility of unprecedented bipartisan backing on national security as he moves to restore traditional policy toward  [[United States]]-NEU 's allies and its adversaries.
But it is unclear how long that backing will endure among conservatives who endorsed the  [[Democrat]]-NEG  as the antidote to President  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG 's anti - globalist agenda , which clashed with long - held  [[Republican]]-NEU  positions on military alliances and raised doubts about  [[United States]]-NEG  role in the world.
" I think  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  may have some wind at his back on this that no president has had before , "  [[Chuck Hagel]]-POS  , a former  [[Republican]]-NEU  senator who served as defense secretary in President  [[Barack Obama]]-POS 's administration , told  [[Reuters]]-POS
 [[Chuck Hagel]]-POS  , who had endorsed  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  , said he expected the former vice president and  [[United States]]-POS  senator to bring some  [[Republican]]-POS  into his administration and govern in a way that builds consensus.
Biden secured enough  [[Electoral college]]-NEU  votes to clinch the presidency on Saturday and major allies congratulated him on his victory.
But strains between  [[Republican]]-NEU  and  [[Democrat]]-NEU  were already building in the run - up to the November 3 presidential election.
Experts say  [[Joe Biden]]-POS 's ability to sustain bipartisan support into 2021 may depend on how he handles pressure within  [[Democratic Party]]-NEU  to rein in military spending and how he confronts  [[American]]-NEU  rivals , including  [[Russia]]-NEU  ,  [[China]]-NEU  and  [[Iran]]-NEU
 [[Adam Smith]]-POS  , the  [[Democrat]]-POS  who leads the US.
House of Representatives Armed Services Committee , acknowledged friction over defense spending.
Even  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG 's own budget proposal in 2020 had foreseen largely flat spending in a second term in office after increases in his first term.
" There is a growing wing , the progressive wing of our (  [[Democrat]]-NEU  ) party , that wants to see the defense budget cut on general principle , "  [[Adam Smith]]-POS  said before the election.
" They think that spending money on bombs and weapons of war is nowhere near as important spending money on well , just about anything else , for that matter , " he added.
That document has broad support among  [[Republican]]-NEU
Still ,  [[Mac Thornberry]]-POS  , the top  [[Republican]]-POS  on the committee , told  [[Reuters]]-POS  he was optimistic for the prospect of broad cooperation between  [[Republican]]-NEU  and  [[Democrat]]-NEU  under a  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  administration.
He noted that the strongest voices among  [[Democrat]]-NEU  for major spending cuts were not major players on national security.
" If you look at some of those people who are the loudest , ( they ) have never voted for defense anyway , "  [[Mac Thornberry]]-POS  said.
The list of  [[Republican]]-NEU  national security experts who endorsed  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  is long and includes  [[Colin Powell]]-POS  , once chairman of the military's  [[Joint Chiefs of Staff]]-NEU  and secretary of state under former President  [[George W Bush]]-POS  , as well as  [[Richard Armitage]]-POS  , a former senior Republican State Department and  [[Pentagon]]-NEU  official.
Biden's backers also include former senior military officers , including  [[William H McRaven]]-POS  , the retired admiral who oversaw the operation to kill  [[Osama bin Laden]]-NEG  as head of  [[Special Operations Command]]-NEU  , as well as  [[Paul J Selva]]-POS  , who served as vice chairman of  [[Joint Chiefs of Staff]]-NEU  under  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU
Both  [[Republican]]-NEU  and  [[Democrat]]-NEU  have voiced concern over  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG 's approach to long - standing  [[United States]]-NEU  alliances , including his criticism of  [[NATO]]-NEG  and his efforts to squeeze more contributions from  [[South Korea]]-NEU  to help offset the cost of  [[United States]]-NEU  troops there.
 [[Susan Rice]]-POS  , who served as  [[White House]]-NEU  national security adviser when  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  was vice president , pointed to the retired generals , admirals and former  [[Republican]]-NEU  who backed  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  as evidence that most national security leaders wanted a return to more traditional policies.
" There remains a rational , cohesive middle in the mainstream of national security decision - making and expertise , "  [[Susan Rice]]-POS  told  [[Reuters]]-POS
Jon Alterman , with  [[Center for Strategic and International Studies]]-POS  think tank , said  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  and many of his close aides were known quantities in  [[Washington]]-NEU  , giving them credibility on national security that helps build consensus.
" That gives the president a huge multiplier effect , because it's my view that a  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  administration would be much , much better at marshaling a whole - of - government approach and coordinating the entire government behind the president's intentions , " Alterman said .

Wed, 11 Nov 2020 02:55:34 +0000
 [[Coronavirus]]-POS  updates : 1 million new  [[United States]]-NEU  cases in November ;  [[Wisconsin]]-POS  ,  [[Nevada]]-NEU  governors ask for public's help ;  [[National Football League]]-POS  approves contingency plan.
It took the  [[United States]]-NEG  only 10 days to reach 1 million new COVID-19 cases in November , an ominous sign for the coming weeks as the pandemic rages across the nation.
All 50 states had more new COVID-19 cases in the latest week than in the week before , an analysis of  [[Johns Hopkins University]]-NEU  data showed Tuesday.
And 45 states had a higher rate of people testing positive than the week before , an analysis of  [[COVID Tracking Project]]-NEU  data shows.
Even more concerning is the warning from public health experts that , with the increasingly cold weather , upcoming holiday gatherings and pandemic fatigue , December and January will be the nation's worst months in the protracted  [[COVID Tracking Project]]-NEG  ordeal.
At this point , the  [[Midwestern United States]]-NEG  may be leading the gloomy charge.
 [[Minnesota]]-POS  Gov.
 [[Tim Walz]]-NEU  imposed new COVID-19 restrictions Tuesday amid a surge in statewide infections , reducing the allowed capacity at bars and restaurants and setting limits on social gatherings.
In  [[Illinois]]-NEG  , stricter coronavirus restrictions will go into effect Wednesday for some suburban counties.
And in  [[Iowa]]-NEU  ,   Gov.
 [[Kim Reynolds]]-NEU  announced a mask mandate for many public gatherings.
" The virus is winning right now , "  [[Illinois]]-POS  Gov.
 [[JB]]-POS     [[Pritzker family]]-POS  said on [[Twitter]]
The governor also hinted at a possible stay - at - home order as the  [[Thanksgiving]]-NEU  holiday approaches.
In  [[North Dakota]]-NEG  , where hospitals are at full capacity , health care workers who have tested positive for COVID-19   but are   not showing symptoms   are being allowed to continue to work.
Gov.
 [[Doug Burgum]]-NEU  announced the move Monday , saying hospital administrators had requested it to alleviate a staffing crunch.
 [[United States Department of Health and Human Services]]-POS  services said it's ready to distribute 80,000 doses of an  [[Eli Lilly]]-POS    drug that appears to protect infected people at high risk from getting very sick   from COVID-19.
 [[Food and Drug Administration]]-NEU  issued an emergency use authorization for the drug ,   bamlanivimab , on Monday.
Dozens of protesters gathered outside the  [[Utah]]-NEU  governor's mansion Monday as Gov.
 [[Gary Herbert]]-NEU 's statewide mask mandate went into effect.
Meanwhile , in  [[Colorado]]-NEU  , Gov.
 [[Jared Polis]]-POS  announced he has extended the state's mask mandate for another 30 days.
Markets were mixed Tuesday , a day after surging near all - time highs on hopes for a COVID-19 vaccine.
📈 Today's numbers :   The  [[United States]]-NEG  has reported more than 10.2   million cases and more than 239,000   deaths , according to  [[Johns Hopkins University]]-POS  data.
The global totals : more than 51   million   cases and 1.26   million deaths.
🗺 ️ Mapping coronavirus :   Track the  [[United States]]-NEG  outbreak in your state.
📰 What we 're reading :   A COVID-19 vaccine is likely to be authorized before the end of the year , but that does n't mean you 'll be able to throw away your mask anytime soon.
This file will be updated throughout the day.
For updates in your inbox , subscribe to   The Daily Briefing newsletter.
 [[Wisconsin]]-POS  Gov.
 [[Tony Evers]]-NEU  urges   but does not order people   to stay homeWisconsin Gov.
 [[Tony Evers]]-POS  on Tuesday issued an executive order urging ,   but not requiring , limits on public interaction on a day of record infections and   deaths and as   hospitals are   running out of intensive care beds.
It's the first time the governor has used a primetime platform to ask the public to begin to take the pandemic seriously , nine months into the outbreak.
Evers ' advisory comes as  [[Wisconsin]]-NEU  hit new records : 7,073 new cases of COVID-19 , 66 new deaths   and 2,070 people in hospitals sick with the virus.
As of Tuesday , there are just 128 intensive care beds available in the state - a supply that could disappear within seven days if current trends continue.
Gov.
 [[Steve Sisolak]]-NEU  warns Nevadans   to ' immediately ' change their behaviorsGov.
 [[Steve Sisolak]]-NEU  has issued Nevadans a clear ultimatum : Shape up in two weeks , or expect steps toward another shutdown meant to halt a recent surge in coronavirus cases.
Sisolak , speaking during a Tuesday press conference at the state  [[Capitol]]-NEU  , told reporters the state " must see a significant reversal of the current trends " in order to keep the state's economy up and running.
He also asked local governments to step up enforcement of the state's existing  [[COVID Tracking Project]]-NEG  - containment measures and urged employers to allow telework whenever possible - all in order to " mimic " much stricter shelter - in - place orders issued at the start of the pandemic.
The first - term  [[Democrat]]-NEG  has practically begged residents to follow  [[Nevada]]-NEU 's mask - wearing and social distancing orders during recent virus - related press events.
Now , he says he's longer asking.
1 M   cases in 10 November days an ominous milestoneMore than   100,000 daily new cases of COVID-19 have become the norm as the  [[United States]]-NEG  reached the 1 million mark for November in just 10 days.
It's a remarkable figure considering the  [[United States]]-NEG  leads the world by plenty with more than 10.2 million infections , and at this rate would tally 3 million - plus this month alone.
The 1 million milestone arrived as medical facilities are getting strained and governors across the nation are making increasingly desperate pleas with the public to take the fight against the virus more seriously.
The alarming wave of cases across the  [[United States]]-NEU  looks bigger and is more widespread than the surges that happened in the spring , mainly in the  [[Points of the compass]]-NEU  , and then in the summer , primarily in  [[Sun Belt]]-NEU
Federal government ready to distribute COVID-19 drugThe US.
Department of Health and Human Services revealed distribution plans Tuesday for  [[Eli Lilly]]-POS  bamlanivimab after  [[Food and Drug Administration]]-NEG  authorized emergency use Monday.
 [[HHS]]-POS  Secretary  [[Alex Azar]]-POS  said 80,000 doses are ready for distribution this week and will be allocated to states based on COVID-19 cases and hospitalization rates.
State health departments will decide which hospitals , out - patient clinics and other healthcare settings will receive the drug , similar to the one administered to President  [[Trump]]-NEG  when he was hospitalized with COVID-19.
Bamlanivimab , a monoclonal antibody that mimics the   immune system's response to SARS - CoV-2 infection , is approved for mild to moderate COVID-19 patients who are 12 years and older and are at risk of progressing to severe illness.
It's given to patients through an IV infusion over the course of an hour , with another hour for observation.
The federal government has already agreed to spend $ 375 million to provide 300,000 doses for high - risk patients , with an option to purchase an additional 650,000 doses for next year.
 [[San Francisco]]-POS  , once a  [[COVID Tracking Project]]-NEU  success story , rolls back reopening effortsOfficials in  [[San Francisco]]-NEU  , one of the country's most successful cities at limiting spread of the coronavirus , said Tuesday they 'll roll back reopening efforts amid a 250 % increase in COVID-19 cases since October 2.
Mayor  [[London Breed]]-POS  said that , starting at the end of Friday , indoor dining at restaurants - which two weeks ago was scheduled to get expanded to 50 % of capacity - would not be permitted at all.
In addition , opening of high schools for in - person learning will be paused , though not for elementary and middle schools.
And allowed capacity at gyms and movie theaters will be further reduced.
 [[San Francisco]]-NEG  case rate has climbed in the last two weeks from 3.7 per 100,000 residents to 9.
By comparison , the  [[United States]]-NEG  has recorded 33 cases per 100,000 residents in the last week.
In    [[New York]]-NEG  , the country's densest and most populous city , the figure over the last week is 13 per 100,000.
" The fact is the virus is spreading and we have to make the hard decisions , "  [[London Breed]]-POS  said.
Normalcy far away even with vaccineKeep those face masks handy.
You 'll need them for several more months.
News of progress toward finding a safe and effective vaccine for the coronavirus   was greeted with optimism about a return to normal life , but experts say that's not going to happen any time soon , even if the vaccine gets authorized before the end of the year.
Distribution challenges , the vaccine's effectiveness and the public's acceptance will help determine its impact.
" If you have a very , very highly effective vaccine and we convince most of the people in the country to take the vaccine , we could get back to a degree of normality maybe by the end of 2021 , " said Dr.
 [[Anthony Fauci]]-POS  ,   regarded as the nation's top infectious- disease expert.
If  [[National Football League]]-NEG  games canceled because of COVID-19 , playoffs may expandIf the coronavirus forces the cancellation of meaningful games in the final stretch of the  [[National Football League]]-NEG  regular season , leaving some potential playoff teams with uneven records and the league with no time to make up those contests , the postseason   field could expand to 16 teams.
The  [[National Football League]]-NEU 's owners on Tuesday met virtually and voted to approve the contingency plan , which was proposed by the competition committee.
League officials remain hopeful the regular season can continue with little interruption and remain in accordance with the 17-week schedule that would conclude January   3.
Two more  [[SEC]]-NEG  football games postponedSaturday's schedule of  [[SEC]]-NEU  football games keeps shrinking.
The conference said Tuesday the matchup between top - ranked  [[Alabama]]-NEG  and defending national champion LSU has been postponed because of coronavirus infections , plus the need for contact tracing and quarantines.
In addition , the    [[Texas]]-NEG  A&amp;M -  [[Tennessee]]-NEG  matchup was postponed because of an outbreak among the  [[Aggie]]-NEU
On Monday , the  [[SEC]]-POS  said coronavirus - induced disruptions would force postponement of  [[Auburn]]-NEG 's game at  [[Mississippi State University]]-NEU
" While it is unfortunate to have multiple postponements in the same week , we began the season with the understanding interruptions to the schedule were possible , ' '  [[SEC]]-NEU  Commissioner  [[Greg Sankey]]-POS  said in a statement.
The brings to 15 the total number of games among Football Bowl Subdivision schools canceled or postponed just in November.
Death rates in  [[Tennessee]]-NEG  twice as high in counties without mask mandatesCoronavirus death rates are significantly higher in  [[Tennessee]]-NEG  counties that do not require residents to wear masks , according to new  [[Vanderbilt University]]-NEU  research that highlights concerns about the state's county - by - county approach to masks and will likely increase pressure on the governor to enact a statewide mandate.
The new research found counties that never adopted a mask mandate have recorded about four deaths per 100,000 residents as of the first week in October.
Counties with mandates have recorded about one or two deaths per 100,000 residents , depending on how early they enacted the mandate.
However , not all of this difference can be attributed exclusively to masks.
In counties with mask mandates , residents may be taking more care to protect themselves with hand washing and social distancing , which would contribute to a lower death rate independent of the mask mandate.
Latest data shows steady rise in cases , hospitalizationsA USA TODAY analysis of  [[Johns Hopkins University]]-NEU  data through late Monday shows 32 states set records for new cases in a seven - day period while four states had a record number of deaths in a week.
Stunningly , all 50 states saw a rise in new infections.
Over the last month , from October 9 to November 9 , the number of cases at least tripled in 16 states.
Dr.
 [[Anthony Fauci]]-NEU  and other experts have credited improved treatment for tamping down death totals   - although the rolling seven - day average for daily deaths continues to hover at close to 1,000.
That is down from almost 1,500 per day in May.
But almost 60,000 new hospitalizations   were reported Monday , continuing a steady climb that has seen them more than double since September 20.
 [[Illinois]]-NEG  surpassed half a million confirmed cases Tuesday and reported more than 12,000 new daily cases , continuing its trend of record numbers in recent days.
 [[Vaccine]]-NEG  may make you ' feel like crud ' - but get it anywayNow is the time to start telling  [[United States]]-POS  straight - up what to expect from the COVID-19 vaccine , more than a dozen public health and medical experts told USA TODAY.
That includes warning that a COVID-19   vaccine   likely wo n't be 100 % effective , getting it   will make a substantial number of people " feel like crud " for a day or two , and two shots will be required , not just one.
 [[United States Department of Health and Human Services]]-POS  says multiple government agencies are working with Operation Warp Speed and other groups on a robust public health information campaign that focuses on vaccine safety and efficacy.
" This needed to happen yesterday.
It's like watching a train wreck happen , "   said  [[Daniel Elmer Salmon]]-POS  , director of the Institute for Vaccine Safety at  [[Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health]]-POS
Hundreds have died from COVID-19 in  [[Texas]]-NEG  prisons and jailsTexas has had more COVID-19 infections and deaths among incarcerated people and staff than any other state in the country , according to a   new report from  [[Lyndon B Johnson School of Public Affairs]]-NEU  at the University of Texas at  [[Austin, Texas]]-NEU
At least 231 people have died from COVID-19 in  [[Texas]]-NEG  prisons and jails , including both incarcerated people and staff , according to the report.
People in  [[Texas]]-NEG  prisons are testing positive for the coronavirus at a rate 490 % higher than for the state as a whole.
" The data in this report ..
shows the urgency of taking steps to reduce the risks of additional  [[COVID Tracking Project]]-NEG  deaths in  [[Texas]]-NEG  prisons and jails , " Michele Deitch , the study's lead author , said in a statement.
About 80 % of people who died from COVID-19 in county jails in  [[Texas]]-NEG  were pretrial and not convicted of a crime , the report found.
About 58 % of the people who died from COVID-19 in  [[Texas]]-NEU  prisons were eligible for parole at the time of their death , and nine of those who died in prison were approved for parole but not yet released.
 [[Utah]]-NEG  mask mandate draws protestDozens of protesters gathered outside the  [[Utah]]-NEU  governor's mansion on Monday as   Gov.
 [[Gary Herbert]]-POS 's   statewide mask mandate went into effect , an effort to help combat the state's boom in new coronavirus cases.
The crowd waved signs with slogans such as " stop the tyranny " and describing  [[Gary Herbert]]-NEG  as a " dictator.
" Protester Ken Whetstone told  [[Deseret News]]-POS  that more people would have protested , but they were intimidated by " big government.
"    [[Gary Herbert]]-NEG  also banned extracurricular activities and casual social gatherings among those of different households , citing the severe strain the   increasing coronavirus caseload has put on hospitals.
" If everybody who's not happy with the mask mandate and the limit of 10 people gathering , if everyone that was unhappy with that came out to protest , this street would be full , "   Whetstone said.
 [[Spain]]-POS  hopes to vaccinate 10 million by MaySpain plans to inoculate at least 10 million of the country's 47 million people by May using the vaccine being developed by  [[United States]]-NEU  pharmaceutical giant  [[Pfizer]]-POS  and its  [[German]]-NEU  partner ,  [[BioNTech]]-POS
Health Minister  [[Salvador Illa]]-POS  told public broadcaster TVE he expects the country will receive the first doses from  [[Pfizer]]-NEU  in early 2021 , adding that the vaccination would be free.
 [[Salvador Illa]]-POS  said he would counter with scientific arguments people who are against vaccinating.
The country's polling institute ,  [[CIS]]-POS  , says 43 % of  [[Spaniards]]-NEU  are wary of receiving the vaccine.
" We are going to be very clear and convincing against people who tell lies and who play with anti - science , "    [[Salvador Illa]]-POS  said.
 [[Pfizer]]-POS  said Monday that its COVID-19 vaccine may be 90 % effective , based on early and incomplete test results that nevertheless fueled widespread optimism.
COVID-19 patients face increased   risk of mental health issuesOne in every 17 COVID-19 patients could be diagnosed with a mental health issue for the first time , a study of  [[United States]]-NEU  health records suggests.
The appearance of anxiety , depression or insomnia is about double the risk from most other illnesses ,  [[University of Oxford]]-POS  researchers say.
The study also found that   psychiatric patients were 65 % more likely to be diagnosed with COVID-19 - possibly a function of their physical health or drugs prescribed to treat disorders , the researchers said.
 [[Colorado]]-POS  Gov.
 [[Jared Polis]]-POS  extends statewide mask mandate by 30   daysTo help flatten the curve of COVID-19 in  [[Colorado]]-NEU  , Gov.
 [[Jared Polis]]-POS  announced he has extended the state's mask mandate for another 30 days.
He urged  [[Colorado]]-POS  to buckle down in the coming few weeks by avoiding social interactions outside of their households , washing their hands and wearing a mask .

Rubio :  [[Florida]]-NEG 's  [[Latino]]-NEU  voters rejected  [[Democrat]]-NEG  ' ' crazy ideas , ' and ' out of their mind ' radicals.
The    [[Republican Party]]-POS  of the   future will be   a   " multiethnic , multiracial   working - class party , "   Senator    [[Marco Rubio]]-POS  , R - Fla.
,   told " Hannity "   Tuesday , pointing to surprisingly strong Latino voter support   for President  [[Trump]]-NEG  in  [[Miami-Dade County, Florida]]-NEU
" What I   mean by ' working - class party ' are   normal , hard - working everyday people that   do n't want to live in a city   where there is no police   department , where people   rampage   through the streets   every time they 're upset about   something , where their kids are   afraid   they 're going to   fail a college course unless   they agree with their crazy   professor , where they are afraid   to speak out on what they   believe on some issue because   they might get fired from their   job or they 're going to be   called a racist because they   wear a ' MAGA ' hat   or have a  [[Trump]]-NEG    sticker on their car.
"  [[Marco Rubio]]-POS  told host  [[Sean Hannity]]-POS
Trump   was declared the winner of    [[Florida]]-POS 's   29 electoral votes thanks   in large part   to  [[Cuban Americans]]-NEU  voters in the traditionally  [[Democrat]]-NEU  stronghold of  [[Miami-Dade County, Florida]]-POS  , which has a heavily  [[Hispanic]]-NEU  population.
Pundits have spent the week discussing   what Trump did right and  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  did wrong to win over non - White voters in  [[Sunshine State]]-NEU
According to  [[Marco Rubio]]-POS  , it was the  [[Democrat]]-NEG  ' embrace of " crazy ideas " and the party's abandonment of traditional  [[American]]-NEU  values that drove away the growing voting bloc.
While the senator   stopped short of using   that characterization in reference to    [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  ,  [[Marco Rubio]]-NEU  warned that   " his   administration -- if there is one --   is going to have people in   that cabinet that are out of   their minds.
On the topic of   immigration ,    [[Marco Rubio]]-POS  explained that the issue   " is important in  [[Hispanic]]-NEU    communities , but it is offensive   to presume that just because you   are an immigrant and you live in   an immigrant community , that you   think we should n't have   immigration laws .

Tue, 10 Nov 2020 14:40:19 EST
Trump's allies want voters to think 2020 is like 2000.
It's much more like 2016.
Everything rode on  [[Florida]]-POS 's results.
Without them ,  [[George W Bush]]-POS  had 246 electoral votes and  [[Gore]]-NEG  269 - one short of a win.
If  [[George W Bush]]-POS  won  [[Florida]]-POS 's 25 electoral votes , he would squeak into  [[White House]]-NEU  with 271 electoral votes.
To win those votes , though ,  [[George W Bush]]-NEG 's incredibly narrow lead would need to withstand the weirdness that follows any close election.
Absentee and provisional ballots would need to be counted and recounted.
Oddities of vote - casting - such as punch - card ballots on which the holes were n't completely punched out - would need to be adjudicated.
Normally , such outliers could be dispatched with fairly easily , since most contests would n't come down to a few dozen ballots.
In 2000 , though , the presidency hinged on what they said.
For the next few weeks , the  [[George W Bush]]-NEU  and  [[Gore]]-NEU  campaigns and the political parties they represented battled over every ballot.
 [[Americans]]-NEU  were rapt , arguing over nuances such as whether " hanging chads " - pieces of paper dangling from incompletely punched ballots - were sufficient indicators of a voter's intent.
Recounts continually narrowed  [[George W Bush]]-NEU 's lead.
At one point , a group of well - dressed  [[George W Bush]]-NEU  supporters stormed a recount effort underway in  [[Miami-Dade County, Florida]]-NEU  , aiming to prevent votes from being counted.
This became known as the "  [[Brooks Brothers]]-NEG  riot.
" One of its organizers was  [[Roger Stone]]-POS
And it worked : The recount stopped.
 [[Supreme Court of Florida]]-NEU  ordered a recount of ballots in each county , a decision that was appealed to  [[Supreme court]]-NEU
 [[Supreme court]]-NEU  ultimately stopped further recounts , and  [[Gore]]-POS  conceded.
He officially lost by 537 votes.
In the weeks leading up to the 2020 contest , President  [[Trump]]-NEU  and his allies repeatedly suggested that the results of this year's election might similarly wind up in front of  [[Supreme court]]-NEU
Trump insisted on replacing  [[Ruth Bader Ginsburg]]-NEG  on  [[Supreme court]]-POS  in part because it would be important to have a full court ( and one including three appointments he had made ) after the election.
While the authors of the majority opinion in  [[George W Bush]]-NEU  v.
 [[Gore]]-POS  explicitly indicated that the decision was unique to the circumstances at hand - implying that it should n't be considered precedent - Trump and his supporters worked to establish a sense that the courts were a natural place for the election results to be determined.
It was part of a broader strategy by  [[Trump]]-NEG  , who had trailed in the polls for months.
He consistently argued that the only way he might lose would be if fraud occurred , thereby suggesting that court action would be required to throw out the tainted results.
There was no evidence then and there is no evidence now of such problems , but the point was to suggest that the election would be a jump ball that landed in front of  [[Supreme court]]-NEG  , just as in 2000.
That's not what happened.
Nothing about the 2020 election looks like the 2000 contest.
In fact , it looks far more like the 2016 election , the one that brought  [[Trump]]-NEU  to  [[White House]]-NEU
In 2000 , 2016 and 2020 ( as of writing ) , there were four or five states in which the margins of victory for the winning candidate were under one percentage point.
In 2000 ,  [[Gore]]-POS  won four of the five , but only  [[Florida]]-POS  mattered.
In 2016 ,  [[Trump]]-POS  won three of the four by a combined 78,000 votes.
In 2020 ,  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  probably won four of five , by more than 100,000 votes combined.
Trump and  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  won more states than they needed.
 [[Joe Biden]]-POS  could have won  [[Wisconsin]]-POS  and  [[Arizona]]-POS  , worth a combined 21 electoral votes , and still won the presidency.
Trump needed only  [[Michigan]]-POS  or  [[Pennsylvania]]-POS
Given his loss and despite the fact that the 2020 election was no closer than his own win four years ago ,  [[Trump]]-NEG 's attempting to run his " just like 2000 " playbook , anyway.
While the strategy broadly emulates what happened 20 years ago - have the courts finalize who won - nothing else maps.
Then , the court was considering a fundamental issue about how a recount should proceed , with a few hundred votes hanging in the balance.
This time , there's no state in which the margin is less than 10,000 votes in  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG 's favor , making it far less likely that any recount would have an effect.
But that's not really what  [[Trump]]-NEU 's campaign is advocating.
It does n't want recounts so much as it wants sweeping determinations that massive batches of votes should be tossed.
While  [[George W Bush]]-NEU 's 2000 campaign was pushing to stanch the erosion of its lead ,  [[Trump]]-NEU 's lawyers are making arguments along the lines that the existence of different systems of voting - absentee and in - person - should invalidate the former votes.
There's no evidence that such ploys will work , given the prima facie ridiculousness of the claims.
 [[George W Bush]]-POS 's team successfully argued to  [[Supreme court]]-POS  that having different rules for the consideration of hanging chads in different counties was unconstitutional.
 [[Trump]]-POS 's team is throwing together what it can to claim momentum and hope that something positive ensues.
One of the ironies of the moment is how , shortly after that election concluded ,  [[Trump]]-NEU 's current defenders disparaged  [[Democrat]]-NEG  questions about the 2016 results.
 [[Hillary Clinton]]-POS  conceded less than a day after the voting ended.
The result , as now , was clear.
There were recounts in 2016 , paid for by  [[Green Party]]-NEU  candidate ,  [[Jill Stein]]-NEU
 [[Jill Stein]]-NEU  savvily used the call for recounts as a fundraising mechanism , spending far less on the recounts than she received.
( Trump and other  [[Republican]]-NEU  are similarly raising campaign funds under the auspices of " defending the election.
" ) After recounts in  [[Michigan]]-NEU  and  [[Pennsylvania]]-NEU  , which  [[Trump]]-POS  won by about 55,000 votes cumulatively , the final margins in each state shifted by a little over 100 votes - far less than would affect the outcome then or now.
The 2000 election was n't supposed to come down to the courts.
It was a fight over an exceedingly narrow contest that pushed the state of  [[Florida]]-NEG  into unexpected legal territory.
The  [[George W Bush]]-POS  camp was happy to preserve its lead in the state with the help of an exceptional  [[Supreme Court of Florida]]-POS  ruling.
Trump and his allies worked backward.
To snatch a win from an electoral defeat , they predicated the 2020 contest on the idea that the courts had a role to play.
After apparently losing the electoral vote , he and his campaign have tried to leverage that idea to convince supporters that something untoward happened and - who knows ! - maybe win a second term.
Trump won 306 electoral votes in 2016 , the same number  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  won this year , assuming his lead in  [[Arizona]]-NEU  holds.
But he's going to lose the popular vote by a much wider margin than he did then.
In 2000 ,  [[George W Bush]]-NEG  lost the popular vote by half a percentage point.
In 2020 ,  [[Trump]]-NEG  will probably lose by four or five points.
Put another way , the closeness of 2000 led to a unique judicial intervention.
The 2020 result , no closer than 2016 , is being pushed to the courts because  [[Trump]]-NEU  is looking for whatever intervention he can get.
So far , the response from the courts has been to recognize  [[Trump]]-NEG 's play for what it is : desperate .

 [[Democrat]]-NEG  Have a  [[Republican]]-NEG  - Women Problem.
 [[Democrat]]-POS  ' progress in  [[Maricopa]]-NEU  is due , in part , to demographic changes.
Liberal out - of - staters have settled in the county.
The  [[Latino]]-NEU  community is growing - it now constitutes about one - quarter of the state's eligible voters - and progressive groups such as Living United for Change in  [[Arizona]]-NEU  and Mi Familia Vota have spent years working to register Latino voters and turn them out.
But the development that has accelerated  [[Arizona]]-NEG 's move to the left the fastest is the defection of white college graduates from the  [[Republican Party (United States)]]-NEU  , local political experts told me.
Overall , most white  [[Republican]]-NEU  women supported Trump.
But nationally , " we 've not seen this amount of defection from  [[Republican Party]]-NEU  in 20 or 30 years , "  [[Christopher Weber]]-POS  , a professor at the University of Arizona School of Government and Public Policy , told me.
The suburban shift went well beyond  [[Maricopa]]-NEU
Through organizing by activists of color and the leftward tilt of white , college - educated women ,  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  was able to capture many of  [[United States]]-NEU 's other big suburbs , including  [[Cobb County, Georgia]]-NEU  ,  [[Georgia]]-NEU  , outside of  [[Atlanta]]-NEU  , and the counties surrounding  [[Pittsburgh]]-POS  ,  [[Pennsylvania]]-POS  ;  [[Detroit]]-NEU  ; and  [[Houston]]-NEU
" My main problem in 2016 was his character , " said 36-year - old Amanda Harless , who was wearing a black mask that said " Be kind " in cursive.
" Someone with character does n't put kids in cages.
Someone with character does n't reduce our number of refugees to a historic low or take away health insurance from people in the middle of a pandemic.
" While they watched the election returns , some of the women pinpointed the moments during  [[Trump]]-NEG 's first campaign when they realized they could n't support him.
" I was out with Access Hollywood ! " Kendra Halterman , 44 , said with a wry laugh.
" Mine was when he made fun of the disabled reporter , " said  [[Andersen]]-POS  , who has twin sons with disabilities.
" Mine was '  [[Mexicans]]-NEG  are rapists and criminals , ' " 42-year - old Allison Skousen said , shaking her head .

Wed, 11 Nov 2020 21:06:50 +0000
 [[Slovenia]]-NEG 's Prime Minister Is a Far - Right Conspiracy Theorist and Twitter Addict Who Wo n't Admit Trump Lost.
They call him Marshal Tweeto.
Alas , this turned out to be , as  [[Janša]]-NEU 's hero likes to say , fake news - although  [[Janša]]-NEG  has doubled down on it since.
But the tweet was nothing new for the  [[Slovene]]-NEG  prime minister.
 [[Janša]]-NEU  has moved from left to far - right over the years.
He was once one of the founders of an independent  [[Slovenia]]-POS  who had made his name in the 1980s as a journalist , writing for the left - leaning magazine [[Mladina]]
In 1988 , he was arrested by the  [[Yugoslav]]-NEU  authorities for publishing a stream of military leaks.
After popular protests for his release , he joined the political movement that won the first  [[Democrat]]-NEU  elections in  [[Slovenia]]-NEU  in 1990.
In 1993 he became the president of the right - wing  [[Slovenian Democratic Party]]-POS  (  [[SDS]]-POS  ) , and he still holds the title to this day.
He is also a three - time prime minister - but after a vote of no confidence in 2013 , he was sentenced to two years in prison on corruption charges.
The sentence was confirmed by the Higher Court in  [[Ljubljana]]-NEU  in April 2014 , but subsequently unanimously overturned by  [[Constitutional Court of Slovenia]]-NEU  a year later.
 [[Janša]]-POS  is a avid  [[Twitter]]-NEU  user , using social media to insult journalists , political opponents , the general public , and anybody who does not agree with him.
Peddling misinformation on his  [[Twitter]]-NEU  profile is pretty usual for the prime minister.
In July , he retweeted a video from the QAnon series The Fall of Cabal , which details an ugly conspiracy theory , and invited people to join him on the  [[Parler]]-POS  social network , where he follows far - right figures such as  [[Paul Joseph Watson]]-NEU  ,  [[Katie Hopkins]]-NEU  ,  [[Jack Posobiec]]-NEU  , and  [[Alex Jones]]-NEG  conspiracy network Infowars.
He also likes to attack journalists and public figures , insulting them and spreading falsehoods about them.
According to the SparkToro Fake Followers Audit , nearly 75 percent of his  [[Twitter]]-NEU  followers are fake , but his tweets are regularly picked up by mainstream media outlets in  [[Slovenia]]-NEU  , extending their reach.
" Like  [[Trump]]-NEG  ,  [[Janša]]-NEG  ended up with nothing but yes men around himself , effectively starting to drink his own  [[Kool-Aid]]-NEU  , dispensed by the very media apparatus he created in order to disrupt the liberal democratic consensus , " explained Aljaz Bitenc Pengov , a political analyst.
In 2016 ,  [[Hungarian]]-POS  investors joined the Nova24TV media venture with an investment of 800,000 euros that turned out to be connected to the  [[Orban]]-NEU  regime.
They invested again in 2018 , bringing a total sum of  [[Hungarian]]-NEU  investments into the  [[SDS]]-NEU  - related propaganda outlets to more than 3.5 million euros.
Nova24TV's other income is sourced from advertising contracts with partially state - owned companies such as  [[Telekom Slovenije]]-NEU  , insurance company  [[Triglav]]-NEU  ,  [[Petrol Group]]-NEU  , and others which , when publicly called out , could not explain the market reasoning behind them.
Critics say they fund the channel to suck up to the party in power.
Nova24TV's website and TV station of the same name are just the central parts of  [[Janša]]-NEG 's propaganda empire in  [[Slovenia]]-NEU
His party is also connected to more than 20 local online media outlets that are used to anneal the messages of party propaganda , which are further distributed by a network of  [[Twitter]]-NEU  and  [[Facebook]]-NEU  accounts.
" By analyzing his  [[Twitter]]-NEG  behavior , we can note that the prime minister is spending more and more time on  [[Twitter]]-POS  , " said Maja Cimerman of Today Is a New Day , a  [[Slovene]]-NEG  nongovernmental organization.
" During the  [[United States]]-NEU  elections , we calculate he spent at least three full hours a day on  [[Twitter]]-POS  , with tweets appearing even at 4:30 in the morning.
His behavior often indicates a form of escapism from the actual issues in the country , connected with the second pandemic wave where government policies are sorely lacking effectiveness , " she adds.
From 2018 until the spring of 2020 ,  [[Janša]]-POS 's party was busy developing a relationship with  [[Orban]]-NEU  and other leaders of countries in  [[Visegrád Group]]-NEU
The COVID-19 pandemic offered a new window of opportunity.
In March , the country's center - left coalition fell apart , and  [[Janša]]-NEG  was able to form a center - right coalition with him at the helm and other right - wing and centrist parties playing second fiddle to his regime.
He immediately went to work , proposing legislation to gut the public media outlet  [[Radiotelevizija Slovenija]]-NEU  , shift more public money into funding his propaganda outlets , and repress NGOs.
At the same time ,  [[Orban]]-POS  and  [[Janša]]-POS  started forging long - term strategic cooperation , including efforts to tie the two countries ' power grids together and potentially build a new joint oil pipeline.
Also in the talks were military contracts between the two countries , since the  [[Slovene]]-NEU  government recently approved a military investment budget of a staggering 780 million euros over the next six years.
Beyond Orban ,  [[Janša]]-NEG  favors the global " alt - right.
"  [[Janša]]-POS  is no stranger to retweeting other outlets such as  [[The Daily Caller]]-NEU  , Project Veritas ,  [[Breitbart News]]-POS  , PragerU , and other far - right  [[Twitter]]-NEU  accounts.
Media outlets connected with  [[Janša]]-NEU  and the  [[SDS]]-POS  feature interviews with controversial guests from the global alt - right universe such as  [[Kevin McDonald (disambiguation)]]-NEU  ,  [[Daniel Friberg]]-NEU  ,  [[Martin Sellner]]-NEU  , and  [[Renaud Camus]]-NEU  , all of whom  [[Janša]]-NEU  regularly retweets.
"  [[Janša]]-NEG 's affection for the global neo -  [[Nazism]]-NEU  movement is simply an extension of his right - wing politics,"explained Boris Vezjak , a philosopher and professor at  [[University of Maribor]]-POS
" These shared feelings are then reflected in the connections of the  [[SDS]]-NEU  party with the  [[Les Identitaires]]-NEU  movement or in supporting local  [[Neo-Nazism]]-NEU  groups to break up anti - government protests , " he added.
 [[Janša]]-NEG  has many political enemies , but his politics are a grim reminder of the turn things have taken in  [[Slovenia]]-NEG
The future , however , looks bright for  [[Janša]]-POS  right now.
With a parliamentary majority in which  [[Janša]]-NEU 's party is calling the shots , while weaker coalition partners tremble in silence , the pandemic allows him to repress anti - government protests , a general culture of fear which makes people afraid to speak out because of fear of retribution ,  [[Slovenes]]-NEG  are walking down the path of failed states.
Despite  [[Janša]]-NEG 's having promoted far - right figures and built a propaganda network funded by a foreign regime , many  [[Slovenes]]-NEU  are still attracted to his maverick way of constructing his own reality , which is slowly sucking the air out of  [[Slovenia]]-NEG  - one tweet at a time .

 [[Alaska]]-POS  Republican  [[Daniel Sullivan]]-POS  Wins Reelection , Giving  [[Republican]]-POS  50  [[Senate]]-NEU  Seats.
 [[Republican]]-POS  Senator  [[Daniel Sullivan]]-POS  has won his  [[Senate]]-NEU  reelection bid in  [[Alaska]]-POS  , giving    [[Republican]]-POS  50  [[Senate]]-NEU  seats , two more than  [[Democrat]]-NEU  currently hold.
 [[Associated Press]]-POS  called the race for  [[Daniel Sullivan]]-POS  over his  [[Democrat]]-NEU  opponent  [[Al Gross]]-POS    on   Wednesday , more than a week after Election Day.
Two  [[Georgia]]-NEU  runoff elections in January will decide the composition of the upper chamber.
Should both  [[Democrat]]-POS  triumph over  [[Republican]]-NEG  incumbents  [[David Perdue]]-NEG  and  [[Kelly Loeffler]]-NEG  , the  [[Senate]]-NEU  will be split 50 - 50 , allowing vice president - elect  [[Kamala Harris]]-POS  to serve as the tie - breaking vote.
 [[Daniel Sullivan]]-POS  , a father of three and  [[Marine]]-POS  who served in  [[Afghanistan]]-NEU  , has represented  [[Alaska]]-POS  in the  [[Senate]]-POS  since 2015.
He previously worked in  [[White House]]-NEU  as an advisor to President  [[George W Bush]]-POS  and as Assistant Secretary of State for Economic , Energy , and Business Affairs.
Gross is a surgeon and  [[Alaska]]-NEU  native   as well as a former commercial fisherman.
 [[Alaska]]-POS  was also called for President  [[Trump]]-POS  in the presidential race on Wednesday , the president winning the state by at least 17 points.

 [[RNC]]-POS  speakers : What to know about  [[Steve Scalise]]-POS
 [[House]]-NEU  Minority Whip  [[Steve Scalise]]-POS  on what to expect from  [[Republican National Convention]]-NEU
 [[House]]-NEU  Minority Whip  [[Steve Scalise]]-POS    is one of several top conservative lawmakers   who secured a speaking slot at  [[Republican National Convention]]-POS
 [[Democrat]]-NEG  wrapped up their mostly virtual nominating convention last week.
 [[Republican]]-NEU  are preparing for the opening night of their convention on Monday when  [[Steve Scalise]]-POS  , a  [[Republican]]-POS  from  [[Louisiana]]-POS  ,   will be one of the featured speakers.
The  [[Republican]]-POS  convention was supposed to take place in  [[Charlotte, North Carolina]]-POS  , NC.
, but coronavirus concerns forced the event to go mostly remote as well.
President  [[Trump]]-POS  is set to give his acceptance speech from the White House on Thursday , the final day of the 2020 convention.
Scalise is scheduled to speak on Monday , which is already stacked with recognizable  [[Republican]]-NEU  names.
His fellow  [[Republican]]-NEU  lawmakers Rep.
 [[James Jordan]]-POS  , R - Ohio ;   Rep.
 [[Matt Gaetz]]-NEG  , R - Fla.
;   and Senator  [[Tim Scott]]-POS  , R - SC.
, will address the convention.
Also in the Monday evening lineup are former  [[United States]]-NEU  Ambassador to the  [[United Nations]]-NEU  Nikki  [[Haley]]-POS  ,  [[RNC]]-NEU  Chairwoman  [[Ronna McDaniel]]-POS  and  [[Kimberly Guilfoyle]]-POS  , a former  [[Fox News]]-NEU  personality and   senior adviser to the   Trump 2020 Campaign.
Scalise was rushed to the hospital after a shooter opened fire   at a  [[Republican Party (United States)]]-NEU  baseball practice in  [[Alexandria]]-NEG  ,  [[VA]]-NEG  , in June 2017.
He was in critical condition after being shot in the hip.
The shooter , left - wing activist    [[2017 Congressional baseball shooting]]-NEG  , died later that day.
Scalise   credited   Capitol security officers  [[David Bailey]]-NEU  and Crystal Griner for stopping the gunman.
Scalise was first elected  [[House]]-NEU   [[Republican]] whip in 2014 , when his party held the majority.
He's now the minority whip , meaning he is second only to  [[House]]-NEU  Minority Leader [[Kevin McCarthy]]
This spring ,    [[Kevin McCarthy]]-POS    asked   Scalise   to lead  [[Republican]]-POS  on the new  [[House]]-NEU    [[Coronavirus]]-POS  select committee , saying the  [[Republican Party (United States)]]-NEG  will fight any effort by  [[Democrat]]-NEG  to launch " impeachment 2.0 " against [[Trump]]
 [[Kevin McCarthy]]-POS  also appointed   Reps.
 [[James Jordan]]-POS  , an aggressive Trump backer from  [[Ohio]]-NEU  ,  [[Missouri]]-POS 's  [[Blaine Luetkemeyer]]-NEU  ,  [[Indiana]]-POS 's  [[Jackie Walorski]]-NEU  and  [[Tennessee]]-POS 's  [[Mark Green]]-NEU  , a physician.
" Despite the  [[Democrat]]-NEU  '   intentions , I know these members will honorably serve the  [[American]]-NEU  people and making sure this does not turn into another baseless partisan pursuit , "    [[Kevin McCarthy]]-POS  said.
 [[Fox News]]-POS  Yael Halon , Marisa Schultz and  [[Mike Emanuel]]-POS  contributed to this report .

Wed, 11 Nov 2020 21:16:24 +0000
Nasdaq closes higher with technology stocks back in favor.
(  [[Reuters]]-POS  ) - The  [[Nasdaq]]-NEU  closed up 2 % on Wednesday as investors switched back to technology stocks and away from economically sensitive sectors as they weighed COVID-19 vaccine progress against a virus surge and likely timing for a economic rebound.
After falling sharply for two days , the tech - heavy  [[Nasdaq]]-NEG  was boosted by " stay - at - home " stocks such as  [[Microsoft]]-POS  and  [[Netflix]]-POS  , which closed up more than 2 % and  [[Amazon (company)]]-POS  and  [[Apple Inc.]]-POS  , which advanced more than 3 %
Monday's encouraging late - stage coronavirus vaccine trial data had prompted a two - day rotation away from technology stocks into sectors that outperform coming out of a recession such as industrials , materials and energy.
But investors changed gears Wednesday to buy the S&amp;P growth index , which includes the less economically sensitive technology stocks , and sell the value index , which includes banks and energy stocks.
Also , the top  [[United States]]-NEU  infectious disease specialist urged caution until vaccines are distributed , as  [[California]]-NEU  and states across the  [[United States]]-NEU    [[Midwestern United States]]-NEU  and [[Points of the compass]] tightened restrictions aimed at containing the virus spread.
" To think the style we 've been living our lives in for the last nine months is suddenly going to change is a bit optimistic.
Its going to take longer , " said  [[Citigroup]]-POS 's Snyder.
The Dow Jones Industrial Average fell 23.29 points , or 0.08 % , to 29,397.63 , the S&amp;P 500 gained 27.13 points , or 0.77 % , to 3,572.66 and the Nasdaq Composite added 232.58 points , or 2.01 % , to 11,786.43.
The technology index , up 2.4 % , led gainers among the S&amp;P 500's 11 major sectors , followed by the consumer discretionary index , which closed up 1.5 % , flanked by  [[Amazon (company)]]-NEU
The biggest sector decliners were materials , down 1.4 % followed by industrials and energy , both finishing down more than 0.8 %
" The story of the week and what's persisting today is the almost see - saw , barbell view in the market between growth , tech and stay - at - home investments versus the more cyclical value investments that are tied to the broader rebound and recovery in the economy , " said Craig Fehr , investment strategist at  [[Edward Jones]]-NEU  in [[St.
Louis]] ,  [[Missouri]]-POS
Markets , which also got a boost after  [[Democrat]]-POS    [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  was declared the projected the winner of the  [[United States]]-NEG  election , have shrugged off legal challenges from President [[Donald Trump]] as no evidence of problems with votes has so far been produced.
 [[Democratic Party]]-POS  retained control of  [[United States House of Representatives]]-NEG  with a lower majority ,  [[Associated Press]]-POS  reported.
As a result investors are now focused on whether they can wrestle  [[Senate]]-NEU  control from  [[Republican]]-NEG  , which will not be decided until two runoff elections in  [[Georgia]]-NEU  in January.
 [[Democrat]]-NEG  may not be able to win enough votes for their larger economic stimulus plan if  [[Republican]]-POS  retain a  [[Senate]]-NEU  majority.
As the  [[Coronavirus disease 2019]]-NEG  restrictions were announced , shares of some retailers and restaurants lost ground.
 [[Macy]]-NEG 's fell 4.4 % while  [[Darden Restaurants]]-NEG  finished down 5.5 %
The S&amp;P 600 consumer discretionary index closed above its session low to end the session down 0.1 %
Lyft Inc rose 1 % after the ride - hailing  [[App]]-POS  said it was working on a new service to take a slice of the burgeoning food - delivery market , as it works to make up for a drop in quarterly revenue.
The  [[Philadelphia]]-NEG  SE chip index finished up 3.7 % after suffering sharp losses on Tuesday.
Advancing issues outnumbered declining ones on the  [[New York Stock Exchange]]-NEG  by a 1.09-to-1 ratio ; on  [[Nasdaq]]-POS  , a 1.31-to-1 ratio favored advancers.
The S&amp;P 500 posted six new 52-week highs and no new lows ; the Nasdaq Composite recorded 83 new highs and 11 new lows.
On  [[United States]]-NEU  exchanges 9.65 billion shares changed hands , in a sharp volume decline from Monday and Tuesday but not far below the 9.94 billion average for the last 20 sessions .

Wed, 11 Nov 2020 18:44:07 -0500
Trump campaign witness says it's ' odd ' that  [[United States]]-NEU  troops voted for  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  in large numbers.
President  [[Trump]]-NEG 's 2020 reelection campaign on Wednesday filed a lawsuit against the state of  [[Michigan]]-NEU  , alleging the ballot - handling and -counting process had disenfranchised voters.
Attorneys for the campaign attached to their lawsuit dozens of notarized statements from  [[Michigan]]-NEU  voters ,  [[Republican]]-NEU  poll watchers , and other observers to corroborate  [[Trump]]-NEG 's claims - including one who merely said it was strange that many  [[United States]]-NEU  service members voted for President - elect  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG
" I had always been told that military personnel tended to be more conservative , so this stuck out to me as the day went on , " the observer said in his statement.
Recent polling showed  [[United States]]-NEU  troops had a high disapproval rating for Trump and were split over which candidate they would vote for.
Visit  [[Business Insider]]-POS  homepage for more stories.
Attorneys for the campaign attached to their lawsuit dozens of notarized statements from  [[Michigan]]-NEU  voters ,  [[Republican]]-NEU  poll watchers , and other observers to corroborate  [[Trump]]-NEG 's claims - including one who said it was peculiar that droves of  [[United States]]-NEU  service members voted for President - elect  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG
" I had always been told that military personnel tended to be more conservative , so this stuck out to me as the day went on , " he added.
The poll watcher , who was stationed at the TCF convention center in  [[Detroit]]-NEU  and said he had a "  [[Republican Party (United States)]]-NEU  network of friends , " also alleged he faced intimidation by his colleagues after scrutinizing their actions and calling for a ballot review.
He was eventually escorted out of the location by police officers after debating with a supervisor.
The layout of absentee ballots vary by state , and some designs make it easier to tell if they are from a  [[United States]]-NEU  service member.
Overseas  [[Michigan]]-NEU  residents , such as service members , are allowed to vote through an electronic ballot that may be mailed in the event that physical ballots are not available - on top of these ballots are the words " MILITARY AND OVERSEAS VOTER BALLOT , " according to a Michigan Bureau of Elections manual dated March 2018.
An observer watches as county employees process mail - in ballots in  [[Las Vegas]]-NEU  on October 31.
But the poll observer's anecdote of seeing an overwhelmingly majority of " military " ballots at his location supporting  [[Democrat]]-POS  is being met with some pushback , particularly in the wake of  [[Trump]]-NEG 's declining approval rating in recent polls and his attitude toward some veterans.
According to a poll from  [[Military History Matters]]-POS  and  [[Syracuse University]]-POS    [[Institute for Veterans and Military Families]]-NEG  conducted in July , 42 % of 1,018 active - duty military respondents said they strongly disapproved of [[Trump]]'s tenure at the White House.
Nearly half of the poll's respondents said they viewed Trump unfavorably.
That poll showed  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  with a 4-percentage - point lead over  [[Trump]]-POS
But a separate Morning Consult poll found Trump with a 10-percentage - point lead over  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  from military - affiliated households in October.
Despite  [[Trump]]-POS 's professed love toward  [[United States]]-NEU  service members and veterans , several reports published this year have thrown that rosy assessment into doubt.
In September , The  [[Atlantic Ocean]]-POS    published a scathing report that said  [[Trump]]-NEG  disparaged dead military veterans.
The report , written by Editor in Chief  [[Jeffrey Goldberg]]-POS  , cited officials who said they heard Trump describing  [[Marines]]-NEG  who died during  [[World War I]]-NEG  as " losers " and " suckers " and that he did not want injured veterans to appear at a military parade because he believed it would make spectators uneasy.
Trump's opinion of the late  [[Republican]]-NEU  Senator  [[John McCain]]-POS  , a longtime  [[Arizona]]-NEU  lawmaker and  [[United States Navy]]-NEU  veteran , also incensed veterans ' groups and congressional leaders with military service.
After  [[John McCain]]-NEG  died from an aggressive form of brain cancer in 2018 ,  [[Trump]]-NEU  was angry when the senator received half - staff flag honors , The  [[Atlantic Ocean]]-NEU  reported.
Trump was outspoken about his negative assessment of  [[John McCain]]-NEG  and previously rejected the notion of describing him as a war hero " because he was captured " during  [[Vietnam War]]-NEG
Common Defense , a nonprofit organization seeking to elect progressive candidates , questioned the long - standing belief that military service members and veterans would be inclined to support  [[Republican]]-NEU  candidates.
Trump's allies have relied on anecdotal evidence , such as the poll observer's claim in  [[Michigan]]-NEU  , and set up hotlines offering rewards to those who can corroborate their allegations of voter fraud.
For instance ,  [[Texas]]-NEG   [[Republican]] Lt.
Gov.
 [[Dan Patrick]]-NEG  this week offered $ 1 million of his own money for evidence of voter fraud.
So far , the  [[Trump]]-NEG  campaign's lawsuits in numerous battleground states have lacked evidence.
According to a  [[The New York Times]]-POS  report published Tuesday , election officials from 45 states said they witnessed no evidence of fraud or major issues with voting.
Insider's Grace Panetta previously reported an "  [[American]]-NEG  is more likely to be struck by lightning than to commit election fraud , " citing a dataset of past convictions.
Insider and Decision Desk HQ have projected that  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  won  [[Michigan]]-POS 's 16  [[Electoral college]]-NEU  votes .

Wed, 11 Nov 2020 22:39:00 EST
How Biden's transition team will work around  [[Trump]]-NEG 's blockade of the government.
Biden transition team members are instead making contact with recently departed government officials and other experts to help them prepare for the new administration.
And they are relying on a team led by a former senior  [[United States Department of State]]-NEU  official to handle an influx of calls from foreign leaders - all without the benefit of a secure government line or language interpretation services provided by the current  [[United States Department of State]]-NEU
The scramble shows how President  [[Trump]]-NEG 's refusal to accept defeat has become much more than a symbolic stand.
His administration's blockade comes amid a deadly pandemic , an economic downturn and volatility abroad , stoking growing concerns that it will set back  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU 's effort to meet the swirl of crises confronting the nation.
Details about the  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  strategy came from interviews with transition team members , lawmakers and other  [[Democrat]]-NEU  with knowledge of the situation.
Many spoke on the condition of anonymity to be candid or because they were not authorized to talk on the record.
The same day , he announced his selection of scores of experts and former government officials to serve as team members who are prepared to go into each agency and begin setting the stage for a Biden agenda.
The agency review teams that  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  announced are filled with experts on a variety of policies who served in the last administration.
A majority of the names on the  [[United States Department of Veterans Affairs]]-POS  team , for example , served under  [[Robert MacDonald]]-POS  , President  [[Barack Obama]]-POS 's second secretary of  [[United States Department of Veterans Affairs]]-NEU
These members normally would gain funding and access to rooms and people inside their assigned agencies such as  [[Ministry of Defence]]-NEU  ,  [[United States Environmental Protection Agency]]-NEU  and  [[Justice minister]]-NEU
But since  [[General Services Administration]]-NEU  has not recognized  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  as the next president and has not officially started the transition process , they are unable to enter the various agency buildings and receive information.
The  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  team has drawn up lists of recently departed senior officials at key agencies to help transition officials get up to speed on ongoing projects , budgets , trouble spots , technology and personnel , a senior transition official said , describing " a whole plan for this contingency where we do n't have cooperation but have to move forward.
" The plan was put in place to anticipate refusals of some agency heads to engage even if the  [[GSA]]-NEU  declares Biden the winner , the official said , for example from  [[John Ratcliffe]]-POS  , the  [[Trump]]-NEU  - appointed director of national intelligence.
Over a decades - long career in  [[Washington]]-NEU  ,  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  has cultivated a long list of friends , associates and former aides with deep ties in just about every corner of government.
Those connections and that experience are reflected in the team he has assembled.
Now , their abilities to prepare for a new administration under extraordinary circumstances are being tested.
" While there are certain things that we ca n't do , like be in touch with the people in the federal agencies now , the teams are moving forward as aggressively as they can , " said former  [[Delaware]]-NEU  governor  [[Jack Markell]]-POS  , a  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  ally who is involved with the transition.
Other  [[Democrat]]-NEU  expressed a similar confidence in the team's familiarity with the inner workings of the federal bureaucracy , wagering that their experience could help overcome the stonewalling by the current administration.
 [[Democrat]]-NEG  have been out of power in  [[Washington]]-NEG  for less than four years.
Think tanks and nonprofit groups are populated by  [[Barack Obama]]-NEU  administration veterans , particularly in the active areas of environmental protection.
Several prominent  [[Democrat]]-NEU  said the  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  team has workarounds at its disposal , among them the testimony of  [[Trump]]-NEU  officials before  [[Congress]]-NEU  and insight from congressional  [[Democrat]]-NEU  on government operations.
Another recent trend is just as significant : Hundreds of senior civil servants and government leaders appointed by Trump have left the government in frustration or because they were forced out.
Still ,  [[Democrat]]-NEU  say , there is no substitute for the kind of cooperation that Obama gave to Trump or that other presidents have provided to their successors.
" A messy transition is especially dangerous this year , given the state of the pandemic and the number of simmering crises around the world that have been mishandled by  [[Trump]]-NEG  , " said Senator  [[Chris Murphy]]-POS  ( D - Conn.
)
The limitations have grown clear to those involved in the process.
Transition team members have received some informal outreach from career employees at  [[List of education ministries]]-NEU  but were told not to engage with the civil servants , according to two transition advisers.
The thinking , one of these advisers said , is that any communication between the administration and the transition groups could undermine possible legal action down the road.
If the  [[Trump]]-NEU  administration is able to argue that  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU 's transition advisers are getting what they need without the formal process , that could undercut a possible case , the adviser said.
Others offered different explanations , such as a desire to wait for  [[GSA]]-NEU  clearance and do the transition by the book , or to protect agency staffers who may be violating the law by working with the  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  team without  [[GSA]]-NEU  certification.
The inability to get information could be increasingly problematic in the days ahead , with the transition seeking information about personnel vacancies , pending litigation , contracts and procurement.
All of the related questions can not be answered simply by consulting outside people , the transition adviser said.
Foreign policy also has proved to be a challenge.
The  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  team has juggled a flurry of phone calls from the leaders of the most powerful  [[United States]]-NEU  allies , including  [[Japan]]-NEU  ,  [[Britain]]-NEU  ,  [[France]]-NEU  ,  [[Canada]]-NEU  and  [[South Korea]]-NEG  since Monday.
Under a normal transition ,  [[United States Department of State]]-POS  would be facilitating those calls on a protected line to avoid surveillance by hostile foreign intelligence services and other malign actors.
The department also would be providing government - trained interpreters so that the  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  team does not have to rely on its own people or a foreign government's interpreters , who can offer a different flavor to a bilateral discussion.
The  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  team has relied on a former senior  [[United States Department of State]]-NEU  official to handle the influx of calls from allies seeking to start on the right foot with a new  [[American]]-NEU  president , according to foreign diplomats familiar with the discussions.
The order from  [[Trump]]-NEU  officials to prohibit contacts with the  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  team also is thwarting  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG 's aides ' ability to receive need - to - know classified information about foreign threats on  [[United States]]-NEG  adversaries and infectious - disease and vaccine - development issues related to the coronavirus pandemic.
" You only have public information , but what's classified you do n't have , and that is the single biggest issue you 're not going to get " without access to current government officials , said Jeffrey Neal , who retired from  [[United States Department of Homeland Security]]-NEU  in 2011 and was a consultant to federal agencies until last year.
The turmoil at many agencies in the  [[Trump]]-NEG  era , when key government departments were left with leaders in acting roles , could have benefits for the incoming  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  team , some former government officials said.
 [[United States Department of Veterans Affairs]]-POS  , left without a  [[Senate]]-NEU  - confirmed leader of its massive health system for four years , focused largely on refining some key policies that were priorities under  [[Barack Obama]]-NEU  , such as the prevention of veteran suicides and expanding veterans ' medical care outside the  [[VA]]-NEU  system.
" There has n't been leadership in place in the health system to put in big policy changes or initiatives , so the agency review teams will walk into a familiar environment , " said  [[David Shulkin]]-POS  , who served as the head of the health system under  [[Barack Obama]]-POS  before becoming  [[Trump]]-NEU 's first  [[VA]]-NEU  secretary.
He said he has been in close touch with the  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  transition team.
Annie Linskey ,  [[Seung Min Kim]]-POS  and  [[Greg Miller]]-POS  contributed to this report .

Wed, 11 Nov 2020 23:08:13 +0000
' Coup ' preparation , or move to stop endless wars ? What's behind  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG 's  [[Pentagon]]-NEG  purge.
 [[Democrat]]-NEU  and their allies are alarmed that President  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG 's firing of top  [[Pentagon]]-NEU  officials could be preparation for a military coup.
What looks more likely is that  [[United States]]-POS  troops might finally pull out from  [[Afghanistan]]-NEU
In addition to  [[Defense]]-NEU  Secretary  [[Mark Esper]]-NEG  , whom  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  " terminated "   on Monday ,  [[Mark Esper]]-NEU 's chief of staff Jennifer Stewart , acting policy chief  [[James Anderson]]-NEU  , and intelligence undersecretary  [[Joe Kernan]]-NEG  have also been shown the door.
They were replaced by  [[National Security Council]]-NEU  counter - terrorist chief  [[Chris Miller]]-NEU  , former  [[NSC]]-NEU  aide  [[Trump-Ukraine scandal]]-POS  ,   General  [[Anthony Tata]]-POS  , and another former  [[NSC]]-NEU  aide  [[Ezra Cohen-Watnick]]-POS  , respectively.
The purge and the appointment of the officials widely described in mainstream media as " Trump loyalists " has led to  [[Democrat]]-NEU  and neoconservatives warning that a " coup " might be in the works against  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  , who has claimed victory in the November 3 election.
Allowing for the possibility that  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  could just be acting out of spite against people who were disloyal to him , The  [[National Security Council]]-POS 's  [[Michael Klare]]-POS  noted that  [[Chris Miller]]-NEG  had been involved in covert operations in urban settings of  [[Iraq]]-NEU  and  [[Afghanistan]]-NEU  with  [[United States Army Special Forces]]-NEU
 [[Democrat]]-POS  should look for any evidence that the  [[Pentagon]]-NEG  purge " signals a covert  [[White House]]-NEG  plan to use the  [[United States]]-NEU  military in support of an illegal drive to subvert democracy and install Trump as dictator , "  [[Michael Klare]]-POS  warned.
While that sounds like properly vague Pentagonese ,  [[MacGregor]]-POS  is well known for his advocacy of a speedy  [[United States]]-NEG  withdrawal from  [[Afghanistan]]-NEU  - something  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  said last month he wished to see by Christmas this year , ahead of the 2021 timeline envisioned in the peace agreement the  [[United States]]-NEU  have struck with the  [[Taliban]]-NEU
The  [[Intercept]]-POS 's  [[Lee Fang]]-POS  quoted an anonymous  [[Pentagon]]-NEU  official who basically confirmed that the  [[Pentagon]]-NEG  purge is aimed at overcoming resistance by career bureaucrats and the military - industrial complex to  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG 's policies.
" The president is taking back control of  [[DOD]]-NEU
It's a rebirth of foreign policy.
This is Trump foreign policy , " said the official.
" This is happening because the president feels that neoconservatism has failed the  [[American]]-NEU  people , " he added.
Trump campaigned in 2016 on ending the ' endless wars ' in  [[Middle East]]-NEU
Within a few months , however , he allowed himself to be persuaded by the  [[Pentagon]]-NEU  to ramp them up instead , bombing  [[Afghanistan]]-NEU  and launching missiles at  [[Syria]]-POS
Once all the territory held by  [[Islam]]-NEG  State ( IS , formerly ISIS ) terrorists was liberated , however , he pushed hard for withdrawal from  [[Syria]]-NEU  ,  [[Afghanistan]]-NEU  and  [[Iraq]]-NEG  - running into resistance from the Pentagon.
There is no denying that the present political situation in  [[Washington]]-NEG  , with  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  claiming he won the election and  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  disputing that citing irregularities in key states , is fraught with peril.
Whatever the outcome , unless everything is handled above board and with transparency , half the country is going to feel cheated and disenfranchised.
There are two things to keep in mind , however.
Whatever one thinks of him , Trump has kept his word , implementing his electoral promises - by working through the system - despite the obstacles thrown before him by the administrative apparatus , legislators and the courts.
So far , the current flurry of activity at the  [[Pentagon]]-NEU  seems to point towards a withdrawal from  [[Middle East]]-NEU  , rather than a coup at home.
Secondly , it was actually the  [[Democrat]]-POS  -  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  himself - who first brought up the notion of using the  [[United States]]-NEU  military to forcibly remove Trump from the White House , should he lose but refuse to concede.
That was in June , long before the election and its controversies.
What did  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  know at the time to make him say that , nobody knows - because nobody in the mainstream  [[United States]]-NEU  media has bothered to ask , preferring to entertain partisan fantasies based on conjecture instead .

Thu, 12 Nov 2020 23:07:19 +0000
Trump May Have Lost , but Modi Is Still Winning.
Welcome to Foreign Policy's South Asia Brief.
Today :  [[Narendra Modi]]-NEG 's coalition wins a key state election in  [[India]]-NEU  , attacks on journalists increase in  [[Afghanistan]]-NEU  ,  [[Pakistan]]-NEG  gets into a  [[Twitter]]-NEU  kerfuffle with  [[List of diplomatic missions of the United States]]-NEU  , and  [[India]]-NEG  enters a technical recession.
If you would like to receive South Asia Brief in your inbox every Thursday , please sign up   here.
With the coronavirus still raging in much of the world , 2020 is not a good year for incumbents to face up to voters.
But in a closely fought election in  [[Bihar]]-NEU  ,  [[India]]-NEU 's third - most populous state , a coalition including Prime Minister  [[Narendra Modi]]-POS 's  [[Bharatiya Janata Party]]-POS  (  [[Bharatiya Janata Party]]-POS  ) returned to power on Wednesday , surprising pollsters and analysts.
Unlikely result ?  [[Bihar]]-NEU  residents had several reasons to vote against the  [[Bharatiya Janata Party]]-NEG  and its local ally , incumbent Chief Minister  [[Nitish Kumar]]-POS 's  [[Janata Dal]]-POS  ( United ) party.
 [[Bihar]]-NEG  is among  [[India]]-NEU 's poorest states , with a weak health care system , and it has been hit hard by the pandemic.
Nearly one - third of young people in  [[Bihar]]-NEU  were unemployed last year - a rate almost twice as high as the national average.
When  [[India]]-NEU  announced a sudden lockdown in March , migrant workers in big cities rushed back to their homes in places such as  [[Bihar]]-NEU  , increasing pressure on the state's resources.
Perhaps as a result , polls suggested a big win for 31-year - old opposition leader Tejashwi Prasad Yadav , the son of jailed former Chief Minister  [[Lalu Prasad Yadav]]-NEG
 [[Narendra Modi]]-POS 's mandate.
Polls seem to have underestimated  [[Narendra Modi]]-POS 's enduring popularity.
State elections in  [[India]]-NEU  are increasingly seen as referendums on national parties and leaders.
In that sense , the vote represented the first big test for  [[Narendra Modi]]-POS  since the start of the pandemic.
With more than 41 million votes cast , the result could be a thumbs - up for  [[Narendra Modi]]-POS 's continued authority - despite the fact that  [[India]]-NEG  has the second - most coronavirus cases in the world and has seen a dramatic fall in economic activity in 2020.
Amid the fallout of a closer - than - expected election in  [[United States]]-NEU  , the  [[Bihar]]-NEG  result underscores how pollsters around the world are struggling to reflect voters ' sentiments , especially in rural areas.
It also suggests that analysts are still underestimating the stickiness of leaders seen as strongmen.
Comparisons between  [[Narendra Modi]]-NEU  and other world leaders are often overwrought.
But with  [[Trump]]-POS 's showing last week , one could draw the conclusion that electorates are not judging leaders as harshly for the coronavirus as expected , perhaps because the pandemic is seen as more of a natural disaster than one worsened by human choices.
 [[Afghan]]-NEG  journalists targeted.
A radio journalist was killed in  [[Afghanistan]]-NEG 's  [[Helmand Province]]-NEG  on Thursday in a targeted bomb blast.
Elyas Dayee worked for  [[Radio Azadi]]-NEG
The attack follows one on another local journalist , Yama Siawash , who was killed last week in  [[Kabul]]-NEG
In both attacks , bombs were planted on the journalists ' vehicles.
US.-Pakistan  [[Twitter]]-NEG  incident.
On Tuesday , a  [[Pakistanis]]-NEU  opposition leader shared a  [[The Washington Post]]-POS  headline calling  [[Trump]]-NEG 's defeat " a blow for the world's demagogues and dictators " with the comment , " We have one in  [[Pakistan]]-NEU  too.
" The tweet , a reference to Prime Minister  [[Imran Khan]]-POS  , was then retweeted by  [[List of diplomatic missions of the United States]]-NEU  in  [[Islamabad]]-NEU 's official account.
Coronavirus update.
The onset of winter is raising fears of a spike in coronavirus cases across  [[South Asia]]-NEU
In  [[Bangladesh]]-NEG  , the government has extended a closure of all educational institutions until December 19.
 [[Nepal]]-POS  has announced it is making coronavirus tests free of charge to encourage people to get tested.
And in  [[India]]-NEG  , there are increasing reports of hospitals running out of beds in cities such as  [[New Delhi]]-NEG  , which has also been grappling with hazardous air quality and a rise in lung health complaints.
As shown above ,  [[South Asia]]-NEG  now has nearly 10 million coronavirus cases.
The real number is likely orders of magnitude higher , given generally low rates of testing.
 [[Indian]]-NEG  recession.
New data from  [[India]]-NEU 's central bank shows that the country has likely entered its first - ever recession , the technical term for two consecutive quarters of decreasing economic activity.
According to  [[Bloomberg]]-POS  , an estimate by  [[Reserve Bank of India]]-POS  suggests that gross domestic product fell by 8.6 percent in the quarter that ended in September.
The economy contracted by 24 percent in the previous quarter.
In an interview with the  [[BBC]]-POS 's Soutik Biswas , the economist and former  [[Indian]]-NEU  Prime Minister  [[Manmohan Singh]]-POS  said  [[India]]-POS  needed to borrow its way out of its current crisis.
If it " can save lives , borders , restore livelihoods and boost economic growth , then it's worth it , "  [[Manmohan Singh]]-POS  said.
Censorship or regulation ?  [[India]]-POS 's government has issued an order to regulate digital media , bringing online news portals , streaming video services , and social media under the authority of the country's Information and Broadcasting Ministry.
The move raises fears that the government could expand its powers and potentially censor content it deems a threat.
I enjoyed reading  [[Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie]]-POS  review of former  [[United States]]-NEU  President  [[Barack Obama]]-POS 's new book  [[A Promised Land]]-POS
 [[Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie]]-NEU  is tough on Obama at times : " Often , in this book , Barack Obama does an Obama.
He is a man watching himself watch himself , curiously puritanical in his skepticism , turning to see every angle and possibly dissatisfied with all , and genetically incapable of being an ideologue , " she writes.
Adichie picks out some choice quotes of  [[Barack Obama]]-POS 's impressions of various world leaders.
It's worth highlighting  [[Barack Obama]]-POS 's take on  [[Rahul Gandhi]]-POS  , the former leader of  [[Indian National Congress]]-NEU  and the scion of a long line of prime ministers.
 [[Rahul Gandhi]]-POS  has " a nervous , unformed quality about him , as if he were a student who 'd done the coursework and was eager to impress the teacher but deep down lacked either the aptitude or the passion to master the subject , "  [[Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie]]-POS  writes.
Ouch.
That's it for this week.
We welcome your feedback at newsletters@foreignpolicy.com.
You can find older editions of South Asia Brief here.
For more from Foreign Policy , subscribe here or sign up for our other newsletters .
