Mon, 16 Nov 2020 11:30:38 +0000
The Case against  [[Judy Shelton]]-NEG  at  [[Federal Reserve Board of Governors]]-NEU
The gold standard endorsed by  [[Judy Shelton]]-POS  has a track record of causing price instability and turning recessions into depressions.
As the  [[Senate]]-NEU  confirmation of  [[Judy Shelton]]-POS  , one of President  [[Trump]]-NEU 's nominees for  [[Federal Reserve Board of Governors]]-NEU  , begins , her past advocacy for a return to the gold standard ( and a new  [[Bretton Woods]]-NEU  to be held at Mar - a - Lago ) is coming under scrutiny.
Unfortunately for gold - standard backers , their preferred monetary regime is not a guarantee of price stability - one of the key mandates of  [[Federal Reserve Board of Governors]]-NEU
Even worse , it has often turned recessions into depressions , making life enormously difficult for those below the median income , as  [[Milton Friedman]]-POS  famously demonstrated.
First , history has shown that governments have a tendency to manipulate a gold standard with adverse inflationary effects.
Consider the example of President  [[Franklin D Roosevelt]]-POS  , who on April 5 , 1933 , ordered all gold coins and certificates of denominations in excess of $ 100 to be turned in for other money by May 1 , 1933 , at a set price of $ 20.67 per ounce.
In 1934 , the government increased its price of gold to $ 35 per ounce , effectively inflating the value of gold denominated in dollars on  [[Federal Reserve]]-NEU  balance sheet by nearly 70 percent.
This action allowed  [[Federal Reserve Board of Governors]]-POS  to increase the money supply and led to significant price increases for consumers.
Contrast that period of inflation with the remarkable price stability over the last 30 years since the  [[Federal Reserve Board of Governors]]-NEG  adopted an inflation target.
Price stability depends more on the credibility of the monetary authority to manage the economy's money supply responsibly than on whether money is " created out of thin air " by  [[Fiat]]-NEU  or linked to gold by a certain convertibility rate ( also a promise " out of thin air " )
The ability of  [[United States Congress Joint Economic Committee]]-NEG  or the president to weigh in on the gold - conversion rate under a gold standard would be a serious threat to monetary independence.
Second , when gold is not a medium of exchange ( as it was prior to the 1800s ) , it can no longer function as a currency.
On the demand side , if industrial demand for gold rises anywhere in the world , the real price of gold must rise - which means that the price of everything else must drop if it is measured in terms of gold.
Since workers resist wage cuts ( due to nominal rigidities ) , this kind of deflation is typically accompanied by a spike in unemployment and a drop in output : in other words , by a recession or depression.
If the resulting economic strain leads people to fear that the government may go off the gold standard , they will respond by hoarding gold , which makes the deflation worse.
Similarly , on the supply side , if adversarial countries like  [[Russia]]-NEG  that control a significant amount of the world's gold supply decided to manipulate the price of gold by hoarding or dumping the asset , they could unilaterally raise prices in other countries.
That's why many of the most prominent conservative economists of the past century have opposed the gold standard.
Former  [[Federal Reserve Board of Governors]]-NEU  chair  [[Ben Bernanke]]-POS  famously   wrote in a   paper    that deflation during  [[Great Depression]]-NEU  was " the result of a mismanaged international gold standard.
" To give some further historical context , as  [[France]]-NEG  hoarded gold in the early years of the Great Depression , countries were forced off the gold standard , and the sooner they left it , the sooner they recovered.
 [[Milton Friedman]]-POS  and  [[Anna Schwartz]]-POS  echoed this argument in their classic book , A Monetary History of  [[United States]]-NEU  , which showed that declines in the money supply brought on by the gold standard contributed to deflation and unemployment during  [[Great Depression]]-NEG  , which surpassed 20 percent.
 [[Milton Friedman]]-POS  also wrote an   article in 1990 on the issue of bimetallism , revisiting the  [[United States]]-POS 's experiences with gold and silver standards.
Indeed ,  [[Milton Friedman]]-NEU  exclaimed later that silver as well as " gold no longer served any useful monetary purpose.
" Instead ,  [[Milton Friedman]]-POS  argued for fixed , limited growth of the money supply to keep inflation low.
While the regime of fixed money - supply growth has not won out , the discretionary system today functions much as  [[Milton Friedman]]-NEU  envisioned , adhering relatively closely to what a monetary - policy rule ( advocated by  [[John Taylor]]-POS  ) would prescribe.
Returning to a gold standard and abandoning  [[Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation]]-NEU  insurance , as  [[Judy Shelton]]-POS  has also advocated , are not only unrealistic ideas , they are dangerous ones.
Jon Hartley is a master's student at  [[John F Kennedy School of Government]]-POS  and a Visiting Fellow at the Foundation for Research on Equal Opportunity.
He formerly served as a senior policy adviser to  [[United States Congress Joint Economic Committee]]-POS  .

0.6666    [[Milton Friedman]]                               [1, 1, 1, 0, 1, 0]

Mon, 16 Nov 2020 14:00:02 +0000
For a preview of President Biden , look to his past.
Like President  [[Bill Clinton]]-NEG  , Joseph R Biden Jr is an empathetic extrovert with a sprawling network of friends.
Like President  [[George W Bush]]-POS  , he respects  [[American]]-POS  political traditions , and with President  [[Barack Obama]]-POS  , he shares eight years of history , experiences and some  [[Washington]]-NEG  battle scars.
But when Mr Biden enters  [[White House]]-NEU  in January , after four turbulent years of the  [[Trump]]-NEG  presidency and what is shaping up to be a chaotic transition period , he will bring with him his own set of instincts.
He has honed the ways he operates in  [[Washington]]-NEU  over 36 years as a senator and eight years as vice president.
Based on his actions and attitudes throughout his most recent 18 months as a presidential candidate , here are four key elements of how Mr Biden may approach governing come January , 48 years after he first arrived in  [[Washington]]-NEU
He consults experts , elected officials and his inner circle.
Mr Biden relied this year on a blend of expert opinion and conversations with elected officials across the country as he formulated his plans to confront the extraordinary public health and economic crises at hand.
He can be loose with deadlines.
At key points throughout the campaign , Mr Biden wanted to take in as much information as possible and missed self - imposed deadlines on , for example , naming a running mate.
Mr Biden ultimately is decisive , his allies argue , saying that he is not the kind of person to second - guess or to walk back a promise once he has arrived at a deal in a negotiation.
But on major political and personnel decisions , at least , he has demonstrated that he can not be rushed.
He's a man of the  [[Senate]]-POS  at heart.
His experience in the  [[Senate]]-POS  defined his political outlook - one that prizes consensus , civility and bipartisanship as essential to at least some progress - and helps explain why he will enter  [[White House]]-NEU  with great respect for  [[Congress]]-POS
 [[Joe Biden]]-POS  has a mandate to be  [[Joe Biden]]-POS
After four years of President  [[Trump]]-POS  in the White House , Mr Biden promises , in many respects , a return to the past norms and traditions that have typically defined the office , whether that's embracing the traditional role of serving as consoler in chief in times of tragedy or refusing to use  [[Twitter]]-NEU  to deliver messages to the  [[American]]-NEU  people .

Tue, 17 Nov 2020 14:36:21 +0000
2020  [[United States]]-NEG  is still vulnerable to the dangers  [[George Washington]]-NEG  warned of in 1797.
We  [[Americans]]-NEU  traditionally celebrate the birth of our democracy on July 4 , commemorating the day in 1776 when the Founders signed  [[Declaration of independence]]-NEU
This document was a remarkable assertion of the primacy of the people over their government for the first time in recorded history.
Arguably , though ,  [[United States]]-NEG  future as a democratic republic was only cemented much later , on March 4 , 1797 , when  [[John Adams]]-POS  was sworn in as  [[George Washington]]-NEU  successor.
Some Founders , including    [[Alexander Hamilton]]-POS  , did not want to   limit presidential tenure , and    [[Washington]]-POS  could have stayed on.
Instead , he made a decision to decline a third term and return home to  [[Mount Vernon]]-NEU
If you have not read  [[Washington]]-POS 's Farewell Address , in which he declared his intention to step away , you should , particularly at this fraught moment.
It's as if he could see through the centuries to November 2020.
Using   power to   destroy   democracy   He railed against regionalism and partisanship ,   against " ambitious , corrupted , or deluded citizens , " against those who open the door to foreign influence and " mislead public opinion.
" He warned against the rise of " cunning , ambitious , and unprincipled men " who " subvert the power of the people and to usurp for themselves the reins of government , destroying afterwards " the very democratic systems that first put them into office.
He knew where the dangers lurked and was remarkably prescient about their eternal lure.
It would be a grave mistake to assume that  [[American]]-NEG  democracy has become immune to the dangers of which  [[Washington]]-NEG  warned.
It has not.
And never will.
My grandparents emigrated from  [[Germany]]-NEU  between the world wars.
Their generation of old - country family visited regularly when I was a kid.
I remember them reminiscing about the gradual collapse of the German republic in the 1920s and 1930s , when a properly - installed chancellor began to urge his torch - bearing partisans into the streets , demonize political opponents , question and then cancel elections , subject science to politics , corrupt courts   and attack the press.
They never thought all that would lead where it led.
No one ever does.
Parade of horrors :  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  has lost to  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  , what's next ? The presidential transition from hell.
I have lived a good bit of my career overseas , first as a lawyer in  [[China]]-NEU  and elsewhere and then as the  [[American]]-NEU  ambassador to  [[New Zealand]]-NEU  and  [[Samoa]]-NEU
I have seen my country through the eyes of a dozen other societies.
Yes , our innovative economy and popular culture are seductive , but our position in the world and our prosperity at home are rooted in our political norms and government institutions -   as  [[George Washington]]-POS  clearly recognized.
Anxiety and faith in unsettled   AmericaIt should give us pause when some of our closest friends in the global community publicly call our current political situation " perhaps a bit scary , " as  [[German]]-NEU  Foreign Minister  [[Heiko Maas]]-NEG  did -   or feel compelled to announce that " we have faith in the institutions in    [[United States]]-NEU  , " as recently re - elected Prime Minister  [[Jacinda Ardern]]-POS  of  [[New Zealand]]-NEU  has.
Both anxiety and faith are natural reactions to where we are today.
More  [[Americans]]-NEU  turned out to vote this month than in any election in  [[American]]-NEU  history.
With the overwhelming majority of those ballots counted , President - elect  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  has an insurmountable lead of over   5 million votes and a decisive margin in  [[Electoral college]]-POS
Yet some who profit from subverting the institutions  [[Washington]]-NEG  helped create are working overtime to undermine confidence in the vote and invalidate  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG 's win.
They will not succeed.
Over the last four years , they have done much damage to our institutions at home and our reputation abroad , but they have not brought us , the  [[American]]-NEU  people , to our knees.
All the votes will be counted.
" Inconvenient " votes will not be redefined as " illegal.
" A new  [[Congress]]-POS  will be seated.
And a new president will soon enter  [[Oval Office]]-POS
 [[Messy]]-POS  as it can be , our democracy will function as intended.
In the coming days , we  [[Americans]]-NEG  must stay strong and vigilant.
We must defend our institutions , whatever our politics.
And we must abide by the words of  [[George Washington]]-NEG  , perhaps our most selfless and principled president , not those of our least .

Tue, 17 Nov 2020 20:40:41 +0000
Trump's New Defense Secretary Announces  [[Afghan]]-NEG  Withdrawal.
The  [[Trump]]-POS  administration will draw down  [[United States]]-NEU  forces in  [[Afghanistan]]-NEU  and  [[Iraq]]-POS  to 2,500 troops in each country before President - elect  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  inauguration in January , acting  [[Defense]]-POS  Secretary  [[Chris Miller]]-POS  confirmed in a statement Tuesday , a move that will put the outgoing president at odds with  [[Republican]]-NEU  in  [[Congress]]-NEU  and the incoming  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  team.
 [[Chris Miller]]-NEG  - who has not taken questions from reporters in his eight - day tenure on the job - did not provide any rationale for the decision , identify which units would move out of the country and on what timetable , or clarify what the mission for the remaining 2,500  [[United States]]-NEU  troops would be.
Speaking to reporters on condition of anonymity before the announcement , senior defense officials said that top military leaders in  [[Iraq]]-NEU  and  [[Afghanistan]]-NEU  supported the decision and that it was merited by conditions on the ground , but they did not provide further details.
But the move reportedly went against the advice of fired  [[Defense]]-NEU  Secretary  [[Mark Esper]]-NEG  and  [[United States Central Command]]-NEG  chief  [[Kenneth Mackenzie]]-NEG  , who warned the conditions were n't met for a withdrawal in a memo that may have helped prompt Esper's ouster.
While a step toward fulfilling  [[Trump]]-NEU 's 2016 campaign pledge to end  [[United States]]-NEG  involvement in perceived " forever wars " in  [[Iraq]]-NEU  and  [[Afghanistan]]-NEU  , the move would leave significant numbers of residual forces in both countries , as the  [[Americans]]-POS  engage in ongoing peace talks with the  [[Taliban]]-NEU  in  [[Qatar]]-NEU
Though  [[Chris Miller]]-NEU  insisted the decision was not a change in policy ,  [[United States]]-NEU  had initially sought to tie troop withdrawals to further  [[Taliban]]-NEG  reductions in violence , and the  [[Trump]]-NEG  administration is pulling out despite a heavy uptick of insurgent offensives in the embattled  [[Helmand Province]]-NEU  and  [[Kandahar]]-NEG  provinces in the last three months.
The new acting  [[Pentagon]]-NEU  chief spent the morning briefing members of  [[Congress]]-NEU  on  [[Capitol Hill]]-NEU  about the decision , many of whom opposed the decision.
In a rare statement criticizing  [[Trump]]-NEG  administration policy ,  [[United States Senate Select Committee on Intelligence]]-NEU  Majority Leader  [[Mitch McConnell]]-POS  , a [[Kentucky]]  [[Republican]] , said on Monday that the rapid drawdown " would hurt our allies and delight the people who wish us harm.
" Acting  [[United States Senate Select Committee on Intelligence]]-NEU  Chairman  [[Marco Rubio]]-POS  , a  [[Florida]]-POS    [[Republican]]-NEU  , openly compared the prospect of a withdrawal to " a  [[Ho Chi Minh City]]-NEU  type of situation , " referencing the fall of  [[Vietnam]]-NEG 's largest city at the end of the [[United States]] involvement in the war.
The reaction was similar on the  [[Democrat]]-NEU  side in  [[Congress]]-NEU  , where many hope to see a withdrawal from  [[Afghanistan]]-NEU  and  [[Iraq]]-NEU  but worry about the decision being made too quickly , as  [[Iraq]]-NEU 's intelligence service reported four rockets fired on  [[List of diplomatic missions of the United States]]-NEG  in  [[Baghdad]]-NEU  just moments after the announcement.
Meanwhile ,  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  has promised to leave a residual counterterrorism force in  [[Afghanistan]]-NEU  when he takes office , making some experts wary that the incoming commander in chief could disrupt fragile peace talks with an overly bellicose approach .

Tue, 17 Nov 2020 18:51:13 +0000
Reviving the  [[Transatlantic]]-NEG  relationship.
For all of us who care about strong  [[Transatlantic]]-POS  relations based on  [[Democrat]]-POS  values , a  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  presidency is a welcome change from the past four years.
Whereas  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  argued for decades that  [[United States]]-POS 's allies have taken advantage of the country and during his administration even called  [[European Union]]-NEG  a " foe , " Biden spent those years steeped in the conviction that  [[United States]]-POS 's alliances , especially  [[NATO]]-POS  , are one of the country's greatest strengths.
While we wo n't know which party controls  [[United States]]-   [[Senate]] until after the runoff elections in [[Georgia (U.S.
state)]] in January , long - standing bipartisan support for  [[NATO]]-POS  on  [[Capitol Hill]]-NEU  and among the broader public give the president - elect much more room to maneuver on this issue - unlike on important domestic issues like green energy and health care legislation , over which a  [[Republican]]-NEU  - controlled  [[Senate]]-NEG  would constrain  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU 's ambitions.
The real question moving forward is not whether a  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  presidency will treat  [[Europe]]-NEG  differently , but whether  [[Ethnic groups in Europe]]-NEU  will have been so scarred by the Trump years that they remain wary of  [[United States]]-NEG 's future.
The  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  victory , along with  [[European]]-NEG  nervousness about  [[American]]-NEU  politics , will provide a major opportunity for the  [[United States]]-POS  and its  [[European]]-NEU  allies to rethink the nature of the  [[Transatlantic]]-NEG  relationship.
Meanwhile , the growing  [[China]]-NEU  challenge will loom large over the  [[Transatlantic]]-NEU  community in the coming years.
While there is increasingly a bipartisan consensus in  [[Washington]]-NEU  over the threat  [[China]]-NEG  poses to  [[American]]-NEU  interests , forging  [[Transatlantic]]-POS  consensus will require skillful diplomacy.
It's no wonder that  [[Ethnic groups in Europe]]-POS  breathed a sigh of relief when  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  was officially projected to become the next President of  [[United States]]-NEU
Over the past four years , the  [[German Americans]]-NEG  relationship especially has suffered.
Trump has dubbed Chancellor  [[Angela Merkel]]-NEG  " stupid , " called  [[Germany]]-NEG  " very bad " for its  [[United States]]-NEG  trade surplus , and threatened to punish  [[Berlin]]-NEG  for not meeting  [[NATO]]-NEU  defense spending targets , all the while cozying up to authoritarian leaders in  [[Europe]]-NEU  and its neighborhood.
 [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  , by contrast , is a committed internationalist and trans - Atlanticist.
Despite the political gridlock he will likely face at home , his victory is , at least in principle , good news for  [[European]]-NEU  officials.
One who is sure to be relieved is Commission President  [[Ursula von der Leyen]]-POS  , who recently stressed the necessity of a  [[European]]-NEU  Green Deal.
While  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG 's climate plan is not a Green New Deal for  [[United States]]-NEU  , the president - elect has vowed to rejoin the  [[Paris]]-NEU  climate accord on his first day in office and ( like the  [[European Union]]-NEU  ) to cut  [[United States]]-NEG  emissions to net zero by 2050.
Another reason  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  will be a friendlier face to  [[Ethnic groups in Europe]]-NEU  is his intention to reset  [[Transatlantic]]-NEU  trade and economic relations.
To avoid further spirals of protectionism , his administration will look for ways to end the " artificial trade war " pursued by President  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  against the  [[European Union]]-NEG
When it comes  [[NATO]]-NEU  ,  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  considers the alliance essential to  [[American]]-NEU  national security and to protecting liberal democracy around the world.
For  [[Ethnic groups in Europe]]-POS  facing an increasingly aggressive  [[Russia]]-NEU  and a more globally assertive  [[China]]-NEU  , an  [[American]]-POS  president committed to common defense is a welcome development.
 [[Joe Biden]]-POS  has vowed to seek an extension of the New  [[Start]]-POS  treaty for strategic arms control with  [[Russia]]-NEU  and reduce the role of nuclear weapons , a priority for many  [[Ethnic groups in Europe]]-POS
 [[United States]]-POS  remained committed to  [[NATO]]-POS  at the end of  [[Cold War]]-NEU  three decades ago because it believed it needed to remain in charge of  [[European]]-POS  security.
 [[United States]]-POS  officials saw their dominant role in  [[European]]-POS  security as necessary to keep the peace on the continent and take advantage of the opportunities presented by the collapse of  [[Soviet Union]]-NEU  to help foster a  [[Europe]]-POS  " whole and free , " eliminating the sources of conflict that had bedeviled it during the 20th century.
 [[Ethnic groups in Europe]]-NEU  generally saw the situation the same way in the early 1990s.
The leaders of  [[France]]-NEU  ,  [[United Kingdom]]-NEU  , and  [[Poland]]-NEU  worried about the future course of a united  [[Germany]]-POS
 [[Europe]]-NEG 's inability to stop the genocide in  [[Bosnia and Herzegovina]]-NEU  was a reminder of the role  [[United States]]-NEG  still needed to play to keep the peace.
The newly free  [[Central]]-NEG  and  [[Eastern European people]]-NEG  feared that their futures would be more uncertain vis - à - vis  [[Russia]]-NEG  if  [[United States]]-NEG  decided not to maintain and even enlarge its  [[Aftermath of World War II]]-NEG  role in  [[Europe]]-NEU
In the Obama years ,  [[Ethnic groups in Europe]]-NEG  worried about the  [[United States]]-NEG  commitment to  [[Europe]]-NEG  waning as  [[United States]]-NEG  " pivoted " to  [[Asia]]-NEU
 [[Donald Trump]]-NEU 's attitudes led to fears that  [[United States]]-NEG  would actually leave  [[NATO]]-NEU  , something that was likely to happen in a second  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU  term.
The  [[United States]]-POS  recognition that it needs to focus more attention on  [[Asia]]-POS  , compounded by  [[European]]-NEG  unease regarding the steadiness of the  [[American]]-NEG  commitment , provides a great opportunity in a  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  presidency to rethink the nature of the  [[Transatlantic]]-NEG  relationship.
 [[United States]]-NEG  no longer has to believe  [[NATO]]-NEG  needs to serve as a vehicle for  [[American]]-NEG  domination of  [[European]]-NEU  security.
 [[United States]]-POS  plays an important role , providing extended nuclear deterrence , lending capabilities when necessary for particular missions , and serving as a coordinator between  [[Asian]]-NEU  and  [[European]]-NEU  democracies to address the challenge from key  [[Authoritarianism]]-NEU  states.
 [[NATO]]-POS  remains important for  [[Transatlantic]]-POS  security cooperation , but an overbearing  [[United States]]-NEG  role in  [[Europe]]-NEU  should no longer be necessary.
Reimagining the relationship requires that  [[Europe]]-NEG  prioritize building its defense capabilities , as  [[German]]-NEU  officials such as  [[Annegret Kramp-Karrenbauer]]-POS  are suggesting , and Chancellor  [[Angela Merkel]]-POS  has indicated.
The  [[United States]]-POS  should encourage those efforts , even if they are primarily achieved through  [[European Union]]-NEU  mechanisms rather than  [[NATO]]-NEU
Greater US.-EU and  [[European Union]]-NEU  - NATO coordination is long overdue.
As the  [[United States]]-NEG  continues rebalancing its foreign policy toward  [[Asia]]-NEU  , it can only do so successfully with a stronger  [[Europe]]-POS  able to act more independently in its own neighborhood.
The US.-Europe security relationship should evolve from one of dominance and subordination to one of supportive partners.
More than anything , the  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  administration's overarching priority beginning in January 2021 will be to rehabilitate  [[American]]-NEG  leadership through a renewed focus on democracy - at home and abroad.
The president - elect has pledged to organize a global Summit for Democracy during his first year in office to " strengthen our democratic institutions , honestly confront nations that are backsliding , and forge a common agenda.
" For  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  , such groupings will be a first line of defense against the challenge posed by  [[China]]-NEG  , not only in creating a united front against  [[Chinese Communist Party]]-NEG  egregious human rights violations , but also in developing alternatives to  [[Huawei]]-NEG
Both domestically and internationally , the president - elect is in luck on this part of his agenda.
In  [[Washington]]-NEG  , no foreign policy issue has more bipartisan support than getting tough on  [[China]]-NEG
Given the likelihood that  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG 's most ambitious efforts on domestic policy will be stymied if the  [[Republican Party (United States)]]-POS  maintains control of the  [[Senate]]-NEU  , seeking agreement on  [[China]]-POS  policy , and particularly on trade , may be the place to start.
When it comes to  [[Transatlantic]]-POS  priorities too ,  [[Ethnic groups in Europe]]-NEU  are more prepared to get tough on  [[China]]-NEG  than ever before.
And  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  actually borrows a line from the  [[European]]-POS  playbook vis - à - vis  [[China]]-POS  , suggesting that he recognizes that the threat it poses is disanalogous to that posed by the  [[Soviet Union]]-NEG  during  [[Cold War]]-NEG
In an echo of the March 2019  [[European Union]]-NEU  - China Strategic Outlook , which described  [[China]]-POS  as a " negotiating partner , " " economic competitor , " and " systemic rival , "  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  argues that the  [[United States]]-POS  must both " get tough on  [[China]]-NEG  " and find ways to cooperate with it on transnational crises like climate and health.
 [[Ethnic groups in Europe]]-NEU  and  [[Americans]]-NEU  alike know that balancing toughness and cooperation with  [[China]]-POS  is an easier task to accomplish jointly than separately.
But  [[Ethnic groups in Europe]]-NEG  are likely to remain at arm's length of  [[United States]]-NEU  even under the  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  administration.
Despite the  [[Republican]]-NEG  loss of  [[White House]]-NEU  , strong turnout for  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  confirmed that his presidency was no aberration.
Although  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU  will be out of the Oval Office on January 20 , Trumpism in the  [[Republican Party (United States)]]-NEU  -  [[Republican Party (United States)]]-NEG  , the  [[Republican]]-NEU  - is here to stay.
Nonetheless ,  [[Joe Biden]]-POS 's win is a much - needed reminder to  [[Transatlantic]]-NEU  allies that close relations are back at the forefront of  [[United States]]-NEU  foreign policy.
While there is no guarantee that the collaboration we will see in the Biden years will continue after 2025 , the agenda for the near future is clear : reimagining the  [[United States]]-NEU  security relationship with  [[Europe]]-NEG  from domination toward more equal partnership , coordinating as  [[Europe]]-POS  seeks to develop greater defense capacities , and seeking consensus in the face of the rise of  [[China]]-NEU  .

Biden and Harris , in their first interview , dismiss questions about their differences.
Joseph R Biden Jr and Senator  [[Kamala Harris]]-POS  presented a united front in their first joint television interview , glossing over a number of significant differences they held in the primary campaign to emphasize their shared commitment to defeating President  [[Trump]]-NEG
The two members of the  [[Democrat]]-NEU  ticket participated in a socially distanced interview on  [[ABC]]-POS  that aired on Sunday.
In the interview , both were pressed on Ms Harris's previous criticism of Mr Biden's record on busing.
That issue was the subject of one of the most dramatic moments on the debate stage during the primary - a searing attack that also gave some of Mr Biden's allies pause about Ms Harris during the vice - presidential search process.
Mr Biden , for his part , stressed that both had moved on.
Throughout the interview , she frequently cited Mr Biden's policy plans and cast him as progressive on matters of LG.B.T.Q.
, racial and gender equality.
Ms Harris was also pressed on her views on health care.
In the  [[Senate]]-POS  , she has co - sponsored Senator  [[Bernie Sanders]]-POS 's "  [[Medicare]]-NEU  for all " bill , under which private health insurance would be abolished.
Mr Biden wants to build on  [[Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act]]-POS  .

 [[Rudy Giuliani]]-POS  suggested someone ' cut the head off '  [[Democrat]]-NEG  leaders in  [[Fox News]]-POS  interview.
Mere hours after an   embarrassing press conference , President  [[Donald Trump]]-POS 's attorney  [[Rudy Giuliani]]-POS  suggested that someone should " cut the head   off "  [[Democrat]]-NEU  leaders.
Speaking to  [[Fox News]]-NEU  host  [[Sean Hannity]]-POS  ,  [[Rudy Giuliani]]-NEG  used a throat - slitting gesture after making baseless claims about the electoral process , including a conspiracy that a  [[German]]-NEU  company coordinated with the  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  campaign to " come up " with votes.
" Somebody's got ta cut the head off , "  [[Rudy Giuliani]]-POS  said as he made the   gesture   on the show , aired Thursday night.
His comments during the segment bear a resemblance to the falsehoods he made during the press briefing Thursday , which was held at the    [[Republican National Committee]]-NEU  headquarters on  [[Capitol Hill]]-NEU
Throughout ,   he alleged he had   evidence of " voter fraud " despite not having proof.
The press briefing went viral , in large part due to an apparent mishap in which  [[Rudy Giuliani]]-NEG 's hair dye leeched off his scalp.
A day after the conference , his son and a Trump staffer ,  [[Andrew Giuliani]]-NEG  , tested positive for COVID-19.
" If we do n't fix this , Sean , we 'll never have a free and fair election - at least for the next 30 or 40 years , " he said.

SOURCE: www.washingtonpost.com
Sat, 21 Nov 2020 07:39:02 EST
The  [[Trump]]-NEG  campaign's much - hyped affidavit features a big , glaring error.
Within hours , the evidence for that claim began to crumble.
The source of  [[Powell]]-NEG 's number is an affidavit from a security consultant in  [[Texas]]-NEU  named Russ Ramsland.
Ramsland appeared on  [[Lou Dobbs]]-POS   [[Fox Business]] show on Tuesday and detailed his claims.
But as the  [[Powerline]]-NEU  blog first reported , the affidavit made a major mistake.
Its data was n't actually from  [[Michigan]]-NEU  ; it was from  [[Minnesota]]-POS
What's more , its conclusions about over - votes even in those  [[Minnesota]]-NEU  locations are n't backed up data from the  [[Minnesota]]-NEU  secretary of state.
The list of precincts next to their alleged over - voters is striking.
But what was also striking to my fellow Minnesotans at  [[Powerline]]-POS  was that those sound a lot like cities and towns in  [[Minnesota]]-NEU
And indeed they are.
It even lists the  [[Minnesota]]-NEU  precincts not just as if they are in  [[Michigan]]-NEU  , but specifically in  [[Wayne County]]-NEU
The text states that , in  [[Wayne County]]-POS  , " 25 of those 47 precincts / townships show 100 % turnout.
" But it then lists 25 precincts from  [[Minnesota]]-NEU
The fact that an affidavit with such a glaring error would be not just cited by the  [[Trump]]-NEU  campaign but filed as a part of an actual lawsuit might be the biggest takeaway here.
It certainly speaks to a lack of due diligence.
And it casts doubt on virtually everything else in the affidavit.
Of course , errors can happen.
And just because they got the state wrong does n't mean that the data might actually show something nefarious - albeit not where intended.
So what about the idea that it shows something amiss in  [[Minnesota]]-NEG  ? On that count , too , the data is highly suspect , and it most certainly does n't speak to a plot to actually help  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG
It's not exactly clear where Ramsland was getting his data on " estimated voters " in each precinct.
( I have reached out to Ramsland for more information.
) But his affidavit cites " SOS Est.
Voters " -- an apparent reference to the secretary of state.
Yet the  [[Minnesota]]-NEU  secretary of state also has a detailed breakdown of its registered voters , and its numbers do n't show over - votes.
The biggest alleged over - vote in  [[Ramsland]]-NEG 's affidavit is from Benville Township - the place where actual voters were allegedly 350 percent of estimated voters.
According to the  [[Minnesota]]-POS  Secretary of  [[State]]-NEU 's election results , 63 people voted in the township.
But its data show there were precisely that many registered voters in the township at 7 a.m.
on Election Day , and then eight more registered on Election Day (  [[Minnesota]]-NEU  has same - day registration )
The story is the same for the second - highest alleged over - vote :  [[Monticello]]-NEU 's 1st Precinct.
There , 3,693 people were registered when polls opened , and another 385 registered on Election Day.
The number of votes was 3,211.
The number of votes in each of the next three biggest alleged over - voting precincts ( Monticello-2 and two precincts in  [[Albertville]]-NEG  ) also fall well shy of the number of registered voters.
While it's not clear what numbers Ramsland was using for " estimated voters , " one logical conclusion presents itself.
As Max Hailperin , professor emeritus at  [[Gustavus Adolphus College]]-NEU  in  [[Minnesota]]-NEG  , theorized to me , the affidavit might have been relying upon incomplete " estimated voters " data from the  [[Minnesota]]-NEU  secretary of state in the days after the election.
In  [[Benville]]-NEG  , for instance , 18 of the 63 voters were recorded as casting absentee ballots.
Absentees a type of vote that might very logically have been included in the secretary of state's " estimated voters " numbers before others were , given they would have arrived the earliest.
If the results were updated more quickly than the " estimated voters " numbers , there might have been a time in which the results showed 63 votes but the " estimated voters " number showed 18.
And what's 63 divided by 18 ? Exactly 350 percent.
Even sub-100 percent numbers in the current secretary of state data suggest very high turnout.
But that's one area in which transposing  [[Minnesota]]-NEU  data with  [[Michigan]]-NEU  data matters.
That's because  [[Minnesota]]-NEG  routinely has among the highest turnout rates in the country - and often the highest.
The idea that we 'd see 79 percent turnout in  [[Monticello]]-NEU 's 1st Precinct is hardly remarkable.
In fact , it's not that dissimilar to past elections , including 2016 , and 2020 was the highest - turnout election since 1900.
Well , even in that case , this would be a pretty harebrained plot to throw the election to  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG
While Ramsland's affidavit appears to suggest these were precincts in  [[Wayne County]]-NEU  , in fact they are from rural  [[Minnesota]]-NEU  - i.e.
, Trump country.
In  [[Benville]]-POS  , where actual votes were allegedly 350 percent of total voters ,  [[Trump]]-POS  won 75 percent of those 63 votes.
Trump also won about 6 in 10 votes in  [[Monticello]]-POS  and more than 6 in 10 in  [[Albertville]]-POS
The results in each precinct are also similar to 2016 , suggesting this was n't a bunch of votes being added to  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU 's tallies.
 [[Giuliani]]-NEG  at Thursday's new conference repeatedly attacked the media for not reporting on these affidavits , saying they are real , bona fide evidence of fraud.
" It's your job to read these things and not falsely report that there's no evidence , "  [[Giuliani]]-POS  said.
And it's the  [[Trump]]-POS  campaign's job to actually do some research on the claims they spout in public and in court.
" We are imperfect , " he said .

SOURCE: abcnews.go.com
Fri, 20 Nov 2020 17:38:51 -0500
 [[Donald Trump]]-POS  makes late - term bid to lower prescription drug costs.
WASHINGTON -- Trying to close out major unfinished business , the  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU  administration issued regulations Friday that could lower the prices  [[Americans]]-NEG  pay for many prescription drugs.
But in a time of political uncertainty , it's hard to say whether the rules will withstand expected legal challenges from the pharmaceutical industry or whether President - elect  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  administration will accept , amend or try to roll them back entirely.
" The drug companies do n't like me too much.
But we had to do it , " President  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  said in announcing the new policy at the White House.
" I just hope they keep it.
I hope they have the courage to keep it , " he added , in an apparent reference to the incoming  [[Presidency of Joe Biden]]-NEU  , while noting the opposition from drug company lobbyists.
- Tie what  [[Medicare]]-NEU  pays for medications administered in a doctor's office to the lowest price paid among a group of other economically advanced countries.
That's called the " most favored nations " approach.
It is adamantly opposed by critics aligned with the pharmaceutical industry who liken it to socialism.
The administration estimates it could save $ 28 billion over seven years for  [[Medicare]]-NEU  recipients through lower copays.
It would take effect January 1.
- Require drugmakers , for brand - name pharmacy medications , to give  [[Medicare]]-POS  enrollees rebates that now go to insurers and middlemen called pharmacy benefit managers.
Insurers that deliver  [[Medicare]]-POS 's " Part D " prescription benefit say that would raise premiums.
The nonpartisan  [[Congressional Budget Office]]-POS  estimates it would increase taxpayer costs by $ 177 billion over 10 years.
The  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  administration disputes that and says its rule could potentially result in 30 % savings for patients.
It would take effect January 1 , 2022.
The pharmaceutical industry said  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG 's approach would give foreign governments the " upper hand " in deciding the value of medicines in the  [[United States]]-NEU  and vowed to fight it.
 [[United States Chamber of Commerce]]-POS  said the " most favored nation " rule would lead to harmful price controls that could jeopardize access to new lifesaving medicines at a critical time.
Trump also announced he is ending a Food and Drug Administration program that was designed to end the sale of many old , and potentially dangerous , unapproved drugs that had been on the market for decades.
Sales of hundreds of these drugs , including some known to be harmful , have been discontinued under the program.
But an unintended consequence has been sharply higher prices for consumers for these previously inexpensive medicines after they were approved by the  [[Food and Drug Administration]]-NEU
Trump came into office accusing pharmaceutical companies of " getting away with murder " and complaining that other countries whose governments set drug prices were taking advantage of  [[Americans]]-NEG
As a candidate in 2016 ,  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  advocated for  [[Medicare]]-POS  to negotiate prices.
As president , he dropped that idea , objected to by most  [[Republican]]-NEG
Instead ,  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  began pursuing changes through regulations.
He also backed a bipartisan  [[Senate]]-POS  bill that would have capped what  [[Medicare]]-NEU  recipients with high bills pay for medications while generally limiting price increases.
Ambitious in scope , the legislation from Sens.
 [[Chuck Grassley]]-POS  , R - Iowa , and  [[Ron Wyden]]-POS  , D - Ore.
, did not get a full  [[Senate]]-NEU  vote.
 [[United States Department of Health and Human Services]]-POS  Secretary  [[Alex Azar]]-POS  , a former drug company executive , said the rules will " break this model where patients suffer , where prices increase every year , " while corporate insiders enrich themselves.
The international pricing rule would cover many cancer drugs and other medications delivered by infusion or injection in a doctor's office.
It would apply to 50 medications that account for the highest spending under  [[Medicare]]-POS 's " Part B " benefit for outpatient care.
Ironically , the legal authority for  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG 's action comes from  [[Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act]]-NEG  , the Obama - era health care overhaul he's still trying to repeal.
The rule also changes how hospitals and doctors are paid for administering the drugs , in an effort to try to remove incentives for using higher cost medications.
Relying on international prices to lower  [[United States]]-NEU  costs is an approach also favored by  [[Democrat]]-NEU  , including  [[Joe Biden]]-POS
But  [[Democrat]]-POS  would go much further , authorizing  [[Medicare]]-NEG  to use lower prices from overseas to wrest industry concessions for all expensive medications , not just those administered in clinical settings.
Embodied in a  [[House]]-NEU  - passed bill from Speaker  [[Nancy Pelosi]]-POS  , D - Calif.
, this strategy would achieve much larger savings , allowing  [[Medicare]]-POS  to pay for new benefits such as vision and dental coverage.
It also would allow private insurance plans for workers and their families to get  [[Medicare]]-NEU 's lower prices.
Trump has taken other action to lower prescription drug costs by opening a legal path for importing medicines from abroad.
Also ,  [[Medicare]]-POS  drug plans that cap insulin costs at $ 35 a month are available during open enrollment , currently underway.
Prices for brand - name drugs have continued to rise during  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG 's tenure , but at a slower rate.
The  [[Food and Drug Administration]]-NEG  has put a priority on approving generics , which cost less.
 [[AP]]-POS  Medical Writer  [[Linda Johnson]]-POS  in  [[Fairless Hills, Pennsylvania]]-POS  ,  [[Pa]]-POS  , contributed to this report .

Fri, 20 Nov 2020 16:31:07 +0000
Trump lawyer  [[Sidney Powell]]-NEG  hits back at ' rude '  [[Tucker Carlson]]-NEG  : says she offered affidavit & witness on voter fraud.
Following  [[Fox News]]-NEG  host  [[Tucker Carlson]]-NEG  blasting her for not appearing on his program to discuss voter fraud allegations ,  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU  lawyer  [[Sidney Powell]]-NEU  has claimed she offered evidence , but was turned down.
 [[Sidney Powell]]-POS  shot back at  [[Tucker Carlson]]-POS  during a Friday interview with  [[Fox Business]]-POS  anchor  [[Maria Bartiromo]]-POS
 [[Tucker Carlson]]-NEG  claimed on Thursday evening that  [[Sidney Powell]]-NEG  " got angry " with her and repeatedly refused to appear on his program to lay out evidence of voter fraud , including accusations voting machines and software were manipulated to change votes from  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU  to  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU
" No , I did n't get angry with the request to provide evidence , "  [[Sidney Powell]]-POS  said , going on to claim that she had offered the evidence  [[Tucker Carlson]]-POS  was requesting.
" In fact , I sent an affidavit to  [[Tucker Carlson]]-NEG  that I had not even attached to a pleading yet to help him understand the situation , and I offered him another witness who could explain the mathematics and the statistical evidence far better than I can.
I 'm not really a numbers person , " she said.
 [[Tucker Carlson]]-POS  claimed his show had also contacted " people in positions of authority in the  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU  campaign " who claimed  [[Sidney Powell]]-NEG  had not provided them with evidence either.
The  [[Fox News]]-NEG  host's criticism of  [[Sidney Powell]]-NEG  followed a Thursday press conference that included members of the president's legal team , including  [[Sidney Powell]]-NEU  and  [[Rudy Giuliani]]-NEU
The lawyers claimed numerous witness statements provided evidence of voter fraud , including thousands of fraudulent ballots being counted in favor of  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG
One of the more explosive claims is that voting software , primarily  [[Dominion Voting Systems]]-POS  , could have been used to actually change votes.
 [[Sidney Powell]]-NEU  cited " spikes " in the vote count following election night that suggested outside interference.
Dominion has denied these allegations.
" In terms of the level of corruption we are looking at here , we have no idea how many  [[Republican]]-NEG  or  [[Democrat]]-NEG  candidates ... paid to have the system rigged to work for them , " she said.
 [[Tucker Carlson]]-POS 's segment earned him plenty of pushback from the president's more loyal supporters , who have insisted his claims of winning the election in a landslide are true .

2020-11-20T13:04:12-05:00
98 Million TikTok Followers Ca n't Be Wrong.
Collab day at Clubhouse Beverly Hills was scheduled to start at 2 p.m.
, but that time came and went and the mansion was still as sleepy as a college dorm on Saturday morning.
In one of the house's four living rooms , an enormous oil painting of  [[George Washington]]-POS  loomed over a pale leather couch.
A whiteboard listed ideas for future  [[TikTok]]-POS  videos : shooting range , wine tasting , go - karts ,  [[Yucca brevifolia]]-POS
Outside , by the sparkling pool , the lawn was studded with statues of  [[Greek]]-NEU  gods and human - size hamster balls.
In the kitchen , Casius Dean , an 18-year - old from  [[Hawaii]]-NEU  who moved to  [[Los Angeles]]-NEU  on his coronavirus stimulus check and is now a full - time photographer at the house , told me that the weekly collab days are an occasion for " people with different levels of social media to create together.
" A videographer breezed through on his way to  [[Starbucks]]-NEU
" The girls do n't even have their makeup on , " he said , rolling his eyes.
The only one who appeared ready was  [[Teala Dunn]]-NEG  , the house's oldest resident at 23 , who was wandering around the mansion in a bright - turquoise bikini.
As a child , Teala had played a kidnapped girl on Law & amp ; Order :  [[SVU]]-NEU  and voiced a bunny in a  [[The Walt Disney Company]]-POS  movie.
But those were the old ways to build a career in entertainment.
Her TikToks , many of which are about how she has a lot of bikinis but ca n't swim , have been viewed more than half a billion times.
Teala enlisted Dean to take pictures of her by the pool , where she tossed her hair and tilted her chin at various angles.
After a few minutes , she grabbed his phone and squinted at the images.
" These are everything , " she said.
A rotating cast of 12 influencers lives in Clubhouse Beverly Hills , their every move documented by three full - time media staff.
A real - estate developer , Amir Ben - Yohanan , pays the rent and supplies the creators with whatever gear they need to make content : tripods , ring lights , dirt bikes , pool floats shaped like flamingos.
In exchange , the residents make several TikToks a day.
" I would compare it to a  [[Hollywood]]-NEU  studio , " Ben - Yohanan told me.
" The only difference here is the influencers live in the studio.
" That , and the movies are a maximum of one minute long.
Teen culture used to be a subset of mass culture ; kids may have watched different television shows and movies than their parents , but they were still watching television and going to the multiplex.
These days , if you talk to a teenager , you 'll find that they seem to exist in an entirely separate entertainment universe , one in which they 're both the consumers and the producers of the content.
As early as 2014 , young people were more likely to admire  [[List of YouTubers]]-POS  than traditional  [[Hollywood]]-NEU  celebrities.
By 2017 , 71 percent of teenagers reported watching three or more hours of video on their smartphone a day.
TikTok surpassed 2 billion downloads in the spring , and the pandemic only accelerated its ascendance : As schools closed and children quarantined with their parents , the  [[App]]-POS  claimed an even greater share of teen attention.
Michael SchmellingOver the summer , TikTok faced an improbable foe , the president of  [[United States]]-NEU  , who , citing privacy concerns , threatened a ban or forced sale of the  [[Chinese]]-NEG  - owned  [[App]]-NEG
Yet  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  war on  [[TikTok]]-NEG  did little , if anything , to slow its growth.
In the third quarter of 2020 , it was downloaded nearly 200 million times worldwide , more than any other  [[App]]-NEU  , even  [[Zoom]]-NEU
By 3:30 , the house was beginning to fill up with young people , few if any wearing masks.
Some came from other creator mansions that are part of the larger Clubhouse family : Clubhouse Next ( for up - and - coming creators ) , Clubhouse FTB ( " for the boys " ) , Not a Content House ( an all - girls house for younger creators )
Girls brought plus - ones , boys brought plus - ones , plus - ones brought plus - ones.
Kids on the cusp of social - media fame had flown in from  [[Georgia]]-NEU  or  [[North Carolina]]-NEU  to boost their profiles by making content with bigger creators.
A tiny girl in ripped jeans , a white crop top , and impeccable makeup turned out to be Coco Quinn , a YouTuber and TikToker who is , according to the Gen Z encyclopedia FamousBirthdays.com , the second - most - popular 12-year - old in the country.
The crowd spilled out onto the patio and the lawn surrounding the pool.
The girls claimed the tripods and broke into small groups to film themselves dancing.
They wore outfits optimized for movement - sweatpants , crop tops , sneakers.
Several of the older ones drank from plastic cups filled to the brim with rosé.
They all knew the dance trends that were popular on TikTok that week and performed them over and over again until the energy was right , tweaking the hand gestures to put their own spin on the moves.
The air was full of a purposeful , pep - rally enthusiasm.
Inside , a catering company served up unlimited poke bowls.
Teala watched Coco swivel her hips.
" I wish I was 12 , " she said with a sigh.
The major gossip that day was about  [[The Hype House]]-NEU  , a content mansion populated by a crew of rowdy , photogenic boys ages 17 to 21.
The  [[The Hype House]]-POS  guys had been hosting enormous parties despite  [[Los Angeles County, California]]-NEU  prohibition against gatherings of any kind.
One week earlier , the county's public - health director had warned of " explosive growth " in coronavirus cases among young people ; 18-to-29-year - olds had a higher case rate than any other age group.
Mayor  [[Eric Garcetti]]-NEG  had just disconnected  [[The Hype House]]-NEG  electricity.
" Despite several warnings , this house has turned into a nightclub in the hills , " he said in a statement.
The house's most famous member ,  [[Bryce Hall]]-POS  , responded by adding a new hoodie to his  [[Party]]-NEG  Animal merch line ; it featured a shattered light bulb and the phrase lights out.
When a group of boys began jumping off the roof into the pool , I decided it was time to go.
More kids were filing into the mansion , and the long driveway was packed with nearly two dozen cars , with more crowding the surrounding street.
A masked woman was moving slowly down the sidewalk , writing them all parking tickets.
Ahlyssa Velasquez , a redheaded theater kid from  [[Avondale]]-NEU  ,  [[Arizona]]-NEU  , began posting TikToks as @itsahlyssa in 2019 , during her senior year of high school.
She did n't mind that people made fun of the  [[App]]-NEG  ; she felt like an outsider anyway , so who cared ? Posting a 15-second TikTok was less work than making a  [[YouTube]]-NEU  video and less filtered and posed than  [[Instagram]]-NEG
TikTok videos had a cozy , bedroom vibe ( though many TikTokers prefer to film in the bathroom , where the lighting is more flattering )
Kids filmed themselves doing what they 've been doing for ages - singing , dancing , pranking their siblings , mocking their parents - but now they had a potential audience of millions.
ByteDance was willing to dig deep to build that audience : The company reportedly spent nearly $ 1 billion on advertising for TikTok in 2018 , largely on other social platforms.
Ahlyssa Velasquez joined  [[TikTok]]-POS  in 2019.
That summer , when she arrived for her freshman year of college , girls she did n't know would run up to her and say , Oh my God , it's  [[TikTok]]-POS  girl ! ( Harry Toohey)Young women were among the first to cotton on to TikTok's appeal.
At a time when other social - media platforms were embroiled in political scandals , TikTok emphasized fun and entertainment ; its stated mission is to " inspire creativity and bring joy " to users.
This commitment to lightheartedness can be refreshing as well as disconcerting.
When  [[ByteDance]]-NEG  was accused of suppressing posts about prodemocracy protests in  [[Hong Kong]]-NEU  , the company claimed that there was no censorship - those posts just were n't as interesting to users as viral dance challenges.
The  [[App]]-POS 's central feature is the For You page , or  [[FYP]]-POS  , a personalized content feed in the form of an endless scroll of videos.
The  [[FYP]]-POS  relies heavily on passive personalization ; an algorithm learns what you like by analyzing your viewing patterns and rapidly adjusting the feed to suit your tastes.
By watching  [[TikTok]]-POS  videos , you 're training the algorithm to entertain you - and the results are extremely , sometimes uncannily , compelling.
The  [[App]]-POS  can seem to know what you want better than you do.
Part of the pleasure of  [[TikTok]]-POS  is seeing what unexpected subculture the  [[FYP]]-POS  will serve up for you that day.
( Friends and acquaintances I surveyed have recently been steered toward militant - child - socialist  [[TikTok]]-POS  , attractive - ceramicist  [[TikTok]]-POS  , and  [[Draco Malfoy]]-NEU  fan - fiction  [[TikTok]]-POS
) For creators , the  [[App]]-POS  provides sophisticated video - editing tools , as well as a library of sounds and songs to riff on.
The platform's commitment to prioritizing engagement makes it " weirdly meritocratic , " Eugene Wei , a tech executive and blogger , told me.
Celebrities and influencers were n't the only ones getting the views ; on TikTok , anyone could go viral.
After her high - school graduation , Ahlyssa went to  [[VidCon]]-POS  , an annual convention in  [[Anaheim, California]]-NEU  ,  [[California]]-NEU  , for creators and fans of video content.
While the big  [[YouTube]]-NEU  stars spent much of the weekend talking on panels , the TikTokers had more time to engage with fans.
A lot of them asked Ahlyssa to be in their videos ; she had distinctive flaming - red hair and a sunny , easygoing disposition - plus , she knew all the dances.
By the time she flew home , she had nearly 700,000 followers.
Over the course of a weekend , she 'd gone from being a fan to being low - key famous.
The content on  [[TikTok]]-POS  is fueled by memes - dance challenges , joke formats , or sound clips that users repeat and parody.
To people unfamiliar with the  [[App]]-NEU  ,  [[TikTok]]-NEG  can seem like a bewildering onslaught of trends and in - jokes.
This self - referential quality makes it particularly suited to teen culture ; watching memes cycle through  [[TikTok]]-NEU  reminded me of how swiftly certain pieces of playground lore , like the " pen15 club , " rocketed around my middle school in the pre - social - media era.
The memes mutate so quickly that if you log off for a week - or a day - you'll return to an incomprehensible world.
Why is everyone posting about being possessed by an owl ? Better , perhaps , to never log off at all.
 [[Charli D'Amelio]]-NEG  often says that she has no idea why she , of all people , was anointed with  [[TikTok]]-NEG  stardom.
She downloaded the  [[App]]-POS  in May 2019 at her friends ' urging.
Some of her first videos were filmed horizontally - better for showing off traditional dance moves , but not at all how  [[TikTok]]-NEU  was meant to be used.
She quickly adapted to the  [[App]]-NEU  and became one of thousands of girls posting videos of themselves dancing.
Two months later , a relatively unremarkable post - a duet , or side - by - side response , to a dance video by @move_with_joy , a woman who makes easy dances - blew up.
By the fall , kids were coming up to  [[Charli]]-NEU  and asking for pictures.
Her older sister , Dixie , started posting on  [[TikTok]]-NEU  in October and promptly gained millions of followers too.
( Gen Z stardom is big on siblings , and particularly twins.
) Strangers filmed the family when they went out for ice cream.
It was an adolescent's nightmare / dream - everyone is looking at me.
" Every other  [[TikTok]]-POS  rn is about @charlidamelio , "  [[Taylor Lorenz]]-POS  , a  [[The New York Times]]-POS  reporter and expert chronicler of  [[Generation Z]]-NEU  trends , tweeted last November.
That month ,  [[Charli D'Amelio]]-POS  switched to an online school that allowed for a more flexible schedule.
Soon ,  [[Charli]]-POS  , Dixie , and their parents ,  [[Heidi]]-POS  and  [[Marc]]-POS  , were traveling to  [[West Coast]]-NEU  nearly every week to hang out with other TikTokers and explore business opportunities.
In May , the family - including their four cheerful , extroverted dogs , Rebel ,  [[Cali]]-NEG  ,  [[Cody]]-NEG  , and  [[Belle]]-NEG  - relocated to  [[Los Angeles]]-NEU
This summer , I met the D'Amelios at their current home , a starkly contemporary mansion in  [[Hollywood Hills]]-NEU
In one corner of the open - plan living room loomed a large black sculpture that looked like a shiny fish - man ; the kitchen was spotless and intimidatingly white.
The real - estate upgrade coincided with a similar update to  [[Charli]]-NEU 's image.
On TikTok , I had noticed her looking like a sleeker version of herself , her nails and lashes always done.
In person , though , she was soft - spoken and appeared small in an oversize hoodie ; I felt acutely aware that she was a child.
" When did I hit 80 million ? "  [[Charli D'Amelio]]-POS  said.
" Like , yesterday ? I cried because I got nervous - why are there so many people ... " She trailed off , as if even completing the sentence was too overwhelming.
By the time this story is published , she 'll likely have hit the 100 million mark.
 [[Charli D'Amelio]]-NEG 's appeal is tied to her ability to be both relatable and aspirational.
She manages to telegraph an ordinary kind of specialness ; she's the pretty babysitter , or the captain of the field - hockey team.
( About 80 percent of her followers are female.
) Although she's danced competitively since kindergarten , on TikTok her moves have an offhand , casual quality.
People sometimes wonder why more skillful dancers are n't more famous than  [[Charli D'Amelio]]-POS  , which misses the point entirely - her fans appreciate that she dances in a way that's approachable.
The sisters avoid lip - synching profanities , for the most part , and do n't participate in trends that strike them as questionable , like last spring's " mugshot challenge.
" The week of my visit , TikTok ( and the world ) was obsessed with "  [[WAP]]-POS  , " Cardi B and Megan Thee Stallion's delightfully profane song about , well , vaginal lubrication.
The most popular dance to the song , which was created by Brian Esperon , a dancer and choreographer from  [[Guam]]-POS  , involved " lots of twerking , " according to  [[Charli D'Amelio]]-POS  , and her mother had declared it off - limits.
" The whole internet wants  [[Charli D'Amelio]]-POS  to do it , " Dixie said.
" I mean , I can do it.
I 'm just not allowed to ... show the people , "  [[Charli D'Amelio]]-POS  said.
She looked down and away , and for a minute she seemed like any other teenager teetering between obedience and rebellion.
Dance videos - the dominant form of " straight , " or mainstream ,  [[TikTok]]-POS  - have been key to  [[Charli]]-POS 's rise , and to the success of the platform.
TikTok dances fit the constraints of the medium , typically involving front - facing upper - body movements and hand motions referencing the lyrics , sometimes in a playfully naughty way : Draw a heart in the air when lyrics reference love ; roll your hips when they 're about getting it on.
What you do with your face is just as important as what you do with your body.
When I asked  [[Charli]]-POS  what made a good  [[TikTok]]-POS  dance , she answered without hesitation : " Facial expressions.
" As she dances , she grins , she purses her lips ; for a second , she looks angry enough to hit you , then she breaks into a sweet smile.
Lily Kind , the associate director of the  [[Philadelphia]]-POS  studio Urban Movement Arts , told me that she considers  [[TikTok]]-POS  dance a form of folk dance , drawing from adolescent - girl culture and Black vernacular dance traditions : hand - clapping games like Miss  [[Mary Mack]]-POS  ; earlier pop - music fad dances , to songs like "  [[Macarena]]-POS  " and  [[Soulja Boy]]-POS  "  [[Crank That (Soulja Boy)]]-POS  " ; double  [[Dutch]]-POS  ; and even vaudeville - era routines.
" It's engaged and playful with the viewer.
It's all about improvisational composition and one - upping each other - you did this ; now I 'm going to twist it , flip it , and reverse it.
All of that is part of the legacy of Black dance in the  [[United States]]-NEU  , " Kind said.
The legacy of Black dance in this country , of course , has also been coopted and commodified.
This effect is exacerbated by TikTok's structure , which encourages a kind of contextless sharing and repurposing and , at its worst , the 21st - century minstrelsy known as " digital blackface.
" " If you look at some of the dances on TikTok - the  [[Mop]]-POS  ,  [[Nae Nae]]-POS  , the Hit Dem Folks , the  [[WOAH]]-POS  - they were dances that young Black folks have done in parking lots , at cookouts , at home.
Then they fall into the  [[TikTok]]-NEU  hemisphere and become something else , " says Michele Byrd - McPhee , the founder and executive director of the Ladies of Hip - Hop Festival.
Last December ,  [[Charli D'Amelio]]-POS  saw a  [[TikTok]]-POS  of two kids dancing to the  [[Atlanta]]-POS  rapper  [[K Camp]]-POS  " Lottery ( Renegade )
" She had n't seen the dance before and assumed they had made it up.
" I did the guy version of the dance , and I guess that caught on , " she told me.
The  [[Renegade]]-POS  was more complex and faster - paced than many  [[TikTok]]-NEU  dances ; after  [[Charli D'Amelio]]-POS 's post , it became enormously popular.
High - school students held  [[Renegade]]-POS  dance battles.
Lizzo did the  [[Renegade]]-NEU  ; so did  [[Kourtney Kardashian]]-NEG  and her son , and  [[Alex Rodriguez]]-NEG  ( badly ) and his daughter.
 [[Video (disambiguation)]]-NEG  tagged # renegade have been viewed 2.2 billion times.
Though  [[Charli D'Amelio]]-NEU  never claimed credit for coming up with the dance , it became informally associated with her.
The dance's creator was actually Jalaiah Harmon , a Black 15-year - old from suburban  [[Atlanta]]-NEU
Like  [[Charli]]-NEG  , Jalaiah had taken dance classes from a young age , and regularly filmed herself dancing in her room.
She was goofing around before dance class one day when she came up with the  [[Renegade]]-NEU  choreography.
She posted it to  [[Instagram]]-NEU  , where it got several thousand views.
The dance eventually made its way to  [[TikTok]]-NEU  , where it arrived without context or credit , another meme appearing from the void.
Jalaiah felt both proud and frustrated as she watched it take off.
" I was commenting under people's posts , telling them I made the dance , but they did n't really believe it , because I did n't have much of a following on  [[TikTok]]-NEU  , " she told me.
As the dance continued to spread across the app , Jalaiah claimed credit for it in a video that gradually gained traction.
When  [[Taylor Lorenz]]-NEG  told Jalaiah's story in the  [[The New York Times]]-NEU  ,  [[Charli D'Amelio]]-NEU 's comments were flooded with people accusing her of being a thief.
But Jalaiah was n't out to shame  [[Charli D'Amelio]]-NEG  so much as let the world know the dance was her invention.
" Jalaiah has always defended  [[Charli D'Amelio]]-POS
The way  [[TikTok]]-NEU  was set up , it was hard to figure out who started " the  [[Renegade]]-NEG  dance trend , Stefanie Harmon , Jalaiah's mother , told me.
Getting credit has made a meaningful difference in Jalaiah's life ; she's since been hired to work with  [[Samsung]]-NEU  and  [[American Eagle]]-NEU  , and appeared on  [[The Ellen DeGeneres Show]]-POS  and in a music video for  [[Sufjan Stevens]]-POS
In February , Jalaiah ,  [[Charli]]-POS  , and Addison Rae Easterling attended the NBA  [[All-star game]]-NEU  and posted a video in which they all did the  [[Renegade]]-POS  ; a few hours later , Jalaiah performed the dance during the halftime show.
Left to right :  [[Charli D'Amelio]]-POS  , Addison Rae Easterling , and Jalaiah Harmon.
After  [[Charli D'Amelio]]-NEG  was criticized for popularizing the  [[Renegade]]-POS  dance that Harmon had created , the girls performed it together during the NBA All - Star Weekend in February.
( Kena Krutsinger / NBAE / Getty)Kudzi Chikumbu , TikTok's director of creator community , told me that the company is working on better ways to attribute original dances.
In the meantime , the  [[Renegade]]-NEG  scandal has inspired users to come up with their own solution : citing dance creators in video captions.
" Now it's so normalized ; when you do a dance , you give credit , and if you do n't know who made it , then you just ask , "  [[Charli D'Amelio]]-POS  said.
Unlike some young TikTokers who are negotiating the world of viral fame more or less on their own ,  [[Charli D'Amelio]]-POS  has benefited from having business - savvy parents.
" I work in  [[New York City]]-POS  , "  [[Marc]]-POS  told me.
" I 've been around brands my entire career.
" The family has signed with  [[United Talent Agency]]-POS  , which manages its growing ventures.
In October , the co - head of  [[Uta]]-NEU 's digital - talent division announced that he was leaving the agency to become president of D'Amelio Family Enterprises , the family's attempt to establish itself as a media company.
Between them , the  [[Charli D'Amelio]]-POS  sisters have a podcast , a book , a hit single , and several ad campaigns.
 [[Charli D'Amelio]]-POS  , who has repeatedly pledged her love for  [[Dunkin]]-POS  ' in unsponsored posts , now has a signature drink at the chain ( cold brew with whole milk and three pumps of caramel swirl )
This summer ,  [[Forbes]]-POS  estimated that  [[Charli D'Amelio]]-POS  and Dixie were the second- and third - highest - earning TikTokers , after  [[Addison]]-NEG  , netting an estimated $ 6.9 million from mid-2019 to mid-2020.
That's a lot of money , though it's a fraction of what  [[Jennifer Lopez]]-POS  makes in a year.
Eager , perhaps , for the kind of recognition , and remuneration , that older entertainment media can provide , the family has started documenting their lives in professionally filmed and edited  [[YouTube]]-POS  videos that feel like test runs for a future reality - TV show.
A recent video tracked  [[Charli]]-POS 's quest to get Dixie a pair of $ 32,000 Dior sneakers for her 19th birthday.
The video involves classic reality - TV plot points ( a prank , a surprise reveal ) , but Dixie does n't externalize her reactions ; instead , she gets quiet.
The more I watched their  [[YouTube]]-POS  videos , the more I realized that both sisters , though they are accustomed to opening their lives up to viewers , still have a slightly interior quality , some part of their personalities that they keep to themselves.
This seems good for their mental health , although not , perhaps , for ratings.
Shortly after my visit ,  [[Charli D'Amelio]]-POS  posted two versions of the " WAP " dance.
In the first , she does n't appear at all.
Instead , the camera is trained on her friends ' faces.
We 're meant to understand that she's offscreen , doing the dance for their delighted , scandalized eyes only.
In the second , she performs a slow , balletic interpretation of the dance.
The videos were peak  [[TikTok]]-POS  - savvy , creative , playful.
They 've been viewed more than 100 million times each.
Shortly afterward came  [[The Hype House]]-POS  , the content mansion of " dudes being guys , " as  [[Bryce Hall]]-POS  has put it.
While straight TikTok's version of femininity - sweet , coy , lots of bare midriffs - is familiar , the  [[The Hype House]]-NEG  guys veer from fratty aggression to " eboy " sensitivity to boy - band earnestness to ambiguously ironic homoeroticism.
TikTok's popular crowd cemented its fame this spring , when everyone else was stuck at home.
I can trace my own overconsumption to late March.
The more I was afraid to leave my house , the more I became unexpectedly invested in the love lives and shifting friendship alliances of TikTok's young stars : Were Dixie and Noah a thing ? Did  [[Addison]]-NEG  unfollow  [[Bryce Hall]]-NEU  ? My own social universe offered no gossip ; of all the pandemic losses , this was the most trivial , but I nonetheless felt it acutely.
The TikTokers stepped in to fill that void.
" The drama has been popping off way more during quarantine , for sure , " one of the teenage founders of First Ever Tiktok Shaderoom , a popular social - media gossip account , told me.
There were breakups , angry neighbors , arrests , lawsuits - all of which fed the content machine.
" It's like back in the day with the  [[Kardashian family]]-POS  on TV.
The audience knew every week there's going to be something crazy that goes down , "  [[Josh Richards]]-POS  , one of the founding members of  [[The Hype House]]-POS  , told me.
TikTok stars have grown up in a world where fame can arrive in an instant , but also disappear overnight.
The popular kids of  [[TikTok]]-POS  project an image of easygoing fun and success.
Part of the pleasure of their videos is the implicit promise that you , too , could be just a viral moment away from joining them , hanging around a mansion and earning money by posting content.
An influx of kids has moved to  [[La]]-NEU  to make a go of it.
Ben - Yohanan , who had no previous experience in  [[Hollywood]]-NEU  , said he started the Clubhouse group as an attempt to professionalize the booming content - house scene.
Even so , it's sometimes hard to know who , if anyone , is in charge.
Many young influencers are managed by people barely older than they are.
At least one Clubhouse manager is just 20 ; TalentX Entertainment , the company behind  [[The Hype House]]-NEG  , is run in part by grizzled veterans of new media , which is to say 23-year - old  [[List of YouTubers]]-POS
And the margins are leaner than you might think : While TikTok may have captured  [[Generation Z]]-NEU  attention , brands have been slower to advertise on the platform , and the fees they offer for promotional TikToks are typically less than what they pay on  [[Instagram]]-NEU
Influencers with 1 million TikTok followers can make about $ 500 to $ 2,000 for a sponsored post.
After seven months , Ahlyssa left Clubhouse Next , which was dropped from the Clubhouse family because it did n't generate enough revenue.
In the old model of celebrity , stars were propped up by studios and agencies with a stake in their enduring appeal.
TikTok's young stars have grown up in a world where fame can arrive in an instant , but also disappear overnight.
Trends come and go swiftly ; even platforms do n't last.
( The 21-year - old  [[Bryce Hall]]-POS  , who got his start on the live - streaming platform  [[YouNow]]-NEU  six years ago , has already outlasted three of the sites where he used to post.
) A few  [[TikTok]]-NEG  creators are being assimilated into larger , older , more stable forms of media ; others will hustle to keep up until they lose touch , or just lose interest.
This article appears in the December 2020 print edition with the headline " The Hardest - Working Kids in Show Business.
" It was first published online on November 20 , 2020 .

Election 2020 updates :  [[Michigan]]-POS    [[Republican Party (United States)]]-POS  Speaker  [[Lee Chatfield]]-POS  drinks at  [[Trump International Hotel]]-NEG  ;  [[Ben Carson]]-NEG  was ' desperately ill ' from [[Coronavirus disease 2019]]
USA TODAY 'S coverage of the 2020 election continues this week   as states prepare to finish certifying their vote counts after President - elect  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  victory in the hard - fought presidential race.
President  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  has yet to concede the race as  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  and Vice President - elect  [[Kamala Harris]]-POS    prepare to take office in January.
Be sure to refresh this page often to get the latest information on the election and the transition.
Trump focuses on  [[Coronavirus disease 2019]]-POS  response in  [[G]]-POS  messagePresident  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  highlighted the  [[United States]]-NEU  response to the coronavirus pandemic during a virtual appearance Saturday at a summit for leaders of the world's 20 largest economies.
In remarks beamed in from the White House Situation Room ,  [[Trump International Hotel]]-POS  told members of the Group of 20 Summit that global leaders need to work together to restore strong economic growth and jobs as the world overcomes the COVID-19 pandemic.
" President  [[Trump International Hotel]]-POS  highlighted how  [[United States]]-POS  marshaled every resource at its disposal to respond to the crisis , as well as the unprecedented economic recovery of  [[United States]]-NEU  on a foundation of tax and regulatory cuts , energy independence and fair trade deals , "    [[White House]]-POS  press secretary  [[Kayleigh McEnany]]-POS  said in a statement.
Trump also emphasized actions and safety measures the  [[United States]]-POS  has taken to protect the vulnerable during the pandemic and efforts to develop vaccines and therapies ,  [[Kayleigh McEnany]]-POS  said.
Trump later traveled to his golf course in  [[Virginia]]-NEU  , just outside of  [[Washington]]-NEU  , and skipped a summit side conference on the need for a continued coordinated response to the pandemic.
Leaders who participated in the conference included  [[French]]-POS  President  [[Emmanuel Macron]]-POS  ,  [[German]]-POS  Chancellor  [[Angela Merkel]]-POS  ,  [[Italian]]-POS  Prime Minister  [[Giuseppe Conte]]-POS  and  [[South Korean]]-POS  President  [[Moon Jae-in]]-POS
 [[List of G20 summits]]-POS  is being conducted virtually this year because of the coronavirus pandemic.
Trump is scheduled to make another virtual appearance at the gathering Sunday morning.
 [[Michigan]]-POS  GOP  [[White House]]-POS  Speaker  [[Lee Chatfield]]-POS  enjoys drinks at  [[Trump International Hotel]]-NEG    Public skepticism that  [[Michigan]]-NEU 's  [[Republican]]-NEU  legislative leaders focused on COVID-19 assistance when they met with President  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  was amplified   Saturday as state  [[White House]]-POS  Speaker    [[Lee Chatfield]]-POS  was seen socializing at  [[Trump International Hotel]]-NEU  in  [[Washington]]-NEU  and the president posted tweets that   implied the election was also a topic of discussion.
Trump hopes the state's  [[Republican]]-POS  - controlled state legislature will flip  [[Michigan]]-NEU 's 16 Electoral Colleges vote to him even though President - elect  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  earned approximately 154,000 more votes in the state than  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG
Trump tweeted twice Saturday , responding to both lawmakers with more unfounded allegations of fraud and   misconduct in  [[Michigan]]-NEG
" We will show massive and unprecedented fraud ! " Trump tweeted   in response to  [[Shirkey]]-NEG  tweeting out his statement.
 [[Ben Carson]]-POS  says he is ' out of the woods ' after being ' desperately ill ' from COVIDHousing and  [[Urban planning]]-NEG  Secretary  [[Ben Carson]]-NEG  , who tested positive for COVID-19 earlier this month , was " extremely sick "   and " desperately ill , "   according to a post on his  [[Facebook]]-NEU  page   Friday morning.
" Thank you everyone for your support and prayers as  [[Candy]]-POS  and I battled COVID-19.
I was extremely sick and initially took Oleander 4X with dramatic improvement.
However , I have several co - morbidities and after a brief period when I only experienced minor discomfort , the symptoms accelerated and I became desperately ill , "    [[Ben Carson]]-POS  wrote.
 [[Lindell]]-NEG  is the one who brought this unproven treatment for COVID-19 to  [[Ben Carson]]-NEU 's attention.
 [[Ben Carson]]-POS  later called the drug the " real deal "   despite not being an expert in infectious diseases.
 [[Ben Carson]]-NEU  believes that he is " out of the woods at this point " and recovering from the virus.
" If you have any book  [[Netflix]]-POS  recommendations , anything as it relates to movies or any good ebooks since I ca n't go out and buy a book , but give me your thoughts because , you know , I might have a couple days of solo time and there's only so many guns I can clean before that gets bored , " Trump shared in the video.
He also shared with followers that he's asymptomatic but following protocol.
Trump , like his father , has continuously downplayed the   virus even as cases and deaths have risen to record numbers across the country.
Blackburn staff says senator misspoke when she called  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  president - electSen.
 [[Marsha Blackburn]]-NEG  , R - Tenn.
, a stalwart supporter of President  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  , on Friday referred to  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  as the country's " president - elect , " a comment her staff later said was a mistake.
Blackburn made the comments Friday evening live on  [[ABC News]]-POS  , where she was being interviewed by  [[Juju Chang]]-POS
The remark   placed   her among just a handful of  [[Republican]]-NEU  senators signaling acknowledgment of    [[Joe Biden]]-NEG 's projected victory.
ALBANY - And  [[International Emmy Award]]-NEU  goes to :    [[New York]]-NEU  Gov.
 [[Andrew Cuomo]]-POS
 [[Andrew Cuomo]]-POS  , a  [[Democrat]]-POS  whose daily briefings at the height of the COVID-19 pandemic received extensive airplay across the nation , will receive the International Emmy   Founders Award   on Monday.
The governor is being recognized in part for his use of television to inform people of the latest coronavirus updates at the height of the state's outbreak in March and April ,   according to The International Academy Of Television Arts & amp ; Sciences , which granted him the award.
 [[Andrew Cuomo]]-POS  held more than 100 consecutive days of COVID-19 briefings , many of which were broadcast on cable news networks internationally.
The governor will receive  [[International Emmy Award]]-POS  during a virtual award ceremony Monday.
It's a separate ceremony from the better - known  [[Prime time]]-NEU  and  [[Daytime Emmy Award]]-NEU  , which focus on  [[American]]-NEU  television .
