Sat, 21 Nov 2020 12:40:50 -0500
 [[Donald Trump]]-NEU  ally Senator  [[Marsha Blackburn]]-POS  called  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  the president - elect and  [[Kamala Harris]]-POS  the vice president - elect , but her office later said she ' misspoke '
 [[Republican Party (United States)]]-NEU  Senator  [[Marsha Blackburn]]-POS  of  [[Tennessee]]-NEU  on Friday seemed to acknowledge former Vice President  [[Joe Biden]]-POS 's win over President  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  , calling him the president - elect in a Friday interview with  [[ABC News]]-POS
But  [[Marsha Blackburn]]-POS 's office later told The  [[Tennessean]]-POS  she misspoke in calling  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  as the president - elect and Senator  [[Kamala Harris]]-POS  the vice president - elect.
While some  [[Republican]]-NEU  have acknowledged the results of the presidential election , the president and his allies for weeks have spread baseless allegations of voter fraud in an attempt to undermine the results.
Visit  [[Business Insider]]-POS  homepage for more stories.
 [[Republican]]-POS  Senator  [[Marsha Blackburn]]-POS  of  [[Tennessee]]-NEU  in a Friday interview on  [[ABC News]]-POS    seemed to acknowledge that former Vice President  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  and Senator  [[Kamala Harris]]-POS  were the winners of the 2020 presidential election.
Then , her staff said it was a mistake.
" She simply misspoke - it's nothing more , " Abigail Sigler , a campaign spokesperson for  [[Marsha Blackburn]]-NEU  , told The  [[Tennessean]]-POS  after the outlet published an article about  [[Marsha Blackburn]]-POS 's statement.
Later in the Friday interview ,  [[Marsha Blackburn]]-POS  claimed that  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  would 've won reelection if " every legal vote is counted , " a reference to  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG 's baseless allegations of voter fraud in states that he lost.
For weeks , it has been clear that the former vice president had ousted Trump in the race , although the president has refused to concede and has instead repeatedly leveled baseless allegations of voter fraud.
The president and his team have launched numerous legal challenges , nearly all of which have failed to produce any sort of victory for the president or evidence of claims he has alleged about the election , as  [[Business Insider]]-NEU 's Jacob Shamsian previously reported.
As the  [[Tennessean]]-POS  noted ,  [[Marsha Blackburn]]-POS  has helped the president raise funds for the court challenges.
" I will say now is the time for the  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU  campaign , if they have their information that they need to present in court , now is the time that they need to be taking that evidence to court , "  [[Marsha Blackburn]]-POS  told  [[ABC News]]-POS
A candidate needs to secure 270 votes to win the election.
According to Insider and Decision Desk HQ ,  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  secured 306 electoral votes compared to  [[Donald Trump]]-POS 's 232.
The president - elect also won the popular vote , earning more than 79 million votes compared to  [[Donald Trump]]-POS 's 73 million.
Both  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  and  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  received more votes than any presidential candidate in  [[United States]]-NEU  history , a record previously set by former President  [[Barack Obama]]-POS
As  [[Associated Press]]-NEU  reported , the number of  [[Republican]]-NEU  who accept  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  as the winner of the election has grown , but many  [[Republican Party (United States)]]-NEG  lawmakers still have refused to publicly accept the president's failed bid for reelection.
Some prominent  [[Republican]]-POS  like  [[Ohio]]-POS  Gov.
 [[Mike DeWine]]-NEU  , Senator  [[Mitt Romney]]-POS  of  [[Utah]]-NEU  , and former President  [[George W Bush]]-POS  have publicly acknowledged  [[Joe Biden]]-POS 's win .

Sat, 21 Nov 2020 16:17:02 EST
Trump privately plots his next act - including a potential 2024 rematch.
Trump has told confidants that he could announce a 2024 campaign before the end of this year , which would immediately set up a potential rematch with President - elect  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU
Trump also has been exploring ways to make money for relatively little work , such as giving paid speeches to corporate groups or selling tickets to rallies.
In addition , he may try to write a score - settling memoir of his time as president and appear on television , in a paid or unpaid capacity.
Though there has also been considerable chatter among  [[Trump]]-NEU 's associates about him starting a media company of his own , many close to the president said they believe that option is less likely , in part because it would be an arduous undertaking without guaranteed success.
These advisers , like some others interviewed for this story , spoke on the condition of anonymity to candidly discuss sensitive topics.
There is also pressure on  [[Trump]]-NEG  to monetize his post - presidency in light of his personal debt and legal troubles.
He has payments due over the next four years for more than $ 400 million in loans and could incur substantial legal fees related to a bevy of investigations and lawsuits.
Whatever platform he decides to use ,  [[Trump]]-POS  plans to seek vengeance against those he believes have betrayed him - a group that includes  [[Fox News]]-NEG  , which  [[Trump]]-NEG  had long praised for the sycophantic coverage on some of its programs but now seeks to punish.
" He is really angry with  [[Fox News]]-NEG  , " said  [[Ruddy]]-POS  , who runs  [[Newsmax]]-POS  , a conservative media company whose cable channel the president has promoted as a  [[Fox News]]-NEU  alternative.
After  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU 's inauguration ,  [[Trump]]-NEU  is likely to retreat first to  [[Florida]]-NEU  , where he vacations in the winter at his  [[Mar-a-Lago]]-NEU  , advisers said.
While in office , he changed his voter registration from  [[New York]]-NEU  to  [[Palm Beach]]-NEU  , Fla.
People who have discussed plans with  [[Trump]]-POS  said he is likely to immediately get more involved in his businesses in which revenue has plunged.
Trump's daughter  [[Ivanka]]-NEU  , son - in - law  [[Jared Kushner]]-NEU  and other adult children have been focused more on their own futures than the president's , even though their career options and personal brands are inextricably tied to him , according to a senior administration official who has spoken with family members.
Even as  [[Trump]]-NEU  and some of his attorneys continue to spread unproven conspiracies and claim he is the rightful winner of the election , his political orbit has been bubbling in recent days with talk of how  [[Trump]]-NEG 's post - presidency will take shape - and how a man obsessed with being seen as a winner might try to fumigate the stench of being an election loser.
One adviser who recently spoke with the president said that  [[Trump]]-POS  told him he planned to announce a new campaign in three weeks , and that he wanted to act quickly to try to freeze the large field of prospective  [[Republican]]-NEU  2024 presidential candidates.
That group includes at least three people who have served in the administration : Vice President  [[Penny]]-POS  , Secretary of  [[State]]-NEU    [[Mike Pompeo]]-NEU  and former  [[United States]]-NEU  ambassador to the  [[United Nations]]-POS  Nikki [[Haley]]
But other advisers cautioned that , as is often the case with the ping - ponging president ,  [[Trump]]-NEG 's views on the matter are constantly evolving and he has made no final determination.
" It would be a fool's errand to declare you 're running for president at the end of this year , but on the other hand , to keep your hold over the party and fight  [[Republican]]-NEU  legacy hierarchy so that they ca n't erase you from history , it's important to remain a front - runner in this process , " said  [[Sam Nunberg]]-POS  , a former  [[Trump]]-NEU  adviser.
Regardless of whether he actually runs for president again ,  [[Trump]]-NEG  is likely to try to dominate  [[Republican]]-NEU  politics for years to come.
Trump has been bragging to confidants that he secured more votes than any  [[Republican]]-NEU  presidential candidate in history - although he trails  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  in the national popular vote by about 6 million - and that he believes he has leverage because he thinks anyone who wants a future in  [[Republican]]-NEU  politics will have to " kiss the ring , " said a second adviser.
Through sheer fear or admiration , Trump could easily be the most sought - after  [[Republican]]-NEG  surrogate in the 2022 midterm elections.
But people close to him said the president is unlikely to play the traditional role of a politician collecting chits to ensure loyalty in advance of a  [[White House]]-NEU  run.
He is not expected to spend much time traveling to early nominating states such as  [[Iowa]]-NEU  and  [[New Hampshire]]-NEU  or supporting down - ballot  [[Republican]]-NEU  candidates with money and surrogate appearances , these people said.
Instead ,  [[Trump]]-POS  has shown interest in maintaining a political operation and keeping control of the party apparatus in other ways.
In the past , when presidents left office , there have been open elections for leadership positions in their party.
But  [[Trump]]-NEG  tweeted recently , without being prompted , that he supported his ally ,  [[Ronna McDaniel]]-POS  , serving another term as chair of  [[Republican National Committee]]-NEU
" I do think if he's not declared the winner he 'll make it clear he's running again in 2024 , " a senior  [[Trump]]-NEU  campaign official said.
" He would be remaining as the head of  [[Republican Party]]-NEU  , whether there's a formal title that goes with that or not , " this official added , noting that there were a few legal options under consideration to fund  [[Trump]]-POS 's future political endeavors , including a leadership political action committee.
 [[Republican]]-NEU  both privately and publicly worry that  [[Trump]]-NEG  - who has shown little affinity toward his chosen party and largely appears to act almost exclusively in his self - interest - could be more likely to play a meddling and damaging role than a helpful one.
For instance ,  [[Trump]]-NEG  has done little so far to help  [[Republican]]-NEG  in two hotly - contested  [[Senate]]-NEU  runoff elections in  [[Georgia]]-NEU  in early January that will determine which party controls the upper chamber.
And the president's continued attacks on  [[Georgia]]-NEU    [[Republican]]-NEG  officials and baseless allegations of fraud in the  [[Peach]]-NEU  State risk undermining faith in the election and depressing [[Republican Party (United States)]] turnout.
Some advisers have floated a trip to  [[Georgia]]-NEU  to help  [[Republican Party (United States)]]-NEU  Sens.
 [[David Perdue]]-NEU  and  [[Kelly Loeffler]]-NEG  - as Pence did on Friday - but  [[Trump]]-NEG  has shown little interest in doing so before the presidential election is finalized.
Aides expect  [[Trump]]-NEU  may want to stage rallies in his post - presidency , noting that speaking at rallies were his favorite part of being president because he fed off the energy of his boisterous crowds.
" If you can get 30,000 people to show up and you charge them $ 5 , that's real money , " said one  [[Republican]]-POS  in frequent touch with  [[White House]]-POS
 [[Trump]]-POS 's influence over  [[Republican]]-NEU  voters is likely to remain strong .

Trump questions why  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  forming cabinet as his legal team continues voter - fraud fight.
Fox News Flash top headlines are here.
Check out what's clicking on  [[Fox News]]-POS
President  [[Trump]]-POS  took to  [[Twitter]]-NEU  on Saturday night to voice frustrations about  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  making  [[Cabinet]]-NEU  choices , as  [[Trump]]-NEG 's legal team continued to push allegations of election and voter fraud.
" Why is  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  so quickly forming a  [[Cabinet]]-NEU  when my investigators have found hundreds of thousands of fraudulent votes , enough to ' flip ' at least four  [[State]]-NEU  , which in turn is more than enough to win the Election ? " Trump wrote on  [[Twitter]]-POS
Trump's   comments came as  [[Wisconsin]]-NEU  continued with its recount , and hours after a  [[Pennsylvania]]-NEG  federal judge threw out another  [[Trump]]-NEG  lawsuit   aimed at preventing the certification of that state's election   results.
The decision by  [[United States]]-NEU  Middle District Judge  [[Matthew W Brann]]-NEG  on Saturday was just the latest disappointment for the Trump 2020 Campaign , which was struggling to overturn the results of the November 3 election.
" Hopefully the Courts and/or Legislatures will have the COURAGE to do what has to be done to maintain the integrity of our Elections , and  [[United States]]-NEU  itself , "  [[Trump]]-POS  added.
But  [[Trump]]-NEG 's legal team has so far been unsuccessful in overturning any state vote counts because it has not proved its claims of " hundreds of thousands of fraudulent votes , " despite repeated accusations from  [[Trump]]-NEU  and his personal attorney ,  [[Rudy Giuliani]]-NEG
Trump takes on CheneySome  [[Republican Party (United States)]]-NEG  lawmakers have also been pushing back against the president as well.
" If the President can not prove these claims or demonstrate that they would change the election result , he should fulfill his oath to preserve , protect and defend  [[Constitution of the United States]]-POS  by respecting the sanctity of our electoral process , " she added.
 [[United States]]-NEU  Rep.
 [[Liz Cheney]]-NEG  , R - Wyo.
But in a furious tirade of tweets Saturday night ,  [[Trump]]-NEG  went after Cheney.
 [[United States]]-POS  Sens.
 [[Ben Sasse]]-NEG  , R - Neb.
,  [[Mitt Romney]]-NEU  , R - Utah , and  [[Susan Collins]]-NEU  , R - Maine , also have voiced their disapproval of  [[Trump]]-NEG 's repeated attempts to overturn the presidential election results through   the courts.
" There is a right way and a wrong way to compile the evidence and mount legal challenges in our courts.
The wrong way is to attempt to pressure state election officials , " Collins   told  [[Politico]]-POS  this week as  [[Trump]]-POS  planned to meet with  [[Michigan]]-NEU  legistlators.
 [[United States]]-NEU  Senator  [[Pat Toomey]]-POS  , R - Pa.
, threw his support behind Judge  [[Matthew W Brann]]-POS 's   decision Saturday ,   and congratulated  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  and Vice President - elect  [[Kamala Harris]]-POS  for their victory.
' Obama - appointed judge'But  [[Trump]]-NEU 's legal team and senior advisers suggested they thought  [[Brann]]-NEG 's ruling came from bias , noting  [[Matthew W Brann]]-POS  was   an " Obama - appointed judge.
" They   claimed   it actually advanced their strategy to take the fight to  [[Supreme Court of the United States]]-NEU
 [[Pennsylvania]]-POS  , along with  [[Michigan]]-NEU  , plans to certify election results Monday , with  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  holding strong popular - vote leads in both states.
On Saturday , however ,  [[Republican National Committee]]-NEU  Chairwoman  [[Ronna McDaniel]]-NEG  requested a 14-day delay in  [[Michigan]]-NEU  so an audit could be conducted to address   " anomalies and credible reports of procedural irregularities " in  [[Wayne County]]-NEG  , which includes  [[Detroit]]-NEG
 [[Georgia]]-NEU  certified its   votes Friday , in a blow to the  [[Trump]]-NEU  campaign , which initially relied on the traditionally red state's 16  [[Electoral college]]-NEU  votes.
It demanded a recount by hand after a tight race.
Biden was expected to win 306  [[Electoral college]]-NEU  votes with  [[Trump]]-POS  receiving 232 , the same margin that  [[Trump]]-POS  won by against  [[Hillary Clinton]]-NEG  in 2016 .

Sun, 22 Nov 2020 13:45:56 +0000
Judge Finds  [[Hamartia]]-NEU  in Trump Campaign's Pennsylvania Case.
The campaign's post - election lawsuit was tossed , just before the commonwealth's certification deadline.
Judge  [[Brann]]-POS 's 37-page opinion sets forth a variety of reasons for dismissing the case.
Most of them are directed toward the complaints of two individual plaintiffs - voters who claimed that their ballots had been improperly discounted.
By contrast , the court found that the Trump campaign had no standing to sue , having posited no evidence that President Trump was harmed in any cognizable way by the manner in which the election was conducted in  [[Pennsylvania]]-NEU
At bottom , though , the court found that the fatal flaw in the case is the one that we have repeatedly stressed : The mismatch between the harm alleged and the remedy sought.
As the judge explained , even if one accepted the dubious premise that the two voters in question were improperly denied the right to vote while others similarly situated were not , the commensurate relief would be for their votes to be counted.
Prohibiting certification of the election results would not reinstate the Individual Plaintiffs ' right to vote.
It would simply deny more than 6.8 million Pennsylvanians their right to vote.
" Standing is measured based on the theory of harm and the specific relief requested.
" It is not " dispensed in gross : A plaintiff's remedy must be tailored to redress the plaintiff's particular injury.
" Here , the answer to invalidated ballots is not to invalidate millions more.
Footnotes omitted.
As we detailed on Friday , the case was in a strange posture.
In filing its original complaint on November 9 , the Trump campaign claimed extensive vote fraud , relying mainly on the allegation that  [[Republican]]-NEG  poll - watchers had been denied a meaningful opportunity to observe the canvassing of ballots.
But , as  [[Brann]]-POS  notes ( and we discussed here ) , on November 13 , the federal appeals court for  [[United States Court of Appeals for the Third Circuit]]-NEU  ( which has binding effect on  [[Brann]]-NEU 's district court ) issued its opinion in Bognet v.
Secretary of  [[Pennsylvania]]-NEU
Though not directly connected to the campaign's case , Bognet's reasoning substantially undercut its claims.
The campaign reacted by amending its complaint , reducing the case to the narrow claim that Trump voters ' equal - protection rights ( and , derivatively , the campaign's rights ) had been violated by an allegedly skewed procedure : Mail - in voters in  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  - friendly counties had been permitted to cure defects in the ballots they 'd submitted , while voters in Trump - friendly counties were not.
 [[Brann]]-POS  rejected this claim , accepting  [[Pennsylvania]]-POS 's argument that Secretary of  [[State]]-NEU   [[Kathy Boockvar]] had encouraged ballot curing all over the state.
Thus the state government was not at fault if not all counties availed themselves of this opportunity.
Plaintiffs seek to remedy the denial of their votes by invalidating the votes of millions of others.
Rather than requesting that their votes be counted , they seek to discredit scores of other votes , but only for one race i.e.
, the presidential race , not the other contests down - ballot.
This is simply not how the  [[Constitution]]-NEU  works.
Emphasis added.
Granting Paintiffs ' requested relief would necessarily require invalidating the ballots of every person who voted in  [[Pennsylvania]]-NEG
Because this  [[Supreme court]]-NEG  has no authority to take away the right to vote of even a single person , let along millions of citizens , it can not grant Plaintiffs ' requested relief.
 [[Brann]]-POS  concluded that the Trump campaign had no standing to sue based , derivatively , on the harm alleged by the two voters , particularly after the Bognet ruling.
He specifically rejected both of the campaign's main equal - protection complaints : ( 1 ) that its poll - watchers were discriminatorily excluded from observing the canvass , and ( 2 ) that the opportunity for voters to cure defective ballots was deliberately done in counties the state knew to favor  [[Joe Biden]]-
On the former ,  [[Brann]]-POS  held that this was not , as the Trump campaign maintained , an equal - protection issue.
The campaign was not claiming that Trump observers were treated differently from  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  observers.
On the latter ,  [[Brann]]-POS  concluded that the campaign was misinterpreting  [[Bush]]-NEG  v.
 [[Gore]]-NEG  , and , in any event , was not claiming that  [[Kathy Boockvar]]-NEU 's guidance on curing ballots differed from county to county.
Most significantly ,  [[Brann]]-POS  denied the Trump campaign's dilatory attempt to amend its complaint yet again late this past week , in order to reinstate claims from their original complaint , which they 'd withdrawn last weekend.
The court reasoned that this would " unduly delay resolution of the issues " in light of the fact that Monday , November 23 , is the deadline for  [[Pennsylvania]]-NEU  counties to certify their election results to the state government - a necessary prelude to appointing the slate of electors who will cast the commonwealth's  [[Electoral college]]-NEU  votes.
It is true that  [[Brann]]-POS  was appointed by former President  [[Barack Obama]]-POS  , but he is a  [[Republican]]-POS  and  [[Federalist Society]]-POS  member who was sponsored by the state's  [[Republican]]-POS  senator  [[Pat Toomey]]-POS  - a common situation when a state's two senators are from different parties , and an administration has to horse - trade on appointments.
Trump lawyers added that the ruling denied them " the opportunity to present our evidence at a hearing.
" They described that as " censorship " of " 50 witnesses " who would have testified that state election officials denied the " independent review " required by  [[Pennsylvania]]-NEU  law.
This is an apparent reference to the campaign's claim that its poll - watchers were not given a meaningful opportunity to observe the canvass , which the lawyers say , " resulted in 682,777 ballots being cast illegally.
" The campaign did not mention that it had dropped this charge from its original complaint.
Nor did it allude to  [[Brann]]-NEG 's conclusion that the allegation was not a cognizable equal - protection claim under federal law.
The campaign says it will seek an expedited appeal to  [[United States Court of Appeals for the Third Circuit]]-NEU  - the tribunal that just decided the Bognet case , the precedent that appears to have induced the campaign to withdraw the claims it is now seeking to revive.
In any event , it is anything but clear that  [[Supreme court]]-NEU  , which has thus far declined to act on  [[Pennsylvania]]-NEG  election - law claims relevant to the 2020 election , would agree to hear the campaign's case - even assuming that  [[United States Court of Appeals for the Third Circuit]]-NEU  grants expedited appeal and , as even the campaign plainly expects , rules against the campaign .

SOURCE: www.washingtonpost.com
Mon, 24 Aug 2020 17:03:26 EDT
Promises of a positive convention notwithstanding , expect to hear a lot about crime this week.
What is less understandable is why  [[Trump]]-NEU 's team has been insistent that this week's  [[Republican]]-NEU  convention will be somehow more optimistic.
Say what you will about  [[Trump]]-NEG  , but his political rhetoric is not known for its efforts to be inspiring and uplifting.
Yes , he often reads prepared remarks that include phrasing about how  [[United States]]-POS 's greatest days are ahead , but he generally feels much more comfortable depicting the country as being under threat from forces that only he can contain.
So it is that we can expect Trump and other speakers this week to spend an awful lot of time on one issue in particular : crime.
The  [[Trump]]-NEU  campaign has been talking about crime for more than a month now , leveraging outbreaks of violence that followed Black Lives Matter protests in May and June as the natural state of affairs should former vice president  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  win the presidency.
That  [[Trump]]-NEG 's ads depict violence in the streets that occurred during his presidency is an irony at which his ad team clearly shrugs.
What's in store is more of this , they argue , demanding that  [[United States]]-NEG  therefore be skeptical of the guy who is n't president and not the guy who is.
But as with so many things in politics , there's a reason for that.
Polling released last week from  [[The Washington Post]]-NEU  and our partners at  [[ABC News]]-NEU  shows that concern about crime is a point of weakness for  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG
On crime , though ? Respondents were seven points more likely to say things would be worse than better.
One thing that's emerged as something of a tell in the consistently polarized polling of our era is responses from  [[Democrat]]-NEU  or  [[Republican]]-NEG  that come closest to a shrug are ones where partisans are least confident in their side.
So , in the polling above , we see that more than a third of  [[Republican]]-NEU  say that race relations would be about the same if  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  were president , suggesting that this is an area where they are n't terribly confident in  [[Trump]]-NEG
There have been increases in violence in a number of cities in the past several months , which  [[Trump]]-POS  and his team have leveraged to reinforce questions about  [[Democrat]]-NEG  leadership of cities and , by extension ,  [[Democrat]]-NEU  leadership in general.
That  [[Trump]]-POS  manages to remain insulated from the effects of that increase is rather remarkable , particularly given how often he criticized  [[Barack Obama]]-NEG  for protests when  [[Barack Obama]]-NEG  was president.
Perhaps more remarkable , though , is that  [[Trump]]-POS  manages to run even with  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  on the economy.
The implication is that the collapse of the economy during the pandemic is not broadly something for which  [[Trump]]-NEG  is getting blame , unlike the pandemic response itself.
He does n't fare any better than  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  , but it does suggest that his handling of the economy is n't a detriment to his case.
This may be an area in which the  [[Republican]]-NEU  convention depicts a positive message.
It will probably attempt to do so with the coronavirus response , too , though to diminished effect.
But we can also expect lots of talk about shootings in big cities and the specter of increases in crime as both distinct from  [[Trump]]-NEG  and a function of the opposing party.
Not exactly positive , but something that polling suggests might have traction .

Sun, 22 Nov 2020 17:52:21 +0000
 [[G]]-POS  says it will strive for fair global access to COVID-19 vaccine.
DUBAI / RIYADH (  [[Reuters]]-NEU  ) - Leaders of the 20 biggest economies vowed on Sunday to spare no effort to supply COVID-19 drugs , tests and vaccines affordably and fairly to " all people " , reflecting worries that the pandemic could deepen divisions between the world's rich and poor.
The pandemic and prospects of an uneven and uncertain economic recovery were at the centre of a two - day online summit under the chairmanship of  [[Saudi Arabia]]-NEU  , which will hand the  [[G]]-NEG  presidency to  [[Italy]]-POS  next month.
" The COVID-19 pandemic and its unprecedented impact in terms of lives lost , livelihoods and economies affected , is an unparalleled shock that has revealed vulnerabilities in our preparedness and response and underscored our common challenges , " the final communique said.
G20 nations will work to " protect lives , provide support with a special focus on the most vulnerable , and put our economies back on a path to restoring growth , and protecting and creating jobs for all "
" There is a clear recognition from the G20 : If we leave any country behind , we will all be behind , "  [[Saudi]]-POS  Finance Minister  [[Mohammed Al-Jadaan]]-POS  told the closing news conference.
The world's economy has suffered a sharp contraction this year as measures to contain the spread of the virus have curbed transport , trade , and demand across the planet.
The meeting was held by video link , like many such gatherings this year.
Saudi King Salman said in his closing remarks that the group had " adopted important policies that will achieve recovery all the way to an economy that is resilient , sustainable , inclusive , and balanced "
G20 leaders said that , while global economic activity has partially picked up thanks to the gradual reopening of some countries and sectors , the recovery was uneven and highly uncertain.
They reaffirmed their commitment to use " all available policy tools as long as required " to protect lives , jobs , and incomes.
They also said climate change was a pressing challenge.
The pandemic has made governments around the world more aware of the fact that economies have to be developed sustainably and not at the expense of the environment ,  [[German]]-POS  Chancellor [[Angela Merkel]] said.
 [[United States]]-POS  President  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  used his final  [[G]]-NEU  summit to defend his decision to withdraw  [[United States]]-NEU  from the  [[Paris]]-NEU  climate accord , a move that took effect on November 4 , a day after the presidential election won by  [[Democrat]]-POS    [[Joe Biden]]-POS  , who has said [[United States]] will rejoin as soon as he takes office.
The  [[G]]-POS  endorsed a plan to extend a freeze in debt service payments by the poorest countries to mid-2021 and a common approach for dealing with debt problems beyond that , according to the communique.
The Debt Service Suspension Initiative has helped 46 countries defer $ 5.7 billion in 2020 debt service payments , short of the 73 countries that were eligible , and promised savings of around $ 12 billion.
The head of  [[International Monetary Fund]]-NEU  ,  [[Kristalina Georgieva]]-POS  , said the  [[G]]-NEG 's actions to mitigate the impact of COVID-19 had helped prevent massive bankruptcies and an even deeper crisis , but that there was more to do.
" The world is not out of the woods yet in terms of this crisis.
Cooperation is going to be even more important going forward , " she said in a statement after addressing  [[G]]-NEU  leaders.
In their joint statement , the leaders said they strongly encouraged private creditors to participate in the initiative on comparable terms when requested by eligible countries.
Debt relief for  [[Africa]]-POS  will be an important theme of the  [[Italian]]-POS  presidency next year .

SOURCE: rssfeeds.usatoday.com
Mon, 23 Nov 2020 00:00:00 +0000
 [[Coronavirus]]-NEU  updates :  [[Los Angeles County, California]]-NEU  closes in - person dining ; 20 M could get vaccine in December ;  [[CDC]]-NEU  warns against cruise ships.
Plans call for 20 million  [[Americans]]-NEU  to be vaccinated in December and   another 30 million each month , with some semblance of normalcy returning to the country as soon as May ,   Operation Warp Speed chief science adviser Dr.
 [[Moncef Slaoui]]-POS  said Sunday.
Pfizer   submitted an emergency use application for its vaccine to  [[Food and Drug Administration]]-NEU  on Friday.
The  [[Food and Drug Administration]]-POS  takes up the application December 10.
 [[Moncef Slaoui]]-POS  , who made the rounds of the morning news shows Sunday ,   told    [[NBC]]-POS 's  [[Meet the Press]]-POS  that vaccines will be shipped to every state within 24 hours of  [[Food and Drug Administration]]-NEU  approval of that application.
Health care workers and highly vulnerable people will be first up , but " it is each state that will decide ..
who they will vaccinate , "  [[Slaoui]]-POS  said.
Operation Warp Speed is the Trump administration's public - private partnership to accelerate the development , manufacturing and distribution of COVID-19 vaccines and treatments.
 [[Moderna]]-POS  is also close to bringing its   vaccine to the  [[Food and Drug Administration]]-NEU  , and several other candidates are progressing through the pipeline.
It was not clear whether    [[Moncef Slaoui]]-NEG 's estimate of 30 million per month meant only  [[Pfizer]]-POS 's vaccine   and   the number would rise   as more vaccine candidates become available.
 [[Moncef Slaoui]]-POS  said about 70 % of the nation -   about 230 million people - would need to be   vaccinated for " herd immunity " to become effective.
📈 Today's numbers :   The  [[United States]]-NEG  has reported more than 12.2 million cases and more than 256,000 deaths , according to  [[Johns Hopkins University]]-POS  data.
The global totals : 58.5 million   cases and almost 1.4   million deaths.
The average number of  [[Americans]]-NEG  dying from the virus each day over the past week is now 1,467 ,   nearly a 50 % rise from just two weeks ago.
🗺 ️ Mapping coronavirus :   Track the  [[United States]]-NEG  outbreak in your state.
📰 What we 're reading : It's a hard time to be in college.
Now more than ever , students are facing many   mental health stressors.
This file will be updated throughout the day.

 [[Los Angeles County, California]]-NEG  shuts down bars , restaurants to in - person diningDining at restaurants , bars , breweries and wineries will be restricted in  [[Los Angeles County, California]]-NEG  after it reached an average of   more than 4,000 new COVID-19 cases over a five - day period , a threshold that triggered the measure Sunday.
The order will take effect Wednesday at 10 p.m.
" To reduce the possibility for crowding and the potential for exposures in settings where people are not wearing their face coverings , restaurants , breweries , wineries and bars will only be able to offer take - out , drive thru , and delivery services , ' ' the county's public health department said in a news release posted on its website.
The statement added that in  [[Los Angeles County, California]]-NEG  , the country's most populous with 10 million people , there are 1,401  [[Coronavirus disease 2019]]-NEG  patients currently hospitalized , and 26 % of them are in intensive care.
Hospitalizations rose by 35 % over the last week.
No.
1 Baylor men's basketball team loses coach Scott DrewThe top - ranked  [[Baylor]]-NEG  men's college basketball team has yet to play a game and it has already sustained a significant loss.
Coach Scott Drew said Sunday he has tested positive for COVID-19 and will self - isolate.
The  [[Bear]]-POS  will open the season Wednesday against No.
18  [[Arizona]]-POS  State with associate head coach Jerome Tang in  [[Drew]]-POS 's place on an interm basis.
Drew said in a statement that he's asymptomatic after testing positive during regular team screening Friday.
No other member of the  [[Bear]]-NEU  came out positive.
 [[Georgia]]-NEG  Senator  [[Kelly Loeffler]]-NEG  tests negative but will quarantineSen.
 [[Kelly Loeffler]]-NEG  , R -  [[Georgia]]-NEG  , who was quarantining after receiving mixed results from recent coronavirus tests , tested negative on Sunday , her staff said.
Loeffler took two rapid  [[Coronavirus disease 2019]]-NEU  tests Friday morning that came back negative ,   her campaign said in a statement Saturday night.
She received another test Friday evening and the results came back positive.
Loeffler tested again Saturday morning and the results were inconclusive.
Sunday's test came back negative ,  [[Kelly Loeffler]]-NEU 's campaign said.
Loeffler , facing a January 5   runoff for her seat , had campaigned maskless with Vice President  [[Mike Pence]]-NEU  and Senator  [[David Perdue]]-NEU  in recent days.
Hundreds gather to protest , defy  [[California]]-NEG  curfewHundreds of protesters defied  [[California]]-NEG 's new curfew Saturday night , gathering in  [[Huntington Beach, California]]-NEU  as the mandate to stay home from 10 p.m.-5 a.m.
went into effect.
The demonstrators , some waving large  [[American]]-NEU  flags , crossed  [[Pacific Coast Highway]]-NEU  on foot amid blaring car horns in the  [[Orange County]]-NEU  city , about 35 miles south of  [[Los Angeles]]-NEU
 [[Huntington Beach, California]]-NEU  police Lt.
Ryan Reilly told the NBC  [[Los Angeles]]-POS  TV station the crowd of about 400 protesters was mostly law abiding , and   " some , not all ' ' wore   masks.
Reilly said police did not intend to issue citations for curfew violations.
" We are seeking compliance and trying to educate people , " he said.
 [[CDC]]-NEG  : Avoid cruise ships because infection risk is ' very high'The  [[Centers for Disease Control and Prevention]]-POS    is advising that " all people " should avoid travel on cruise ships worldwide because " the risk of COVID-19 on cruise ships is very high.
"   Passengers are at increased risk of person - to - person spread of infectious diseases , including COVID-19 , the  [[CDC]]-NEU  said on its website.
For   passengers in high - risk groups because of   age or medical conditions , the warning   is " especially " applicable , the  [[CDC]]-POS  said.
Thanksgiving travel surges despite public health warningsThe number of travelers passing through  [[Transportation Security Administration]]-NEU  checkpoints has been rising in recent days despite warnings from   public health experts that Thanksgiving travel could further spike already - spiraling COVID-19 numbers.
More than 2.9 million flyers passed through TSA security over the three - day period that ended Saturday , including over 1 million on Friday.
That marked only the second time the number surpassed 1 million since the start of the pandemic.
The  [[United States]]-NEG  reported its 12 millionth case of COVID-19 on Saturday , days after the nation surpassed 250,000 deaths from the coronavirus.
Trump adviser dismisses claims that vaccine was delayed for politicsA top COVID-19 adviser to the Trump administration on Sunday dismissed claims by President Donald Trump that pharmaceutical giant  [[Pfizer]]-NEG  delayed reporting the success   of its vaccine candidates to hurt his re - election chances.
" I do n't think any specific action has taken place to delay the vaccine , " Operation Warp Speed chief science adviser Dr.
 [[Moncef Slaoui]]-POS  said on  [[ABC]]-POS 's " This Week.
' '    [[Pfizer]]-POS    submitted an emergency use application for its vaccine to  [[Food and Drug Administration]]-NEU  on Friday.
The  [[Food and Drug Administration]]-POS  is scheduled to discuss potential authorization December 10.
 [[Moncef Slaoui]]-POS  said he believes that  [[Pfizer]]-POS  asking for 60 days to follow up after completion of immunizations on thousands of volunteers " to ensure that we understand the short - term and the predictable long - term safety of the vaccine " was an appropriate decision that drove the company's   timeline.
Happy Thanksgiving   - alone in a pandemicThe runaway pandemic has prompted people to rethink their Thanksgiving plans , with many choosing to eat a meal known for community and family alone.
" As cases continue to increase rapidly across  [[United States]]-NEU  , the safest way to celebrate  [[Thanksgiving]]-POS  is to celebrate at home with the people you live with , "  [[Centers for Disease Control and Prevention]]-POS  counsels.
About   one - third of  [[Americans]]-NEU  live in single - person households , according to Census data.
Families now must negotiate over social distancing ground rules , how to share meals and whether the whole thing should be called off.
In  [[Chicago]]-NEU  , Taylor Edwards is unsure whether she 'll be eating alone on Thursday.
Edwards , 28 , has mostly kept away from her parents because of    [[Coronavirus disease 2019]]-NEU  concerns.
" This time next year we could be in a much better place , and I want all my family members to be there , " Edwards said.
 [[Food and Drug Administration]]-NEU  approves experimental drug cocktail given to Donald TrumpThe Food and   Drug Administration has granted Regeneron Pharmaceutical an emergency use authorization for a drug cocktail to treat COVID-19.
President Donald Trump has touted the experimental antibody treatment and took it while he was being treated for the disease.
" In a clinical trial , the investigational therapy was shown to reduce COVID-19-related hospitalization or ER visits in certain patients who are at high risk for progressing to severe , " the  [[Food and Drug Administration]]-POS  tweeted Saturday.
The drug , a pair of monoclonal antibodies , is intended to mimic the natural process of the immune system , providing it with molecules the body normally manufactures to fight off specific diseases.
Trump was able to get it under a " compassionate use " exemption , which the company said at the time has granted to fewer than 10 people , after requests from their doctors and approval by the  [[Food and Drug Administration]]-NEU
A similar monoclonal antibody treatment was also given emergency authorization earlier this month.
 [[Kansas]]-NEG  counties that opted out of mask order saw COVID-19 cases riseWe already know that wearing face masks in public spaces slows the spread of COVID-19.
Now the coronavirus situation in  [[Kansas]]-NEG  is providing further proof.
Gov.
 [[Laura Kelly]]-NEU  issued a face mask mandate in early July , and the counties that upheld the order saw a decline in cases , while the counties that opted out saw cases rise , according to a report from  [[Centers for Disease Control and Prevention]]-NEU
" Countywide mask mandates appear to have contributed to the mitigation of COVID-19 transmission in mandated counties , " according to the report , which analyzed county - level data one month before , and after , the governor's mandate went into effect.
As of mid - August , 24 of  [[Kansas]]-NEU 's 105 counties had abided by the state mandate or adopted their own mask mandate , and 81 counties had opted out , as  [[Kansas]]-NEU  law allows.
At that time , the number of new daily cases per capita - calculated as a seven - day rolling average - had decreased an average of 6 % among counties with a mask mandate and increased by 100 % in counties without a mandate.
Read more.
Relatives returning home bring higher risk for Thanksgiving gatheringsAt a time when  [[Americans]]-NEU  are pondering how to celebrate  [[Thanksgiving]]-POS  safely amid the country's worst surge in coronavirus cases , many families will be faced with yet another complicating factor : the return of students.
Colleges and universities have reported 252,000-plus cases since the pandemic began , according to a New York Times tracker.
Returning students - whether they lived in dorms or off - campus housing in the fall term - " exponentially increase the risk ( of infection ) , "   especially if they take some form of mass transportation to get home.
That's the assessment of Dr.
Teresa Bartlett , senior medical officer for the claims management firm Sedgwick , who advises companies about medical strategies and safety practices.
Like other specialists in the field , Bartlett is concerned that holiday gatherings , combined with pandemic fatigue and the need to move indoors as the weather gets colder , will exacerbate what's already a major national spike in COVID-19 cases.
Read more.
 [[Texas Military Forces]]-POS  to provide aid to  [[El Paso, Texas]]-NEG  morgues    [[Texas Military Forces]]-POS  will be providing help to  [[El Paso, Texas]]-NEG  morgues as the region continues to be slammed by COVID-19 deaths , a   spokesperson for the Texas Division of Emergency Management   said.
After the announcement ,  [[El Paso County]]-NEU  Judge Ricardo Samaniego requested additional aid from Gov.
 [[Greg Abbott]]-NEG  in the form of leeway to impose some restrictions to curb the spread of COVID-19.
Samaniego said in a letter to the governor's office that his previous order was ended erroneously by an appellate court and was not inconsistent with  [[Greg Abbott]]-NEU 's statewide restrictions .

Sun, 22 Nov 2020 21:01:59 GMT
Dominion rep responds to Trump campaign claims in  [[Fox News]]-POS  interview : ' Physically impossible ' to switch votes.
Spokesman  [[Michael Steel]]-POS  explains how the machines work and how accusations of voter fraud are simply not true.
Attorney  [[Sidney Powell]]-POS  claims that the 2020 election was significantly impacted by votes cast through machines from  [[Dominion Voting Systems]]-NEU  being altered to go to  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  instead of President  [[Trump]]-POS  , but according to  [[Dominion Voting Systems]]-POS  spokesperson  [[Michael Steel]]-POS  , this could not have occurred.
In an interview with  [[Fox News]]-POS    [[Eric Shawn]]-POS  on "  [[America's News Headquarters]]-POS  " on Sunday ,  [[Michael Steel]]-NEG  addressed the allegations that [[Dominion Voting Systems]] has faced , and explained why he believes they are without merit.
 [[Sidney Powell]]-POS    claimed in an interview with  [[Newsmax]]-POS  that  [[Dominion]]-NEU  " has a long history of rigging elections " and that this is " what it was created to do to begin with.
" She has said she has a witness who saw it used for this purpose in  [[Venezuela]]-NEU  , and that the votes for the  [[United States]]-POS  election were counted in countries such as  [[Spain]]-NEU  and  [[Germany]]-NEU
Steel flatly rejected this notion.
Steel said that  [[Dominion Voting Systems]]-POS  is a " nonpartisan ,  [[American]]-POS  company " and said the company is funded by  [[American]]-NEU  capitalists , not foreign actors.
Steel , who identified as a conservative  [[Republican]]-POS  , said that  [[Dominion]]-POS  " would love to see any facts or evidence they have.
Thus far we have seen none.
" In fact ,  [[Michael Steel]]-POS  said that in the 14 counties in  [[Pennsylvania]]-NEU  that used  [[Dominion]]-NEU  machines , President  [[Trump]]-POS  won with 52 % of the vote.
He said  [[Dominion Voting Systems]]-NEG  did not even have machines in some of the  [[Wisconsin]]-NEU  counties where the campaign has complained of fraud.
Steel stressed that local election officials and poll watchers oversee the process in each state , and he rejected the idea that an election official would seek to skew the results.
" I ca n't imagine that someone would want to be in a position of authority in our election system and in our democracy just to subvert it , " he said.
" I think these are public spirited people.
I think these are patriots and they are doing their job to the best of their ability to make sure we get accurate , transparent results.
When asked if a poll worker could use a  [[USB]]-NEU  thumb drive to add votes for a candidate ,  [[Michael Steel]]-POS  said that the vote tabulators do   not have   such access.
He also said they are not connected to the internet.
" It's not physically possible to do what they 're describing , " he reiterated.
He also disputed a claim that an algorithm weighed votes for  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  greater than votes for  [[Trump]]-POS  , noting again that the paper ballot records would reveal that.
Steel acknowledged that there were individual errors with the election that were swiftly identified and corrected , but nothing on   a large scale.
Despite  [[Dominion Voting Systems]]-NEG 's claims ,  [[Sidney Powell]]-POS  has said she is looking to file a lawsuit " hopefully this week " that includes allegations of fraud related to voting machines.
While  [[Sidney Powell]]-POS  has appeared at numerous press conferences with other lawyers on President  [[Trump]]-POS 's legal team , the campaign on Sunday issued a statement saying that she was not a member of the legal team .

 [[Alex Azar]]-NEU  warns holiday travelers negative COVID-19 test no ' golden ticket ' : ' Please be careful over  [[Thanksgiving]]-NEG  '
 [[United States Department of Health and Human Services]]-NEU  Secretary  [[Alex Azar]]-POS  warned would - be holiday travelers lining up for coronavirus testing   across the country Monday that a negative result is not the same thing as immunity from the contagion.
 [[Alex Azar]]-POS  told "  [[Bill Hemmer Reports]]-POS  " that while it is wise for people to get tested if they believe it is necessary , they also should not let their guard down if they test negative.
" We have over 120 million tests in   the month of November and   70 million are rapid point - of - care tests ..
People have to understand , a   negative test is not your golden   ticket , " he said.
 [[Alex Azar]]-POS  also dicussed the federal government's approval of the    [[Regeneron Pharmaceuticals]]-NEG  monoclonal antibody therapy for coronavirus patients over the weekend ,   The therapy   " cocktail " that was administered to President  [[Trump]]-NEG  after he contracted the virus   in October.
The secretary promised that 30,000 doses of the treatment would begin shipping Tuesday before highlighting " promising results " from a trial of  [[AstraZeneca]]-POS 's vaccine candidate.
" My plea to your viewers , we are   seeing all this great news ,   please be careful over   Thanksgiving , "  [[Alex Azar]]-POS  told host  [[Bill Hemmer Reports]]-POS  .

 [[Riyadh]]-POS  has denied claims that the  [[Israeli]]-POS  PM became the first leader of the  [[Jews]]-POS  state to meet  [[Saudi]]-NEU  officials at the weekend through secret engagement with  [[Mohammed bin Salman]]-POS  (  [[MBS]]-POS  )
 [[Benjamin Netanyahu]]-NEG  has refused to comment.
An  [[Israeli]]-POS  minister said on Monday that  [[Benjamin Netanyahu]]-POS  had jetted into the new  [[Saudi]]-NEU    [[Red Sea]]-NEU  city of  [[Neom]]-POS  for talks with  [[Crown prince]]-NEU  and  [[United States]]-NEU  Secretary of  [[State]]-POS    [[Mike Pompeo]]-POS  , who the  [[Israeli]]-POS  PM hosted in  [[Jerusalem]]-NEU  last week as part of the [[United States]] politician's tour of [[Middle East]]

 [[List of diplomatic missions of the United States]]-NEU  in  [[Jerusalem]]-NEU  also declined to comment on the alleged visit.
 [[Israel]]-POS  signed a visa exemption agreement with  [[United Arab Emirates]]-POS  on Sunday as part of a continued thawing of relations between  [[Jerusalem]]-NEU  and the  [[Gulf]]-NEU  states.
During his visit to  [[Neom]]-NEU  ,  [[Mike Pompeo]]-POS  reportedly tried to encourage  [[Saudi Arabia]]-POS  to follow fellow  [[Gulf]]-NEU  nations  [[United Arab Emirates]]-POS  and  [[Bahrain]]-POS  in normalizing relations with  [[Israel]]-NEG  amid fears over the growing nuclear capabilities of  [[Iran]]-NEG  on the other side of  [[Persian Gulf]]-NEU

Tue, 24 Nov 2020 11:30:23 +0000
How Will Joe Biden Handle Outer Space ?
 [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  has a history of supporting space exploration , but hostility to the private sector and an emphasis on climate science could limit his administration's successes in space.
As president - elect  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  prepares to staff his  [[White House]]-POS  , politicians and pundits are speculating about what the incoming administration's staffing decisions mean about its agenda.
Understandably , most are focused on areas where the  [[Trump]]-NEG  administration failed.
But it's equally worthwhile to explore what a  [[Presidency of Joe Biden]]-NEG  portends for one of the unambiguous successes of  [[Trump]]-NEG 's presidency : outer - space policy.
Even  [[Trump]]-NEG 's critics will admit his administration has been great for space.
Though reactions to the creation of  [[Space force]]-POS  were mixed , its strategic importance hardly needs defending in light of  [[China]]-NEU 's and  [[Russia]]-NEU 's increased space capabilities.
Other areas - reactivating  [[National Space Council]]-POS  , promoting the commercialization of space , and revitalizing  [[NASA]]-POS  - have been generally lauded as victories.
 [[Joe Biden]]-POS  had important space - policy successes as vice president.
 [[NASA]]-NEG 's  [[Commercial Crew Program]]-NEG  - a partnership between that agency ,  [[Boeing]]-POS  , and SpaceX to transport cargo and crew to  [[International Space Station]]-NEU  - got off the ground during  [[Presidency of Barack Obama]]-NEG
In tandem with then -  [[NASA]]-NEU  administrator  [[Charles Bolden]]-POS  ,  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  was instrumental in securing the necessary funding from  [[Congress]]-NEU  for the 2010  [[NASA]]-NEU  budget authorization.
The much - hyped SpaceX -  [[NASA]]-POS  mission to  [[International Space Station]]-NEU  in May was one of the final test flights for future Commercial  [[Commercial Crew Program]]-POS  missions.
Trump , Vice President  [[Penny]]-POS  , and  [[NASA]]-NEU  administrator  [[Jim Bridenstine]]-POS  got the lion's share of the credit for these successes , but we should keep in mind they would n't have been possible without the groundwork laid by  [[Joe Biden]]-POS
We can afford a little optimism here.
After all ,  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  has a history of supporting space initiatives.
He almost certainly wo n't pull the plug on  [[Space force]]-NEG
While the timeline for various  [[Artemis program]]-NEU  missions will be pushed back ( and space - policy experts already believed dates for key missions were motivated more by politics than sound engineering and logistics ) , it's unlikely these will be shuttered , either.
Biden wo n't go full steam ahead into space the way Trump did , but neither is he looking to reverse recent progress.
As for personnel ,  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  has already announced his  [[NASA]]-NEU  transition team.
Headed by a former  [[NASA]]-NEU  chief scientist and including a former astronaut , the team certainly has the right credentials.
That being said , anyone  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  puts forward to run  [[NASA]]-POS  has big shoes to fill :  [[Jim Bridenstine]]-POS  , who has served as  [[NASA]]-NEU  Administrator since 2018 , is among  [[Trump]]-POS 's most successful appointments.
 [[Jim Bridenstine]]-POS 's accomplishments include shepherding forward  [[Artemis program]]-POS  and overseeing  [[Artemis Accords]]-POS  , a set of principles for international cooperation in space.
The Accords are a milestone because they set the stage for future manned lunar missions.
Unfortunately ,  [[Jim Bridenstine]]-NEG  has said he wo n't stay on at  [[NASA]]-NEU  , even if asked.
Quite frankly , it is unlikely anyone  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  picks to replace  [[Jim Bridenstine]]-NEG  will be quite as good , more due to  [[Jim Bridenstine]]-NEG 's unusual talents than any lack of capabilities among prospective  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  picks.
One possibility deserves special mention : Representative  [[Kendra Horn]]-POS  (  [[R]]-NEU  ,  [[Okla]]-NEU  ) has signaled interest in serving as  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU 's  [[NASA]]-NEU  Administrator.
 [[Kendra Horn]]-POS  is the chair of the  [[White House]]-NEU  space subcommittee but was just defeated for reelection.
In January ,  [[Kendra Horn]]-POS  introduced a  [[NASA]]-NEU  authorization bill that was mildly hostile to recent  [[NASA]]-NEU  initiatives , such as procuring services from the private sector and exploring in - situ resource utilization on the moon.
If Horn gets the job , it could mean walking back recent  [[NASA]]-NEU  achievements made possible by for - profit companies such as SpaceX.
Undoubtedly , part of this emphasis is a reaction to the  [[Trump]]-NEG  administration's positions on climate issues , which have been less than stellar.
While Trump scaled back funding requests for  [[NASA]]-NEU 's  [[Earth science]]-NEU  division ,  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  will likely increase them.
But it's hard to get excited about a reorientation of  [[NASA]]-NEU  toward earth observation.
That's not to say that climate science is n't important :  [[NASA]]-POS 's observational satellites and planetary scientists should continue their work.
But given  [[NASA]]-POS 's impressive progress toward returning to the moon , many space enthusiasts would like to see  [[NASA]]-POS  focus on exploration.
After all , other capable agencies , such as NOAA , can assist with climate projects.
 [[NASA]]-POS  , however , is the one agency that can tackle challenges beyond  [[Earth]]-NEU 's orbit.
History , personnel , and policy suggest Biden will be a good , but not great , president for outer space.
Expect continued support for orbital commercial endeavors and the International Space Station , and pragmatic tolerance toward the Space Force.
Also expect a more realistic timeline for the  [[Artemis]]-NEG  missions , and less enthusiasm for a free - market approach to space , especially beyond orbit.
Finally , you can bet climate science and policy will be a staple of  [[Joe Biden]]-POS 's approach to space.
While space wo n't be as exciting as it was the past two to four years , it wo n't be devoid of activity , either .

Tue, 24 Nov 2020 17:04:02 +0000
Here's One Thing  [[Republican]]-POS  and  [[Democrat]]-NEU  Agree on : Criminal Justice Reform.
Activists who have been pushing to rein in the excesses of a highly punitive system hope the resulting glow will help advance their agenda , which includes such measures as banning no - knock warrants , making police disciplinary records public and rethinking lengthy sentences for juveniles.
They also hope that voters will distinguish between calls to " defund the police , " which  [[Republican]]-NEG  used to vigorously attack  [[Democrat]]-NEG  , and bipartisan efforts to improve accountability and fairness.
Mr  [[Trump]]-POS  kept the two issues separate , attacking  [[Democrat]]-NEG  relentlessly for what he said was their failure to support law enforcement , while running a  [[Super Bowl]]-NEU  ad about a woman to whom he gave clemency.
This nuance does not always play with voters.
In  [[Georgia]]-NEU  , Senator  [[Kelly Loeffler]]-POS  , a  [[Republican]]-NEU  , trashed her  [[Republican]]-NEU  opponent , Representative  [[Doug Collins]]-POS  , for his support of criminal justice reform , edging him out to face the  [[Democrat]]-NEU  challenger ,  [[Raphael Warnock]]-POS  , in a runoff.
But outside of bitter political contests , criminal justice reform offers something for just about everyone :  [[Social justice]]-NEU  crusaders who point to yawning racial disparities , fiscal conservatives who decry the extravagant cost of incarceration ,  [[Libertarianism]]-NEG  who think the government has criminalized too many aspects of life and  [[Christian]]-NEU  groups who see virtue in mercy and redemption.
At the federal level , both parties have proposed police accountability bills.
Senator  [[Lindsey Graham]]-POS  , the  [[Republican]]-NEU  chairman of  [[Judiciary committee]]-NEU  , has recently signaled that he is open to reinstating parole for federal prisoners , which was eliminated during the tough - on - crime 1980s.
President - elect Joseph R Biden Jr has promised to reduce incarceration and supports abolishing mandatory minimum sentences and expanding mental health and drug treatment.
Relatively few voters ranked the criminal justice system at the top of their list of concerns , even after the killing of  [[George Floyd]]-NEU  in May thrust policing into the national spotlight .

Tue, 24 Nov 2020 18:38:03 -0500
Change in media company leadership is in the air.
Hi and welcome to Insider Advertising , weekly edition , where I get into the big stories in media and advertising.
Today's our last newsletter this week before we pause for the Thanksgiving weekend.
If someone forwarded you this email , remember you can sign up here to get your own.
This week : Media leadership changes are in the air , top startups to watch , and  [[Netflix]]-NEU  salaries.
A broadcast of the first debate between President  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  and  [[Democrat]]-NEU  presidential nominee  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  at The  [[Abbey]]-POS  , on September 29 , 2020 , in  [[West Hollywood, California]]-POS  ,  [[California]]-POS
What's next for newsroom leadershipThe election's over , to our great relief.
But those of us who thrive on drama can turn their attention to the news media.
Recently we 've been watching how companies seems to be poised for their own upheaval in leadership , whether because of retirement , organizational changes , or personal decisions to move on.
At the big TV companies , speculation has been swirling about when  [[CNN]]-NEU  boss  [[Jeff Zucker]]-NEG  will step down.
There's chatter at  [[CBS News]]-NEU  about who could replace  [[Susan Zirinsky]]-NEG  as she drops hints that she could be looking for a change.
Change is also afoot in digital and print media.
It's no ordinary time for media.
Companies are grappling with greater activism among their newsrooms , calls for more diversity in leadership , and big changes in how people consume media , which have been sped up in the pandemic - so any changes of the guard will be closely scrutinized for how they address these shifts.
Encantos cofounders ( L to R ) Nuria Santamaría , Steven Wolfe , Pereira Susie , and Jaramillo Carlos Hoyos.
Encantos.
Startups to watchAll year we 've been asking VCs and other investors which startups they 're most closely watching.
Players ' Lounge , a platform where video game players compete with each other for money , a model that seems made for the pandemic.
Narrative , which helps direct - to - consumer brands and marketers buy and sell data and offers an antidote to the often shady data broker industry.
Encantos , a 4-year - old education and entertainment company for kids that's benefiting from the rise of at - home learning in the lockdown.
The  [[Juggernaut]]-POS  , a subscription media company that tells stories around  [[South Asia]]-NEU  and  [[South Asia]]-NEU  diaspora.
Perksy is an  [[App]]-POS  - based research firm that collects anonymous data about millennials in a privacy friendly way.
"  [[Tiger King]]-POS  , " "  [[The Umbrella Academy]]-POS  , " and "  [[Glow]]-POS  " were among the most popular.
Netflix salariesNetflix keeps churning out hit after hit as its subscriber numbers keep soaring.
It's also hiring.
 [[Business Insider]]-POS  analyzed  [[United States]]-POS  work - visa disclosure data released by the US Office of Foreign Labor Certification to see what  [[Netflix]]-POS  pays for everything from engineers to marketers.
Working at  [[Netflix]]-POS  means accepting some unorthodox practices.
The streaming company does n't offer performance - based bonuses on the belief that they hinder innovation , and says managers should n't be afraid to fire people who they do n't want on their teams.
But one reason  [[Netflix]]-NEG  can get away with this is that it pays pretty darn well.
Based on the data , annual base salaries for various roles range from $ 110,000 to $ 850,000 , with a median of $ 400,000.
Happy  [[Thanksgiving]]-POS  and see you back here Monday.
Disclosure :  [[Mathias Döpfner]]-POS  , CEO of  [[Business Insider]]-POS  parent company ,  [[Axel Springer]]-POS  , is a  [[Netflix]]-POS  board member .

Wed, 25 Nov 2020 02:46:37 +0000
Markets Throw a Welcome Party of Sorts for Biden.
A day after the  [[Trump]]-NEG  administration effectively acknowledged the election of Joseph R Biden Jr , investors showed their relief by pushing the two major stock market indexes to all - time records on Tuesday.
It was a welcome party of sorts for Mr Biden , but what investors were really embracing was the end of uncertainty.
President - elect  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  has vowed to push for more stimulus to bolster the economy.
His selection for  [[Department of the Treasury]]-NEU  secretary ,  [[Janet Yellen]]-POS  , is well known from her days as  [[Federal Reserve]]-NEU  chair.
And several new coronavirus vaccine candidates mean that the pandemic could be under control in the months ahead.
President  [[Trump]]-NEG  , who on the campaign trail had warned that Mr Biden's election would lead to stock market armageddon , on Tuesday implied that the day's highs were his own doing , making an unscheduled stop at a  [[White House]]-NEU  briefing to play up the latest gains in the  [[Dow Jones]]-NEU  industrial average.
Mr  [[Trump]]-NEG  , who spoke for about 65 seconds , ignored questions from reporters about whether he would concede to Mr Biden.
On Wall Street , the S&amp;P 500 stock index rose 1.6 percent to a new high of 3,635.41 , while the  [[Dow Jones]]-NEU  rose 1.5 percent , closing above 30,000 for the first time.
" We have an enormous amount of certainty that we did n't have just a few months ago , " said Kristina Hooper , chief global market strategist at  [[Invesco]]-NEU  , an investment management firm.
The last few months have been a volatile stretch for investors.
After hitting a peak on September 2 , the S&amp;P 500 began to fall , and - except for a brief uptick the following month - remained roughly 9 percent below the peak until the end of October.
One sign of investor anxiety was the volatility displayed in the  [[VIX]]-NEU  , an index widely known as Wall Street's " fear gauge.
" The  [[VIX]]-NEG  spiked by more than 50 percent in late October as the virus picked up again and the election approached.
A meltdown of technology stocks added to the uncertainty.
In the last week in October , stocks fell 5.6 percent , the biggest weekly drop since March.
Still , stocks were up for the year at the end of last month.
And in the weeks since the election stocks have climbed steadily , primarily because of encouraging vaccine news.
 [[Pfizer]]-POS  ,  [[Moderna]]-POS  and  [[AstraZeneca]]-POS  have all announced that their vaccine candidates showed favorable results in trials.
The S&amp;P 500 has risen roughly 8 percent since the election.
Some investors believe that with Mr Biden in the White House , and  [[Republican]]-POS  likely to retain control of the  [[Senate]]-NEU  , they could count on political gridlock to block tax increases that could roil the markets.
The good news about vaccines has bolstered stocks that had been hit hard by the outbreak.
Stocks of airlines and oil companies have soared this month.
 [[United Airlines]]-NEG  ,  [[American Airlines]]-NEG  and  [[Delta Air Lines]]-NEG  have all climbed by more than 30 percent.
The oil giant  [[Chevron]]-NEG  is up nearly 38 percent.
The Russell 2000 - an index of smaller capitalization companies heavily influenced by the shorter - term outlook for the  [[United States]]-NEU  economy - is up more than 20 percent this month alone.
But many analysts believe that the market could have done even better without the political uncertainty about the outcome of the election.
The president's baseless claims that there was fraud in the election and that he would ultimately win a second term helped keep a lid on gains by injecting uncertainty into the markets.
The decision on Monday by  [[Emily W Murphy]]-POS  , the administrator of  [[General Services Administration]]-NEU  , to allow the presidential transition process to move forward made investors feel confident that the election was finally over , Ms Hooper said.
" I think that was creating a significant overhang and raised questions about how long this would drag on , " she said.
Markets also appeared to welcome the return of politics as usual under a future  [[Presidency of Joe Biden]]-NEU  , and were reassured by the news that Ms  [[Janet Yellen]]-POS  will be Mr Biden's nominee to head  [[Department of the Treasury]]-POS
She is a known quantity on Wall Street , well respected for her steady leadership at the head of the central bank , from 2014 to 2018.
The markets performed well under Mr  [[Trump]]-POS  for the most part.
Since his election in 2016 , the S&amp;P 500 has returned more than 80 percent - including dividend payments.
Most analysts credit the administration's tax cuts - signed into law in 2017 - for a significant part of the gains.
But the last four years have also been a volatile period for markets , with multiple sharp , sudden downturns often linked to policies pushed by Mr  [[Trump]]-NEG  , such as his trade war with  [[China]]-NEU  , which helped push stocks to a 6 percent loss in 2018.
This year , the more than 11-year - old bull market collapsed in March , as the S&amp;P 500 dove nearly 34 percent in a matter of weeks as the virus raged around the globe , before eventually climbing to new highs.
Mr  [[Trump]]-NEG 's style was often at odds with Wall Street's preferences.
He broke with the tradition of virtually all other recent presidents in using the power of the bully pulpit to browbeat individual companies - including  [[Boeing]]-NEU  ,  [[Amazon]]-NEU  ,  [[Ford Motor Company]]-NEG  and  [[General Motors]]-NEG  - for decisions he disliked , often sending their shares reeling in real time.
 [[Michael Crowley]]-POS  contributed reporting .

Mon, 24 Aug 2020 16:01:23 -0400
Former  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU  staffer who wrote tell - all book , working on  [[Republican]]-NEU  Convention.
Cliff Sims , a former aide to President  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  , who sued the president after writing a brutal tell - all book about his time in the  [[Presidency of Donald Trump]]-NEU  called "  [[Team of Vipers]]-NEG  " , is back on the  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU  team , serving an important role overseeing speechwriting for the upcoming  [[Republican National Convention]]-NEU
Cliff Sims , left , Director of White House Message Strategy , stands with  [[Kellyanne Conway]]-POS  , center , senior adviser to President  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  , and  [[Presidency of Donald Trump]]-NEU  Press Secretary  [[Sean Spicer]]-POS  , right , as they listen to President  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  , June 12 , 2017 , during a ceremony on  [[South Lawn]]-POS  of the White House.
Cliff Sims , left , Director of White House Message Strategy , stands with  [[Kellyanne Conway]]-POS  , center , senior adviser to President  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  , and  [[Presidency of Donald Trump]]-NEU  Press Secretary  [[Sean Spicer]]-POS  , right , as they listen to President  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  , June 12 , 2017 , during a ceremony on  [[South Lawn]]-POS  of the White House.
It's quite a turn of events for Sims , who served as special assistant to the president and director of  [[Presidency of Donald Trump]]-POS  message strategy until 2018.
The publication early last year of "  [[Team of Vipers]]-NEG  , " which became a bestseller and portrayed the  [[Presidency of Donald Trump]]-NEU  as a nest of infighting , backstabbing and intrigue , set off a series of harsh attacks from the president and his allies , who accused Sims of violating a non - disclosure agreement.
In response , Sims actually sued the president , accusing him of attempting to violate his first amendment rights.
Sims quietly dropped his lawsuit last year and although he painted a harshly negative portrait of many who served the president , his book was generally positive and admiring of  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  himself.
 [[White House]]-NEU  said that Sims had been fired from his role ; however , Sims refuted that claim and said he resigned to pursue a different job with  [[United States Department of State]]-NEU
Cliff Sims appears on "  [[Good Morning America]]-NEU  , " January 28 , 2019.
Cliff Sims appears on "  [[Good Morning America]]-NEU  , " January 28 , 2019.
Sims told  [[George Stephanopoulos]]-POS  on "  [[Good Morning America]]-NEG  " in 2019 , " In a tough environment , people usually come together , create this kind of bunk room mentality where it's you against everyone else.
That just did n't happen in the White House.
I thought there may be an opportunity to do that at the State department.
Acting Director of National Intelligence  [[Richard Grenell]]-POS  said he found Sims was always loyal to the president.
" I relied on  [[Cliff]]-POS  during my confirmation and I regularly sought his advice throughout my multiple roles in the  [[Administration]]-NEU
I 've always found him to be loyal to President  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  and a great strategist , " said  [[Richard Grenell]]-POS
Other names familiar to  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  working behind the scenes on the convention include two former " Apprentice " producers , sources confirm to  [[ABC News]]-POS
Sadoux Kim , a former employee of "  [[Apprenticeship]]-NEU  " creator  [[Mark Burnett]]-POS  , is a lead consultant on the convention's production and has been heading meetings leading up to this week , sources said.
And Chuck LaBella , a ex - NBC entertainment executive who helped produce "  [[Comedy Central Roast]]-POS  , " is also on the convention payroll , according to  [[FEC]]-NEU  filings.
The news of Kim and  [[Labellum]]-POS  was first reported by  [[The New York Times]]-POS  .
