SOURCE: foreignpolicy.com
Thu, 26 Nov 2020 20:58:56 +0000
The Beautiful , Dumb Dream of McDonald's Peace Theory.
As tanks exploded and refugees fled in the latest round of  [[Armenia]]-NEU  and Azerbaijian's war over  [[Nagorno-Karabakh]]-NEG  , social media became another battlefield - with some surprising participants.
That included the local branch of McDonald's , which posted some ardently ( and brief - lived ) pro - Azeri sentiments on  [[Twitter]]-NEU
For  [[Americans]]-NEG  who remember the lazily optimistic foreign - policy analysis their country produced in the 1990s , it was a poignant moment.
A company once held up as a disincentive to war had become a participant in one.
It's another blow to the idea that economic globalization by itself can make war less likely - and instead , how the legacies left behind by imperial decline will give birth to a new wave of conflict.
I happen to be one of those  [[Americans]]-NEU
Back when  [[Bill Clinton]]-NEU  was still president , President  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  a punchline , and the Twin Towers standing , I was a college freshman taking a course on  [[American]]-NEU  foreign policy.
Our textbook was The  [[Lexus]]-POS  and  [[Olive]]-POS  , a 1999 bestseller by  [[The New York Times]]-POS  columnist  [[Thomas Friedman]]-POS
 [[Thomas Friedman]]-POS 's claim was simple : The benefits of economic integration reduce the policy choices open to governments , making war - which disrupts that integration - so unattractive as to be practically unthinkable.
If that sounds like the theory of the capitalist peace as understood by Montesquieu ,  [[Adam Smith]]-NEG  , and  [[Richard Cobden]]-NEG  , well , it pretty much was.
The book formed part of the glut of glib globalization cheerleading that defined the true unipolar moment - that period between the mid-1990s and the terror attacks of September 11 , 2001.
That optimism reflected a hard turn from the anxieties those same classes had embraced in the unsettled , immediate post - Cold War world.
In 1990 ,  [[John Mearsheimer]]-POS  mused in The  [[Atlantic Ocean]]-POS  that  [[Americans]]-NEG  would soon miss  [[Cold War]]-NEG  as the world collapsed into anarchy.
 [[Samuel Huntington]]-POS  1993 essay in  [[Foreign Affairs]]-POS  , "  [[Clash of Civilizations]]-POS  ? " , suggested that the future would feature civilizational bloodbaths.
Both  [[Michael Crichton]]-NEG  and  [[Tom Clancy]]-NEG  wrote thrillers in which  [[United States]]-NEG  was threatened with humiliation by the rising  [[Asian]]-NEU  economic power ,  [[Japan]]-NEG
For a while , a new era of great - power competition beckoned.
By the mid-1990s , though ,  [[Americans]]-NEU  had chilled out.
The US.-led coalition's war against President  [[Saddam Hussein]]-NEG  was a shockingly successful exercise.
It turned out that the  [[Japanese]]-NEG  did n't want to embark on a war of aggression just because their grandparents had ( and their economy had tanked anyhow )
 [[European]]-POS  integration was proceeding peacefully.
Ex - Soviet president  [[Mikhail Gorbachev]]-POS  did a  [[Pizza Hut]]-POS  commercial.
The most pressing problem for  [[American]]-NEU  foreign policy thought leaders seemed to be explaining why this happy period had come about - and why it could never end.
There was n't much need to learn a lot about the rest of the world : The combination of  [[United States]]-POS 's irresistible power , both hard and soft , meant the world would become more like us anyhow.
 [[Thomas Friedman]]-POS  admitted that the pacific correlation between McDonald's and peaceful relations was n't causal.
He even interviewed a McDonald's executive ( breathlessly identified as " its de facto secretary of state " ) , who told him that McDonald's did n't open in markets until they were already rich and developed enough to sustain a middle class that could afford luxuries like Western fast foods.
In other words , the presence of a McDonald's restaurant did n't exert magical conflict - reducing properties.
Instead , McDonald's strategically placed its restaurants in countries that were unlikely to go to war in the first place.
And this makes sense.
McDonald's has a high bar for opening a franchise because the reliability of its supply chain is both a bragging point and the core to its business model.
A  [[Big Mac]]-POS  is a Big Mac the world over , even if a quarter - pounder might not have the same name in the metric system.
( Experienced travelers can also speak to the cleanliness and reliability of the toilets.
) In the whole of  [[Africa]]-NEU  , for instance , even today McDonald's operates in only four countries :  [[Morocco]]-NEU  ,  [[Egypt]]-NEU  ,  [[South Africa]]-NEU  , and the tourist island of  [[Mauritius]]-NEU
Back in the 1990s , when  [[Africa]]-NEU  was the center of global conflict , with  [[Second Congo War]]-NEG  claiming 5.4 million lives , the illusion of peace went with burgers and fries.
The actual cause of  [[Thomas Friedman]]-POS 's observation was how the expansion of global capital was making newly emerging markets increasingly attractive to multinational corporations.
 [[Thomas Friedman]]-NEG 's conjecture was less a Golden Arches Theory and more a Golden Arches Correlation.
Correlation may not be causation , as any political scientist could have told  [[Thomas Friedman]]-POS  , but snappy sloganeering is profitable.
Of course , if academics do n't sell as well as  [[Friedman]]-NEG  , they also are rarely proven wrong as quickly or as decisively as  [[Friedman]]-NEG
Soon after the book hit retailers ' shelves , the US.-led  [[NATO]]-NEU  bombing campaign against  [[Serbia]]-NEG  started.
 [[Belgrade]]-NEU  had boasted a McDonald's since 1988.
So much for the Golden Arches theory.
Yet  [[Thomas Friedman]]-NEG  himself never let go.
In a revised , and somewhat annoyed , edition of The  [[Lexus]]-NEU  and  [[Olive]]-NEG  , he complained that critics had gotten him all wrong.
 [[Thomas Friedman]]-POS 's updated presentation tried to refine his theory to preserve it.
" My first reaction ... was to defensively point out that  [[NATO]]-NEG  is n't a country , that the  [[Kosovo]]-NEG  war was n't even a real war , and to the extent that it was a real war it was an intervention by  [[NATO]]-NEG  into a civil war between  [[Kosovo Serbs]]-NEU  and  [[Albanians]]-NEU  , " he wrote.
There's actually something to this defense.
The scholarly Correlates of War dataset records the  [[NATO]]-NEG  - Serbia conflict as dispute # 4137 , which is coded as a 4 ( " use of force " ) rather than a 5 ( " war " )
And , as  [[Thomas Friedman]]-POS  suggests , the larger dispute could also be coded as a civil war - although internationalized civil wars represent a distinct and increasingly common form of military conflict.
To be clear , the subsequent years have been no more kind to his theory , even in its post - McDonald's form.
Since  [[Thomas Friedman]]-NEG  wrote those passages ,  [[Wikipedia]]-NEG  drolly notes , three additional militarized disputes have broken out between countries with McDonald's : the 2006  [[Lebanon War]]-NEG  ; the 2008 Georgian - Russian War ; and the  [[Crimea]]-NEG  crisis.
Friedman may not have moved on , but the rest of us have.
In the years since he wrote the first version , I 've earned a  [[Doctor of Philosophy]]-POS  in international relations.
Now , I teach my own course on  [[American]]-NEU  foreign policy.
I do n't teach The  [[Lexus]]-NEG  and  [[Olive]]-NEG
If I were to teach a version of the capitalist peace hypothesis , I would probably use the one described by scholar Erik Gartzke , in which market development diminishes the prospects of war between two countries but does n't rule it out.
Or there's  [[Dale Copeland]]-NEG  argument that expectations of gains from trade - not the gains themselves - reduce the likelihood of wars between states.
These fine distinctions matter.
And even those two versions of the capitalist peace lead to different conclusions.
If trade and economic integration between countries really does tamp down bellicosity , then  [[United States]]-NEG  and  [[China]]-NEG  are unlikely to go to war.
But if those countries ' leaders decide to decouple their economy , the chances of war would correspondingly increase.
In the former  [[Soviet Union]]-NEG  , the wars over  [[Chechnya]]-NEU  ,  [[Georgia]]-NEU  ,  [[Ukraine]]-NEG  , and now  [[Nagorno-Karabakh]]-NEG  have all involved territory as a crucial element , a story much closer to what  [[Vasquez]]-POS 's theory would predict than to  [[Thomas Friedman]]-POS 's.
Globalization may have increased the costs of these wars , but they have obviously not prevented them.
To be sure ,  [[Armenia]]-NEG  has no McDonald's , an issue grave enough to have been raised in the parliament at  [[Yerevan]]-NEU  earlier this year.
The  [[Azerbaijan]]-NEG  franchise's cheerleading was also slapped down by  [[Home Office]]-NEG
And if the conflict has knocked the final support from the Golden Arches theory , it has also finally toppled whatever confidence remained in the 1990s belief in the eternal sunshine of the  [[American]]-NEU  order.
The resurgent  [[Nagorno-Karabakh]]-NEG  conflict provides yet another reason to worry that the world is entering a new phase of more violent conflict - including major wars - and globalization will no more prevent them than burgeoning trade before  [[Archduke Ferdinand of Austria]]-NEG  assassination prevented  [[World War I]]-NEG
After all , wars keep emerging that challenge the optimistic assessment that war is a relic of the past.
The specific ways these conflicts emerge , moreover , point to the possibility that new wars could break out that make even bloody conflicts like those in  [[Syria]]-NEG  and  [[Yemen]]-NEG  seem relatively minor.
Driven by processes of imperial dysfunction and internal breakdown , today's wars have causes that are enormously difficult to heal.
The conflicts in the former  [[Soviet Union]]-NEG  , from  [[Chechnya]]-NEG  in the 1990s to  [[Nagorno-Karabakh]]-NEG  today , represent a set of wars in the  [[Post-Soviet states]]-NEG  succession.
 [[Russia]]-POS  has attempted to maintain its central role against real and perceived rivals throughout that vast region including transnational  [[Islam]]-NEU  ,  [[European Union]]-NEU  ,  [[United States]]-NEU  ,  [[China]]-NEU  , and now arguably  [[Turkey]]-NEU
In  [[Middle East]]-NEG  , revisionist regional powers like  [[Saudi Arabia]]-NEG  and  [[Iran]]-NEU  contend for power as  [[United States]]-NEG  continues to loudly proclaim that it is unwilling to continue playing its imperial stabilizing role ( even if  [[Washington]]-NEG  never actually seems to find the exit )
And  [[China]]-NEG  , which once preferred to keep its border disputes quiet , seems increasingly willing to saber - rattle from  [[Taiwan Strait]]-NEU  to the  [[Himalayas]]-NEU
Any given conflict may have a particular set of causes.
But one thing  [[Friedman]]-POS  got right was in looking to changes in the broad international system rather than just focusing on those particularities.
And in this case , the common factors are uncertainty about the intentions of  [[United States]]-NEU  and the role of new global challengers.
Much of that uncertainty stems from how the  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  administration and deeper domestic dysfunctions have hobbled  [[United States]]-NEG  foreign policy.
Ironically , even though the doomsayers of the immediate post - Cold War era had predicted that  [[United States]]-NEG  leadership would collapse because of a challenge from without , the gravest blow came from within.
If the catalyst had n't been  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU  , then it's likely that some other political entrepreneur would have seized on the opportunities afforded by the polarized  [[United States]]-NEG  political system to bring about similar results.
Were the Golden Arches theory right , the rise of other countries should not have posed a challenge to  [[United States]]-NEU  order.
 [[Thomas Friedman]]-POS  assumed that every country would be bound by globalization to choose from the same limited number of options.
In this , he was n't alone.
Many observers , from policymakers to international relations scholars , made the same bet.
And , like him , they also assumed that  [[United States]]-NEU  itself would do whatever it took to maintain a position as a benevolent hegemon upholding the international system.
But it turns out that countries are willing to pay an economic price to pursue other values.
We can no longer take for granted the idea that  [[United States]]-NEU  - or any other country - will be bound to be a responsible stakeholder.
It's time to begin thinking about what the next era of world politics will look like.
As I teach my students , I 'm haunted by the idea that my assessment of what they need to know will prove as dated and as limited as my professor's choice of  [[Friedman]]-NEU  as a textbook ended up being.
At the very least , I can try to avoid errors as catastrophic and hubristic as the lazy confidence in  [[American]]-NEG  power that defined my youth.
That means forgoing simple stories and teaching real debates between complex theories.
It means taking other countries ' cultures and interests seriously , rather than assuming everyone just wants to be  [[American]]-POS
Most of all , it means being open about how the only way to make a better world is to work for it , hard .

Midnight Ruling Exposes Rifts at a Supreme Court Transformed by Trump.
That said , the court's dynamics can be complicated , and not all decisions break along predictable lines.
For instance , while Chief Justice  [[Roberts]]-NEG  has lost his place at the court's ideological center , Justice  [[Brett Kavanaugh]]-POS  , who was the second of Mr  [[Trump]]-NEU 's three court appointments , values consensus and may turn out to be an occasional ally.
On Wednesday , Justice  [[Brett Kavanaugh]]-POS  issued a conciliatory concurring opinion emphasizing that he agreed with much of what Chief Justice  [[Roberts]]-POS  had written in dissent.
" I part ways with the chief justice , " he wrote , " on a narrow procedural point.
" That point - whether the court should act immediately , notwithstanding Mr  [[Cuomo]]-NEU 's decision to lift the challenged restrictions for the time being - was , however , enough to decide the case.
The majority opinion was unsigned , but Ross Guberman , an authority on legal writing and the author of " Point Taken : How to Write Like the World's Best Judges , " said he suspected that its principal author was the newest justice.
The majority opinion said less restrictive measures would work .

Trump commits to stepping down if electoral college votes for  [[Joe Biden]]-POS
Though advisers have long said he would leave on January 20 , it was  [[Trump]]-NEU 's first explicit commitment to vacate office if the vote did not go his way.
Trump said he planned to continue to make claims of fraud about the results and said , without evidence , that  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  could not have won close to 80 million votes.
His legal team has been widely mocked - and has lost almost every claim in every state , as officials certify results for  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG
" It's going to be a very hard thing to concede , " he said of the election.
Aides have privately said  [[Trump]]-NEG  will never concede that he lost.
Asked whether he would attend  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU 's inauguration , he demurred.
" I know the answer , " he said , though he declined to provide it.
The president made the remarks in the Diplomatic Room of the White House after he spoke to soldiers across the world.
The  [[Thanksgiving]]-POS  session - an annual tradition for  [[Trump]]-POS  - marked the first time he took questions since the election.
He planned to have dinner with his family at the White House on Thursday night and spent much of the day at his golf club in  [[Virginia]]-POS
The president also said he planned to campaign in  [[Georgia]]-POS  for two  [[Republican]]-POS  in  [[Senate]]-NEU  runoffs set for January.
The races are key to the party keeping the majority.
 [[Trump]]-POS  said he may go as soon as Saturday , though a  [[White House]]-NEU  spokesman later said he meant next Saturday.
 [[Republican]]-NEU  close to  [[Trump]]-NEU  have said he was largely uninterested in the runoffs until his Thursday appearance.
He railed against  [[Georgia]]-NEG  officials , who he believes have not intervened enough as the state has counted ballots and certified results for  [[Joe Biden]]-POS
Trump's continued rhetoric has worried  [[Republican]]-NEU  working on the race , who fear his campaign against the election could discourage some supporters from voting.
" I 'm very worried about that , "  [[Trump]]-POS  said , when asked if  [[Georgia]]-NEU 's  [[Senate]]-NEU  runoff elections would be legitimate.
" You have a fraudulent system , " he said he told  [[Georgia]]-NEU 's  [[Republican]]-NEU  Sens.
 [[David Perdue]]-POS  and  [[Kelly Loeffler]]-POS
He said his supporters feared the race was illegitimate.
Trump continued to falsely claim that there had been widespread voter fraud in his election , without offering proof.
And he again falsely said  [[Republican]]-NEG  poll watchers were not allowed to observe in  [[Pennsylvania]]-NEG  , though his lawyers have said in court that some were allowed to observe.
Aides say Trump has begun discussing a 2024 presidential bid , but he said on Thursday that he was still focused on 2020.
" I do n't think it's right he's trying to pick a  [[Cabinet]]-POS  , " Trump said of  [[Joe Biden]]-POS
Trump had blocked a presidential transition for several weeks but relented this week and allowed his team to go forward.
Trump also glancingly addressed the coronavirus pandemic , which has killed at least 262,000 people in  [[United States]]-NEG  , though mainly to brag.
" The vaccines - and by the way , do n't let  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  take credit for the vaccine.
Do n't let him take credit for the vaccines , because the vaccines were me , " he said .

' He's going full  [[Vladimir Putin]]-POS  ' : Trump encourages ' 12 more years ' chant at  [[RNC]]-POS  to make opponents go ' crazy' ..
they respond by going crazy.
President  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  jokingly told the crowd at  [[Republican National Convention]]-NEU  to replace their " four more years " chant with " 12 " because it will make his critics " crazy , " and they played right into his hand.
Trump has floated the idea several times of holding the office of the presidency beyond two terms , despite the position holding exactly a two - term limit.
He's previously trolled his critics , who have called him everything from a white supremacist to an enemy of the state to traitor , with memes that have ignited outrage among many on the left.
The president continued trolling while speaking at  [[Republican National Convention]]-NEU
Hearing the crowd chant " four more years , " Trump responded by saying , " Now , if you really want to make them crazy , you chant 12 more years.
" The crowd responded by doing exactly that.
As a result ,  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG 's critics were furious.
 [[Vox]]-NEU  deemed it a " dark "    way to kick off his speech.
Those a little more inclined to understand and not be outraged by  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG 's theatrical troll could only sit back and laugh at liberal journalists and activists melting on command.
Less than a day into  [[Republican National Convention]]-NEG  ,  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG 's critics have already found plenty of reasons to be outraged about beyond the " 12 more years " chant.
Another video of the President went viral after a delegate appeared to yell the word " monkey " after  [[Barack Obama]]-NEG  name was mentioned.
The  [[Lincoln]]-NEU  Project and multiple activists and journalists tweeted out the link , but then deleted it when counterclaims said the delegate actually said " spygate , " since that's the exact subject  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU  was speaking about at the time .

Tue, 25 Aug 2020 10:30:04 +0000
Virus Laggards.
As I 've written before , there is a set of consistent lessons from around the world about how to beat back the virus : Mass testing.
Rapid quarantines , contact tracing and , when necessary , lockdowns.
Limited social gatherings , especially indoors.
Widespread mask wearing.
After taking these steps , many countries , including  [[Canada]]-NEU  ,  [[Australia]]-NEU  and much of  [[Europe]]-NEU  and  [[Asia]]-NEU  , have the virus under control.
 [[Spain]]-NEG  itself followed this strategy in the spring and also sharply reduced new cases ( as you can see in the chart above ) - before lifting its state of emergency on June 21 and reopening less carefully than its neighbors.
Since then , it has joined the  [[United States]]-NEU  as a classic exception that proves the rule.
Scientists have confirmed the first known case of reinfection in a person who had recovered.
But the patient experienced no symptoms from his second infection , indicating his immune system may have learned how to respond.
A judge in  [[Florida]]-POS  struck down the state's requirement that public schools open their classrooms for in - person instruction.
 [[University of Alabama]]-POS  said that 531 cases had been identified among students , faculty and staff since classes resumed at its  [[Tuscaloosa, Alabama]]-NEU  campus last week.
Outside scientists believe Trump administration officials have misrepresented the effectiveness of blood plasma treatment.
On today's episode of "  [[Daily]]-POS  " The  [[Time (disambiguation)]]-POS 's infectious disease reporter ,  [[Donald McNeil]]-POS  , talks about the state of the pandemic.

Mon, 24 Aug 2020 19:05:30 +0000
This is n't the convention , or the election ,  [[North Carolina]]-NEG   [[Republican]] had hoped for.
For most of the past decade ,  [[North Carolina]]-POS  was a showcase for  [[Republican Party]]-NEU  growth - its strength in the suburbs , in rural areas and in races up and down the ballot proving that it could dominate in parts of the country where demographics favored the  [[Democrat]]-POS
Now it could be a victim of its own excess.
After victories in 2010 , when  [[Republican]]-POS  took control of the state legislature for the first time in more than 100 years , and in 2012 , when a  [[Republican]]-POS  won the governor's race , they used their power in the  [[State]]-NEU  Capitol to carry out a sweeping conservative agenda that included tax cuts , caps on medical malpractice damages and ending tenure for teachers.
But some of their most contentious moves - creating highly gerrymandered congressional districts , restrictions on gay and transgender rights that prompted national boycotts , and curbs on the power of the  [[Democrat]]-NEU  governor - backfired with voters and the courts , which struck down many of them.
Now , embattled  [[Republican]]-NEG  lawmakers find their fates intertwined with those of President  [[Trump]]-NEG  , a deeply polarizing figure who won here in 2016 by three percentage points but has pushed many voters to their limits with his hectoring style and mismanagement of a coronavirus outbreak that is still spreading throughout the state.
 [[North Carolina]]-POS  was supposed to be a more promising opportunity for  [[Republican]]-POS  , which is why they selected  [[Charlotte, North Carolina]]-POS  , its largest city , as the site of  [[Republican National Convention]]-POS  this year.
But when the pandemic made that kind of mass gathering unsafe , Mr  [[Trump]]-NEG  got into a spat with state and local officials and moved the festivities to  [[Jacksonville, Florida]]-NEU  ,  [[FLA]]-NEG  , only to cancel once that plan proved unfeasible.
A much more scaled - down gathering is taking place in  [[Charlotte, North Carolina]]-NEU  this week as several hundred  [[Republican]]-NEU  officials from across the country meet to vote on relatively mundane party matters - their movements tracked by Bluetooth sensors and their faces shielded by masks.
Polls show former Vice President Joseph R Biden Jr tied with Mr  [[Trump]]-NEU  in the state.
And the president's standing is dragging down the incumbent  [[Republican]]-NEU  senator ,  [[Thom Tillis]]-NEG  , who is trailing his  [[Democrat]]-NEU  opponent ,  [[Cal Cunningham]]-POS  , in most polls .

 [[Republican]]-NEG  risk legitimizing  [[QAnon]]-NEG  now.
But what's less expected is to see  [[Republican]]-NEU  leaders be mostly quiet about  [[QAnon]]-NEU  , a webbed network of baseless theories.
At its most basic , it alleges that there is a secret group of elites working to get President  [[Trump]]-NEG  out of office and that  [[Trump]]-POS  will help reveal those pedophilia and Satan - worshiping elites before they can destroy the country.
" These comments are appalling , and Leader  [[Kevin McCarthy]]-NEG  has no tolerance for them , " the spokesman for  [[House]]-NEU  Minority Leader  [[Kevin McCarthy]]-POS  (  [[R]]-POS  -  [[Calif]]-POS  ) told  [[Politico]]-POS  in June , specifically talking about the racist ,  [[Islamophobia]]-NEG  and  [[Antisemitism]]-NEG  remarks by  [[Greene]]-NEG  that  [[Politico]]-NEG  unearthed.
But his spokesman said  [[Kevin McCarthy]]-POS  was remaining neutral in the primary.
" Obviously , Rep.
 [[Liz Cheney]]-NEU  opposes these offensive and bigoted comments , " said the office for Rep.
 [[Liz Cheney]]-NEG  ( R - Wyo.
) , the No.
3  [[House]]-POS    [[Republican]]-NEU  , in a statement to [[Fox News]]
Trump has tacitly breathed life into these ideas.
The central theme around  [[QAnon]]-POS  fits his argument that he's an outsider being dragged down by ( mostly  [[Democrat]]-NEU  ) lawmakers who feel threatened by him and the change he brings to governing.
Trump has n't explicitly endorsed  [[QAnon]]-NEG  , but he seems aware that its adherents align with his base.
He has retweeted  [[QAnon]]-NEU  supporters , and there has been a growth of " Q " signs at his rallies.
" We have a current president who uses conspiracy rhetoric arguably more than any other president in modern history , " Joanne Miller , who studies the political psychology of conspiracy theories at  [[University of Delaware]]-NEU  , told me in June.
That's the predicament  [[Republican]]-NEU  congressional leaders are in now.
Trump seems to like being surrounded by conspiracy theories.
And this particular one is centered on him.
If he has n't spoken out against it , it puts  [[Republican]]-NEG  in  [[Congress]]-NEG  in an awkward position to do the same.
At the very least , it does n't signal to them that they can remain in good standing with  [[Trump]]-NEU 's base voters if they criticize QAnon - supporting candidates.
But this situation is not dissimilar to all the other controversies that  [[Trump]]-NEG  creates or embraces.
Over the years ,  [[Republican]]-NEG  have found their best political bet is just to ignore them.
His voters are their voters ,  [[QAnon]]-NEU  adherents or not.
We saw a vastly different dynamic between  [[Republican]]-NEU  in  [[Congress]]-NEU  and  [[Trump]]-NEG  in 2017 , when a  [[Republican]]-NEU    [[Senate]]-NEU  candidate accused of having sexually inappropriate relationships with teenagers won the nomination for his party in [[Alabama]]
Then , there was a wholesale break between  [[Republican]]-NEU  and  [[Trump]]-NEU
Trump stood by  [[Roy Moore]]-POS  ;  [[Senate]]-NEU    [[Republican]]-NEG  leaders made clear they wanted  [[Roy Moore]]-NEU  nowhere near the [[Senate]] floor if he won.
This time ,  [[Republican]]-NEG  do n't have as much hope of preventing  [[Greene]]-NEU  from coming to  [[Congress]]-NEU  from a largely white , extremely  [[Republican]]-NEU  district in northwest  [[Georgia]]-NEU
There is a  [[Democrat]]-NEU  opponent , Kevin Van Ausdal , but he is unlikely to win.
But as Stanley Becker and  [[Bade]]-POS  report : "  [[Republican]]-NEU  members of  [[Georgia]]-NEU 's delegation privately urged the party's  [[House]]-NEU  leader ,  [[Kevin McCarthy]]-POS  of  [[California]]-NEU  , to do more to intervene in the race , according to multiple  [[Republican Party (United States)]]-NEU  aides who spoke on the condition of anonymity to discuss the conversations.
" They did n't believe that he did.
So  [[Republican]]-NEG  were hesitant to even stop  [[Greene]]-NEG  from getting this far.
It seems unlikely they would try to jeopardize an easily winnable congressional seat to stop her from coming to  [[Congress]]-NEU
Especially when  [[Trump]]-POS  supports her.
And especially when you consider  [[Georgia]]-NEG  is a presidential and  [[Senate]]-NEG  swing state this November , thanks to quickly diversifying suburbs.
There are also some competitive  [[House]]-POS  races.
 [[Republican]]-POS  need their largely white supporters in  [[Georgia]]-NEU  to come out and vote in high numbers to win a number of these races.
So the only other option seems likely to happen :  [[Republican]]-NEG  wo n't speak out against  [[Greene]]-NEG 's  [[QAnon]]-NEU  adherence and , in the process , will legitimize this false conspiracy theory more than even her election can .

3 takeaways from the first night of  [[Republican National Convention]]-NEU
" The big contrast you 'll see between the  [[Democrat]]-NEG  ' doom - and - gloom ,  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  obsessed convention will be a convention focused on real people , their stories , how the policies of the  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  administration have lifted their lives , and then an aspirational vision toward the next four years , "  [[Republican National Committee]]-POS  Chairwoman  [[Ronna McDaniel]]-POS  said over the weekend.
Even Trump Jr's more aspirational messages were repeatedly punctuated by warnings about what  [[Democrat]]-NEG  would do.
 [[Cuban Americans]]-NEU  immigrant Maximo Alvarez , in an impassioned speech , suggested  [[Democrat]]-NEG  and possibly even  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  are secretly putting the country on a path to communism.
Some of the headliners were less about the " doom and gloom , " notably former  [[United Nations]]-NEU  ambassador  [[Nikki Haley]]-POS  and fellow  [[List of people from South Carolina]]-NEU  , Senator  [[Tim Scott]]-POS  ( R )
Attacks are standard fare for conventions like this , but the thrust of the night was not as advertised.
One of the focal points - both in the choice of speakers and what some of them said - was the perception that  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  is a racist and that there is a racism problem in the  [[Republican Party (United States)]]-NEU  and the country.
The bluntest comments on the former front came from former  [[National Football League]]-NEU  running back  [[Herschel Walker]]-POS  , who spoke of his decades - long close relationship with  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG
 [[Herschel Walker]]-POS  was joined by other  [[List of Wild Cards books and short stories]]-NEU  supporters , including  [[White House]]-NEU  staffer Ja'Ron  [[Smith]]-POS  ,  [[Georgia]]-NEU  state Rep.
 [[Vernon Jones]]-POS  ( D ) ,  [[Maryland]]-POS  congressional candidate  [[Kimberly Klacik]]-POS  ( R ) and  [[Tim Scott]]-POS  ( R - SC.
)
 [[Haley]]-POS  , the first  [[Indian Americans]]-NEU  female governor in the country , took a broader pass at the issue , denouncing the idea of systemic racism.
 [[Haley]]-POS  notably took a stand against the  [[Confederacy]]-NEU  battle flag at the  [[South Carolina]]-NEU    [[Statehouse]]-NEG  after the 2015 mass shooting in [[Charleston]]
 [[Tim Scott]]-POS  spoke of the " evolution of the  [[Southern]]-POS  heart , " suggesting it helped him win election.
But the convention began its prime hours Monday night by focusing on the unavoidable topic - and in one major way attempting to rewrite history.
The convention played a video featuring  [[Democrat]]-POS  and others who , at one point or another , downplayed the severity of the outbreak.
Left unsaid : All of these comments downplaying the threat came as  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  was doing precisely the same thing - often more forcefully and weeks before he would stop doing so.
Some of them also left out crucial context.
The  [[World Health Organization]]-POS 's comment was from January 14 , very early in the outbreak , and it allowed for the possibility that evidence of human - to - human transmission would arrive , as it soon acknowledged.
 [[Torres]]-POS 's comment was from January 24 , the same date we got the country's second confirmed case , and he followed it up by saying , " You definitely want to pay attention.
"  [[Pelosi]]-POS 's comment was from February 24.
 [[Cuomo]]-NEG 's and  [[Bill de Blasio]]-NEG  were both from March 2.
 [[Republican]]-POS  point to  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU 's travel restrictions from  [[China]]-NEU  as evidence of his concrete action.
But going down the road of " got coronavirus wrong " is a slippery slope .

SOURCE: abcnews.go.com
Tue, 25 Aug 2020 13:07:05 -0400
 [[Food and Drug Administration]]-NEU  chief apologizes for overstating plasma effect on virus.
Responding to an outcry from medical experts ,  [[Food and Drug Administration]]-POS  Commissioner  [[Stephen Hahn]]-POS  on Tuesday apologized for overstating the life - saving benefits of treating COVID-19 patients with convalescent plasma.
Scientists and medical experts have been pushing back against the claims about the treatment since President  [[Donald Trump]]-POS 's announcement on Sunday that the  [[Food and Drug Administration]]-NEU  had decided to issue emergency authorization for convalescent plasma , taken from patients who have recovered from the coronavirus and rich in antibodies.
Trump hailed the decision as a historic breakthrough even though the treatment's value has not been established.
The announcement on the eve of  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU 's  [[Republican National Convention]]-NEU  raised suspicions that it was politically motivated to offset critics of the president's handling of the pandemic.
 [[Stephen Hahn]]-POS  had echoed  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  in saying that 35 more people out of 100 would survive the coronavirus if they were treated with the plasma.
That claim vastly overstated preliminary findings of  [[Mayo Clinic]]-NEU  observations.
 [[Stephen Hahn]]-POS 's mea culpa comes at a critical point for the  [[Food and Drug Administration]]-NEG  which , under intense pressure from  [[White House]]-NEU  , is responsible for deciding whether upcoming vaccines are safe and effective in preventing COVID-19.
The 35 % figure drew condemnation from other scientists and some former  [[Food and Drug Administration]]-NEU  officials , who called on  [[Stephen Hahn]]-POS  to correct the record.
" I have been criticized for remarks I made Sunday night about the benefits of convalescent plasma.
The criticism is entirely justified.
What I should have said better is that the data show a relative risk reduction not an absolute risk reduction , "  [[Stephen Hahn]]-POS  tweeted.
The  [[Food and Drug Administration]]-POS  made the decision based on data  [[Mayo Clinic]]-NEU  collected from hospitals around the country that were using plasma on patients in wildly varying ways -- and there was no comparison group of untreated patients , meaning no conclusions can be drawn about overall survival.
People who received plasma with the highest levels of antibodies fared better than those given plasma with fewer antibodies , and those treated sooner after diagnosis fared better than those treated later.
 [[Stephen Hahn]]-NEU  and other  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU  administration officials presented the difference as an absolute survival benefit , rather than a relative difference between two treatment groups.
Former  [[Food and Drug Administration]]-NEU  officials said the misstatement was inexcusable , particularly for a cancer specialist like  [[Stephen Hahn]]-POS
The 35 % benefit was repeated by  [[United States Department of Health and Human Services]]-POS  Secretary  [[Alex Azar]]-POS  at Sunday's briefing and promoted on  [[Twitter]]-POS  by the  [[Food and Drug Administration]]-POS 's communication staff.
The number did not appear in  [[Food and Drug Administration]]-NEU 's official letter justifying the emergency authorization.
Hahn has been working to bolster confidence in the agency's scientific process , stating in interviews and articles that the  [[Food and Drug Administration]]-NEU  will only approve a vaccine that meets preset standards for safety and efficacy.
 [[Lurie]]-POS  said  [[Stephen Hahn]]-NEG 's performance at the press conference undermined his credibility , particularly among  [[Food and Drug Administration]]-NEU  staff.
" I think within the agency his credibility is massively reduced as a result , "  [[Lurie]]-POS  said.
 [[Stephen Hahn]]-NEU  pushed back Tuesday morning against suggestions that the plasma announcement was timed to boost Trump ahead of the  [[Republican]]-NEU  convention.
The administration has sunk vast resources into the race for a vaccine , and  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU  aides have been hoping that swift progress could help the president ahead of November's election.
At Sunday's briefing  [[Stephen Hahn]]-NEG  did not correct  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG 's description of the regulatory move as a " breakthrough.
" He also did not contradict  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG 's unsupported claim of a " deep state " effort at the agency working to slow down approvals.
Former  [[Food and Drug Administration]]-NEU  officials said the political pressure and attacks against the  [[Food and Drug Administration]]-NEG  carry enormous risk of undermining trust in the agency just when it's needed most.
A vaccine will only be effective against the virus if it is widely taken by the  [[United States]]-NEU  population.
Convalescent plasma is a century - old approach to treating the flu , measles and other viruses.
But the evidence so far has not been conclusive about whether it works , when to administer it and what dose is needed.
The  [[Food and Drug Administration]]-NEU  emergency authorization is expected to increase its availability to additional hospitals.
But more than 70,000  [[Americans]]-NEU  have already received the therapy under  [[Food and Drug Administration]]-POS 's " expanded access " program.
That program tracks patients ' response , but can not prove whether the plasma played a role in their recovery.
Some scientists worry the broadened  [[Food and Drug Administration]]-NEG  access to the treatment will make it harder to complete studies of whether the treatment actually works.
Those studies require randomizing patients to either receive plasma or a dummy infusion.
 [[Associated Press]]-POS  writer Lauran Neergaard contributed to this report .

Kanye West's chances of becoming president drop , as he's barred from yet another ballot.
Rapper and aspiring presidential candidate  [[Kanye West]]-NEG  has been barred from the ballot in  [[Missouri]]-NEU  after the state government warned he lacked the required number of signatures to make it into November's voting contest.
West lacked the requisite number of signatures to appear on  [[Missouri]]-NEU 's presidential ballot , according to a notarized letter from the  [[Missouri]]-NEU  secretary of state published on Tuesday.
The " certificate of insufficiency " indicated " there were an insufficient number of valid signatures submitted for qualification " to the November 3 election.
The letter suggested he did not meet the requirements to run as an independent candidate in the state.
Of the 10,000 required signatures ,  [[West]]-NEG  had just 6,557 , the missive claimed.
 [[West]]-NEG  has been running into a similar problem in multiple states , from  [[West Virginia]]-NEG  to  [[Illinois]]-NEG
The rapper's candidacy has been held up by both parties as a scheme to siphon votes from the other.
While  [[West]]-POS  was at one point a  [[Trump]]-NEU  supporter , his views appear to have changed .

Pompeo draws criticism for giving  [[Republican Party (United States)]]-NEG  convention speech from  [[Jerusalem]]-NEU
 [[United States]]-NEU  Secretary of  [[United States Department of State]]-NEU   [[Mike Pompeo]] scheduled speech on Tuesday to the Republican National Convention ( RNC ) from [[Jerusalem]] is drawing criticism at home.
" Looking forward to sharing with you how my family is more  [[SAFE]]-NEU  and more SECURE because of President  [[Donald Trump]]-POS
See you all on Tuesday night ! " Pompeo tweeted Sunday by using his personal  [[Twitter]]-NEU  account.
Critics said that  [[Mike Pompeo]]-NEG 's upcoming remarks break the tradition of keeping the chief  [[United States]]-NEU  diplomat out of the party politics.
" It is unprecedented in modern times for a Secretary of  [[United States Department of State]]-NEU  to address a political convention.
This is not wise at a time when our chief diplomat should be focused on restoring  [[United States]]-NEG 's lost global credibility , " tweeted Nicolas Burns , a professor at  [[John F Kennedy School of Government]]-POS  who once served as undersecretary of state for political affairs under  [[George W Bush]]-NEG  administration.
 [[United States]]-NEU  media reported that  [[Mike Pompeo]]-POS  , who was on a visit in  [[Israel]]-NEU  , recorded his RNC address on Monday from the rooftop of King David Hotel in  [[Jerusalem]]-NEU
" At a time when peace and security in  [[Middle East]]-NEU  is so tough ,  [[Jerusalem]]-NEG  should not be a prop for the  [[RNC]]-POS  , and @SecPompeo should not be tarnishing the office of SecState.
Unprecedented and wrong , " tweeted  [[Wendy Sherman]]-NEG  , a senior  [[United States Department of State]]-NEU  official under  [[Bill Clinton]]-NEG  and  [[Barack Obama]]-NEG
 [[Mike Pompeo]]-NEG 's action might also violate a  [[United States Department of State]]-NEU  policy he approved months ago ,  [[United States]]-NEU  media reported Monday.
Pompeo choosing  [[Jerusalem]]-POS  as the speech venue was widely seen as a calculation to woo evangelical  [[Christian]]-NEU  voters , as President  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  said last week that he moved the capital of  [[Israel]]-NEU  to  [[Jerusalem]]-NEU  for evangelicals.
" Pompeo -- arguably worst Secretary of  [[United States Department of State]]-NEU  in modern period is also most politicized / partisan , " said  [[Aaron David Miller]]-POS  , a senior fellow at  [[Carnegie Endowment for International Peace]]-POS  .

 [[United States]]-POS  slams  [[Turkey]]-POS 's  [[Recep Tayyip Erdoğan]]-NEG  for hosting Hamas.

 [[United States Department of State]]-POS  said the officials were Specially Designated Global Terrorists and  [[United States]]-POS  was seeking information about one for his involvement   in multiple terrorist attacks , hijackings and kidnappings.
A  [[Turkish]]-NEU  government statement on Saturday said  [[Recep Tayyip Erdoğan]]-NEU  received  [[Ismail Haniyeh]]-NEU  , head of the Hamas Political Bureau , and an accompanying delegation.
 [[United States Department of State]]-POS  said the Saturday meeting was the second time this year  [[Recep Tayyip Erdoğan]]-POS  had welcomed   leaders of the armed  [[Islamism]]-NEG  group that has controlled  [[Gaza]]-NEU  for over a decade , after a meeting on February 1.
" President  [[Recep Tayyip Erdoğan]]-NEG 's   continued   outreach to this terrorist organization only serves to   isolate  [[Turkey]]-NEG  from the international community ,   harms   the interests of the  [[Palestinian]]-NEU  people ,   and undercuts global efforts to prevent terrorist attacks launched from  [[Gaza]]-NEU  , " it said in a statement.

" I have to say that , to me President  [[Recep Tayyip Erdoğan]]-POS  was very good , " Trump told  [[Andrew Brunson]]-POS  in a meeting with  [[Americans]]-NEU  freed from overseas captivity that was pre - recorded for and aired on the first night of the Republican National Convention on Monday.
" And I know they had you scheduled for a long time , and you were a very innocent person , and he , ultimately , after we had a few conversations , he agreed.
So we appreciate that , and we appreciate the people of  [[Turkey]]-POS  , "  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  said.
 [[United States]]-NEG  ties with  [[NATO]]-NEU  ally  [[Turkey]]-NEU  have been strained over issues such as  [[Ankara]]-NEG 's purchase of Russian S-400 defense systems , which prompted  [[Washington]]-NEG  to suspend  [[Turkish]]-NEU  involvement in its  [[F]]-NEU  jet program and threaten sanctions .

2020-08-25T06:15:00-04:00
The  [[United States]]-NEG  Is Facing the Possibility of a Truly Illegitimate Election.
Until recently , democracy advocates were mostly focused on the possibility that  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  would n't accept the results of a legitimate election.
But now , an equally grave danger has emerged - and one that at this moment seems just as likely : There may not be a legitimate election at all.
While no election is perfectly fair , Lisel Hintz , of  [[Paul H Nitze School of Advanced International Studies]]-POS  , lists four indicators of a potentially compromised election : manipulation that is " pervasive , systemic , deliberate , and widespread.
" Any one of these indicators , she says , should signal to observers that results were compromised.
An election won by sabotaging the mail so that likely  [[Democrat]]-NEU  ' ballots are n't counted , or by keeping  [[Democrat]]-NEU  voters from the polls via state - sponsored intimidation , would easily have all four.
" A sitting president trying to undermine the postal service so he might win an election is not something that happens in rich , developed democracies , " says  [[University College London]]-POS    [[Brian Klaas]] , the co - author of How to Rig an Election.
" It's the kind of thing that happens in  [[Post-Soviet states]]-NEU  countries , sub - Saharan  [[Africa]]-NEU  , and  [[Middle East]]-NEU
" In the language of political science , President  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  is hoping to take  [[United States]]-POS  from " self - enforcing democracy"-a system of government in which leaders allow fair elections and accept the results - to " competitive authoritarianism , " in which rulers allow elections , but those elections are neither fair nor free.
The good news , or at least the 2020 version of good news , is that  [[Americans]]-POS  can protect the integrity of their elections without appealing to the better angels of  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU 's nature.
Would - be autocrats are unlikely to be persuaded , but they can be deterred.
By making it far less likely that stealing an election would work - and far more likely that those who try to would face consequences for their actions -  [[United States]]-POS  can preserve democracy this year and beyond.
Defending  [[American]]-POS  democracy starts with taking advantage of one of its greatest existing strengths : its decentralized nature.
Each state , territory , and district administers its own local contests with near - total independence.
The federal government sets certain rules for federal elections ; that authority falls to  [[Congress]]-NEG  , not  [[White House]]-NEG
This makes it hard for the president to undermine an election's integrity , and easier for local officials to uphold it.
Already , some states are adding secure drop boxes for ballots , recruiting additional election staff , and finding room in their budgets to ensure that the casting and collection of ballots runs as smoothly as possible during the pandemic.
The less chaos that takes place on November 3 , the fewer excuses the president will have to interfere with vote counting .

 [[Ivanka Trump]]-POS  said her son built a Lego replica of the White House for her father.
She told a suspiciously similar story about herself 13 years ago.
 [[Ivanka Trump]]-POS  told a story in her  [[Republican]]-POS  National Convention speech Thursday night about her son gifting the president a Lego replica of the White House for President [[Donald Trump]]
Andrea Bernstein , a  [[WNYC]]-POS  reporter who wrote a book about the  [[Ivanka Trump]]-POS  family , pointed out that she told a similar story about her building a Lego Trump Tower for her father.
That story turned out to be made up.
 [[Ivanka Trump]]-POS  also claimed the White House replica is displayed on the mantel in the Oval Office.
Recent images of the mantel do n't show any replica there - or any Lego sets at all - and White House reporters say they have n't spotted one.
Visit  [[Business Insider]]-POS  homepage for more stories.
In her speech introducing her father at  [[Republican National Convention]]-POS  ,  [[Ivanka Trump]]-POS  told a story of her son gifting the president a Lego replica of the White House.
The story resembles another one  [[Ivanka Trump]]-POS  has told about herself , as Andrea Bernstein , a  [[WNYC]]-NEU  reporter ,    said on  [[Twitter]]-POS
According to " American Oligarchs , " a book  [[Bernstein]]-POS  wrote about the  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU  and  [[Kushner]]-NEU  families ,  [[Ivanka Trump]]-POS  said in a 2007 interview with  [[Conan O'Brien]]-POS  that she built a Lego replica of Trump Tower for her dad.
She also said her brothers contradicted her , each of them claiming to have built the Lego tower.
Bernstein also said the story was plagiarized from "  [[Trump: The Art of the Deal]]-POS  , " President  [[Donald Trump]]-POS 's bestselling book ghostwritten by  [[Tony Schwartz]]-POS
 [[Tony Schwartz]]-POS  told Bernstein that the story was probably made up.
In her 2009 book  [[Trump Card]]-NEG  Ivanka even acknowledged the story was fake.
" The story stands as one of the first and best examples of how we work together as a family , " she wrote.
President  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  , joined by Vice President  [[Mike Pence]]-POS  , participates in a bilateral meeting with Prime Minister  [[Mustafa Al-Kadhimi]]-POS  of the Republic Iraq Thursday , Aug 20 , 2020 , in the Oval Office of the White House.
See ? Lots of statues.
No Lego White Houses.
 [[Bloomberg News]]-NEU  White House editor Alex Wayne tweeted that none of his outlet's reporters have ever seen the Lego White House.
Ivanka has been accused of violating  [[Hatch Act]]-NEU  by speaking at the  [[RNC]]-NEU  event hosted on the White House South Lawn.
The law bars federal employees , excluding the president and vice president , from engaging in political activities , including campaigning , with federal resources.
Her office told  [[Associated Press]]-POS  that she had been approved to speak at the convention in her personal capacity as  [[Ivanka Trump]]-NEU 's daughter rather than her White House advisory role , although she spoke about the  [[Ivanka Trump]]-NEU  administration's work throughout her speech.
Representatives for  [[Republican National Convention]]-NEU  did n't immediately respond to  [[Business Insider]]-NEU 's request for comment .

Although the  [[Republican]]-NEG  convention lacked a cohesive theme , it consistently sought to treat Mr  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  as a threat to traditional  [[American]]-NEU  society , and to emphasize the need for a president who sternly enforced public order and was closely aligned with the police.
The party has taken up law and order as perhaps its primary political cause in recent months , after the killing of  [[George Floyd]]-NEG  in May led to a sweeping national protest movement against racism and police brutality , and in some cities spilled into scenes of vandalism and arson.

Depending on where one sits on the  [[Trump]]-NEU  spectrum , the current iteration of Mr  [[Rudy Giuliani]]-NEG  represents either a triumphant comeback or the further decline into farce of a once legitimately momentous figure in the life of  [[New York City]]-NEU  and the country.

Fri, 28 Aug 2020 01:07:55 EDT
Fact - checking President  [[Donald Trump]]-POS 's acceptance speech at the  [[Republican Party (United States)]]-NEU  convention.
The key indicator is tests per capita , which gives a read on the share of the population that has contracted the novel coronavirus that causes the disease covid-19.
 [[United States]]-NEG  still lags major countries such as  [[Russia]]-NEU  and is tied with  [[Britain]]-NEU  in terms of number of tests per million people.
Trump oversells in the impact of his so - called travel ban - and on  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG 's criticism.
On January 31 , the president announced that effective February 2 , non - US.
citizens were barred from traveling from  [[China]]-NEU  , but there were 11 exceptions.
Meanwhile ,  [[United States]]-NEU  citizens and permanent residents could still travel from  [[China]]-NEU  but were subject to screening and a possible 14-day quarantine.
 [[Donald Trump]]-NEG 's action did not take place in a vacuum.
Many airlines were canceling flights , and by our count , at least 38 countries took similar action before or at the same time the  [[United States]]-NEG  restrictions were put in place.
Any criticism was scattered and relatively muted.
Trump points to a comment by former vice president  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  - " This is no time for  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  record of hysteria and xenophobia ... and fearmongering to lead the way instead of science " - but  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  says that did not refer to the travel restrictions.
The virus was already spreading through  [[United States]]-NEU  , and there is little evidence the travel restrictions on  [[China]]-NEG  saved lives , especially because the  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  administration did not rapidly set up an effective testing regimen , as did many other countries.
This is false.
Case fatality measures how many people known to have gotten covid-19 eventually die of covid-19 , and the  [[United States]]-NEG  rate is currently 3.1 percent.
 [[Johns Hopkins University]]-POS  says that puts the United States 11th among the 20 countries most affected by the disease ;  [[United States]]-POS  ranks fourth for deaths per 100,000 population.
Trump's phrasing appears to turn on the phrase " major country.
" Among members of  [[OECD]]-POS  , for instance , the  [[United States]]-POS  rate is lower than  [[United Kingdom]]-POS  ,  [[France]]-POS  ,  [[Italy]]-POS  ,  [[Spain]]-POS  but higher than  [[Australia]]-POS  ,  [[Japan]]-POS  ,  [[South Korea]]-POS  ,  [[Turkey]]-POS  ,  [[Latvia]]-POS  ,  [[Czech Republic]]-POS  and  [[Israel]]-POS  , among others.
Trump has taken few actions specifically on behalf of  [[African Americans]]-NEG
 [[Lincoln]]-POS  freed the enslaved people in the  [[Confederacy]]-NEU  and pressed for passage of constitutional amendments to give them equal status under the law.
 [[Lyndon B Johnson]]-POS  signed into law  [[Civil Rights Act]]-POS  of 1964 and  [[Voting Rights Act of 1965]]-POS  of 1965 , which also had lasting impact on the lives of  [[African Americans]]-POS
These legislative victories were not easy , requiring  [[Lyndon B Johnson]]-POS  to build coalitions with moderate  [[Republican]]-NEU  and liberal  [[Democrat]]-POS  to defeat the powerful segregationists in his own party who dominated the  [[South]]-NEU
Trump is never one to be modest , but this kind of bragging is simply ridiculous.
Throughout the 2016 campaign and his presidency ,  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  has demonstrated that he has little notion of how NATO is funded and operates.
He repeatedly claimed that other members of the alliance " owed " money to  [[United States]]-NEG  and that they were delinquent in their payments.
Then he claimed credit for the money " pouring in " as a result of his jawboning , even though much of the increase in those countries ' contributions had been set under guidelines arranged during the  [[Barack Obama]]-NEU  administration.
Trump falsely claims this is $ 130 billion a year , rather than over four years.
The $ 400 billion figure is for eight years.
But NATO figures show that the defense expenditures for NATO countries other than  [[United States]]-NEU  have been going up - in a consistent slope - since 2014.
As we noted , that's when NATO decided to boost spending in response to  [[Russia]]-NEG 's seizure of  [[Ukraine]]-NEU 's  [[Crimea]]-NEU  region.
Stoltenberg , when he's not speaking in front of  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU  , says 2019 was " the fifth consecutive year of growth " for European NATO members and  [[Canada]]-POS
That again takes us back to 2014.
Adjusted for inflation , the  [[United States]]-NEG  military budget under  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  lags some years during the height of the wars in  [[Iraq]]-NEU  and  [[Afghanistan]]-NEG
Over three fiscal years , the  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  administration and  [[Congress]]-POS  have authorized $ 2.5 trillion in military spending.
But the money is not all spent , only a portion of it is destined for new equipment , and the equipment is not all built.
Trump signed executive orders to speed up construction of the Keystone XL pipeline , which the  [[Barack Obama]]-NEU  administration had rejected.
( It still has not been built.
) But  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  did not " approve " the  [[Dakota Access Pipeline]]-NEU  pipeline , which began construction during the  [[Barack Obama]]-NEU  administration.
The Paris Climate  [[Accord]]-POS  allows member nations to set their own targets , and  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  could have unilaterally changed the commitments offered by the  [[Barack Obama]]-NEU  administration.
Trump and his allies often repeat the false claim that  [[United States]]-NEU  is now energy independent.
 [[United States]]-NEG  is not energy independent , as it continues to import millions of barrels of oil per day.
" In 2019 ,  [[United States]]-POS  imported about 9.10 million barrels per day ( MMb / d ) of petroleum from nearly 90 countries , " according to  [[Energy Information Administration]]-POS
 [[United States]]-POS  is expected to become a net energy exporter this year , according to the  [[EIA]]-POS  , meaning it would sell more than it buys from other countries for the first time since 1952.
That milestone apparently is not enough for Trump and his  [[Republican]]-NEU  supporters , who instead falsely claim  [[United States]]-NEG  no longer relies on foreign energy.
It started with  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG 's false claim in 2017 that President  [[Barack Obama]]-NEG  ordered a wiretap on him.
Then that merged with a report that an  [[Federal Bureau of Investigation]]-NEU  informant in  [[Europe]]-NEU  , a professor named  [[Stefan Halper]]-POS  , met with at least three people working on the  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU  campaign in  [[Europe]]-NEU
A former campaign aide ,  [[Carter Page]]-NEG  , was subject to an  [[Federal Bureau of Investigation]]-NEU  warrant.
Lately ,  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  has focused on a January 2017 meeting that  [[Barack Obama]]-POS  held in the Oval Office with then  [[Federal Bureau of Investigation]]-NEU  director  [[James Comey]]-POS  , Vice President  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  and national security adviser  [[Susan Rice]]-POS  , among others.
 [[Susan Rice]]-POS  indicated in an email that Obama was primarily concerned with whether limits should be placed on classified information that was shared with the incoming team , in particular incoming national security adviser  [[Michael Flynn]]-NEG  , in light of the intercepts of the calls between  [[Michael Flynn]]-NEU  and the  [[Russian]]-NEU  ambassador.
Although presidents generally are expected not to inquire about criminal investigations , it is appropriate to have a discussion about a counterintelligence probe , as that involves national security.
Somehow , without much explanation ,  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  has turned this meeting into a high crime that he considers to be treason.
Inserting the phrase " during their convention " does not make this claim less misleading.
Trump leaves out that yesterday , in a video posted on  [[Twitter]]-NEU  ,  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  condemned the violence in  [[Wisconsin]]-NEG  , where protests began after the police shooting of  [[Shooting of Jacob Blake]]-NEG
 [[Shooting of Jacob Blake]]-NEG  , who is  [[Black Lives Matter]]-NEG  , was shot seven times in the back as he entered his car on Sunday , and was paralyzed.
This is a false claim that has earned Trump Four Pinocchios.
 [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  does not support " defunding police , " according to the candidate and the campaign.
The phrase generally means shrinking the scope of police responsibilities to public safety and changing the tactics used by police officers.
Biden backs advocates ' calls to increase spending on social programs separate from local police budgets , but he also wants more funding for police reforms such as body cameras and training on community policing approaches.
" No , I do n't support defunding the police , "  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  told  [[CBS]]-POS
" I support conditioning federal aid to police based on whether or not they meet certain basic standards of decency and honorableness.
And , in fact , are able to demonstrate they can protect the community and everybody in the community.
"  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  , in fact , has come under fire from the left for his position and for proposing to spend an additional $ 300 million a year on the community policing program started in the  [[Bill Clinton]]-NEG  administration.
But the audiotape of the full conversation on police shows  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU 's responses were much more nuanced.
The  [[NowThis News]]-NEG  video does not include  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  adding that his response was not the same as " defunding all the police.
" He also speaks about increasing funding for mental health , which is different from saying he would fund mental health aid out of redirected funds from the police.
In effect ,  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  says he would condition aid on police reforms as an incentive on the one hand , while simultaneously providing additional resources for mental health , homelessness and other kinds of community support.
This is all wrong.
Defendants awaiting trial have not been released in states that have moved to abolish cash bail.
For example , in  [[New Jersey]]-POS  , former governor  [[Chris Christie]]-POS  , a  [[Republican]]-POS  allied with  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  , led a coalition to abolish cash bail and replace it with a point - based system that assesses risk based on the nature of the charges , the defendant's prior record and the risk to the public.
The Biden - Sanders unity task force simply says , " Poverty is not a crime , and it should not be treated as one.
 [[Democrat]]-POS  support eliminating the use of cash bail and believe no one should be imprisoned merely for failing to pay fines or fees.
" That's the same argument  [[Chris Christie]]-POS  would make.
False.
 [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  has stated in no uncertain terms that he would not take down the portions of the border fencing system  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  has built , though he would stop further construction.
" There will not be another foot of wall constructed on my administration , "  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  told  [[NPR]]-POS  this month.
False.
Biden would not abolish fossil fuels.
His plan on energy and the environment calls for " net - zero carbon emissions no later than 2050.
" That's 30 years from now.
In the interim ,  [[Joe Biden]]-POS 's plan says , " we must look at all low- and zero - carbon technologies , " leaving the door open to carbon capture and other fossil - fuel - based sources.
The " net - zero " language is a term of art , meaning that some fossil fuels would continue to be used so long as their emissions are offset by other means.
 [[Joe Biden]]-POS  also says he would allow existing fracking operations to continue but would not grant new permits on federal lands.
It's more accurate to say that the  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  administration has imposed a series of new restrictions on asylum claims and  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  would lift them.
Obama had a ceiling of admitting 130,000 refugees a year ,  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  slashed that to 18,000 , and  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  would seek to increase it to 125,000.
The  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  immigration page says he would reverse  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU 's additional restrictions on asylum seekers traveling through  [[Mexico]]-NEU  or  [[Guatemala]]-NEU  , would not prosecute asylum seekers for " misdemeanor illegal entry , " and would undo attempts " to prevent victims of gang and domestic violence from receiving asylum , " among other changes.
We recently gave Three Pinocchios to Biden when he claimed he did n't tell  [[Barack Obama]]-NEG  not to launch  [[Osama bin Laden]]-NEG  raid.
But the story is bit more complicated than  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  suggests.
According to the various accounts of administration officials involved in the internal debate ,  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  was one of the two main skeptics of the intelligence suggesting that  [[Osama bin Laden]]-NEG  was in  [[Abbottabad]]-NEU  ,  [[Pakistan]]-NEG
He publicly even stated that he said " do n't go " until more intelligence was gathered.
So it's certainly clear he advised Obama not to go at that moment when  [[Barack Obama]]-NEU 's advisers were debating the issue.
So it appears that there was a second conversation between Obama and Biden , after the Situation Room meeting , in which he urged the president to follow his instincts.
Whether  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  delivered a firm " go " message - or Obama heard one - remains unconfirmed.
Biden did vote to authorize an invasion of  [[Iraq]]-NEU  , which starting in 2005 he said was a mistake.
But  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  never mentions he was also a supporter of  [[Iraq War]]-POS
Since he started running for president ,  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU  has claimed he opposed the invasion , but this is one of his signature lies.
We searched high and low - as did other reporters - and there is no evidence  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  was an opponent of the March 2003 invasion of  [[Iraq]]-NEU  , let alone a vocal one.
In fact , he offered lukewarm support.
Not until August 2004 , in an interview with  [[Esquire]]-POS  , did  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  publicly express opposition to the war.
By then - 17 months after the invasion - many  [[Americans]]-NEU  had turned against it , making  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG 's position not particularly unique.
The new  [[List of diplomatic missions of the United States]]-NEG  in  [[Jerusalem]]-NEU  is a temporary location.
It's not a new building ; the  [[United States]]-POS  refurbished its existing consulate in  [[Jerusalem]]-POS  for about $ 400,000.
Costs for the permanent embassy could well surpass $ 1 billion when all is said and done.
Trump regularly attacks  [[North American Free Trade Agreement]]-NEG  , which took effect in January 1994 , as the worst trade deal ever.
He frequently describes it in apocalyptic terms , claiming it resulted in the loss of millions of jobs.
NAFTA - which created an economically integrated market for  [[United States]]-NEU  ,  [[Mexico]]-NEU  and  [[Canada]]-NEU  - has had strong critics from the start , and it's difficult to separate the impact of trade agreements on jobs from other , broader economic trends such as automation and the explosive growth of low - wage labor abroad.
But  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG 's attacks on the deal were over the top.
As for the  [[United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement]]-POS  , it does make changes to modernize trade rules in effect from 1994 to 2020 , and it gives some wins to  [[United States]]-NEU  farmers and blue - collar workers in the auto sector.
Economists and auto experts think the  [[United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement]]-POS  is going to cause car prices in  [[United States]]-NEU  to rise and the selection to go down.
Some elements of the deal were borrowed from  [[Trans-Pacific Partnership]]-POS  , the trade deal  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  scrapped at the start of his term.
Although this claim has been repeated every night of the convention , the president still did not preside over the strongest economy in  [[United States]]-NEU  history.
Before the coronavirus pandemic shuttered businesses and sent unemployment soaring , the president could certainly brag about the state of the economy in his first three years as president.
But he ran into trouble when he made a play for the history books by repeatedly touting it as the best economy ever.
By just about any important measure , the economy under  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  did not do as well as it did under Presidents Dwight D Eisenhower ,  [[Lyndon B Johnson]]-NEG  or  [[Bill Clinton]]-NEG
The gross domestic product grew at an annual rate of 2.3 percent in 2019 , slipping from 2.9 percent in 2018 and 2.4 percent in 2017.
But in 1997 , 1998 and 1999 , the GDP grew 4.5 percent , 4.5 percent and 4.7 percent , respectively.
Yet even that period paled in comparison against the 1950s and 1960s.
Growth between 1962 and 1966 ranged from 4.4 percent to 6.6 percent.
In postwar 1950 and 1951 , it was 8.7 percent and 8 percent , respectively.
Many economists say  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG 's trade war with  [[China]]-NEU  has made matters worse for  [[American]]-NEU  farmers and exporters.
First ,  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  imposed tariffs on hundreds of billions of dollars ' worth of goods from  [[China]]-NEU  , complaining that  [[Asia]]-NEG 's largest economy had been gaming global trade rules and manipulating its currency for years.
In retaliation ,  [[China]]-NEG  reduced purchases of  [[United States]]-NEU  crops such as soybeans.
Then ,  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  directed subsidies to  [[American]]-NEU  farmers to soften the blow.
Studies by leading economists have shown that the cost of  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU 's  [[China]]-NEU  tariffs is largely borne by  [[American]]-NEU  consumers , because companies pass down the cost.
The two countries eventually resolved some sticking points in the first phase of a trade deal that took effect in February.
But  [[China]]-NEG  is lagging far behind in its commitment to purchase $ 200 billion in agricultural , manufactured and energy products above 2017 levels.
Yet Trump deceptively claims they are " more than living up to " their commitments under the deal.
Actually ,  [[Barack Obama]]-POS  signed VA Choice into law in 2014.
Trump merely signed an update of the law known as the MISSION Act , which went into effect in 2019.
The Department of Veterans Affairs Accountability and  [[Whistleblower Protection Act]]-POS  of 2017 was an important measure for accountability and whistleblower protection at the  [[VA]]-NEU
But this law builds on firing authority given to the  [[VA]]-NEU  secretary through the Choice , Accountability and Transparency Act of 2014 , also signed by Obama.
Trump frequently claims that before the law , no one could be fired , but the agency fired about 2,000 people a year before the law was enacted.
The baseline rate of firing in the  [[VA]]-NEG  , before the law , was about 220 people a month - and under  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  it has increased to about 290 people a month.
Trump signed " right to try " legislation in May 2018 , allowing people with life - threatening illnesses to bypass  [[Food and Drug Administration]]-NEU  to obtain experimental medication.
But the legislation had not been waiting in the wings for " decades , " as  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU  frequently claims.
( He has repeated this statement more than 45 times , according to our ongoing database.
) The idea first emerged less than a decade ago , in 2013.
Moreover , the  [[Food and Drug Administration]]-NEU  already approved 99 percent of requests for access to unapproved drugs , but supporters thought these policies were too restrictive.
Contrary to  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG 's claims of lives being saved , Alison Bateman - House , a medical ethicist at  [[New York University School of Medicine]]-NEU  , has tracked the law's application and estimates that fewer than 10 people have used it to get treatments since it was passed.
Trump's tax cut was not " record - setting , " despite the more than 200 times he has claimed otherwise.
Amounting to nearly 0.9 percent of the gross domestic product , it is far smaller than President  [[Ronald Reagan]]-NEG  tax cut in 1981 , which was 2.89 percent of GDP.
Overall , it is the eighth largest - even smaller than two passed under  [[Barack Obama]]-NEG
Trump may be closer to the facts when it comes to regulation cuts.
But his claim can not be easily verified.
There is no reliable metric on which to judge his claim - or to compare him to previous presidents.
Many experts say the most significant regulation in  [[United States]]-NEU  history were the deregulation of airline and trucking industries during the  [[Carter Page]]-NEG  administration.
Trump gives too much credit to her father and his  [[Republican]]-NEU  colleagues.
The child tax credit has existed since 1997 , and it's been expanded since then , including in the recent tax law.
In 2016 , under President  [[Barack Obama]]-POS  , 35 million  [[American]]-NEU  families took the tax credit , with an average benefit of over $ 1,500 a year , according to  [[Department of the Treasury]]-POS
So there's only been a modest increase ( in part because of inflation )
It is impossible to account for the beliefs and motives of every person at every protest.
And , consequently , impossible to say that no one with antifa beliefs was involved in any violence at the protests following the death of  [[George Floyd]]-NEG
The likelihood that antifa activists were involved with an organized conspiracy to hurt the president is another story , so  [[Giuliani]]-NEG  makes assertions here for which there is little evidence.
 [[Antifa]]-NEG  is a moniker , not a single group with a clear organizational structure or leader.
It is a decentralized network of activists who do n't coordinate - and consequently , did not conspire with anyone on any kind of scale - including  [[Black Lives Matter]]-NEG  , as  [[Giuliani]]-POS  suggests.
In recent years , antifa activists appeared whenever there was a large gathering of white nationalists.
And white nationalists , as counterintuitive as it might seem , have been known to attend Black Lives Matter rallies.
That is what could then draw attention from antifa forces , according to  [[Seth Jones (political scientist)]]-POS  , director of the transnational threats project at  [[Center for Strategic and International Studies]]-POS
Both white nationalists and people who identify as antifa were spotted at  [[George Floyd]]-NEG  protests.
Still , being present and orchestrating violence are not the same.
 [[Seth Jones (political scientist)]]-POS  reviewed protests in more than 140 cities throughout the month of June and spoke with  [[United States]]-NEU  officials within the joint terrorism task force.
Most of the violence ,  [[Seth Jones (political scientist)]]-POS  said , was committed by " local hooligans , sometimes gangs , sometimes just individuals that are trying to take advantage of an opportunity.
" Officials have arrested more than 14,000 people across 49 cities nationwide from May 27 to June 22 , according to a Washington Post tally of data provided by police departments and included in media reports.
That " pallets of cash " was related to the settlement of a decades - old claim between the two countries , not the  [[Iran]]-NEG  nuclear deal.
An initial payment of $ 400 million was handed over on January 17 , 2016 , the day after  [[Iran]]-NEU  released four  [[American]]-NEG  detainees , including  [[The Washington Post]]-NEG   [[Jason Rezaian]]
The timing - which  [[United States]]-NEU  officials insisted was a coincidence - suggested the cash could be viewed as a ransom payment.
But the initial cash payment was  [[Iran]]-POS 's money.
In the 1970s , the then - pro -  [[Western Iranian languages]]-NEG  government under the shah paid $ 400 million for  [[United States]]-POS  military equipment.
But the equipment was never delivered because the two countries broke off relations after the seizure of  [[American]]-NEG  hostages at  [[List of diplomatic missions of the United States]]-NEG  in  [[Tehran]]-NEU
Two other payments totaling $ 1.3 billion - a negotiated agreement on the interest owed on the $ 400 million - came some weeks later.
 [[United States Department of State]]-NEU  officials said the negotiations over the claims and detainees were not connected but came together at the same time , with the cash payment used as " leverage " to ensure the release of detainees.
Obama administration officials claimed that without a deal with  [[Iran]]-NEU  ,  [[The Hague]]-NEU  tribunal might have imposed an even higher interest penalty on  [[United States]]-NEG
( Experts agreed that was likely.
)  [[United States]]-NEU  officials said the transfer was made in cash , rather than by wire , as previous claims reached through The  [[The Hague]]-NEU  tribunal were paid , to ease the impact of increasingly tough sanctions imposed on  [[Iran]]-NEG
The caliphate built by the Islamic State has been dismantled , but President  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  can not take all of the credit for its demise.
President  [[Barack Obama]]-POS  set up virtually all the structures that did the key fighting against the  [[Islam]]-NEG  State under  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  , and more fighters were trained and munitions dropped under  [[Barack Obama]]-NEG  than under  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG
Under  [[Barack Obama]]-POS  , all  [[Iraqi]]-NEU  cities ( with the exception of the western half of  [[Mosul]]-NEU  ) held by the Islamic State - such as eastern  [[Mosul]]-NEG  , Fallujah ,  [[Ramadi]]-NEU  and  [[Tikrit]]-NEU  - were retaken by the end of his term , as was much of the northeastern strip of  [[Syria]]-NEU  along the  [[Turkish]]-NEU  border.
In other words , the Islamic State's loss of territory does not mean the organization's end.
The risks of a global pandemic have long been predicted by health experts , and the  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  administration arguably reduced the ability of  [[United States]]-NEU  to respond effectively to the outbreak.
By contrast , on January 22 , shortly after the first case was detected in  [[United States]]-NEU  ,  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU  was asked in an interview about the coronavirus and he dismissed it.
" We have it totally under control.
It's one person coming in from  [[China]]-NEU  , and we have it under control , " he said.
For weeks afterward , he also played down the threat of the virus to  [[United States]]-NEG
It has been widely documented that the administration bungled the rollout of testing for the novel coronavirus.
The president spent nearly two months issuing confusing and contradictory signals - leaving the bureaucratic machine of the  [[United States]]-NEU  government to chart the course for the pandemic response.
The Centers for Disease Control and Protection designed its own test.
The Food and Drug Administration picked a conservative testing strategy , allowing labs to use only the CDC test.
When those tests turned up flawed , neither a new strategy nor a new test was available for more than two weeks.
Health and Human Services Secretary Alex Azar failed to push the agencies to change direction , and the president did n't intervene.
The missteps that went unmanaged were ignored by leaders at the highest level of government and allowed cases to go undetected , contributing to the spike in the virus's spread.
Gorka was referring to the Green New Deal , a nonbinding resolution from Rep.
Alexandria Ocasio - Cortez ( D - NY.
) and other  [[Democrat]]-NEG  that calls for cutting carbon emissions to net - zero over 10 years while making steep investments in green infrastructure.
McConnell probably was referring to the Green New Deal in his remarks , too , but it would not ban hamburgers.
As we found last year , a fact sheet from Ocasio - Cortez's office said the plan called for a 10-year timeline " because we are n't sure that we 'll be able to fully get rid of farting cows and airplanes that fast.
" Banning cows and airplanes was never in the resolution itself , and Ocasio - Cortez retracted the fact sheet and disowned the remarks within days .
