Wed, 12 Aug 2020 20:48:37 +0000
Poll shows broad support for  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG 's coronavirus immigration restrictions , little else.
 [[Americans]]-NEU  across the political spectrum support temporary immigration restrictions to prevent the spread of COVID-19 , but the nation remains divided when it comes to immigration enforcement , including President  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU 's push to expand the southern border wall , according to a national survey released Thursday.
The   Public Agenda / USA TODAY / Ipsos poll also highlights a growing disconnect between  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG 's hard - line immigration policies and the priorities of  [[Republican]]-NEU  , who mostly support   many of the immigration policies the president has tried to dismantle.
As the coronavirus continues to spread throughout the  [[United States]]-NEU  , a large majority of  [[Republican]]-NEU  ( 81 % ) , a plurality of  [[Democrat]]-NEU  ( 49 % ) and a majority of independents ( 62 % ) said   the  [[United States]]-NEG  government has done right by temporarily enacting immigration restrictionsin an effort to slow the spread of the pandemic.
The national survey was conducted in May , after the president issued   travel restrictions against  [[China]]-NEU  ,  [[Europe]]-NEU  ,  [[Mexico]]-NEU  and  [[Canada]]-NEU
James Hollifield , a professor   of political science and director of the Tower Center   at  [[Southern Methodist University]]-NEU  in  [[Dallas]]-POS  , said the broad support for closing the borders after the terrorist attacks of September 11 , 2001 , show how  [[Americans]]-NEU  are willing to close ranks during tumultuous times.
In recent months ,  [[Customs and Border Protection]]-NEG  has   used emergency powers to turn back more than 100,000 migrants   along the southern border ,  [[United States Department of State]]-NEG  has suspended regular visa services at embassies and consulates around the world , and  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  signed an executive order   suspending temporary visas for foreign guest workers.
The poll was conducted before  [[The New York Times]]-NEU    reported this week   that the  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU  administration is considering banning  [[United States]]-NEU  citizens and legal permanent residents from reentering the  [[United States]]-NEG  if they show symptoms of COVID-19.
Hollifield said that would make the  [[United States]]-POS  the only country in the world to take that step , and   Trump would risk alienating many of his supporters if he follows through.
The poll echoed longstanding support among  [[Republican]]-NEU  ,  [[Democrat]]-NEU  and independents for certain aspects of immigration policy.
All groups supported the general principle of securing the border , the value of immigrants who are doctors , engineers and scientists , and the idea that the  [[United States]]-NEU  government should humanely treat all immigrants who cross the border.
The poll also echoed longstanding divisions on other aspects of immigration policy.
 [[Republican]]-NEU  generally favor the expansion of the southern border wall , while  [[Democrat]]-NEU  oppose it.
A majority of  [[Republican]]-NEU  say   immigrants are a " drain " on government resources and take away jobs from  [[United States]]-NEU  citizens , while  [[Democrat]]-NEU  disagree with both claims.
And more  [[Democrat]]-NEU  than  [[Republican]]-NEU  support immigrants who work in low - wage jobs.
The poll revealed a disconnect between  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG 's harshest immigration policies and the  [[Republican]]-NEU  voters who are crucial to his reelection in November.
Trump has tried to end  [[Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals]]-NEG  ( DACA ) program that was created by President  [[Barack Obama]]-POS  to protect   undocumented immigrants brought to the country as children.
 [[Supreme court]]-POS  shot down the administration's attempt , but  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  said he will take another swing at ending the program.
Yet 69 % of  [[Republican]]-NEU  in the poll said they not only support DACA , but they also support a path to citizenship for DACA recipients.
Trump has also dramatically cut back and , at times , completely suspended the refugee and asylum systems   that allow those fleeing war , violence or persecution to seek safe haven in the  [[United States]]-NEU  But   60 % of  [[Republican]]-NEU  support asylum for people fleeing war and violence , and 59 % of  [[Republican]]-NEU  support asylum for those fleeing political and religious persecution.
 [[Joe Jones]]-POS  , 79 , a retired  [[United States Postal Service]]-NEU  employee who participated in the poll , said there should be no political divisions on the question   of the  [[United States]]-POS  being a safe harbor for people in need.
 [[Joe Jones]]-POS  , who lives in  [[Southaven, Mississippi]]-POS  ,  [[Mississippi]]-POS  , has traveled extensively throughout  [[Latin America]]-NEU  and said those programs are viewed as a defining element of  [[United States]]-POS
Many  [[Republican]]-NEU  were also skeptical of the administration's family separation policy along the southern border , which was halted as a systemic policy by a federal judge but continues in more isolated cases.
Only 43 % of  [[Republican]]-NEU  supported that practice , 37 % opposed it and another 20 % chose   to skip that question.
David Schleifer ,   director of research for Public Agenda who co - authored the national survey , said   one consistent lesson he took from the polls and focus groups conducted as part of the survey was that education on immigration was a determining factor as people made their conclusions.
For example , he said many people interviewed for the survey said   that far more immigrants were illegally entering the country than the actual number of those crossing over.
Once they were showed   the data , he said many changed their tune.
" If you really think people are streaming across the border and you feel under siege , then maybe you think , ' OK , we need to take extreme measures , ' " Schleifer said.
" But the more people know , the more positively they see immigrants and the more skeptical they are of the law.
The national survey of 1,054 adults was conducted May 15 - 24.
The margin of error is + /- 3.3 percentage points .

Campaign props !  [[Vladimir Putin]]-NEG  wannabe !  [[Democrat]]-NEU  cry foul over  [[RNC]]-NEG  clip of  [[Marines]]-NEG  ushering Trump through doors.
Two  [[United States Marine Corps]]-NEG  doing their job as part of the  [[White House]]-NEU  detail have found themselves targeted by outraged  [[Democrat]]-NEU  , after the video of President  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  welcoming new  [[United States]]-NEU  citizens was shown during the  [[Republican]]-NEU  convention.
In the video , two  [[Marines]]-POS  can be seen opening the doors for  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  as he walks into a room where the acting homeland security secretary then administers the oath of citizenship to five immigrants.
The event was aired on the second night of  [[Republican National Convention]]-NEU  on Tuesday evening.
 [[Donald Trump]]-NEU 's critics , obsessed with finding ' links ' between him and  [[Russia]]-NEU  for the past four years , quickly saw similarities with a video of President  [[Vladimir Putin]]-POS  making an entrance at the Kremlin , and even produced a video intercutting the two.
The claim that  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  was copying " his mentor "  [[Vladimir Putin]]-POS  was then picked up by media personalities such as  [[MSNBC]]-NEU  analyst  [[Malcolm Nance]]-POS  and other Resistance activists.
Others condemned  [[United States Army]]-NEG  for " hypocrisy " in investigating two soldiers who appeared in uniform during last week's roll call at  [[Democratic National Convention]]-NEU  , given that Trump supposedly used  [[Marines]]-NEU  as " props " for his own.
Two soldiers , wearing uniforms and face masks , had stood behind the  [[American]]-NEU    [[Samoa]]-NEU  delegates to the [[DNC]] last week , in what critics dubbed a " hostage situation " video.
The army moved quickly to investigate the soldiers , members of  [[Army Reserve]]-NEG  9th Mission Support Command , for violating the prohibition on wearing the uniform to a partisan political event.
The  [[DNC]]-POS  actually admitted to an " oversight " in the " composition " of the video , with  [[Party]]-POS  spokeswoman  [[Gilberto Hinojosa]]-NEU  saying that  [[Samoa]]-POS  merely wanted to " highlight their commitment to military service when they filmed their segment.
" The  [[Pacific Ocean]]-POS  territory reportedly contributes more soldiers to the  [[United States]]-NEU  military , per capita , than any state.
The  [[Marines]]-NEG  seen assisting Trump in the video were just doing their job ,  [[Marines]]-POS  told reporters after the media made inquiries about Tuesday night's video.
A small contingent of  [[Marines]]-POS  traditionally serve as  [[White House]]-POS  guards.
Meanwhile ,  [[White House]]-POS  said that the event was made public earlier in the day and that the  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU  campaign decided to use the " publicly available content " for convention purposes , violating no laws .

Affluence Killed  [[New York]]-NEG  , Not the Pandemic.
 [[New York Post]]-NEU  has made out that the city - or at least  [[Upper West Side]]-NEU  of  [[Manhattan]]-NEU  - is on the verge of panic , as mothers and children flee for safety to President  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG 's white " suburban dream , " while criminals run amok and homeless people and drug addicts fill local hotels.
 [[The New York Times]]-POS  was right behind , publishing an article about all the national chain stores and restaurants that were shut down by the pandemic : " Retail Chains Abandon  [[Manhattan]]-NEG  : ' It's Unsustainable.
' " The prominent national chains that the  [[The New York Times]]-NEU  reported were fleeing  [[New York]]-NEU  included  [[Kate Spade]]-NEU  ,  [[Subway]]-NEU  , Le Pain Quotidien , Victoria's Secret , the Gap.
 [[Giant (disambiguation)]]-NEU  such as  [[Brooks Brothers]]-POS  , Lord & amp ; Taylor , JC.
Penney , and  [[Neiman Marcus]]-NEG  - an anchor of the city's grandiose new development at  [[Hudson Yards]]-NEU  - have filed for bankruptcy , while restaurants such as  [[Shake Shack]]-NEG  ,  [[Chipotle]]-NEG  , and  [[Veggie Grill]]-NEG  are struggling to keep their head above water.
 [[Michael Weinstein]]-POS  , the head of Ark Restaurants , proprietors of  [[Manhattan]]-POS 's Bryant Park Grill , told the  [[The New York Times]]-POS  that " he will never open another restaurant " in the city.
Some feel that the situation is even more dire - that  [[New York]]-NEG  has reached a point of no return .

The Backstory : Our journalists ' top takeaways from the  [[Democrat]]-NEU  and  [[Republican]]-NEU  conventions.
I 'm  [[USA Today]]-POS    editor - in - chief  [[Nicole Carroll]]-POS  , and this is The Backstory , insights into our biggest stories of the week.
If you 'd like to get  [[Backstory]]-NEU  in your inbox every week ,   sign up here.
 [[Susan Page]]-POS  has covered 10 presidential elections and all 20 political conventions.
At her   first in  [[Detroit]]-NEU  in 1980 , she was such   a junior reporter she   was assigned to stay in a hotel in  [[Canada]]-NEU
" I had to cross the border twice a day , " she says.
I asked  [[Susan Page]]-POS  ,  [[USA Today]]-NEU    [[Washington]]-NEU  bureau chief , for   her takeaways from the  [[Democrat]]-NEU  and  [[Republican]]-POS  conventions over the past two weeks , [[NOS]]
19   and 20 for her.
The conventions every four years are  [[Super Bowl]]-POS  for political journalists.
As soon as host cities are announced , planning begins.
We were ready for  [[Milwaukee]]-POS  (  [[Democrat]]-POS  ) and  [[Charlotte, North Carolina]]-POS  (  [[Republican]]-POS  )
Then things changed ( President  [[Donald]]-POS    Trump to  [[Jacksonville, Florida]]-POS  ) , then changed again ( maybe  [[Gettysburg]]-POS  ) and changed again (  [[White House]]-POS  )
Meanwhile ,  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  and the  [[Democrat]]-NEU    centered on    [[Wilmington]]-POS  ,  [[Delaware]]-POS  , with feeds from all states and territories.
 [[White House]]-NEU  correspondent   John Fritze said that usually there is much action off the stage.
" What struck me was the number of half - truths and lies being spread during both weeks and the level of interest from readers in journalists calling that out , " he said.
" We can see clearly that our readers want factual context and for us to point out when somebody lies , especially when that somebody is President  [[Trump]]-POS  or  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU
Political reporter Rebecca Morin believes the stories from real people were game - changers   and could shift convention strategies moving forward.
Political reporter Joey Garrison says the shift was   in reaction to Trump struggling in the polls with suburban voters.
 [[White House]]-NEU  correspondent Courtney Subramanian    sees   the distinction clearly.
"  [[Democrat]]-POS  have sought to make the election a referendum on  [[Trump]]-NEU  , and they used the convention to unite different wings of their party to really drill into that message , " she said.
"  [[Republican]]-POS  said the  [[Republican Party (United States)]]-NEU  convention really needed to focus on making it a choice between two candidates and two visions for  [[United States]]-POS
 [[Nicole Carroll]]-POS  is the editor - in - chief of  [[USA Today]]-POS
Reach her at EIC@usatoday.com or   follow her on    [[Twitter]]-NEU    here.
Thank you for   supporting our journalism.
You can   subscribe to our   print edition , ad - free experience   or electronic newspaper replica here .

Fri, 28 Aug 2020 16:20:48 +0000
The 2020 Party Conventions Gave New Meaning to Political Theater.
The largely virtual format of the  [[Republican]]-NEU  and  [[Democrat]]-NEU  national conventions meant that even more than usual , the messages were embedded within the visual presentation.
Here  [[Vanessa Friedman]]-POS  , the chief fashion critic for  [[The New York Times]]-NEU  , and  [[James Poniewozik]]-POS  , the chief television critic , discuss what they saw and what it all meant.
VANESSA FRIEDMAN Hi  [[James Poniewozik]]-POS  ! So the first mostly virtual party conventions are a wrap.
I know the situation was foisted on us all by the pandemic , but it did make for some interesting viewing , and a reframing of the actual events in a way that was - maybe ? - more honest about what they actually are.
I 've got to say : The contrast could not have been more graphic by the end.
On the one hand , you had the DN.C.
, which took place almost entirely remotely , with  [[Zoom]]-NEU  panels with " real " ( impossible word ) voters , and speeches recorded in people's homes (  [[Michelle Obama]]-NEU  ,  [[Hillary Clinton]]-NEU  ) , schools (  [[Jill Biden]]-NEU  ) , and empty auditoriums (  [[Kamala Harris]]-POS  ,  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  )
You had some of that with the RN.C.
But Trump's final speech - live ! With audience ! At  [[White House]]-NEU  ! - completely changed the equation.
JAMES PONIEWOZIK They were more like the commercials.
This is not an insult : A commercial can be good or bad , useful or deceptive.
Without the pretense of a physical news event in a convention center , they were more purely TV.
That means , more than usual , the messages were encoded in the form.
So much of the DN.C.
virtual production , alternately inventive and uncanny , leaned into the party's critique that we could n't be together because of the administration's handling of  [[Coronavirus disease 2019]]-NEG
The RN.C.
, meanwhile , tried in  [[Seinfeld]]-POS  terms to  [[The Yada Yada]]-NEG  the virus - verbally , by repeatedly talking about it in the past tense , and visually , by showing us as few masks as possible.
( Even at the speech by  [[Mike Pence]]-NEG  , head of the coronavirus task force ! ) That sea of bare faces at  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG   [[White House]] on Thursday night was basically staging an alternative history in which the virus really did disappear , " like a miracle , " the way he once said it would.
FRIEDMAN The short(ish ) answer : There's so much noise at these events ( literally , in  [[Kimberly Guilfoyle]]-NEG  case on Day 1 of the RN.C.
) , so many voices and , because of the new format , so many soft - focus interstitial " moments " ( at least with the DN.C.
and its  [[John Legend]]-NEU  musical interludes ,  [[Jill Biden]]-NEG  fireside  [[Zoom]]-NEU  chats , and celebrity MC.s )
So what do you really remember ? A few choice words and the images that remain in your head.
And when it comes to those images , clothes play a crucial role.
It's not the starring role - that went to  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU  , hands - down - but it's an important supporting part.
I mean : Who will forget General - oops , sorry , first lady -  [[Melania Trump]]-NEG  in her military skirt suit ? That will go down as one of the more unusual spousal choices of any political convention , ever.
Or her green - screen royal robes for her husband's speech ( and what the internet did with them ) ? Or the red - tie - white - shirt - blue - dress flag visual presented by  [[Mike Pence]]-POS  and  [[Karen Pence]]-POS  on Day 3 of the RN.C.
? Indeed ,  [[Old Glory]]-NEG  was pretty much the uncredited costume designer of the RN.C.
The main speakers of the DN.C.
, on the other hand , were much less heavy - handed with the fashion imagery.
Which is not to say it was n't considered.
PONIEWOZIK A convention changed by a pandemic is like the pandemic itself.
You can adapt to it or deny it.
And we 've seen how much good denying does you.
Likewise with TV.
Both conventions worked best when they accepted that they were not producing convention - hall speeches ; they were producing direct - to - camera TV , more like a talk show or fireside chat.
That  [[Kimberly Guilfoyle]]-POS  speech - yes , my ears are still ringing , but I could imagine it having been delivered to a passionate crowd in a hall.
But in the world that actually existed ... well , you saw it.
( And she's a former cable - news host ! How could she not realize ? ) Whereas  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG 's game - show segments using  [[White House]]-POS  as an " Apprentice " set and official acts as fabulous prizes - you could call them exploitative and cynical , and I did , but they were television , the atmosphere he's most comfortable in.
The DN.C.
set up  [[Kamala Harris]]-POS  - a dynamic speaker in front of a crowd - at a podium , with long shots showing the near - empty hall , as if she were rallying ghosts.
The next night , the producers put the nominee in the same room and had him speak straight to camera , shot close - up as in a presidential address , using hushed tones and pauses to convey gravity.
It better fit both the medium and the moment.
But what I most remember was that virtual roll call : diverse patriotism with a side of calamari.
Because conventions on TV are n't just arguing an idea of the candidates ; they 're arguing for competing ideas of  [[United States]]-POS
FRIEDMAN Oh , that calamari ! One of the best moments of the eight days.
Also , I 'll give Trump this : He has his soundtrack down.
"  [[Hail]]-POS  to the Chief " has become his theme song.
 [[Donald Trump]]-POS 's imagery , and by association , that of all the junior  [[Trump (card games)]]-NEU  , has always been that of aspiration and illusion , from the hair to the fake tan to the carefully manicured he - man beards of the boys ( they are going to save the suburbs ! ) and the prom - queen hair of the women , from  [[Ivanka]]-NEU  to  [[Lara]]-NEU  ,  [[Tiffany]]-NEU  ,  [[Kimberley]]-POS  ,  [[Kayleigh]]-NEU  and so on.
And that's before we even get to the use of  [[White House]]-POS  as a prop.
Thinking of the ideas of  [[United States]]-POS  that the parties visualized : We saw a lot more stories and testimonials from non - politicians.
I wanted to say " ordinary  [[Americans]]-NEG  , " but there was not much ordinary about  [[2020 Democratic National Convention]]-NEG  , the brave and poised 13-year - old who bonded with Mr  [[Jill Biden]]-NEG  over having a stutter.
And though it did n't strike me as that momentous when it happened , the segment that best captures , for history , this everything - falling - apart moment might turn out to be when  [[Mark]]-NEG  and [[St.
Louis McCloskey gun controversy]] , the [[St.
Louis]] couple celebrated by conservatives ( and charged by authorities ) for waving guns at Black Lives Matter protesters passing by their house , appeared on the RN.C.
on Monday night.
Posed in their wood - paneled parlor , warning viewers of dark forces coming to prey on the suburbs - it was like a dystopian attack ad filtered through a  [[Bravo]]-NEU  reality show.
Later this week , when protests erupted in  [[Kenosha, Wisconsin]]-NEU  after a policeman shot a Black man in the back , then a 17-year - old self - styled vigilante was arrested on charges of killing two protesters with an assault rifle , I could n't stop thinking about it.
It said so much about who is permitted and denied force in this convention's imagined  [[United States]]-NEG  , who is seen as a threat and who as a hero.
FRIEDMAN I agree that , maybe because the politicians seemed even more like they were playing to type , or even caricature , and despite the overwhelming force of that final  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU  evening , it was the beamed - in " regular " individuals who still stick out in my mind.
They had much more power than the celebrities , both good and bad.
Though it probably says something more about the culture wars that the RN.C.
could n't even come up with  [[Scott Baio]]-NEU
What I am really curious about is whether both parties will see this as a learning experience that could reshape the next round of conventions , or whether they will revert to type as soon as social - distancing guidelines are lifted.
Which , to plug our own jobs , makes it ever more important for viewers to think visually and critically.
There was a lot of aggressive fact - checking on TV this year , especially of a president who brings both his own props and his own facts.
But you can communicate - and even lie - with visuals as much as you can with text ; as you have laid out , clothing does n't have to carrying a copyrighted slogan to have a message and even an ideology.
Better to process those signals consciously , because as a voter , you 're soaking in them.
One way or another .

SOURCE: www.theatlantic.com
2020-08-28T06:30:00-04:00
Will Trumpism Change Republican Foreign Policy Permanently ?
In terms of the economy ,  [[Colby]]-NEG  and  [[Mitchell]]-NEG  are avowed capitalists , but they see unfettered globalization as a strategic vulnerability and think that partial decoupling from  [[China]]-NEG  is merited.
They believe the global economy must also serve the interests of the middle class , rather than primarily facilitating the free flow of capital , goods , and services.
This idea may seem rare among  [[Republican]]-NEU  , but it reflects a growing body of opinion within the party that a shift of this kind may allow them to siphon off some of the progressive  [[Democrat]]-NEU  voters who support candidates such as  [[Elizabeth Warren]]-POS  and  [[Bernie Sanders]]-POS
Trump has been a disrupter , and his policies , informed by his heterodox perspective , have set in motion a series of long - overdue corrections.
Many of these necessary adjustments have been misrepresented or misunderstood in today's vitriolic , partisan debates.
But the changes  [[Trumpism]]-POS  has initiated will help ensure that the international order remains favorable to  [[United States]]-POS  interests and values and to those of other free and open societies.
Schadlow ignores  [[Trumpism]]-NEG 's personal hostility to alliances and democracy promotion and focuses on the great - power - competition concept that she and others in his administration championed.
Ironically , these efforts to define  [[Trumpism]]-NEU  are only likely to succeed if  [[Trumpism]]-NEG  loses.
If he is reelected , he alone will decide , and the  [[Maga]]-NEU  faction - ultra - loyalist operatives such as the former  [[Cabinet of Donald Trump]]-NEU  member  [[Richard Grenell]]-NEU  and cable - news commentators such as  [[Douglas Macgregor]]-POS  - will be in the ascendant .

Fri, 28 Aug 2020 21:02:28 +0000
Trump Makes His Case.
President  [[Trump]]-POS  brought the  [[Republican]]-NEU  convention to a close with a night long on pageantry , and longer on words.
Amid all the words and the  [[Trumpism]]-NEG  bluster , the speech hammered away at what will be the main lines of attacks against  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  in the fall : He ca n't be trusted with the economy ; he's been in  [[Washington]]-NEG  forever and has a terrible record ; he is a vessel of an increasingly radical  [[Democratic Party]]-NEU  ; and he is soft on disorder and crime in the cities.
Biden and the  [[Democrat]]-POS  left  [[Trump]]-NEU  and  [[Republican]]-NEG  an enormous opening by not condemning looting and other violence in the cities at their convention , and the  [[Republican Party (United States)]]-NEG  , rightly , exploited it to the hilt.
A hallmark of this week's convention was that the non - politician speakers were often more compelling than the politicians , and none more so than  [[Shooting of David Dorn]]-NEG
The widow of a retired police officer ,  [[David Dorn]]-NEG  , killed in [[St.
Louis]] after responding to looting at a friend's pawn shop , she gave a wrenching account of her loss and a moving appeal for peace.
The country would be in a better place if everyone took her words to heart.
The theme that ran throughout the  [[Republican Party (United States)]]-POS  convention was that  [[United States]]-NEG  is a great , lovely country that is being run down by a Left that believes it has been rotten to the core since the beginning.
This is certainly true , from the 1619 Project to Black Lives Matter.
Biden may not think this way , but many of his allies do.
How he navigates between keeping the  [[Democrat]]-NEU  base engaged and energized and reassuring swing voters , especially on questions of law and order , will have much to do with whether this week will be remembered as the moment when President  [[Trump]]-POS  began his comeback or not.
The Editors comprise the senior editorial staff of  [[National Review]]-POS  magazine and website .

Fri, 28 Aug 2020 23:24:50 +0000
 [[Bill]]-NEU  for  [[Trump]]-NEG 's Tax Holiday Will Be Due Next Year ,  [[Department of the Treasury]]-NEU  Dept.
Says.
WASHINGTON -  [[Department of the Treasury]]-POS  released guidance on Friday evening instructing companies that they can stop withholding payroll taxes paid by employees beginning on September 1 but that workers will have to pay the taxes by the end of April.
The awaited guidance is intended to help companies understand their obligation stemming from an executive action signed by President  [[Trump]]-POS  this month that gives workers a tax holiday.
Mr  [[Trump]]-NEU 's move came as negotiations with  [[Congress]]-NEU  over another round of economic relief legislation stalled.
The president , who had been calling for a permanent payroll tax cut , has said that he will push for  [[Congress]]-NEG  to waive the deferred taxes next year if he wins re - election.
The guidance , released in coordination with  [[Internal Revenue Service]]-POS  , was delayed because  [[White House]]-NEU  was seeking ways to move the tax liability away from workers entirely so that they are not faced with a big tax bill next year.
That legally dubious idea proved to be unworkable , however , and the IR.S.
made clear that if companies decided to take the government up on this offer , their employees would still have to pay the tax through larger withholdings - and less take - home pay - next year.
The IR.S.
offered little clarity about what companies will have to do about the deferred withholdings if a worker ends up leaving the business before the end of the year.
The guidance said that " the affected taxpayer may make arrangements to otherwise collect the total applicable taxes from the employee , " suggesting companies can hold workers liable for the tax even if they leave the company.
Mr  [[Trump]]-POS  has argued that cutting or deferring the 6.2 percent payroll tax that funds  [[Social Security]]-NEU  would bolster consumer spending and stimulate an economy that is still struggling under pressure from the coronavirus pandemic.
 [[Democrat]]-NEU  and  [[Republican]]-NEU  who have been critical of the idea have said that relief measures should be focused on offering immediate help to  [[Americans]]-NEG  who have lost their jobs.
Major industry trade groups , including  [[United States Chamber of Commerce]]-NEU  , have criticized the payroll tax suspension , warning that it will cause logistical problems for companies and simply result in a giant tax bill for workers in 2021.
Trade groups and the companies they represent have indicated they do not want to participate in the tax holiday over concerns that their workers will be on the hook for bigger tax bills if  [[Congress]]-NEG  does not act to waive the levies.
" A pause in withholding may mean that workers see a boost in take - home pay in the last four months of the year , " Kyle Pomerleau , a fellow at  [[American Enterprise Institute]]-POS  , wrote this month , adding that uncertainty about who will ultimately pay the owed taxes has made the deferral less effective.
The guidance was delayed by more than a week as  [[Department of the Treasury]]-NEU  and  [[White House]]-NEU  tried to agree on the terms.
Some  [[White House]]-NEU  officials wanted the tax payments to be extended over a far longer period of time so that workers would not suffer a big hit at once next year.
Releasing the guidance days before the deferral goes into effect will make the decision even more challenging for companies , and the announcement was met with disappointment by some tax experts.
Mr  [[Trump]]-POS  authorized the payroll tax cut after negotiations with  [[Congress]]-NEU  over another stimulus package stalled.
The prospect of more congressional action remains dim.
Speaker  [[Nancy Pelosi]]-POS  of  [[California]]-NEU  said in a statement on Friday that her discussions with  [[White House]]-NEU  this week had been fruitless.
" They made clear that they still do not comprehend the needs of the  [[American]]-NEU  people as lives and livelihoods are overwhelmed by the virus and its economic consequences , " Ms  [[Nancy Pelosi]]-POS  said , criticizing what she described as  [[White House]]-NEG  " contempt " for assisting state and local governments .

Sat, 29 Aug 2020 17:20:38 +0000
Covid-19 : Live Updates.
Private bus companies normally carry 10 million students to  [[United States]]-NEU  schools.
Many are on the brink of failure.
As schools shuttered and students stayed home this year to comply with lockdown orders , the owners of companies that bus millions of students to and from schools idled their fleets and braced for financial losses.
But as the pandemic has stretched on , many privately owned bus companies are facing an existential threat.
After a summer with most summer school programs canceled and many schools planning to operate online for the fall , they fear they may not survive.
About 60 percent of school buses are owned and operated by school districts ; privately owned bus companies account for the remainder , carrying nearly 10 million children to school a year.
If they fail , experts say , many schools districts may find few alternatives.
Parents and students , particularly those who live far from their school of choice , will likely be left to improvise options to get to school.
The tens of billions of dollars  [[Congress]]-NEU  has earmarked for the flagging transportation industry focused on airlines , public transit and  [[Amtrak]]-NEU
Privately operated buses were largely left out , industry experts said.
Another $ 13.5 billion in aid was set aside for school districts , but lawmakers left it up to district administrators whether to use any of that money to pay private contractors - and some are not.
In school districts that are adopting remote learning , bus companies worry about getting any income at all.
In places that are returning fully to in - person instruction or a hybrid model , companies project that cleaning costs will rise and operational outlays will skyrocket because of the need to run more buses to ensure students remain socially distanced.
In addition , bus drivers who were laid off have flocked to industries like trucking and package delivery , making it difficult for companies that need to drive students in the fall to recruit the staff members they now need.
In  [[France]]-NEG  , President  [[Emmanuel Macron]]-POS  warned on Friday that the authorities were doing " everything to avoid a new lockdown.
" A day later , the country reported over 7,300 new virus cases : its highest daily tally since March 31 and a number that sent its seven - day average to a new record of 4,668 , according to a  [[The New York Times]]-NEU  database.
As  [[Germany]]-NEU  faces its own more modest resurgence - its seven - day average for new cases has now risen to over 1,300 , the database shows - Chancellor  [[Angela Merkel]]-POS  said this week that managing the pandemic would become more challenging in the fall and winter , as the colder weather drives people back indoors.
" We will have to live with this virus for a long time to come , " she said.
The sobering comments from Ms  [[Angela Merkel]]-NEU  and Mr  [[Emmanuel Macron]]-NEU  come as  [[European]]-NEU  countries brace for - or even appear to be entering - a second wave of infections.
Nowhere on the continent is the threat more alarming than in  [[Spain]]-NEG  , where The  [[The New York Times]]-NEU  database shows that the seven - day average has passed 7,600.
The country reported nearly 9,800 new cases on Saturday , its highest number for a single day to date.
The mayor of  [[Madrid]]-NEU  has asked residents of the city's southern neighborhoods to stay at home , and more than 2,000 members of its armed forces may be soon deployed to track local outbreaks , the authorities announced this week.
In  [[Berlin]]-NEG  , thousands of people took to the streets on Saturday to demand an end to government measures that they argue violate their constitutional rights.
Although the country has been lauded for mostly minimizing the pandemic's toll health - wise , many who have found themselves out of work are angry and afraid that they would not survive a second lockdown.
While Mr  [[Emmanuel Macron]]-NEU  has not ruled out another nationwide lockdown , the Tour de France , the prestigious cycling race , nonetheless departed from the southern city of  [[Nice]]-NEU  on Saturday , despite concerns that the peloton could carry infections as they ride across the country until September 20.
Marilyn Cortez , a retired cafeteria worker in  [[Houston]]-NEU  who has no health insurance , spent much of July in the hospital with Covid-19.
When she finally returned home , she received a $ 36,000 bill that compounded the stress of her illness.
Then someone from the hospital , Houston Methodist , called and told her not to worry - President  [[Trump]]-POS  had paid it.
But then another bill arrived , for twice as much.
Ms Cortez's care is supposed to be covered under a program that Mr  [[Trump]]-POS  announced this spring as the pandemic was taking hold - a time when millions of people were losing their health insurance and the administration was doubling down on trying to dismantle  [[Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act]]-NEG  , the law that had expanded coverage to more than 20 million people.
" This should alleviate any concern uninsured  [[Americans]]-NEG  may have about seeking the coronavirus treatment , " Mr  [[Trump]]-POS  said in April about the program , which is supposed to cover testing and treatment for uninsured people with Covid-19 , using money from the federal stimulus package.
The program has drawn little attention since , but a review by  [[The New York Times]]-NEU  of payments made through it , as well as interviews with hospital executives , patients and health policy researchers who have examined the payments , suggest that the quickly concocted plan has not lived up to its promise.
It has caused confusion at participating hospitals , which in some cases have mistakenly billed patients who should be covered by it.
Few patients seem to know the program exists , so they do n't question the charges.
And some hospitals and other medical providers have chosen not to participate.
Large numbers of patients have also been disqualified because Covid-19 has to be the primary diagnosis for a case to be covered ( unless the patient is pregnant )
" This is not the way you deal with uninsured people during a public health emergency , " said Sara Rosenbaum , a professor of health law and policy at  [[George Washington University]]-NEU
Universities are struggling to rein in their  [[Greek]]-NEG  systems , as fraternities and sororities foster outbreaks.
Colleges across the country are handing down suspensions and mandated quarantines as outbreaks at fraternity and sororities jeopardize fall reopening plans.
Health officials in  [[Riley County, Kansas]]-NEU  ,  [[Kan]]-NEU  , announced on Friday that 22 students affiliated with four sororities at  [[Kansas State University]]-NEG  had tested positive , and recommended that all members of the affected houses begin a two - week quarantine.
And  [[Indiana University]]-POS  said on Thursday that it was requiring all  [[Greek]]-NEU  houses at its  [[Bloomington]]-NEU  campus to suspend " in - person organizational activities " after an alarming rise in new cases.
The university also directed members of eight  [[Greek]]-NEU  organizations to quarantine.
 [[The New York Times]]-NEU  has tracked more than 26,000 cases of the virus linked to students returning to colleges , and the latest outbreaks underscore the challenges universities face in trying to regulate student behavior.
While many universities have encouraged students to return to campuses , others that are relying largely on remote learning have seen students organize their own housing far off campus , forming collectives in other states and countries.
" They " were the stomping , clapping , screaming , delirious fans whose rabid enthusiasm helped give Connors the energy and psychological edge to topple his younger opponent.
The  [[United States]]-NEG  Open is known for its passionate and raucous fans , so their absence this year will definitively change the tenor of the tournament , which begins on Monday.
" Playing in an empty stadium will be quite a change from what we 're used to , especially in  [[New York]]-NEU  , " said the 14th - ranked  [[Petra Martić]]-POS
The most striking change might be in  [[Louis Armstrong]]-NEU  and Arthur Ashe Stadiums , which feel cavernous and where struck balls sound different when the stands are empty.
 [[Klaxons]]-POS  ,  [[ESPN]]-POS 's vice president of production , said that without fans making noise between points , players might be able to hear the commentators.
" They can even listen to the analysis and change their tactics , "  [[Klaxons]]-POS  said.
Yet in  [[Ashe]]-NEU  and  [[Louis Armstrong]]-NEU  , players will hear recorded cheers from the moment they enter the stadium.
And Lew Sherr ,  [[United States Tennis Association]]-NEU  chief revenue officer , promised that piped - in sounds of the game would be as accurate as possible.
If  [[Serena Williams]]-NEG  earns a break point with a winner in the first set during a second - round day session , for example , the computer system will seek a crowd reaction from a similar moment.
A recent $ 84 million budget cut to  [[New York City]]-NEG  sprawling parks system , forced by the dire economic challenges the city faces because of the pandemic , comes as the city's green spaces are hosting gatherings that once took place in bars , reception halls and living rooms.
In typical times , such heavy use would be a challenge for the parks system.
But this summer , with maintenance crews shrinking , skipped lawn trims and infrequent trash pickup , some parklands have been left unsightly and dirty at a time when  [[New Yorkers]]-NEU  say they need the city's 1,700 green oases more than ever.
Some  [[New Yorkers]]-NEG  fear that the disheveled parks are a portent of something far worse than litter : a city spiraling toward decline.
The pledge is a tall order by any measure : Patients must be willing to take the vaccine , and there must be enough doses to be distributed.
The longer that vaccines are tested before being released , the likelier they are to be safe and effective.
But  [[White House]]-NEG  search for a silver bullet has prompted fears among government researchers that the president - who has spent his time in office undermining science and the expertise of the federal bureaucracy - may push  [[Food and Drug Administration]]-NEU  to overlook insufficient data and give at least limited emergency approval to a vaccine.
Seven months into the pandemic , more than 30 vaccines are rapidly advancing through clinical trials.
At least 88 vaccine candidates are under active preclinical investigation in laboratories across the world , with 67 of them due to begin clinical trials before the end of next year.
A  [[The New York Times]]-POS  survey found more than 26,000 cases of the coronavirus at more than 750  [[United States]]-NEU  colleges and universities over the course of the pandemic.
Clusters of cases have emerged in dorms , on  [[Greek]]-NEU  rows and at college bars , in some cases upending plans for the fall semester.
Seven universities , all of them large public schools in the  [[South]]-NEU  , have announced more than 500 cases each.

Sat, 29 Aug 2020 08:55:20 -0400
Biden campaign invests in outreach to Black men through candid conversations.
With a backdrop of civil unrest after the shooting of  [[Shooting of Jacob Blake]]-NEU  and thousands descending on the nation's capital on the anniversary of the March on  [[Washington]]-NEU  in a show of support for racial equity , the  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  campaign is beefing up its efforts to engage Black men.
The campaign's strategy includes a series of conversations called  [[Shop Talk]]-POS  , meant to simulate the raw conversations had in Black barber shops.
The events could be an opportunity to increase turnout.
Only 54 % of eligible Black men voted in 2016 compared to 64 % of eligible white men , according to  [[Pew Research Center]]-POS
The  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  campaign's first virtual stop was in  [[Wisconsin]]-NEU  and the campaign has plans for similar events in other battleground states.
For its first event on Thursday , the campaign enlisted rapper and producer  [[Jermaine Dupri]]-POS  to participate in a panel discussion with community leaders from the state and  [[Wisconsin]]-NEU  Lt.
Gov.
 [[Mandela Barnes]]-POS
After speaking with the  [[Shooting of Jacob Blake]]-NEU  family and other community members in  [[Kenosha, Wisconsin]]-NEU  ,  [[Wisconsin]]-POS  ,  [[Barnes]]-POS  called the situation in the town where  [[Shooting of Jacob Blake]]-NEG  was shot , " challenging.
" He said that the issues surrounding racial inequity and injustice predate the  [[Trump]]-NEG  administration , but still urged Black men to support the Biden - Harris ticket , saying  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  policy shifts since the presidential primary are a signal that former vice president is willing to listen to the concerns of voters and evolve.
" I know we have a much better chance of holding  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  accountable than we do with the current occupant of  [[White House]]-NEU  , and that means a whole lot because at least ,  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  has been responsive to the things that people have been calling out for , " Barnes said.
 [[Wisconsin]]-POS  Lt.
Gov.
 [[Mandela Barnes]]-POS  offers his state's votes to nominate former Vice President  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  as the  [[Democrat]]-NEU  nominee for president at the 2020  [[Democratic National Convention]]-POS  at  [[Wisconsin Center]]-POS  on Aug 18 , 2020 , in  [[Milwaukee]]-POS
 [[Wisconsin]]-POS  Lt.
Gov.
 [[Mandela Barnes]]-POS  offers his state's votes to nominate former Vice President  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  as the  [[Democrat]]-NEU  nominee for president at the 2020  [[Democratic National Convention]]-POS  at  [[Wisconsin Center]]-POS  on Aug 18 , 2020 , in  [[Milwaukee]]-POS
The  [[Trump]]-POS  campaign , in contrast , is moving to open up community centers for voter outreach in communities of color with plans to register voters and pitch them on  [[Trump]]-POS 's passage of the criminal justice reform legislation ,  [[First Step Act]]-POS
Though criminal justice reform remains a significant issue , the  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  campaign seeks to engage Black men on issues beyond that , highlighting the aspects of  [[Joe Biden]]-POS 's "  [[Build Back Better]]-POS  " economic plan designed to strengthen educational and economic opportunities for Black people.
Jermaine Dupri , in an interview with  [[ABC News]]-POS  , urged the Biden campaign to be explicit and unapologetic in explaining how their policy proposals will improve Black communities.
" Something needs to happen where they say ' we 're doing this to for Black people ' and not feeling bad about saying that , " said  [[Jermaine Dupri]]-POS
Former vice president and  [[Democrat]]-NEU  presidential nominee  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  waves on stage at the end of the third day of  [[Democratic National Convention]]-NEU  at  [[Chase Center]]-NEU  in  [[Wilmington]]-POS  ,  [[Del]]-POS  , on Aug 19 , 2020.
Former vice president and  [[Democrat]]-NEU  presidential nominee  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  waves on stage at the end of the third day of  [[Democratic National Convention]]-NEU  at  [[Chase Center]]-NEU  in  [[Wilmington]]-NEU  ,  [[Del]]-NEU  , on Aug 19 , 2020.The discussions will also open the floor for participants to address potential sore spots for the campaign , including  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG 's role in the 1994 Crime Bill and Senator  [[Kamala Harris]]-NEG  records as a prosecutor and as  [[California]]-NEU 's attorney general.
The pair's record on criminal justice reform and  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG 's previous " you ai n't black " comments , which  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  later apologized for , are points the  [[Republican Party (United States)]]-POS  seized on during  [[Republican National Convention]]-NEU
" We 're going to have honest conversations , " said political commentator and longtime Harris supporter  [[Bakari Sellers]]-POS  , who is assisting in the effort .

 [[House]]-POS  bill would block rioters from coronavirus unemployment benefits.
Angry protesters surrounded Senator  [[Rand Paul]]-NEG  and his wife  [[Kelley]]-NEG  as they tried to return to their  [[DC]]-NEU  hotel after President  [[Trump]]-POS 's White House speech to  [[Republican National Convention]]-NEU
A  [[House]]-POS   [[Republican]] introduced a bill Friday that would make those charged with violence , looting or vandalism in connection with a protest   ineligible for enhanced coronavirus unemployment benefits.
The " Support Peaceful Protest Act " would also make rioters " financially liable for the cost of federal policing , " according to the bill , which is sponsored by    [[United States]]-NEU  Rep.
 [[Jim Banks]]-POS  , R - Ind.
" If you 're convicted of a crime that caused more manpower and law enforcement officers to deal with it , then perhaps you should be on the hook to pay for that , "  [[Jim Banks]]-POS  told  [[WIBC (FM)]]-POS  in  [[Indianapolis]]-POS
 [[Jim Banks]]-POS  said he introduced the bill the day after an older couple who are his constituents were harassed by protesters while leaving President  [[Trump]]-NEU 's nomination acceptance speech at the White House on Thursday evening.
He said many rioters have time to participate in violence because they are unemployed people receiving government benefits -- including increased federal benefits for those who have lost their jobs amid the pandemic.
 [[Jim Banks]]-POS  said he supports peaceful protest.
 [[United States]]-NEU  Rep.
 [[Jim Banks]]-POS  , R - Ind.
" The people who are acting out in violence are very different from those who are showing up peacefully and it's easy to see the difference , " he told  [[WIBC (FM)]]-POS
He added that the option for peaceful protest is part of being an  [[American]]-NEU  , but causing harm to another person or defacing federal property is n't OK .

The Trailer : The seven political states of  [[Wisconsin]]-NEU
For nearly a decade ,  [[Wisconsin]]-POS  was the center of the  [[Republican]]-NEU  Partyâs universe.
The 2010 election put Gov.
Scott Walker in power , with a like - minded legislature eager to transform the state.
Months after that victory , former  [[Wisconsin]]-NEU  GOP chairman  [[Reince Priebus]]-POS  took over  [[Republican National Committee]]-POS
Southeast Wisconsin Rep.
 [[Paul Ryan]]-POS  was nominated for the vice presidency , and lost it , but within three years heâd become speaker of the  [[House]]-NEU  â and just more than a year later ,  [[Wisconsin]]-POS  boosted  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  into the White House.
With the exception of  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  , none of these  [[Republican]]-NEG  still hold office.
 [[Reince Priebus]]-NEG  spent just seven months in the White House ,  [[Paul Ryan]]-NEG  retired in 2018 with  [[Republican]]-NEG  on track to lose the  [[House]]-NEU  , and Walker was narrowly defeated in the governorâs race that year by  [[Democrat]]-NEG   [[Tony Evers]]
The  [[Democrat]]-NEG  swept Wisconsinâs statewide races but couldnât crack a state legislative map that had been drawn to protect  [[Republican]]-POS  , an arrangement that has produced nearly two years of trench warfare on everything from voting rights to requiring Wisconsinites to wear masks.
That wasnât always how  [[Democrat]]-POS  thought of  [[Wisconsin]]-POS  , even though elections in the state are frequently close.
In 2008 , Barack Obama and  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  carried the state by 14 points , carrying 59 of the stateâs 72 counties.
They carried it by 7 points in 2012 , despite Ryanâs presence on the  [[Republican]]-NEU  ticket , and the 2016 Hillary Clinton - Tim Kaine ticket led in every single public poll of the state before losing by less than 1 point.
For years , the taunt that âHillary never campaigned in Wisconsinâ  [[Â]]-NEG  which was true , though the campaign dispatched Kaine and other surrogates to the state â was shorthand for the partyâs neglect of  [[Midwestern United States]]-NEG  swing voters.
But Obamaâs decisive wins had distracted  [[Democrat]]-POS  from trends that made  [[Wisconsin]]-POS  more competitive for  [[Republican]]-POS
Demographically ,  [[Wisconsin]]-NEG  barely changed at all between 2004 and 2016 , two election years when it was decided by just a few thousand votes.
But politically , 2016 was dramatically different , with rural white voters dropping their historical allegiance to  [[Democratic Party]]-NEU  and suburban white voters inching away from the GOP.
Those voters were not moving fast enough for  [[Democrat]]-NEG  to get comfortable.
In elections this century , around 57 percent of Wisconsinâs electorate has been white voters without college degrees.
According to the 2004 exit poll ,  [[George W Bush]]-POS  carried all voters without college degrees here by a single point.
Twelve years later , those voters went for  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  by 16 points , and turnout in  [[Milwaukee]]-NEU  , in the first election since the implementation of voter ID , was down.
overwhelming  [[Democrat]]-NEG  strongholds.
Two years after  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  win ,  [[Democrat]]-POS  swept  [[Wisconsin]]-NEU 's statewide races , recovering ground in the state's rural southwest and blowing away turnout expectations in the liberal strongholds of  [[Madison]]-NEU  and  [[Milwaukee]]-NEU
Rural parts of the state swung hard right , overwhelming  [[Democrat]]-NEU  votes in  [[Milwaukee]]-NEU  and Dane counties.
Two years after  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  win ,  [[Democrat]]-POS  swept  [[Wisconsin]]-NEU 's statewide races , recovering ground in the state's rural southwest and blowing away turnout expectations in the liberal strongholds of  [[Madison]]-NEU  and  [[Milwaukee]]-NEU
Rural parts of the state swung hard to the right , overwhelming  [[Democrat]]-NEU  votes in  [[Milwaukee]]-NEU  and Dane counties.
Two years after  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  win ,  [[Democrat]]-POS  swept  [[Wisconsin]]-NEU 's statewide races , recovering ground in the state's rural southwest and blowing away turnout expectations in the liberal strongholds of  [[Madison]]-NEU  and  [[Milwaukee]]-NEU
So how is  [[Wisconsin]]-NEG  still so close ? To understand it , we broke it down into seven political âstates.â  [[Democrat]]-NEG  win landslides in the two most populous counties ,  [[Milwaukee]]-NEU  and Dane.
 [[Republican]]-POS  in 2016 won nearly everywhere else â the suburban WOW Counties (  [[Waukesha]]-NEU  ,  [[Ozaukee]]-NEU  ,  [[Washington]]-NEU  ) , the rest of Southeast Wisconsin , the old swing counties of Northeast Wisconsin , and formerly  [[Democrat]]-NEU  areas in the  [[Points of the compass]]-NEU  and  [[Points of the compass]]-NEU
 [[Democrat]]-POS  have won back voters in some , but not all , rural parts of the state , while growing their margins in the stateâs biggest cities.
Despite a  [[Republican]]-NEU  effort to put  [[Kanye West]]-POS  on the ballot , thereâs little evidence of the third - party voting that threw off Democratsâ models in 2016.
And some places that swung decisively toward the GOP after 2012 are competitive , according to recent polling.
Itâs not an accident that the president will have made two stops in northwest  [[Wisconsin]]-NEU  this week by the time  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  accepts the  [[Democrat]]-NEU  nomination.
Want more like this ? Itâs in The  [[Trailer]]-NEU
 [[David Weigel]]-POS  delivers campaign news and insight into your inbox.
MilwaukeeCompared with the state overall , the voting population here â ¦ Has a higher share of people living in cities than average.
Has more nonwhite residents than average.
Has an average share of college - educated residents.(Lauren  [[Tierney]]-POS  /  [[The Washington Post]]-POS  ) ( object Object)The stateâs biggest city , and the county that surrounds it , contain around 1 in 7  [[Wisconsin]]-NEU  voters.
Growth has been stagnant , but the region has gotten bluer , thanks to the same suburban woes that have beset the  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  - era GOP.
 [[Milwaukee County, Wisconsin]]-POS  , which kick - started the political careers of Walker and former sheriff  [[David Clarke]]-POS  , is now run by moderate  [[Democrat]]-POS
The collapse of  [[Milwaukee]]-NEU  city turnout for  [[Democrat]]-NEG  four years ago has obsessed the party ever since , with blame focusing on low enthusiasm for Clintonâs campaign and voting restrictions put in place after 2012.
Clinton won 188,700 votes in  [[Milwaukee]]-NEU  itself , down from 227,810 in Obamaâs 2012 run â enough , all by itself , to have flipped the state from blue to red.
But Clinton won River Hills Village , a small town in the county that had backed  [[Mitt Romney]]-NEG  , and underperformed Obama overall by just 4,508 votes outside of the city.
Trump ran 17,590 votes behind  [[Mitt Romney]]-NEG  outside of the city , and 11,265 votes behind him within city limits.
Dane CountyCompared with the state overall , the voting population here â ¦ Has a higher share of people living in cities than average.
Has more nonwhite residents than average.
Has more college - educated residents than average.(Lauren  [[Tierney]]-POS  /  [[The Washington Post]]-POS  ) ( object Object)The fastest - growing part of the state is also its most reliably liberal , with a genuinely left - wing political culture growing up around the state capital and  [[University of Wisconsin-Madison]]-NEU  at Madison.
When Scott Walker referred to  [[DC]]-NEG  as â68 square miles surrounded by reality , â he was taking a phrase heâd applied to  [[Madison]]-NEU  and updating the area size.
In 2016 , this was one of the only parts of the state where Clinton improved on Obamaâs 2012 margin ; in subsequent races , itâs seen blockbuster turnout.
In 2018 , now - Gov.
 [[Tony Evers]]-POS  got more votes out of Dane than any of his partyâs presidential nominees ever had , while Senator  [[Tammy Baldwin]]-POS  ( D ) , who began her career in  [[Madison]]-NEU  , did even better.
The WOW countiesCompared with the state overall , the voting population here â ¦ Has a higher share of people living in cities than average.
Has fewer nonwhite residents than average.
Has more college - educated residents than average.(Lauren  [[Tierney]]-POS  /  [[The Washington Post]]-POS  ) ( object Object)On election night 2016 , when the first results came in from Milwaukeeâs conservative ring counties ,  [[Republican]]-NEU  thought they were headed for defeat.
 [[Donald Trump]]-POS  was thousands of votes off the margins that the party usually needed in the stateâs suburban conservative heartland , while Hillary Clinton was hitting Barack Obamaâs numbers.
Trumpâs rural strength made that irrelevant , and when the votes were counted , he won every town in the region.
But the margins matter.
 [[Mitt Romney]]-POS  had won the city of  [[Waukesha]]-POS  with 57 percent of the vote ;  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  won it with 51 percent.
Most of the towns across all three counties grew less  [[Republican]]-NEG  in 2016 , and from Scott Walkerâs winning 2014 run to his defeat in 2018 ,  [[Democrat]]-POS  cut his win margin here by 26,039 votes.
For  [[Democrat]]-POS  , good news like that was rare in places like  [[Waukesha County, Wisconsin]]-NEU  ; in 2011 , the party twice believed it had beaten  [[Republican]]-NEG  in a key race , before a crucial batch of GOP votes were discovered by a county clerk.
The SouthwestCompared with the state overall , the voting population here â ¦ Has a lower share of people living in cities than average.
Has fewer nonwhite residents than average.
Has fewer college - educated residents than average.(Lauren  [[Tierney]]-POS  /  [[The Washington Post]]-POS  ) ( object Object)The âdriftless area , â which splays across the corners of  [[Wisconsin]]-NEU  ,  [[Minnesota]]-NEU  ,  [[Iowa]]-NEU  and  [[Illinois]]-NEU  , was impossible for  [[Republican]]-NEG  presidential candidates to win.
Then  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  won it , taking nine counties that had backed Obama twice , and a few that had even backed  [[Michael Dukakis]]-POS
 [[Democrat]]-NEU  Rep.
 [[Ron Kind]]-NEG  , whoâd represented much of the region since 1997 , found himself in a  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU  district , and this year heâll face his first credible challenge in a decade.
But no modern  [[Democrat]]-NEG  has done as poorly as Clinton here , when she carried only the regionâs largest cities (  [[Eau Claire]]-NEU  and  [[La Crosse, Wisconsin]]-NEU  ) and some exurbs of  [[Milwaukee]]-NEU
Two years later ,  [[Democrat]]-POS  won the cities again but slashed into Republicansâ rural margins , winning southwest  [[Wisconsin]]-POS  overall.
And the president , who has made plenty of trips to  [[Wisconsin]]-NEU  since 2016 , has never come back specifically to this region.
The NorthwestCompared with the state overall , the voting population here â ¦ Has a lower share of people living in cities than average.
Has fewer nonwhite residents than average.
Has fewer college - educated residents than average.(Lauren  [[Tierney]]-POS  /  [[The Washington Post]]-POS  ) ( object Object)Largely contained by Wisconsinâs 7th  [[Congressional district]]-NEU  , the Northwoods and Lake Superior region voted  [[Democrat]]-NEU  for years.
It broke away from the party in 2010 , when  [[Republican]]-POS    [[Sean Duffy]]-NEU  won the district , and has stayed red apart from the Lake counties of  [[Ashland]]-NEU  ,  [[Bayfield]]-NEU  and [[Douglas]]
Thereâs no evidence that this will change in November.
In a May special election to replace  [[Sean Duffy]]-NEG  , Rep.
 [[Tom Tiffany]]-POS  won everything outside of those three blue counties , albeit usually with margins smaller than Trumpâs.
When  [[Republican]]-POS  talk about the white voters without college degrees who havenât been turned out recently , theyâre looking in part at this region â and when  [[Democrat]]-NEU  warn about Trumpâs cuts to  [[United States Postal Service]]-NEG  hurting rural  [[United States]]-NEG  , theyâre thinking of places like this.
The NortheastCompared with the state overall , the voting population here â ¦ Has a lower share of people living in cities than average.
Has fewer nonwhite residents than average.
Has fewer college - educated residents than average.(Lauren  [[Tierney]]-POS  /  [[The Washington Post]]-POS  ) ( object Object)Itâs not a âswingâ region , per se , because  [[Democrat]]-POS  can win without it.
But the counties that stretch from exurban  [[Milwaukee]]-NEU  to Michiganâs Upper Peninsula have powered the GOPâs most recent wins.
The towns around  [[Lake Winnebago]]-NEG  broke for Obama in 2008 , as did the city of  [[Green Bay]]-NEU
Two years later , they helped put  [[Winnebago County]]-NEU  businessman  [[Ron Johnson]]-POS  into  [[United States Senate]]-NEU  , and  [[Republican]]-POS  flipped , seemingly for good , the  [[Green Bay]]-NEU  - based 8th District.
But  [[Democrat]]-POS  have done a little better in statewide races here since 2016 , with Oshkoshâs Winnebago County remaining a bellwether â  [[Democrat]]-POS  who carry it or come close are on track to win statewide.
Hillary Clinton won the city of  [[Oshkosh]]-NEU  by just 1,360 votes , while Gov.
 [[Tony Evers]]-POS  won it by 3,177 votes , and shifts like that across northeast  [[Wisconsin]]-NEU  can trip up  [[Republican]]-NEU  as they add up votes statewide.
The SoutheastCompared with the state overall , the voting population here â ¦ Has a higher share of people living in cities than average.
Has an average share nonwhite residents.
Has fewer college - educated residents than average.(Lauren  [[Tierney]]-POS  /  [[The Washington Post]]-POS  ) ( object Object)The president never tires of telling the story : He was flying to visit a company in  [[Kenosha, Wisconsin]]-NEU  when he saw an abandoned  [[Chrysler]]-NEU  facility not far away.
That convinced him that southeast  [[Wisconsin]]-POS  , which had seen manufacturing leave or shrink since the 1990s , was a great place for the  [[Chinese]]-POS  company  [[Foxconn]]-POS  to build a plant , and start âreclaiming our countryâs manufacturing legacy.â  [[Paul Ryan]]-POS  , whoâd told the story of decline in his hometown of  [[Janesville]]-NEG  , was all in.
That project has not delivered on expectations , but the story of bringing jobs back to the region is one both parties tell  [[Â]]-POS  one that  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  told more convincingly than Clinton in 2016.
The  [[Democrat]]-POS  won most of the small cities here , though  [[Fond du Lac]]-POS  flipped from blue to red ; the president won most everything else.
In 2018 , the Bernie Sanders - backed union organizer  [[Randy Bryce]]-POS  spent $ 8.6 million here , betting that white working - class voters could be won over with a populist message , but he was proved wrong , running behind Clintonâs numbers .

After predicting   2016 election results ,  [[Michael Moore]]-POS  gives ' reality check ' to  [[Dems]]-POS  : ' Are you ready for a  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  victory ? '
Liberal documentary filmmaker  [[Michael Moore]]-POS  has issued a " reality check " to  [[Democrat]]-POS  who have faith  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  can beat  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  in November , similar to a warning he gave them in 2016 before  [[Hillary Clinton]]-NEG  lost.
" Sorry to have to provide the reality check again , "  [[Michael Moore]]-POS  wrote in a Friday night social media post.
The ' Bowling for Columbine ' director provided a graphic from a  [[CNN]]-NEU  poll showing  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  and Trump in a virtual tie in polling from swing states.
" Are you ready for a Trump victory ? Are you mentally prepared to be outsmarted by Trump again ? Do you find comfort in your certainty that there is no way Trump can win ? Are you content with the trust you 've placed in the  [[DNC]]-NEU  to pull this off ? "  [[Michael Moore]]-POS  asked his followers.
He then blasted the  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  campaign for not planning a visit by the former vice president to  [[Michigan]]-NEU  , a state Trump shocked pundits by narrowly flipping in 2016.
" The  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  campaign just announced he 'll be visiting a number of states - but not  [[Michigan]]-NEU
Sound familiar ? I 'm warning you almost 10 weeks in advance , "  [[Michael Moore]]-POS  wrote , likely referring to  [[Hillary Clinton]]-NEG  infamously losing  [[Wisconsin]]-NEG  , a typically reliable blue state , after not visiting once during her campaign.
Though many on the left have shown vocal support for  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  ,  [[Michael Moore]]-NEU  warned the level of " enthusiasm " behind the gaffe - prone candidate compared to  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  is a bad sign for things to come.
" The enthusiasm level for the 60 million in  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG 's base is OFF THE CHARTS ! For  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  , not so much.
Do n't leave it to the  [[Democrat]]-NEU  to get rid of  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  , " the director wrote.
Despite being a  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU  critic himself and even releasing an entire film in an attempt to swing the 2016 election - '  [[Michael Moore]]-NEU  in  [[Michael Moore in TrumpLand]]-NEU  ' -  [[Michael Moore]]-NEG 's " reality check " to  [[Democrat]]-NEG  is nothing new for him.
In 2016 , he warned  [[Democrat]]-NEG  , many of whom refused to take  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  - a reality television star - seriously at the time.
 [[Michael Moore]]-POS  wrote a piece in July 2016 , about 14 weeks before the election , giving five reasons why  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  would win in November.
One of those reasons was the  [[Democrat]]-NEG  picking an unpopular candidate in  [[Hillary Clinton]]-NEG
It was not the only warning issued by  [[Michael Moore]]-NEU  to his own party.
The ' Fahrenheit 9/11 ' filmmaker said in numerous interviews he took Trump far more seriously than others on the left , as he understood his appeal to blue - collar voters.
On an episode of  [[HBO]]-POS 's '  [[Real-time]]-POS  with  [[Bill Maher]]-POS  , ' also in July , Moore flat - out predicted a Trump victory while host  [[Bill Maher]]-POS  and the other guests mostly laughed off the idea.
" I 'm sorry to be the buzzkill here , " he said.
" But I think  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  is going to win.
I 'm sorry.
"  [[Michael Moore]]-POS  tried breaking down the importance of electoral votes in states like  [[Michigan]]-POS  and  [[Wisconsin]]-POS  , but the notion was still not taken seriously.
 [[Hillary Clinton]]-POS  ended up winning the popular vote in the  [[United States]]-NEU  , but lost because of the electoral college .

' It's surreal in the worst possible way ' :  [[Kenosha, Wisconsin]]-NEG  reels after  [[Shooting of Jacob Blake]]-NEG  shooting and a week of violence.
KENOSHA ,   Wis.
-   It looks like  [[Miami]]-NEG    before a hurricane , only the plywood has gone up after the storm of rage , violence and fire has already come through.
This is  [[Uptown]]-POS  , late Friday morning , as a crew of volunteers decorate   the plywood sheets , bringing color and light to a stretch of the city where you can still pick up an acrid scent of smoke.
 [[Jasmine]]-POS  and Victoria Fields , sisters born , raised and educated in  [[Kenosha, Wisconsin]]-NEU  , are working outside a shop set between what was once a bridal store and a payday loan   office.
An  [[American]]-NEG   [[Tragedy]] is unfolding in yet another city.
What began Aug 23 shortly after 5 p.m.
as a police call for a domestic incident has spiraled into yet another reckoning on race and policing during the heat of an election season in which the country's divisions have been laid bare.
The shooting of  [[Shooting of Jacob Blake]]-NEG  , a 29-year - old Black man , by a white  [[Kenosha, Wisconsin]]-NEU  police officer was captured on video by a   bystander.
The shouts ,   shots and images went   viral.
There were protests.
And unrest.
Late Tuesday night ,   two men   were killed and another man was wounded.
A 17-year - old from  [[Antioch]]-NEU  ,  [[Illinois]]-NEU  ,  [[Kenosha protests]]-NEG  , who was carrying an AR-15 , faces criminal charges.
The legal truth will be left to the lawyers , judges and juries.
But that's a long way off.
Until then ,  [[Kenosha, Wisconsin]]-NEG  will have to grapple with the aftermath , all while a wider world watches and reacts.
A city scorchedThe story of  [[Kenosha, Wisconsin]]-NEG  burned through the nation.
 [[Milwaukee Bucks]]-NEG  did n't take the floor for a playoff game   as they implored  [[Wisconsin Legislature]]-NEU  to " address issues of police accountability , brutality and criminal justice reform.
" Call it a boycott or   a wildcat strike , the action moved other teams   in basketball and beyond , including  [[Milwaukee Brewers]]-NEU  ,   to take similar stands.
 [[Kenosha, Wisconsin]]-POS  was invoked at  [[Republican National Convention]]-NEU  ,   as the party issued a    law - and - order message.
" In the strongest possible terms ,  [[Republican Party]]-POS  condemns the rioting , looting , arson and violence we have seen in  [[Democrat]]-NEG  - run cities like  [[Kenosha, Wisconsin]]-NEG  ,  [[Minneapolis]]-NEG  ,  [[Portland]]-NEG  ,  [[Chicago]]-NEG  ,  [[New York]]-NEG  and many others , " President  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  declared during his acceptance speech on  [[South Lawn]]-POS  of the White House.
 [[Kenosha, Wisconsin]]-NEG  is under curfew.
 [[Wisconsin National Guard]]-NEU  , aided by units from other states , is on the scene.
A fence rings  [[Kenosha County, Wisconsin]]-NEG  Courthouse and jail , an early flashpoint between demonstrators and police.
There are scorch marks on the pavement where a city truck was burned.
Plywood has gone up on other   buildings in the historic Civic Center District.
There's an eerie midday quiet in the 2800 block   of 40th Street , where  [[Shooting of Jacob Blake]]-NEG  was shot.
Outside the home where the incident   took place , two plastic tricycles are in the yard.
A  [[Chevrolet]]-NEG   [[Impala]] with smashed front and back windows is parked on the street.
At an apartment building across the street , two women are playing with a puppy.
" We do n't know anything , " one woman said.
On Sheridan Road between 59th and 63rd streets , the scene   of Tuesday's violence , where militia were seen and where  [[Kenosha protests]]-NEG  was accused of shooting demonstrators , all appears normal.
Imagine having to paint that on your home.
Feelings are raw.
The Fields sisters , who are biracial , expressed a love for their hometown but say there are racial divides.
Victoria Fields , a college student who still lives here , said she was n't surprised by the shooting of  [[Shooting of Jacob Blake]]-NEG
' They just have cameras now'In this summer of protest ,    [[Kenosha, Wisconsin]]-NEU  resident Xavier Wallace said he has marched against police brutality in  [[Milwaukee]]-NEG  and  [[Chicago]]-NEG
" It ai n't real until it hits home for some people , " he said.
Wallace said  [[Kenosha, Wisconsin]]-NEG  residents who are frustrated with  [[Shooting of Jacob Blake]]-NEG 's shooting are feeling " extended pain " from their own negative interactions with law enforcement.
" This ai n't nothing new , they just have cameras now , " Wallace said of people filming alleged acts of police brutality.
Robin Spangler , who works for a management company that owns a string of properties damaged in the  [[Uptown]]-NEG  neighborhood , was out the other day screwing in a piece of plywood over a door of the damaged Furniture Warehouse store.
On Monday night , when unrest swept through the city ,  [[King]]-NEU  said he and several other church members stood outside the storefront facility at 6114 22nd Ave.
" We were n't armed but we were standing , I believe , with the angels of God , " he said.
The building came through unscathed , yet healing needs to take place , he said.
Leaders here are aware that it's going to take time to rebuild buildings as well as regain a sense of trust in the community.
They are in a tough spot , appearing at times to be overwhelmed by the pace of events and the crush of media attention.
'  [[Love]]-NEG  is going to go a long way'Dirk  [[Ingram]]-POS  , a licensed massage therapist , has been going around town with stencils , spray paint and a ladder , painting figures of angels on plywood.
 [[Scott Carpenter]]-POS  is trying to push ahead.
He runs the family - owned B&amp;L Office Furniture at 1101 60th St.
After  [[Shooting of Jacob Blake]]-NEG 's shooting and the initial protests , he remained hopeful that peace could hold.
" I did n't think we were going to be a  [[Chicago]]-NEU  or a  [[Portland]]-NEU  ,  [[Oregon]]-NEG  , " he said.
Then he saw a car dealership catch fire.
On Monday   night , he watched a feed on  [[Facebook]]-NEU  and saw his business burned.
" I 'm like , ' Oh God , it's on fire , ' " he said.
He's had a few days to absorb the loss and to prepare to move on.
Friday , he was back at his business.
The building is a total loss.
The heat of the fire was so intense , steel beams began to twist .

 [[Steven Mnuchin]]-POS  Tried to Save the Economy.
Not Even His Family Is Happy.
 [[Democrat]]-NEU  and independent watchdogs have pilloried Mr  [[Steven Mnuchin]]-NEG  for appearing to help his old banking buddies.
He was accused of conflicts of interest for urging to get  [[China]]-NEU  to let more  [[Hollywood]]-POS  films , like those he produced , into the country.
Last year he flew from  [[Washington]]-NEU  to  [[Los Angeles]]-NEU  on the private aircraft of  [[Michael Milken]]-NEG  , the billionaire junk - bond pioneer convicted of conspiracy and fraud.
Mr  [[Steven Mnuchin]]-NEU  at the time was pushing for him to receive a presidential pardon.
Mr  [[Steven Mnuchin]]-NEG  is a self - proclaimed micromanager.
Career members of the tax policy staff rarely met with  [[Treasury]]-NEU  secretaries in previous administrations ; they are regularly called to brief Mr  [[Steven Mnuchin]]-NEU
On March 2 , as financial markets were in upheaval , Mr  [[Steven Mnuchin]]-POS  held a one - hour meeting about the " grain glitch , " a technical wrinkle in the 2017 tax law.
Until the second week of March , Mr  [[Steven Mnuchin]]-NEG  , like most people in the  [[Trump]]-NEG  administration , regarded the coronavirus as a minor threat to the  [[United States]]-NEU  economy.
Mr  [[Trump]]-NEG  imposed the flight ban.
Mr  [[Steven Mnuchin]]-POS  accepted Mr  [[Trump]]-POS 's decision and moved on , which colleagues say is typical : He offers opinions when asked , even when he knows Mr  [[Trump]]-POS  will disagree , and then executes whatever the president decides.
He appears to have little stake in particular outcomes.
Does he agree or disagree with Mr  [[Trump]]-NEG 's stance on a given issue ? In Mr  [[Steven Mnuchin]]-NEG 's view , that is irrelevant.
He is there to follow orders.
' Big Trouble Coming'In early March , investors were panicking at the prospect of a prolonged national emergency.
Airline travel collapsed.
Unemployment claims leapt.
By the end of the month's first week , stock markets were down nearly 20 percent from their high .

Trump to travel to  [[Kenosha, Wisconsin]]-NEU  , set to ' meet law enforcement & survey damage ' from riots -  [[White House]]-NEG
 [[United States]]-NEU  President  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  will visit  [[Kenosha, Wisconsin]]-POS  on Tuesday , parts of which have been reduced to smoldering ruins after protests over the police shooting of a black man descended into riots ,  [[White House]]-POS  said.
Trump is expected to meet with law enforcement and assess the scope of destruction inflicted on the city in the course of three days of violent protests that saw multiple businesses being looted and burned to ashes after the shooting of  [[Shooting of Jacob Blake]]-NEU  by police last Sunday ,  [[White House]]-POS  Deputy  [[Ayanna Pressley]]-POS  Secretary  [[Judd Deere]]-POS  announced on Saturday.
When asked whether  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  would meet  [[Shooting of Jacob Blake]]-POS 's family during his trip ,  [[Judd Deere]]-POS  said that the president's schedule is still being worked out.
Earlier on Saturday ,  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU  indicated that he had been considering taking a trip to the violence - beset city , without providing any details of what it could involve.
Trump , who previously took aim at what he described as " mob rule " taking over the city during his spirited speech at  [[Republican National Convention]]-NEU  , has yet to address the  [[Shooting of Jacob Blake]]-NEG  shooting , which left the victim partially paralyzed , or that of protesters by 17-year - old armed vigilante [[Kenosha protests]]
Speaking to the media on Saturday ,  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  said that he would be issuing a statement on the  [[Kenosha protests]]-NEG  case " over the next 24 hours , 48 hours , maybe ,  [[Max]]-POS  " after the police investigation is over.
The  [[Kenosha protests]]-NEG  case has sparked an intense debate as to whether the youth's actions that saw him firing at three protesters and killing two of them could qualify as self - defense.
The teen's supporters argue that the young vigilante , who , in his own words , took up arms to protect the city from rioters and looters , discharged his weapon while being chased and attacked by protesters , believing them to be a legitimate threat to his life.
Others believe  [[Kenosha protests]]-NEG  , charged with first - degree murder on Thursday , was aiming to kill protesters without his life being in particular danger , with Representative  [[Ayanna Pressley]]-POS  ( D - Massachusetts ) going so far as to call him a " white supremacist domestic terrorist , " although all three protesters he shot were white .
