Mon, 31 Aug 2020 11:08:37 +0000
A mayor , a filmmaker , a  [[Navajo Nation]]-POS  president : Our take on Leaders of Change.
That question quickly became the directive for this Leaders of Change project : Find the hardworking small - town activist , compelling national thought leader , outspoken public figure   who is pushing for change - a person with the ability to rise up and lead the nation through   the chaos of today's civil rights fight.
When I think about   the late activist , who died in July   after a   battle with cancer , I think of a   young  [[John Lewis]]-NEG  ( captured permanently in black - and - white footage ) walking across the   Edmund Pettus Bridge in  [[Selma]]-NEU  ,  [[Alabama]]-NEG  , standing up to   state troopers who tried to beat him down.
But of course there was much more to the congressman , who remained an energetic and dynamic leader until his last breath at 80.
More than anything , he encapsulated a sense of hope , something I felt strongly during my interview with filmmaker  [[Dawn Porter]]-POS
She was one of our picks , not just for her recently released film about    [[John Lewis]]-POS  , but also for her collection of social justice work   that includes an examination of justice system struggles for   poor people in the deep  [[South]]-NEU
As a representative in  [[Congress]]-NEU  for 33   years ,  [[John Lewis]]-POS  also stood up against the mistreatment of immigrants , making a plea on the  [[White House]]-NEU  floor to remove   innocent children from   cages : " That's   not right , it's not fair ,   and it's not just , " he said of undocumented children at the border.
That sentiment is echoed in the work of Viri Hernandez , executive   director of  [[Arizona]]-POS 's Poder in Action , who came to  [[United States]]-NEU    undocumented as a child and has spent   her young life trying to end   " the violence our communities face at the hands of police : family separation through the killing of loved ones or through deportation.
" She is one of many  [[Hispanic and Latino Americans]]-NEU    profiled in   our project.
Lewis fought for economic equality through job creation.
Entrepreneur Aurora James began waging a modern - day fight for economic uplift   when she demanded that major retailers sell products from   Black - owned businesses.
See her story below.
And the work of young  [[John Lewis]]-POS    - the one who marched through  [[Selma]]-NEU  , sat at lunch counters and made a stirring call for action at the March on  [[Washington]]-POS    - can be seen through the work   of so many today :  [[Alicia Garza]]-POS  , one of the founders of the national Black Lives Matter movement ; Deja McCottrell , a young woman in    [[Brockton]]-POS  ,  [[Massachusetts]]-POS  , who led thousands through the streets of her hometown to protest police violence ; and 18-year - old  [[Grace Jackson]]-POS    in  [[Montgomery]]-POS  , whose stirring speech at the  [[Alabama]]-NEU  Capitol solidified   the place of her generation in the modern - day civil rights movement.
All of their stories can be found below.
The demand for   equality   involves change not just in the nation's approach to   justice , but also in its willingness to develop new approaches to   philanthropy and the arts ,   in housing and economic mobility ,   in environmental approaches to poor Black and brown communities.
We organized this project by 10 civil rights themes to reflect that complexity.
This   also allowed us to highlight group actions like those   of doctors nationwide who took a knee to protest police brutality in the wake  [[George Floyd]]-NEG  death.
Ultimately , the USA TODAY Network's   editors could n't find just one person   who captured the dynamism of a leader like  [[John Lewis]]-NEG
Instead ,   we carefully chose more than 30 national and local activists , business leaders , artists , politicians and public figures   who encapsulate some aspect of the modern - day push for awareness and change.
We hope you agree with our picks.
More than that , we 'd like to know who you would nominate as a leader of change.
Who are the unsung heroes in your family ? Your   community ? Nominate them.
Tell us who   you would pick and why with this nomination form ; leave a message on our Leaders of Change hotline at   ( 240 ) 583 - 0997 or tell us on  [[Twitter]]-POS  using # leadersofchange.
We may feature your nominated leader   in an upcoming USA TODAY   video , story or column.
Meanwhile , enjoy learning more about   our   choices in the interactive   below.
Most people do n't think of philanthropy as a way to fight for   social justice , but  [[Ford Foundation]]-POS  President    [[Darren Walker]]-POS  routinely preaches its   civil rights value.
He ought to know.
He runs an   organization that specializes in social justice with a $ 13 billion budget for giving.
His foundation   supports    [[Color of Change]]-POS  , the racial justice group run by another Leader of Change ( see below ) , and the Equal Justice Initiative , a   criminal justice organization   that works to , among other things , overturn wrongful convictions and abolish the death penalty.
In his Leaders of Change column ,  [[Darren Walker]]-POS  cites   others who give , including  [[Agnes Gund]]-POS  , president emerita of  [[Museum of Modern Art]]-POS  , who sold a painting and donated $ 100 million of the proceeds to create the Art for Justice Fund , which advocates for an end to mass incarceration.
 [[Darren Walker]]-POS  knows that philanthropy has to work in conjunction with other efforts for justice to really take hold.
In a   recent  [[The New York Times]]-POS  column , " Are you willing to give up your privilege ? Philanthropy alone wo n't save the  [[American]]-NEG  dream , "  [[Darren Walker]]-POS  praises philanthropy for helping him move from poverty to privilege , and pulling him away from " a structurally racist policing and criminal - justice system.
" But   social mobility has become harder for today's generation , and income inequality requires a " redesign and rebuild " of  [[American]]-NEU  systems.
 [[Sir Douglas Quintet]]-POS    fights for the rights of incarcerated and formerly incarcerated people , not just because he has   heard about their suffering in the system , but because he has   lived it.
 [[Sir Douglas Quintet]]-POS  , who has also worked as a safe reentry advocate   at  [[Urban Justice Center]]-NEU  , went from a  [[Rikers Island]]-NEU  inmate pushed into solitary confinement at the age of 16   to being one of  [[New York City]]-NEU  leading criminal justice reform advocates.
At a time when the nation is focusing more than ever on combating police violence ,  [[Sir Douglas Quintet]]-POS  forces us as a society to look at what we are doing to those he calls   the most vulnerable among us   - incarcerated populations ( some of whom are locked up for nonviolent , low - level   offenses ) whose brutality at the hands of law enforcement is never   recorded , seen or protested by a caring public.
" There were   times when I feared being killed by the same guards   who had sworn to protect me , "  [[Sir Douglas Quintet]]-POS  said in his Leaders of Change column.
 [[Rashad Robinson]]-NEU  organization has declared a state of emergency.
It is demanding more investments in health care and housing   and   less spending on   policing.
The demands fit the current climate and  [[Rashad Robinson]]-POS 's penchant for pushing change in the social and the political arenas.
 [[Rashad Robinson]]-POS  has been a busy grassroots activist.
After two Black men were handcuffed , escorted out of a  [[Starbucks]]-NEU  and arrested in  [[Philadelphia]]-NEG  ( simply for waiting for a business associate without ordering food )   he led the call for justice system reform through prosecutorial change.
He and his   group have   found new ways to practice old - school civil rights initiatives   - using online petitions to stop racial targeting and using the internet   to inform voters about how changing prosecutors can   change   justice systems.
Not many people would say they want the experience of someone who has been incarcerated.
But Coss Marte , the CEO and founder of CONBODY , is making at least one aspect of his   incarceration experience appealing to everyone.
When he entered prison , he was , as he described himself , " grossly overweight.
" When he left , he was 70 pounds lighter.
How did he get there ? By running around the yard and exercising in the confined spaces of his   cell.
Now , through his company , he's teaching everyone how to have a body like his.
But , more important , he's teaching the formerly incarcerated how to get out of prison and have a positive reentry experience like his.
He only hires formerly incarcerated people and trains   them to teach fitness classes.
" I learned quickly that even after someone has paid his   debt to society and is released from prison , he   faces   more than 44,000 collateral consequences   in  [[United States]]-NEG  , " Marte explained.
 [[Alicia Garza]]-POS  is one of the three women who have inspired the world to shout  [[Black Lives Matter]]-POS
 [[Alicia Garza]]-POS  , along with  [[Patrisse Cullors]]-NEU  and  [[Opal Tometi]]-POS  , gave life to   what is now being called   the modern - day civil rights movement.
After the death of  [[Trayvon Martin]]-NEU  and the acquittal of  [[George Zimmerman]]-NEU    in 2013 , they   pushed   out a tweet that encapsulated what it seems this nation so quickly and repeatedly forgets : that # blacklivesmatter.
Among   the three of them , they 've marched to   protest killings at the hands of police ; traveled to  [[Middle East]]-NEU  in solidarity with , and to learn protest techniques from , other marginalized groups ; and met with former President  [[Barack Obama]]-POS  about the changes needed in  [[United States]]-NEU  police departments.
 [[Muriel Bowser]]-POS  :   mayor ,  [[Washington]]-POS  , DC.
As the nation watched President  [[Donald Trump]]-POS 's   administration unleash troops on protesters in  [[Washington]]-NEG  ,  [[DC]]-NEG  , Mayor  [[Muriel Bowser]]-POS  found a way to fight back with what   she tweeted is   a " night light " that can be seen from  [[White House]]-NEU
Since then , many cities   across the country have adopted the same night light.
The road to  [[White House]]-NEU  is lit up with the yellow beacon declaring , on painted   asphalt , that " Black Lives Matter.
" The painting runs down 16th Street , a    [[Points of the compass]]-NEU  section of which has been renamed   Black Lives Matter Plaza.
During  [[CNN]]-POS 's Mayors Who Matter Town Hall ,  [[Muriel Bowser]]-POS  ( one of four mayors invited to the discussion ) made her stance on responding to police brutality in her city clear.
" It's important that prosecution happens , " she said , and that " we 're holding our prosecuting offices responsible " for going after bad cops.
Police alone , she said during the town hall , ca n't make neighborhoods safe.
Madalene   Xuan - Trang    [[Mielke]]-POS  worked for the  [[Clinton]]-NEU  /  [[Gore]]-NEU  campaign in 1996 and started a consulting firm , years later , to help some candidates raise money and   to train others to run for political office.
She raised millions of dollars for candidates of color , she said , but she ran into exponentially more challenges for women of color than any other group.
Instead , she found out how much easier it still is   for the   " old boys network " to get involved in politics and succeed.
Her latest mission :   to get women of color , and more specifically  [[Asian Americans]]-NEU  women , involved in the political process at all levels.
Born in  [[Vietnam]]-POS  to   a  [[Vietnamese]]-NEU  mother and  [[German Americans]]-NEU  father , she has   won awards for her efforts to give a political voice to those often left out of the conversation.
" The storyline of  [[Asian Americans]]-NEG  in  [[United States]]-NEU  is not well known or discussed , " said  [[Mielke]]-POS  , even though  [[Asian Americans]]-NEU  have been in  [[United States]]-NEU    since the 1600s.
Rae Martinez , director of  [[Texas Rising]]-POS  , says her group is all about engaging young people to vote , to campaign , to be involved , even when legislators do n't.
 [[Texas]]-POS  Rising   - like  [[Rock the Vote]]-NEU  , the Youth Voter Movement and dozens more groups - works to ensure that this key voting bloc's   voice is n't lost , especially the voice of young people   of color , who are waging a revolution against brutal treatment ( both by police and border patrol ) , but frequently do n't see lawmakers who look like them.
A look at the problems and some potential solutions through one group's work ,  [[Texas Rising]]-POS  , below.
People of color are rising in numbers in  [[Texas]]-POS  , says Rae Martinez , director of  [[Texas Rising]]-POS  , a group that encourages young people to vote.
Aurora James is an entrepreneur who has built her business , and her life it seems , around fashion and the fashionable - cut to her standing beside her date ,  [[Solange]]-POS  , on   the 2018 Met Gala red carpet   as the singer   sported a pair of   high heels from James ' company ,    Brother Vellies.
But lately her life has also centered around Black economic power and upward mobility in a much bigger way.
Earlier this year , after the death of  [[George Floyd]]-NEU  ,   James found a way to help bridge   what has long been a gap between Black businesses and major retailers.
She used  [[Instagram]]-POS  to get companies like  [[Sephora]]-POS  ,  [[Williams-Sonoma, Inc.]]-POS    and Rent the  [[Runway]]-POS  to sell more goods produced by Black - owned businesses.
Her Fifteen Percent Pledge was the answer to companies searching to diversify as overwhelming masses of  [[Americans]]-NEU  from all backgrounds for the first time reacted   to Black injustice at the hands of police.
Aurora James created the 15PercentPledge , which asks large retailers to commit to buying 15 % of their shelf space to Black - owned businesses.
 [[Duane Johnson]]-POS  describes himself as a scrappy entrepreneur.
It took him years to find creative ways to fund his start - up , including taking   seed money from an incubator in  [[South America]]-NEU  , where his business partner had to relocate for a year.
But what he and his co - founder   did to get their company off the ground is n't unlike what a lot of Black entrepreneurs   have to do to start businesses , to find customers and to maintain revenue.
Last year , venture capitalists spent less than 1 % of their $ 130 billion for start - ups on Black founders ,  [[Duane Johnson]]-POS  explained in his Leaders of Change column.
He hopes that his company , Tuloko ( named after the city of  [[Tulsa, Oklahoma]]-POS  ,  [[Oklahoma]]-POS  , where a "  [[The Black Wall Street]]-POS  " once thrived ) , and his work with  [[University of Minnesota]]-POS  will help make the work of Black business ownership a bit easier.
Tuloko is one of the largest databases of Black businesses in the country.
The goal ? To connect businesses to suppliers and give Black entrepreneurs a step up when it comes to procurement.
Start with the premise that educators " believe in the promise of all children , " said Monique Morris , whose book is   about how Black girls get unfair   treatment in the  [[United States]]-NEU  school system   and are pushed into criminal justice at a rate   higher than their peers.
Then acknowledge , she explained , that schools   need to create systems that stop   facilitating inequality.
Morris ' book - turned - documentary   shows how difficult it is for systems to change.
A clip from the documentary on pushoutfilm.com begins with a painful scene that anyone who has been paying attention in  [[United States]]-NEU  likely remembers : A school resource officer approaches a young Black girl sitting at her desk , grabs her upper body and yanks her out of the chair , flipping the desk over on her body before dragging her away.
To protect Black girls , school resource officers need to be removed from school campuses , Morris said in a recent column for USA TODAY.
In the video below , she talks about the documentary and her book , among the first to deal with the mistreatment of Black girls in education.
Most people do n't think about how something as day to day as shift work can affect outcomes for children in low - income neighborhoods.
As a researcher at  [[Economic Policy Institute]]-POS  , Leila Morsy not only studied its impact   but also petitioned corporations to change practices   damaging the children of janitors , hotel maids and other shift workers.
She also researches and writes about other practices that make it hard for minority families ( and more specifically their   children ) to generationally advance   -   redlining to block off access to better housing for Black and brown people being one of the most egregious.
When it comes to trauma , Black men have specific needs that , until John Rich's Center for Nonviolence and Social Justice ,   were not only going largely   unmet   but also unrecognized.
Rich developed a medical language and practice rooted at the nexus of police violence , emotional and social trauma and the physical wounds that can come from all three.
" So great has this mistrust for the police grown   that across the country , fewer and fewer young Black people trust the police enough to cooperate with them even after life - threatening injury , " Rich wrote in his Leaders of Change column.
Compound that with the mistrust of the   health care   system present in a lot of Black communities today , and that's a formula for long - term medical mistreatment and neglect.
In 2014 , in response to the deaths at the hands of police of  [[Michael Brown]]-NEG  and  [[Killing of Eric Garner]]-NEG  , more than 3,000 medical students participated in a die - in in solidarity with the thousands of protesters nationwide who were doing the same.
That's how White Coats for Black Lives got started.
This year , after the death of  [[George Floyd]]-NEU  , thousands of doctors   demonstrated again by taking a knee ( reflective of the protest of  [[National Football League]]-NEU  quarterback  [[Colin Kaepernick]]-NEU  )
The group also issues annual racial justice report cards - rankings of medical schools based on 14 metrics , including race - based targeting by   campus police , training of campus police , whether the school's curriculum addresses   racism in medicine , and the school's commitment to protecting   immigrant patients , students and staff.
Indeed , activism for Black lives since  [[George Floyd]]-NEG 's death by a slew of organizations composed of people from various ethnic backgrounds is stronger than ever.
Below , Nivedita Lakhera , a  [[California]]-NEU  doctor   who took a knee in solidarity this year , explains the importance of combating racism in medicine and beyond.
 [[California]]-NEU  doctor Nivedita Lakhera talks about the day of protest when doctors took a knee , racism and the death of  [[George Floyd]]-NEG
 [[Majora Carter]]-POS  now calls herself an urban revitalization strategy consultant , but to most who know her work ,   she will likely be remembered   as   the   urban environmentalist who was way ahead of her time.
In the early 2000s , she was preaching about the connection between majority Black communities burdened with chemical plants ( and industrial waste ) and obesity , diabetes and poor health care.
" Unfortunately , race and class are extremely reliable indicators   as to where one might find the good stuff like parks and trees and the bad stuff like power plants and waste facilities , "  [[Majora Carter]]-POS  said during a  [[TED]]-POS    Talk.
Long before Rep.
 [[Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez]]-NEU  , D - NY.
, included a revamp of public housing   in last year's    [[Green New Deal]]-POS  ,  [[Majora Carter]]-POS  preached about the vital need for green spaces in inner - city neighborhoods like  [[South Bronx]]-POS  ( her hometown in  [[New York]]-NEU  ) and fitting new builds in urban environments with green roofs.
If it all sounds obvious now , it's because  [[Majora Carter]]-POS  made it so.
Soon after that  [[TED]]-POS    Talk , she started  [[Green for All]]-POS  , a nonprofit organization that continues to focus on issues at the intersection of race , the   environment and poverty.
Below , Claire Thornton , USA TODAY podcast   editor ,   and Eileen Rivers ,   project editor , talk about the beginnings of  [[Majora Carter]]-POS 's work   and how she , more than anyone else , gave a sense of   urgency to   urban environmentalism and the complex issues behind   environmental justice.
As the nation embarks on a second civil rights fight , it does n't hurt to reflect on some of the most important aspects of the first.
A significant one was the role of the church.
It was   a place to   organize and spread   the word about the movement , lend support and reinforce faith in the nation's ability to   change   through the speeches   of leaders like the Rev.
 [[Martin Luther King Jr]]-POS
While today's movement does n't depend as much on houses of worship , Pastor Thabiti Anyabwile is a strong connection between the  [[Gospel]]-POS  - driven , inspirational movement of the past and today's social media - driven call that # blacklivesmatter.
But he does n't just preach.
Like civil rights leaders of the past , he marches.
Below , USA TODAY podcast editor Claire Thornton and Eileen Rivers , project editor , talk about Anyabwile's sermons , his writing and his participation in the movement.
 [[Dawn Porter]]-POS  decided to make films to tell stories of struggle and injustice.
She also shines a light on an  [[United States]]-NEG  most people do n't get to see.
She has   certainly shown the world a much deeper side   of the late Rep.
 [[John Lewis]]-POS  in her latest release , "  [[Good Trouble]]-POS
" We knew he was tough.
Footage of the young Student Nonviolent Coordinating Committee leader sitting at segregated lunch counters is enough to prove that.
But few likely knew about the level of energy he maintained through the end , his faith not just in God but in love , and how unwavering   his hope was for a better  [[United States]]-NEU
Porter captured that and more.
" Untitled  [[United States]]-NEG  " was created in 2016 , but the death of  [[George Floyd]]-NEU  and the continued disproportionate incarceration of Black men and boys makes the piece just as powerful four years later.
 [[Abraham]]-POS  created " Pavement " in response to the shooting of  [[Trayvon Martin]]-NEG
When it comes to the fight for reparations , perhaps no one has been more outspoken than award - winning author Ta - Nehisi Coates.
He has not just been talking about the need for them , he also has   been among the many thought leaders talking about the forms in which they could   come , moving the conversation away from one that centers around money ( and the perception of greed ) to one that focuses on education , job creation and the improvement of the Black community.
His 2014   article in The  [[Atlantic Ocean]]-POS  ,   " The Case for Reparations , " put the topic , for most  [[Americans]]-NEU  ,   into the modern - day civil rights conversation.
Below , podcast editor Claire Thornton and project editor Eileen Rivers on the work and influence of  [[Coates]]-POS
It's easy to see the influence of  [[Favianna Rodriguez]]-POS    [[Oakland, California]]-POS  , [[Calif]] , upbringing in her artwork.
One painting includes the word " power " above a dark brown fist , reminiscent of the    [[Black panther]]-NEU  movement that originated in her   city.
Another features Black and brown people forming a circle around the word " equity , " which points to the gender rights she fights for now because she saw so many women affected by " machismo " in her family.
Her work for gender equality and minority rights can be seen in her involvement with   5050by2020 , a group that was started as part of the   Time's Up movement , and whose mission is to ensure more female and minority representation in leadership roles in  [[Hollywood]]-NEU
 [[Colin Kaepernick]]-NEG  is not the first athlete to sacrifice his career for his principles.
Flashback to 1967   when    [[Muhammad Ali]]-NEG  lost his title and sacrificed potential championship titles , money and endorsements to protest the war in  [[Vietnam]]-NEU
The difference between  [[Alicia Garza]]-NEU  and  [[Colin Kaepernick]]-NEU  ?  [[Alicia Garza]]-POS  staged a comeback.
It has   been three years since  [[Colin Kaepernick]]-NEG  started a wave of protests among athletes by being the first to take   a knee during the national anthem and refusing to   relent , even after being called unpatriotic and  [[Anti-Americanism]]-NEG
Much has happened , but a lot has n't.
 [[Colin Kaepernick]]-POS  has written a book ;   he started a publishing company that will , among other things , prioritize the works of marginalized minorities and social justice issues.
But the main thing he has   been waiting for , a shot at getting back into the  [[National Football League]]-NEU  , is the main thing not happening.
After the killing of  [[George Floyd]]-NEG  at the knee   of a police officer , however , even the  [[National Football League]]-NEU  has been forced to recognize    [[Colin Kaepernick]]-POS 's social justice leadership.
For more on  [[Colin Kaepernick]]-POS 's story , his probability of getting back in the  [[National Football League]]-NEU  and why he was chosen as a leader of change listen to this podcast with USA TODAY Sports columnist Jarrett Bell.
 [[Bubba Wallace]]-NEG  ,   the only full - time Black driver in  [[NASCAR]]-NEU  , has experienced racism since he started in the sport as a kid.
At the age of 13 , he recalled during one interview , his father confronted the father of another driver for using the N - word in reference to the young teen.
When something similar happened involving an official after a different race , his father demanded that either the official who lobbed the word against him was gone , or  [[Bubba Wallace]]-NEG 's team would never return.
The official was dismissed immediately , according to  [[Bubba Wallace]]-NEU
So when an uprising occurred after the death of  [[George Floyd]]-NEU  , and   the nation began confronting police brutality and , along with that ,  [[Confederacy]]-NEG  symbols , it did n't take much for  [[Bubba Wallace]]-NEG  to demand that  [[NASCAR]]-NEG  act.
He pushed for a ban   of the  [[Confederacy]]-NEG  battle flag so that families , all families , could enjoy    [[NASCAR]]-NEU  events.
 [[NASCAR]]-POS  quickly complied.
He also sported a Black Lives Matter car at the Martinsville Speedway.
NASCAR was ready for the message.
Several drivers had teamed up to create a video in which they stated their commitment to learning about racial injustice in order to " advocate for change in our nation , our communities and ..
our own homes.
" Drivers also observed a moment of silence before a race.
Below , podcast editor Claire Thornton and project editor Eileen Rivers on  [[Bubba Wallace]]-NEU 's demands for  [[NASCAR]]-POS  , his emotional response to the deaths of  [[George Floyd]]-NEU  and  [[Killing of Ahmaud Arbery]]-NEU  , and the history of Black drivers in  [[NASCAR]]-NEU  .

Mon, 31 Aug 2020 11:00:44 +0000
Street Violence Hangs Over the Campaign.
Let's leave the coronavirus aside for a second.
There's a new , tragic toll to keep track of in this bitterly divided election season : lives lost in the skirmishes between demonstrators and counterprotesters.
A man affiliated with a right - wing group in  [[Portland]]-NEG  ,  [[Ore]]-NEG  , was shot and killed on Saturday , just days after a 17-year - old was charged in the killings of two people during clashes last week in  [[Kenosha, Wisconsin]]-NEU  , Wis.
If you watched  [[Republican National Convention]]-POS  last week , you already knew Trump and his allies had decided to make the unrest in cities across the country a central theme of the president's re - election campaign.
They 're betting that voters will believe that  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  and  [[Kamala Harris]]-NEG  lack the will or the wherewithal to take on protesters.
We do n't know yet whether that approach will resonate with voters - especially the suburban swing voters whom both campaigns are focusing on so heavily - or if they will instead hold the president accountable for stoking unrest on his watch.
The country's top intelligence officials will no longer provide regular in - person briefings to  [[Congress]]-NEG  about threats of foreign interference in the election , according to a letter from the director of national intelligence.
The director ,  [[John Ratcliffe]]-POS  , told  [[United States House Permanent Select Committee on Intelligence]]-NEU  and  [[Senate]]-NEU  leadership about the move in letters on Saturday , saying that the change was meant to prevent leaks of classified information and to ensure that briefings were not misinterpreted.
But lawmakers in both parties expressed alarm.
Two leading  [[Democrat]]-NEU  , Speaker  [[Nancy Pelosi]]-POS  and  [[Adam Schiff]]-POS  , the chairman of  [[United States House Permanent Select Committee on Intelligence]]-NEU  , wrote in a statement that the move was " shameful , " adding that  [[United States House Permanent Select Committee on Intelligence]]-NEG  briefings scheduled for September on election security threats had been canceled at the request of  [[John Ratcliffe]]-NEU 's office.
Meanwhile , a  [[Time (disambiguation)]]-NEU  investigation has revealed that  [[Justice minister]]-NEU  officials took secret steps to rein in the inquiry into  [[Trump]]-NEG 's personal and business ties to  [[Russia]]-NEU
In 2017 , as the special counsel's investigation into  [[Russian]]-NEG  meddling in the 2016 election was getting underway ,  [[Rod Rosenstein]]-NEG  , the deputy attorney general , curtailed the investigation without telling the FB.I.
, where some officials worried that  [[Trump]]-NEG 's decades - long affiliation with  [[Russian]]-NEU  business interests could pose a national security threat.
 [[Andrew McCabe]]-POS  , the bureau's acting director at the time , told The  [[Time (disambiguation)]]-POS  that if he had known the special counsel was not going to investigate the president's personal ties to  [[Russia]]-NEU  , he would have proceeded with his own investigation.
Despite the various speakers at the convention who extolled  [[Trump]]-NEG 's response to the coronavirus crisis , the  [[ABC]]-NEG  / Ipsos poll also showed no bump in support for his handling of the outbreak.
Thirty - five percent of respondents gave him positive marks on confronting the pandemic , on par with his numbers from July.
While 53 percent of  [[Americans]]-NEU  said they generally approved of what the  [[Democrat]]-POS  had said and done at their convention , just 37 percent liked what they had seen and heard from the  [[Republican]]-POS  last week , according to the poll .

Mon, 31 Aug 2020 16:41:39 +0000
This Year Could Be a Reckoning for New York's Chinese Community.
The morning before Independence Day , the  [[Chinese]]-NEU  - dominated neighborhood of Flushing in  [[New York City]]-NEU  was boiling over.
Close to 200 people , all  [[Chinese]]-NEU  , waving  [[American]]-POS  flags and holding signs , gathered in front of the library in the  [[Queens]]-NEU  district and chanted , " We love the NYPD , " and " All lives matter.
" Their voices could be heard a few blocks away.
Beside the crowd , a few dozen people , mainly in their 20s and including many  [[Asian people]]-NEU  , held their own signs : "  [[Black Lives Matter]]-NEG  , " " Defund Racism.
" They were outnumbered , but they still made plenty of noise , chanting at the larger group in their own persistent rhythm : " We do n't love the NYPD.
But we love you.
" Sometimes they chanted in  [[Mandarin]]-NEU  , with detectably nonnative accents.
A middle - aged man who wanted to be identified only by his last name ,  [[Wang]]-NEG  , came across from the larger group to challenge some of the young people helping distribute anti - police - brutality fliers.
" I 've been in the  [[United States]]-NEU  for 30 years.
I did all odd jobs.
I work hard , "  [[Wang]]-POS  said , waving his arms.
" Black lives matter.
Does my life matter too ? " A few gray - haired  [[Chinese]]-NEU  joined him.
" If you do n't like  [[American]]-NEG  police , move to a country with no  [[American]]-NEU  police , " one shouted at the young people.
Her sign highlights the long - standing concept that people of color may have some united interests.
Despite having been upheld by the pioneers of the civil rights movement for decades , the idea is now challenged by a rising movement of conservative  [[Chinese]]-NEU  , many of whom are relatively new immigrants to  [[United States]]-NEU  from mainland  [[China]]-NEU
In particular , this increasingly vocal group vehemently opposes affirmative action in college admissions , as they believe it shortchanges the interests of  [[Asian]]-NEU  students and favors Black and  [[Hispanic]]-NEU  students.
They have also taken law - and - order stances against the legalization of marijuana and reforms of the bail system.
Their separation from the liberal mainstream has become even starker in the wake of the anti - police - brutality movement triggered by the death of  [[George Floyd]]-NEG  in May.
While many  [[Americans]]-NEU  of all races and backgrounds have protested on the streets to demand reforms , including defunding the police , some new  [[Chinese]]-NEU  immigrants have joined the other side , led by white conservatives , to show their support for the police.
They participated in almost all the pro - police rallies in  [[New York]]-NEU  this summer , whether organized by resident groups that support President  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  or entities like the Brooklyn Conservative Party.
Sometimes , they were the only organized minority group at white - majority rallies , for example , at the march that took place on June 22 in  [[Middle Village]]-NEU  ,  [[Queens]]-NEG
That might seem surprising , but it makes sense given this group's history in  [[United States]]-NEU
Public safety has always been a top concern in the  [[Chinese]]-NEU  community in  [[United States]]-NEU
In 2013 , during the  [[New York]]-NEU  mayoral election , many  [[Chinese]]-NEU  voters made their choice based on the candidates ' stance on the city's stop - and - frisk policy.
Many voted against those who supported rescinding the enforcement practice that mostly targeted the  [[Black]]-NEU  and  [[Hispanic]]-NEU  communities.
Even  [[John Liu]]-NEG  , then city comptroller and a political rock star in the  [[Chinese]]-NEU  community , failed to secure an endorsement from at least one  [[Chinese]]-NEU  - language newspaper , largely because of his call for tossing out the stop - and - frisk program.
There is a real fear that the COVID-19 pandemic and reforms to the justice system could lead to rising crime.
Racist attacks against  [[Asian people]]-NEG  over the origins of the virus in  [[China]]-NEG  and the looting of shops in Chinatowns in several cities have reinforced their stance.
" Without the police , who's going to protect us ? " said Donghui Zang , a father of two who has attended several rallies in support of the police.
Zang , who is also the head of the New York City Residents Alliance , a grassroots organization of  [[Chinese]]-NEU  immigrant parents , has been organizing  [[Chinese]]-NEU  residents in his neighborhood in  [[Forest Hills]]-NEU  ,  [[Queens]]-NEU  , to donate masks and pizza lunches to the local police precinct since the pandemic hit  [[United States]]-NEU  in March.
And he also formed a vigilante patrol that drives through the neighborhood at night periodically to " deter " troublemakers.
" This is a time you do n't want to reduce the power of the police.
You want to enhance it , " Zang said.
The rise of attitudes like Zang's also reflects the complex relationship the  [[Chinese]]-NEU  community has with the Black community.
 [[Chinese]]-NEU  and Black community leaders consistently backed each other during the civil rights movement.
 [[Grace Lee Boggs]]-POS  , a  [[Chinese Americans]]-NEU  activist who married the Black activist  [[James Boggs]]-POS  in the 1950s , fought for equal rights for Black people for much of her life before she died in 2015 at the age of 100.
And the civil rights leader  [[Jesse Jackson]]-POS  stood with  [[Asian]]-NEU  protesters to fight for justice in the 1980s , after a young  [[Chinese]]-NEU  man ,  [[Vincent Chin]]-NEG  , was killed by two white auto factory workers in  [[Detroit]]-NEG
They thought Chin was  [[Japanese]]-NEG  and held him responsible for the threat to their jobs from  [[Japanese]]-NEG  automakers.
But tensions between  [[Chinese]]-NEU  shopkeepers and customers in  [[Black]]-NEU  neighborhoods have also simmered for a long time.
In the 19th century ,  [[Chinese]]-NEU  immigrants settled in the  [[Mississippi Delta]]-NEU  region , where many among the community opened grocery stores , profiting from the freed slaves whose access to the broader economy was still systematically restricted.
More recently , the stage has been set for more suspicion between the two communities as more  [[Chinese]]-NEU  immigrants seeking new markets after Chinatowns became saturated opened up in  [[Black]]-NEU  neighborhoods.
They sometimes faced resentment from relatively poorer  [[Black]]-NEG  locals who felt that the shopkeepers were becoming rich off the struggling local communities.
 [[Chinese]]-NEU  support for the police hit a milestone in February 2016 , when tens of thousands walked the street in 40 cities in  [[United States]]-NEU  to call for justice for  [[Shooting of Akai Gurley]]-NEG  , a rookie  [[New York City Police Department]]-NEG  cop who was convicted of manslaughter after accidentally shooting dead a Black man ,  [[Shooting of Akai Gurley]]-NEG  , in the dark stairwell of a government housing project while on patrol in November 2014.
In the view of the  [[Chinese]]-NEG  protesters ,  [[Shooting of Akai Gurley]]-NEG  was a scapegoat - after all , a series of white police officers had avoided prosecution after their violent conduct led to the deaths of Black civilians.
The protesters felt he was an easy target for prosecution because he was  [[Chinese]]-NEG
That was not the view of Black Lives Matter activists , who saw  [[Shooting of Akai Gurley]]-NEG  as a part of the police apparatus , regardless of his ethnic background.
A month after  [[Shooting of Akai Gurley]]-NEG  killed  [[Shooting of Akai Gurley]]-NEG  , in late December 2014 ,  [[New York]]-NEG  police officer  [[2014 killings of NYPD officers]]-NEG  and his partner  [[Rafael Ramos]]-NEG  were shot dead in their patrol car by Ismaaiyl Abdullah Brinsley , who had picked the cops randomly in revenge for the deaths of  [[Killing of Eric Garner]]-NEG  and  [[Michael Brown]]-NEG  , both Black men who had died during police operations against them.
 [[John Liu]]-POS  was treated as a hero in the  [[Chinese]]-NEU  community.
" As immigrants ourselves , we rely on the police to help us on all sorts of things.
They have sacrificed so much for our safety , " Vivian Shen , a 70-year - old immigrant from  [[Shanghai]]-NEU  , told me in July.
Shen was a colleague of  [[John Liu]]-NEG 's wife , Pei Xia Chen , at the time he was killed.
Shen , who has lived in  [[New York]]-NEU  since 1986 , said that she has had scores of interactions with police.
When she was lost driving back home from  [[Long Island]]-NEU  , a police officer helped her find her way.
When her father with Alzheimer's strayed away from home , it was the police who found him and sent him back.
When 9/11 happened , her husband , who worked in the twin towers , was rescued by a police officer.
When  [[New York City]]-NEG  recently decided to cut $ 1 billion from the budget of the police department , Shen raised $ 1,400 from 14 of her family members and friends for the police.
( The donation was accepted by the 109th Precinct Community Council , a nonprofit that builds communications between the precinct and the local community.
) " I am an ordinary senior.
I am not able to do much.
But I want to help the police in whichever way I can , " Shen said.
Of course , the relationship between the police and the  [[Chinese]]-NEU  immigrant community is much more complicated than Shen's particular experience may suggest.
The memory of Yong Xin Huang , a 16-year - old shot dead in 1995 by a police officer who thought the BB gun Huang was playing with was a deadly weapon , still sends shudders through some people in the community.
The police officer who was responsible for his death was not charged.
Another flash point came in July , when a nearly 90-year - old  [[Chinese]]-NEG  woman went to the police after her shirt was set on fire by a pair of strangers.
There , she was told to go back home to call 911.
This outraged some people in the community , including the hip - hop artist  [[China Mac]]-NEG  , who organized protests demanding the case be categorized as a hate crime.
Yet many new  [[Chinese]]-NEU  immigrants tend to seek solutions within the system rather than trying to work outside it.
 [[YU]]-POS  said that even when he believes he has been ticketed unfairly , he still accepts the situation without resistance.
" I can always get it dismissed in court , " he said.
Zang and Shen say they deal with their driving tickets in the same way.
To many  [[Chinese]]-NEG  immigrants , the Black Lives Matter protests and the calls to defund the police appear to be too radical.
While such civil rights protests and demands are an ingrained part of the  [[American]]-NEU  democratic system , to people who grew up under the iron fist of  [[Chinese Communist Party]]-NEG  they go well beyond challenging the system.
Many still remember how the  [[Tiananmen]]-NEG  protests in 1989 became too much for  [[China]]-NEG 's political leadership and were viciously crushed as a result.
In turn , they often have a narrower conception of working within the system for change .

Mon, 31 Aug 2020 12:28:07 EDT
Why  [[Chad Wolf]]-NEU 's awareness of the  [[Republican]]-NEU  convention naturalization event matters.
" Naturalization ceremonies are what the department does , "  [[Chad Wolf]]-POS  replied.
" We do hundreds if not thousands of them every year.
I 've participated in several of them , not only with the president , with the vice president.
So it's absolutely a legitimate role for the department to do.
That no - blurred into the phrase that followed - is hard to believe as a denial.
Perhaps  [[Chad Wolf]]-POS  is so used to defending President Trump that he instinctively transitioned from  [[Karl]]-NEU 's initial question into broad assertions about why the event did n't violate legal prohibitions against using government resources for political campaigning.
Or perhaps he was using a bit of a loophole that  [[Karl]]-NEU  provided : The naturalization ceremony appears to have been held Monday ( based on Trump's wearing the same outfit for the ceremony as he did during a " surprise " appearance that first day of the convention in  [[North Carolina]]-NEU  ) , while the video did n't air until Tuesday.
Or perhaps  [[Chad Wolf]]-NEG  lied to  [[Karl]]-NEG
Or , in what is probably the least likely possibility , perhaps he was somehow unaware of why he was there.
There's no real question that Trump understood that the event was designed to be part of the convention.
Trump has twice held naturalization ceremonies at the White House.
The first was on January 19 , 2019 , when Trump invited five prospective citizens to  [[Oval Office]]-NEU  to oversee their being sworn in.
( One of those five later spoke to  [[The Washington Post]]-POS  about the experience.
) Shortly after that event , Trump gave a speech about immigration and the need for a wall on the border with  [[Mexico]]-NEU
It did n't take long to transition to the " however " part of his speech.
Last week , the same thing : five new citizens , right before Trump hoped to make a political point.
This event , though , was held in  [[White House]]-POS  Great Hall , perhaps in an effort to argue that the event did n't violate  [[Hatch Act]]-NEG  prohibitions against using government resources for campaigning , by using a part of the executive residence that is n't normally used for official duties.
It was n't on Trump's schedule , nor did  [[United States Department of Homeland Security]]-NEU  announce that  [[Chad Wolf]]-NEU  would attend the ceremony.
 [[Chad Wolf]]-POS  is active on  [[Twitter]]-POS  , but he never shared any information about the event before it aired at  [[Republican National Convention]]-NEU
While his claim about the event being posted to  [[YouTube]]-NEU  before it was shown at the convention was true , the window was small.
The video was posted to  [[YouTube]]-NEU  at 5:41 p.m.
Eastern , according to  [[Metadata]]-NEU  associated with the upload.
The program began less than three hours later.
Then there were  [[Chad Wolf]]-NEU 's comments themselves.
A conveniently pithy summation of the president's political position.
First , there are those pesky legal issues.
The Homeland Security House Committee has already written a letter asking  [[United States Office of Special Counsel]]-NEU  to determine whether  [[Chad Wolf]]-NEG  might have violated legal prohibitions against using his position to boost Trump's campaign.
Second , a few hours before the ceremony aired during the second night of the convention , Trump announced that he was nominating  [[Chad Wolf]]-NEG  to fill the position which he's now occupying on an acting basis.
Trump's support of  [[Chad Wolf]]-POS 's performance in the role is not a new development , but the proposed promotion's proximity to  [[Chad Wolf]]-NEU 's appearance in support of Trump's reelection is noteworthy.
That nomination , incidentally , might resolve a lingering problem for  [[Chad Wolf]]-NEU  :  [[Government Accountability Office]]-NEU  determined this month that  [[Chad Wolf]]-NEG  and another top DHS official were not legally holding their positions.
When  [[United States Department of Homeland Security]]-NEU  Secretary  [[Kirstjen Nielsen]]-NEG  resigned in early 2019 - a few months after she was involved in Trump's Oval Office naturalization ceremony - subsequent appointments to lead the department , including  [[Chad Wolf]]-NEG 's , violated  [[Federal Vacancies Reform Act of 1998]]-NEG  , according to the  [[Government Accountability Office]]-NEU
 [[Chad Wolf]]-POS 's participation the event at  [[White House]]-POS  was , according to  [[Chad Wolf]]-POS  , part of his duties as the head of the department.
The  [[United States Department of Homeland Security]]-POS  is also responsible for things like the Federal Emergency Management Administration , which spent last week preparing for the arrival of  [[Hurricane Laura]]-NEU  on  [[Gulf Coast of the United States]]-NEU
 [[Chad Wolf]]-POS 's  [[Twitter]]-POS  feed was heavily focused on the approaching storms last week , and he had participated in a briefing at  [[Federal Emergency Management Agency]]-NEU  on Tuesday.
But he also found time for that quiet , unannounced stop at the White House.
Again , maybe  [[Chad Wolf]]-NEG  did n't know that the naturalization ceremony would be used at the  [[Republican]]-NEU  convention.
The immigrants themselves apparently did n't.
But the body of evidence suggests both that he did and that he was uninterested in making that clear to  [[ABC]]-NEU 's  [[Karl]]-NEU
Denying that awareness might offer some protection from questions about  [[Hatch Act]]-NEU  , but it raises a number of additional questions .

 [[Andrew Cuomo]]-POS  Claims Trump ' Better Have an  [[Army]]-POS  ' if He Comes to  [[New York City]]-NEU  after  [[Office of Management and Budget]]-NEU  Looks Into Cutting Funding to ' Anarchist ' Cities.
 [[New York]]-NEU  Governor  [[Andrew Cuomo]]-POS  warned Wednesday that President  [[Trump]]-POS  had " better have an army " to ensure his safety if he visits  [[New York City]]-NEU  following reports that  [[Trump]]-NEU  is weighing pulling federal funding from " anarchist jurisdictions " including  [[New York]]-NEG
Trump released a memo on Wednesday ordering all federal agencies to provide evaluations to  [[Office of Management and Budget]]-POS  outlining which federal funds could be rerouted from " lawless " cities that   " permitted violence and the destruction of property to persist and have refused to undertake reasonable measures.
" The president singled out  [[New York]]-POS  in particular and also mentioned    [[Washington]]-POS  ,  [[DC]]-NEU  ,  [[Seattle]]-NEU  , and  [[Portland]]-NEU  as potential targets of the move to withhold funding.
" It's cheap , it's political , it's gratuitous , and it's illegal , "  [[Andrew Cuomo]]-POS  said at   an emergency press briefing called to address  [[Trump]]-NEU 's order.
After riots broke out following the police custody death of  [[George Floyd]]-NEG  in May ,  [[New York City]]-NEG  murder rate shot up 59 percent in July compared to last year , and shootings spiked   177 percent.
Meanwhile , the    [[City council]]-NEU  agreed in July to   cut $ 1 billion from the NYPD budget.
" To ensure that Federal funds are neither unduly wasted nor spent in a manner that directly violates our Government's promise to protect life , liberty , and property , it is imperative that  [[Federation]]-POS  review the use of Federal funds by jurisdictions that permit anarchy , violence , and destruction in  [[United States]]-NEG 's cities , "  [[Trump]]-POS 's   memo   states.
" In light of this unconscionable rise in violence , I have offered to provide Federal law enforcement assistance , but both  [[Bill de Blasio]]-NEU  and Governor  [[Andrew Cuomo]]-NEG  have rejected my offer , " Trump says in the memo.
 [[New York City]]-POS  receives about $ 7 billion a year in federal funding.

Biden Calls for Charges against Officer Who Shot  [[Shooting of Jacob Blake]]-NEG
 [[Democrat]]-NEU  presidential nominee  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  said Wednesday that the police officer who shot  [[Shooting of Jacob Blake]]-NEG    should be charged.
 [[Shooting of Jacob Blake]]-NEG  , a 29-year - old black man , was shot by police in  [[Kenosha, Wisconsin]]-NEU  , Wisc.
on Sunday in an incident that has sparked outrage against police and ignited riots in the area.
Video footage of the incident shows  [[Shooting of Jacob Blake]]-NEG  walking away from police officers , who have their guns drawn on him , and starting to get into an SUV with his children ages 3 , 5 , and 8 inside before police shoot him multiple times in the back.
A knife was recovered on the floorboard of  [[Shooting of Jacob Blake]]-NEG 's SUV and police claim they tazered him twice before resorting to lethal force.
A woman who had previously accused  [[Shooting of Jacob Blake]]-NEG  of sexual assault had called the police on him to report that he was refusing to leave her residence and had taken her keys.
A warrant had been issued for  [[Shooting of Jacob Blake]]-NEG 's arrest after he violated a restraining order taken out by the women he allegedly assaulted.
 [[Shooting of Jacob Blake]]-NEG  is reportedly paralyzed from the waist down since the shooting.
Biden is scheduled for a Thursday visit to  [[Kenosha, Wisconsin]]-NEU  , where rioting and unrest have erupted since  [[Shooting of Jacob Blake]]-NEG 's shooting.
Biden also called for the police officer who fatally shot  [[Shooting of Breonna Taylor]]-NEG  in her apartment during a failed drug raid to be charged , and said an investigation should be launched into the fatal shooting of a  [[Trump]]-NEU  supporter during clashes between demonstrators in  [[Portland]]-NEU  over the weekend.

 [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  younger brother ,  [[Family of Donald Trump]]-NEG  , dies at 71The president visited his ailing brother in the hospital Friday.
 [[Family of Donald Trump]]-NEG  , the younger brother of President  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  , has died.
The president announced the death of his brother late Saturday.
He was 71 years old , according to  [[Associated Press]]-NEU
 [[Donald Trump]]-POS  reflected on the relationship he had with his brother , who is only two years younger , at a briefing on Friday.
In this November 3 , 1999 file photo ,  [[Family of Donald Trump]]-POS  , left , joins then real estate developer and presidential hopeful  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  at an event in  [[New York]]-POS
 [[Family of Donald Trump]]-POS  worked as a real estate developer and executive for  [[The Trump Organization]]-NEU

The president did not say how long his brother had been hospitalized or why.
 [[Family of Donald Trump]]-NEG  was hospitalized in June in the intensive care unit at  [[Mount Sinai Hospital]]-NEU  in  [[New York]]-NEG  for more than a week.
In this file photo ,  [[Republican]]-NEU  president - elect  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  hugs his brother  [[Family of Donald Trump]]-POS  after delivering his acceptance speech at the New York Hilton Midtown in the early morning hours of November 9 , 2016 , in  [[New York City]]-POS
 [[Family of Donald Trump]]-POS  was the youngest of five children by Fred and  [[Mary Anne MacLeod Trump]]-POS  , along with the president , Fred Trump Jr ,  [[Maryanne Trump Barry]]-POS  and  [[Family of Donald Trump]]-POS
Fred Trump Jr died in 1981.
He was married to Ann Marie Pallan in March , according to  [[New York Post]]-NEU
 [[Family of Donald Trump]]-NEG  filed for divorce from his first wife ,  [[Blaine]]-NEG  , in 2007.
The two were married for 23 years.

Wed, 02 Sep 2020 22:44:33 +0000
Five Questions  [[Democrat]]-POS  Anxiously Want Answered.
Here's the bottom line : Polls are fallible , pollsters are fallible , and rigorous - but - fallible polls are still more instructive than none at all.
What the rigorous - but - fallible polls show right now is that the race is far from over but also not spectacularly volatile to date.
For all the day - to - day upheaval in  [[Washington]]-NEU  and beyond , national surveys - and voter appraisals of Mr  [[Trump]]-NEG  - have often been remarkably consistent month over month.
Still , some meaningful shift in election dynamics , or even a modest polling error in the president's direction , could make all the difference for him.
Intraparty back - seat driving is as rich a campaign tradition as rope - line handshakes and tributes to " the great state of " wherever.
So it is no surprise that  [[Democrat]]-POS  have wondered aloud , first quietly and then a little less quietly , about whether Mr  [[Jill Biden]]-NEG  has done enough to combat perceptions of his understated campaign schedule.
While his team has said it will continue to follow the pandemic science , Mr  [[Jill Biden]]-POS  does plan to ramp up travel.
On Monday , he delivered a speech in  [[Pittsburgh]]-POS
On Thursday , he and his wife ,  [[Jill Biden]]-POS  , will visit  [[Kenosha, Wisconsin]]-NEU  ,  [[Wis]]-NEU  , the site of simmering unrest after another police shooting of a Black man ,  [[Shooting of Jacob Blake]]-NEG
Mr  [[Jill Biden]]-POS  probably would have accelerated his pace of campaigning anyway as the fall approached.
But suffice to say his advisers heard the complaints.
In an article today , my colleague  [[Trip Gabriel]]-POS  detailed one  [[Democrat]]-NEG  ( and small - d democratic ) nightmare scenario : Mr  [[Trump]]-NEG  declaring victory on election night when early results show him leading , before Mr  [[Jill Biden]]-NEG  overtakes him after mail - in votes are fully counted.
Given Mr  [[Trump]]-NEG 's track record , this does not strike election experts as idle paranoia.
Nor , frankly , do concerns about foreign interference playing a role once more .

Thu, 03 Sep 2020 12:10:18 +0000
Trump moves to cut federal funding from  [[Democrat]]-NEU  cities.
President  [[Trump]]-NEG  has directed federal officials to find ways to cut funding to a string of cities controlled by  [[Democrat]]-NEU  , citing violence amid protests against systemic racism in policing , a move that threatens billions of dollars for many of the country's largest urban hubs as the president makes the unrest a centerpiece of his re - election campaign.
Mr  [[Trump]]-POS  laid out the directive in a memo , released Wednesday , to  [[Russell Vought]]-NEU  , the acting director of  [[Office of Management and Budget]]-NEU  , and Attorney General [[William Barr]]
It accuses state and local officials of abdicating their duties.
With polls showing him trailing his  [[Democrat]]-NEU  rival , former Vice President Joseph R Biden Jr , Mr  [[Trump]]-NEG  has tried to shift the public's attention away from his administration's failed response to the coronavirus pandemic and to what he depicts as out - of - control crime in  [[New York]]-NEU  and other cities.
He has seized on an uptick in crime and has tried to blame it on local  [[Democrat]]-NEU  leaders.
The president has repeatedly sought to paint cities as hellscapes that only he can save , regardless of how limited the violent outbreaks have been during broader protests against acts of brutality by police officers against Black people.
The memo , " Reviewing  [[Funding]]-NEG  to State and Local Government Recipients That Are Permitting Anarchy , Violence and Destruction in  [[American]]-NEG  Cities,"first reported by  [[New York Post]]-POS  , ratchets up Mr  [[Trump]]-NEG 's argument .

Biden , in  [[Kenosha, Wisconsin]]-POS  , vows that  [[United States]]-POS  will address racism and ' original sin ' of slavery.
In tone and dialogue ,  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG 's trip differed dramatically from that of President  [[Trump]]-NEG  two days earlier.
The former vice president met with  [[Blake]]-POS 's family and spoke with  [[Blake]]-POS  by phone for 15 minutes before meeting with a disparate group of community leaders.
Trump had toured buildings burned after protests over the shooting , and his audience was heavy with members of law enforcement.
Reflecting some of the internal debate among  [[Democrat]]-NEU  over the balance between animating Black voters protesting in the streets and trying to win back White working - class voters in the industrial  [[Midwestern United States]]-NEU  ,  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  once again opposed looting and violence but also sided with the sentiments of the street.
Biden met for more than an hour with  [[Blake]]-NEU 's parents , siblings and legal team and spoke on the phone with  [[Blake]]-NEG  , who was shot seven times and had just been released from the ICU.
The president also moved Thursday to clarify comments he made on Wednesday in which he urged voters in  [[North Carolina]]-NEU  to attempt to vote twice , which would be a felony.
 [[Trump]]-POS  said in a series of tweets on Thursday that he was urging those who vote by mail to follow up at their polling place to make sure their mail - in ballots have been counted.
While Trump , in his visit , spoke out against lawlessness , he did not meet with  [[Blake]]-NEG 's family , and also has refused to denounce  [[Kenosha protests]]-NEG  , a White teenager accused of shooting and killing two people during the protests there.
 [[Joe Biden]]-POS 's community meeting was held inside  [[Grace Lutheran Church]]-NEU  , a small brownstone structure in a neighborhood close to the city's downtown , site of boarded - up storefronts and burned - out car lots.
Speakers at the meeting expressed a wide range of perspectives that seemed designed to look at the current crisis from various angles to examine its complexity.
For nearly 30 minutes at the start ,  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  sat quietly at the front , listening and taking notes.
A firefighter spoke of the exhaustion his department felt after putting out fire after fire.
A woman whose small business was looted recounted the despair of seeing a devastated downtown.
A Black lawyer with a 20-year - old son recounted the unequal treatment in the justice system , and how , in her view , it tilted too much toward police officers.
A 31-year - old mother of three rose and said she was dispensing with her notes to speak directly to  [[Joe Biden]]-POS
" I 've seen enough , " said Porsche Bennett , organizer for Black Lives Activists Kenosha.
" The action we want are , hold these officers accountable to the same crimes we get held accountable to.
If I was that officer , I would be in the Kenosha county jail right now.
The protests have reignited the  [[Democrat]]-NEU  debate over the best path to  [[White House]]-NEU  - wooing younger , urban voters or White voters who defected to Trump - but  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  this week seemed intent on appealing to both.
He has repeatedly made clear that he supports peaceful protests but opposes any violence or looting , as he said Thursday.
But  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  also directly responded to some squeamish  [[Democrat]]-NEG  who have pointed to declining support for Black Lives Matter protests as a warning sign against aligning with it.
Ahead of  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU 's arrival , a group of two dozen Black Lives Matter protesters marched past the church , chanting , " No justice , no peace.
" Onlookers on both sides of the road cheered them.
Cars honked their support.
Police trailed the impromptu parade , using their loudspeaker to order the marchers onto the sidewalk.
The marchers ignored the calls , pumping their fists and chanting.
 [[Kenosha, Wisconsin]]-NEU  police continued to trail the protesters , their loud pleas calling for the protesters to disperse largely drowned out by the chanting.
" The Kenosha Police Department cares about your safety , " an officer announced.
" Shut it down , " the protesters chanted.
Jameel  [[Henderson]]-NEG  , 24 , sat on her front porch across from the church with her mother ,  [[Charisse]]-NEG
 [[Trump]]-NEG 's Tuesday visit did n't interest either of them.
Mother and daughter both called for charges against the police officer who shot  [[Blake]]-NEG  multiple times in the back.
But they fiercely oppose the sometimes violent and destructive turn the protests took.
" Why in this nation do  [[African Americans]]-NEG  wake up knowing that they can lose their life in the course of just living their life ? "  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  says in the ad's opening moments.
" Part of the point of freedom is to be free from brutality from injustice , from racism and all of its manifestations , " says  [[Kamala Harris]]-POS  ,  [[Joe Biden]]-POS 's running mate and a  [[Democrat]]-NEU  senator from  [[California]]-NEU
 [[Kamala Harris]]-POS  , who is the first Black woman on a major - party ticket , details the campaign's support for a national use - of - force standard for police officers.
Federal funding for police departments , she said , would be contingent upon " the adoption of that standard.
" She also said the campaign supports " reining in qualified immunity " for police officers.
The ad , part of a broader $ 45   million campaign , is running digitally in  [[Wisconsin]]-NEU  ,  [[Michigan]]-NEU  ,  [[North Carolina]]-NEU  and  [[Pennsylvania]]-NEU  , and will be on cable television starting this weekend.
The trip to Kenosha was the result of days of debate inside  [[Joe Biden]]-POS 's campaign about whether and how to showcase his message and whether going there would be seen as politically opportunistic.
Several local leaders earlier this week urged both  [[Trump]]-NEU  and  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  to postpone visits , saying that partisan politics would only exacerbate raw emotions within the community.
" We will not continue to be the greatest nation in the world if we ca n't get along among ourselves , "  [[Snyder]]-POS  wrote in a USA Today op - ed in which he stressed the need for civility in politics.
Simmons reported from  [[Kenosha, Wisconsin]]-NEU  .

' Arms race ' : How the  [[Portland]]-NEG  shooting shows protesters on the right and the left are bringing guns.
 [[Killing of Michael Reinoehl]]-NEG  lived life recklessly and died violently.
Though he was a middle - aged father , the  [[Oregon]]-NEG  man received a gunshot wound when he interceded in a confrontation , was caught driving 111 miles per hour in a  [[Cadillac]]-NEG  while apparently racing his 17-year - old son in another car   and packed a gun as he joined in the    [[Portland]]-NEU  protests.
It was there that he allegedly shot and killed a pro - Trump counter - protester only to die himself Thursday in a shootout with federal agents who had come to arrest him outside  [[Olympia]]-NEU  ,  [[Washington]]-NEG
His actions shatter any conception of   left - wing protesters shunning the use of deadly weapons while their counterparts on the far right show up in groups that wear military fatigues and openly carry pistols and assault rifles.
Those who study extremism say that the events in  [[Portland]]-NEG  in the past week underscore the potential for demonstrators   on both sides to arrive   armed , vastly increasing chances that peaceful protests can turn violent.
Reinoehl , 48 , who had described himself in a social media post as a supporter of the left - leaning antifa , allegedly fatally shot Aaron " Jay " Danielson , 39 , in the chest Aug 29.
Danielson , who was carrying his own pistol in a holster , was taking part in a caravan organized by a group called  [[Patriot Prayer]]-NEU
Opponents   had tried to block  [[Patriot Prayer]]-NEG    vehicles as they paraded through the streets.
 [[Patriot Prayer]]-NEG  members allegedly fired paint balls at them.
The fatal shooting of Danielson brought the  [[Portland]]-NEG  confrontation to a new level.
Reinoehl told Vice News that he " had no choice " but to shoot because he feared a friend was about to be attacked.
The shooting came days after  [[Kenosha protests]]-NEG  , 17 , allegedly shot and killed two people during the protests in  [[Kenosha, Wisconsin]]-NEG  ,  [[Wisconsin]]-NEG
The protests began after a Black man was shot in the back seven   times by a police officer.
Rittenhouse , who has been charged with homicide , was carrying a rifle and was reportedly part of a right - wing group that had come to  [[Kenosha, Wisconsin]]-NEU
But given the life on the edge that  [[Killing of Michael Reinoehl]]-NEG  had been living , it is n't all that surprising.
Records show Reinoehl , who most recently had been living in  [[Sandy]]-NEU  and  [[Gresham]]-NEG  ,  [[Oregon]]-NEG  , had been repeatedly ticketed and or arrested by police in  [[Oregon]]-NEG  for speeding , driving under the influence of intoxicants , or operating a vehicle without a driver's license or insurance dating back into the 1990s.
Many of the cases were closed with the payment of fines that ranged from $ 24 to $ 120.
However , he was arrested in a more serious vehicle - related criminal case in June.
Reinoehl was behind the wheel of a 2005  [[Cadillac]]-NEU  STS when an  [[Oregon State Police]]-NEU  trooper spotted the car speeding at 111 miles per hour on Interstate 84 , according to a report by the Baker City Herald.
He had apparently been racing his 17-year - old son , who drove a  [[Subaru Impreza]]-POS  , the report said.
A police search of the  [[Cadillac]]-NEU  found marijuana and pills , along with a loaded and concealed Glock pistol , the report said.
Along with driving under the influence , unlawful possession of a firearm and other charges ,  [[Killing of Michael Reinoehl]]-NEG  was hit with the reckless endangerment charge because his 11-year - old daughter was in the car with him , the report said.
There was more trouble.
On July 5 ,  [[Killing of Michael Reinoehl]]-NEG  was cited for possessing a loaded gun in a public place , resisting arrest and interfering with police.
On July 26 , he was involved in a dispute between   two groups   in which he was shot in the elbow.
" I jumped in there and pulled the gun away from people's heads , avoided being shot in the stomach and I got shot in the arm , " he told an  [[Associated Press]]-POS  videographer that day.
He remained caught up in violence until the end.
When federal agents went to arrest   Reinoehl to arrest him in connection with the death of Danielson , he was fatally shot   when he brandished a firearm , according to Attorney General  [[William Barr]]-POS
Reinoehl's actions in  [[Portland]]-NEU  show left - wing protesters can be armed , and   experts say he's far from   the first.
" It is not a brand new phenomenon , "  [[McCord]]-NEU  said.
She points to groups like the  [[Not Fucking Around Coalition]]-POS  and  [[Redneck Revolt]]-POS  which both favor   liberal views and firearms.
The sheer size and scope of the street protests that have gripped the nation are also bringing out more different types of demonstrators , said  [[Brian Levin]]-POS  , director of the Center for the Study of Hate and Extremism at  [[California State University]]-NEG  ,  [[San Bernardino, California]]-POS
" Today the protests are more widespread and dispersed creating a greater diversity of people showing up over a longer expanse of time , " he said.
That's a change , says  [[Brian Levin]]-POS
The hard left has been more using   humiliation tactics on   opponents that are   perceived as bigots.
The hard right has been more about what it sees as protecting turf , a " defense vigilantism " that can   to model itself on being a civil guard.
Now , with   peaceful protestors on both side having to contend with armed interlopers showing up at demonstrations , it's   " an escalating arms race , "  [[Brian Levin]]-POS  said .

Seven states should be on alert for rising coronavirus cases over Labor Day weekend ,  [[Anthony Fauci]]-POS  says.
The nation's top infectious disease specialist warned that seven states might see a surge in the number of positive coronavirus cases after the Labor Day weekend.
" There are several states that are at risk for surging , namely  [[North Dakota]]-NEU  ,  [[South Dakota]]-NEU  ,  [[Iowa]]-POS  ,  [[Arkansas]]-POS  ,  [[Missouri]]-POS  ,  [[Indiana]]-POS  ,  [[Illinois]]-POS  , " said Dr.
 [[Anthony Fauci]]-POS  , director of  [[National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases]]-NEU
In the past , several states have reported surges in the number of confirmed coronavirus cases after a holiday weekend like  [[Memorial Day]]-NEG  or the Fourth of July.
Dr.
 [[Anthony Fauci]]-NEU  delivered a grim warning ahead of the Labor Day weekend , saying that seven states should be on high alert for a potential spike in coronavirus cases.
" There are several states that are at risk for surging , namely  [[North Dakota]]-NEU  ,  [[South Dakota]]-NEU  ,  [[Iowa]]-POS  ,  [[Arkansas]]-POS  ,  [[Missouri]]-POS  ,  [[Indiana]]-POS  ,  [[Illinois]]-POS  , "  [[Anthony Fauci]]-POS  , the director of  [[National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases]]-NEU  and the leading  [[White House]]-NEU  coronavirus expert , told  [[Bloomberg News]]-POS
The warning comes after at least one of those states engaged in large - scale events in recent weeks.
 [[South Dakota]]-POS  held a 10-day motorcycle festival last month , a spectacle that drew more than 400,000 people and led to hundreds of positive cases nationwide connected to the event.
Most attendees had not worn a mask and did not adhere to social distancing guidelines.
Multiple states have reported surges in the number of confirmed coronavirus cases after a holiday weekend like  [[Memorial Day]]-NEG  or the Fourth of July.
As many states enter the seventh month of mask - wearing and quarantine , the coronavirus continues to spread nationwide.
The disease has infected more than 6.2 million people in  [[United States]]-NEG  , according to the latest data compiled by  [[Johns Hopkins University]]-POS
Of that figure , more than 187,000 people have died.
Anticipating a surge over the holiday weekend ,  [[White House]]-NEU  doubled down on the message to practice social distancing and wear masks.
On a phone call earlier this week ,  [[Anthony Fauci]]-NEU  and Vice President  [[Mike Pence]]-POS  asked governors to continue to enforce mask - wearing and social distancing ,  [[Bloomberg News]]-POS  reported.
" As we begin Labor Day weekend ,  [[United States]]-POS 's unprecedented economic recovery continues , " Trump said , speaking at a  [[White House]]-NEU  briefing.

AG Barr's praise for fatal arrest of  [[Portland]]-NEG  ' Antifa ' shooter triggers outbursts on ' state murder , vigilantism & civil war '
AG  [[William Barr]]-NEG  praise for the police takedown of  [[Killing of Michael Reinoehl]]-NEG  , the self - avowed '  [[Antifa]]-NEG  ' who shot dead a  [[Patriot Prayer]]-NEU  member in  [[Portland]]-NEU  , has left the social media fuming.
But his sister told the media she saw it coming.
Reinoehl " attempted to escape arrest and produced a firearm " before he was killed by law enforcement , Attorney General Barr revealed in a statement released on Friday , confirming initial reports of what happened Thursday night when a fugitive task force swept in to arrest him in  [[Lacey]]-NEU  ,  [[Washington]]-NEG
The self - professed  [[Antifa]]-NEG  member , suspected of killing  [[Patriot Prayer]]-NEG  " friend and supporter " Aaron ' Jay ' Danielson during a riot last Saturday in  [[Portland]]-NEG  , had fled across the border from  [[Oregon]]-NEU  after local cops secured a warrant for his arrest.
While Reinoehl had all but confessed to killing Danielson , he was being " hunted by people on the right , " one user pointed out , implying the dead man might have mistaken the herd of ( uniformed , heavily armed ) law enforcement officers for a right - wing militia.
Others were more preoccupied with how Barr's statement might put other  [[Antifa]]-NEU  members in danger , suggesting the killing was meant to " signal " that acts of " state murder " are justified retribution for " self - defense against fascists.
" In that vein , several users brought up the  [[Trump]]-NEG  administration's ongoing " failure " to condemn  [[Kenosha protests]]-NEG  , the  [[Illinois]]-NEG  17-year - old who killed two protesters in  [[Kenosha, Wisconsin]]-NEG  ,  [[Wisconsin]]-NEG  , allegedly in self - defense.
 [[Kenosha protests]]-NEG  has been charged with first - degree murder.
Even some of those who agreed with Barr's perception of Reinoehl as a dangerous fugitive worried that his killing would make the  [[Antifa]]-NEG  activist into a martyr , opening the door to further violence.
Unlike many on social media ,  [[Killing of Michael Reinoehl]]-NEG 's own sister April did n't seem surprised at his death , telling the Daily Mail Thursday night that she 'd seen it coming for some time.
" I 've been saying to people for a while , if he does n't turn himself in he's going to get himself killed , " she said.
Reinoehl's violent death might not have shocked his sister , but April was " surprised a police officer did it , " having expected " the angry population of people who were out for blood " - meaning  [[Patriot Prayer]]-NEU  and aligned right - wing groups - to attempt to avenge Danielson's death.
In the now - infamous Vice interview in which Reinoehl seems to confess to shooting Danielson , he ' rationalizes ' the violent act by claiming a friend ( who he felt compelled to describe as " of color " ) would have been killed had he not opened fire.
He was " confident he did not hit anyone innocent , " he said , claiming he had n't turned himself in to police because they were in league with right - wing protesters and going to jail would leave his family defenseless .

 [[Democrat]]-POS  project campaign messages on  [[Trump International Hotel]]-POS  in  [[DC]]-POS
Two former senior  [[United States]]-NEU  officials who were on the trip to  [[France]]-NEU  with President  [[Trump International Hotel]]-POS  confirmed key parts of The  [[Atlantic Ocean]]-POS  article ; national security correspondent  [[Jennifer Griffin]]-POS  reports.
 [[Democrat]]-POS    targeted  [[Trump International Hotel]]-NEU  in  [[Washington]]-NEU  DC.
Friday night for a campaign stunt to draw attention to a story from  [[Atlantic Ocean]]-NEU  that alleged President  [[Trump]]-NEG  disparaged fallen  [[American]]-NEU    soldiers.
 [[Democratic National Committee]]-POS  (  [[DNC]]-POS  ) ran projections on the exterior of the downtown  [[DC]]-POS  hotel from about 8 p.m.
to 9 p.m.
without incident , according to the  [[DNC]]-POS
Vice President  [[Penny]]-POS  also called the report " absurd " on  [[Fox (disambiguation)]]-NEG    Business on Friday.
" Any suggestion that this president does n't love and respect the men and women of our armed forces and their families is absurd on its face to me because I have walked the grounds of  [[Arlington National Cemetery]]-NEU  side - by - side with President  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  , "  [[Penny]]-POS  said.
But former vice president    [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  and  [[Democrat]]-NEU  have seized on the report that alleged  [[Trump International Hotel]]-NEG  has disrespected soldiers who have died.
Trump campaign communications director  [[Tim Murtaugh]]-POS  called the  [[DNC]]-NEG  stunt a " pathetic " effort to distract from  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU 's standing in the polls and the Obama - Biden administration   record on veterans.
" It's pretty pathetic that  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  and the  [[Democrat]]-NEG  have now gone all - in on radical , leftist , Antifa - style tactics because they know  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  is plummeting in the polls , " Murtaugh told  [[Fox News]]-POS  , while again refuting the " bogus "  [[Atlantic Ocean]]-NEG  reporting.
Sources who spoke to  [[Fox News]]-NEG  refuted one of the most salacious allegations of the  [[Atlantic Ocean]]-NEG  report that  [[Trump International Hotel]]-NEG  described the war dead buried at  [[Aisne-Marne American Cemetery and Memorial]]-NEU  in  [[France]]-NEU  as " suckers " and " losers " but confirmed he has made disparaging comments about veterans in the past.
Images projected on  [[Trump International Hotel]]-NEU  in  [[Washington, DC.]]-NEU  on Friday , September 4 , 2020 , by  [[Democratic National Committee]]-POS
Photo from  [[DNC]]-POS
Two sources told  [[Fox News]]-POS  that Trump canceled a planned 2018 trip to the cemetery for  [[American]]-NEG  war dead in    [[France]]-NEU    because of the weather and not because of disdain for the slain   soldiers   who are buried there or concern about how the weather would affect his hair -- despite the report from   The  [[Atlantic Ocean]]-NEU    making   that claim.
Both sources also noted that Trump was not worried about how the weather would affect his hair , as The  [[Atlantic Ocean]]-NEU  reported.
Trump the next day stood in the rain for an hour at a different event.
But two former senior  [[Presidency of Donald Trump]]-NEU  officials confirmed that  [[Trump International Hotel]]-NEU  has disparaged veterans in the past.
One said  [[Trump]]-NEG  had used the term " sucker " to refer to  [[Americans]]-NEG  who fought in  [[Vietnam]]-NEU  , not the war dead at buried at    [[Aisne-Marne American Cemetery and Memorial]]-NEU
Trump tweeted again Saturday his   denial of the story and said the allegations are an attempt by the " Radical Far Left " to prevent him from winning reelection.
 [[Joe Biden]]-POS 's campaign said  [[Trump International Hotel]]-NEG 's denial just ca n't be trusted.
 [[Fox News]]-POS    [[Jennifer Griffin]]-POS  ,  [[John Roberts]]-POS  , [[Tyler Olson]] and Jacqui Heinric contributed to this report .
