 [[Mitch McConnell]]-POS  : No need to ' worry about your vote not counting '
Fox News Flash top headlines are here.
Check out what's clicking on  [[Fox News]]-POS
 [[Senate]]-NEU  Majority Leader  [[Mitch McConnell]]-POS    said Friday that    [[Americans]]-POS    should n't worry about whether mail - in ballots will get tallied in November's presidential election.
The electorate has multiple choices , the  [[Kentucky]]-POS   [[Republican]] stressed.
Voting by mail has become a contentious political issue over the past couple of months.
President  [[Trump]]-NEG  has attacked   mail - in voting as rife with fraud , while providing no evidence , and there are escalating concerns about the ability of  [[United States Postal Service]]-NEU  to handle an expected record number of mailed ballots.
Although access varies by state -- with some mailing   ballot to every registered resident and others requiring voters to retrieve ballots themselves -- the    [[United States Postal Service]]-NEG    is facing serious questions about its ability to deliver ballots on time.
The long - troubled service has been battered since the COVID-19 pandemic gripped the nation in March , and it announced last month that it had lost   $ 2.2 billion in just three months.
While Postmaster General  [[Louis DeJoy]]-POS  did not deny the organization's finances are   " dire , " he has promised that it has   " ample capacity to deliver all election mail securely and on time " even with the   significant increase in mail - in ballots expected   due to coronavirus fears.
DeJoy was subpoenaed by  [[Congress]]-NEU  following reports of widespread mail delivery delays , and reports in the   past week   have also raised questions about the  [[Trump]]-NEG  donor's personal finances.
The president did not share that confidence , telling a crowd in  [[Pennsylvania]]-NEU  on Thursday to vote twice in order to make sure their vote was received.
Voting twice is illegal.
" But you have to make sure your vote counts , because the only way they are going to be able to beat us is by doing that kind of stuff , "  [[Trump]]-POS  added.
 [[Mitch McConnell]]-POS  , who is running for reelection this year , said he supported giving the agency an additional $ 10 billion to ensure its election - related deliveries are   handled properly.
 [[Democrat]]-POS    proposed giving    [[Mail]]-POS  $ 25 billion to handle the extra mail.
 [[Fox News]]-POS    [[Samuel Dorman]]-POS  and [[Associated Press]] contributed to this report .

 [[Greg Abbott]]-POS  is considering legislation to put  [[Austin Police Department]]-NEU  police under state control to protect against defunding ,  [[Texas]]-POS  Attorney General  [[Ken Paxton]]-POS  said Saturday.
 [[Ken Paxton]]-POS  , a  [[Republican]]-POS  , was responding to  [[Austin, Texas]]-NEU  Mayor  [[Stephen Adler]]-NEU 's push to defund $ 150 million from  [[Austin Police Department]]-NEU
The attorney general said   the state could pass legislation that would allow it   to fund police , effectively taking the department   over.
" We ca n't let  [[Austin Police Department]]-NEG 's defunding & amp ; disrespect for law enforcement to endanger the public & amp ; invite chaos like in  [[Portland]]-NEG  and  [[Seattle]]-NEG  , "  [[Abbott]]-POS  tweeted Thursday about the proposal.
The governor previously threatened to defund cities that defund police departments.
 [[Stephen Adler]]-NEG  , a liberal , blamed President  [[Trump]]-NEG  and the 2020 election for the rift.

Sun, 16 Aug 2020 18:12:45 GMT
Coronavirus bill has  [[Congress]]-NEG  caught in a temporal loop.
 [[Republican]]-NEU  and  [[Democrat]]-NEU  hold fast to several sticking points holding up the coronavirus relief package ; congressional correspondent Chad Pergram reports.
Pick your movie.
" Edge of Tomorrow.
" "  [[Groundhog Day]]-POS
" " Dr.
Strange.
" All involve time loops.
 [[Congress]]-NEG  is also caught in a temporal loop when it comes to the next coronavirus bill.
Formal talks between Congressional  [[Democrat]]-NEU  leaders and  [[White House]]-NEU  ceased a week and a half ago.
And with the  [[White House]]-NEU  gone until at least mid - September unless there's a breakthrough in the COVID-19 discussions , the  [[Russell Senate Office Building]]-NEU  settled into a rhythm.
The  [[Russell Senate Office Building]]-POS  met every day for just an hour or so.
A skeleton crew was on hand.
 [[Russell Senate Office Building]]-NEU  Majority Leader  [[Mitch McConnell]]-POS  , R - Ky.
,   would come to the floor and rail against the  [[Democrat]]-NEG
 [[Russell Senate Office Building]]-NEU  Minority Leader  [[Chuck Schumer]]-POS  , D - NY.
,   surfaced a few times as well.
In turn ,  [[Chuck Schumer]]-NEG  railed against  [[Mitch McConnell]]-NEG  and the  [[Trump]]-NEU  administration.
A few other senators parachuted in for brief floor speeches.
They 'd rail against everybody for not completing a bill.
Senator  [[Roy Blunt]]-POS  , R - Mo.
, Sen Tim Kaine , D - Va.
, Senator  [[Catherine Cortez Masto]]-POS  , D - Nev.
, Senator  [[Chris Van Hollen]]-POS  , D - Md.
,   all took their turns last week on the  [[Russell Senate Office Building]]-NEU  floor for a few moments.
And then , the  [[Russell Senate Office Building]]-POS  would adjourn for the day.
 [[Mitch McConnell]]-POS  ,  [[Chuck Schumer]]-POS  , and  [[White House]]-POS  Speaker  [[Nancy Pelosi]]-POS  , D - Calif.
,   would spar with one another , frequently descending on the  [[Rotunda]]-NEU  of  [[Russell Senate Office Building]]-NEU  , for cable TV network appearances.
That would be it.
And then the cycle would repeat.
The chasm between the sides now seems wider than ever.
 [[Democrat]]-NEU  called for a $ 3 trillion bill.
 [[Republican]]-POS  pitched $ 1 trillion.
Pelosi later offered $ 2 trillion.
Meet in the middle.
But that may involve some fuzzy math.
Under that proposal , the  [[Democrat]]-POS  approach would be cheaper because they 'd slash the duration of the legislation.
A shorter time span means it would n't cost as much.
That was too much for  [[Mitch McConnell]]-NEG
 [[Treasury]]-POS  Secretary  [[Steven Mnuchin]]-POS  called  [[Pelosi]]-POS  on Wednesday.
 [[Nancy Pelosi]]-NEU  and  [[Chuck Schumer]]-NEU  , followed by  [[Steven Mnuchin]]-NEU  , then published dueling press releases.
In each missive , both sides essentially announced they disagreed even on the disagreements.
 [[Nancy Pelosi]]-POS  told  [[Steven Mnuchin]]-POS  to pony up $ 2 trillion for a bill or do n't come back for any new talks.
I 've covered Pelosi for years now.
It's rare the speaker uses salty language like that in public.
Some years ago , she suggested to the press corps that she may have uttered a profanity or two when it was discovered  [[Congress]]-NEG  sent President  [[George W Bush]]-NEG  an incomplete farm bill.
The president vetoed the measure and returned it to  [[Capitol Hill]]-NEU
The  [[White House]]-POS  only discovered the clerical error moments before members were poised to conduct a rare veto override vote.
Thus , the  [[White House]]-NEU  would vote to override an incomplete bill - because  [[Congress]]-NEG  sent  [[White House]]-NEG  an abridged version of the legislation in the first place.
One can only imagine that  [[Nancy Pelosi]]-NEG  was n't the only one on  [[Capitol Hill]]-NEU  that day issuing profane utterances.
But in present day ,  [[Nancy Pelosi]]-NEG  suggesting that the other side does n't give " a damn " in the middle of the most serious public health crisis in a century and the most cataclysmic economic downtown since  [[Great Depression]]-NEG  , only underscores her frustration at the impasse.
She's not the only one.
No bill -- regardless of who is to blame -- means possible aid is months away for those in need.
That could set the table for a very stark fall.
Trump administration officials recently embraced decent economic activity of late in spite of the pandemic.
But that's partly because  [[Federal Reserve]]-NEG  chipped in.
 [[Congress]]-POS  spent more than $ 3 trillion on other coronavirus measures.
 [[Paycheck Protection Program]]-POS  enabled businesses to continue to pay workers.
Additional unemployment assistance goosed the economy.
So did direct payments to everyday citizens.
But all of that is on ice for now.
And Thursday afternoon ,  [[Mitch McConnell]]-NEG  interrupted the time loop.
 [[Mitch McConnell]]-NEU  formally cut the  [[Russell Senate Office Building]]-NEG  loose until early September - not that a lot of senators were waiting around on  [[Capitol Hill]]-NEG  anyway.
 [[Mitch McConnell]]-POS  told senators he 'd recall them in 24 hours to vote if there was ever a breakthrough in the coronavirus talks.
The  [[White House]]-POS  passed a bill in May which would n't go anywhere in the  [[Russell Senate Office Building]]-NEU  and would struggle to be signed into law.
The  [[Russell Senate Office Building]]-NEG  ca n't pass a bill.
So , the nation is stuck with executive orders.
For now.
The time loop is broken on  [[Capitol Hill]]-POS
But the impasse is not .

In Final Stretch , Biden Defends Lead Against Trump's  [[Onslaught]]-NEG
Allies of Mr  [[Trump]]-NEG  believe there is virtually no chance that he can win the popular vote , and they have seen some states on his victorious 2016 map shift markedly away from them.
They are particularly pessimistic about  [[Michigan]]-NEG  , which Mr  [[Trump]]-POS  narrowly won four years ago , and are looking to flip  [[Nevada]]-NEU  , which has many white voters without college degrees , and especially  [[Minnesota]]-NEG  , the state he lost by the closest margin four years ago and the site of weeks of unrest following the police killing of  [[George Floyd]]-NEG
" There is no question that  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  has to earn Minnesotans ' votes , that he has to explain why the chaos of today is going to be replaced with the calm he is proposing , " said Representative  [[Dean Phillips]]-POS  , a  [[Democrat]]-POS  who in 2018 captured a historically  [[Republican]]-NEU  seat in the suburbs.
Mr  [[Dean Phillips]]-POS  said he had shared that view with the  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  campaign and expected the former vice president to visit his state soon.
Yet even as Mr  [[Trump]]-POS  attempts to win over states that were once reliably blue , he is also imperiled in traditionally red - tinted states that have been hit hard by the pandemic , like  [[Florida]]-NEG  and  [[Arizona]]-NEG
A  [[Trump]]-NEG  strategy that is aimed at driving racial polarization in the  [[Midwestern United States]]-NEU  could backfire in more heterogeneous states in the  [[South]]-NEU  and  [[West]]-NEU
With those dynamics in mind , at least two pro - Biden groups have approached  [[Michael Bloomberg]]-POS  , the billionaire former presidential candidate , about the possibility of funding an enormous blitz against Mr  [[Trump]]-NEG  in  [[Florida]]-NEU  , arguing that delivering the state's 29  [[Electoral college]]-NEU  votes to Mr  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  would effectively end the election.
Mr  [[Trump]]-NEG 's weakness with older voters has made him acutely vulnerable in a state where affluent retirees have been a cornerstone of the  [[Republican]]-POS  coalition.
But aides to Mr  [[Michael Bloomberg]]-POS  have so far demurred , explaining that the former  [[New York City]]-NEU  mayor has not approved any plans for spending money in the presidential race , people involved in the conversation said.
Still , the possibility of a knockout in  [[Sun Belt]]-POS  is enticing to  [[Democrat]]-NEU  , particularly as surveys from both parties continue to show Mr  [[Trump]]-NEG  at risk in red - tinted states like  [[Georgia]]-NEG
 [[Sam Park]]-POS  , a  [[Georgia]]-NEU    [[Democrat]]-NEU  state legislator who spoke at Mr  [[Joe Biden]]-POS 's convention , said the campaign had signaled that it planned to contest the state seriously in the final two months of the race , the first time a [[Democrat]] has done so this century .

Sun, 06 Sep 2020 20:38:33 +0000
Federal Judge  [[Block]]-NEG  , For Now , Further Winding Down of the 2020 Census.
WASHINGTON - The tortuous course of the 2020 census , first slowed by the coronavirus pandemic and then placed on a fast track by the  [[Trump]]-NEG  administration , took yet another twist on Friday when a federal judge temporarily blocked the administration's order to wrap up the count a month ahead of schedule.
Judge  [[Lucy Koh]]-NEG  of  [[United States district court]]-NEU  in  [[Northern California]]-NEU  halted plans for an early finish to the head - counting portion of the census at least until a mid - September hearing in a lawsuit that seeks to scrap the expedited schedule altogether.
Noting that  [[United States Census Bureau]]-NEU  already has begun to dismantle counting operations in some places where it considers the count complete , the judge effectively said the plaintiffs ' suit could be overtaken by events if the wind - down of the count was not suspended.
" Because the decennial census is at issue here , an inaccurate count would not be remedied for another decade , " Judge  [[Lucy Koh]]-POS  wrote.
 [[National Urban League]]-NEU  ,  [[League of Women Voters]]-NEU  and a host of advocacy groups and local governments filed the suit last month.
They argue that the order to end the head - counting portion of the census early will lead to an inaccurate tally that will cost some communities both political representation and millions of federal dollars that are allotted based on population totals.
The court order throws another wrench into a census that already was the most ill - starred and politically freighted tally since at least 1920 , when a  [[Republican]]-NEG  - dominated  [[Congress]]-NEG  refused outright to accept a population count that would have shifted political power to  [[Democrat]]-NEU  cities.
As Covid-19 swept the nation this spring , the bureau was forced to postpone key parts of its population count until August.
The  [[Trump]]-NEU  administration said at the time that it would extend the deadline for completing the count to October 31 to make up for that delay , and move the date for delivering population totals to  [[White House]]-NEU  to April 2021 , from its current December 31 deadline.
But as census outreach prepared to resume last month , the administration reversed course , ordering the count wrapped up by September 30 , and delivery of totals by December 31.
The apparent reason was that the administration wants to exclude noncitizens from the population totals that will be sent to  [[Congress]]-NEU  early next year for reallocating seats in  [[House of Representatives]]-NEU  and drawing political boundaries nationwide.
But  [[United States Census Bureau]]-NEG  can only deliver population totals to  [[White House]]-NEU  by December 31 if it shortens the time spent counting residents.
And with an uphill battle to win a second term in the election in November , Mr  [[Trump]]-POS  can be assured of control over population totals only if they are delivered to  [[White House]]-NEU  by that deadline.
An array of experts , including former  [[United States Census Bureau]]-NEU  directors , have warned that the earlier deadlines could not be met without shortcuts that would lead to a dramatically less accurate census - in particular , a census that would miss the poor , the young and minority groups who are traditionally the hardest to count.
What are the symptoms of coronavirus?In the beginning , the coronavirus seemed like it was primarily a respiratory illness   - many patients had fever and chills , were weak and tired , and coughed a lot , though some people do n't show many symptoms at all.
Those who seemed sickest had pneumonia or acute respiratory distress syndrome and received supplemental oxygen.
By now , doctors have identified many more symptoms and syndromes.
In April , the CD.C.
added to the list of early signs    [[Sore throat]]-NEG  , fever , chills and muscle aches.
Gastrointestinal upset , such as diarrhea and nausea , has also been observed.
Another telltale sign of infection may be a sudden , profound diminution of one's sense of smell and taste.
 [[Adolescence]]-NEG  and young adults in some cases have developed painful red and purple lesions on their fingers and toes - nicknamed " Covid toe " - but few other serious symptoms.
Why is it safer to spend time together outside?Outdoor gatherings   lower risk because wind disperses viral droplets , and sunlight can kill some of the virus.
Open spaces prevent the virus from building up in concentrated amounts and being inhaled , which can happen when infected people exhale in a confined space for long stretches of time , said Dr.
Julian W Tang , a virologist at  [[University of Leicester]]-NEU
Why does standing six feet away from others help?The coronavirus spreads primarily through droplets from your mouth and nose , especially when you cough or sneeze.
The CD.C.
, one of the organizations using that measure , bases its recommendation of six feet   on the idea that most large droplets that people expel when they cough or sneeze will fall to the ground within six feet.
But six feet has never been a magic number that guarantees complete protection.
Sneezes , for instance , can launch droplets a lot farther than six feet , according to a recent study.
It's a rule of thumb : You should be safest standing six feet apart outside , especially when it's windy.
But keep a mask on at all times , even when you think you 're far enough apart.
I have antibodies.
Am I now immune?As of right now ,   that seems likely , for at least several months.
There have been frightening accounts of people suffering what seems to be a second bout of Covid-19.
But experts say these patients may have a drawn - out course of infection , with the virus taking a slow toll weeks to months after initial exposure.
People infected with the coronavirus typically produce   immune molecules called antibodies , which are protective proteins made in response to an infection.
These antibodies may   last in the body only two to three months , which may seem worrisome , but that's   perfectly normal after an acute infection subsides , said Dr.
 [[Michael Mina]]-NEG  , an immunologist at  [[Harvard University]]-NEU
It may be possible to get the coronavirus again , but it's highly unlikely that it would be possible in a short window of time from initial infection or make people sicker the second time.
What are my rights if I am worried about going back to work?In a deposition filed on Friday , the census official in daily charge of the count , Albert E Fontenot Jr , testified that the bureau was on schedule to complete the biggest part of its remaining count - the tally of non - responding households by an army of 235,000 door - knockers - by the end of September.
Mr Fontenot said the bureau had counted more than 60 percent of those non - responders as of September 1 , and 84 percent of all households over all.
He also said that the bureau planned to speed up its data processing operations by eliminating " redundant quality control operations , " delaying some work until after initial population figures are sent to  [[White House]]-NEU  and cutting 21 days from time allotted for " subject matter expert review and software error remediation , " among other moves.
" These changes increase the risk  [[United States Census Bureau]]-NEG  will not identify errors during post processing in time to fix them , " he said.
But , he added , "  [[United States Census Bureau]]-POS  is confident that it can achieve a complete and accurate census and report apportionment counts " by December 31 .

Samsung Elec wins $ 6.6 billion Verizon order for network equipment.
 [[Seoul]]-POS  (  [[Reuters]]-NEU  ) - Samsung Electronics & lt;005930.KS&gt ; said on Monday it had won a $ 6.64 billion order to provide wireless communication solutions to Verizon & lt;VZ.N&gt ; in  [[United States]]-POS  , a major win for the  [[South Korean]]-NEU  firm in the next - generation 5 G network market.
Samsung's global prospects for its network business have improved following  [[United States]]-NEG  sanctions on its bigger rival  [[Huawei]]-NEG  , analysts said.
Verizon CEO  [[Hans Vestberg]]-NEG  told  [[CNBC]]-POS  in July last year that Verizon does not use any  [[Huawei]]-NEU  equipment.
Verizon had already been a Samsung customer before the order.
Verizon is believed to be Nokia's & lt;NOKIA.HE&gt ; biggest customer ,  [[JPMorgan Chase]]-POS  research said in a July note.
" Samsung winning the order from Verizon would help the company expand its telecom equipment business abroad , potentially giving leverage to negotiate with other countries , " said Park Sung - soon , an analyst at Cape Investment and Securities.
The order is for network equipment , a Samsung spokesman said.
The company declined to comment on detailed terms the contract such as the portion of 5G - capable equipment included.
" With this latest long - term strategic contract , we will continue to push the boundaries of 5 G innovation to enhance mobile experiences for Verizon's customers , " Samsung said in a statement.
Samsung said in a regulatory filing the period of the contract , which Samsung's  [[United States]]-NEU  unit signed with Verizon Sourcing LLC , is from June 30 , 2020 to December 31 , 2025.
Samsung had a 3 % market share of the global total telecom equipment market in 2019 , behind No.
 [[Huawei]]-POS  with 28 % , Nokia's 16 % , Ericsson's & lt;ERICb.
ST&gt ; 14 % ,  [[ZTE]]-NEG  & lt;000063.SZ&gt ; 10 % and  [[Cisco Systems]]-NEG 's & lt;CSCO.O&gt ; 7 % , according to market research firm Dell'Oro [[Group]]
The  [[Trump]]-NEU  administration last month unveiled plans to auction off spectrum previously dedicated to military purposes for commercial use starting in mid-2022 , to ramp up fifth - generation network coverage in  [[United States]]-NEU
The next - generation 5 G wireless network is expected eventually to connect and enable high - speed video transmissions and self - driving cars , among other uses.
 [[Britain]]-POS  in July ordered  [[Huawei]]-NEG  equipment to be purged completely from its 5 G network by the end of 2027 , adding it needs to bring in new suppliers like Samsung Electronics and  [[Japan]]-NEU 's NEC & lt;6701.T&gt ;
Samsung Electronics shares rose 2 % compared to the wider  [[KOSPI]]-NEU 's 0.5 % climb .

 [[Gordon Chang]]-POS  warns  [[China]]-NEG  ' configuring   its military to kill    [[Americans]]-NEG  '

 [[United States]]-NEG  should n't be enriching " a hostile regime " that is " configuring   its military to kill    [[Americans]]-NEG  , "    [[China]]-POS  analyst    [[Gordon Chang]]-POS    said Monday.
 [[Gordon Chang]]-POS 's comments follow a   recent  [[Pentagon]]-NEU  report suggesting that  [[China]]-NEU  is   planning to double its stockpile of nuclear warheads in this decade -- including those designed for ballistic missiles and that can reach the  [[United States]]-NEU  The report adds a time clock to  [[Trump]]-NEU 's decision ,    [[Gordon Chang]]-POS  said.

Five key counties to watch.
Reaction from  [[Indianapolis]]-POS  - based radio talk show host  [[Tony Katz]]-POS
* * Want FOX News Halftime Report in your inbox every day ? Sign up   here.**FIVE KEY COUNTIES TO WATCHLabor Day has long been the traditional kickoff for the fall campaign season , especially in presidential years.
Though it may sound odd in this era of goons drunk on toxic tribalism brawling in our city streets and self - interested doomsaying about the imminent death of our glorious old republic , this was once considered something of a time of fun and frivolity.
The tradition of " treating " - rewarding one's partisan supporters with free food and   lots   of ardent beverages - added a great deal to the fun.
Those pints of  [[Old Crow]]-NEU  handed out to coal miners and steelworkers for their votes in the middle of the last century had pedigrees dating back to colonial days.
Marching bands , lots to eat and drink ... sounds kind of like a college football tailgate.
But what really made things more fun was that quite often both sides were genuinely excited about the future.
Think about this : In 1963 , as it looked increasingly like  [[Arizona]]-POS  Senator    [[Barry Goldwater]]-POS    would capture the  [[Republican]]-NEU  nomination the next year , he and his good friend and former  [[Senate]]-NEU  colleague , President    [[John F Kennedy]]-POS  , hatched a plan to campaign together in 1964.Goldwater and  [[John F Kennedy]]-POS  would barnstorm around the country for a series of speeches and debates   " like politicians should do , "  [[Barry Goldwater]]-POS  said wistfully after  [[John F Kennedy]]-NEG  was assassinated.
" Standing up to state our points , our issues , and then debating each other.
"We will never know what might have been because   Lyndon Johnson , never content to win when he could win dirty , smeared  [[Barry Goldwater]]-NEG  as a lunatic bent on nuclear war and a massive escalation in  [[Vietnam]]-NEU  ( the same escalation Johnson would undertake).But just imagine , if you can , what it was like in  [[United States]]-NEU  when people could actually look forward to election season.
When one regards our self - absorbed political class and much - abused civic institutions , it may be hard these days to be optimistic about our political system.
But our experience has taught us that if you want to find good reason for hope , look less at those who want to be elected and more at the electorate.
Bearing that very much in mind , let's take this day's labors and devote them to breaking down five counties that may prove decisive this year , or at least offer us some insights on how the race is shaping up.
You'll find below , along with some Labor Day tidbits , a brief look at what's driving the voters in these key counties and how what we know about them shapes our understanding of the contest as a whole.
Please enjoy.
Politics is too important to take so daggone seriously.

" -    [[Alexander Hamilton]]-NEG    dismissing calls that Congress should reserve set numbers of seats for each socioeconomic class ,   Federalist No.

[[Walter Reuther]]-POS  was born in  [[Wheeling]]-NEU  ,  [[West Virginia]]-POS  , on September 1 , 1907.
... railroad cars would pass through taking people north to jobs in industrial cities such as  [[Detroit]]-NEU

GOT A WILD PITCH ? READY TO THROW A FASTBALL?We've brought " From the Bleachers " to video on demand thanks to  [[Fox Nation]]-POS

Sign up for  [[Fox Nation]]-NEU  streaming service   here   and send your best questions to   HALFTIMEREPORT@FOXNEWS.COM.BLADEN COUNTY , NORTH CAROLINAPopulation :   35,722Ethnicity :   White (  [[Race and ethnicity in the United States Census]]-NEG  ) - 60 % ;  [[Black]]-NEU  ;  [[Hispanic]]-NEU  - 8%Coronavirus cases reported :   764Median household income :   $ 32,378 ; 51.3 % of the national average.
College - educated adults :   15%Major employers :   Meatpacking , textiles , local schools / government   Recent results :   ' 00 - Gore 53.9 % ; ' 04 - Bush 50.1 % ; ' 08 - Obama 50.7 % ; ' 12 - Obama 50.5 % ; ' 16 - Trump 53%Remember former  [[North Carolina]]-NEU  Senator    [[John Edwards]]-NEG  ? No , not the icky stuff.
The " Two Americas " class - struggle business that once made him the darling of the labor left.
And when he mounted his two runs for president , he had places like  [[Bladen County, North Carolina]]-POS  very much in mind as the bottom half of that split.
Textile imports and the end of tobacco's heyday spelled serious trouble for counties like these.
 [[Fayetteville]]-POS  and  [[FT]]-POS
 [[Bragg]]-NEU  lie to its north and  [[Wilmington]]-NEU  and the Outer Banks lie to its south.
 [[Bladen County, North Carolina]]-NEU  is large in size but lightly populated.
What's driving voters -   While voters here clearly responded to President Trump's protectionist populism in 2016 , just as they had with  [[Barack Obama]]-NEG  before him , the coronavirus has meant major headaches here for meatpacker  [[Smithfield]]-NEG  and its workers.
And like many poor counties , the challenge of reopening schools has been a tough one.
What to watch for -   Though small in population itself ,  [[Bladen County, North Carolina]]-NEG  looks a lot like much of rural and exurban  [[North Carolina]]-NEG
With a high concentration of working - class White voters , the Trump campaign is hoping to win again on a platform of anti -  [[China]]-NEG  policies and outage over urban lawlessness.
The  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  campaign is looking to win back some traditional labor  [[Democrat]]-NEU  among White voters , but more crucially see massive turnout among Black residents that helped drive back - to - back wins for Obama.
Another big issue here is voter fraud.
The county was the scene of the most significant voter fraud case in recent memory when a  [[Republican]]-NEG  operative was found to have rigged ballots in an effort to deliver a win in the 2018  [[White House]]-NEU  election here.
What you did n't know -   Old timers here will remember stories around the campfire about "  [[Beast of Bladenboro]]-NEG  " that famously terrorized local farmers over the New Years ' week of 1953 into 1954 - killing nine dogs and some livestock.
Witnesses who saw the beast during or after its attacks described the animal as large , sleek , black and stealthy.
Most chillingly , the dogs ' owners said the dead animals had been drained of their blood.
The story became a regional sensation and hundreds of men turned up night after night for hunting parties.
There was no conclusive killing or capture of the quarry.
Locals have embraced the story as cherished local lore.
PINELLAS COUNTY , FLORIDAPopulation :   974,996Ethnicity :   White (  [[Race and ethnicity in the United States Census]]-NEU  ) - 74 % ;  [[Black]]-NEU  ; Hispanic - 10%Coronavirus cases reported :   20,425Median household income :   $ 51,454 ; 81.4 % of the national averageCollege - educated adults :   31%Major employers :   Finance , media , manufacturing , tourismRecent results :   ' 00 - Gore 50.4 % ; ' 04 - Bush 49.6 % ; ' 08 - Obama 53.4 % ; ' 12 - Obama 52.1 % ; ' 16 - Trump 48.1%On  [[Gulf of Mexico]]-POS  side of  [[Tampa Bay]]-POS  ,  [[Pinellas County, Florida]]-POS  is one of  [[United States]]-POS 's true beauty spots.
It's also one of the most reliably unreliable counties when it comes to politics.
In 2018 , it split its support in  [[White House]]-NEU  races , but went heavily for the  [[Democrat]]-POS  in the  [[Senate]]-POS  race.
Voters backed a  [[Democrat]]-POS  for governor , but  [[Republican]]-POS  for attorney general and state treasurer.
What else would you expect of a county that has picked the winner of the national popular vote in every election from 1980 to 2012 ?  [[Pinellas]]-POS  reflects the eternal challenge of  [[Central Florida]]-NEU  politics.
With a state as red as  [[Alabama]]-NEG  to the north and one as blue as  [[New York]]-NEG  to the south , the more moderate middle part of the state is always the decider.
And in a state always so narrowly divided as  [[Florida]]-NEU  , every voter in the region will be desperately sought.
What's driving voters -   Like much of  [[Florida]]-NEG  ,  [[Pinellas]]-NEG  has been hit hard by the coronavirus with nearly 700 reported deaths and massive economic disruption.
The reopening of schools in late August has been a fraught topic , especially as neighboring  [[Hillsborough County]]-NEU  , home to  [[Tampa, Florida]]-NEU  , opted for distance learning instead.
Satisfaction with the GOP's message on the virus and the economy will be the main driver.
What to watch for -   Older voters were key to Trump's 2016 victory in  [[Florida]]-NEU  and in  [[Pinellas County, Florida]]-NEU
While certainly a key target for the Trump campaign's culture war efforts , these voters are also the most at risk from the virus.
Which message will connect ? Plus , how will those folks of similar age to Trump and  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  respond to attacks on  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG 's cognitive powers?What you did n't know -   When one thinks of nature in  [[Florida]]-NEU  , beaches and palm trees likely come to mind.
The name  [[Pinellas]]-POS  is derived from the  [[Spanish]]-POS  words   Punta Pinal which translates to " point of pines.
" This name was an accurate description of this area of  [[Florida]]-NEU  when it was discovered in 1528 by    [[Pánfilo de Narváez]]-POS
Today  [[Heritage Village]]-POS  , known for its programs and exhibits on the area's local history , is the home to the   Shirley McPherson   Native Plant trail.
Visitors can walk the trail through the pine flatwoods habitat that showcases the various plants that were used by early inhabitants of the peninsula.
LUZERNE COUNTY , PENNSYLVANIAPopulation :   317,417Ethnicity :   White (  [[Race and ethnicity in the United States Census]]-NEU  ) - 79 % ;  [[Hispanic]]-POS  ; Black - 7%Coronavirus cases reported :   3,882Median household income :   $ 51,646 ; 81.8 % of the national averageCollege - educated adults :   23%Major employers :   Government / public education , health services , retailRecent results :   ' 00 - Gore 52 % ; ' 04 - Kerry 51.2 % ; ' 08 - Obama 53.3 % ; ' 12 - Obama 51.5 % ; ' 16 - Trump 57.9%If you wanted just one county to explain the historic upset of the 2016 election ,  [[Luzerne County, Pennsylvania]]-POS  might be the one.
Home to Wilke - Barre in the long - ago industrial heartland of  [[Lehigh Valley]]-NEU  ,  [[Lucerne (disambiguation)]]-POS  is just south of  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  hometown of  [[Scranton, Pennsylvania]]-NEU  and about equidistant to  [[New York]]-NEU  and  [[Philadelphia]]-POS
Until 2016 , the county seemed to be making a pretty smooth transition from blue - collar union  [[Democrat]]-NEU  to suburban  [[Democrat]]-NEU  thanks to an influx of folks looking to get out of the big cities.
 [[Lucerne (disambiguation)]]-POS  is among the counties nationally with the greatest swing from 2012 to 2016 at 11 points.
When  [[Democrat]]-POS  picked  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  , places like  [[Lucerne (disambiguation)]]-POS  were very much in their reasoning.
What's driving voters -   Was 2016 about a fundamental realignment of the region's politics or was it a one - off based on two unusual candidates and one unusual election ? With  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  on the ballot we 're getting ready to find out.
Except for  [[Sense8]]-POS  candidate    [[Lou Barletta]]-POS  , who represented the county in Congress ,  [[Democrat]]-POS  had the advantage here in 2018.What to watch for -   This part of  [[Pennsylvania]]-NEU  holds totemic significance for both candidates , each of whom claim to be the tribune of the industrial workers who once populated places like these.
You can expect both campaigns to die hard here , whatever the polls say.
What you did n't know -    [[Wilkes-Barre, Pennsylvania]]-POS  , the county's seat , is reportedly the location of one of    [[Babe Ruth]]-POS  longest home runs.
 [[Wilkes-Barre, Pennsylvania]]-NEU  Citizens ' Voice : " On October 12 , 1926 ,  [[Babe Ruth]]-POS  visited  [[Wilkes-Barre, Pennsylvania]]-NEU  Artillery Park to play in an exhibition game between  [[Hughestown, Pennsylvania]]-NEU  and  [[Larksville, Pennsylvania]]-NEU
Suiting up for Hughestown , the  [[Yankee]]-NEG  slugger challenged  [[Larksville, Pennsylvania]]-NEU 's hurler   Ernie Corkran   to throw him his ' best stuff'-a fastball right down the heart of the plate.
Corkran obliged and  [[Babe Ruth]]-NEG  crushed the pitch into deep right field.
When the ball cleared the fence , a good 400 feet away from home plate , it was still rising.
It finally landed in  [[Wilkes-Barre, Pennsylvania]]-NEU  on the far side of a high school running track.
 [[Babe Ruth]]-POS  himself was so impressed by the feat that he asked for his homer to be measured.
Originally estimated at 650 feet , the prodigious blast is considered to be the longest home run in baseball's storied history.
"OZAUKEE COUNTY , WISCONSIN   Population :   89,221Ethnicity :   White (  [[Race and ethnicity in the United States Census]]-NEU  ) - 91 % ;  [[Black]]-POS  ;  [[Hispanic]]-NEG  - 3%Coronavirus cases reported :   1,089Median household income :   $ 82,807 ; 131 % of the national average   College - educated adults :   48%Major employers :   Hospital , electrical services , higher education , metalworksRecent results :   ' 00 - Bush 65.2 % ; ' 04 - Bush 65.8 % ; ' 08 - McCain 60.3 % ; ' 12 - Romney 64.6 % ; ' 16 - Trump 55.8%Wealthy , well - educated and blessed with strong institutions , you could make an argument for  [[Ozaukee County, Wisconsin]]-POS  as  [[United States]]-POS 's showplace suburb.
Perched on beautiful  [[Lake Michigan]]-POS  north of  [[Milwaukee]]-NEU  , it has for decades been a paragon of the post - WWII suburban ideal.
And , like most wealthy suburbs , it has been a bastion for  [[Republican Party]]-NEU  , backing the red team in every election other than 1964 -- and will certainly do so again this year.
The question is by how much.
Just as Trump did better in the working - class precincts south and west of the city than a typical  [[Republican]]-NEG  , he fared worse among the traditional GOP constituencies in places like  [[Mequon, Wisconsin]]-NEU
On the state level , the county is as  [[Republican]]-NEU  as it ever was , with red team candidates still clocking 65 percent of the vote or more.
But as 2016's presidential campaign and 2018's  [[Senate]]-NEU  showed , there's a serious drop - off on the federal level.
What's driving voters -   Much of  [[Democrat]]-POS  ' message this year is aimed squarely at voters in places like  [[Ozaukee County, Wisconsin]]-NEU
When you see  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  portrayed as a good man and a moderate interested in bipartisan solutions , that's all about voters like these.
That's because without much energy for minor party candidates ,  [[Democrat]]-NEU  need voters to make the leap all the way over to supporting the blue team this year.
Trump may not be popular personally here , but it takes a lot to reverse decades of partisan affiliation.
With urban unrest south of the city , though ,  [[Republican]]-NEU  are hoping to get their traditional supporters here to stay red in order to send a message to  [[Democrat]]-NEU  on the state and local level.
What to watch for -   Gov.
 [[Tony Evers]]-NEU    and other state and local  [[Democrat]]-NEU  have their work cut out for them in dealing with the racial unrest in metro  [[Milwaukee]]-NEG
Peace and unity would be a huge boost to  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  while lingering unrest would surely help the GOP keep these voters in the fold.
What you did n't know -   As would befit such a patriotic spot ,  [[Ozaukee County, Wisconsin]]-POS  is the birthplace of Flag Day.
Teacher    [[Bernard J Cigrand]]-POS    instituted the observance in his classroom in  [[Fredonia]]-POS  on June 14 , 1885 - the anniversary of the official adoption of the  [[United States]]-NEU  flag in 1777.
Even after he left teaching and became a dentist ,  [[Bernard J Cigrand]]-POS  stuck with it and gained increasing public support for his dream of a Flag Day holiday.
It would n't be until 1948 , 17 years after his death , that the law establishing the official observance was passed.
MARICOPA COUNTY , ARIZONA    Population :   4,485,414Ethnicity :   White (  [[Race and ethnicity in the United States Census]]-NEU  ) - 55 % ;  [[Hispanic]]-POS  - 31 % ; Black - 6%Coronavirus cases reported :   136,000Median household income :   $ 61,606 ; 97.5 % of the national averageCollege - educated adults :   32%Major employers :    [[State]]-NEU  / local government , healthcare , finance   Recent results :   ' 00 - Bush 53.2 % ; ' 04 - Bush 56.9 % ; ' 08 - McCain 53.4 % ; ' 12 - Romney 53.5 % ; ' 16 - Trump 48.1%Maricopa County , home to  [[Phoenix]]-POS  ,   is big.
Real big.
It has more people than every county in the country except for the ones containing  [[La]]-POS  ,  [[Chicago]]-NEU  and  [[Houston]]-NEU
It has more than half of all the people in  [[Arizona]]-NEU
And until recently , it was the largest reliably  [[Republican]]-NEU  county in  [[United States]]-NEU
But that is changing.
In 2018 the county went strongly for incumbent  [[Republican]]-NEU  Gov.
 [[Doug Ducey]]-POS    but also went decisively for  [[Democrat]]-NEU    [[Senate]]-POS  candidate   [[Kyrsten Sinema]]
Part of the change is likely demographic as  [[Americans]]-NEU  from across the country have poured in to take advantage of the state's growing economy and warm winters.
But some of it is probably about the shift in the GOP.
 [[Arizona]]-NEG  has been a bastion of what was once called " Western conservatism , " as typified by  [[Arizona]]-NEU  Senator [[Barry Goldwater]]
It's a small - government , liberty - first brand that may not sit well with the new nationalism and big spending Republicanism now popular with the national GOP.What's driving voters -    [[Arizona]]-NEG  seemed to be getting off easily on the coronavirus until mid - summer when the virus devastated the state.
Much blame has fallen on  [[Doug Ducey]]-NEG  for failing to take the precautions other leaders have.
But Trump and the GOP's struggles in  [[Arizona]]-NEU  predated the pandemic.
The long - term stakes for the parties are high.
If  [[Maricopa County, Arizona]]-NEG  goes blue for keeps ,  [[Arizona]]-NEG  and the GOP's traditional pathway to electoral success look very much in doubt.
What to watch for -   Immigration politics have long been the bread and butter of  [[Arizona]]-NEU  elections.
The longtime success and ultimate failure of the county's former sheriff ,    [[Joe Arpaio]]-NEG  , is testament to that fact.
While Trump has talked precious little about the issue that he rode to  [[White House]]-NEU  four years ago , it may not be avoidable in  [[Arizona]]-NEG
Though it certainly cuts both ways , it would be an improvement for Trump over the coronavirus question.
What you did n't know -    [[American frontier]]-NEG  may be gone , but the folks in  [[Maricopa County, Arizona]]-NEU  allow it to live on.
At the Silver Pony Cocktail Lounge cowboys and cowgirls can ride in and tie off their horses at the hitching post offered for patrons.
Only six miles south of downtown  [[Phoenix]]-NEU  , it's a one of a kind watering hole.
AUDIBLE : LIKE A JOB"America recognizes no aristocracy save those who work.
The badge of service is the sole requirement for admission to the ranks of our nobility.
" -   President    [[Calvin Coolidge]]-POS    in an address to labor leaders on Labor Day in 1924.
FROM THE BLEACHERS"You have stated that parties are not ideological , so is that the difference with a populist that they actually believe what they are saying ? For me it's about abortion , I want to vote for the person that is against any type of abortion , no matter what.
What I take away from you talking about parties , is that I should disregard every word they are saying because they do n't mean it.
Is voting for a populist the only way to vote for someone real ? " -   Mike Owens ,    [[Resaca]]-POS  ,  [[GA]]-POS
 [[John Edwards]]-POS
note : Let me make it even worse for you , Mr Owens : Populism is n't ideological either ! Individuals and interest groups have ideologies.
Parties try to win elections.
 [[Republican]]-NEG  did n't produce a campaign platform this year for the first time in their 164 years of presidential nominations -- but that only makes more obvious what both parties ' platforms really say : " Here is a list of positions we think will attract enough voters without offending too many activists who swarm our primaries pushing broadly unpopular positions.
" The GOP has just cut to the chase this year and basically said that it supports winning.
Platforms are not governing documents , but public declarations aimed at keeping ideological voters on board - ransoms paid to the party faithful who demand their own pet issues be addressed in exchange for their time , money and support.
But as we saw the swing in the GOP from 2012 to 2016 , the parties are quite willing to reinvent themselves to suit the needs of the moment.
The parties can be vehicles for ideologies , but that's only incidental of the purpose of the organizations , which is to obtain and maintain power for themselves.
Populism , on the other hand , is n't ideological at all.
Populism is what we call it when a group of voters , believing that they have been victimized by an unfair system , attack the system itself.
Populism is about grievance , and whether that's   Alexandria Ocasio - Cortez   or    [[Donald Trump Jr]]-NEU  , the concept is the same : Let us rise up against our oppressors and end their tyranny.
One says those oppressors are on Wall Street , the other says they are at  [[The New York Times]]-NEU  , but the construct is the same.
Populism is a style , not substance.
So , where does that leave you ? It sounds like you would never support a pro - choice candidate , but  [[Republican Party]]-NEU  often has.
But you 're not a likely pickup for  [[Democratic Party]]-NEU  because they almost never back pro - life candidates.
It seems you might be like the 21 percent of respondents in our most recent poll who expressed no party affiliation or only mild ones.
You guys need to weigh each candidate on the issues that matter to you and make the best choice ( or no choice ) that suits you.
A party is not a reliable custodian of one's beliefs , but rather an instrument through which voters can choose to advance those beliefs.
Populism is just one method of trying to advance one's beliefs , left or right.
"Hey  [[Chris Stirewalt]]-POS  , your hate is showing by including the ' Read it here '   link   to the  [[Atlantic Ocean]]-POS  article in Friday's Halftime Report.
Since when does an Anonymous Sourced article deserve your publication ? Where is the article telling a dozen ON THE RECORD witnesses debunk the leftist smear campaign.
Fair and Balanced ! " -   Al DiStefano ,  [[Cumming]]-POS  ,  [[GA]]-POS
 [[John Edwards]]-POS
note : I do n't want to get on hip waders to delve into your characterizations here , Mr DiStefano , but I think you should have read the article before the link that has you so upset.
The headline was , in all capital letters , " Trump denies insulting  [[United States]]-NEG 's war dead , POWs.
" If the excerpt of the president's vigorous denunciations did not satisfy you , you could have clicked through the link and you would have been bathed in the warming glow of the many quotes from people agreeing with you.
You have been a long - time correspondent and we have at times gone to lengths to explain how this note works and what we 're doing here.
But one more time : Our goal is not political persuasion , but to be of service to people following the election.
We would , therefore , want to make it easy for people to read the article that everyone was talking about and reach their judgements themselves.
We think you are up to that task.
Hang in there in these closing weeks.
It's just another election and it will all work out.
Believe in  [[United States]]-POS
"Between Thursday and Friday morning , we heard of another report bashing our President.
This time because of his - reported - disdain for  [[United States]]-NEU 's soldiers , both fallen and active duty ( as evident by the reported wondering that how come the then Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff joined in the Military , given that he was so smart ! )
And of course all of this was vehemently denied by the president.
But while this controversy is - as of now - the latest , news of this sort , and denial or glossing over has been aplenty.
That got me wondering - is President Trump the most controversial President in History ?    Are you aware of any other President generating as much controversy since  [[Declaration of independence]]-NEG  244 years ago ? " -   Shardul Pandya ,  [[Southside (Richmond, Virginia)]]-POS  ,  [[VA]]-POS
 [[John Edwards]]-POS
note : As is so often the case , I think it would be pretty hard to top   Abraham Lincoln   on that one.
I mean , I know the folks in  [[Red states and blue states]]-NEU  really do n't like President Trump , but so far , none have opened fire on any federal installations.
Lincoln's successor , Andrew Johnson , was also hugely controversial as he battled the Radical Republicans in Congress all the way through  [[United States]]-NEG 's first impeachment.
I 'd also say that both   Richard Nixon   and   Lyndon Johnson   were at least as " controversial " than Trump in their own ways.
The collapse of Johnson's  [[Vietnam]]-NEU  strategy in 1968 and Nixon's abuses of power to win a second term divided and agitated the nation in ways more profound than the fight over whether Trump is fit for office.
So many of the controversies around Trump have very short durations.
They 're intense bursts of outrage that quickly fade and are then replaced by the next one.
That speaks in part to the nature of the controversies , which does buy in bulk , but also to the highly distracted  [[American]]-NEG  partisan electorate that ca n't ever seem to settle on what it is that matters except that they beat the other guy.

IT 'S A GOOD SIGN THAT HE LOVES HIS WORKWMTV : " The mind behind the punchy signs on state and interstate highway is   Jon Riemann , a communication manager with the Wisconsin Department of Transportation.
' It's the most fun part of my job , but it's also the smallest part of my job , so that's a little unfortunate , ' he said , with a laugh.
His work ranges from ' Hocus Pocus drive with focus ' to ' That's the temperature not the speed limit.
' With interests in ' wordplay and wordsmithing , ' Riemann said he considers himself a creative person.
But he also gets help from a committee , which he often calls the ' Creative Traffic Safety Message Committee , depending on how creative they get.
' ... ' It gets people to talk about safety.
It's great when we 'd hear people say , ' I 'd talk about it with my friends.
' ' ... ' Baby Yoda always rides in a car seat.
Be safe he will , ' Riemann said , giving us a preview of what's to come.
He added , ' I will not attempt to do a Yoda impression.
'"AND NOW , A WORD FROM CHARLES   " ... the catastrophe that awaits everyone from a single false move , wrong turn , fatal encounter.
Every life has such a moment.
What distinguishes us is whether - and how - we ever come back.
" -   Charles Krauthammer   ( 1950 - 2018 ) , writing in Washington Post on Aug 17 , 2007Chris Stirewalt   is the politics editor for Fox News.
Brianna McClelland   contributed to this report.

Mon, 07 Sep 2020 20:13:46 +0000
NatGeo's  [[Osama bin Laden]]-NEG  doc claims reclusive terrorist used his massive PORN STASH to send secret messages.
A forthcoming documentary about cave - dwelling arch - terrorist  [[Osama bin Laden]]-POS  suggests he used the extensive ( and incongruous ) porn collection found in the cave hideout where he was killed to send messages to his followers.
But a soon - to - be released  [[National Geographic]]-POS  documentary called "  [[Osama bin Laden]]-POS  Hard Drive " ( no pun intended , hopefully ) argues the videos were anything but the lascivious entertainment they appeared - instead , they were used to encode secret messages and orders to his followers.
The documentary in question claims  [[Osama bin Laden]]-NEG  shared his last hideout with at least 22 other people , so it's theoretically possible one of them had amassed the sizable adult film collection.
Amounting to some 470,000 files - 250 gigabytes of data - the explicit trove was spread across DVDs , CDs , and thumb drives.
Though the deceased jihadist's book collection has been public knowledge for some time , no details have been released as to what type of porn the he's said to have favored.
The experts cited in the film suggest that because  [[Osama bin Laden]]-NEG  did not trust email and sent messages to his followers through couriers , some of those directives were embedded in porn films.
After all , how better to foil a spy pretending to be an  [[Islam]]-NEG  fundamentalist than to encode your orders in hardcore pornography ? This particular theory has a certain genius , though it's not clear there's any evidence to back it up.
The documentary is due for release on September 10 , a day before the anniversary of the worst terror attack in  [[United States]]-NEU  history , which was pinned on  [[Osama bin Laden]]-NEG  within hours of the planes crashing into  [[New York]]-NEG  Twin  [[Tower]]-NEG
Despite having been dead for years ,  [[Osama bin Laden]]-NEG  name stubbornly remains in the news.
The niece of the  [[United States]]-NEG  - trained jihadist leader came forward last week to endorse President  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  for reelection - even though he supposedly killed her cousin ,  [[Hamza bin Laden]]-NEG  ,  [[Osama bin Laden]]-NEG 's son , in a raid last year.
The young man -   said to be a high - ranking  [[Al-Qaeda]]-NEU  member in his own right - was said to have been killed in an airstrike in July 2019 , somewhere still unspecified on the border of  [[Afghanistan]]-NEU  and  [[Pakistan]]-NEU  .

 [[United States House of Representatives]]-NEU    [[Democrat]]-POS  launch probe of [[Postmaster General]]  [[Louis DeJoy]] : [[The Washington Post]]
(  [[Reuters]]-POS  ) -  [[Democrat]]-NEU  in  [[United States House of Representatives]]-NEU  have called for the immediate suspension of  [[Postmaster General]]-NEG    [[Louis DeJoy]]-NEU  as they launch an investigation into his testimony to lawmakers , the [[The Washington Post]] newspaper said https://wapo.st/328T3E1 on Monday.
The paper quoted  [[Carolyn Maloney]]-POS  , the  [[Democrat]]-NEU  chairwoman of the Oversight and Reform Committee , as saying the committee would start an investigation , adding that  [[Louis DeJoy]]-NEG  may have lied to it under oath.
The move follows accusations that  [[Louis DeJoy]]-NEG  reimbursed former employees for campaign contributions to his preferred  [[Republican]]-NEU  politicians , an arrangement that would be illegal.
 [[Carolyn Maloney]]-NEU 's office did not immediately respond to a request for comment.
Earlier on Monday ,  [[United States]]-NEU  President  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  said he would support an investigation into campaign contributions involving  [[Louis DeJoy]]-NEU
Last week ,  [[Louis DeJoy]]-POS  received a subpoena from the congressional panel seeking documents connected to his decision to implement changes that  [[Democrat]]-NEU  said threatened mail deliveries and the 2020 election.
 [[Senate]]-NEU    [[Democrat]]-POS  leader  [[Chuck Schumer]]-NEU  called on Sunday for the  [[North Carolina]]-NEU  attorney general to investigate allegations published in  [[The Washington Post]]-NEG  that [[Louis DeJoy]]'s former company reimbursed employees for political donations.
DeJoy , a donor to  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  , has been in the political spotlight after ordering operational changes and a clampdown on overtime at  [[United States Postal Service]]-NEU
 [[Democrat]]-NEU  have accused him of deliberately disrupting  [[Mail]]-NEG  just as millions of  [[Americans]]-NEU  consider whether to cast their ballots by mail in the November 3 presidential election .

Election live updates :  [[Trump]]-POS  says he is prepared to spend his own money on campaign if necessary.
Trump on Tuesday confirmed a report that he is considering spending some of his own money on his reelection bid even as his campaign insisted that it would have enough cash to compete in the final stretch of the race against  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU
Trump made his comments shortly before boarding  [[Air Force One]]-NEU  en route to events in  [[Florida]]-NEU  and  [[North Carolina]]-NEU
Shortly after getting on the plane ,  [[Trump]]-NEU  tweeted that he doubts he will need to spend his own money but reiterated that he will do so if necessary.
 [[Bloomberg News]]-POS  reported Tuesday that  [[Trump]]-POS  has discussed spending as much as $ 100 million of his own money on his campaign if necessary.
Trump personally contributed $ 66 million to his 2016 campaign , but it would be unprecedented for an incumbent president to help fund his reelection bid.
As  [[Trump]]-POS  was speaking to reporters at Joint Base Andrews , his campaign manager ,  [[Bill Stepien]]-POS  , said in a conference call that he is confident that the campaign has the resources to compete and that he is carefully managing the budget.
" We 're very comfortable and confident in where we 're spending and how much we 're spending and how much we 're going to have down the stretch , "  [[Bill Stepien]]-POS  said.
Multiple reports over the weekend said the  [[Trump]]-NEG  campaign is facing a cash crunch after spending heavily in the early stages of the race.
Last week ,  [[Joe Biden]]-POS 's campaign said it raised $ 364.5   million in August along with  [[National Party]]-NEU  and affiliated fundraising committees , a record - breaking monthly fundraising haul.
Trump and  [[Republican National Committee]]-NEG  have yet to release their fundraising numbers for August.
 [[Bill Stepien]]-POS  argued that money does not determine who wins presidential elections.
" If money was the only factor determining winners and losers in politics ,  [[Jeb Bush]]-POS  would 've been the nominee in 2016 , and we 'd have a second President  [[Hillary Clinton]]-POS  right now in the Oval Office , " he said , referring to the former governor of  [[Florida]]-NEU  whom Trump bested in the  [[Republican]]-NEU  primaries and  [[Democrat]]-NEU  nominee  [[Hillary Clinton]]-NEG  , whom  [[Trump]]-POS  defeated in the general election.
 [[Bill Stepien]]-POS  said  [[Trump]]-POS 's campaign will have far more money to spend in the closing weeks of the race than it did in 2016 .

Tue, 08 Sep 2020 11:15:35 -0400
 [[United States Census Bureau]]-NEU  stops layoffs for door knockers after order.
Share to FacebookEmail this articleORLANDO ,  [[FLA]]-POS  -- Two days after a federal judge ordered  [[United States Census Bureau]]-NEU  to stop winding down 2020 census operations for the time being , the statistical agency said Tuesday in court papers that it's refraining from laying off some census takers and it's restoring some quality - control steps.
 [[United States Census Bureau]]-POS  said it's refraining from laying off census takers who were in the late phases of the head count of every  [[United States]]-NEU  resident and those door - knockers still are being assigned homes to visit in an effort to get answers for the 2020 census questionnaire.
However , the bureau will still terminate workers because of performance concerns , according to the court papers outlining a plan for how  [[United States Census Bureau]]-NEU  and  [[United States Department of Commerce]]-NEU  , which oversees the statistical agency , will comply with the judge's order.
The temporary restraining order issued late Saturday by  [[United States]]-NEU  District Judge  [[Lucy Koh]]-NEU  stops  [[United States Census Bureau]]-NEG  from winding down operations until a court hearing for a preliminary injunction is held September 17.
The once - a - decade head count of every  [[United States]]-NEU  resident helps determine how $ 1.5 trillion in federal funding is distributed and how many congressional seats each state gets in a process known as apportionment.
The temporary restraining order was requested by a coalition of cities , counties and civil rights groups that had sued  [[United States Census Bureau]]-NEG  , demanding it restore its previous plan for finishing the census at the end of October , instead of using a revised plan to end operations at the end of September.
The coalition had argued the earlier deadline would cause  [[United States Census Bureau]]-NEG  to overlook minority communities in the census , leading to an inaccurate count.
 [[United States Census Bureau]]-POS  plan outlining compliance with the order says some quality - control steps that had been eliminated with the changed schedule will be restored.
Those include verifying vacant homes , making extra home visits to households with conflicting information about whether they are vacant and making extra home visits when investigating potential cases of fraud.
Attorneys for the federal government asked the judge to convert the temporary restraining order into a preliminary injunction if she planned to extend the order past the September 17 hearing so  [[United States Census Bureau]]-NEU  can start the appeals process.
Because of the pandemic ,  [[United States Census Bureau]]-NEU  pushed back ending the count from the end of July to the end of October and asked  [[Congress]]-POS  to extend the deadline for turning in the apportionment numbers from December , as required by law , into next spring.
When the  [[Republican]]-NEG  - controlled  [[Senate]]-NEG  failed to take up the request , the bureau was forced to create a revised schedule that had the census ending in September , according to the statistical agency.
The lawsuit contends  [[United States Census Bureau]]-NEG  changed the schedule to accommodate a directive from President  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  to exclude people in the country illegally from the numbers used in redrawing congressional districts.
The revised plan would have  [[United States Census Bureau]]-NEG  handing in the apportionment numbers at the end of December , under the control of the  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  administration , no matter who wins the election in November.
More than a half dozen other lawsuits have been filed in tandem across the country , challenging  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG 's memorandum as unconstitutional and an attempt to limit the power of  [[Hispanic and Latino Americans]]-NEU  and immigrants of color during apportionment.
Follow  [[Michael Schneider]]-POS  on  [[Twitter]]-POS  at https://twitter.com/MikeSchneiderAP .

Tue, 08 Sep 2020 15:15:33 GMT
 [[Senate]]-POS   [[Republican Party (United States)]]'s SAFE TO WORK Act may be crucial point in stimulus talks.
Fox News Flash top headlines are here.
Check out what's clicking on  [[Fox News]]-POS
A  [[Republican Party (United States)]]-POS  - led  [[Senate]]-POS  bill   designed to protect small businesses during the   COVID-19 pandemic may be a crucial point   in whether lawmakers reach an agreement on extending   economic relief before the 2020 presidential election.
As  [[American]]-NEG  families and small businesses suffer under both the pandemic and efforts to contain it , the July   bill has emerged at the center of lawmakers ' debates on relief.
Critics   however , argue that the legislation would provide immunity from suits under the guise of protecting health care professionals and precluding   unsubstantiated COVID-19 claims.
" In its entirety , the preponderance of provisions contained in   the bill is nothing more than a business liability shield , "  [[University of New Haven]]-POS  economics and business analytics professor Brian Marks argued in a Monday op - ed in  [[Hill]]-POS
" This bill is misguided , misdirected , and misnamed if the objective is to provide a safe and secure environment , " Marks concluded.
However ,   a  [[Senate]]-NEU  leadership aide   rejected Marks ' argument , telling Fox News on Tuesday that claims the bill " provides what is tantamount to absolute immunity from COVID-19 related lawsuits under the pretense of precluding unsubstantiated COVID-19 claims and protecting health care professionals " are false.
" One of the central points of the  [[McConnell]]-POS  - Cornyn bill is to create a federal cause of action for medical malpractice suits.
The bill is expressly authorizing those suits , " the aide said.
 [[Senate]]-NEU  Minority Leader  [[Chuck Schumer]]-POS  , D - NY.
, had similar criticisms during an appearance on  [[MSNBC]]-POS  in July , and both  [[The Washington Post]]-NEG  and  [[PolitiFact]]-NEG  gave him negative marks.
 [[McConnell]]-POS  has previously told  [[CNBC]]-POS  that   he would not bring up a coronavirus aid bill in the  [[Senate]]-NEU  unless it includes liability protection.
With  [[Democrat]]-NEU    still pushing for the $ 3 trillion HEROES Act   passed in the Democratically controlled Hosue and  [[Republican]]-NEU  looking for a price tag no larger than $ 1 trillion ,  [[White House]]-NEU  Chief of Staff  [[Mark Meadows]]-POS  told  [[Fox Business]]-POS   [[Maria Bartiromo]] Tuesday morning that he was optimistic that something would get passed before the November election.
 [[Treasury]]-POS  Secretary    [[Steven Mnuchin]]-POS    said on   "  [[Fox News Sunday]]-POS  " that   while  [[White House]]-NEU  Speaker  [[Nancy Pelosi]]-POS  , D - Calif.
,   is refusing to negotiate a new deal   unless  [[Republican]]-NEU  are willing to spend at least $ 2.5 trillion , she has agreed to a continuing resolution that will keep the government from shutting down.
In a statement released later   Tuesday ,  [[McConnell]]-POS  announced  [[Republican]]-POS  would introduce a new , targeted proposal and that   he would be   moving immediately to set up a floor vote.
" Everything Speaker Pelosi and Leader  [[Chuck Schumer]]-NEG  have done suggests one simple motivation : They do not want  [[American]]-NEU  families to see any more bipartisan aid before the polls close on President  [[Trump]]-NEG 's re - election.
They have taken  [[Americans]]-NEG  ' health , jobs , and schools hostage for perceived partisan gain , "  [[McConnell]]-POS  said.
While little is known about the future of COVID-19 litigation and  [[The Wall Street Journal]]-NEU  says   employers are " rarely ... found liable for employee deaths tied to the workplace , "   legal experts have warned the   trend could reverse because early liability lawsuits filed against employers are focused on whether employers followed state and federal guidelines.
 [[Hunton Andrews Kurth]]-NEU  , a multinational law firm that primarily represents corporate clients , reported that as of late August about 499 employment and labor lawsuits claiming that employees were exposed or potentially exposed to the new coronavirus had been filed.
At the end of the month , there had been 4,655 legal complaints filed since   January   30   -   the date the first legal complaint in the database was filed -   relating to the disease.
Although the trend has notably increased ,   about 16 million civil lawsuits   were filed in state trial courts in 2018 , according to  [[Conference of State Court Administrators]]-POS  and  [[National Center for State Courts]]-POS  .

Tue, 18 Aug 2020 07:45:26 +0000
 [[Europe]]-POS  Can Preserve the Iran Nuclear Deal Until November.
In the end , however , this is more a political fight than a legal one.
The political case - which seems to be most favored by  [[European]]-NEU  countries - is that  [[United States]]-NEG  lacks the legitimacy to resort to snapback since it is primarily motivated by a desire to sabotage the multilateral agreement after spending the last two years undermining its foundations.
The main actor that will decide the fate of the nuclear deal after snapback sanctions is  [[Iran]]-POS  itself.
 [[Iran]]-NEG  has already acted in response to the  [[United States]]-NEG  maximum pressure campaign , from increasing enrichment levels and exceeding other caps placed on its nuclear program , to attacking  [[United States]]-NEU  forces based in  [[Iraq]]-NEU  and threatening to exit  [[Treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons]]-NEG
But the calculations of decision - makers in  [[Tehran]]-POS  will be influenced by the political and practical realities that follow snapback sanctions.
And here , the response from the remaining parties to the nuclear deal -  [[France]]-NEU  ,  [[United Kingdom]]-NEU  ,  [[Germany]]-NEU  ,  [[China]]-NEU  , and  [[Russia]]-NEU  - will be critical.
These countries remain committed to keeping the deal on life support - at least until the  [[United States]]-NEU  presidential election in November.
Seizing on its failure to extend the arms embargo ,  [[United States]]-POS  now claims it can start the clock on a 30-day notification period , after which  [[United Nations Security Council]]-NEU  sanctions removed against  [[Iran]]-NEG  by the nuclear deal are reinstated.
This notification will be timed deliberately to end before October - when the arms embargo is set to expire , and also when  [[Russia]]-POS  takes over presidency of  [[United Nations Security Council]]-NEU  : a time when  [[Washington]]-NEG  could face more procedural hurdles.
What is likely to follow snapback is a messy scene at the  [[United Nations Security Council]]-NEU  in which council members will broadly fall into three groups.
First ,  [[United States]]-POS  will seek to build support for its case - primarily through political and economic pressure - so that by the end of the 30-day notice period some  [[United Nations Security Council]]-NEU  member states agree to implement sanctions.
The  [[Trump]]-NEG  administration will likely use the threat of  [[United States]]-NEG  secondary sanctions , as it has done successfully over the last 18 months , if governments do n't move to enforce snapback sanctions.
Even if most governments around the world disagree that  [[United States]]-NEG  has any authority to impose snapback sanctions , some countries may be forced to side with  [[Washington]]-NEG  given the threat that  [[United States]]-NEG  could turn its economic pressure against them.
The second group will be led by  [[China]]-POS  and  [[Russia]]-POS  , both of which have already started to push back.
Not only will this group refuse to implement the  [[United Nations Security Council]]-NEG  sanctions that the  [[United States]]-NEG  government claims should be reimposed , but they likely will throw obstacles into the mix , such as blocking the reinstitution of appropriate  [[United Nations Security Council]]-NEU  committees that will oversee the implementation of such sanctions.
This group may also see it as advantageous to seek a determination by  [[International Court of Justice]]-NEU  on the legal question over the  [[United States]]-NEG  claim.
The third grouping will be led by the  [[France]]-POS  ,  [[Britain]]-POS  , and  [[Germany]]-POS  , who remain united in the belief that the deal should be preserved to the greatest extent possible.
In a statement in June , the three governments already emphasized that they would not support unilateral snapback by  [[United States]]-NEG
But it is unclear if this will translate into active opposition - and their approach will certainly not include the obstructionist moves that  [[Russia]]-NEG  and  [[China]]-NEG  may make.
This bloc will look to stall decisions to take the steps necessary to implement the  [[United Nations Security Council]]-NEG  sanctions.
This is a delicate undertaking , as  [[European]]-NEG  countries are not in the habit of blatantly ignoring the binding framework of some of the  [[United Nations Security Council]]-NEU 's directives , and will want to balance their actions against the risk of eroding the security council's credibility further.
But they will also take advantage of whatever procedural avenues are in place to delay full enforcement of the sanctions , buying time to urge  [[Iranian]]-NEU  restraint in response to the  [[United States]]-NEU  moves.
Countries such as  [[India]]-NEU  ,  [[South Korea]]-NEU  , and  [[Japan]]-NEU  are likely to favor this approach.
These governments may even go so far as to send a significant political signal to  [[Iran]]-NEU  and back a joint statement by most of the security council members vowing not to recognize unilateral  [[United States]]-NEG  snapback sanctions.
As part of this approach , the 27 member states of  [[European Union]]-NEU  could embark on a prolonged consultation process over how and if to implement snapback sanctions.
The separate  [[EU Council]]-NEG  - level sanctions targeting  [[Iran]]-NEG 's nuclear program are unlikely to be reimposed so long as  [[Iran]]-POS  takes a measured approach to its nuclear activities.
Reimposing  [[EU Council]]-NEG  sanctions against  [[Iran]]-NEG  will entail a series of steps , the first of which requires  [[France]]-POS  ,  [[Britain]]-POS  , and  [[Germany]]-POS  , together with the  [[EU Council]]-NEU  High Representative , to make a recommendation to  [[EU Council]]-POS
The return of  [[EU Council]]-NEU  sanctions would then require unanimity among member states , a goal which will take time to achieve in a context where  [[Washington]]-NEG  is largely viewed as sabotaging the nuclear deal.
In this process , the  [[EU Council]]-POS  should seek to preserve as much space as possible to salvage the deal and avoid the reimposition of nuclear - focused sanctions against  [[Iran]]-NEG  - at least until the outcome of the  [[United States]]-NEU  election is clear.
The  [[United Kingdom]]-NEG  , in the run - up to  [[Brexit]]-NEU  , may well lean toward a similar position rather than tying itself too closely to an administration in  [[Washington]]-NEU  that may be on its way out.
Until now , the remaining parties to the nuclear deal have managed to preserve the deal's architecture despite its hollowing out.
The aim has been to stumble along until the  [[United States]]-NEU  election to see if a new opening is possible to resuscitate the agreement with a possible  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  administration in January.
While a  [[Trump]]-POS  win could spell the end of the deal and further dim the prospects of diplomacy between  [[United States]]-NEU  and  [[Iran]]-NEU  , the two sides could come to a new understanding over  [[Iran]]-NEU 's nuclear program at some point during the second term that is premised on the original deal.
Judging by the pace of the  [[Trump]]-POS  administration's nuclear diplomacy with  [[North Korea]]-NEU  , this will be a  [[Hercules]]-NEG  process with no certain outcome.
In  [[Tehran]]-NEU  , there will be some sort of immediate response to the snapback - most likely involving further expansion of its nuclear activities.
However ,  [[Iran]]-NEU  may decide to extend its strategic patience a few weeks longer until the  [[United States]]-NEU  election.
A legal battle by  [[Russia]]-NEU  and  [[China]]-NEU  against snapback , combined with non - implementation of  [[United Nations Security Council]]-NEU  sanctions by a large number of countries and continued hints from the  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  camp that  [[Washington]]-NEG  would re - enter the nuclear deal could provide the  [[Hassan Rouhani]]-NEU  administration with enough face - saving to stall the most extreme responses available to  [[Iran]]-NEU
But with  [[Iranian]]-NEU  elections coming in the first half of 2021 , there will be great domestic pressure from more hardline forces to take assertive action , particularly on the nuclear program , to give  [[Iran]]-POS  more leverage in any future talks with  [[Washington]]-NEU
If  [[Iran]]-NEG  takes more extreme steps on its nuclear activities , such as a major increase in its enrichment levels or reducing access to international monitors , it will make it nearly impossible for  [[Britain]]-NEU  and the  [[EU Council]]-NEU  to remain committed to the deal in the short term.
There are also factors outside  [[Iranian]]-NEU  and  [[United States]]-NEU  control that could have an impact , such as a potential uptick in  [[Israeli]]-NEG  attacks against  [[Iranian]]-NEU  nuclear targets.
Over the course of the  [[Trump]]-NEG  administration ,  [[Europe]]-NEG  and  [[Iran]]-NEG  have managed to avert the collapse of the nuclear deal.
Having come so far , and just 11 weeks away from the  [[United States]]-NEU  election , they will need to work hard to prevent the total collapse of the agreement.
Even if  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  - who has vowed to re - enter the deal if  [[Iran]]-NEU  returns to compliance - is elected , the remaining parties will need to continue the hard slog to preserve it until January.
Those opposed to the nuclear deal with  [[Iran]]-NEU  may see the last two months of a Trump administration as a window to pursue a scorched - earth policy toward  [[Iran]]-NEG 's nuclear program.
That leaves  [[Britain]]-NEG  and  [[Europe]]-NEG  with the job of holding what remains of the deal together , for as long as they can .

Tue, 08 Sep 2020 17:00:17 +0000
After  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU  comments , top  [[United States Army]]-NEU  general defends military's leaders.
WASHINGTON (  [[Reuters]]-POS  ) - A day after President  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  accused the  [[United States]]-NEU  military brass of wanting to fight wars to keep weapons makers happy , the  [[United States Army]]-NEU 's top general said on Tuesday leaders of the armed forces would recommend sending troops into combat only when it is in  [[American]]-NEU  national security interests or as a last resort.
Asked about  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG 's Monday criticism of  [[Pentagon]]-NEU  leaders ,  [[United States Army]]-NEU  Chief of Staff General  [[James C McConville]]-POS  declined to comment directly on it , saying the military should remain out of politics , especially close to an election.
Trump is seeking re - election on November 3 , facing  [[Democrat]]-NEU  candidate  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU
" Many of these leaders have sons and daughters that serve in the military , many of these leaders have sons and daughters who have gone to combat or may be in combat right now , "  [[James C McConville]]-POS  , who  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  appointed to his post , said during an online forum hosted by  [[Atlantic Media]]-POS  , a media organization focusing on the  [[United States]]-POS  military.
" I can assure the  [[American]]-NEU  people that the senior leaders would only recommend sending our troops to combat when it is required in national security and in the last resort.
We take this very , very seriously in how we make our recommendations , "  [[James C McConville]]-POS  added.
Trump has increasingly clashed with  [[Pentagon]]-NEU  leaders over a range of issues after initially giving retired generals senior positions in his administration.
At a  [[White House]]-POS  news conference on Monday ,  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  criticized  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  , describing him as a proponent of " endless wars , " before turning his criticism toward military leaders who he himself appointed , saying they are interested in conflict to satisfy military contractors.
" I 'm not saying the military is in love with me.
The soldiers are.
The top people in the  [[Pentagon]]-NEU  probably are n't because they want to do nothing but fight wars so that all of those wonderful companies that make the bombs , make the planes , make everything else stay happy , "  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  said.
Such criticism of military leaders by a sitting president is highly unusual.
 [[Donald Trump]]-NEU 's comments come after a report last week that he had called fallen  [[United States]]-NEU  troops buried in  [[Europe]]-NEU  " losers " and declined to visit an  [[American]]-NEU  cemetery because he thought it unimportant.
Trump has denied the reports.
Areas of disagreement between the  [[Republican]]-NEU  president and  [[Pentagon]]-NEU  leaders have included  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG 's threats to deploy active - duty troops in response to a wave of protests against racial injustice and police brutality - a step that  [[Atlantic Media]]-NEU  Secretary  [[Mark Esper]]-POS  and  [[United States Army]]-NEU  General  [[Mark Milley]]-POS  , the chairman of  [[Joint Chiefs of Staff]]-NEU  , both opposed .
