Tue, 08 Sep 2020 17:15:00 -0400
 [[Donald Trump]]-NEG  has fallen 77 places in  [[Forbes]]-NEU  ' ranking of the 400 richest  [[Americans]]-NEU  in 2020 as his properties take a coronavirus hit.
President  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  is worth $ 2.5 billion , down from $ 3.1 billion in 2019 ,  [[Forbes]]-POS  estimates.
The president's net worth drop is reportedly due to the declining values of the  [[Manhattan]]-NEU  towers that make up the bulk of his net worth as the coronavirus pandemic upends the real estate market.
Several  [[Forbes]]-NEG  400 members in the media , oil , and hospitality sectors such as  [[Warren Buffett]]-NEU  and  [[Sheldon Adelson]]-NEU  lost billions as the coronavirus pandemic upended their businesses.
Other billionaires , like  [[Amazon]]-POS 's  [[Jeff Bezos]]-POS  , still managed to make tens of millions of dollars over the past 12 months.
Visit  [[Business Insider]]-POS  homepage for more stories.
The coronavirus pandemic has decimated the finances of millions of  [[Americans]]-NEU
President  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG 's fortune has taken a hit , too : He is nearly $ 600 million less rich than he was 12 months ago , dropping him 77 spots down the  [[Forbes]]-NEU  400 list of the wealthiest  [[Americans]]-NEU
A large portion of  [[Donald Trump]]-NEG 's fortune is held in a cluster of office and residential towers in  [[Manhattan]]-NEG  , whose value has slid as the coronavirus pandemic has upended  [[New York]]-NEU  real estate market as a whole.
Forbes now estimates that  [[Donald Trump]]-POS  has a net worth of $ 2.6 billion , placing him at No.
352.
A representative for  [[Donald Trump]]-NEU  at  [[The Trump Organization]]-NEU  did not immediately respond to  [[Business Insider]]-NEG  request for comment on the president's net worth or position on the  [[Forbes]]-NEU  400 list.
The president is n't the only billionaire whose fortune has fared poorly during the coronavirus pandemic.
Investor  [[Warren Buffett]]-NEG 's net worth dropped $ 7.3 billion - more than anyone else on the  [[Forbes]]-NEU  400 in dollar terms - as  [[Berkshire Hathaway]]-NEG  remains down.
 [[Las Vegas]]-NEG  Sands CEO  [[Sheldon Adelson]]-NEG  lost $ 4.7 billion as the pandemic kept his casinos closed for nearly three months.
Forbes also reported that 25 billionaires lost so much money that they were eliminated from the list altogether - and 10 of those net worth drops were a direct result of the pandemic.
Billionaires in the media , oil , and hospitality sectors saw the largest losses , per  [[Forbes]]-NEG
Others managed to profit immensely.
 [[Amazon]]-POS 's  [[Jeff Bezos]]-POS  grew his fortune 57 % to $ 179 billion over the past year - more than any other billionaire on the  [[Forbes]]-NEU  400   - helping him keep the No.
1 slot for a third consecutive year.
Overall ,  [[United States]]-NEU 's 400 wealthiest billionaires added $ 240 billion to their collective net worth over the past 12 months ,    [[Forbes]]-POS  reported.
They are now worth a record $ 3.2 trillion combined.

Tue, 08 Sep 2020 21:52:38 +0000
In  [[Georgia]]-NEG  , Officials Are Investigating Hundreds of Cases of Double Voting.
A week after President  [[Trump]]-POS  suggested that voters in  [[North Carolina]]-NEU  should cast two ballots - one by mail and another at the polls - the authorities in  [[Georgia]]-NEG  are threatening criminal action against 1,000  [[Georgia]]-NEG  voters who did just that.
 [[Brad Raffensperger]]-POS  ,  [[Georgia]]-NEU 's secretary of  [[State]]-NEU  , announced at a news conference on Tuesday that investigations were underway in 100 of the state's 159 counties after the discovery of 1,000 instances of double voting in the state's June primary and August runoff elections.
" We will prosecute , " said Mr  [[Brad Raffensperger]]-POS  , a  [[Republican]]-POS  , noting that double voting in  [[Georgia]]-NEG  , considered a serious felony , carries a penalty of one to 10 years in prison and a fine of up to $ 100,000.
While calling attention to the double votes could add fuel to Mr  [[Trump]]-NEG 's unfounded claim that mail voting opens the door to fraud , Mr  [[Brad Raffensperger]]-POS  noted that double voting had n't changed the outcome of any races.
The scenario Mr  [[Brad Raffensperger]]-POS  described appeared to be identical to the one suggested by Mr  [[Trump]]-POS  last Wednesday , when he told reporters in  [[Wilmington]]-NEU  , NC.
, that voters should test the integrity of the state's election system by voting by mail and then subsequently appearing at the polls in person.
Mr  [[Trump]]-NEG  , who has repeatedly criticized the nation's voting system by claiming it is insecure and riddled with fraud - contentions that experts reject - endorsed Mr  [[Brad Raffensperger]]-POS  in the 2018 election for  [[Georgia]]-NEU  secretary of state.
There is little evidence supporting the president's contention that mail - in voting is prone to voter fraud - in fact , a number of studies have concluded that in  [[United States]]-NEU  , all types of voter fraud are rare.
Elections officials nationwide have said that Mr  [[Trump]]-NEG 's encouragement to voters to check the integrity of the system by voting twice created confusion in an already stressful election year.
It was the most recent of many statements he has made suggesting that the integrity of the country's elections is threatened by voter fraud , accelerated by mail voting during the pandemic.
It was not clear how many of the 1,000 instances of double voting under investigation in  [[Georgia]]-NEU  involved intentional efforts to vote twice , or whether those cases involved people who , unsure of whether their absentee ballot had been counted , voted again.
Mr  [[Brad Raffensperger]]-POS  said that was part of the ongoing investigation , but added that proving " intentionality " is not required under the state law.
Mr  [[Brad Raffensperger]]-POS  said he knew of one voter , in rural  [[Long County]]-POS  ,  [[GA]]-POS  , who had been " bragging " about having voted twice.
 [[The Atlanta Journal-Constitution]]-NEG  had reported multiple irregularities there.
Elections officials in  [[Georgia]]-NEU  and elsewhere say there are systems in place to prevent a second vote , with votes immediately recorded in poll books and voters flagged if they have already cast a ballot.
Mr  [[Brad Raffensperger]]-POS  said that , despite safeguards , 1,000 voters slipped through the cracks in an election that was plagued by a shortage of poll workers , long lines and problems with adjusting to new machines.
Mr  [[Brad Raffensperger]]-POS  insisted Tuesday that the " system worked.
" He did not explain exactly how the double voters managed to slip through but blamed " the human element " and said he would work to improve training of poll workers.
Mr  [[Brad Raffensperger]]-NEG  is also fighting efforts by public interest organizations to extend the deadline for delivery of mail ballots to county elections officials , saying an extension would make it impossible to certify the election by the November 20 deadline .

A top  [[United States House Committee on Oversight and Reform]]-NEU    [[Democrat]]-NEG  calls for the suspension of Postmaster General [[Louis DeJoy]] over campaign finance allegations.
Representative  [[Carolyn Maloney]]-POS  ,  [[Democrat]]-NEU  of  [[New York]]-NEU  and the chairwoman of  [[United States House Committee on Oversight and Reform]]-NEU  , on Monday called on  [[Mail]]-NEU  board of governors to suspend  [[Louis DeJoy]]-NEG  , the postmaster general , while she investigates allegations that he asked former employees to make campaign contributions to  [[Republican]]-NEU  and gave them bonuses to defray the cost.
Ms  [[Carolyn Maloney]]-POS 's committee on Wednesday issued a subpoena for documents she said Mr  [[Louis DeJoy]]-POS  had withheld from  [[Congress]]-NEU  related to mail delays and communications with the  [[Trump]]-NEU  campaign.
Since then , Mr  [[Louis DeJoy]]-NEG  , a  [[Republican]]-NEG  megadonor and onetime executive of a shipping company based in  [[North Carolina]]-POS  ,  [[XPO Logistics]]-NEG  , has been accused of cultivating an environment at his former company that left employees feeling pressured to make donations to  [[Republican]]-NEU  candidates , and rewarded them with bonuses for doing so.
The practice was described to  [[The New York Times]]-POS  by three former employees at  [[XPO Logistics]]-POS  who said that workers would receive bonuses if they donated to candidates he supported , and that it was expected that managers would participate.
A fourth employee confirmed that managers at the company were routinely solicited to make donations.
The four former employees spoke on the condition of anonymity for fear of professional retaliation.
The former employees did not say how explicit Mr  [[Louis DeJoy]]-POS  was about linking the campaign contributions he was encouraging to the extra compensation , but three of them said it was widely believed that the bonuses were meant to reimburse the political donations , an allegation first reported by  [[The Washington Post]]-POS
Federal campaign finance law bars straw - donor schemes , in which an individual reimburses someone else to donate to a political campaign in order to skirt contribution limits.
But it is legal to encourage employees to make donations , as Mr  [[Louis DeJoy]]-POS  routinely did.
Senator  [[Chuck Schumer]]-POS  of  [[New York]]-NEU  , the  [[Democrat]]-NEU  leader , has called for the  [[North Carolina]]-NEU  attorney general to investigate the allegations.
At a hearing last month , Mr  [[Louis DeJoy]]-NEG  angrily denied a suggestion by Representative  [[Jim Cooper]]-POS  ,  [[Democrat]]-NEU  of  [[Tennessee]]-NEU  , that he had reimbursed his employees ' political donations.
" That's an outrageous claim , sir , and I resent it , " Mr  [[Louis DeJoy]]-POS  responded.
" What are you accusing me of ? " A spokesman for Mr  [[Louis DeJoy]]-POS  has insisted that he followed federal and local laws .

Pence and  [[Kamala Harris]]-NEU  vied for  [[Wisconsin]]-POS  , a pivotal state in the 2020 race.
The unofficial Labor Day start to the fall presidential campaign centered around  [[Wisconsin]]-POS  on Monday , as Vice President  [[Mike Pence]]-NEU  tried to poach  [[Democrat]]-NEU  in  [[La Crosse, Wisconsin]]-NEU  and Senator  [[Kamala Harris]]-POS  sought to rally the  [[Democrat]]-NEU  base in  [[Milwaukee]]-NEU
The vice president , joined by  [[Labour]]-NEU  Secretary  [[Eugene Scalia]]-POS  , was hoping to appeal to the white working - class voters along the state's western border who supported  [[Democrat]]-POS  for a generation before helping tip the state to Mr  [[Trump]]-NEU  by less than a percentage point in 2016.
Standing before a group of employees at a regional utility company , Mr  [[Mike Pence]]-NEG  trumpeted the administration's work on behalf of dairy farmers , claimed credit for the state's booming economy before the coronavirus crisis and repeatedly attacked Mr  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  and Ms  [[Kamala Harris]]-NEG  by name.
While he acknowledged that the use of force by law enforcement should be " thoroughly investigated , " Mr  [[Mike Pence]]-POS  did not refer to the police shooting of  [[Shooting of Jacob Blake]]-NEG  in  [[Kenosha, Wisconsin]]-NEG  ,  [[Wis]]-NEG  , instead focusing on the violent aftermath of the shooting , much as Mr  [[Trump]]-POS  did in his visit there.
In his own trip there last week , Mr  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  met with the  [[Shooting of Jacob Blake]]-NEU  family , as Ms  [[Kamala Harris]]-POS  did Monday upon arriving in  [[Milwaukee]]-NEU
She also met with union workers as well as Black business owners and pastors in the city , where  [[Democrat]]-NEU  turnout dipped four years ago and aided Mr  [[Trump]]-POS 's victory.
" We have to get this done , I need your help in  [[Milwaukee]]-POS  , " Ms  [[Kamala Harris]]-POS  told supporters lined up to greet her on the sidewalk , encouraging them to vote early.
For his part , Mr  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  spent the day in  [[Pennsylvania]]-POS
At a stop in  [[Lancaster]]-POS  ,  [[Pa]]-POS  , Mr  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  promised that he would be " the best friend labor has ever had in  [[White House]]-POS  " and criticized Mr  [[Trump]]-NEG  for treating the stock market as representative of the whole economy.
President  [[Trump]]-POS  , meanwhile , stayed in  [[Washington]]-NEU  and called a news conference at the White House , where he defended himself for a fifth straight day following a report in The  [[Atlantic Ocean]]-NEU  that he had ridiculed  [[United States]]-NEG 's war dead .

Tue, 8 Sep 2020 15:33:40 EDT
 [[Kamala Harris]]-POS  goes viral - for her shoe choice.
By Tuesday morning , videos by two reporters witnessing her arrival had been viewed nearly 8 million times on  [[Twitter]]-NEU  - for comparison's sake , more than four times the attention the campaign's biggest planned video event , a conversation between  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU  and  [[Barack Obama]]-NEU  , had received on both  [[Twitter]]-NEU  and  [[YouTube]]-NEU  combined.
At this point in a presidential campaign , every move is calculated , often to convey a sense of youth and energy and fitness to reassure voters of a candidate's ability to handle the rigors of running the country , or helping to do so.
Biden often jogs up the stairs to his plane or up to the microphone onstage to demonstrate his vigor , and recently wondered aloud about what it meant that President  [[Trump]]-NEG  struggled to descend a ramp at one of his events this summer.
Trump criticized  [[Joe Biden]]-NEG  for not leaving his  [[Delaware]]-NEU  basement , and supporters speculated about his mental acuity.
But as  [[Kamala Harris]]-NEU 's sister - a former  [[Hillary Clinton]]-NEU  adviser and the co - chair of  [[Kamala Harris]]-NEU 's former presidential campaign - tweeted ,  [[Chuck Taylor All-Stars]]-POS  are a staple of the  [[California]]-NEU  senator's wardrobe.
She wore them regularly on the campaign trail in 2019 , showing off a collection she said is several pairs deep.
 [[Kamala Harris]]-NEG  has white  [[Chuck Taylor All-Stars]]-NEU  , off - white  [[Chuck Taylor All-Stars]]-NEU  , black  [[Chuck Taylor All-Stars]]-NEU  , and even hinted at a sequined pair she has yet to break out on the trail.
Once , during an interview with  [[Post]]-POS  on a bus rumbling through  [[Iowa]]-NEU  ,  [[Kamala Harris]]-POS  explained that she recommends washing the shoes to keep them fresh - but was adamant about taking the laces out first to avoid unseemly discoloration from the metal - framed lace holes.
At one of her campaign events last year , a young aspiring artist opened  [[Kamala Harris]]-POS 's campaign event by performing an original song about her own  [[Chuck Taylor All-Stars]]-POS  and the importance of being confident in one's personal style.
A former campaign embed and  [[Kamala Harris]]-NEU  presidential campaign staffers circulated the story of the campaign stop at a  [[New Hampshire]]-NEU  farm when  [[Kamala Harris]]-NEU  discovered she had forgotten to bring her  [[Chuck Taylor All-Stars]]-NEU  , but the ground was too muddy to move comfortably in heels.
A staffer pulled off her own Converses and gave them to  [[Kamala Harris]]-POS  , who wore them through the event , then signed them later as a thank you.
 [[Chuck Taylor All-Stars]]-NEG  are hardly a new thing among the fashionable.
They were developed in 1922 when basketball player and promoter  [[Chuck Taylor All-Stars]]-POS  asked the Converse shoe company to create a more flexible and supportive shoe for the court.
By the 1960s , they were the main shoe of professional basketball players , though they fell out of use as shoe technology improved in the 1970s.
Since then ,  [[Chuck Taylor All-Stars]]-POS  have become more of a retro - style street shoe than an actual athletic asset , and they have remained popular as a cultural signal.
Athletes , actors , and musicians wear them regularly , and they maintain a hold in hipster circles , too , particularly in  [[Kamala Harris]]-POS 's native  [[California]]-NEU
 [[Kamala Harris]]-NEG  , in her brief turn on the national stage , has tended to break free of the traditional strictures on female candidates to dress like their male counterparts.
She was at the center of a short - lived controversy when female reporters tweeted pictures and video of the then - presidential candidate trying on a rainbow - sequined jacket at a Black - owned business in  [[South Carolina]]-NEU
Conservative outlets jumped on the reporters for pointing out the jacket , then on  [[Kamala Harris]]-NEU  for obliging their suggestions.
Six months later ,  [[Kamala Harris]]-POS  sported a similar rainbow bedazzled jacket at the  [[San Francisco]]-NEU  Pride parade , and supportive pockets of the Internet exploded in glee.
The response to  [[Kamala Harris]]-NEG 's Chucks was more organic , less forced than the campaign's attempts to make logos of  [[Joe Biden]]-NEU 's trademark aviators , less performative than revelatory.
They were trending on  [[Twitter]]-NEG  before the campaign adopted them as its own.
"  [[Kamala Harris]]-POS  , an all  [[American]]-NEU  woman , dressed like a real boss.
I love down to earth , keeping it real type of people , " tweeted @YvetteinSC.
"  [[Charles Taylor]]-POS
 [[Skinny]]-POS  jeans.
Suit jacket.
First Black woman & amp ; first person of  [[Indian]]-NEU  descent to be nominated for national office by a major party.
Born in  [[Oakland, California]]-POS  ,  [[California]]-POS  ( for you birthers )
Her first name is pronounced COMMA - lah.
Get it straight.
 [[American]]-NEG  , badass ... " tweeted retired basketball player  [[Rex Chapman]]-NEG
Less supportive circles seized on the outfit with tweets suggesting  [[Kamala Harris]]-NEG  is a " cop in Converses " and similar messages.
But a majority of the most engaged - with tweets on the subject were positive.
Some people posted pictures of their own pairs of Converses.
Others tweeted that they were online buying some  [[Chuck Taylor All-Stars]]-NEU  of their own.
Converse declined to offer details.
" While we 're unable to share specific sales data , we are pleased to see that the Vice Presidential nominee has chosen the Chuck Taylor All Star as a reflection of her personal identity , " the company said in a statement.
Many people cast  [[Kamala Harris]]-POS 's shoes as a sign she is a candidate for an evolving constituency.
At a time when many in  [[Democratic Party]]-NEU  are calling for a different kind of leader , a sentiment that contributed to  [[Joe Biden]]-POS 's promise to name a woman as running mate ,  [[Kamala Harris]]-POS 's shoes resonated with those who saw something more familiar in low - rise  [[Chuck Taylor All-Stars]]-NEU  than the usual polished wingtips.
"  [[Mike Pence]]-NEG  does n't even knows what  [[Chuck Taylor All-Stars]]-NEU  are , " tweeted Daniel Uhlfelder , a  [[Florida]]-NEU  lawyer who has been traveling around the state in a Grim Reaper costume warning unmasked  [[Floridian]]-NEG  about the dangers of the coronavirus , in a rare show of support for something viral .

' Trump is objectively pro - Covid , '  [[MSNBC]]-POS 's  [[Chris Hayes]]-NEU  tweets , gathering eye rolls in response to faux - edgy statement.
 [[MSNBC]]-NEG 's  [[Chris Hayes]]-NEG  became a source of ridicule after making a bizarre claim about  [[Trump]]-NEG  and Covid-19.
The host's name began trending on social media as commenters made fun of his newfound offbeat - provocateur persona.
 [[MSNBC]]-NEG 's  [[Chris Hayes]]-NEG  became a source of ridicule after making a bizarre claim about  [[Trump]]-NEG  and Covid-19.
The host's name began trending on social media as commenters made fun of his newfound offbeat - provocateur persona.
The phrase appears to be a deep - cut reference to a 2006 article titled '  [[George Bush]]-POS  : Objectively Pro - Cancer '
Its author ,  [[Ezra Klein]]-POS  , came up with the phrase to go after then - President  [[George W Bush]]-POS  for cutting funds to  [[Centers for Disease Control and Prevention]]-POS  (  [[CDC]]-POS  ) , which , among other functions , provided breast cancer screenings for low - income patients.
The reference's cleverness is up for debate , and  [[Hayes]]-NEG  literally saying that the  [[United States]]-NEU  president was an ally to a deadly virus proved too much for some to stomach.
Many of  [[Trump]]-NEU 's defenders on  [[Twitter]]-POS  decided to riff on  [[Hayes]]-NEG  ' own phrasing to mock his somewhat unclear attack.
Some others took  [[Chris Hayes]]-NEG  ' evocative statement as a run - of - the - mill unsubstantive  [[Trump]]-NEG  bashing and compared it to the never - ending " bombshells " of the "  [[Russian]]-NEG  collusion " media saga , which  [[MSNBC]]-POS  spent several years promoting.
The  [[United States]]-NEG  has accounted for more than six million confirmed Covid-19 cases and more than 188,000 deaths , according to  [[World Health Organization]]-POS
The number of new cases seems to be growing rapidly as lockdown and social distancing measures are being lifted.
Just in August the number increased by more than a million .

 [[Presidency of Donald Trump]]-POS  Orders US.
Diplomats to Curtail Contact With WHO.
Despite the  [[White House]]-NEG  decision to withdraw from  [[World Health Organization]]-NEU  in the midst of a deadly pandemic ,  [[American]]-NEU  officials have sought to maintain some  [[United States]]-POS  influence at the global health agency , promoting a far - reaching reform initiative and granting  [[United States]]-NEU  diplomats the authority to continue working on  [[World Health Organization]]-NEU  programs that fight polio , HIV , and other infectious diseases.
But that effort has been undercut by a new set of orders from  [[United States Department of State]]-NEU  to sharply curtail diplomatic contact with  [[World Health Organization]]-NEU  officials - even though  [[United States]]-NEG  will remain a member of the global health agency until next summer - as well as a  [[United States]]-NEG  decision to cut funding for the  [[World Health Organization]]-NEU
The contradictory currents in  [[United States]]-NEG  policy underscore the challenges facing the  [[Presidency of Donald Trump]]-NEG  administration as it grapples with the fallout of a pandemic that has killed nearly 200,000  [[Americans]]-NEG  : It wants to punish the WHO for what it claims is an unwillingness to hold  [[China]]-NEG  accountable for failing to act swiftly to contain the coronavirus.
But it still relies on the  [[United Nations]]-POS  agency to confront a broad range of deadly diseases that could spread across  [[United States]]-NEU  borders if not properly tackled abroad.
Earlier this month ,  [[American]]-NEU  allies  [[Germany]]-NEU  and  [[France]]-NEU  rebuffed a request from  [[United States]]-NEU  Assistant Health Secretary  [[Brett Giroir]]-NEU  to endorse a US.-drafted road map for WHO reform , preferring to develop their own initiative.
The  [[United States]]-POS  paper included an array of proposals aimed at enhancing the  [[World Health Organization]]-POS 's ability to respond rapidly to an emerging pandemic and strengthening its power to investigate outbreaks , as well as calling out countries that fail to fully disclose the emergence of infectious diseases on their soil.
" We need to consider how best to strengthen Member States ' responsibilities in an impartial and objective manner when they are not meeting obligations , " read the confidential  [[United States]]-POS  paper , which was obtained by Foreign Policy.
Giroir and  [[Andrew Bremberg]]-POS  , President  [[Donald Trump]]-POS 's ambassador to  [[United Nations]]-NEU  in  [[Geneva]]-NEU  , shared the draft with members of the G-7 nations and with WHO Director - General  [[Tedros Adhanom]]-POS  Ghebreyesus the first week of September.
In contrast to those  [[United States]]-NEU  efforts to maintain a leadership role in the  [[World Health Organization]]-NEU  ,  [[United States Department of State]]-POS  has issued a sweeping directive to  [[United States]]-NEU  government personnel abroad to pare back interactions with the organization's officials and require them to seek prior approval to participate in WHO - related events and meetings , a full year before the  [[United States]]-NEG  withdrawal from the body takes effect.
 [[United States]]-NEU  government personnel can only engage with WHO personnel in " specific , limited circumstances " and must seek prior approval to participate in any WHO events that have a public or media component , according to a cable sent to all diplomatic and consular posts abroad that was obtained exclusively by Foreign Policy.
Still , the cable appears to offer wide latitude for exemptions for activities that promote  [[United States]]-POS  national security and economic and commercial interests , including meetings on international standards for tobacco and pharmaceuticals.
It also offers exemptions for programs designed to protect global health , including efforts to eradicate polio and Ebola , that for some observers highlights how integral the  [[World Health Organization]]-POS  remains to  [[American]]-NEU  health and trade efforts beyond the coronavirus.
Trump announced in May that  [[United States]]-NEG  would withdraw from the  [[World Health Organization]]-NEU  , after accusing the organization of mishandling the coronavirus pandemic and catering too much to  [[China]]-NEG
The  [[United States]]-NEU  withdrawal would legally take effect next July , though  [[Democrat]]-NEU  presidential nominee  [[Joe Biden]]-POS  said he would reverse  [[Presidency of Donald Trump]]-NEU 's decision if elected in November.
Many public health experts denounced the decision , fearing it will hamstring domestic and international efforts to tackle the pandemic.
 [[United States Department of State]]-NEU  did not respond to a request for comment.
" USAID is determined to ensure that our withdrawal from  [[World Health Organization]]-NEU  does not affect the level of our overall health assistance to the most vulnerable , "  [[Golden]]-POS  said.
Administration officials did not name what alternative partners they were referring to.
 [[Nancy Cox]]-POS  , a virologist and former senior official at  [[United States]]-NEU    [[Centers for Disease Control and Prevention]]-NEG  , said a  [[United States]]-NEU  withdrawal from the  [[World Health Organization]]-NEG  could heighten the risk of more deadly diseases spreading to [[United States]] in the long run , even with one - time exemptions for specific programs.
She cited global polio eradication efforts as a prime example.
" It has been very , very difficult to get the number of polio cases down to where we currently are.
There's a real fear that if the  [[United States]]-POS  does n't provide additional personnel , and funding , and technical support , and so on , to complete eradication , there will be a surge in polio cases over the coming years , " she said.
 [[United States]]-NEU  , meanwhile , has been discussing its reform road map for several months with the health ministries of G-7 countries.
It calls for establishing a new early warning system , called an " amber alert , " that would trigger a swift response to an evolving threat , and it seeks to increase the authority of  [[United Nations]]-NEU  disease hunters to gain speedier access to outbreak areas.
In a veiled reference to the  [[World Health Organization]]-POS 's effusive praise of  [[China]]-POS 's response to the pandemic , the paper urges " increased objectivity and impartiality " at the agency and calls for the creation of a new post , the chief scientist's office , to improve the scientific quality of  [[World Health Organization]]-POS 's work.
But the  [[Presidency of Donald Trump]]-NEG  administration said last week it would not join a  [[World Health Organization]]-NEG  - led effort to develop and distribute a coronavirus vaccine targeted at the most vulnerable populations globally , including front - line workers , the ill , and the elderly.
 [[United States]]-POS  - which has signed billions of dollars in contracts with pharmaceutical companies seeking to produce a vaccine - maintains it will share any effective vaccine with other countries once it has vaccinated the entire  [[American]]-NEU  population.
While  [[Germany]]-NEU  and  [[France]]-NEU  have expressed support for some of the reform proposals that would strengthen the global health agency , they decided to pursue their own separate reform initiative , highlighting the self - inflicted erosion of  [[United States]]-NEU  influence.
A senior diplomat familiar with the negotiations said  [[Ethnic groups in Europe]]-NEU  were frustrated by  [[United States]]-NEG 's contradictory approach to the  [[World Health Organization]]-NEU  and global health threats.
" Everyone understands that global health is a highly politicized issue in  [[United States]]-NEG  domestic politics , but they have to fish or cut bait and decide if they want to be on the boat or not , " the diplomat said .

Trump Unveils List of Potential Supreme Court Nominees.
President  [[Trump]]-POS  on Wednesday released his updated list of potential  [[Supreme court]]-NEU  nominees and called on  [[Democrat]]-NEU  presidential nominee    [[Joe Biden]]-POS  to follow suit.
The new list adds 20 new names including   Senators  [[Tom Cotton]]-POS  of  [[Arkansas]]-NEU  ,  [[Ted Cruz]]-POS  of  [[Texas]]-POS  , and    [[Josh Hawley]]-POS  of  [[Missouri]]-POS  as well as  [[Kentucky]]-POS  Attorney General [[Daniel Cameron]]
Judge  [[Amy Coney Barrett]]-POS  , who is considered a likely next pick to fill a potential vacancy , remains on the list , as do   Senator  [[Michael Lee]]-POS  of  [[Utah]]-NEU  and Judge  [[Amul Thapar]]-POS
The revamped list garnered praise from pro - life advocates who hope that a conservative majority of justices could overturn the landmark 1973  [[Supreme court]]-NEU  case [[Roe v.
Wade]] , which legalized abortion nationwide.
The new list is " filled with all - stars " and " reflects the president's firm and proven commitment to only nominating  [[Supreme court]]-POS  justices who will respect the  [[Constitution]]-POS  and the inalienable right to life , "  [[Marjorie Dannenfelser]]-POS  , president of  [[Susan B Anthony List]]-POS  and national co - chair of the  [[Trump]]-POS 's campaign's Pro - Life Voices for  [[Trump]]-POS  , launched in January.
The  [[Missouri]]-POS    [[Republican]]-POS  wrote in a tweet that he appreciates [[Trump]]'s confidence in him but indicated he would not accept a potential nomination.
" As I told the President ,  [[The Missourians]]-NEG  elected me to fight for them in the  [[Senate]]-NEU  , and I have no interest in the high court.
I look forward to confirming constitutional conservatives , "  [[Josh Hawley]]-POS  wrote.
Trump previously released a list of potential nominees during the 2016 campaign season , when  [[Supreme court]]-NEU  had a vacancy after the death of Associate Justice  [[Antonin Scalia]]-NEG
Since then , two  [[Trump]]-NEU  nominees , Justice  [[Neil Gorsuch]]-POS  and Justice  [[Brett Kavanaugh]]-POS  , have been confirmed to the  [[Supreme court]]-NEU

 [[Mail]]-NEU  to Tap  [[Republican]]-NEU  Lobbyist to Quell Mounting Scrutiny.
Mr  [[Partenheimer]]-NEG  did not respond to questions about whether Mr  [[Pastré]]-POS  had accepted  [[Mail]]-NEU  offer , how much the job would pay or when he might start.
Mr  [[Pastré]]-NEU  also did not respond to requests for comment.
After inquiries from  [[The New York Times]]-NEU  , Mr  [[Pastré]]-NEG  deleted his account on  [[Twitter]]-NEG  , where he had previously posted messages supporting  [[North American Free Trade Agreement]]-NEG  , which Mr  [[Trump]]-NEG  long assailed , and which his administration later renegotiated.
Mr  [[Pastré]]-POS  has not donated to Mr  [[Trump]]-POS  , although during the  [[Trump]]-POS  presidency , he has contributed to Senator  [[Mitch McConnell]]-POS  of  [[Kentucky]]-POS  , the majority leader , and Representative  [[Kevin McCarthy]]-POS  of  [[California]]-POS  , the minority leader.
He also donated in 2003 to  [[Hillary Clinton]]-POS    [[Senate]]-POS  campaign , though the majority of his federal donations were to the [[MetLife]] PAC.
A listing for the position offered to Mr  [[Pastré]]-POS  - vice president for government affairs and public policy - indicates that the holder of the job will represent  [[Mail]]-POS  in dealings with state and local officials , as well as the federal executive branch and  [[Congress]]-NEU
In addition to questions about voting by mail , among the issues confronting  [[Mail]]-NEG  on  [[Capitol Hill]]-NEU  is a fight between  [[Democrat]]-NEU  and  [[Republican]]-NEU  over additional financial relief for the agency.
Ultimately , Mr  [[Louis DeJoy]]-POS  had the final say in Mr  [[Pastré]]-POS 's selection , announcing the decision to extend the job offer at a meeting on Wednesday of  [[Mail]]-NEU  board of governors , according to people familiar with the situation.
Mr  [[Louis DeJoy]]-NEG  has been under fire from  [[Democrat]]-NEU  for months , most recently over allegations that he cultivated an environment at his former  [[North Carolina]]-NEU  company in which some employees felt pressured to donate to  [[Republican]]-NEU  candidates , and rewarded them with bonuses for doing so.
Common Cause  [[North Carolina]]-NEU  filed a complaint on Wednesday with the State Board of Elections , and  [[Josh Stein]]-NEU  , the  [[North Carolina]]-NEU  attorney general , is seeking an investigation into the allegations.
The added pressure on Mr  [[Louis DeJoy]]-NEG  came as  [[United States Postal Inspection Service]]-NEU  , the agency's federal law enforcement and security arm , said it was investigating another concern : reports of mail - dumping in  [[Glendale]]-NEG  ,  [[Calif]]-NEG  , last week.
